<Author>TraverDuMonde
<Content>Punta Canwe have service? To start off, our family of 6 took this vacation as a business benefit which we receive, once a year, a five star resort vacation. This one, by far, has been the biggest letdown. When we arrived we were excited but once we walked into our rooms we were a little bit unsure of the quality of the hotel. Despite that the hotel is only 3 years old it appears to be more like 30 (no exaggeration). Of the three rooms that we each had two had problems. The first room did not have the bathrobes or slippers which were promised, and the toilet seat would not stay up (very difficult for the men). The plugs were barely functional in the sinks and bathtubs, there were stains, the ceiling and tiles were cracked and covered in grit. The second room needed improvement. For starters, having a working light in the shower, a working telephone, and not to mention the missing alarm clock (not that the ones in the other rooms worked), would have been nice. Moving on to the service. The tidiness of the room seemed to dwindle after the first day. First everything was done excellent. But then they stopped bringing clean towels and restocking the minifridge. Then it was the cans and garbage being left behind. Finally the bed was skipped over completely. Fortunently we had one towel for the two of us to dry off with.The food quality was good, but not five star quality. Ordering a drink could sometimes be a task and even when you placed your order you weren't really sure what you were getting. We had several great waiters that we tried to find every night, but the remainder left us unsatisfied and disappointed. We were excited about in room internet (even though we had to pay) but after waiting for two hours after paying for it and no one showed up to fix the problems that we called about several times we gave up. From our experience figure out a way around problems, don't bother asking for help (they don't seem interested in your needs).The Casino was fun, and of course we had two guests who love to gamble, but I am not sure if 25 slots and 4 tables is a casino (especially when the change the table rules to even more favor the house). All in all, we absolutely loved the pool (one of the best) and the ocean. You can't beat the beautiful white sand, and warm expansive beach line. Our only suggestion is if you're looking for a five star service and quality get that at different resort; Majestic Colonial is more like 4 star quality with 3 star service.

<Content>Very disappointed with the standard of cleanliness in room and housekeeping in g Spent one week at this Hotel and would not go back. It was a long way to travel, especially for one week. It was possible that this was as a result of the jacussi/bath being placed openly within the bedroom and not as a separate attached room....who knows? The bedding was of a poor standard and I am quite certain that the bedroom floor was not washed during the whole of our stay - the childrens feet were black and that was after they had just showered. The towels were of a poor quality - when we actually were given them and despite reporting the lack of towels to guest relations we are still waiting for the housekeeping supervisor to bring them.Housekeeping may seem a trivial point of discussion but in actual fact a number of assumptions are made based on your immediate opinion of the room that has been allocated to you - if it's not what you expect , and of a poor standard then you begin to wonder what you have actally paid for. I certainly did not anticipate it being so poor especially as the hotel boasts a five star rating. I note that most of the rave reviews are from visitors from Canada and the USA and I found that extremely surprising knowing the high standards that they offer in their own country.Although I've had the opportunity to voice my opinion of the room we were allocated and the general poor standard of the Housekeeping - sack the supervisor I say! <Author>goglobalSaskatchewan
<Content>Good and Bad This is a very long review. I have included the good and bad, but what was bad for us others may not mind. I have included some tips of the things you can do to enjoy your stay more, and avoid the problems we encountered. We stayed at this resort for only a week in December, and originally I was sad to be only going away for one week. However by the end of the week we were glad to be going home. It is a beautiful hotel with a lot of amazing staff! Some staff such as housekeeping as has been said in other reviews iffy. We tipped $5 a day, I don't know if this is reasonable or not, but sometimes as in other reviews they would not show up, not that we cared it made no difference to us. We read in the booklet from our room as well as on trip advisor to tip right away and this will ensure good service. We learnt quickly this is not acurate, at least not for us. After having to get Denny on the beach's attention for drinks we tipped him (around $4 or $5 for 2 drinks) thinking we wouldn't have to find him and he would come to us in the same spot right in the area he was working, however he never bothered to check with us again. So we learned the obvious, tip after good service not to get it! But as I mentioned before perhaps we don't tip enough? Which is sort of weird because apparently tips are included in the all inclusive price? We booked an Ocean front Colonial juinor suite (with the jaccuzzi both in the room and on the deck, more about the jaccuzzi's later) The deck and view were spectacular and we requested the most private balcony when we booked through West Jet not really expecting to get it, but we did and loved it. RM 1348. There was supposed to be a bottle of both rum and whiskey upon arrival in the room also with a fruit basket. The fruit basket was there and so were the glasses but the bottles of rum and whiskey were never seen. For us this wasn't a huge deal as it is all inclusive and you couldn't go more then 300 feet without finding a bar, but it is nice to get what you are supposed to without having to fight for it or consently remind and ask for things. We mentioned this to our Hola trip representative and she said she would mention it to the hotel, weither she did or not either way we never heard about it again. We also noticed and mentioned to her that our room service privacy door lock was broken, basically meaning anyone could get into our room threw it from the outside, this also was never addressed/fixed. My husband ended up jamming it from the inside with a spoon. However much that really would have stopped someone I don't really know. Again possibly not the hotels fault if the rep never did mention it to them we didn't feel like fighting with people our whole week there, and I think we are fairly easy going, so just let everything slide. As for the privacy room service door, I am not sure why they have it as the one day that we got room service for breakfast (which also comes with the room category and which we did not have to remind them) they never used it anyways they woke us up and came into the room. Again not a big deal unless you are expecting them to use the privacy door and you aren't ready for someone to come into the room, which we would have been if not for the door anyways, so well just don't expect it maybe, and take PJ's. Apparently there is also a sensor in the room that tells staff when you are in the room automatically and they will never disturb you, this did not work for us. They constantly knocked when we were in our room and we did not have the old fashioned yet highly effective DO NOT DISTURB sign. However we did see these signs elsewhere through out the hotel so if this is something important to you, you may want to ask for one on checkin. You are also supposed to get slippers and house coats for use during your stay. The house coats were there however they were very small, and there weren't slippers. So if these things are important to you and you aren't a size 0-4 you may want to bring your own. This wouldn't have mattered to us other then the staff knocking and we were scrambling for clothes, oh yes and they only knock twice and come in so don't just grab a robe and head for the door, yell 'just a minute' or something like that. As for the jaccuzzi's we never used the one on the deck as it took to long to fill and the smaller one in the room took a long time as well and the water dissappeared quickly once it was full, so we only used it once. In this category of room there is supposed to be beach towels in the room, ours also were missing, no big deal we walked down to the towel hut and tried to get towels and they wouldn't give them to us without a card. Not a problem and understandable, we went to the front desk and after explaining that the towels were never in our room did manage to get the cards and then return to the towel hut and trade the card for towels, so if you are in this category of room might be useful to make sure either the yellow beach towels (room towels are white) are in your room before the bellman leaves or that you have towel cards. Not sure if we just have bad luck or what? The food, well my husband was sick from the day after we arrived until days after arriving home and I was lucky enough to not get sick until about our third day but was also still sick for sometime after returning home. We did not drink any of the water as reccommended and we used bottled water for brushing our teeth, so not sure what that was about. The food isn't horrible but it isn't great either. Definetly take some Immodium if you don't need it great, but if you do at least you have it. We were glad we did! We also were pretty glad we took a roll of toilet paper from home to. The paper there isn't bad or anything but it is nice to have some really good stuff if you end up having to frequent the bathroom. At least we didn't gain weight this year, unlike previous trips elsewhere, which is good.The Beach was outstanding, the water is rough but it was windy the whole time we were there but we didn't mind we kind of enjoyed the waves and spent pretty much all day every day on the beach. And the water wasn't so rough, that the childern playing in it had any problems. There is fish you can feed right off the beach in not more then thigh high deep water. And we never wore shoes in the water, there are some rocks to look out for but we didn't have a problem. The sand was amazing and we walked for miles barefoot. Another great point about the beach you could walk and walk along the ocean. There are a lot of photographers along the beach that will take pictures for you and they do an absoultely amazing job! Take advantage of it, the prices aren't horrible, and you don't have to buy if you don't want to or end up not liking them. I would recommend taking some kind of inflatable lounger if you like to float in the pool and the beach chairs aren't super comfortable. I did get maybe six mosquito bites but my husband didn't even get one and we did not use any repalinat, so I don't think they are that bad. Of course we are from saskatchewan.As for the children, we were aware that this is a family resort when we went, and we don't particularly like kids, at all. However I thought the resort was large enough we would easily be able to avoid them. Especailly since there are childern areas. Not so, if you really are looking to get away from kids, or are like us and just aren't really kid people, I would highly recommend thinking about adults only resorts, and not this resort. There were crying screaming kids everywhere or we have some really bad luck, and apparently the parents are oblivious to this screaming and acting out I don't know. We went during the school season so this made no difference either. Like I said it is a family resort and we were aware of this so....our bad, but important lesson learned.Spa ~ we each had half hour massages on the beach and really enjoyed them, so next day we went to book hour long massages at the spa. My husband was in a lot of pain from the beds or pillows so he wanted to try the deep tissue massage I not being that brave and just wanting an enjoyable experience wanted the relaxation massage. They seemed to understand when we booked, but well somehow we both ended up getting the deep tissue and I was left bruised and in pain. However I should have probably attempted to stop her and sort out the problem right away rather then suffer the hour long torture. But wasn't sure with the language barrier if it would work anyway so just endured. Nothing against the spa as far as the bruises and pain go as I am told this is typical with a deep tissue, and I take medication to thin my blood so am more prone to bruising. So you may just want to confirm with your therapist that you are getting what you really want before they begin, to avoid the same mistake I made, and obviously I don't recommend the deep tissue to anyone on anticoagulation therapy!We really liked the waiters and waitresses at all of the resturants and most of the bartenders they were friendly and always happy. If you know spanish you will have an easier time at this resort, however it isn't a big deal if you don't, they are pretty good with english. Some good drinks to try are the Miami Vice and of course the Majestic. You have to ask to have alcohol in your drink which I thought was a good thing, since it is a family resort with all the kids and preggo's. The resort is about 1/4 mile long so there is a lot of walking but we enjoy this. We noted a few people in medichairs so it is a very accessible resort if you have a disability. There are elevators at the stairways everywhere we noticed and there were ramps into the lobby to the resturants and on the beach bar area. The trip all in all wasn't our best, and I am not really sure we would return to this hotel, mostly for the fact of the kids. It was clean and friendly with a beautiful pool and beach and nice rooms. There is tones of huts and chairs both on the beach and pool side. We like to sleep in and go for a late breakfast so we were never on the beach before 11 AM and never had a problem. We also never had to wait for a spot at any of the resturants either.The one major problem I was really not happy about was that we charged all of our massages to our room. The day we went to check out and pay they said the visa machine was not connecting and we would have to take money out of the ATM in the lobby. While I didn't really like this idea, what are you going to do. The machine in the lobby ended up riping us off 1,000 peso's, and the hotel did nothing about it. We were told to contact our bank when we got home. I thought ya right get out of the country and then try and fix it, yah right! This was the most upsetting part of the trip and I was very very glad we only lost 1,000 peso's and that this was only about 30 some canadian dollars. So in the future we will make sure to go down a day before we check out of resorts and pay our tab and if the machine isn't working they have at least a day to have it fixed before check out or we will try and pay in cash, which is probably the safest thing to do anyways.All in all wasn't the best trip but could have been worse.

I enjoyed everything about the entertainment and things that were offered to the guests.I went off the resort for the Safari tour, and I'd highly recomend that to anyone. <Author>nattlesleelee
<Content>A detailed review of the Hotel and our Wedding Hello everyone,This is a LONG and detailed review. My husband and I (along with 27of our friends and family) stayed at the Majestic Colonial from about November 27th to December 6th. (Our arrival and departure dates varied by two days) We planned this group vacation because we were having a wedding. I will write this review in two parts, the first focusing on the vacation and the second focusing on the wedding.THE VACATION:Overview: The hotel is beautiful. It is very well maintained. The property is clean and well groomed. It is located on a beautiful section of beach. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If you have any questions or issues, they are definitely happy to assist.Food: There is a wide variety of food. It's true, after a week the food can seem a little boring. But, they do a good job on trying to ensure there is some variety. There are a number of restaurants. I did not get a chance to try all of them. However, I did try the grill, the buffets (the main buffet and the beach buffet), the 'French' restaurant and the Taino restaurant. All of them had a fairly good selection of food. But, the food itself can be hit or miss. Some foods are great and others - not so much. My best advice, try a little of everything. (I am not particularly picky, I'm willing to try most foods at least once. If you have a strong stomach and a willingness to try foods, this is a good approach) Since the food can be repetitive throughout the week within a day or two, you'll know what's good and not so good. I really enjoyed the burgers at the beach side restaurant, but I didn't enjoy the hot dogs or french fries there.... You really just have to try it out. My husband had a really difficult time with the food. He is generally a really finicky eater. If you know that you are picky, take a few things with you that you know you like and that are easy to transport, ie. granola bars, chocolate.I do have to tell you, a number of us did suffer with the runs. I would say about half of us were dependent on Immodium and Pepto Bismol for at least one day. In my case - three days (that's what I get for trying everything).The Rooms: We stayed in the room 2253 - it's an Oceanview room that's a little larger than the standard rooms. It is located on the 2nd floor. The view is beautiful. We encountered a few issues with bugs - but it is to be expected, it is the Caribbean after all. There were lots of little ants and there were definitely some mosquitoes. My advice for the rooms - make sure that you have insect repellent! You will need it. Some of the people who were staying with us on the ground floor had many mosquitoes in their rooms and suffered with many bites. I'm not sure if it was because of the time of year - just coming out of the rainy/hurricane season. Or, if they hadn't sprayed for mosquitoes yet. But, please be careful, and make sure you have a good bug spray, especially if you're traveling with kids/babies. And, one of our friends made friends with a cockroach that was staying with the during their stay. They couldn't bring themselves to kill it, for whatever reason.Aside from that, our room was clean and in good condition. From what I saw of the other rooms, a few were starting to look a little tired. Some had a few cracks in the walls, and the seals on the doors to the toilets/showers were starting to come off. I can't say that it bothered me. But, if you are really finicky and have a very specific idea of what a 5 star should be like, this may not be what you're thinking about.Staff: The cleaning staff were amazing! They did a fabulous job cleaning our room. We left a tip everyday for her. She made all kinds of towel creations for us. We always had clean towels and a full bar. The front desk were incredibly helpful and the maintenance staff were very friendly. An A1 team of hardworking people!Beach: Absolutely beautiful! I loved the beach. The sand was white and soft. The water was turquoise and beautiful. I just loved it. You can go for long walks. The week that we were there, it was quite busy. But there were lots of seats and palapas. You shouldn't have any problems finding a spot to relax.The pool: I have to tell you, I'm not a huge fan of pools on vacation. But, I will say that it was a massive pool. There were tonnes of places to sit and hang out. And, our friends who hung out at the pool really enjoyed it.THE WEDDING:We went to the M.C. for our wedding. We started planning our wedding there over a year ago. During that time we were in communication with Larissa. She had been the wedding planner there for a number of years. Unfortunately, she had left just before we got there. I believe that the transition wasn't as smooth as it could be, so we encountered a number of issues.I will say this to the brides who are thinking of having a wedding there. Despite the issues that you may have communicating, you will have a great wedding. But, it may not be quite what you expected. If I had to do it all over, I may have considered going somewhere else. I had spent a LOT of time planning and thinking about the details of the wedding. I had sent everything to Larissa over the course of a year, and she had promptly responded to every email that I had. However, about two or three months before the wedding, my wedding planners here in Toronto from LUXE sent me an email informing me that Larissa was no longer the wedding coordinator at the resort. Unfortunately, the resort did not send me any further information.Over the year, I had sent all of the details to Larissa, including information about bouquets, centerpieces, food/menus, cake flavour and style, chair covers, table cloths... you name it I sent pictures and information of what I wanted. When I arrived, I found that they didn't have ANY of the information that I had spent hours putting together. In fact, they only had the information from the very first email that I sent over a year ago. I was really surprised and because I had sent everything to them so long in advance I didn't think I needed to bring everything with me. I was really disappointed and frustrated. I know now that I should have brought everything with me despite feeling like I was so organized.***Anything that you want PLEASE make sure you send them the details and keep copies of everything that you sent.I even sent an email a week before I arrived, but no one responded to me. I figured that I would deal with everything once I arrived. I tried not to stress out too much about it.The day of my wedding I had no clue what was going on. No one bothered to fill me in on the itinerary for the day, or what was going to happen. I had no menus as to what was being served, or what the bar was going to look like. <Content>"Interesting" My wife and I have traveled for many years and this hotel had its ups and downs but certain qualities bugged us the most.First the ups... By the third or fourth day the drink waiters knew what you were drinking at each meal.Our room was fine. It was clean and everyday the minibar was stocked with soda and water. Now the down part -- When you check in they give you two towel cards and that is all you are allowed to get. TWO towels? ONE towel per person. The fries were soggy most of the time. Nobody really understands much English so dont try to ask for any food done differently,,, they won;t understand.ICE... They turn off ALL the ice machines around 10:30 at night. Let me repeat that... They turn off ALL the ice machines around 10:30 at night. That is also nuts especially in weather like this. If you want ice then you must walk to the main bars and fill your ice bucket that way. Room service also stops at around 11:00pm.I recommend you bring a large cup for your drinks and keep it for the duration of your trip. Although you can get as many drinks as you like, you will be served in small plastic cups and you will be glad you brought your big mug from home. The food quality isn't first class but by no means is it bad. If you can deal with buffets then you will be fine and happy with the selections.Hope this helps.. Happy and safe travels

<Author>bp_thegolfpro
<Content>Good Week, Just Know What To Expect If you are like me and read a lot of reviews prior to booking, hopefully this will help.I booked a week at the Majestic Colonial based on the overall ratings and a general feeling from all the reviews. Having travelled pretty extensively to a lot of locations, I have a pretty realistic view when it comes to a vacation. The reviews that you read that are either AWFUL or ABSOLUTELY PERFECT..well, they either have never travelled before, or are drinking the punch - so to speak.Rooms - I had a Junior Suite - Ocean View. Best part of the trip, in my opinion. Yes the mattress is a bit tired, but it's a beautiful room with a great, stylish bathroom and a view of the ocean. The Bathroom is less than private - and if that's not your style, then go to the HOliday Inn. Mine was #3150. I could walk right out my patio door on to the beach. Yes - the room has a slight musty smell IT'S THE ISLANDS - IT'S 85% humidity! What do you expect? Also, this resort is on the planet earth, and unless you've been living in a bubble for your life, there are bugs on earth. So if you see a bug, do not assume the place is infested... just flatten the thing, toss it, and go back to relaxing.Food - Again - Know what to expect. Most of the food you eat will be from a buffet. The hardest part of a buffet is to keep food hot, all the time....and it's not. Most meals were luke-warm. If you're smart and avoid risky foods (lettuce, chicken, etc) you will be fine. But if you choose to eat anything, then don't complain about sitting on the can for the duration of your trip. OUt of the 3 of us that traveled, not one of us had a single problem, because we were smart. Skip the Taino restaurant, and book the Le Gourmet for as many times as possible. Terrific food, terrific menu, best meals by far... The Japanese steakhouse is very good, but remember - he's Dominican, not Japanese... if you order Chinese food in Alberta, don't expect it to be purely authentic.. 10-4?Pools - They're cool, refreshing, and well... a pool. Nice shape, swim up bar is handy. lots of room to cool down out of the sun.Staff - Friendly, most speak English just fine. Maintenance guys do a bang-up job of keeping the place tidy and attractive. Any encounters I had with the front desk were terrific. One young lady was extremely helpful when I checked out.General Comments; Remember it's an all-inclusive. They're going to serve you cheap booze, and lots of it. Don't go down expecting to have the best drinks...just expect free drinks. Ask for the Smirnoff if you're a vodka drinker. And if you're not a big drinker, don't be shocked to find out that some people there are. You'll be sure to have some dude in a straw hat completely blasted by 2 pm, yelling like a fool by the swim-up bar. That's the benefit to the size of the place - go somewhere else. And if you are that guy in the hat... cheers, enjoy yourself. (I wasn't the guy in the hat, by the way).Don't go expecting a Vegas Casino either - a few one-armed bandits, 2 roulette tables, 2 blackjack tables, 2 Carribean Poker tables... and that's it. All in all we had a good time. Everything was fine. out of 10 we'd give it 8 - 8.5. No real complaints. It is a bit down the beach in terms of location. It's about a 2 and a half hour walk round trip to the straw market (to the right, by the way). The beach is supreme, lots of spots to sit and cook. If you are Canadian through Signature Vacations, and are north of about 5'11, pay the extra and go in the StarClass seats. Didn't on the way down, HAD TO on the way home because I simply DID NOT fit in the standard seat....plus the drinks are free, so it lessens the blow.If Punta Cana is your choice of destination, you won't regret the choice, just don't expect to be blown away by a 5 star location...it's a quality 4+.. and dependable at that.Oh, and to the extremely RUDE wedding group down there from the 20th-27th of Nov.. may we never cross paths again. Learn some manners and decency...

<Content>Great hotel with some bumps This is going to lengthy. On the whole this is a great resort, but they do have some things to work on to be a 5 star. Some of the reviews below are off the wall. We spent 7 days at this resort and the animation team is out of this world. Whoever said all they do is play drinking games and have bikini contests is exaggerating hugely. In the week we were there I saw 1 drinking game and 1 bikini contest. I should also mention we were there with our 10yr old daughter and my 16yr old daughter and her friend. The animation crew came around and spent time with any guests who were interested in this. My kids loved them. These staff members work from 10am to 1am every day and they never run out of energy. In my opinion they are by far the best part of this resort. Please remember to tip if you feel they have worked for it. It is one area that people forget about. This whole team is wonderful.We arrived 3 hours late due to a flight delay. We travelled with Nolitours. Don't make the mistake in thinking that you are getting anything extra with this tour company. It is false advertising. You can get a cheaper golf rate from the hotel...there rooms are in the 3rd building which in my opion is the worst of all of them and you do not get 1 st choice of dinner reservations. It's all bull. We requested 2 rooms next to each other in the 2 building. I requested this with Nolitours and with AnneMarie from the hotel directly. When we arrived at midnight and went to our room we were at opposite ends of the building 3. We were told to speak to a manager the next morning. We spoke to Hilario and he arranged for us to be in building 2 close to the beach overlooking the pool. We were very happy with the new location. The rooms are gorgeous. Yes you have to be careful on the floors when wet, but thats the case anywhere in the carribean, not isolated to this hotel only.The service at this hotel on the whole is great. The management team, animation team, pool bartenders (especially Rosa), the lower level lobby bartenders, waiters in Japanese, Chinese, DOminican,Breakfast buffet and Gourmet are great. We had superb service at these places.Now for the bad service. The Seafood restaurant is the worst. They are almost rude in here and don't like to give out extra food. It is an all inclusive and you should be able to order what you want as you can in any other restaurant. We heard complaints from others about this restaurant, but went with an open mind. Well we agreed with what everone said. We also didn't really enjoy the steakhouse service. The food was good but we were really rushed. We are on vacation and live extremely busy lives. The last thing we want to do on vacation is rush. The lunch buffet by the beach was very slow or nonexistant.The other area were the service is bad is the upstairs lobby bar. The main bartender there does ignore you when you are waiting to order a drink. I got fed up and walked away and never went back to it. Its too bad he is like that because he makes a mean Mojito. The other main complaint was they ran out of things a couple of times. For instance they ran out of fresh mint for 3 days, and ran out of bananas twice for the remaining part of that day.The appearance of this resort is beautiful. They are for ever cleaning everywhere, so much so that my husband and I would joke about it. The beach is the nicest in Punta Cana. It goes on forever and the sea is beautiful colors of blue. We unfortuanetly had some bad weather while we were there but we could get into the ocean everyday but one.No one in our party got sick, but we did hear of some people who had stomach problems. We were just careful about buffet food and didn't overinduldge in alcohol.I should mention they have photographers taking pictures all week. They do an amazing job. We ended spending alot of money on some great photos. If they take your picture make sure you stop by the photo shop to see them. We were really happy with this service. Overall we had a great vacation. Yes there were some problems but we were on vacation so we didnt let them bother us too much. If you are looking for problems you can find them anywhere. We would return to this resort again if we were guaranteed the 2nd building. If they work on the service in some areas I would definitely give it 5 stars. It was a great vacation for the price.

<Author>deanameredith
<Content>Best Pool in DR Stayed here in Oct 08. We have been to DR 6 times Mexico 5 times and Jamaica so will provide a review based on our overall travels.Hotel Overall: Excellent - The grounds are immaculate. Staff are fabulous, the Dominican people are so nice generally but staffing here is very very good. Rooms cannot be faulted, very good standard, large balcony, mini bar with soft drinks, water and beers (tip a few bucks each day and a note if you require extras), Ice bucket, coffee maker and coffee, herbal teas, sugar, creamer (bring some t-bags if you love your cuppa, there's never enough black/breakfast tea in rooms or buffet). Ice machines on ground floor near lifts. We had a standard room 3440 which we loved, 3rd floor no-one above us here with a great view of beach and main pool bar (which offered great amusement around 4pm lol). It was a fair walk from the lobby  main buffet but not only did it help with all those calories but we much preferred the beachfront bar on an evening with the sea breeze, also they were happy to give you full cups of liquor to take away at the end of the evening for your nightcap in room etc if you asked. The Pool FANTASTIC!!! It's such a great pool, always loads of beds available at all times, bars at each end, 2 big jacuzzi's in pool, swim from the lobby end of hotel all the way to the beach (only one little wall to either climb over or round) a great place if your a water baby like me. Beach is great, very very pretty, no rocks etc in water but the waves and current are very strong in October so be careful not to go too far out.Can't comment on shows as we didn't bother with them as they are all about the same in the DR but there is an nightly film in the sports bar which is handy.My only 2 very slight problems are regarding the food. Firstly in the buffet a lot of the food is not always very warm, unless it's from the cooking stations which are always excellent but don't get me wrong the food is very good and loads of choice and secondly the service at the steakhouse is very erratic (we were given our 2nd and main course together and another table were given 3 courses at once. Don't let this put you off though as we enjoyed the steaks very very much but if you know before you go that this can happen you wont be worried by it (we went twice and it was the same both times).We would go back to this resort again without hesitation. Hope this helps as I use TA to help me with my hotel choices loads.

<Author>ksvoice
<Content>Awesome holiday!! We went to the majestic colonial for my brother's wedding and it was gorgeous. I found the staff incredibly friendly and I would like to give a shout out to Rafael who worked in the buffet and mexican restaurant! He remembered my one and a half year olds name throughout the trip and was extremely friendly. All of the staff were for the most part friendly. The hotel was fully booked, that being said there was usually a spot at the beach to be had. We had to put towels out early to sit by the pool. The animation team by the pool were also very friendly and calling my sister and cousin by name by the end of the trip to come and do activities! The food was good with a lot of variety. I personally got a little sick of the menu and I think eating for two weeks there might have been too much! Most of us did get minor cases of diarrhea at one time or another so I would suggest some immodium. There was also misquito's, suprisingly, mostly early morning and at night! The wedding was gorgeous even though there were a few issues with the private dinner the bride and groom were supposed to get. It is actually just a dinner in one of the restaurants that they could go to anytime anyways. I was thinking it would be on the beach or more romantic. Their breakfast the morning after the wedding was extremely late 11:30am so that was also a little frustrating for them. They were happy with the photographer though! The photo hut is a little cash cow. I spent 60 US dollars myself just on pictures that the hotel photographer took of us bumming around the resort. I love that they will give you a private photo session if you want. they charge 10 dollars per picture if you want a burnt cd. not cheap, but worth it if you are on a honeymoon or want family pics done. there work was fantastic!Now for the drawbacks. The beds were extremely hard and uncomfortable! I had a room with two double beds and the rest of my party that had these rooms agreed that the beds were very hard. The rooms do not leave much to the imagination because you can literally hear everything that is going on in the toilet because it is not fully enclosed. The housekeeping was random and sometimes was not done until 5 or 6pm at night. For some reason the power kept going out so bring a watch to reset the clock in your room. some rooms didn't even have a clock. The pool was a little dirty for my liking with debris floating in it. It didn't seem like they gave it a very thorough cleaning every day. the kid's area was also lacking. Bring some toys if you have kids because the hotel provides no water toys for the kiddies. My son played mostly in the shallow pool by the pool bar. The stores in the hotel were a major rip off. It cost 12 dollars for deodorant! If you are looking for touristy stuff you can go and barter at the market that is just outside of the first set of gates (about a 10 minute walk) You will get way cheaper souvenirs. All said and done we had a fantastic trip and I would recommend this hotel. It is not quite a 5 star rating, but it could be with a little more work!

<Author>SunnyDLongIsland_NY
<Content>Beautiful, clean and friendly resort From the moment you step into this resort the feeling is truly majestic. The two-story open air lobby is equisitely, yet comfortably furnished with a full-service bar. Perfect spot to relax while waiting for travel companions to join you.Main feature is the hotel length pool - absolutely wonderful! If you can, get a ground floor room facing the pool. You can exit your sliding glass doors and walk 20 steps to the pool and jump right in. Rooms are gorgeous but not big on privacy - modest travelers may consider putting a towel down on the floor of the shower while dressing (it's huge - it could stand 4 or 5 people).There are several restaurants which are all decent but our fav by far was the Mexican one. Japanese and French require reservations so book when you arrive.Beach is gorgeous!! Comfortable lounge chairs and plenty of palm trees and palm umbrellas if you need some shade. You can snorkel or boogie board for 1hr. per day per person per room so if you like to snorkel for extended periods, bring your own stuff. Reef is very close to shore. Windsurfing and Catamaran are also included.The staff couldn't have been friendlier!!! Everyone spoke enough english to assist your needs. We went down to breakfast buffet each morning and were always warmly welcomed by Marisal Savados Refinas. She was always so cheerful and happy to see us and exchanged light conversation. Made us feel very comfortable.Entertainment every night in their beautiful, huge, open air covered theater complete with wait staff bar service . Entertainmant not always appropriate for children or teens, however one night there was an acrobatic circus that was really great for everyone.Don't forget several cans or bottles of sunscreen because it is very expensive at the resort!!

Just wanted to report this before anyone else falls victim to this.If I was told ahead of time, I would have been able to change my plans in coming. I work for the airlines, so that is not a problem to fly at a later date. Also, if you get stuck not being able to make reservations at the ala carte restaurants, you will be at the buffets. The food was horrible. Pizza was the only thing we liked. I will say the ala carte restaurants we were able to get into, were quite good. I know I will be bashed by some regarding my comments. My wife and I felt really bad for this young couple that arrived on Sunday. They were on their honeymoon! They were so disgusted by the room they got, they left to go back home. You make reservations, expect to get all the amenities that read about. Only you end up with quite the opposite. We were also told we could upgrade for $30/night to the Ambra, where you get 24hr room service, things that we have received at the Majestic. I should not have to pay anything more out of my pocket, the Majestic should have done that for us.I do understand that a delay can happen, I also do understand that one might need to be moved to another location. But, I do believe a resort should do everything possible to make your stay as nice as it would be if you were at your original resort where booked. Should not be way way less!Although I can't actually review the hotel, this is more of a review of the way they are treating those who were booked and moved. The Gran Bahia is rated # 34 out of 86, you would think the #1 resort Majestic would have moved us to at least first top ten.

<Author>rcolumbus
<Content>didn't want to leave... My best friend and I were slated to stay at the new Majestic Elegance from November 8th to the 15th, but due to opening delays resided instead at the Majestic Colonial. I myself had never been to the Dominican Republic, where she had been numerous occasions to the different tourist areas throughout the country. I think we were both equally impressed with the resort and area alike. To me there could have been no better ambassador to the Dominican than the Majestic Colonial; every member of staff I met was extremely and genuinely friendly (not to mention incredibly hard working). I found this to be true elsewhere in the area as well (just in case you are thinking of excursions). Amazingly enough the great attitudes of the people working at the Majestic rubbed off on our fellows tourists; we made many new friends Dominican and American. The hotel itself is beautiful, perfectly echoing its natural surroundings. The grounds are impeccably landscaped and facilities are well-maintained. Rooms are spacious and very clean (love the big shower and Jacuzzi tub). Each room also has a balcony or sitting area which is nice for relaxing in the evening. The pool, though second to the beach in my opinion, is one of the hotels greatest assets. It is refreshing and large, spanning just about the entire length of the hotel. There is always a place to rest in the sun or under the palapas. Drinks are never far away whether walking to the bar or swimming. We tried all of the restaurants including the two a la carte, and always found something we like. Desserts were always fabulous; the local fruits were especially delicious (as is anything covered in chocolate!). The best place by far is the beach. I highly recommend snorkeling. There is a vast array of beautiful fish swimming around the coral reefs that dot the shoreline of the property. *While you are on the beach, say hello to the wonderful beach concierge Denny. He is very sweet, attentive, and will make you feel right at home. I miss him already!!!Do not hesitate to stay at this property. If you are easy going like myself, you will find nothing wrong. I think even the more discerning clientele would have to agree, the tiniest of problems are greatly overshadowed by the gracious people who are there to welcome you and assist you in your stay.

All the water used throughout the resort is purified, you can check this out with your vacation representative.All in all, I would not hesitate to go back to the resort in a heartbeat, for a third time. <Author>realriderbmc
<Content>A great resort We just returned from an enjoyable stay at the Majestic Colonial which is located in the Bavaro beach/coastline area, about a 35 minute drive from the Punta Cana airport. We had flown in with our 18 month old son for our friends' wedding to be held later during the week.We arrived at the resort at approximately 8 pm and were immediately impressed with the beautiful lobby/reception area. The check-in process was straightforward and we were greeted by one of the staff handing out a tray of tropical drinks - a very nice way to start our vacation!The lobby/main reception area is enormous. On the reception area there is an internet/library room (air conditioned), a jewellery shop, a cigar shop, and a large seating area with many couches and coffee tables and a well stocked bar. Most evenings the resort has a pianist playing piano which makes for a nice relaxing environment. Adjacent to the internet room are 3 desks for concierge service where you can book golf tee times or dinner reservations/excursions outside of the resort.There are porters on hand to haul your luggage to your room - because we had our toddler with us, we had a lot of luggage and the porter still managed to cart all of it using a little dolly within the promised 15 minute time frame.Coming down the stairs from the main lobby is another bar/lounge area, surrounded by 3 restaurants (Taino - Caribbean fare, Le Gourmet - French cuisine, and Matsuri - Oriental offerings). The rooms are set up such that they buildings run perpendicular to the main building (front of the main building faces west, and the hotel room buildings run east west, with the east side closest to the beach/ocean). In between the two parallel building structures is the pool. A huge pool. More on that later.We booked a junior suite (separate master bedroom ensuite) and the living room area was separted from the master BR via wooden sliding doors. The room was huge and being on the 4th floor we had very high ceiings which added to the feeling of space. The living room area doubled as our son's bedroom at night, and because our master BR was so big and had its own TV and its own minibar (there is also one in the living room area) we never felt trapped at night. Another nice touch with the junior suite is that you get an extra large/long balcony, accessible from both the living room area and the bedroom area. Our room faced the interior of the resort so we had a good view of the pool. The rooms are air conditioned which made for a nice reprieve from being out in the sun every day.We loved the pool area. The pool basically runs the entire length of the hotel room building structures. Even being on the fourth floor we were a quick elevator ride and 60 second walk to the pool. Closer to the ocean side of the pool there is a swim-up bar. This area is usually where the games/festivities are held.This place is designed for weddings. There is a beautiful white gazebo which is used for weddings, although many others choose to get married on the beach (there is a gazebo set up on the beach as well - this is where our friends got married). The staff can quickly convert a bar/ lounge area into a nice wedding reception area complete with white/ ivory chair covers and dinner table settings.Overall we found the food to be good - the buffet is adequate and contained enough variety to satisfy our toddler. Although there was variety I wouldn't say that the food was top notch. especially compared to some all-inclusives I've been to in Cancun. The staff are very attentive and friendly, always quick to refresh your drink and take away finished plates and replace cutlery.The steakhouse in the palapa hut by the ocean is very good. You don't need reservations, unlike other a la carte restaurants at other all-inclusives, so we were able to visit some of the a la carte restaurants more than once. The chateaubriand was good - although the portions could have been larger (I'm sure I could just ordered extra). Sirloin steak was also very good and accurately cooked - portion size was spot on.We didn't visit Le Gourmet (reservations required, children are not permitted in the restaurant) but our friends indicated that they enjoyed the food.Matsuri served oriental food. Reservations are required if you want the Teppan-Yaki food demonstration experience (basically the chefs cook the food in front of you) but no reservations are required is you eat in the general restaurant area. Sushi is mediocre - we showed up just when the restaurant opened and it appeared that the sushi had been sitting there for a couple hours. The fish and shrimp used in the nigiri-sushi seemed to be dried up and shriveled. We ordered a lemon chicken dish - the lemon sauce was a bit too overpowering and a pork chow mein dish which seemed to have a whole bottle of soy sauce thrown into the dish! Overall we weren't impressed with the food at Matsuri.The beach area is fantastic. Beautiful sand, warm ocean, and there always seemed to be a nice breeze blowing through which helped to take the edge off of the humidity.Hotel staff, the bueffet staff (Yissel, and all the guys and gals at Buffet Supreme - thank you for your hospitality and for putting up with our energetic little boy!), chambermaids and pool and beach staff were all very friendly and courteous. This is one of the reasons why we enjoyed the resort so much.There is an onsite spa - we both booked massages and had different experiences even though we both used the same massage therapist (Claudia). Mine was in the morning and the massage was good. Claudia must have been tired by the time the afternoon rolled around because she actually fell ASLEEP while she was giving my wife a massage. What the???? Spa staff overall were friendly.For those with toddlers/babies - it's hit and miss as to whether or not your room will be equipped with a playpen/crib. We chose to bring one with us and it turned out to be a good decision because there wasn't one in our suite when we arrived. A small hassle to bring it with us, but proved handy in the end.The resort has babysitting service ($15 USD per hour) which is great for couples bringing their kids. Allows you to get away and have a quiet dinner or two! Thanks to Leonella for babysitting.Overall - an above average experience due to the friendliness of the staff, the resort layout, the amazing pool area and the beach area. Don't expect a lot from the food - it is average at best.

<Author>vaca_03
<Content>Sub-4 Star We stayed at the Majestic Colonial for 3 nights/4 days with a large group. The trip was fabulous but I attribute most of the positives to the group that I was with and to the staff of the resort. Below is my attempt to write a neutral and comprehensive review of Majestic Colonial because I rely heavily on these reviews when I travel.Staff* The team in place throughout this resort is very professional* English is clearly not their first language, but each of the servers and staff was able to successfully and positively communicate despite the potential language barriers* Check out Victor by the pool bar---the other reviews are spot on when they praise him* It helps to tip (the drive from the airport to the resort shows how poor it is in the immediate area)Facilities* In general, the facilities throughout the resort are clean and nice* The beach is absolutely gorgeous and I'd return to Punta Cana anytime for the lovely beaches* We were surprised that this resort is only several years old because the building structures, outdoor furniture, and pool area seem older and dated* The large pool is great, especially if the resort is ever at full capacity* The situation with the towels annoyed me after a while (even though you had a bracelet and key, you still have to show the towel card)* The disco was entertaining, but the casino is pretty pathetic (and very smoky)* The walkways were always cleanFood* The food was horrible (there's just no other way to describe it)* Typically, the breakfast options at these all-inclusives are good and, in general, fulfill the purpose---not here! The breakfast/brunch was not very impressive and I worried about the overall cleanliness at the buffet* Still worse were the restaurant options; it didn't matter where you ate, everything had the same taste and no appeal* The only positive that I have relating to the food was our experience at the Japanese restaurant (we made reservations for the hibachi); the food was okay here but it was the chefs that made this one of our favorite dinners---thank you, Marcelino and Davio! I highly recommend you all make the reservations and eat here.Rooms* The room grew more dissatisfactory as the trip went on* Our bed wasn't made when we first arrived, which wasn't a big deal because we wanted to head to the pool right away. BUT, by nighttime, it still wasn't made and the comforter was stained (gross!)* The rooms never really felt really clean and again, you realized quickly where the resort skimped (mold near the sinks, clogged sink, broken jacuzzi, etc.)Overall Resort* While we had a nice time on this trip, I cannot honestly say that I'd return to the Majestic Colonial* When deciding to write a review, I hoped to project an accurate and thsu meaningful contribution. In that regard, I would say that my experience is relative to other true 4-5 star all-inclusives that I've visited (Riu Palace and Dreams Resorts). Compared to these other franchises, Majestic Colonial disappoints and falls in the sub-4 star category.

<Author>Carribeantravels
<Content>Great AI but advise from a very sick guest I agree with most of the reviews about the hotel but here is some advise I wish that someone had posted when I had read the reviews. HOW TO AVOID BECOMING ILL. If I can prevent you from getting ill, as we did, then at least all will not be lost. We travelled Oct. 22-30, 2008.I guess that we (4 of us) should have become worried when the bus announcer told us about 20+ times not to brush our teeth with the tap water. OK, I got that and did not. He assured us that all produce etc. was washed in purified water and water at eating areas was also purified. Take your chances on that. On our second day, despite all precations, my friends and I all became became violently ill. In fact, we all passed out either onto the hard marble floors or onto the cement around the pool hiting our heads and receiving large bumps.Major amounts of Gravol to get home and we were sick for at least 5 days after returning. So our 7 day vacation turned into at least a 2 day vacation and 5 days of sickness, plus 3 days work loss.Doing research upon returning home, we found out the following:Do not eat eat any produce or vegetables that do/did not have a peel.Do not eat anything from the sea.Do not drink any water, except bottled water, even at buffets.Only choose dishes that are bubbling hot or cooked in front of you.Majestic has a cooked vegetarian section, try it.Do not eat at the Beach Buffet where food is more often recycledThis is a 5* hotel that is only 2 years old....many people we talked to, since we looked so ill, also told us that they felt ill too. Shame on this hotel for not providing the purified water for all patrons. A purification system would be inexpensive in the long run as we won't be back to the DR despite the fact that the Majestic is otherwise a very nice place to vacation.Hope this helps. Sounds limiting but you take your chances. I took gravol, imodium etc. and nothing worked. We are all social drinkers and not heavy sunbathers, so we know it was the food/water. Be careful of young and elderly, please, because we were very, very ill.

Water sports, banana boats and all, be free to talk to those people and negotiate the price and time you want them to provide services for, other wise you'll get short time on anything. Go to their Photo store, make an appoitment and take lots of pictures with their professional photographers, Santi was amazying, we made an appoitment and he spent like over an hour with us, the pictures are just the BEST!!!. Please tip those people as well. Also, as i found out two days before leaving, there is room service ( towel change and that) in the evening and someone else than morning person does it, so leave a tip for that person as well. Take dollar bills with you, and even a dollar makes people happy. Stuff and service was good, have nothing to complain about.Bring comfy shoes, flip flops and anything you need, just bring, or will need to pay some high price for... cheap stuff...My honey is a coffee drinker and he didn't like their coffee, so bring your own, just in case.Before going to the airport, which wasn't as bad as people mentioned, EAT and even take some snacks with you, bring ziplock bags or wrap with you and take the food to the airport. The road to the airport wasn't bad at all, yes the country is very poor, but i guess most people don't know what bad roads are :))) come on everyone be thankful and.... enjoy.We went to use spa and had massage, that was very nice, i had aromatherapy and the woman was great.Entertainment: the hotel shows : magic show, circus, dancers performars were unprofessional. The beach party was boring, nothing special. The animation team was good, and shows with audience were great, funny, so good and i would rather watch that than have so called professionals to come over. WEATHER; was so warm, hot at times, it rained like 4 times during our 10 nights for about 10 minutes. The stay was great, but i wouldn't go to DR again, it seems that the hotels are not as good as in mexico. But no regrets, enjoyed, relaxed and had fun. Take lots of pictures, walk around to other resorts, be happy!!!

<Author>blackjag
<Content>Destination Wedding at Majestic Colonial was great Must husband and I just returned from having our daughter's destination wedding at Majestic Colonial Punta Cana in Dominican Republic.Our experience was wonderful, only we wished we had booked a few more days than the 5 days we did book, just to have more time to ourselves after the guests left. Besides my husband and myself and the bride and groom, there were 20 guests that attended. The hotel and grounds are very beautiful with every ammenity you could imagine. Service was wonderful and the staff was cordial, polite and helpful, and most spoke English. The few that did not speak English, such as the housekeepers, we had no trouble communicating with using sign and body language--not a big deal. Bring a Spanish-English dictionary with you if you think you could use one.The day of the wedding, 6 of us women utilized the spa for makeup, hair and nails, and all of us were very happy with how we looked when we were done. If you bring a picture of how you want your hair done, they will be happy to comply, or they have their own pictures there as well.We had the rehearsal dinner in the Taino restaurant and it was great and the food was wonderful, as was the service. This was done by reservation of course, so the staff could plan for us.The wedding itself went off without a hitch and the wedding coordinator and planner did a wonderful job taking care of things. The wedding was under the gazebo and it was romantic and beautifully decorated. Originally, the bride wanted the ceremony on the beach, but the coordinator advised us the day of, that the weather forecast was for 90% chance of rain and advised that we have it under the gazebo on the property, instead. I was impressed that they were looking out for us regarding that detail, as we were so busy with other things that we weren't watching the weather forecast. I think the gazebo was a better choice, personally, anyway. The ceremony took place at 5:00 pm, which was a cooler time of the day and very comfortable at that time of the year.The reception following the ceremony was in the Parrot Bar by the pool in the evening and the table settings and decorations and food was fantastic. We did personalize by adding some of our own touches, such as our own colored tapered candles and candlesticks and table runners that we wanted to use. We brought those over with us on the airplane, and provided them instructions on how we wanted them to place them on the tables. We had a full moon that night, and we arranged for a DJ and everything was wonderful. Again, the food was fantastic and exquisitely presented and decorated.I felt that it was less stress for all involved to do a wedding this way, with the added benefit of being able to take a vacation at the same time and actually spend some quality time with family and guests for such a special occasion.I highly recommend the Majestic Colonial for a destination wedding or for just a vacation. I would love to return again. There are 7 restaurants, 5 a la Carte, 1 buffet, and 1 fast food. Nine bars, nightime and daytime animation programs, and more. Just a fun place and they have a really neat pool. A word of advice for novice travelers. Be aware that the water is not potable on the island, but the hotel provides free bottled water and restocks the minibar in the rooms with it daily. Must use bottled water to brush teeth, so don't drink or rinse your mouth with tap water. The water and ice served in the Majestic hotel restaurants and bars is safe, however, as they use a purifed water source for food and drink preparation. In addition, contact your local health department for any needed immunizations prior to traveling, as should be the case when you travel anywhere out of the US. Only eat cooked vegetables and well cooked meat, and fruits without the peeling. If you follow these rules, you should be just fine and as always, don't overdo the alchohol. No one in our group became sick, by following these rules.Our trip was all inclusive, and although no tipping was required, we brought plenty of one dollar bills to tip anyway, as 47% of the island lives below the poverty level, and they do such a fine job,. We were more than glad to tip them a dollar or so here and there for their services. Also, we found that a tip left for housekeeping each day and a note or personal request for something, insured that we got looked after over and beyond. I also brought basic school supplies (pencils, paper, crayons, coloring books, stickers, etc.) for the staff's children as they are hard to come by there, which they were so grateful for. The Dominican people are a happy, pleasant people, and I enjoyed getting to know them.

They gave us 1 coffee for the room and when it was finished they never replaced it, again we had to chase the maid down hall and get one from her. Very unprofessional and it seemed like the maid didn't really care about her job and yet we were leaving $5 a day tips for her. After days of service like this I stopped the tips pretty fast! Mosquito's were another problem the first day or two I must have killed 60 of them in our room alone. Finally I went down to the lobby and asked if they could do something about it I was told that they could spray the room and it would help. It did help somewhat and cut down on the mosquito's considerably. To come to a conclusion the small things were just not there at all, and that's what counts for us! They really need to have their employees learn some English as well, most of the employees we spoke to, spoke nothing but Spanish and smiled. The most beautiful part of our trip was the excursion to Sanoma Island it was breathtaking and fun! So in the end we were not that impressed with their resort, and would never go back there, we had much better service and professionalism at the Riu in Playa Del Carmin, Mexico in February! There were staff waiting for us upon arrival and as people on here had said they were quick to take our bags after checking in. We were so impressed with our terrace. We had an oceanview/beachfront room and the terrace was so nice we spent more time on it then on the beach. Although when we went to the beach it was only a few steps away. We used the wirlpool in the day to cool off..it was hot in the sun so the wirlpool was much appreciated.The hurricane had caused a lot of minor flooding but I must say you would never know it. The workers at this hotel are out cleaning 24/7. We were amazed to see so many people working and how quickly they worked. Housekeeping came everyday and tried to come at the same time about 9:30am but with being on our honeymoon we weren't getting up early. They did come back later in the afternoon to clean the room which we were happy with because most hotels they come once and if you aren't there too bad they don't come back. Our drinks were the same...always filled. The food was good..we had no problems at all. The steakhouse and the main buffet were our favorites. We always had lots to eat there. Alcohol at the main bar at least was very strong. Two drinks and I was done..this is not typical for me so I was surprised because so many people on here had said that the drinks were watered down. The coke..well it's definately NOT like our coke that's for sure. It comes from the US but it's just flat and tastes like it's missing something. But it's drinkable. The beach was gorgeous..I wish I was on it right now :( There is nothing... nothing bad we could say about this resort. I also loved that it was more of an adult resort although there were some children..it was just amazing and I would go back!!

<Author>ballplayer1
<Content>Excellent stay at the Majestic I just returned from a stay at the Majestic Colonial from 9/27 - 10/4. This resort is truly Majestic. I've been to resorts in Mexico, Puerto Rico, Cuba, The Bahamas and Jamaica and this one stands out by far. It has matured into a 5* resort.Pros:-------* Beautiful beach - white sand, turquoise warm water* Customer Service - everyone wants to make you happy* Food - There is good selection from multiple restaurants. Surprisingly, we found the buffet to be the best. It's nice that some of the food there is cook to order* Pool - it is gorgeous and 1200ft pool with a swim up bar in the middle* Entertainment: Loved the anamacion team; Awesome beach party with professional circus; Great magic show* Drinks: Make sure you try their drink Majestic. Also..try the mamajuana.* Lobby: The lobby is stunningly beautiful. You'll sit there and not want to leave.Cons:--------* Mosquitoes: There are lots of mosquitoes at night. Even though the rooms are air conditioned, they still manage to get in and bite* Bathrooms: The bathroom configuration is awkward. There is only a frosted door that separates the toilet from the rest of the room.* Location: The beach is great, but there is not much to do in town. You'll likely never leave the resort* Sports Complex: This area is underdeveloped and not maintained. The tennis court was usable, but there was no soccer, basketball nor archery as advertised. Tips:-------* Bring mosquito repellent and even a mosquito coil* Bring US currency. We never even saw the local Dominican Currency while there. Even in Santo Domingo, everything is priced in USD.* Bring a stack of $US 1 bills for tipping * Book excursions early as they are only available on certain days* Only go on the Santo Domingo excursion if you are a history buff. It's a very long trip with little time to enjoy the sites.* Vendors have a hard time taking No as an answer. If you don't want to buy something, then just walk fast and avoid eye contact.

<Author>kgkitkat
<Content>A Honest Review My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at the Majestic, along with 2 close friends of ours. We had requested rooms in Buildings 2 or 3 ahead of time through Ann Marie, and were happy to see that we were down the hall from eachother in Building 3, when we checked in. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. Some parts were a little beat up, but we were happy with the view of the pool and ocean. Our luck turned a little sour when we came back to our room later in the evening on our first night there. As I walked into the bathroom, the glass door fell from its hinges and shattered everywhere! We called down to the front desk, and housekeeping was in our room within 3-5 minutes to clean it up. A few managers came into the room to check it out as well- based on their reactions, I don't think it happens too often. We went back to the front desk to get a different room, and we were upgraded to a full ocean view room, still down the hall from our friends. (#3250) This room was beautiful and in much better shape than our previous room. We loved the room, with the exception of the leak in our bathroom ceiling. It was unfortunate to have Hurricane Kyle stop by on our vacation, or else the leak would probably have not been noticed at all. Other than the occasional cockroach visitor in our room, it was very comfortable.The food is plentiful and there was usually enough to choose from. We did experience some upset stomachs/not so pleasant bathroom experiences and definitely would recommend bringing an assortment of stomach medications, such as GasX, Immodium, Pepto, and Tums.The drinks were great- sometimes you will need to specify that you want rum added to the frozen drink: example- a majestic with rum or a pina colada with rum. We did an excursion to Saona Island through Hotelbeds. We were told that it was a 25 min ride to the excursion, with a speedboat and catamaran ride, snorkeling, and we'd be back by 630PM. Well- it was a good time, but it ended up being about an hour drive to another large bus of people, then another hour and a half drive to the speedboat, which then took us to the catamaran, which then took us to the island, with no snorkeling. Then the same on the way back. We got back at 800PM. All in all, we enjoyed the island, but would probably have prefered to know what was really going to happen ahead of time! We were a bit nauseous that evening upon returning to the hotel.If I were to come back to this hotel, I would come back due to the staff. They were so friendly and helpful. If they did not know the answer for you, they directed you to who would know. There was always someone around, and plenty of people serving at the bars and restaurants. A smile and a hola goes a long way here- and you will always get it returned right back at you.

<Author>LintomNewJersey
<Content>Awesome Hotel We had heard many good things about this hotel but they were all understated. This was the best vacation we have ever experienced. We went there to celebrate our anniversary. Our travel agent was able to get us an upgrade to a bottom floor opposite the pool. This is building 2. When we arrived, check-in went smoothly and the door of our room had a Happy Anniversary banner on it. This suite was beautiful. The bath area had two sinks, a large walk-in shower and a jacuzzi. We also had another jacuzzi on the balcony. They had spread live flowers all over the area. To welcome us, there was a bottle of wine and an assortment of fruits and cheeses. Half the nights we were there, each night there was some wine and another treat waiting for us. The pool outside our room was the biggest one I had ever seen. It mendered over 1200 ft. through the property and had water jets every couple of hundred feet. The temperature was delightful and we spent many hours there. The beach was also great and clean and I enjoyed the topless bathing feature. One night we had a great beach party with food, drink, dancing and a limbo contest. One day for lunch they set up a 6 foot pan of paella on the beach. There were numerous restaurants and only two, Le Gourmet and Hatsuri needed reservations. They fill up quickly, so I'd recommend making reservations for your stay as soon as you check in. The best is the Hibachi cooking at Matsuri. The buffet place is great for breakfast every morning and the lunch and dinner is also good. The beach area has two places, Beef and Seafood. The Chauteaubriand is awesome. The seafood is just Ok. Stay away from the lobster. We had good fortune in the small casino. Your money will gom further if you use pesos because the minimums are less. If you get hungry late, there's a snack bar next to the casino that's open from 11pm to 4am. It seems that we had every rum drink imaginable. The best bar is the upper lobby bar staffed by Roberto, the best bartender we've ever encountered. Every drinking session was an adventure. Tipping is not required, but just a couple of dollars daily left for the maid(on the sink) and for your favorite bartender go a long way to getting great service. Finally, theren was good entertainment and dancing every night. No need to ever leave the resort. We can't wait to return to this wonderful place.

<Author>french_vanilah
<Content>Dream Vacation We just returned from staying at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana, and it was by FAR the best resort we've ever been to. Usually we go to Mexico, and were a little weary on the Dominican experience in general because of mixed reviews we've heard from friends, but we decided to give it a try, not expecting much. But we were completely blown away by this resort!Check-in went okay. There was a bit of a mix up since we missed our flight and had to catch a later one, but it got cleared up right away. We recieved a free upgrade to a ground level room which consisted of TWO jacuzzi tubs, one indoor, one outdoor, as well as swim-up access to the gorgeous, lagoon-style pool. Needless to say, the room itself was as gorgeous and amazing as it sounds. The bed was huge and SUPER comfortable. I usually have trouble sleeping while on vacation but slept like a baby here.The lobby area was amazing as well, consisting of two huge levels and two bars. And all the drinks were perfect! The food started off kinda blah, but seemed to get better as the week progressed. The Japanese Tapanyaki experience is a must!! My husband hates japanese food but it was the most delicious meal of the week! Everything there tasted perfect and the chef and servers were really friendly. The Gourmet restaurant served really good food too. The Mexican/Dominican restaurant was a bit of a let down. Everything tasted a little off so we left right away and finished our dinner at the buffet. Buffet food was pretty standard. Had a pasta station and pizza, along with a salad bar and the other usual buffet foods. There's a snack bar that stays open from 11pm -4am if you get a late night craving, and they serve the BEST burgers and nachos. You even see the guy cutting up the tortillas to make the nachos fresh! Ketchup tasted normal as well, which is odd for Dominican or Cuba. Breakfasts were good too.This resort had the nicest beach we've ever been to, hands down. Powder white sand and you can see colourful fish swimming by your feet!Mosquitos in general were pretty bad. But I brought After Bite so I was fine with that. The staff and bartenders were generally very nice and a lot speak english. The only thing that got a bit annoying were the photographers and the night the merchants that came in to sell their jewellery. They're both pretty forceful, even when you say no. Once a photographer from the resort was wearing jeans and just jumped in to the pool to take pictures of people. I found we were hiding from them quite often!Even though it rained the majority of the days we were there, it was still easily the best vacation my husband and I have ever been on. On rainy days the Animation Crew would come around with cookies, and board games which was nice. The entertainment was alright. We only watched the Michael Jackson show, the International Show, and the Magic Show. The Magic Show was really good!I would definitely come back (maybe to try the new Majestic Elegance next door!) and I would recommend this resort to any couple. It's more suited for couples, as the rooms are very open concept...no separate bathroom area really.
