<Author>elitenyc
<Content>Mixed feelings My family members are Dominican natives, so every summer we go and vacation there and stay at new resorts. The Majestic has by far been the best pick. In total, there were 63 of us staying at the majestic and considering the large number of us staying there, check in was VERY fast. It will usually take about an hour at the least for us to be checked in and this time it took only about 20 minutes. Upon arrival they greet you with a cold towel and a cold colata which is great for the tropical weather. I would assume that since it only took 20 minutes to check in 63 people it would take even less time to check in a smaller group.FOODBefore going on the trip I religiously came to trip advisor to catch up on new reviews. I became worried about the food and I find that although it wasn't gourmet food, it was fine. The food was pretty basic. You can always find something to eat at the supreme buffet. Don't eat the pancakes at breakfast, they were awful, but the waffles are great! For lunch and dinner they have a lot of varieties so you will find something, believe me! You can also try one of the restaurants although we had a terrible experience at La Hispaniola restaurant: the service was horrible! They didn't take our orders til about 25 minutes after we sat and the food didn't come til about 40 mins after we ordered (and only 5 of us were at my table, everyone else was eating somewhere else or had already eaten). And it wasn't even out waiter who brought us our food! We had to ask another man to find out where our food was. After that night I decided to stick to the buffet, where I know how long it will take to get my food!SERVICEAs I just said, the service at La Hispaniola restaurant was terrible, but since I didn't try any other restaurants I can't speak for them. Service at the door of the buffet can also be a bit unrefined during lunch hour. Since during those hours (12 noon- 3pm) people are either on the beach on in the pool, when they want to go to lunch they are wet. The people at the door do not tolerate that and will make you go back to your rooms and change (try to get a room not ending in a number after 25 if you want to be close to the buffet). Service everywhere else was pretty ordinary. Nothing to brag about. HOWEVER! There are some men by the beach who claim to take you in a boat ride to see dolphins, to a natural pool, and scuba diving. DO NOT DO IT. The dolphins we saw were part of another resort and were putting on a show about 80 feet away for people who paid for it. Standing so far trying to see was embarrassing! The natural pool was nice, it was at the beach and about 4 feet deep away from the shore so it was nice. NOT worth the 2 HOUR trip on a very small boat though. And about the scuba diving, YEAH right. If you want to do real scuba diving speak to someone who comes to the pool everyday to give scuba lessons. They had a bucket full of goggles and used mouth pieces covered in sand and salt water. It was gross.THE WORST PART OF ALL was when we ran out of gas about 40 minutes away from the resort. The man had to swim to shore to buy gasoline. We were very upset!!! There were 25 of us in two boats and some of the people on one boat were paying for some people on the other boat and vice versa. The two men driving the boats pretended like no one paid so we ended up paying double for the boat ride from hell!! DON'T DO IT! Stick to ALL resort activities and make SURE they WORK for the resort! That was the mistake we made; believing they had a partnership with the resort. Stick to things in the resort and you will have a wonderful time.RESORT GROUNDSLet's get back to the positives. The resort is beautiful. It almost seems fake. Everything is gorgeous. The pool is huge, the beach is beautiful. The theater area has extremely comfortable seating which is more than I can say for any other resort I've been to in the Dominican Republic. You will want to take a picture of every inch of the resort. ROOMSThe rooms are nice. They don't do the pictures on the website justice but they are nice. They are always well stocked and they are HUGE. The bathroom is a bit odd because it's not really in a room it's just an open space. The shower and toilet have doors but the sink and jacuzzi and very visible. On my last night there the light went out about 6 times but I wasn't in my room for any of it. I didn't really mind because the light would always come right back on and I'm sure it was a problem just occurring during that , particularly since on my last night there Tropical Storm Fay was around. OVERALL EXPERIENCEOverall I had an incredible time. The only thing I can really complain about is the boat ride from hell which isn't really the resorts fault because it's not part of their activities. My other cousins did resort activities like parisailing and kayaking and loved it so as long as you stick to resort activities, you will have a great time. The service can sometimes be a little lackluster but I was hardly in need of service so it wasn't a big deal to me. I do recommend this hotel but purely because of how beautiful it was, not for the service or food.

<Content>Paradise We were at the Majestic from Aug. 9 to Aug. 16. After reading some previous reviews, I had to comment. I have no idea what these people are talking about. The resort is beautiful. Yes, there were some blackouts last week, but hey, Tropical Storm Fay hit on Friday and yes the power did go out! Duh!The beach is incredible and there were always waiters walking around taking drink orders. Entertainment was excellent! The pool is extremely nice, warm and clean.I honestly have nothing negative to say about this resort and I have travelled to several resorts in the past from Mexico to Puerto Plata to Jamaica. This is honestly the nicest resort I've stayed at and well worth the money by far.

<Author>jduyk727
<Content>Beautiful resort, but... My family and I (6 adults, 8 kids/teens) just returned from our stay at the Majestic, and I wanted to share our experience. We have stayed at many all-inclusive resorts over the years, and have been to Punta Cana before as well (my husband and I stayed at Excellence last March, and absolutely loved it). Although we genuinely enjoyed our vacation at The Majestic, there were several problems that fellow travelers need to be aware of, and that management at the resort really needs to address. First, here鈥檚 what we liked: Check-in was fast and easy, and our interaction with Madeleine at Guest Services was a pleasure. The beach, pool and resort grounds are all very beautiful and seem to be well maintained. Everything you鈥檝e heard about the beach is true - it is absolutely spectacular, and the water is amazing. Plus, there are always plenty of lounge chairs and shade both at the pool and the beach. The Animation team is friendly and fun, and there are plenty of enjoyable activities to keep all ages happy. Our rooms were cleaned every day, and contained several nice amenities (e.g. hair dryer, iron, DVD player, Jacuzzi, etc.). The entertainment was enjoyable (especially the Circus Show), the sports bar and casino were both lots of fun, and the staff was generally very nice. All in all, we had a good time. On the down side, the food isn鈥檛 very good, nor very plentiful. You certainly won鈥檛 starve, but the portions (in the sit-down) restaurants are small, and it is difficult to get a second helping. This is the only all-inclusive that we鈥檝e stayed at where staff refused to bring what we ordered. In fact, at most other resorts, the staff is eager to please you, and will usually bring you anything you鈥檇 like. At the Majestic, however, this doesn鈥檛 seem to be the case. On our first night at the resort, we went to the Seafood restaurant and my husband ordered the grouper. The portion was small and the fish was bland, so after he finished his dinner, he asked for the lobster (my daughter had ordered it, and liked it). He was told NO; when we protested, the waiter relented, but then never brought out the dinner. We finally gave up, and walked up to the Main Buffet. This happened again the following evening at the ala cart Asian restaurant when we each ordered two appetizers. Other people at the resort reported the same thing happening to them, so it definitely wasn鈥檛 an isolated instance (by the way, just so you know, both my husband and my children are all quite thin, and were not really looking to gorge themselves). Also, there are generally no snack foods available during the late afternoon; in other resorts, snacks such as chips and salsa, chicken wings, grilled foods, etc. are available all day by the beach. However, much to the disappointment of my children, this was not the case at The Majestic. One last comment regarding the food - the mixed drinks (including the 鈥渇rozen鈥?drinks) are not very cold, are usually watered down, and most have a funny after-taste; as a result, we generally stuck to sodas and bottled water, but even they weren鈥檛 very cold either. Also, while the staff is usually pretty nice, the service (in the restaurants, not the bars) is quite slow - especially for drink/water orders. Another issue was that our keys stopped working numerous times during the week. My husband, children and I stayed in two adjacent rooms on the second floor of building 2 (a very nice location facing the beach). Between us, we had 4 keys - 2 for each room. Over the course of our vacation, each of us had to replace our keys many times. While this wasn鈥檛 exactly the end of the world, it was extremely frustrating and inconvenient - mostly because the main lobby/front desk was a good 10 minute walk away. Imagine trudging all the way up to your room to use the 鈥渇acilities,鈥?only to learn that...surprise... your key doesn鈥檛 work. Talk about uncomfortable situations! Anyway, that brings me to a problem that seems to be common in the DR: out of the 14 people in our party, more than half had tummy troubles - including my two children (mercifully, my husband and I were spared). Was that because of the food, the water, the heat? I have no idea, but I suggest that anyone visiting the Majestic ( or anywhere in the DR) pack a large supply of Immodium! Another observation I鈥檇 like to share is that the resort seems to have been built in a hurry (I think this was mentioned by other reviewers as well). Although all our concerns (broken toilet seat, bad outlet, broken safe, etc.) were attended to quickly, a resort this new probably shouldn鈥檛 have so many issues. We heard the same complaints from several other travelers at the resort, so again, this was not an isolated instance. One other indication that the resort may have been built quickly/poorly is that we had 4 blackouts during our week's stay; two lasted 30 plus minutes, and two were brief - all were annoying. Each time a blackout occurred, the thermostat in our room had to be reset, and the air-conditioning had to be turned on again. Since none of the blackouts seemed to affect the resort adjacent to the Majestic, the cause was probably internal. If you do decide to go to The Majestic, I strongly suggest that you bring a flashlight or two...it is very dark around the resort grounds, especially during a blackout. Finally, our last complaint was (as far as we know) an isolated issue: on the second night of our stay, we discovered an island 鈥渞oach鈥?the size of a mouse in our room. Seriously, I鈥檓 not kidding - it was huge!! Sadly, that was not the end of it; although Guest Services quickly fumigated our room, we also discovered several regular-sized roaches throughout the remainder of the week. As you can imagine, this put a major damper on our stay. Now, I realize that The Majestic is in a tropical location, and I also completely understand that bugs (ants, mosquitos, flies, etc.) are part of the deal in the Carribean... BUT, I draw the line at roaches. I should mention, however, that none of the other members in our group had this problem (including our two children in the room next door to us), so maybe roaches are not really a big problem at the resort...maybe we were just unlucky. Unfortunately, this one issue will probably prevent me from returning to The Majestic anytime soon.

<Content>A completely honest opinion - Do not go here! I had the grouper, which was bland and mushy. The seafood bisque is overly salty and had sand in it. For dessert, you go up to a buffet line, which had tons of flies on it.The next night, we went to the Steak place (right next to the seafood). I like to play blackjack and the minimum bet is $5US. If you get a blackjack and the dealer isn't showing a face card or ace, you get half a $5 chip that you have to play the next hand. If you have blackjack and the dealer is showing a face card or an ace, you don't get paid until the dealer shows his or her hand and if they have blackjack, you lose. <Author>julehigham
<Content>Ticks a lot of boxes but....... Spent 3 weeks in this hotel - our 7th visit to Punta Cana,but different hotels.Must admit the formula is now wearing a bit thin! Size and scale of the Majestic is comparatively user-friendly and easy to navigate your way around.Hotel design is attractive- especially at night- but the plot is fairly narrow and the pool area can get very hot and claustrophobic. Noisy hotel on one side and construction work on the other.This particular stretch of beach is becoming very busy and if you're after haciendas and vistas look elsewhere.Rooms are a strong feature - comfortable and spacious with good storage and lighting and none are overlooked but the lack of privacy between the bathroom and sleeping area will not suit everyone.The hotel is well-managed and service in all areas ranges from good to excellent. Although the hotel was full for most of the duration of our stay there were always plenty of loungers available both on the beach and by the pool and also parasols.Service in the bars a particularly strong feature, even in the night club which is open until 4am but the music is definitely geared towards hispanic tastes.Reservations required in only 2 out of the 6 a la carte restaurants and food generally OK but mediocre in the buffets.Breakfast finishes ridiculously early (by european standards) at 10am and consequently very busy.Continental breakfast available at the main beach buffet from 10.30am but this admittedly quite poor.Difficult to get a decent cup of coffee here-trying to pass off weak,stewed filter coffee with a squirt of Dairy Whip as cappucino is a bit of a joke. Animation team professional and unobtrusive and the theatre has comfortable seating and good bar service.Shops on the hotel complex are extortionate.There is a shopping complex of about 30 units just ouside the hotel- all selling the same tourist tat and not a buyer in sight! Nice spa in the hotel grounds but again fairly expensive.Annoying photographers on the beach parading monkeys/macaws etc and quite a trek to get a drink fro m the bar.Overall,this hotel has many strong features but never manages to be more than the sum of its parts.Probably not helped by the large turnover of short stay guests which generally creates an impersonal ambience.Bedrooms located in 2 main wings and the corridors act as main thoroughfares so this generates a lot of noise.Lots of lifts which is useful for guests with wheelchairs or prams.

<Author>nicoxox
<Content>Nice Resorts, But Problems My husband and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial July 6, 2008 to July 13, 2008. Aesthetically, the resort is gorgeous, but it does have some problems. Room:We booked the Majestic Colonial Suite room. The room itself was one of the nicest rooms we have stayed in. We were in room 2117, which is on the first floor. There was a bottle of champagne and a plate of fruit in the room for us when we arrived. There is a jacuzzi in the room and on the balcony. You have direct access to the pool with your own cushioned lounge chairs so you don't have worry about finding a spot around the pool. You also have a little lawn in the back leading to the pool, and there are bushes separating the lawns, so you do have some privacy. Some of the reviews I have read said the bed was uncomfortable. The bed in our room had a pillow top mattress cover. Not sure if that was because we had the upgraded room or not. If you book the upgraded room, you get a breakfast delivered to the room on a morning of your choice. It isn't a full fledged breakfast. They bring, coffee, oj, another bottle of champgne, fruit, muffins. We went to the buffet afterwards. Room serivce is also free with the upgraded room. Only problem is that there really isn't much to choose from and the food isn't that good. The A/C did work well. Pool:The pool its very large and the temperature was always warm, some days a little too warm. It is about 4 feet deep throughout. There is a swim up bar over by the activites portion of the pool. Room Service:The maid did not come clean the room on her own the first 3 days. We had to call housekeeping more than once each time to have the room cleaned and to get clean towels. As the other reviews have mentioned, there were no washcloths.The mini bar in the rooms are supposed to be re-stocked daily. This also didn't happen. Again we had to call multiple times. My husband went to the concierge after the third day in a row of problems. After complaining, the room was cleaned and the mini bar was stocked daily.Internet:There is an internet room upstairs in the lobby. They charge $5 for 30 minutes.Restaurants:For breakfast, the indoor buffet is pretty good. They have a large variety of choices and a couple of cooking stations for made to order eggs. You can also go to the open air restaurant by the beach for breakfast. They have a smaller selection, also buffet. The food for lunch at the indoor buffet is very repetitive. The same foods were offered every day. Oh, and if you are wearing a bathing suit that even looks wet, they won't let you in. You will have to eat at the open air restaurant at the lunch buffet. The pasta station at both places is pretty good. The French restaurant is by far the best restaurant at the resort. We ate there twice during our stay. The French restaurant requires a reservation and guys must wear long pants, and shoes. The steakhouse and the seafood restaurant are the same restaurant even though they list it as two seperate restaurants. They just ask you if you want the steak or seafood menu. It is at the open air restaurant which also serves breakfast and lunch. We did not eat from the seafood menu, but the steakhouse food was pretty good. The Mexican/ Dominican restaurant was hit and miss. Two nights it was good and another night it was pretty gross. They do have a large salad bar/ buffet for appetizers. We did not go to the hibachi (requires reservation) part of the Asian restaurant, but we did eat at the a la carte part of the restaurant and it was terrible. I got sick from eating the food. For anyone who has food allergies, be VERY CAREFUL of the food at the buffets. Many of the foods at the buffet are not labeled so if you have any severe food allergies, don't eat anything unless you know exactly what it is and what is in it. They also use the same tongs to cook seafood and other meats so beware of cross contamination. My husband is very allergic to seafood. We went to the buffet for dinner one night and he ate something that must have touched seafood and got really sick. Drinks:We could never get a cold drink anywhere. The frozen drinks were never frozen, just slightly icy even though they are in a machine. The soft drinks were always super warm. I think the problem was that the dispenser didn't keep the drinks refridgerated. They stored them at room temperature and just put ice in the drinks which never got cold. Beach:The beach was nice. There were plenty of palapas, and we never had issues finding a chair. There is a big drop on the beach as you approach the water and the depth of the water drops a lot a few yards in. The water was very clear and refreshing though. Nightlife:The entertainment at the resort is pretty bad. The shows are corny. The Michael Jackson show is funny for a quick minute but after that minute you are ready to leave. They had a magician one night who was so bad people were just sitting there trying to figure out if he was performing a trick or just walking around. We gave up going to the shows after that. They have a beach party one night with a band, but that too is poorly organized. The casino is small. They have one roulette, black jack, and poker table, though the poker table was never open. The slots were ok, you can actually hit for a couple bucks on them. Every night in front of the lobby bar they have a table set up serving nachos, and other snacks. One night they had a smoothie hut set up - this was the only semi-frozen drink I had the entire stay. Overall, we had an okay vacation. We travel to the caribbean at least once a year and have been to Dominican 3 times now: Sun Village Resort in Puerto Plata; Grand Palladium Palace Royal Suites, Punta Cana, Jamaica: Iberostar, Rose Hall, Mexico: Aventura Spa Palace, Riviera Maya; Seacrets Excellence, Rivier Maya; Grand Palladium Resort, Riviera Maya. Room wise, this was the nicest room we have stayed in. With everything else considered, this was ranked at the bottom of our trips. The resort boasts that is it 5 star, but it really isn't. It is about a solid 3 star resort. When you travel as much as we do, you get a sense of what to expect out of a resort. This resort has potential, but we were disappointed. Again, aesthetically the resort is very nice, but the serivce is poor. For the cost of this resort you can stay at another place just as nice, if not nicer, and have 10 times better service. If you are not a sesoned traveller, and this is your first time to the Dominican, you will probably not be bothered with the issues . For those who do travel often, you should stay at another resort.

Our room was perfect, if you can get 2250, you will love it. Great view of the pool, and the ocean as well, can't go wrong with that! We could never hear anything outside of the patio doors once they were closed. And we were right across the beach restaurant, so that says a lot. The room was immaculate, the maids did an excellent job. The mini fridge was always well stocked. We left a note asking for more water on the first day, and every single day after that we must have had 6 bottles waiting for us, plus pop! The pool is like none other I have ever seen. It's the full length of the resort, and was NEVER crowded. You could probably put everyone who stayed at the resort in the pool and you wouldn't touch each other. So that really eased up the beach as well. The beach was never crowded either. We walked up and down the beach quite a bit and found that the other resorts' beachfronts were much more jammed with people. My husband and I really couldn't care less where we were, beach, pool, whatever, everywhere you looked was an amazing view. Which takes me to the grounds. The staff works VERY hard at keeping the grounds well manicured. My husband ran each morning around the perimeter of the resort, usually around 6:30/7:00, and would see all the workers dropped off ready to start the day. There was one morning they were spraying the bushes for bugs/mosquitos, we never had a mosquito bite the entire trip. At that time of the morning, they are cleaning, having staff meetings at the restaurants, all making sure we all would have the best vacation possible. I am so appreciative of their hard work ethic, most of them were there from sunrise to way after sunset. So, to tell me the service was bad, sorry. I didn't see it.There were so many options for meals, we couldn't possibly get to everywhere we wanted to try. Breakfast was incredible. Tons of food to choose from, I really can't think of anything they didn't have. Lunch, we always went to the beach buffet. Every day was amazing view of the ocean while we ate, we didn't want to go anywhere else! Never had an issue with any of the food there. There is a lot I can't eat due to allergies, but I ALWAYS found something. Dinner, you must make a reservation for the Japanese Restaurant, Matsuri. I could never eat half of what they gave there's that much food! I wanted to finish it because it was the best food there (the shrimp is to die for!), but couldn't stuff it all in! I liked the french gourmet restaurant, the chicken was very good. The seafood and steak restaurants were not bad, but weren't our favorite either. I chose food at the buffets that were cooked in front of you, for the most part. That way I ensured the temperature was good and the food wasn't out for too long.We're not the ones to ask about nightlife. We are up so early in the morning, that we were too exausted by the time the shows were starting. So, we never made it to any. But after dinner there was always two guys playing just outside of the main buffet in an open air stage area, one on keyboard and one on either an alto or soprano sax. The last night we were there, they had a full band with three singer, performing what I think were very popular latin songs. They were fantastic!I'm sure I'm leaving a million things out, but I will say this. I LOVED this resort. We have never come home so rested and relaxed, it could not have been a better vacation. BIG thank you-s to AnneMarie for always providing fabulous service, and for being there for any questions. I am so sad I didn't get to meet you! To Victor at the front desk, who was very accomodating and made sure we were happy. To Oscar at Matsuri, who provided great entertainment and fabulous food! I really wish we could have taken you home! And lastly to Victor at the pool bar!!! YEAH BABAY!!!!! He made every visit to the bar a great one, we looked forward to seeing him every day. The man LOVES his job!! If anyone has any questions at all, please feel free to private message me. I will do my best to help. I seriously can't stop talking about the Majestic, I might as well be of some use to all of you!! I'm still mourning the fact that I have to cook for myself, and CLEAN... just terrible... :-)

<Rating>5	5	5	5	5	4	5	-1	

<Author>hellocdm
<Content>We Loved the Majestic; It exceeded our expectations!!!!!!! We are seasoned travelers traveling on average two to three times a year staying at more upscale resorts (Ritz Carlton, Fairmont, Hyatt, Marriott, Omni, etc. or the more upscale all-inclusive resorts or boutique resorts or we cruise) for the last 25 years. I have also traveled on business throughout the US staying at five star resorts in major cities. While rating this resort, you have to realize that the rating should be based on the type of resort it is; an all-inclusive in the Caribbean. Of course you cannot compare it to a true five star hotel in major metropolitan city. As an all-inclusive in the Caribbean, in our opinion, it is an absolutely wonderful resort and one of the best out there. We stayed at this resort from June 26th to July 4th and had a wonderful relaxing vacation. (We usually go to an all-inclusive once a year based on convenience and I have a teenage daughter who enjoys the all-inclusive experience.SERVICE:The service was EXTRAORDINARY!!! At times we actually felt guilty the service was so wonderful. Did we deserve to have anywhere from three to six people doting over us during breakfast, lunch and dinner AND THE BEST PART WAS THEY ALL HAD BEAUTIFUL SMILES ON THEIR FACES WHILE THEY WERE SERVING US. HOSPITALITY:Everyone at the resort goes out of their way to make your experience as wonderful as possible. You start off with a gracious welcoming from AnneMarie and her staff. As you have your first meal and your first drink, you are welcomed with a big smile from the wait staff and the bartendars.The first day we were at the resort we questioned whether the resort would be intimate based on the size. By the second day we felt right at home. I have to say that the Dominican people welcome you with open arms into their country and make you feel like you belong there. By the end of our vacation we felt like we were leaving family behind. It was all big hugs and kisses on our last day. Some of our favorite staff members are Claudia, Aura, Marisol and, Raphael in the main buffet and Angel, Massimo, Alejandro and Flaura from the downstairs lobby bar and of course AnneMarie and Madeline in guest services. THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!!!!LANGUAGE BARRIER:Many of the servers did not speak English. However, everytime a server did not understand us, they immediately asked either a Manager or a co-worker to come to our table and translate for them. We never encountered a language barrier because there was always someone around to translate our needs. CLEANLINESS:The resort is SPOTLESS. Believe me I am very particular when it comes to cleanliness. It is a very well managed resort and the management team is CONSTANTLY overseeing its staff. One of the policies that we liked is that they do not allow you to bring food out of the buffet area; therefore, they do not have guests leaving dishes all over the resort. Marisol does a great job in the main buffet making sure nobody leaves with plates of food.GROUNDS:The grounds are spectacular. The landscape architect did a phenomenal job designing the gardens there is such a beautiful variety of flowering bushes, fountains and statues. AT NIGHT THE RESORT TRULY BECOMES MAGICAL; the lighting design is unbelievable. Everything from the pool to the pathways to the fountains to the statues to the palm trees to the gardens to the building.... etc. are lit up.The lobby is beautiful and is filled with numerous comfy couches and chairs to relax in. Since it is an open air lobby, it can however be hot at times.ROOM:We were in room 2320 which was on the third floor overlooking the pool (Do not hesitate to get a room on an upper floor since the buildings do have elevators) We loved our room; we had a partial view of the ocean and a huge palm tree in front of our room that just swayed with the trade winds every day. There is a very large balcony that has two chairs and a table along with a clothes rack to dry your bathing suits.My daughter is 15 and privacy was somewhat of a problem with the room set up. Since the bathroom door was made of glass, she felt awkward. She corrected the problem by putting a large beach towel over the door; she also put one over the shower door. When she needed to get changed, she used the very large shower as her changing room. Before dinner my husband and I would go to the bar so she could privately shower.I think the resort should look into possibly providing some easily removable draping around the whirlpool tub to make the bath area more private. They could put the drapery up when a family was using the room and remove it when a couple was using the room.BEACH:We loved this beach. THE BEACH HAS CONSTANT TRADE WINDS THAT KEEP YOU COOL AND THE WATER IS NOT TOO WARM; THEREFORE, IT IS REFRESHING. The other thing we liked was that you could walk for miles on the beach and you never got too hot because of the trade winds.TIP: We found a great spot to sunbathe everyday. If you walk all the way to the end of the pool and enter the beach almost by the water sports, there is an elevated ridge about six to eight feet above the beach where there are wonderful trade winds and it is somewhat private and less congested. Just make sure you claim your spot between 8:00 and 9:00 because this is a coveted spot.Be aware that the water does have ledgerock in it; it does not however, have any small rocks. Also keep in mind that depending on how the current moves the sand; an area that five minutes before had been sandy may now have ledgerock exposed. As long as you are constantly aware of this, you will not have a problem. We didn't see any need for water shoes at all.The water current and waves also varied widely. Sometimes the current was quite strong and easily pushed you. Other times it was extremely calm. The water appeared most calm when it was low tide. The current also affected the clarity of the water. When the current was calm, the water was crystal clear; when the current was strong, the clarity was much less because of the movement of the sand.TIP: There was also pretty decent snorkeling right by the double buoy on the rope. The resort provides free snorkeling equipment.POOL:The pool is beautiful with numerous bridge crossings throughout the entire pool. There is also a swim up bar at one end as well as another bar at the other end. We found the pool to be a bit too warm this time of the year so we preferred to spend most of our day at the beach. Usually around 3:00 in the afternoon we headed to the pool. At this time of the day there were many shaded areas.PHOTOGRAPHERS:The photographers do a great job taking pictures. What is really nice is that they take their time and put you in numerous settings and positions to get the best pictures possible. They took about 10 different shots of my daughter with a white python wrapped around her body. I also watched them doing photo sessions with couples and with families.FOOD:Okay the all-important segment....FOOD. For an all-inclusive the food was great. Is it gourmet food? ABSOLUTELY NOT. Is it great food? ABSOLUTELY!!!!!!!. You must realize when choosing any all-inclusive resort that most all-inclusive properties do not have gourmet food. You also have to realize that you are not paying $100 to $200 a person for a gourmet dinner. We found the food to be very fresh (especially the fruits, vegtables and fish) and tasty.BreakfastThe breakfast is served in the main buffet from 7:00 to 10:00. They have everything you can imagine and more for breakfast. Some of the things we enjoyed: bacon (don't be fooled by the way it looks; it tastes delicious), croissants, fresh fruit shakes, potatoes (all of the potatoes are delicious and flavorful), lemon squares, churros and donuts (the donuts are not greasy at all), crepes, fresh fruit, orange juice. The wait staff continually fills your coffee/tea cup and provides you with fresh juice.TIP: To ensure your eggs, waffles, crepes, pancakes etc. are hot just ask the cook to give it to you straight off the grill rather than taking the items under the heating lamp. Lunch:We preferred the main buffet rather than the buffet at the beach. For convenience purposes we ate at the beach buffet twice. Some of the items we enjoyed there: spaghetti with olive oil and hot peppers, ham and cheese Panini, mussels Rockefeller (the mussels are delicious very tender and not gritty at all), paella, breaded pork cutlets and the many desserts. With regards to the complaints about flies, this statement is true. There were flies at the open air buffet. TIP: Find a table where there aren't any flies. We noticed that certain tables had more flies than others. We also loved sitting on the outside patio facing the ocean.Some of the items we enjoyed at the main buffet for lunch were: minestrone soup (at the pasta station), fried shrimp, mussels, all of the potato side dishes (they make wonderful homemade potato chips and homemade french fries), pizza with artichokes and mushrooms, breaded cauliflower, crusty French bread, large selection of vegetables (roasted red peppers, broiled tomatoes etc.), grilled mahi mahi, grouper, calamari, and shrimp. The desserts are also very good: coconut macaroons, apple strudel, flan.BE ADVENTUROUS AND TRY SOMETHING NEW. WE TOOK SMALL PORTIONS OF ITEMS WE WERE NOT SURE OF. SOME OF THE ITEMS WE LOVED; SOME WE DID NOT. BUT GIVE IT A TRY YOU HAVE NOTHING TO LOOSE AND EVERYTHING TO GAIN.NOTE: Service at the open-air buffet and main buffet was outstanding. There was always a server replacing your old drink with a new drink. Your glass of beer never got warm.On Fridays DO NOT MISS the paella they prepare on the beach. It is filled with lobster, shrimp, clams, mussels and other fish. Although they have Paella every day at the buffets; this was the best prepared paella. TIP: If you like lobster and clams just ask to have more lobster and clams placed on your plate.Dinners:We made our reservations when we checked in for the gourmet and Japanese restaurant. Later in the week we decided we wanted to go to the gourmet restaurant again and did not have any problems getting reservations. We never had to wait more than five minutes at any restaurant to be seated.Gourmet restaurant - We ate here twice. We had the red snapper which was excellent. TIP: Keep in mind that most of the fish served at the resort is very fresh so it is usually a great choice for an entree. We also had the filet mignons which was very flavorful and enjoyable; it was not tough but it also did not melt in your mouth like a filet you would get in a NY steakhouse. Chinese - We also ate here twice. My daughter loved the self serve sushi station. The sushi they offered was salmon roll, salmon and cream cheese roll, California roll, vegetable roll, cooked shrimp, egg, and eel. For appetizers they had great spring rolls and chicken with peanut sauce. The entrees we enjoyed were chicken with lemon sauce and fish tempura (this was great; I wished I had some malt vinegar to go with it) The only item we didn't care for at all was the sweet and sour pork.Seafood - We also ate here twice. The shrimp and avocado salad and the lobster tails are delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!! The fried mahi mahi appetizer is also very good. All but one of the lobster tails we had were very tender. Please keep in mind that if you are not satisfied with any of your meals send them back. If your lobster is tough ask for another one. We never had a problem doing this. The wait staff were always very gracious when you asked for a replacement. They never had an attitude which was quite nice.Steak - We all had the chateaubriand which was very good (not as tender as I would have liked it but very good). Japanese - The shrimp and the chicken stir fry were very good. The filet mignons however was a little on the tough side. Prior to your main entree they serve your appetizer. The only problem I had was that they had two people share one dish of an appetizer. I think a better policy would be to have each person have their own individual dish of an appetizer. The appetizers were very good and consisted of sushi, spring rolls, vegetable tempura.Stomach Problems:We ate practically everything and never had any stomach problems. PLEASE BE AWARE THAT YOU SHOULD NOT BRUSH YOUR TEETH WITH THE TAP WATER. We have always used bottled water and never had a stomach problem. Although we never had problems I believe the resort should do the following: Put a sign by the bathroom sink along with bottled water explaining that the tap water should not be used to brush teeth.  Have Purel or another antibacterial lotion stand available at the entrance of all of the buffets. Ask each guest as they enter to kindly use the Purel before dining. The cruise line industry has been doing this for years and no one is offended by it. In fact I believe most people welcome this trend. They should also have antibacterial stations set up in the bathrooms.BAR SERVICEWe found that the drinks were not watered down at all! As with most resorts, the lobby bar does have the best drinks. The service at the lobby bar is outstanding as well as the drinks. We absolutely loved the Coco Loco and the Dirty Banana. What I really like about this resort is that they treat each guest equally regardless of whether you tip the bartender or you don't (As a side note we always tip). This is just another sign at how well this resort is managed and how they try to make everyones trip equally enjoyable.The only area which I believe needs improvement is the bar service on the beach which is very sporadic. Some days when you are on the beach you will have a server throughout the day. Other days there won't be a server in sight. The problem lies in the fact that the resort does not have a bar right on the beach. Management should really consider adding a beach bar in the middle of the beach.Here lies the problem: The beach is quite large and the bar at the restaurant can be far away depending on where you are seated. The real problem lies in the fact that if you want a drink you have to put your sandals on, wash your feet in the shower and then head over to the bar at the restaurant to get a drink.MAID SERVICEOur maid did an outstanding job keeping our room clean. Every day we had a new assortment of flowers decorating our room. On two occasions we needed towels; we just dialed 1001 and we received our towels within five minutes. We also never had a problem getting our mini fridge refilled daily.ENTERTAINMENTWe thought the Majestic had great relaxing music playing during cocktail hour. It was usually a jazz ensemble or a Dominican band. The shows in the main theater are your typical all-inclusive type shows. My teenager daughter loved going to them every night; my husband and I could have done without them. The theater itself; however, is quite lovely with very comfortable chairs. It is very easy to fall asleep in one of these chairs.Certain nights of the week they had karoke in the lobby and of course they had the disco every night at 11:00. They also had a small casino which was a lot of fun. We played Blackjack one night and doubled our money. My daughter also loved playing the slot machines.OUTSIDE VENDORSOn Thursday nights the resort has a group of outside vendors come to sell items ranging from mostly jewelry to T-shirts and art work.NEGOTIATE, NEGOTIATE, NEGOTIATE. All I can say is that you have to negotiate your price. We bought many items at 60 to 80% off the original price quoted. WHATEVER YOU DO. DO NOT PAY FULL PRICE! This also applies to the beach vendors.Also, be aware of the vendor in the first booth. This was the only BAD experience we had on our entire vacation. Since he was the first vendor we dealt with we told him we would come back to purchase an item after looking at other booths. When we came back to purchase our item, he told us he did not want our business and to get away from his booth. He wanted to charge us $75 for an item that he had previously agreed we could purchase for $5.I went up to the front desk and they asked me to explain my situation to AnneMarie. AnneMarie went right down to the vendor with me and made sure that I got the item I had negotiated. Once again, Majestic went out of their way to ensure their customers are happy.CONCLUSION:I would highly recommend this resort to anyone and I truly look forward to going back to the Majestic. I did a lot of research before booking this trip, read both the good and the bad. All I can say is that our experience was all POSITIVE. Other than the vendor, we did not encounter any negative experiences. We loved the Majestic and it exceeded all of our expectations. The Majestic is a very well managed resort that is TOTALLY COMMITTED TO SATISFYING ITS GUESTS. The management of the resort as well as the staff go out of their way to make your vacation enjoyable. The Majestic is truly a service oriented resort.

<Content>WOULD RECOMMEND TO ANYONE We stayed 7/07-7/16 and had a great stay. I emailed ahead to request building 2-3 and on a higher level. Well we were given a room in building 4 but on the 3rd floor. At first i was a little disappointed when we arrived to our room and our view from the balcony was the new hotel buidings under construction. I thought of requesting a new room but my husband enjoyed watching the construction and men working. It was actually entertaining. They do start hammering away at about 7am but you really can not hear the noise if the balcony door is closed. We booked the standard junior suite. We thought the room was great. Very spacious and no issues with privacy and the bathroom. I could see how some might have an issue with this but we are pretty comfortable with each other. I used the jacuzzi while my husband and son were out doing their thing. We all loved the huge walk in shower. Room service is not included in this room category but no big deal.We tried all the restaurants. Our favorites were Japanese-hibachi, regular Japanese, Gourmet, and the Steakhouse. We always had breakfast at the main buffet. Lunch we ate at the both buffets. If you are in beach attire during lunch at the main buffet they will ask you to sit on a chair. If the chair gets wet they will not serve you. That was funny to see. People would get angry and complain but the chairs there are upholstered.Really no issues with the food. Like I said we tried every restaurant and if we didn't like it we wouldn't go back to that one. We are not complainers and had the attitude, I'm glad I didn't have to pay for that.The chef at the Japanese-hibachi was entertaining. He actually put his apron and hat on my son and took him behind the grill. The different rooms would have matches back and forth screaming who had the best chef. You couln't see each other but it was fun.The casino was entertaining. Abot 40 slot machines and then some tables. We went evey night for an hour or two. We won a few hundred on the slots. During the early evening they would let my son in but after 8pm the bouncer at the door would enforce the 18 year and older rule. The brochure states 16 is allowed but there is a tiny sign on the door stating 18.The sports bar is directly next door. At night it converts to a disco. We would laugh at the kids trying to get in saying they were 18 but obviously not. Just was funny to see. It made me look back and think I must of looked that stupid at their age when I was trying to do the same thing.I tried the spa. The prices are the same here in New Jersey. I had the aromatherapy bath and massage for 85 minutes at $125 USD. I enjoyed myself and I think my sun parched skin appreciated it.The pool was nice. My husband and son enjoyed the swim up bar. I would float around and they would bring me cocktails. There were always chairs available. We we would go down to breakfast and put our things on the chairs and occupy them after breakfast. The towel game is in full force here but there is really no need for that. There are plenty of areas available. I just can't see waking up at the crack of dawn to reserve a seat.The beach was awesome. Just like a postcard. Again, always spots in the shade available. I prefer tthe beach but my husband and son always want to stay at the pool. We would compromise by splitting the day up with pool in the morning and beach in the afternoon. There is a beach waiter/concierge but didn't see him that much.There is at least one wedding a day on the beach. They really seemed to be organized with that. It was nice to sit on the beach and watch someone's wedding. Some couples opted for the live musicians and that just added a nice touch to the ceremony.Can't comment on the nightly shows. We never went. The shows are basically the same at any all-inclusive. They are kind like a high school musical. We spent our evenings in the casino or at the lobby bar playing cards or just socializing with other guests.My son was bored with us this year. So, next year we will let him bring a friend. Really can't blame him for being bored. He's 14 going on 30. What teenager wants to hang out alone with his parents for 10 days? I think bringing a friend would be great...it would give me and my husband some time alone.One thing that I forgot was that the bars do not have a cocktail menu or a daily drink special. That kind of bummed me out. You kind of have to remember from previous trips what you liked and see if they could make it. If not, just look around at what others are drinking and just ask what it is. No big deal though, but it would be a nice thing to have.Okay, if you have already booked, don't worry you will enjoy yourself. And if you haven't booked yet..what are you waiting for?Again, if you go with an open mind and are not a nit-picker you will definitel enjoy this resort.

<Author>Judy88
<Content>Beautiful - as pictured resort Beautiful -describes everything about this resort!We vacationed at this resort from 7/7-7/15/08 and had a wonderful time. Our family is parents and two teenagers, 17  19, both boys. We had two rooms that were next to each other. In building two. The rooms were 1st floor, Majestic Junior Suites. We loved the location and the rooms. Majestic Junior Suites are the 1st upgrade in rooms for this resort. They are pool front with your own grass back yard to the pool. The patio has two chairs with small table, two chaise lounge chairs and a Jacuzzi. The rooms were some of the biggest we have stayed in, for the money:) Bathroom was great for us, huge marble shower, king bed, sofa, coffee table, desk w/chair, room safe, good closet space, air conditioning in our room was wonderful, mini bar (stocked daily with 4 water, 4 soda, 2 beer), room also comes with bottle of rum  scotch. We have been to another resort in the Punta Cana, Iberostar, where the room key activates the air conditioning, not the case here the room is wonderfully cool when you return! This resort has a great beach! Beautiful white sand, lots of thatch palapa umbrellas, gentle waves, some rocky areas but mostly sand in water (we did not need water shoes), great snorkling (bring your own if you have it), long beach for walks, sand volleyball was lots of fun. We also took out catamarans, which you need to reserve in advance. Women have the option to go topless in the Dominican but there were only several at this beach, due to the mostly American clientele.The pool here was one of the best, it runs the length of the resort inbetween buildings 2 and 3. There are some busy parts, swim-up bar, and activity area where the animation team does group activities but in the pool in front of our room there were few people even though the resort was sold out. Bring a raft and float around!Also bring large insulated glasses, use them for alcoholic or nonalcoholic drinks on the beach or by the pool. The to-go glasses provided are are small, plastic and uncovered.Language problems? We encountered none! Most of the guests during our stay were from Miami, New Jersey, New York or London. The staff all speak English -except for the some of the maids and gardeners. This was a change from the Iberostar where most of the guests were French or German with some English. We liked that too though.Grounds were nice, Iberostar is better but it has been in operation longer, so everything is more mature. The staff at the Majestic work constantly on the grounds and they are nice but will be more lush as time goes by.The casino is great. It was small but adequate. We like to play BlackJack and there were almost always atleast two tables. Minimum bet is $5. Age for Casino is 16 and over.Our kids loved the Disco. We stopped by too. It was open from 11pm-4am and was mostly young people 17-25. If you take older teens be prepared to set guidelines. Alcohol is easily available. We had no problems with our boys but have traveled alot to Europe and other all-inclusives where alcohol is readily available.We also did the spa and golfed. Spa costs between $50 -$100 for most treatments. Golf is 5 minutes away and is $145 per person + $40 to rent gold clubs. Both were very nice.Food- This varies so much from person to person. We enjoyed it! The Supreme Buffet has a pasta station, pizza station, a grill (different selection daily) I had grilled salmon and grouper one day. Roast meats, carved individually (we saw beef, pork, ham , fish), salads, desserts, fresh fruit and more. Another review mentioned the delicious strawberry/bubble gum ice cream - we hated it and we hated the rum raisin ice cream too. This buffet is indoor and airconditioned:) And never crowded.The restauraunts we liked best were the Supreme Buffet, Restaurant Le Gourmet (ate there twice but you must make a reservation) had the tenderloin fillet and grouper, the Teppanyaki Japanese Cooking Presentation (make reservation immediately after checking in to resort). We also ate at the Matsuri and Rodeo Grill, both just OK to us. The Japanese Cooking is the hardest restaurant to get into, if you don't get a reservation sometimes if you just stop by you may get lucky - we talked to two families that got in that way.The boys both got a touch of tummy - surprise, you're in a 3rd world foreign country. The boys were told not to brush their teeth with tap water but thought they would be fine. They also ate ice cubes after working out at the fitness center. Be careful, pick up extra bottles of water to brush your teeth. At Iberostar they supplied each room with a gallon of water for the bathroom, here you just use the little bottles of water from the fridge, be sure to pick up more from bar for room. My husband and I were fine. And the boys problems were solved by taking two imodium immediately and another if needed later.Things to bring-Pool RaftsInsulated Drinking GlassesPepto BismolImodiumBug SpraySmall first aid kitsun screenWash clothWater shoes (optional)Febreze Spray (optional)Snorkle gear (optional)Room numbers: four digits 1st digit is building #, 2nd is floor #, and 3rd/4th is room #.In my opinion Building 2 is best, followed by Building 3, next 1 and finally 4 (only because of construction next door).Shows - We liked the Circus Show and Beach Party with limbo contest.Drinks- The Majestic is good (think orange creamsicle), dirty monkey (think chocolate/banana), my huband liked that stoli vodka was included. Lots of brand name alcohol is included, if you order some thing that is not included they will tell you that it is an additional charge (greygoose vodka was not included)I did get some mosquito bites at night (4) and found two in our room. I am a mosquito magnet. My husband got none and one son got 2 bites and the other none. Use your bug spray at night - I never saw them but they must be there! Side note I was not bitten at all at Iberostar, so they must spray more.We had one bug in our room during the 8 days that we were there. And no ants but then again we did not use room service so there was no food in our rooms... Maids washed the floors and changed the sheets and towels daily.Go enjoy! This is a beautiful resort! You will have a excellent time:) The Dominican Republic has some of the nicest beaches in the Caribbean and this resort has it all!

I had requested a room with two full size beds for the four of us, but apparently they were full, and we had to take a room with a king size bed, and a pull out. We slept three of us in the king bed, (as my kids, 11 and 13, girl and boy will not sleep together), for two nights until we could get moved two days later. We then moved to room 2242, which was a great location, with a view of the pool and the ocean, and most inportantly two beds.I thought the food was good, with a hugh selection. Of course it is different from home, but that is part of being in another country, trying new things and experiences. My parents on the other hand did not like the food at all, and had complanint and dislike for almost everything they ate. I think older Americans will have more difficulty with the food, especially if they have not traveled outside of the country much.Our room was great, very clean and roomy, but lacks privacy, epecially when there is four people sharing. It was absolutely the warmest pool i have ever been in.Be careful around the chairs on the beach, (under the palapas), as my husband cut his foot on a piece of glass that was on the side of the chair. It required a visist to the resort doctor for disinfecting and bandaging, but thankfully no stiches. It did put a damper on the last two days of our vacation, as the doctor advised that he should not go into the water with the cut on his foot, especially the pool.Luckily, he had done all the activities like scuba, snorkel, and play numerous games of beach vollyball prior to the incident.Regarding scuba and snorkeling: really not the place to go if you want to see a lot of variaties of fish or corals. The reefs are just ok, as we have seen a lot better on other vacations. Also, the sea can be a little rough a times, which was a bit unnerving for my 11 year old, who was not very comfortable on the resort snorkeling trip we did, even though she is a very good swimmer.The swells were such, that on occasion they would go over the snorkel, and she would swallow water.This was a two hour trip, and was $35.00 pp. The boat ride out to the reef was fun, as we were able to see a lot of the coast on the way.I would like to extend a big Hello and Thank you to Marisol M. She was the most helpful person to us at the resort. She is the guest relations intern, and a super nice person. Sincerely cares about the guests, and tries to help you in any way she can. She is always pleasant, and smiles, and she was key in getting us moved into the room we had requested. She is most visible at the main buffet, as the hostess, as well as any other resturant that needs her. She is on site from morning to night, and it seems like she never has a day off. She's great!In closing, we had a great time, despite the few incidentals that happened, and would say keep an open mind, and just go with the flow, and you'll have a great time...P.S.- The lobby bar, and the beach bar had the best drinks. Swim up bar was poor, unless you just drink beer.

<Author>dcrawfe
<Content>A Great Vacation at the Majestic Colonial My family (husband, son 17 yrs, daughter 14 yrs) and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Majestic Colonial. After reading some of the negative reviews, I wanted to share the wonderful experience we had.The Majestic Colonial was everything we had hoped it would be. The resort grounds are beautiful; the staff does an incredible job of maintaining the area. The room was was large and spacious. We had absolutely no problems with air conditioning, bugs, etc. Because I had done extensive reading abouf the hotel prior to booking it, I was well aware of the open bathroom setup. Just in case, I brought a sheet to hang up for privacy. However, the sheet was not needed, and even my teenage kids agreed that the toilet and shower areas provided enough privacy (occassionally, we did hang a towel over the toilet door). The beach was beautiful -a few rocks here and there, but not a problem at all. Each day, we arrived at the beach mid-morning and had no problem getting 4 chairs in the shade. The pool was absolutely gorgeous - clean and not crowded. Again, there was no need to reserve our chairs at the pool. After reading many comments about the food, my concerns were put to rest after our first night's dinner at the steak restaurant. While the food is not gourmet, it is tasty, plentiful and none of us experienced any stomach issues. We were not able to get reservations for the Japanese restaurant; however, we tried most of the others. The Mexican/Dominican was a big hit!We found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. And, any attempt to speak Spanish is greatly appreciated. When we only received two bathroom towels on our 2nd day, we left a note in Spanish (thanks to my son's high school spanish) and requested 4 towels for each day we were there. The note, along with a few American dollars, ensured that we always had ample bath towels. Concerning beach towels, each time we exchanged our beach towels, we were greeted by the friendliest employee at the resort. Although we didn't catch his name, this employee was always cheerful, friendly and we all looked forward to seeing him each day. Overall, we had a wonderful time at the Majestic Colonial and hated to leave. Though we were there for a short time, it was by and far, one of the most relaxing vacations we've experienced!

<Author>MaD64
<Content>Thank God the negative reviews were over dramatized!!!! Don't listen to the bad reviews....the Majestic Colonial was very nice. We just returned yesterday after a week stay and I have to say that we were relieved after reading the reviews on this web site. We had a very nice time. Food - The food was above average as compared to an Iberostar all inclusive we stayed at last year in Cancun. We live in New York and are used to the great food of NYC and these restaurants, on the whole, did not disappoint. Of course some restaurants rated higher for us than others. Our favorite was the French restaurant, Le Gourmet. The food (especially the bisque soup and the filet mignon) was really good. We also had the grouper and chicken which were good. We ate here twice. The seafood (Tres Carabela) and steak (Rodeo Grill) restaurants were decent. As written in other reviews, the grilled lobster at the seafood restaurant and the chateaubriand at the steak restaurant were very good. These two restaurants are in an open air location on the beach and were a little warm the nights we were there. Our least favorite restaurant was the Dominican/Carribean (Taino) and I think it was purely because it was our first night, we were tired and the service was not very good. The food was good. Breakfast and lunch at the Gourmet Buffet was incredible. There is nothing that they did not offer. Everything was great here...fresh pasta bar, omelets, paella, hamburgers, fruit, soup, salad, etc. Beware that your bathing suit cannot even be damp to enter this restaurant for lunch. They do feel your bathing suit or make you sit on a chair to see if it leaves a wet mark. The security guard made at least one person from our group of 8 go back to the room to change each day. You cannot get one over on the guys. Lunch is also available at the beach if you don't want to deal with this issue, but the food selection does not compare. It's definitely worth drying off or changing. By the way, while we did not eat dinner at the Buffet restaurant, the food selection for lunch is the same as dinner. Also, the Japanese/Asian restaurant was also good. The tepanyaki side was fun and food was nice and fresh. The ala carte side was just OK.Rooms - alot written about the lack of bathroom privacy.....just go with it. We traveled with our 16 year old son and 13 year old daughter and we found ways around it. The room is so big that you don't even realize someone is in the bathroom. As far as showering and privacy...put on a cover up or the robes they provide to come out of the shower. Before we arrived, I thought I would be able to change in the shower area since everyone said it was so big, but the entire shower area does get wet. There was enough room to stand in the water closet and get dressed or you could open a couple of the closet doors and stand behind them. It was no big deal even with the four of us. On the whole, rooms were very large and clean. In contrast to a couple of reviews, we had wash cloths every day.As I'm sure you read, there are 4 buildings....1, 2, 3 and 4. They each start up near the lobby and extend like fingers to the beach. The pool is the second largest in the Carribean and extends the entire length of the resort from the lobby to the beach and is located between buildings 2 and 3. Unbelievable pool!General - Lobby/Piano bar was great. It was quiet, the music was nice and Roberto the bartender was great! He made a really nice champagne cocktail which the other bartenders could not make. The only champagne cocktail they knew about was a mimosa! While we didn't see or feel any mosquitos, we did get bitten. Bring some anti-itch cream. Again, not a big deal. Don't leave the balcony door open and you won't have any bugs in your room. I did not smell any musty odor as reported in some of the reviews. I brought room freshener just in case and did not use it. There were reviews about the rudeness of the employees. We did not experience any rudeness. However, they did not go out of their way to say hello. We were in Cancun for the two previous summers and the locals there are extremely friendly. Obviously, the Domincans are not as friendly as the Mexicans, but they were not rude. No one in our party of 8 got sick. The employees tell you upon arrival not to drink the tap water and don't overdo it on milk based food/drink because they use goat milk and not cow milk.....this includes pina coladas! We didn't even use the tap to brush our teeth..they provide bottled water in the room refrigerators. The only disappointment is that there weren't any waitresses taking drink orders at the pool. This is a family resort and anyone who is going there without children and then complain about the fact that there are kids needs to go to an adult-only all inclusive.We had a great time and were relieved that the negative reviews were over dramatized.

<Author>richny
<Content>Great Vacation at Majestic, can not understand these reviews It's been about 2 weeks since we went to the Majestic and don't normally write reviews, but seeing so many negative comments I felt compelled. It was me, my wife and our 2 teenage boys( 15 and 18).We booked through Continental Airlines Vacation and was very happy doing it this way. We flew from Newark to Punta Cana non-stop. They contract with VIP services who were waiting for us right after we got the luggage. We had a private mini-van pick us up, as part of the package, and took us directly to the Majestic...no delay, no bus and no problems what so ever. Our check in was again flawless. We were introduced to Annmarie who is absolutely fantastic and could not do enough for us. What a great job she does...thanks to her for making our vacation extra special. We had 2 rooms in building 2, our sons on the 2nd floor, us on the 3rd floor. Nice view overlooking the pool.I do agree with some that the rooms were somewhat musty and the addition of a room deodorizer did little to help...but it is not bad at all. People are making way too much of this.I can not understand the comments with the bathroom...it is spacious and easy to navigate. Ok, so the toilet is behind a glass door...deal with it...you're on vacation. The shower is huge and fantastic for couples. We used bottled water for brushing our teeth.We always had enough towels...as a matter of fact, they kept giving us extra towels which was much appreciated...we did not even have to ask. The rooms were always cleaned by noon, except for 1 day where they were cleaned by 3pm. I must say I was very impressed how clean they got the rooms. Each morning I saw all the housekeepers ready to start their work day.Ok...on to the food.After reading the reviews on this board, I was afraid that we were going to either be sick the whole time or be so disgusted by the meals that we would not eat anything. This could not be further from the truth. First off people, lets be realistic...this is all inclusive. Anyone here eat at a all you can eat buffett in the US? Of course you have...and do you think that you need to eat everything on the buffett or everything needs to be perfect for you? That is an absurd thought...because buffetts are made to fill you up...not all are a gastric pleasure palace.Let me give you my real rundown on each place we ate:Each breakfast we ate at the main buffett area...this was very good and had a huge variety. Most lunches we ate at the same main buffett area...each day there were new items that made it interesting. We ate light for lunch and were never disappointed. Now...is the pizza like the stuff you find at authentic restaurants in the US...no it is not. However there was so much to choose from...I never had a problem...neither did my family.Japanese restaurant - very good and filling...probably way too much food and it was very tasty.French Restaurant - again, very good food and service was great. Steak Restaurant - excellent, ate there twice...never disappointedSeafood Restaurant - excellent again, ate there twiceNone of us got sick, had the runs or anything. We drank bottled water mostly. My wife did eat the salads and both my older son and me ate the fruits. The only stomach ache was eating too much food sometimes. So overall, these negative food reviews are without merit. We had some really great meals and again I was perplexed at the reviews. We did eat at 6:30pm each night and never ever encountered crowds. As for a comment I saw about flies in the outdoor restaurants...I laughed...I guess they have never eaten outside before. Where I live in NY...if you eat outside at night you need to fight the flys and mosquitos...I think these creatures are everywhere, not just Punta Cana.Ok...now onto the beach. Beautuful...no bugs like I read. We used repellent one day because I was paranoid from what I read...what a waste. We did not encounter any issues from bugs at the beach. The water was a bit choppy in the afternoon for 3 days...but you could still easily swim...the water was not as clear. On our last 4 days the water was very calm and was crystal clear. We snorkeled everyday off the beach and feed so many fish...it was like being in an aquarium. My younger son loved it and we snorkeled twice a day, at least. They don't like you taking bread out of the restaurant, so just put it in your pocket if you plan on feeding the fish. Oh...we never had an issue finding lounge chairs.The pool...super nice and fun. If I did have two negative comments... the concrete apron around the pool had a lot of potholes that should have been patched....it is sometimes hard to walk on the concrete in some areas. Also...they need to have more people cleaning up after the guests who drop their cups all over the place. I found cups all over the place. The staff does an amazing job at keeping everything super clean in some much of the resort,,,so I was a bit surprised that the pool area got a bit unkept by the end of the day.We went on two trips:Macau Crazy Wheels ATV tour...in a word....FANTASTIC. If you are looking for a real fun time...do the ATV trip. You will love it. Not going to spoil it for you...it is fun!We went on a snorkel trip too but I forgot the name of the tour. It was a lot of fun too and everyone enjoyed.They really do a great job at the Majestic and was very satisfied and felt I got my money's worth. If you are expecting a Ritz Carlton...stay home...you are not paying for that. You get great value at a super nice place. I would not hesitate recommending this resort.

<Author>travelreviewer
<Content>Happy with the Majestic! My husband, myself and three other family members visited the Majestic from 6/28-7/4. Prior to leaving for our trip I was in contact with the manager, AnneMarie, regarding our preferences for rooms. Upon arriving at the resort, Victor at the front desk called AnneMarie who personally greeted us, checked us in at her private desk, made our dinner reservations, and gave us a personal tour of the resort. She escorted us to our room, 2248, and it was a great location, closest to the beach with an almost full ocean view. Thanks AnneMarie!! It's important to understand the layout of the hotel and how the room numbers go in order to put in a request for a specific room location. Building 1 faces the hotel next door, building 2 faces the pool, with some ocean views. The 1st floor rooms in building 2 are the Colonial Junior Suites with slider doors opening up to the pool. Our other family members had these rooms, but never really utilized their pool access from their room. The only difference in their room versus ours, which was a Standard Junior Suite, was that they had a DVD player and a clock in their room. They would have preferred a room on the 2nd, 3rd or 4th floors. Building 3 also faces the pool but has no 1st floor pool access and building 4 faces the construction of their new hotel. Room numbers in all buildings go from 1 to 52? The higher the number, the closer to the ocean. For example, our room 2248, was in building 2 (represented by the first 2), was on the 2nd floor (represented by the second 2) and was room 48 (the last 2 numbers). So if you want a room closest to the ocean, ask for a room in the 40's or 50's. Our room was very nice, a little musty and the comforter had some mildew on it, but no big deal. After all, you are in a tropical, humid environment. We did have an issue with some bugs in our room, not an infestation of any kind, I just can't stand to see them at all, especially in the place where I have to sleep! I killed numerous mosquitos, a couple of roach looking critters, and many small ants around our sink area. You may want to pack some bug spray as well, we did get numerous mosquito bites in the evening, especially at the open-aired restaurants. We only had washclothes in our room the first day, but I had brought my own from home, so it wasn't a big deal for me. The hotel does provide shampoo, conditioner, bodywash and a good working hairdryer so no need to pack these. You also get robes and slippers.I have to say I was a little nervous about the food at the resort after reading some recent reviews. We thought the food was fine, but we did not eat any fruits or vegetables just to be on the safe side. Lunch was the hardest meal for me to find something good to eat. They do have a pasta bar and panini station at the poolside buffet which were ok. Some of our family members ate at the indoor buffet and said lunch was much better there, but I didn't want to trek up there everyday and have to change into dry clothes before doing so. Around 3:30, the poolside buffet restaurant does put out some pizza, nachos and cheese and other snack foods, so I just waited to eat those instead of having lunch most days. We tried all the restaurants for dinner except the main buffet. Food and service was usually pretty good. There were many weddings when we were there and sometimes their receptions were in the same restaurants that we were eating in. This was the only time service was not up to par, because the staff was overwhelmed at these times. The drinks were pretty good as well, my favorite was the Majestic (with Stoli!). Some top shelf liquor is not included so ask before you order if you're not sure. None of us got sick at all or had any major stomache issues.Entertainment was decent. There was a PG-13 movie every night in the sports bar which was good to kill time, and then at 10:00pm the nightly entertainment starts in the theatre. Shows were pretty good, though sometimes we were too tired to stay and watch the whole thing. Never went to the disco, but did go to the casino a couple of times, it was small, but fun. There is a games area and small gym across from the theatre, and also some shops. At 11:00pm a small snack shop opens across from the theatre for those with the late night munchies! The animation team at the resort does a great job. Everyday they had activities planned on the beach and around the pool. They were very professional, energetic and are hard workers, working very long days! On the beach there are many water activities, some for free, some not. If you want to snorkel, you can get free snorkel gear for an hour each day and go right off the beach. We saw lots of cool fish and didn't need to swim out very far. Bring some rolls out for them, and watch them really emerge!! By the way, you can get towels from the dive center located at the beach or at the towel bar, which is quite a distance from the beach. We didn't know this the first couple of days, but were happy to find out we just needed to go to the dive center which was much closer for us. Also, if you bring a float, they will blow it up for you at the dive center. One word of caution, keep your dead bolt on in your room when you are there. The housekeeping staff will knock, but are quick to enter your room if you don't answer right away. I like to sleep in and I found them knocking at my door every morning around 9:00am. If I didn't answer they tried to get in with their key, but if your deadbolt is on, they can't get in. There are no do not disturb signs. Supposedly there are sensors in the room to alert the housekeeping staff if you are there, but if you're sleeping the sensors do not pick up any motion, therefore they think you are not in your room. This was a tip from another trip advisor member and I was glad I listened. Overall our stay was very nice. The weather was great, the ocean and pool were warm, drinks were good, and staff were friendly. Keep in mind this resort is visited mainly by adults. There were some families with small children, but not as many as other all-inclusive hotels I have been to. There were many 20 something year olds there who got kind of rowdy, especially at the pool bar around 5 or 6 pm. By the way, the pool closes at 6:00, which is kind of early, but I think they do this because of all the weddings going on and having to set up for their receptions. Also, there were people from all over the world, many Europeans and Latin Americans, so there are topless sunbathers on the beach. If you go, you'll have a good time. Bring lots of sunscreen and tips for the staff. Enjoy!!  
<Date>Jul 7, 2008
