<Author>garfam
<Content>Less Money, Good Experience Our decision to stay in the Dominican Republic instead of the Riviera Maya was an economic one. We were able to book two rooms in Punta Cana(1 for our 2 children 18,14) for less than the price of a trip to Mexico for one room. While we realized that there is far less history involved in the D.R. than in Mexico we relished the opportunity to share an all-inclusive vacation with our children. The Majestic was a grand resort with lots of open air. The use of A/C was limited to rooms and restaurants and other key locations. The gorgeous lobby was naturally conditioned with light breezes but never felt hot. One detriment of the overall trip was language. Spanish is the first and foremost of the languages spoken here. You would do well to be versant in Spanish. There is just enough English spoken by Majestic front desk personell to get what you need.  There are two restaurants in the resort that require reservations and you should absolutely book them upon your arrival. Le Gourmet was outstanding, a masterpiece for dinner. As far as the Japanese Steakhouse, we never got to experience it because after a full day of travel and unwinding we got to the concierge desk after 6:00 and were unable to book a reservation until the next morning even though there were 3 people sitting at the desk . Already it was too late for any reservations for our 5 night stay. I would make that a priority withany stay here.. The buffets are above average and usually can accomodate any eaters desires. We have 4 extremely different palates in our family yet we were able to find plenty to eat at all buffets. Another hint;if you go to breakfast before8 am, not everything is available. Also, after 9 am, it begins to get crowded and lines will form at the favorite stations. As far as the rooms, we requested rooms next to each other to be close to our children. Although they recieved our request, they do not place a high priority on them and will only accomodate if it is possible. Once again, language was a barrier in this matter. Our children ended up 16 rooms away from us and with only 1 king size bed. This was okay for the first night but I persisted with the front desk(3 phone calls and 2 visits) and was given my request on day 2. Just by happenstance, a couple 2 doors down had requested a King size bed and had 2 double beds. They flip-flopped rooms with our kids. If you are not a smoker, the kids room had a very strong tobaco odor. Most guests seemed to smoke. The accomodations overall were decent. I would not rate them outstanding by any means. They were slightly unkempt even after the housekeeping visit. But never to the point of unclean. The open bathroom area is something to get used to. The beds were firm. The deck looking out over the pool was a nice place for a respit.Sattelite tv helped us keep up with events happening in the states. In closing, I would like to reccomend a trip to the Majestic for either a couple or a family. Lots of either are there. Tipping is not reqquired but a couple of ones goes a long way. Bartenders and the waitstaff are especially appreciative and will remember you on your next visit. The beach was one of the most gorgeous places we have ever experienced, especially on the horseback riding excursion off the resort at Rancho Carribeno.(35/person 1/2 day well worth the money). I would return to this resort in the future.

<Author>slkramer
<Content>Great Value! Great Service! Great....EVERYTHING! Booked this resort in December through Cheapcaribbean.com! I became worried when all the poor reviews (mostly with the food) started coming in the last couple of months, but it was a great deal and we were excited to go. Our trip was June 24-30. The drive to the hotel is about 30 minutes. Our transfer was booked through cheapcaribbean and provided by Turinter Tours. The van was air conditioned (thank god!) and all was well. Check in was just as described: cold, mint scented towels and a non-alcoholic majestic (their signature drink). The service at the front desk was AMAZING! Everyone spoke English. We felt like we were celebrities by the way we were treated. Our room location was PERFECT...building 2, ground floor...with direct pool access! We were located in the building farthest from the beach, but it is close to most of the restaurants and nightly entertainment. NO musty smell in our room. It is VERY humid here and I believe that the musty smell gets better when you turn on the A/C. I brought my own pillow due to recent reviews and I used it, but I am sure that I would have been fine without it. The bed is not a pillow top (like we are used to)...it was kind of hard. Our fridge was restocked everyday and maid service was friendly. Calls to guest services requesting towels and a new remote were fulfilled immediately! The grounds, pool and beach are AMAZING as everyone has reported! I was most suprised by the entertainment staff and variety of things to do. Saw the Michael Jackson show which everyone raves about and it was pretty good. The casino was fun (not smokey when we were there 11-12pm). Near the snack restaurant (open late) there is a place to play pool, chess, checkers or even rent movies. Near the swim up bar it is loud and more of a party atmosphere, but down the pool a little bit (it is THAT BIG) is a different world....you can sleep or just relax by the pool. We saw families of all types....20's and 30's, newlyweds, family w/ young children, fams w/ teenagers, empty nesters, wedding parties/family reunions etc.FOOD: To begin with, I must say that we DIDN'T get sick! Never took Pepto or Immodium! The people we saw at breakfast, lunch and dinner seemed satisfied with the food. Breaskfast was great....they pretty much had everything you can imagine! I had french toast most days...my husband had omelets. We did try to get to breakfast kind of early (before 9). The main buffet closes breakfast at 10 and it is really crowded after 9:15 and they have trouble keeping up with the demand for omelets and some of the dishes. At 10:30 they open breakfast down by the beach, but it is difficult to keep the flies out since it is an open air restaurant. The flies weren't any worse than your typical 4th of July cookout. I have a sweet tooth and the desserts were AMAZING!! really....really.....AMAZING! We ate at Taino (mexican/dominican) and Rodeo Grill (steakhouse). The service at Rodeo Grill wasn't very good and neither was the food...although we DIDN'T order the Chateaubriand because the service was terrible and they rushed us and I just ordered the chicken. Taino was OK, but nothing special! We don't like Japanese so we made both of our reservations at Le Gourmet! It was GREAT! The first time we went in we were given a menu in Spanish and the waiter acted like we were crazy we ask him to tell us what some of the stuff was! We were so confused and just ordered something and it turned out great! For the appetizers...we tried the martini with salmon....not my favorite......for next course I had the Pumpkin soup and my husband had the Lobster soup. They were great. For dinner I had the chicken and he had the steak....delicious! For dessert (my fav) I had the Creme Brulee! soooo good! Our second trip there we got menus in English....so that helped a bit....but we still ordered the same things! I think that pretty much covers it! Here are some tips for those planning a trip! 1. Pick the Majestic! We saw a couple of other resorts (Riu, Bahia etc.) during 2 excursions and Majestic looked by far the NICEST! I just really don't think you can beat the price of this resort. Look for a good deal through cheapcaribbean or other sites! Not sure what the prices are now, but we found a great deal by booking in Dec. (6 months in advance). The staff is great (especially those in guest services/public relations...AnneMarie) 2. BRING ALOT of SUNSCREEN and BIG SPRAY! It costs ALOT to buy it there and the 2 of us used an entire bottle in 5 days! I only got 2 bites but I put it on 3 times a day. 3. Don't exchange for Dominican Pesos....there is NO reason to! 4. If you buy internet access for your room be aware that the timer only runs when you are logged in. I bought 5 days worth of time ($50) because I thought the timer run continuously once you logged in. You only need 1 day (24 hours) of time ($10) because the time only runs out when you are actually logged in and surfing the web. The best part was that they refunded me the $40 for the hours we didn't use! 5. Be wary of drinking too many drinks with Coconut milk (CocoLoco, Majestic, Dirty Monkey, Pina Colada, etc.) because we were told it is a natural laxative. Could contribute to stomach issues....? 6. Bring comfy shoes! The flooring throughout the resort is marble, tile, hardwood and there is a fair amount of walking depending on your room location! 7. FINALLY....they will NOT let you into the main buffet if your clothes are WET! You CANNOT wear wet trunks into there. I am pretty sure that the information give when you check in states this....don't even bother trying to get in if you are wet. We saw many people mad (including my husband :) when they were turned away for having wet clothes. The hostess is just doing her job when she asks you to change. The seats have cloth cushions and I wouldn't want to sit in a chair that is soaked by the person before me! So, that is pretty much it!

<Author>suru
<Content>Fantastic Resort The Majestic is an absolutely wonderful resort. The staff bends over backwards for you and if you can't have fun here, I don't think you can have fun anywhere.After 15 hours of traveling, we finally arrived at the Majestic. The front desk staff checked us in right away and then the wonderfully polite and friendly Angela took us over to make our dinner reservations. She then personally escorted us to our room. Wow, what a room! We had a banner on the door saying Happy Anniversary,  champagne, fruit, cheese, and beautiful towel art by the tub. The room is huge and sparkling clean and just beautiful. I had requested a room near the beach and on a high floor and we got room 2328 which was a little farther toward the beach than half way and overlooked the pool and we also had a little ocean view. The AC worked great and there was no musty smell. It was perfect.I left a note in the mini-bar asking for only beer, water, and diet pepsi and that is what I got the whole week. I also left tips everyday for the mini-bar stocker and the maid. After a few days when the maid figured out that I was using the jacuzzi tub every night, I was greeted with a bubble bath decorated with flowers every night when we came in from the beach. I didn't ask, the maid just did it. You must use the tub, it is so relaxing. I was in it every night. What others have said about the water closet is true, there is not much sound privacy, but you can't see through the frosted door. It really isn't that much of an issue unless you are standing right next to the door. It was just my husband and I and I personally liked the open bathroom, especially when I was sitting in the tub and could talk to my husband wherever he was in the room. The bathroom is so pretty, it was nice to be able to see it from other areas of the room. It just made everything seem more luxurious to me.The bed was fine. Much, much, better than a lot of hotel beds I have slept on. It is not a fancy pillow-top, but it is still very comfortable and we had lots of pillows. My husband and I slept very well. The grounds, the beach, the pool, the restaurants, the lobby, everything is beautiful and well-kept. There is always something going on at the pool or at the beach. I took a few exercise classes and dance lessons and had a lot of fun. We snorkled right off the beach and I was surprised at the variety of fish and sea life. We were going to do a snorkling excursion, but figured why bother, when the snorkling was good just steps from shore. There were also kayaks, boogie boards, and Hobie Cats that you could use for free. The water activiteis hut also offered a lot of excursions. There was so much to do or you could just do a whole lot of nothing. We never had a problem finding beach chairs or pool chairs under palapas. One day we didn't get out to the beach until 11:00AM and there were still a ton of open chairs and palapas. In fact the entire resort did not feel crowded at all and according to Annemarie, the manager, the resort was at 92% capacity.Speaking of Annemarie, she held a Tripadvisor meet and greet and she was so nice. She is a very intelligent and well-educated woman and she really cares about making the Majestic a wonderful resort and making all of her guests happy. I am so glad I got to meet her and thank her personally for the great room and the wonderful service we were receiving. She asked us what we liked and disliked about the resort and I could tell she was really listening to us. I think the Majestic has a gem of an employee with Annemarie.We went to all the shows and they were entertaining. We especially liked the men vs women show and the Michael Jackson show. They also have a huge beach party on Wednesday night which was really fun. We never made it inside the spa or to the gym so I can't comment on that. We did go to the shops and the souvenirs were reasonably priced, but sunscreen, snacks, and that kind of stuff were very expensive, so make sure you bring your own. We also walked down the beach to the beach shops which is about a 45 minute walk. I didn't really enjoy shopping there because the vendors are extremely aggressive and when you try to haggle with them they act insulted or something. I love to bargain and haggle and both parties usually leave the deal smiling, but one of the vendors was pouting and actually said as I left that I had ripped her off. I was a little insulted because she didn't have to sell me the item at the price I asked for.The food was fabulous at Le Gourmet and at the Teppanyaki restuarant. We had the chicken and the snapper at Le Gourmet and it was soooo good. The food was very good at the Rodeo Grill and the buffet. The pasta and the french fries were delicious. They also have the best ice cream. The food was just ok at the Taino. I love spicy Mexican food and the food there was really bland. We told Annemarie about that and she was very receptive to making the food better there. We ate lunch every day at the beach restaurant and there were a few flies, but what do you expect outside. The food for the most part was good. There were some strange items, but I just didn't eat them. the service at all the restuarants was great.Overall we had a great time at the Majestic. The staff is just wonderful and will do anything for you to make you stay special. There is something to do almost every second of the day if you want, or you can always find a quiet place to just veg. The food, 90% of the time is very good and you definately will not go hungry. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone going to Punta Cana.

We had the turn down service at night and that was completed by around 8:30. There were also thick terry robes for us to use. That is something you cannot bring with you, as they are heavy and bulky. It was a nice touch and that made me feel pampered.We would highly recommend this motel to anyone.

<Content>Great time at the Majestic! I have never posted a review before but feel I must this time. We are a family of 4 and just returned from a glorious week at the Majestic. Even our teens had a great time and were in awe of the beauty of the hotel (anyone with teens know that is a major endorsement)! The beach is beautiful - very wide sand area with lots of chairs and palapa's. The water is so crystal clear you can see your feet. The pool is huge and also has lots of chairs and shady areas. It is not very deep (maybe 4 feet) and I recommend that you bring some floats if you can. The swim-up bar was always the place to be for socializing but if you prefer a more quiet place that is easily found as well. The Animation team have games and activities at both the beach and pool areas if you want to participate - they do not push if you are not interested though. The staff at the resort is amazing - we never had a complaint and always felt well taken care of. In fact - they go above and beyond the normal and made us feel very special and important. AnnMarie is wonderful and did so much to help make our stay memorable - if we lived closer I would want to become a friend! We were concerned about the privacy/bathroom issue since we were traveling with 2 teenagers and we only had 1 room but when we arrived we were taken to the most beautiful suite with 1 king bed (in seperate bedroom) and 2 single beds had been brought in and set up in the HUGE living area. This was the perfect solution to keep us all together but not too together....... Lots of talk lately about the food and we had absolutely no problems at all. Never had a stomach issue - not even a growl! We ate in the steakhouse, seafood, Dominican, roomservice, buffet and the Japanese and enjoyed them all. My daughter doesn't eat meat so the made to order pasta at all the buffets were her favorite (and the cheescakes). My son LOVED the sushi. My husband loved the buffet so he could eat all he wanted. I loved the steakhouse and highly recommend the chateaubriand! There was always ice cream available for dessert along with a variety of cakes and fruits. I do not understand how so many people have such harsh words about the food - it is easy to find something you like and with so many options you can't possibly go hungry! The drinks were fine and the bartenders sure work hard. Try the Chocolate monkey (they also have a non alcoholic version for the under 18 crowd). We saw a few of the shows and they were entertaining - not Broadway but enjoyable. The casino was small and smoky but a fun way to blow a few dollars before the show. My son enjoyed the nightly movie in the sports bar a few times - it was a good place to meet up with his new friends. The resort seemed to have lots of younger children (under 10 years old) and lots of newlyweds but less families traveling with teens. We walked to the shopping plaza just outside the hotel and purchased all our souveniers there - it seemed like the prices were better than the resort shops. The Thursday night vendors who come to the hotel were much too pushy for my taste so we didn't stick around to browse. I think I covered everything but if you have any questions feel free to ask.........Remember to bring a ton of sun screen - lots of red bodies parading around the pool (mine included)!Again a special thanks to AnnMarie for making our trip so wonderful!

<Author>Snwbrder4777
<Content>The "Real" Majestic Colonial Experience ***Read before you go!!! I just got back from the Majestic Colonial with my wife and wanted to let everyone know about the place before they go. I really appreciate all the helpful hints before I go somewhere. When you first get off the plane you will notice that they have a line to take your picture with tropically dressed women. You have no choice put to have them take your picture (so smile)since they will not let you in without it. This picture will be available for you to purchase when you leave to go home from Punta Cana. I bought it for $8 US when I left. Then you will have to wait on another line to pay for your tourist card which everyone must purchase for $10 US each person. You must have cash since they do not take anything else (A way for the country to make money). Make sure that you have your transportation booked to the hotel before you get there. We used Club Caribe through Expedia. They were awesome. The best I have ever used. They had a guy holding a sign with our last name on it. He then escorted us to our bus. Everything went really smoothly. The trip to the hotel is about 40 minutes. When we arrived at the hotel I did not realize that my wife had e-mailed the manager for a better room. I asked how our room was and told him I would give a big tip if he gave us a better room. He told us that we already got an amazing room and if we did not like it he would switch it. The front desk guy had to go in the manager鈥檚 office to get our room information since my wife e-mailed him. I tipped the front desk guy $20 anyway and he walked us to our room and let us know everything about the hotel. Before you go to the room you are brought over to the reservation desk for the two reservation only restaurants. Our room was about a 3/4 mile walk from the front desk (no joke). Keep in mind that this resort is huge. When you first walk in the room you will be blown away. There is a giant hot tub for two in every room next to the bed. There is a giant walk-in marble shower with two shower heads. There is no separate bathroom so I don't think this is a good place to go unless you are a couple. The toilet is next to the shower with a frosted 3/4 length door. Not much privacy! The room is huge with a balcony. They also have a free security safe which you must use. They will also deliver a cheese platter and Champagne right after you arrive the first day. The biggest necessities you need to bring are BUG SPRAY  Sunscreen with bug spray in it. This is so important because the climate of Punta Cana is very humid and there is mosquito鈥檚 everywhere. We had read this before we went so we had minimal problems. You have to be careful not to leave your door open or sliding door open on the balcony. They will come in and eat you alive all night. The food really is not that great. We tried all the restaurants. The buffet by the lobby is the best by far. It is the biggest buffet you will ever see. The desert is the best part. The Chinese restaurant is so-so. Do not eat the sushi. It is sitting out all day and you must be crazy to eat sushi in Punta Cana. The steak house was pretty good. We did not try the seafood one because we where already sick after the first day. The buffet by the beach is gross because there are flies everywhere. The only good think about this buffet was that it serves breakfast until 12:30 PM. Ordering drinks is a nightmare unless you want a beer or Majestic (Signature drink of the resort). The bar tenders and waiters do not speak English so they will look at you like you have 4 heads if you ask for anything else. That was our biggest disappointment of the trip. The beach is huge and we never had a problem getting a chair under a shady palapala. The hotel was 99% full when we stayed. The water was really warm and was easy to go into without cold shock. You must be prepared for topless woman because they are everywhere. The pool is huge. The only thing is there are never any shady chairs available by it unless you go later in the day. But who really goes to the Caribbean to sit by the pool. I would recommend this hotel to couples who want a relaxing vacation and are easy going. There are some hitches along the way but the good far out ways the bad. They also really appreciate tips. They go above and beyond and really appreciate it when you tip them.Travel Hints:You must pay $10 US / each person to get into the country (paid when you get off the plane)Bring some sought of stomach medicine (Anti- Diarrhea). Everything is cooked with oil, and I mean everythingThey do not speak good English at all so you might want to get a translation dictionary.Bring at least 20 singles for tips. E-mail the manager of the hotel before you arrive any you will get a better room. (Ask for 3rd floor with ocean view /pool view on the left side of the resort away from the construction) Right side of resort is undergoing MAJOR construction since they are building a couples only resort. This is also a must if you are celebrating an anniversary or honeymoon and they will give you a great surprise when you get to the hotel. I will not tell you what it is so you will be surprised.

<Author>Codester
<Content>AMAZING EVERYTHING! I have traveled to Punta Cana quite a few times and I have never been more pleased with a resort. It will be hard to give anywhere else a chance.I resort itself, the grounds, and the pool were all amazing. The pool starts up by the lobby and is about 4 feet deep and you can walk all the way down to the beach in the pool. Its awesome. We were in there all day when we weren't playing lawn chess or ping pong. The staff at the customer relations, and swim up bar were amazing. There were drinks ready for us before we were even up at the bar. We paid $175 to have a 4 course meal on the beach where they go well out of their way to decorate, give you roses when you leave, you get personal musicians, and your own waiter, who was awesome. It was probably the best meal I have ever had in my life and the experience was more than worth the money. The food in the buffet was average. TONS of variety and you can always find at least something that you like. The coffee is strong, but good. I suggest eating at the Japanese restaurant, and the seafood and steakhouse at the beach. They are a la carte restaurants, but we did not need to make reservations and the food was amazing in all restaurants. Way better than the buffets. We were in room 1417 which was on the 4th floor (to the left walking out of the lobby) and a corner room, so we had 2 balconies. One good sized balcony with a partial ocean view and a bistro style table and chairs. And another balcony with a hot tub and loungers. Our room was HUGE and amazing. We met other people at the resort and their rooms were the regular rooms on the side that the theatre is on (right side out of the lobby), and their rooms were also nice. Just like ours, just a little smaller. I have read MANY REVIEWS stating that people fall ill on their vacations. The first time I came to the DR I almost got sick, but it did go away and I was only ill that one day. So here are my tips, because you DONT NEED TO GET SICK. THEIR FOOD IS NOT BAD! ITS OURS THAT IS THE PROBLEM!Some people may not agree, but it is not the food in the DR that is the problem. They do not use preservatives and pesticides. They pick things fresh and grow it themselves and dont even add many spices. People get sick on their 3rd-5th days there because the food in their system that they ate before they left is making its way out in my experience. In Canada and the US we eat a lot of bad food, even when we think its healthy. SO when you eat natural food it cleans your body out. And that is what happens. So eat healthy for a couple of weeks before you leave. ALSO, stay away from coconut drinks! Coconut is a natural laxative. If you drink Pina Coladas and Coco Locos, you WILL get the runs. I guarantee it! And obviously if you drink a lot, when you wake up in the morning you will have that natural morning issue.As I said, I was sick the first time I visited the DR, i was 17. I have been there many times since, and never been sick. I have never had issues with the food. I also am a healthy eater so I believe that has a lot to do with it. THE LANGUAGE BARRIERI dont know much spanish at all. But I have never had an issue with communication. Everyone that I dealt with at this resort knew english enough to communicate with. REMEMBER, you are in THEIR country. So you should be learning their language. Dont compain if they dont know much english, its not their fault that we've made their country a tourist attraction. I will go to this resort over and over again. It was amazing.

<Author>PuddleJumper2
<Content>Vacation, Wedding and Honeymoon...great time! We spent 8 days (6/14 - 6/21 ) at Majestic Colonial and had our wedding with 50 guests in attendance. We got a package deal for around $90/pp ($180 per night)Overall, the experience was very good and we would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a compromise between price, amenities, and quality for anyone staying in Punta Cana.During our stay the hotel was completely booked so it was at maximum capacity, yet it never really felt crowded which was a definite plus for us. We could always get a covered chair on the beach and always received service at the restaurants without too much of a wait.As one would expect when visiting a developing country, there are definitely some things that will just be out of your control so I want to make sure I present this as realistic as possible.Service:- Although this is an all-inclusive resort, tipping always helps you get better service. It is definitely an American influenced way of eating, so if you aren't used to it then expect service to not be nearly as attentive when you don't tip. Also, we didn't tip unless the service was good because there were some great servers and not-so-great servers at the resort.- The servers and bartenders speak very little English, so please realize that yelling doesn't make things any better. Speaking a few basic words definitely makes things easier for all parties involved. Most Dominicans are nice people and will try their best to understand what you want.Room/Property:- I will admit that we are somewhat biased here, since we had a beachfront room on the third floor (room numbers 2345-2350) and had no problems with our A/C, mold, or room-cleaning. We had plenty of towels, actually an excess of towels, and had everything we needed.- We also took advantage of room-service, since it was included in our package, almost everyday during our stay. It was decent although we have definitely had *much* better quality of food choices before.- Overall, the room was clean, spacious, free of smell (we were on 3rd floor) and cool.- One side of the resort is facing construction at the moment so those rooms might have a bit more noise and a less pleasant view.- Expect to walk a lot, the resort is quite large.Food:- The resort has decent food, but it's definitely not 5-star meals. You will see the same things for breakfast and lunch, but dinner is much more varied across the various restaurants. We ate at every restaurant, including the two reservation restaurants, and found them to be pretty good. The food is very similar to other all-inclusive resorts in a similar price range, so if you've done all-inclusive then you know what to expect.- Keep in mind that you can request more than one plate or multiple servings if you are not content. We usually were able to get extra seafood, meats or whatever we desired without much resistance. The meats and fish, particularly lobster tails, were very good at the various restaurants.- We also ate lots of salads, fruits (with and without skin), and other watch out foods without experiencing any sickness. Your mileage might vary on how well your immune system is doing as far as sickness goes, but in our group of 50 people only 3 people got sick, mostly upset stomaches, possibly due to overindulgence of alcohol and food.- We enjoyed all the restaurants with our favorite foods being lobster tails and shrimp.Weather:- Rainy first day and occasional storm clouds throughout stay, but they were brief rains.Beach:- Great beaches, but some parts of the water are quite rocky so definitely try to stay on the right side where it is less rocky.- Majestic has a nice beachfront property and it is not very crowded which makes it a much more pleasurable experience. You can quickly gauge how nice Majestic is by taking taking a walk on the beach to adjacent properties that are overflowing with guests and not nearly as nice.- Always got covered seating and good drinks service on the beach.Activities/shows:- The kids on our trip (ages 6-13) had a great time at beaches and pools. - Surprisingly there is no arcade room, which is common at most these resorts.- The billiards/ping-pong area for kids is really lacking and could use a face-lift.- The nightly entertainment is your typical rotating shows across the resorts in Punta Cana. The theatre where shows are performed is hot and has poor air-circulation, so definitely have lots of drinks while there to help cool off. Most the shows themselves are a bit cheesy but there was a decent cirque-du-soleil imitation show and the Michael Jackson (Yes, I know some people don't care much for him) show was pretty good.- The discotheque is typical resort disco with popular hits. The DJ was actually pretty decent and it was full of people until about 12-1am, but most people dropped off after that. The only downside is poor exhaust in the disco making sure you'll get plenty of 2nd hand smoke while there.- The casino also has poor ventilation, so you can continue to get 2nd and 3rd hand smoking while in there. There are also top-shelf liquors you can purchase, which are not included. The casino is not vegas, just a small casino with 3-4 tables and a bunch of slots.- Snorkeling and kayaking are included, as well as a few other water activities which were quite fun.- Animation team has activities all day long if you want to dance, do aerobics, play games, etc.Bars/Drinks:- There are different colored wrist bands and during our stay the gray colored bands meant premium drinks. Most drinks will be made with cheap as hell local rum called Brugal. Brugal rum sucks and you *MUST* request your drink to be made with a specific rum, vodka or whiskey else they will use the cheap stuff.- Top-shelf liquors such as Grey Goose, black label whiskey, grand marnier, etc. are not included, yet they display the bottles as if they are. Most all-inclusive resorts don't include them and only those that say PREMIUM INTERNATIONAL drinks are included. You also will pay accordingly at those resorts if you can't survive without top-shelf liquors.- Overall, most drinks are pretty good and they will add more liquor to the drinks if you ask them politely.Wedding/Honeymoon:- We did a very basic wedding in the Gazebo for about $1000 and it definitely exceeded our expectations. The wedding included everything mentioned on their list, as well as reception for all 50 people at a restaurants. Unless you really want a private dinner reception, it is not necessary. We had a non-private reception at no extra cost in the Rodeo Grill. We had our own section of the restaurant with decorated table settings and dedicated waiters, as well as wedding cake and champagne.- The wedding coordinators (Aurelio and Larissa) are *very* professional and do their best to make things work as easily as possible. Just keep in mind that they do about 2-4 weddings a day, so you are not the only *diva* for that day and they can only accomplish so much on a short notice.Tips:- Learn some basic Spanish to make things a bit easier. You don't need to be fluent, but gratitude and counting numbers are a big plus. Just remember that your basic spanish will most likely trump their basic english.- This is the caribbean, so expect to see mosquitoes, ants, roaches, etc. from time to time. It is just inevitable to prevent these bugs at a resort like these, so if this is a problem then maybe you should stay home.- Shopping at the resort is expensive, make sure to bring enough sunscreen, sunglasses, sandals, bathing suits, mosquito repellant, aloe vera gel, etc.Finally, have fun, relax, and enjoy!!

<Author>trip-a-daygirl
<Content>What your should know about the Majestic before you go. I thought you should read what people are not telling you about the Majestic. Sorry...these are mostly negative but you've already read the positves over and over again.Yes, there are mosquitos. Some of the people we were traveling with did not have any problems but we sure did. After returning to our room each afternoon we would kill a minumum of three. They seem to like the yellow curtains and bed canopy. Two mornings I woke up with bites on my face and neck. The maids leave your room door open while cleaning.Always keep your deadbolt locked while in your room. The staff does not use the motion sensor to detect if your in your room...they will knock and come on in. Luckily, we were dressed the first time this happened. The mini bar guy that came around each morning was the worst for knocking and then opening the door. He was great to remember we wanted extra water after telling him the first day.Do not plan on sleeping in at this resort. Especially if your in buildings 3 or 4 with low room numbers (i.e. 3204, 4306, 3110) pay attention to the last two digits when they assign you a room. Because of the close proximity that the buildings are to each other in the low number rooms create an echo. You hear the maids taking carts through the hallways all night long and even one morning there was a maid cleaning the railing with her broom which was a constant banging. We were never able to sleep later than 7am any morning. These rooms are also close to the nightly entertainment. So if you plan on turning in before midnight...forget it. Remember building 4 balconys face the new construction.Bring your own pillow. The hotels were very flat. One was not enough and two pillows stacked was too much. I suggest not to risk it if you have neck issues.We went to the main buffet one night for dinner and found the food to be mediocre. Our saving grace was the pizza station. If they do not have anything to your liking from the premade pizzas ask them to make you a special pizza with the toppings of your choice. We had a fantastic pizza. They make all of their pizza dough fresh as well as their breads. On their dessert bar they had a tray of brown course type of food (I don't know how to describe it) I decided to try it and it was coconut and great.To give them credit they are trying to serve several nationalities with their food service. We always found something to eat so do give everything a try. You never know what you may discover.Internet speed was similar to dial-up. You have to purchase time and it's continuous from the time you first log in. We purchased 72 hours and we had 3 days of continuous internet service and then it expires.After walking the beach we discovered that the Majestic had the most covered areas at the beach and pool. This is a huge plus as the sun is strong and we saw quite a few people with burns.Our over all experience was good. I don't want my negatives to discourage anyone from visiting the Majestic.

<Author>snowerin
<Content>Majestic Horror I traveled to this hotel with my mother. We are 30 and 50 respectively. I had just recently finished my masters degree and this was to be a celebratory trip. I had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to request a room as close to the beach as possible. When we arrived at the resort we were taken directly to our room and found that the hotel had not only honored my request but had upgraded us to a beachfront room with an extremely large balcony. We were absolutely thrilled and expected a phenomenal vacation. We had read the reviews on tripadvisor and knew to expect sub par food. We figured that it wouldn't be that big of a deal given the beauty of our room, the resort, and the beach. We were there to relax and enjoy the beach and the sun, everything else was secondary. The first night we were there we had dinner at the seafood restaurant on the beach. We both woke up during the night with some gastrointestinal issues but by early morning we were feeling better and we were determined to not let it ruin our day. The second night we decided to skip dinner after walking into both the buffets. Breakfast was consistently good so we decided that we would eat alot during that meal as the rest of the food was so awful. We had made two reservations at Le Gourmet, one for the third and the fifth night we were at the hotel. After eating at Le Gourmet the first time my mother fell ill. Since she has a weak stomach we attributed her sickness to her change in eating habits. She stayed in or close to the room the next day but was feeling a little better by the day after. However at this point she decided that she would only eat packaged items and tried to adhere to the BRAT diet - bananas, rice, applesauce, and tea (this diet is great if you find yourself ill on vacation). We dined at Le Gourmet on our fifth night. My mother abstained from eating while I foolishly went ahead and had dinner. The next morning I woke up feeling like I had been hit by a truck. Not only was I vomiting and going to the bathroom every 5 minutes, but I had developed a high fever by mid morning. I felt as if I had the flu. My muscles were stiff and achy and I could barely move. We had an excursion planned for that morning so I called the front desk at 6am and asked to speak to the manager on duty. I was connected to the Night Manager, Callyx. To make a long story short he was rude, argumentative, and unhelpful. He told me that I would have to go to Medical to get a note from the doctor for him to be able to do anything. He then told me that the cost would be $90/pp. When I told him that I was unable to walk to the medical facility he told me that I could pay more to have them come to me. I told him that the Dr visit would cost more than my excursion and he simply said oh well. When I asked for the name of the General Manager he repeatedly told me that he was the manager. There was no language barrier issue, he was purposely being uncooperative. When I finally, out of frustration, told him that I didn't care who he was b/c he wasn't helping me his response was if you don't care who I am then I don't care who you are......and then he hung up. Sick and in tears I waited until 9am and called my travel agent back in the US. She was shocked and appalled because she books this hotel frequently...However both my mother and myself have used the same agent for the past 8 years, generally travel 3-6 times a year each, and we have NEVER complained about a hotel. I'm not sure who she spoke to or what she said but a few hours later the Relations Manager Oscar and the Dr come to our room. The Dr took one look at me, took my blood pressure and temperature and pronounced me very ill. Oscar apologized for the way we had been treated and promised that room service would bring me anything I liked - so I made my high maintenance request for saltines and bananas. He also promised me that he would arrange a meeting with the General Manager, whose name I finally found out was Jose Maria. Needless to say I never got my meeting. We ate bananas and crackers for the last two days of our trip. As we were checking out Oscar came over to apologize again and to offer a voucher for two free nights if we wanted to return to the resort again. Absolutely ridiculous! We would NEVER return even if the trip was free.For all of the naysayers and nonbelievers I just want to clarify that we did not drink the water, we only drank bottled water and did not imbibe any alcoholic beverages. We were also very careful about what we ate. Everywhere we went we heard people discussing their various illnesses and symptoms. I always read the reviews on this site and take the negative ones with a grain of salt b/c I know some people are just difficult to please. We are not those type of people. We went to this resort expecting beautiful beaches and terrible food. What we got was a beautiful resort that we were only able to fully enjoy 3 out of the 6 days we were there due to unsanitary food. That is UNEXCUSABLE. Visit this hotel only if you want to be able to boast to people that you once had E COLI or if you prefer unprofessional, uncaring and downright rude management.

<Author>PatsFan
<Content>Great Time at Majestic!!! Here goes my review - Traveled May 19th - 25th. This was our 4th time to the DR. Having stayed before at the Iberostar Bavaro and Iberostar LaRomana. This was a graduation gift to our two daughters 21 and 25 (lst time for them to DR). My brother and his wife also decided to join us.Rooms - We had three different room categories between us. Thank you Richard for all your help. My husband and I had a Col. Jr. Suite, the girls had a swim-up room and my brother and his wife had a standard room. All rooms had identical furniture. Our room (1420) had was bigger because we had two balconies. One was for the rooftop hot tub, which we only used twice, it was way too hot up there. The other balcony overlooked the resort next door and had a partial oceanview. Would I pay again for this room upgrade. No. My brother and his wife had a great standard room (2334) overlooking the pool area. My daughters had the swim-up room (2148), great location, near the beach and the beginning of the pool. I had requested for them a room with two double beds, this room had a king bed. They decided not to switch. Their only issue with the room was that they had quite a few mosquitos in room. I think it was because it was due to the fact they were on the lst floor with the grassy area in front that got watered daily and was in the shade. We had no mozzies nor did my brother. The girls did not use their outdoor hot tub (really no privacy) and I also made a point to check the other swim-up roomsm I never saw anyone use their hot tub. The girls would go back late in the day and use the lounge chairs to read. We all had champagne in room upon arrival. Also, during the week we all received white wine, red wine, fruit platter, cheese platter, sushi, salmon and grapes delivered to our room. Letters welcoming us and we also received hats and shirts. We also all had slippers and robes in the rooms. I thought that my water pressure in the huge shower could have been alot better. As far as the room categories go, I really think any room would be great for us if we went again. How much time do you really spend in the room? We would be gone by 8:00am til 5:30pm, back out again at 7:00pm til 9:30 or 10:00pm. I know we are party poopers, the sun just wiped us out.Speaking of the weather, it was great. Someone on the plane said it showed showers all week in the forecast. It sprinkled lightly one night during the beach barbeque and then once more sometime through the night. The weather was hot. We were almost hoping for some relief from clouds.We never had a problem getting beach chairs. I don't know if it was just the week. There were always chairs at the beach no matter what time. We would stay on the beach til around 3:30 or 4:00 and then head up to the pool bar area. Never had a problem getting a few chairs around the pool except on Miss Bikini Contest day. (Though on our last morning, I saw the pool guys take away alot of the loungers around the pool. I don't know where he was bringing them) On a side note, I have to say my tuition payments to college paid off as my younger daughter went to the finals against her sister at the Beer Drinking contest and won!!! (It was who could drink the fastest) She made us proud, I say jokingly.The beach was beautiful. That is what we went for. The ocean was great. There was a few rocks right in front, not a problem though. We stayed on the beach all day and enjoyed the ocean. The pool was nice too, but you can have a pool anywhere. The ocean was much more refreshing than the pool, also a wonderful breeze on the beach.Food - Alot has been said about the food as of late. I thought that the food was just OK. You could always find something to eat. Items should definately be labelled better. The best meal to me was the breakfast. My older daughter is a very picky eater, she managed all week on chicken, pasta, fries, bread and ice cream. The younger one tried all kinds of different stuff. We all ate salad too. I came well prepared with all kinds of meds. No one got sick. The girls even brushed their teeth with tap water. Honestly, if someone got sick, I definately would have felt different about the food. We went to the steakhouse, out of the six of us, 4 loved it, 2 did not (steak overcooked). We all had the chateaubriand. The girls went back a second time and enjoyed it. There were flies around the food down by the lunch buffet. You can eat at the lunch buffet by the lobby (which I heard was better) we were just too lazy to go up there. Again, there was a beach barbeque one night and during the day there was paella on the beach.We never really made it to the shows. The girls saw a couple, said it was fun to watch. They went to the disco one night, there was a real bad musty odor there.The casino was small, lost a little money. It killed some time.Had the photographers take some photos of us. Bought the CD.Enjoyed sitting out in courtyard at night listening to music and dancing under the stars.Lost power one night for about 15 minutes.The vendors that came in were very pushy.Treated the girls and myself to massages at the spa. 50.00pp for 25 minutes.Hubby took the girls on a morning fishing charter 85.00pp. They were bummed, did not catch anything.The grounds were beautiful and well maintained.Tipping - we tipped all the waitstaff, bartenders. I have to say that we were in the minority. I tiipped our maid daily and also the person who restocks the refrigerator. I gave money and cold water to the young man who was picking up the beach trash. He was so appreciative.We used Dominican Airport Transfer for our rides to and from the airport. No problem there.Speaking about airports. I think flying today has gotten worse and will only continue. I want to mention about Miami Airport. I have heard alot of comments about Miami International on this site. We were suppose to have a two hour layover in Miami, as it turned out our flight from Boston to Miami was delayed (mechanical) Our flight from Miami to PC was leaving at 10:50am and we landed at 10:05am. I was sure we were not going to make it and i was certain we would not get our luggage with only 40 minutes to spare. We got off the plane and ran to our next gate and they were already boarding. Way too close!! I plane from Miami to PC went off on time and when we landed and I saw my luggage I was so relieved, until the luggage belt stopped and both of my daughters luggage was not there. What gives with that, we were all on the same flight from Boston. Anyway, the young man at the PC airport said that there was another flight from Miami to PC on its way and hopefully the missing luggage was on that flight. (There were about 6 other people who did not get their luggage also, I believe they all originated from the Boston flight) Lucky for us the luggage made it on the next flight and the girls received theirs at around 6:00pm at the Majestic. You can imagine how happy two young women were to receive their luggage. When we had gone previously to La Romana I did not get any luggage for 2 days (another story).I cannot end this without saying how great the animation team was. We had a nice time getting to know them. If you did not want to be bothered by them, they would leave you be. They work such long hours into the night. Hola, to Ray, Walter, Tony, Francisco (Oskay!!!), Maciel, Maria, Leon and Melvin. Auntie Donna says Hola, too.In closing, we had a wonderful week. As I mentioned earlier this was a trip to celebrate both our daughters graduations. We wanted to spend some family time together and give them some R  R before they go off to the real world. It truly was a memorable week for us and we would not hesitate to recommend the Majestic and we are looking forward to returning.I hope this review has helped someone as I always check Trip Advisor before we go anywhere.

<Author>Heatheroc92576
<Content>Amazing Vacation I booked my vacation here through CheapCaribbean.com and got an amazing deal. I was worried because you never know if you're getting ripped off, but I could not have been happier with the customer service I received. I was traveling alone with my three children under the age of nine and was looking for the perfect place that we would all be able to enjoy. I continuously called CheapCaribbean.com to find out about different resorts in the Dominican and what they offered. The customer service workers were more than happy to help and called the hotels directly if they couldn't provide me with a direct answer to save me the cost of an international call. The bus ride from the airport to the hotel was not bad at all. A little bumpy, but you can't count on a luxury experience while traveling down dirt roads. It just added to the experience. When you pull up to the Majestic, you are just blown away by the elegance of this resort. As soon as the workers saw I was alone with three kids, I had two people over helping me with my luggage and to get me checked in. They gave us hand towels which were nice - especially since my four year old had fallen asleep on the ride there. I laid him down on one of the couches and went through the check in. A waitress walked around with Majestics for the guests to drink while waiting in line. My kids fell in love with these drinks (which you can get with rum at any of the bars!) Check out went really well and although we had arrived earlier than check in time, they got us to a room within 30 minutes! The room we had was AMAZING!!! We had two regular beds and the biggest roll away bed I have ever seen! With all that, the room was still huge! There was a jacuzzi in the room as well that my kids loved. I loved the roominess of the shower although the room with the toilet was a little tight fitting. There was a fruit tray waiting for us and then we got a cheese tray the next night. The pool at this hotel is the best pool I have ever seen in my entire life. Even though it is all connected, there is a wall that divides the pool into two sections - the warmer side (towards the ocean) and the cooler side (towards the lobby). Although the ocean was right there, we did end up spending the majority of time at the pool cause it was just so beautiful. It never really seemed crowded except for near the pool bar where everyone would try to get a spot, but was never uncomfortable. Everyone working there were so friendly. I did not run into one person that worked there that did not smile and greet me as I walked by. If you needed anything, they were willing to get it right away. As you stay there, you get to know the waiters and waitresses and there were a few times I would sit at a table and I didn't even have to ask for my drink because they would just bring it over. I enjoyed a lot of the food, but some of it wasn't my thing. They had enough choices though where you were bound to find something you liked. For breakfast, have them make you omlets! So good. The crepes were amazing as well. I went to all the restaurants minus the fancy one because children aren't allowed in there. Make sure you make reservations for the Japanese restaurant to sit at the hibachi table. But if you just go there without a reservation after they open and ask if they have any room, they will seat you in the restaurant part if they have available space. One of the chefs fell in love with my youngest son and was making him all sorts of things to try. The beach was beautiful - one picture I took with the beach at dusk in the background seriously looked like a fake picture! It was that unreal! The water was so warm it took a little getting used to - because water just isn't supposed to be that warm! lol We did the tubing which was so much fun. It can hurt a little and we did get a few scrapes from the rubber against our skin - my advice would be wear a long sleeved shirt and shorts. My bikini bottom tie got ripped out with the pull of the ocean during the tubing, so be careful!!! The lady that worked there was great though and had it all fixed in no time!We also did the snorkeling tour which was a great experience! My four year old didn't want to do it, so one of the workers on the boat took him and carried him around with her so I could still go out in the water. They sell a video of the trip which I bought. I wouldn't buy it again though unless I knew I was in the video more than I was. There were a few good shots, but if you think you are going to buy the video, make sure you put effort in to get in front of the camera to make it worth the money.Also did the tour through the country side which was a lot of fun. We brought bubble gum and some other little toys for the kids - the bubble gum was a huge hit and some of the kids chased our bus asking for more. One lady thought they were begging for money, but that wasn't the case at all! They definitely have a sweet tooth! By the end of the trip, everyone on the bus with us had wished they had brought candy to hand out. The kids club was slightly disappointing because they didn't really have much planned for the kids other than playing in the water area for them. Don't get me wrong, my kids loved this little play area complete with water slides, but they didn't want to stay there for long periods of time. The women working there were awesome though. I would tip them $5 whenever I left my kids there, which they would always try to give back to me but I wouldn't let them. If you're looking for a place to drop your kids off and do your own thing, I wouldn't count on this resort to provide your kids with non stop fun while you're gone. Mine ended up hanging out with me the majority of our trip and it ended up being fine. I didn't really need to use the kids club except for when we went tubing because the youngest couldn't go. I can't say there were always activities offered to keep you busy, but they had enough to make you feel like there was enough to do between sitting and relaxing by the pool or the ocean. My daughter got a really bad sunburn the day we spent swimming in the ocean. I got the yogurt from the buffet and smeared it all over her body which really seemed to help. Everything about this resort and my stay here was incredible! I can't say enough good about it (even though it had taken me a year to write this review! lol) I also went on the forum for this hotel offered on this site and ended up planning to meet a couple from Connecticut that were going to be there the same time we were. They were great and we have remained in contact ever since the trip!If you have any questions, please email me at heatheroc92576@aol.com and I'll try to answer them as well as I can!If you stay here though, you will not be disappointed!PS. I would post pictures, but my youngest deleted them all from my camera the morning we were leaving. That was the worst part of the trip!

I ended up having to hide one in a bag that i carried around with me. We had to call every day to get one. Our room was never serviced completely, if the maid came then the person filling up the minibar would not. Our expresso was never restocked and they do not give you clean glasses in the room to drink out of. They rinse them out (in the bacteria infested water in the room) and just put them back. So, don't use any dishes in the room. they are more than likely dirty. No wonder so many people get sick. We were there for a wedding with a group of 10 people by the end of the week every one of us had some time of stomach issue. The food is horrible at both of the buffets. Make sure you don't eat anything that you don't see them cook in front of you. I had omelets and pasta everyday. Dinner at the restaurants was actually pretty good. Every steak we had was cooked perfect. I did hear from another couple that the japanese restaurant is not worth the effort the food was so bad. I also noticed that the service did not improve after you tipped. We left money every day for the maid and we had issues almost every day. I stopped leaving money the last 2 days because it did not make a difference. Also, beware of the bottled water and make sure the seal on the lid breaks and it is actually filtered water. We had quite a few bottles that tasted as if they were refilled from the tap or something and the lid on all of them came right off with the seal attached. I would not recommend this resort to anyone. There isn't much to do but relax, eat and drink and the food and drinks are horrible. There is no real juice at the bar so if you want anything that has cranberry or orange juice in it you will be disappointed. They use some kind of syrup tasting orange or red drink. I ended up drinking Majestics all week because at least they tasted good. Don't waste your money. It is worth the few extra dollars to go somewhere else.

<Author>PaulaB45
<Content>Paradise!!!! This was our 5th trip to Punta Cana and our second visit to the Majestic. Our stay was 4/27/08 to 5/4/08. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary with 4 of our friends (3 who had never been to Punta Cana). It's hard to believe, but it was even better the second time around. Everyone in our group loved it!! We were in building 3, first floor in 3 consecutive rooms. It was so nice to be able to walk out and meet with our friends on their patio and have a drink  socialize. Thank you to Raphael in reservations who I had emailed back and forth with our requests which were fufilled beyond our expectations. We enjoyed the deliveries every day to our room consisting of wine, fruit plate, chocolate covered grapes, sushi etc... What a nice surprise.  The resort is extremely beautiful and clean. The staff go out of their way to accomodate you. The pool was great. And the best part was the beach where we spent most of our time. We did find this time that we needed to get up early to save seats if we wanted our front row spot under the palapa. Not a big deal as we all took turns. The weather also was great that week. Only one overcast day. Some of the new things added since our last visit a year ago was the beach party, don't miss it. We had so much fun dancing in the sand. Also the cooking lesson on the beach making the paella was good, and they serve drinks to you as you leave the beach around 4pm, all nice additions. It shows that they are always looking to make improvements. I have a hard time understanding some of the reviews that I've read about the food. We had the sirloin and my husband and I didn't get a good cut. There was a lot of fat. Everyone else enjoyed theirs. A few musts to bring are of course your insulated mugs, lots of sunscreen, a night light as the rooms are very dark at night  plenty of ones for tipping. Also bring antibacterial handwash as we used it all day long. Think about it, everyone is touching those serving spoons. My husband got very sick at another resort a few years back and now swears by the handwash. No one got sick this vacation. We love this resort over others we've stayed at in the past for a few reasons. Only needing reservations at 2 of the restaurants, the size of the resort ( you don't need a shuttle bus to get around the resort), we like the rooms and the patio area as the outdoor furniture is made of metal not smelly cushions and lastly the fact that there are not a lot of wild birds roaming around at night (had 2 vacations that we didn't get any sleep as we had roosters and peacocks keeping us up all night) all at five star resorts. Lastly have to compliment the bartenders as we did our share of drinking. They sure do make good drinks. If you request mucho rum you will get it!! Marcos at the beach bar was our favorite. Every morning he would give us the local sports update with our drinks. The entertainment staff was great too!!! Thanks to everyone at the Majestic!! We truly love your resort and will be back!!

<Author>koolaboola
<Content>Applauso, applauso to the animation team I just returned home yesterday, June 7, from a week long stay at the Majestic Colonial. I am your average, middle class, hard working individual from Ohio, USA and I felt like I was living a dream. I went with a group of eleven, all couples except myself. This ended up lenghthy but it contains info. 1st time travelers to the Dominican or the Majestic might like. We all had Jr. Suites, which were very spacious and beautiful. The resorts website pictures really are what you are getting. The jacuzzi tub was awesome. The walk-in shower is HUGE. The room safe requires you to self-program a 4 digit code and was large enough for me to put my camera bag plus other valuables. There is lots of storage space which I suggest you make use of. Because of the humidity, clothing and bedsheets tend to get damp easily. I found that things that i had put away in drawers were less damp than things that I left out. The only negative I can say about the room was that the mattress was very hard. I requested a mattress topper but never got one or their idea of a mattress topper is not mine. I ended up sleeping on the couch for the last 5 nights because I found that it was actually very comfortable and I slept wonderfully. But from what I understand is that mattresses are harder down there everywhere.The resort is beautiful all the way around, the lobby, the pool, the beach. It is maintained well.We hung out at the pool near the pool/wet bar most of the time. Besides being served unlimited amounts of alcohol, (special thanks to William, Destelle, and Amaury for keeping the drinks coming and for always wearing a smile, Ya Baby!), that is where the animation team has activities. The vacation would not have been as fun without them. They get people involved through different games, aerobics and dance. I'm typically a shy person but I enjoyed both watching and participating in their activities. A extra special thanks to Francisco, Melvin, and Sandy for your friendliness and attentiveness to making my stay a memorable one. Advice to those who like to dance, do not wait to start learning the Taki, Taki or club dance. It is not typical line dancing which is repetitive. Parts of the dance repeats but it is changing throughout the whole song so if you really want to learn it, start on day one. I waited until like day 4 and only really learned about half of it. The animation team goes to the disco at night and around 12m they do the taki, taki. It is much more fun to participate if you know what you are doing. And to those of you who would not like all the activities, the pool is very long so i'm sure the other end of the pool is quiet. Our rooms were in building 2 and there is no pathway between the building and the pool. To walk the length of the pool to get to where you want to be, you have to go over bridges which can be kind of tiresome. I finally figured out to walk the length inside the building and exit where i wanted to be, much faster.The food was bad, good, to excellent depending on what you get and what your preferences are. There is more than enough variety to find things that you really like. One warning to Coke fans, they call Pepsi and Coke, cola, and they do not have Coke/Diet Coke, it's all Pepsi at the Majestic. I did discover the Mini Mart sold Diet Coke for $2 a bottle and by day 5, it was worth it. I got really tired of drinking Diet Pepsi and the water. Drinking the water is a necessity though to keep from getting dehydrated. I drank a lot of water compared to normal and I was still partially dehydrated. I did get sick with stomach cramping and diarrhea which kept me confined to my room one night. Almost everyone in our party got sick at one point or another and none of us (i don't think) could pinpoint a specific cause.The best tips i read before going were to take an insulated mug for your drinks and to take an inflatable raft. I kept my mug filled with water and drank as much water as alcohol. Next time I go I will take two mugs, one for each. Bubba kegs keep drinks cold quite awhile. I also enjoyed floating around on my raft a lot and heard in the minimart the lady trying to sell one for $20 US. The last day there i took the raft down to the pool to leave and someone had picked it up within 5 minutes. Another tip, write your name on your mugs and rafts.My opinion on tipping, I don't think the service would have changed much whether i tipped or did not tip. But because it is ingrained in me to tip when you get good service, that's what i did.And after I heard that i can make in one day what an average housekeeper makes in 1 month, I had no qualms about tipping. I tipped a dollar a day to the housekeeper, the person who stocked my mini-bar, to the server at meals and each bartender who served me during the day, and to anyone who transported my luggage.Tips on what kind of clothes to pack. Take more than one swimsuit because of the humidity they do not dry out fast. Take a cover-up to go to lunch in but do not try to go to the indoor buffet even slightly damp, they check to see if you are dry. Take one outfit for supper and the rest of the night. This does not have to be longer pants or even real nice unless you go to the 2 restaurants which require reservations. I saw several shorts and casual attire at the buffet and the outside restaurants. Take whatever you want to go eat breakfast in, you can wear this more than once because you are only in it for a short time. Unless you go out on excursions everyday, you really do not need play shorts and t-shirts. I took one for everyday and wore maybe a third of them.Some of us went on the ATV excursion. Lots of fun! And you end up at Macao Beach which is absolutely gorgeous with torquoise waters. Be prepared to get dirty though and wear older clothes.The weather is hot yet unpredictable. The staff said they could not count on their weather forecasts because one minute it could be sunny and the next it could be raining. They told us this is their rainy season and it did rain at least three of the days we were there. One time all afternoon and another all night.Other tips. Go to guest services right after checkin and make reservation for the 2 restaurants that require it. So discuss it before you get their. Also be prepared to schedule and pay for your excursions at the time you meet with your travel agency representative so discuss that too. If you go out the front entrance of the Majestic and go to the right, there is a shopping plaza within ten minute walk. Don't go though if you are not prepared to be haggled and to bargain for a decent price. I found the best way to deal with unwanted vendors is to say no gracias and keep moving. If you are going to the Majestic, have a great time.

<Author>BostonPhotog
<Content>How Majestic! We just returned from The Majestic 2 weeks ago and , well, I can't say enough ... The trip was just fantastic!! It was our 25th anniversary and it couldn't have been any better! To start with, the traveling was just fine. No problems at all. And to have musicians playing as we deplaned (and also boarded on our way back) was a nice touch. Of course they wanted money so we slid a couple of bucks into their hat, but it was still very nice. The resort couldn't have been better. We did make a change in the beginning, however. The room, which was one of the more expensive rooms, did not have a very nice view of the ocean as we had hoped. Instead, it overlooked the scuba diving rental hut. Leave it to my wife to ask if they had any other rooms available. We did a little research first and found the room(s) we would prefer, went to the front desk and spoke to Roberto. He was the best. He, himself brought us around to look at a couple of rooms and we did end up with the room we wanted; Building #2, room 2344, overlooking the pool AND the ocean. How they did that we'll never know, because the resort was full. But we didn't ask. 2 other things we asked for was the CD player from the first room, and after seeing anniversary and honeymoon banners on several doors, asked for a Happy Anniversary banner on our door. The banner came almost immediately, and the CD player came the next day. Lastly, because we took a lesser room, we went back to the front desk to see if we could get something as compensation. We're really not pushy people, but we figured why not? We spoke to Franklin who gave us 2 30-minute massages for FREE! And, let me tell you, we were so happy -- and grateful!  As for the resort itself, it came as advertised. It was beautiful, and immaculate! The pool was wonderful, winding through the resort, and the beach was just anmazing, going on for miles. We took long walks down the beach everyday and never got past the 3rd or 4th resort. Our resort had 8 restaurants and 8 bars! We ate and drank all week, and made a few friends along the way from PA, KY, Chicago, and many from right here in Boston. Not to mention the people who worked right there at the resort. The waiters were great (Tomas, Eduardo, and Francisco) and the bartenders (William and Pablo). We had a lot of fun with all of them! As a matter of fact, on out last night, we saw Eduardo leaving for the night when we called out, Mi Amigo! He stopped walking and came right over to me and Tamy, gave us big hugs and told us to have a safe flight home! We were shocked. He could have blown us off, but took the time to come over. It's that type of friendliness you can't get everywhere. The swim-up pool bar with William was just so much fun. That's where we met most of the people on the first day. Some of whom we dined with later in the week. The lobby bar with Pablo was also a lot of fun.  Some people who wrote negative things about the food in the trip advisor must be hard to please. The food was plentiful, and very good. Some were better than others, but overall very good. The breakfast buffet at Supreme was fantastic, and depending on where you went, dinner was phenomenal! The Steak House was great. We got the Chateaux Briand twice and would recommend it to everyone. The Mexican/Dominican restaurant was also very good. But our favorite was the Teppenyaka restaurant. You needed reservations, and we didn't get to eat there until the last night, but it was well worth the wait. It was just amazing! Tamy works at a Sushi restaurant here at home, so when we say it was good, it's coming from people who eat sushi all the time. In summary, we both thought the Majestic was very, very good. Very clean (although some rooms -- we heard -- had a musty smell) with very good and friendly employees. The word of each day was Ola. Everywhere we went, all of the people who worked there would smile and say hello. We tipped a lot, which is the best thing to do. Bring plenty of ones, and tip everyone right from the beginning. You'll get much better service. The Dollar is 3 times greater than the peso so a dollar to them means a lot. That, we feel helped a lot, but they seemed genuinely very nice. Our room was always clean, always with flower petals in the tub, the fridge was always filled each day, and the bed made. You never saw a piece of paper on the grounds, nor a cigarette butt in the sand in the ashtrays. They went as far as to put an M in the sand in the ashtrays. We noticed a couple of times workers cleaning them and reforming the M. Again, we tipped $3 dollars per day, and also left notes asking for more water.  All-in-all, we had a blast and would go back in a heartbeat! We spoke to a couple of people from some of the other resorts. One who had come over to check out the Majestic, and another when we went to look at their resort. The first said her resort was fantastic, but after seeing ours, said she would stay at the Majestic next time. The other woman, who stayed at a resort down the beach that looked very nice, had many complaints. One of which was no hot water for 3 days. The only thing we had to worry about, and it had nothing to do with our resort, was to not drink the water and brush our teeth using the bottled water they provided every day. We also were told from Jama (our liason from VIP -- who was great) not to eat the salads, be careful not to eat some of the fruit, and to only have 2 pina coladas per day because of the coconut. Again, we know it's a country thing and had nothing to do with our resort. As I said to my wife -- and some of the people we spoke with about our trip when we got back -- we only had to worry about 3 things all week ... whether to go to the beach or the pool (we had beautiful weather ALL week), what we wanted to drink that day, and where we wanted to go for dinner! It doesn't get any better than that!!  I must also say we booked our trip through allinclusiveexperts.com and had Kathy as our agent. Everything she did for us was fantastic and I would recommend her to everyone wanting to go through an online travel agent. Between her help, a great resort, and a wonderful way to celebrate our 25th anniversary, we cannot be any happier!What an experience this trip was. The Majestic was just that ... Majestic!!

<Author>runnerdude1
<Content>May 23-31 My wife and I visited the Majestic the last week of May. The airport was hectic. Upon arriving, you buy a $10 tourist card and 1 minute later you hand it back in. This puzzled me as to why we didn't just give them the $10. The porters try to take your bags one you exit baggage claim. It takes several NO's to get them to leave you alone. If you have a prearranged transfer, it may take some time between waiting in line to hand in your voucher to get another voucher. It took us about 2 hours from the time we landed to the time we got to the Majestic(we had to drop others off at 2 other hotels) and get a separate voucher from the Prieto Tours agent. Check-in was easy, but nobody greeted us with a wet towel and the Majestic drink. I saw this done later in our stay. Rooms were clean and beautiful, but since the resort hallways are tiled, noise was an issue from the partiers coming in late and rolling suitcases when people were leaving the resort. I didn't have many issues with my stay, but the food was worse than Golden Corral. The main restaurants were pretty good, but the buffets were bad. I left more food on my place than I ate. Throughout the week, I ate breakfast and lunch at both buffet restaurants (beach and the one attached to the lobby) when they first opened and the food was room temperature. Nothing was hot, except if they made an omelette or pasta to order. I ate spaghetti 3 days in a row at the beach restaurant since I nothing else tasted good. My wife went to another restaurant since she didn't like anything she ate at the buffet. Restaurant servers were great. Always removing finished dishes and replenishing the various beverage types(beer, soda, water, wine, mixed drinks). I found that tipping didn't do much to get extra service. We tipped our beach waitress once and never saw her for the rest of the day. We did tip our waiter (Blas) $50 who worked in the steakhouse. I couldn't figure out why some days we would and others we wouldn't. I would recommend this resort but would not give it a 5 star. I would say a very low 4 star would be appropriate. I was looking forward to the Majestic cocktail but it would have to wait until after we checked in.
