I liked how the pool wound through the middle of the resort, with all four buildings essentially being nearby to pool access. There were ample bar locations to get a drink around the pool no matter where you were situated. I liked how the restaurants were split into two locations on opposite ends of the resort. The theater for the nightly shows fit in well at the corner of the resort by the shops, and the casino, disco and late night caf茅 were situated close enough to get to all three with ease as the night went on.The room was nice, we did not choose to do an upgrade since our room is mostly used for sleep and showering when we are on vacation, and we were not disappointed. I don鈥檛 think that either of us had a problem with the bed being uncomfortable, at least after we found some softer pillows in the closet. We didn鈥檛 have an issue, but I can see how people could be upset about the lack of privacy in the bathroom with either children or non-family around. Not much protecting you and the rest of the world in there. We loved having two sinks, the shower was very large, and the garden Jacuzzi was a nice touch. The TV had ESPN and some US channels, but I did miss Channel 21 from the Excellence.The restaurants exceeded my expectations at this resort. We ate a la carte every night and got breakfast and lunch at the buffet almost every morning. The selection at the buffet was better inside rather than near the beach, as the beach is only set up for a continental style breakfast and quick lunch items. The restaurants in order of personal preference from best to worst were (my choice): Steakhouse (chateaubriand), Gourmet (tenderloin), Seafood (lobster), Japanese, Chinese (lemon chicken), and Mexican (don鈥檛 remember). Compared to other DR AI鈥檚 the steak was actually perfect here. The two best restaurants for atmosphere were the steakhouse and seafood when the weather was nice. There was certainly no shortage of food.The pool and beach were about what I expected for the typical all inclusive in the DR, which is outstanding. I鈥檓 not sure if this pool was better than the Excellence though. It was definitely large enough to be away from the pool activities if you just wanted to relax. The water temp was perfect in my opinion especially in the hot sun. The beach was great, I wish they could have put a bar a little bit closer and staff some more with waiters on the beach, but it wasn鈥檛 that big of a deal. You could almost always find a hut if you wanted, even with all the inconsiderate people setting their stuff out in the AM to reserve a place for later.We caught a few shows but had seen them all before on our Honeymoon. They are great to see for the first time, except the magic show. I missed Michael Jackson this time which was the only one I wanted to see. But from what I did catch of the shows, the entertainment crew does a great job. Chris Blizzard had an awesome show at Excellence and I was disappointed to see that they didn鈥檛 have a show like that at Majestic. As far as the extras鈥?the photographers were out all day and there were a lot of photo ops. The shops were overpriced as usual on the resort, but head down the beach for your cigars and souvenirs and save 80% for the same stuff. Take the water taxi for $5. The disco was the best I鈥檝e been to in the DR, at least for the bar. Mini-bar was adequate although went two days without being stocked (yes our DND sign was off the door). Casino was fun, having Texas Hold-em made it the best so far. Front desk wouldn鈥檛 cash a travelers check in US $, so I just did it at the casino. I played golf one day at La Cana, see my review for more but it was amazing.I would recommend this resort and will return to the DR but probably try a new place because we鈥檝e been enjoying seeing as many resorts as possible.

<Content>Great Value  My wife and I have just returned from a 4 day destination wedding stay at the Majestic Colonial Hotel, Punta Cana, DR. The Majestic is one of many hotels along the southeast coast of the Dominican Republic and it鈥檚 hard to imagine a better deal for the money. Unlimited meals, drinks, and comfortable accommodations, with a 4 poster king size bed and a large Jacuzzi tub, for a little over a hundred dollars per person a day. White sandy beaches with concierge service, 9 bars, 7 restaurants, and a staff devoted to pleasing every guest, it was truly a delight. We knew it was something special when we arrived at the expansive open-air lobby and were greeted by a smiling hostess with a soothing Caribbean drink and a staff member with a refreshing moist wash cloth. Donald, the desk clerk who checked us in, deftly moved us to another room since our originally assigned accommodations were not ready. Paola, the desk clerk who checked us out was equally efficient and easy to work with. The staff members responsible for cleaning our rooms everyday worked extremely hard to make everything spic and span. The swan shaped towel with the orchard petal was a nice touch of class.There were plentiful pools to lounge around, take a quick dip in, engage in water exercises, and to just enjoy ourselves. The towel attendant, Bonito, was especially memorable, as he remembered me when I returned to exchange my towel for my towel card. The bartender at the bar closest to the towel pick up place was our favorite. He greeted everyone with a smile, a quick wit, and a savory drink. We were similarly treated as honored guests down on the beach where the beach concierge, Denny, patrolled the area with expedient conscientiousness. He made sure everyone had an opportunity to order a drink and he was quick to return to his guests with drinks in hand. Although we did not personally take advantage of the Spa or Casino, many of the other wedding guests did and all were impressed with the facilities and fun. There was also a wide range of free activities on the premises, including dance lessons, Spanish lessons, exercise classes, and fitness center. Off-site there was scuba diving and parasailing, among a vast array of other activities. The numerous restaurants provided us with a wide range of food choices. Breakfast was our favorite while dinner at the La Gourmet restaurant was our best nighttime meal. Coincidentally, our hostess at both restaurants was the same person, a testament to how hard working and attentive all of the staff are.Other than a few rough spots on the swim deck and some tennis courts that need an upgrade, there was nothing to fault. The grounds were beautiful, well attended to by an attentive staff, the staff was unfailingly courteous and hard working, and the overall experience was one that will be favorably remembered for years to come.

<Author>annalisaja
<Content>Amazing Resort- Definitely 5 Star Quality! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Majestic Dec. 13-Dec. 19 2007, and were blown away by the beauty of DR's land and water. This really is a 5 star resort with excellent customer service, good food (for an all-inclusive), wonderful rooms, and a great beach. I contacted the hotel prior to leaving and explained that this was our first vacation together and we wanted it to be special. I received no response to my email, and simply thought that the email had gone unheeded. However, when we arrived, they had upgraded us to an ocean view room and had champagne and chocolate waiting for us in the room. Such thoughtfullness!I cannot say it enough - what struck me the most about my DR experience was the staff. The Majestic staff possess the most amazing work ethic! They work tirelessly from sun up to sun down to serve hotel guests. Many do not live in the area, so they work for two - three weeks away from their families at the resort, then travel hours away to go home for a few short days. Be sure to thank them for all that they do and show your appreciation by tipping. Check-in was a breeze. We were greeted with a Majestic (orange dreamscicle) and showed our room. No problems whatsoever with our reservations. During check-in, I'd make reservations for the French restaurant and the Hibachi restaurant. A couple tips:Bring large insulated mugs to hold your cold beverage while you are on the beach. It will save you a bunch of trips to and from the bar. We got 64 oz ones with a lid and straw. That was a little overkill- we felt a little ridiculous and probably looked like MAJOR lushes.Bring a watch- the clock in your room shuts off when you leave it for more than an hour. (it beats having to turn the TV oon anytime you want to know what time it it) Plus, they are not big on clocks in the resort itself.Sign up for the ATV excursion. It was a blast although the peddlers were a bit pushy with their wares, but can you blame them? It is how they make their living. Also, the truck they send to pick you up at the hotel was a little scary. It looked like it was going to fall apart (I'm not exagerating). But, that just made it all the more interesting!The beach is gorgous- so definitely make an effort to one morning watch the sunrise on the beach. We saw it come up on kind of an overcast day, and it was still breathtaking. Women- it is windy, so be sure to bring a plethora of hair ties and hats.Try to learn some Spanish. It is their country after all! Most of the guests are European so some of the staff did not speak a lot of English. But it never posed a problem at all. That's about it. I guess the last bit of advice I can offer is to go into this experience with an open mind. It is an all-inclusive in a tropical setting- there may be a few bumps along the way. But, it is an amazing resort for the price. I'd absolutely reccommend it, and we do plan on returning.

<Content>Loved our vacation at the Majestic Colonial The Majestic Colonial was recom. by my nephew and niece. They were there on their honeymoon 11/07. My husband and I don't particularly like all inclusives but this resort was a pleasant surprise. The grounds were beautiful. The bars (although not all of them were open at the same time) were well stocked and the bartenders were very friendly. The restaurants were the biggest surprise. Atmosphere is nice and it is airconditioned. My suggestion is to go to the beach and get yourself a hut before 10 am. It gets really hot down there so you need to have some place for shade. We just stayed in this room and sprayed cologne to mask the smell.  The casino opens at 4 pm, for slots only. It is a very small casino with two roulette tables, poker tables, slots etc.  The shows at night left a little to be desired. Very high schoolish. Overall the entertainment staff had a tough job, they were up for hours trying to entertain the guests. We have no kids so I cant really say what there is to do for kids. Bring alot of single $1. Even though this was an all inclusive resort, a little tip now an then really goes a long way. The beer on tap is Presidente and the tap lines are very clean, we did not get sick at all. The mixed drinks were good. You can get higher end liquor if you want to pay about $3-$6 for it. You can also order better bottles of wine in any of the restaurants. Look on the carts when you go into the restaurant, you can just sign it to the room. The Sommelier, Christian is really nice and knows his stuff. Whatever you do, get to the airport about 3 hours ahead of time. You will have four lines to work your way through. The first line they will go through your bag. The second, you will go to the airline and get your boarding pass and/or check your bag. Make sure it does not go over 50 lbs, they will charge you. The third line is customs and the fourth line is security. When we were there this past Saturday, there was only one security lane open - it was nuts. There is a Wendy's and pizza place in the airport, you can eat there and get some beer while you wait to board your plane. It is better to get their early and hang out. The overal vacation was really great. This is by far one of the nicest resorts to go to. The locals say this one is the best one to be a guest in.  Have a great time - C  D, New York

The next morning we stopped by guest services to report the problem. They were there to repair it within 45 minutes.My main goal here is to review the food. I鈥檓 not sure what those people were describing, but my guess is that they expect their food to be chewed for them. <Author>Kodabuke
<Content>Amazing Paradise We vacationed at the Majestic May 14-21, 2008. This was my second time at the DR and our experience at the Majestic was absolutely amazing. Contrary to previous reviews, our cab ride to the resort was approximately 45 minutes with a couple of stops, and the cab ride back to the airport was about 30 minutes. Both cabs had the air conditioning cranked up. Be prepared for an interesting ride. Upon arrival, we were greeted with coctails and after about 15 minutes we were on our way to our room. Our room was absolutely amazing. We requested a second floor room on the non-construction side of the resort. Although, we didn't hear the construction the entire trip, I did finally notice people working on the addition the last couple days of our stay. Our room and the entire resort is immaculate. The pools are amazing and the beach is just as beutiful as the pictures on their web page. I'm not sure where the previous reviewer stayed, but our room was actually so cold we needed extra blankets. Also, all the main restaurants are air conditioned as well. There was such a nice breeze the entire week we stayed there, even the open-air bars and restaurants were very comfortable. We didn't notice any more bugs than what you would expect in 90-degree weather. There were no bugs in our room either.I didn't use any bug spray the entire week and I think I may have had two bites on my ankle the entire time.I would suggest making reservations on the first day for the French and Japeneese restaurants. We ate at the steak house, Mexican, Japeneese, and the main buffet (Supremo). We liked the steak house and Japaneese restaurants the best, they were excellent. The buffets for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, have a huge variety and many different options. They have many chefs available at the buffets to cook your food made-to-order, which is my recommendation.We went to several shows, the casino, the disco, and a movie one night. We also walked on the beach one night, which was very nice. The shows are entertaining and the dealers at the casino were a lot of fun (Juan Carla - Pit boss, dealers - Josie, danny, lucy). We also had a lot of fun with the animation team (Jesus, Melvin, Tony). I had an on-going ping pong battle with Jesus and Melvin. We had so much fun!We didn't go on any excursions, but we met people that had fun on several of them. We did go boogie boarding at the beach and snorkeling. We walked down the beach about a mile (to the left of the resort if you are looking at the water) and the waves were 3-5 feet. Again, we had so much fun.The resort also has professional photographers that take amazing pictures. There is no obligation for the shoot, which consists of almost 100 pictures taken all over the resort. You can purchase individual pictures for very reasonable prices (i.e. $10 for 5 X 7) or put them on a CD so you print as many as you want later. I would definitely recommend it. They are located right next to the casino.As you can tell, I would definitely go back to the Majestic!!!!!

<Author>fletchman
<Content>First time in the Dominican, First time at an AI My wife and I, along with another couple, recently visited the Majestic Colonial on a four-night vacation. None of us had ever been to an All-Inclusive (AI) resort before and were unsure of what to expect as far as food, service, and amenities go. It is also important to note that this is our first trip to the Dominican Republic as well. We all read a lot about the Majestic prior to making our vacation arrangements and now we collectively feel that we should pass along our thoughts on the resort. We have put together a detailed review but for those of you looking for a quick take we can start by saying we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We give the Majestic Colonial 4 stars.The Good, The Bad, and The BeautifulAs a group we put together a list of requirements that a resort must have prior to making our reservations. At the top of the list we had good food with multiple A La Carte options, ocean front rooms, nice pool, nice beach with shaded areas to sit, plenty of bar options, and price. I say this because most people travel with the same goal in mind which is, of course, to have wonderful vacation. We had outlined what would lead to a relaxing, memorable, and fun experience in our opinion by coming up with the list I just mentioned. So the question is how did it stack up to our expectations? I will tackle food first because this is important to most travelers, although it is an extremely subjective topic. As a group we agreed that the breakfast buffet was very enjoyable with tons of options. Lunch was the weakest meal with a disappointing lunch buffet at the beach restaurant. We never did go to the main dining hall for lunch so we can not offer any opinion on that. It was disappointing that we were not able to take any food from the restaurant back to the beach, pool, or room. There were also not any other options for lunch besides the main dining area and the beach buffet. Dinner for the most part was very good. We ate at the Japanese Steakhouse, the French restaurant, the Steak restaurant (the beach restaurant), and the main dining room buffet. The order in which they are listed was the groups take on quality from great to OK. The Japanese Steakhouse was very very good. The French restaurant was a pleasant surprise for the four of us. The Steak restaurant was a little disappointing and the dinner buffet is very similar to cafeteria food or a Golden Coral type buffet. If you are interested in the Japanese Steakhouse try to make reservations several days before your arrival. We did not and as a result had to get lucky with a last-minute opening one night. Keep in mind your reservations will only be held for 10 minutes so make sure you are not late to dinner or your table will likely be gone. Overall the food was good and on two occasions it was great. Based on other reviews we had read the four of us were extremely careful about what we ate and drank. Perhaps if we had not worried about that our overall dining experience would have been that much better. They did warn us upon arrival though not to drink the tap water and to limit the amount of Pina Coladas and Coco Loco that we drank at one time because the dairy is not quite what we are use to and can be hard on your stomach. There are also a lot of Europeans that vacation in the D.R. and we noticed that if you are looking for a more lively dinner experience you should make your reservations later in the evening.As far as the rooms go we were pleased with the size and amenities. There was a bit of a mixup with the room type that we had reserved versus what was available upon arrival, but the hotel made everything right in time and put to rest any question we had about the customer service based on reviews we had read. The beds were not the most comfortable but I have slept on a lot worse in other hotels.The pool area was great. The resort does a fantastic job of having activities (aerobics, Spanish lessons, etc.) at the pool throughout the day. The pool bars are easily accessible and the bar tenders are riots. The only disappointing thing about the pool is that it closes at 6pm.The beach area at the Majestic is beautiful. We walked by several other resort beaches and I noticed that the Majestic had a lot more shaded areas to sit in than neighboring beaches did. The water is very nice in front of the resort although it is nowhere near as calm as other islands we have visited. It is important to keep in mind that this resort is on the Atlantic Ocean and as a result when it is windy the water can get a little choppy. There are waiters and waitresses that take drink orders on the beach but it is not a very speedy service. We found it much easier to just make the short walk to the beach bar to get whatever we needed to drink. We also noticed that some AI aficionados brought large thermoses with them that they would have filled at the bar with the drink of their choice. We will certainly keep this in mind next time. They have thermoses and sunscreen available at the Mini-mart but you will pay at least double what you can get it for at home. There is a bit of a game played every morning in 鈥渞eserving鈥?a good spot to sit for the day. Most people take towels and other beach items down first thing in the morning and place them on chairs to reserve a spot. After finding this a little annoying at first I came to the conclusion that it鈥檚 just the way it is. As someone in my group put it you might as well not waste time trying to fight the game since you won鈥檛 beat it. Instead, play it. In the end it all worked out. In conclusion we had a wonderful time. The pros outweighed the cons heavily. There is a lot to do during the day as far as on the resort or off the resort activities go. There is a lot of nightlife with all of the restaurants, bars, shows, and of course the discoteca. There are a lot of non-US visitors in the Dominican Republic and at this resort. This in turn means there are a lot of different cultures coming together in one place. At the resort we never had a problem with this and in fact embraced and enjoyed it. The airport is another story but that has nothing to do with the Majestic. The friendliness and hospitality of the staff was pleasantly surprising. The icing on the cake was that we had fantastic weather in the mid 80s every day. Keeping in mind that this is our only AI experience, we would recommend this resort to friends with some pointers (room type, dinner reservations, the beach game etc) to help them maximize their enjoyment. This vacation was about one-third the price we are used to paying for the other non all-inclusive trips we have taken. While the food may have not been as good as other non-AI properties in the Caribbean, for the price, the atmosphere and beauty was well worth it.

<Content>A+ for Majestic Colonial Overall, I was satisfied with my stay at Majestic Colonial (May 9-May15). The hotel is pretty big, clean rooms, and good service. I did notice there was a longer line at the Check-in desk on the weekends, but there were also more people helping with the check-in process.The beach was clean and beautiful. I didn't find the water on the beach or pool to be too cold; it was warm which is perfect for me. The pool closes pretty early, around 6pm.Our room was in the second building, third floor. It has a partial view of the beach, and a great view of the pool. The room was clean, and is gear more towards couples because of the bathroom situation. It does have a musky smell if you don't have your AC turned on. You won't have a problem if you leave it on at automatic. There was one time early in the morning where there wasn't any water coming out of the faucets, but when I checked again later that evening there was water again. Not sure if it is a daily occurrence since I only have to wake up early just that one time. The bed was not hard, it was not extremely soft, it was in between.The food was okay, it was definitely not authentic. I tasted better, but it was not to the point that it was awful. The service in all the restaurants was good except for the steak house which I find the service to be slow. The drinks were inconsistent, didn't taste really good, and didn't taste like any that I tasted anywhere else. There are shows/performances by the same faces each night, which are nothing to wow about. Also, there was a daily movie at the sports bar. There are chess  checkers, tennis, foosball, ping-ping,  bicycles that are broken. There is a lack of interesting stuff to do, and you would probably get bored in a couple of days. But it was nice just relaxing by the pool if that is what you're looking for. There is a great shopping center located right outside of Majestic Colonial; it's walking distance, and remember to bargain like crazy.

<Author>wench0565
<Content>Great property, still finding its legs in some areas I went to Punta Cana with 11 other people and we had a very nice time. The Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana is a lovely resort, but it needs some refinement in some areas. The property itself is amazing, beautiful and enormous. I never felt anything was overcrowded, not even the beach, which I loved. The pool is sparkling clean, although I did not use it myself as I was addicted to the beach. Some of our friends who went with us stayed by the pool the whole time and loved it. I had a view of the pool and beach from my room, and it never seemed overpoopulated. Also, there's a lot of daily activities by the pool to keep everyone amused. The lobby area is lovely, and there's a nice bar there. We played cards in the lobby a few times at the tables provided and we had good service there. There's also internet access at the hotel in a small library type room in the lobby. It's well air conditioned, and there's books and such there as well. It was $5.00 for 30 minutes of time on the computer, but you have to use it all at once. The beach was lovely and remained clean due to the men walking around with trash bags cleaning up after too many people who thought it was alright to leave their stinky cups in the sand instead of throwing them away in the trash cans provided at the edge of the walkway. We had the pleasure of meeting Denny who took excellent care of us. He brought us drinks quickly and made sure we had palapas available to us when we requested one for the following day. We tried to show up early enough that it wasn't a problem as it does get a little busy later in the day. We love you Denny!! Also, there was a cool Paella barbecue at the beach which was dynamite. The chefs worked through a brief rainstorm and managed to make killer Paella. There were also beach olympics and other activities if you wanted to join in. Just so you know, there's a lot of weddings at this resort. You may see up to three a day. It was kind of fun after a while to see brides marching down the beach. The food was mostly good, with a few exceptions. I will say the buffet was ALWAYS good. I found my new favorite appetizer (little bananas wrapped in bacon). We had breakfast there every morning, and I was never disappointed. We ate dinner there three times, and all three times we were extremely pleased. The service in the buffet was excellent as well. I did not get the name of one of the young ladies who sat us in the mornings, but she was awesome. Always a smile, always working hard. The lunch buffet at the Hispaniola (the giant palapa by the beach) wasn't bad, but it's all open and there were a lot of flies. I ate there only once because of this, but I loved the hamburgers and my friends loved the paninis. At night, the Hispaniola turns into two restaurants, Rodeo Grill and the seafood place. I cannot remember its name. Everyone raved about their steak at the Rodeo Grill, but I was disappointed with my meat skewer, it was overdone. The menus don't elaborate if there's sauce on anything either, so be sure to ask what's on the meat or fish you're ordering. The seafood place wasn't bad, though. We did run into a problem when one of our party didn't want seafood and we had arranged earlier in the day for her to be able to get a steak from the Rodeo Grill (which is in the same structure) so she wouldn't be left out, but the waiters gave us a bit of a problem until one of our party spoke to the manager. In the lobby area/main building is a few more restaurants. Taino's food was good, but the service was not. We waited forever for water that never came and twice I ordered soda that never came. I finally went to the bar myself, and our friend contacted the manager. It was fine after that. We also tried the Le Gourmet, which was very nice. The service was very good, and the food was tasty. I would say Matsuri was the best, however. We made reservations for the hibachi room, and I would totally do that again. The chef and his assistant were fabulous, and we had enormous portions of food. As far as evening entertainment, there were a few options. There is a nightly show, but only a couple were worth going to. I think I am spoiled because I live in a town that provides amazing entertainment. The people who work in the shows at the hotel are busting their butts to do a good job for everyone, but they need more refinement and direction. The show that was the most heavily attended involved audience participation (men vs women), and this may be a better direction for most of the nighlty shows to go, with one or two being for dancing or impersonators. Some of the dancers were amazing, I will say. They did also have movies every night in the sports bar, and I was really glad to see newer titles offered, like Hitman, Next and several others that are recent DVD releases. I know on cruise ships sometimes the titles are a little old, so this was a pleasant surprise. There was also dancing, which was good, but it was a very small venue. A few of my friends went to the casino and seemed to have only one complaint, that some of the dealers were not fully trained to handle the tables well, and there were a couple of misdeals that were not handled properly. The front of the property (in front of the lobby) offers sports courts, a big chess board, pool table, ping pong and a kids area. I really didn't see too much of this as I was busy sleeping at the beach, but I heard from friends that this area was nice. There's also an all night food place here, La B del M, and they had good french fries. One night there were salesmen on the property near the lobby to sell jewelry and such to the hotel guests. There was some nice stuff, but they are a bit agressive, grabbing your arms and pulling you to their booths, etc. Some people don't mind this, but I really don't like this kind of agressive sales tactic. The rooms were extremely spacious. I was in a standard Jr. suite, and it was lovely. It has a huge jacuzzi tub that was fun. I had a nice balcony, and a great view of the pool and beach. The maid for my area was awesome. She was there early every day and did turndown service every night. I was in the #2 building. My friends were on the other side of the property and occasionally had a complaint about the maids not coming by late afternoon to give new towels. I personally never had this issue. The guy who handled the free minibar was really nice too, and he figured out early on that I was only drinking the diet soda out of the bar, and he was sure to give me extra bottles of diet instead of the sugar sodas. There were plenty of channels on the TV, including CNN, BBC, TNT, Cartoon Network, Disney channel, a couple of sports channels, and some international options, Starz, and a few others. I was pleasantly surprised by this as I spent late evenings catching up on the news and watching a bit of a movie. Also, there is a small safe in the room, similar to those you find in many hotels. I liked this little detail. What's a tad odd is the door on the shower and toilet area. They're kind of opaque, so if you're rooming wih someone, this could be a bit of an issue. I loved the shower! I did have continual problems with my toilet the first few days, but when I did call about it, someone was at my room in about five minutes and had it fixed in less than 10. There are excursions offered in the lobby by whatever tour company you go with. I don't know if they provide service to those who book direct through the hotel. We dealt with Georges from HotelBeds/Cosco, and he was really helpful, particulary in giving us info when we first arrived. He also made sure we knew when the shuttle would arrive to take us back to the airport when we left. We had a nice excursion in which we swam with sharks and stingrays. A tip or two: Bring some type of bug spray like Off or Cutter, you'll need it. I was eaten up by bugs the first two days, but then I started using spray and had little trouble. Bring some type of anti-itch cream or spray so if you do get bit, you'll have some relief. Bring sunscreen. The sun is equatorial and brutal. I never burn, but I burned in about fifteen minutes and paid with a lobster red back. There's shade and plenty of palapas to hide under if needed. Bring some type of immodium or other similar medication. A few of our party were drinking the water from the tap or making coffee with water from the tap, and they paid. Wash your toothbrush in bottled water provided in the minibar. Your drinks are fine, however. I drank soda and water all week on ice from the various bars and restaurants and had no problems. Bring lots of one dollar bills. I'm glad I read a prevoius review that said this, and it helped. We all like to tip for good service, and having a lot of ones on hand helped us all put in our fair share at dinner and for Denny on the beach who deserved every penny of it. Don't remove your armband they give you when you check in. It's a 90$ replacement cost. Ugh. Everything is expensive on the property, but they take American money. If you're in a room that butts up to the beach, you may hear the music from any weddng receptions. My friend had a room that faced the beach, and there seemd to be a reception at least two nights in which the music kept her awake. Bring goggles or a mask so when you swim you can see the little fish that hang out right there. Overall it was a very nice trip. The property is wonderful, but a few areas need some polishing. The people were friendly, and they work very very hard every day. The beach is beautiful, the pool spotless, the food very good for the most part. Enjoy your stay if you're going here.

<Author>sunshineNewYork
<Content>No complaints, very good experience I feel I owe this to readers planning their trip since Trip Advisor was so helpful for us. We read some scary food reviews a few weeks prior and thought of switching and are very glad we did not. This is our 4th trip to DR and the best resort so far. We went May 11 thru 16, 2008Just to give you an idea our review is based on the fact that we are in our mid-40s going for a quick 5 nights w/out kids. We really just go to do nothing. We love the sun and only one of us drinks. The beach is one of our favorite and we have been to Jamaica, Mexico, St. John's, Hawaii, etc. and it once again didn't disappoint us. The usual arrival with the $10 per person entry pay for a piece of paper and give it back one minute later. A few stops at other resorts on the way to ours. The room was not ready at 1:30 but we were told to eat and come back. We chose to go book our dinner as suggested on TA. One lady at the desk was telling people the LeGourmet was booked for the whole week. We went over there and got in at 7:30 that night and again on Wed at 6:30 and reserved at Japanese for Tuesday at 8pm - 6:30 was already taken. we asked for 2 there on recommendations that it was real good but only got in once. LeGourmet the first night we both got the shrimp salad, pumpkin soup, chicken and two different desserts. The stuff with the chicken was a little heavy but overall very good meal. The second time we did the tenderloin that was highly recommended and it was better. I also did the other soup - lobster and that was very good. Japanese was a good meal also. We went to the steak house the other two nights and went with the Chaeteaubrind as recommended and that was very good. The second time I tried the meat on skewers and it was covered with bar-b-q sauce and I should have stuck with the tried and true but it was not bad. My husband had the grilled pork chop and that was good he said. Service is good although they don't ask if everything is okay once you get your food!! But it was. It was nice to have proprtioned meals and not buffet. Very nice to see the ocean at the steakhouse. We had no stomach troubles. we don't drink anything but the bottled water. As said, my husband said the wines were eh but they were very prompt to keep the glass full at all times. Same with saki at Japanese. Fried ice cream was good. No dessert on menu at steakhouse but a buffet type to pick from. Overall, we have had way worse at all inclusives and enjoyed going out each night compared to others always needing reservations and having hard time to get them.The room we e-mailed Richard prior but not sure that that helped. We were in Bldg 2 2322 and it was a pool view. The higher the number the closer to getting an ocean view looking to one side. I am a smell person and these rooms had no musty smell. I brought room freshener and febreeze for the bed but did not need any of it. This was a first compared to other places and very pleasing. We did tip one day to see if we'd get flowers but to no avail....only on our arrival. We used the bottle water to brush with always.You can get bottled water at any bar which was real nice compared to plastic cups at other places. Not being a drinker this was a plus for me.We never used the pool but it is like the reviews say. We don't need shade so at the beach we didn't need a hut but did see them reserved early with towels. We go to bake ourselves and never use them. Our tv remote didn't work; we took it before the Michael Jackson show and when we came back there was another one that worked - that was the only thing that we had go wrong!!! Don't know what others complain about. We don't go expecting the hotel to be in charge of our entertainment. We finally went to the MJackson show after all these visits, it was entertaining - had forgotten all of his songs!! But our typical day was breakffast, lay on the beach, clean up dinner and done.The walk to the shopping huts on the beach took about 2 hours round trip w/getting t-shirts. We did do our pictures by one of their photographers on the beach and they do a great job. but it's $10/picture or $10 each pic on a CD. Go thru the pictures and say yes or not to them and then they will negotiate. We had two printed and got a CD with the rest. It does work at home thankfully. We were able to walk in the other direction farther and saw some new resort going in.Overall, we had a wonderful stay and was very pleased with the resort. We would return there. I would recommend Bldgs 2 or 3, getting dinner reservations right away and having a positive attitude!! Oh yeah, the bathroom towels are like sand paper though - the beach towels were softer and after a day in the sun they were rough that would be our one complaint - not bad though. We saw a wedding each day and they seem to take great pride in their weddings. Hope this helps someone - any questions are welcome.

<Content>If you have already booked, lower your expections - if you havn't don't Stayed here in March. I could go on forever and bore you entirely but here are a few brief guidelines.Service: Don't expect any unless you are able to hand out huge tips - and even then it's not guaranteed.Food: Expect the worst and you will receive it. Salads are rehashed over and over. If you know the taste of old oil you will know where I am coming from. They have a hamburger chef for lunch who carries on cooking even though there are already 20 hamburgers ready. Rooms: Yes they do smell and you will get a room overlooking the construction site.Haughty staff: Lots of them especially in the Gourmet restaurant. Just one example, my husband went to apologise that we may be late for our booking 20.30 the hostess pulled a stop watch out pushed it under his nose and said it is now 20.32 and if you are not here by 20.40 your table will be cancelled. YOU HAVE 8 MINUTES Enough said but having made the 20.40 deadline we noticed there were at least 4 tables for two free for the entire evening so there was absolutely no need for this attitude.Pool: Nice pool but you do need to put your towels out. They closed the beach for two days during our stay and instead of bringing the beach stools to the pool they brought in two pool attendants who, (having seen the colour of your money ,at least 5 dollars per stool) would grudgingly assist!Casino: If you like to gamble then you'll go there anyway - but be prepared for the most hostile croupiers you have ever encountered. Order a drink on arrival - it may arrive within the length of your stay. Alternatively go to the bar which is SLIGHTLY quicker. Do not tip. You will receive neither thanks nor recognition.Summary:This was a last minute booking and I will not make the same mistake again. My thoughts were, the carribean is the carribean, but nothing could be further from the truth. We have travelled extensively in this area (Curacao,Aruba, Antigua, Barbados, St. Thomas, St. John's, Barbados) and have never encountered such hostility.If you are unfortunate enough to have already booked here are my suggestions:Book a table at the seafood restaurant and order the shrimp starter.Then order the Chataubriand from the steak restaurant (they will bring it to your table and you will not have to move). This is the best evening out we had in our stay.If you have a complaint go straight to the Managers Desk at Reception - talking to the waiting staff will only result in name calling!As I said in the heading if you havn't already booked - don'tand if you have lower your expectations!

<Author>rcrn70
<Content>Perfect Getaway We just returned last night from The Majestic Colonial Punta Cana, DR. I have been all over the world including the Carribean and found this vacation to be among my top 3 best ever. In preparation I had read many reviews and became frightened by some of them. Well, all of my negative expectations were proved wrong by this fabulous place. My husband and I were able to get away without kids for a change; we were in need of some serious alone time, were looking for total relaxation with no other agenda, no sightseeing or schedule of any sort and we did just that. The resort is very large however it seems as though they have really thought out the layout and paid attention to detail. The staff was very accommodating as we were never told no', that something could not be done. Weeks before arriving I had requested a quiet room close to the ocean and that is exactly what I got. Even with the noisy activities going on you could find a beautiful quiet spot somewhere.The entire resort is very clean. My fears of becoming ill ( and I usually get sick the minute I leave the zipcode) did not materialize as the food was very good, actually better than I expected and the drinks were not weak. I had a policy which I stuck to; no salad, no tap water, no ground beef, I did take ice in my drinks but still did not get sick. The grounds are beautiful, like the garden of eden and the beach, ahh you will not want to leave it. The rooms were very clean, and as for that mildewy odor you read about in other reviews, it is not that bad. It is a humid beach climate and you will smell it on your clothes and items more when you get home and is nothing a bit of washing won't fix. There is security all around the resort, some armed some not and they do not allow stray vendors to wander on and solicit you. There is constuction going on right next door for the new Majestic Elegance and you could see it from my room; I did freak out at first then realized it really isn't that bad, didn't really notice much noise. The pool was great too, very clean. For all of you uptight Americans, (I am one) realize this place is NOT americanized, don't be so picky; you will enjoy this place, it is beautiful, we did not want to leave. Funny because I once said I'd never go to the DR and now I can't wait to go back!! This is an adult vacation and really not for kids although there were some there. Personally I would not bring mine here they would be bored after 1.5 days. In closing, we were very impressed with the resort overall, the staff could not do enough for us and we plan to return in the future.

<Author>Tr4vel4ever
<Content>An awesome time at the Majestic! I only have great things to say about the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana! I stayed there for the second time between May 03 and May 10 2008. Just like the first time, everything was awesome!Beach: The Majestic is located on a pointe, the beach is larger there than in nearby resorts, the sand is white and very fine. Water was turquoise blue and warm and the beach was cleaned daily. Also plenty of pallapas for shade, and activities like beach party and paella party during our stay.Rooms: Great rooms, although looked a bit more used than during my previous stay in July 2006 when the resort had just opened. Not much privacy in rooms as toilet is stall-style (not a full door). Something to keep in mind if travelling with friends. Shower is marble and amazingly big, with telephone head. Note there are no face clothes, so better bring a few if you need them. Beds/pillows are decent. Unfortunately our room was overlooking the construction next door (new adult only Majestic resort to open in October 2008), but I personally do not care much as I only sleep in the room :)Pool: The pool is great, warm and as long as the resort. Of course there's a wet bar, lots of animation around 4-6pm. One drawback is pool closes at 6pm. There are also some jacuzzi type areas in the pool, with jets.Food/Drinks: The food selection is great, everything was delicious! Breakfast buffet is amazing, waffles, crepes, pancakes, eggs, omelets, pastries, fresh breads, smoothies, fresh fruits, a full hot buffet, etc. We had lunch at the beach restaurant everyday, where they have a good variety of food and you can enjoy your meal outside. For dinner there are plenty of options, everything is very tasty especially the French restaurant (gotta try the creme brulee with mamajuana infusion!!!). Seafood and japanese were also great (although the ambience at the tepanyaki isnt the best in my opinion as it is way too bright in there) , steak house was my least favorite but my friends liked it a lot. The drinks were great, especially for happy hour at the lobby bar! Staff - The dominicans are so friendly, always smiling and willing to help! Of course it helps if you try to speak Spanish and tip. I went there with two girlfriends and I cannot count how many times we were told we were beautiful... :) My favorites were Felix at the beach bar, Denny the beach concierge, and Orlando at the Japanese restaurant. The animation crew was also great, getting us moving on the beach in the morning (aerobics, stretching, dance lessons) and at the end of the afternoon at the pool (step, games, etc.) I have to congratulate Reginaldo, Melvin, and Jesus for their energy! Loved dancing with you guys :)Shows - The shows were well prepared and looked very professional, and some were really hilarious! A great way to digest your meal before hitting the disco bar!Discotheque: I made it to the night club every night but the first, and had a blast there! If you like to dance to latin rythms (even if you are not very good at it) go there after the show and dance with the animation crew, they are great. Music is good but could be a little more diversified; they also play a lot of club music you hear in the US. There is also a pool table, and a small casino next door. I am not a fan of casinos but I guess it is big enough to waste some money there if thats your thing :)Clientele: During our stay there were a lot of young people, we made a lot of new friends and got to speak tons of Spanish :) Not too many kids screaming around, which was good for relaxing.Overall: Love the Majestic, for that price you absolutely have to go!

<Author>Tonyaj
<Content>Majestic might be an overstatement This is a bit late but better than never. I know that there have been glowing reviews lately so I hate to be a downer but I wasn't that impressed. Grounds: I will agree without a doubt that the grounds of this resort are beautiful. The beach is great and I never had a problem finding chairs. No one will harass you unless you are bothered by the occasional topless women and children. The pools were great, again with ample chairs and no need to go out at the crack of dawn. Staff worked really hard to keep everyone entertained and were always very friendly and accommodating. If I could stay at the pool or beach and not have to eat or sleep then I would have no complaints. Room: The beds had to be the most uncomfortable that I have every slept on. The room stayed humid so it always felt like everything was damp. We could never get the temperature right so we stayed cold and wet if that even makes sense. I think it's been mentioned before but be sure to bring your own wash cloth because you won't be able to get any without a fight. Not sure what the problem is but it took us a few days to get anything other than a hand or bath towel.Food: I've been to countless all inclusive resorts and the food here had to be the worse. First it was totally ridiculous that for a few hours between lunch and dinner there was no where to eat. Each buffet served the exact same food day after day after day. The restaurants weren't much better and the service was often extremely slow.Overall I would say if you can eat anything and sleep anywhere then this resort will be just fine. For some the shortcomings with the food and room will be justified by the beauty of the grounds- unfortunately I wasn't one of those people. I also didn't like that you couldn't really go anywhere outside the property on your own. We did a few excursions that were fun but there weren't very many options. I was there for 7 nights and after the 3rd night I was feeling a little too confined.

The weather was sunny and hot everday. We had 1 hour of rain our first day and that was it. They also had vendors that came to the hotel one night and set up their tables. Mostly jewlery. I got a nice necklace for $9.The food: We were extra cautious about what we ate and we were fine. My husbad was in heaven.All in all it was a great relaxing vacation. Dont worry about the negative reviews like I did. All the worrying was not worth it. You'll have a great time.

<Author>Farmerica
<Content>A great family getaway Travelers: Six adults ( two seniors) and two children ( agers 6 and 3)This was our second trip to the DR but the first w/ the kids. The trip was booked through Costco travel and we chose this resort because of its all-inclusive package which allowed kids under 12 to stay for free. We flew on American and arived in Punta Cana around 1pm local time. The pkg also included roundtrip transfer, but the shuttle service made stops at three other resorts and so what should have been a 30 minute drive ended up being over an hour which was mildly annoying, but not awful. The entrance to the resort lobby is breathtaking. A very grand and expansive lobby area leading to a descending staircase to an elegant bar and lunge area that leads out to the grounds. The property is beautifully landscaped and despite its size looks and feel comfortably intimate.The staff is professional and welcoming from the moment you step into the lobby. Our check-in took longer than it should have as there was some wrangling over a complimentary upgrade that they could not accommodate at the time. We settled into three first floor garden view jr suites. All rooms have refrigerators that are stocked with drinks daily.The rooms are in thirds. The first third is the bathroom; all marble and tile. There is a large jacuzzi tub, a large shower and a narrow, too small toilet stall. I am not a huge guy, but was not really able to comfortably use the toilet when necessary because of the limited room in the stall. The second third is the bedroom areas which in our room was two full beds and the tv armoire. The other rooms w/out kids had nice four post king beds. The last third was the living room area and had a small couch, table, desk and chair. Beyond that was a nice size patio and small garden yard that faced the outer rim of the property. Again, the landscaping was magnificent and it was a pleasant view.The food at the Majestic was better than the food I experienced on my last DR trip. Great choices at breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would recommend the Supreme buffet for breakfast and the beach grill buffet for lunch. There are two restaraunts that require dinner reservations. We enjoyed the Japanese place and Taino which served traditional dominican fare. The Supreme also served good dinner and service everywhere for every meal was superior and attentive.The Majestic's pool extends from one end of the resort to the other. Plenty of chairs and both sunny and shady spots to lounge. They have daily entertainment by their animation team and people are generally having a relaxed, fun time throughout the day. The kiddie pool was centrally located and perfect for our girls to play in with minimal supervision. The pool does close at 6pm, so there is no night pool noise to contend with if your room is on the pool side. The beach is large and again full of chairs. There is a constant breeze coming in off the ocean and the water is true blue. They also have beach parties and evening programs and dances. We also saw about two weddings a day at the resort, so this appears to be a resort with a good track record for destination events.We did not do any excursions, but I sat thru the presentation for them and only one was over $100; most were between $30-$80 to do. My wife used the spa one day and her massage was $85 for an hour. There's a casino which is really like an oversized arcade, but okay enough for some casual hands of blackjack. They have a strip of shops and stores, a dance club and a theater. There is also a nightly happy hour with live music and the grounds have light fixtures built into the landscape to make it very pleasant to stroll around in the evening. Overall, this was a great vacation. We were a group of eight people ranging from age 3 to 78 and everyone had a fantastic time. We would return anytime.

<Author>sunsoo
<Content>Wonderful hotel! I stayed at the Majestic for 5 nights in April with my family and had a wonderful time. The hotel is as beautiful as everyone says it is, from the rooms to the grounds. Everything was so clean. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Most of them spoke some English so it wasn't too hard to communicate. We stayed in Building #2 on the second floor which I requested beforehand. Our view was of the pool which was beautiful and lit up at night. We spent our days relaxing at the pool or at the beach, basically alternating each day. There were plenty of chairs and umbrellas at both the pool and at the beach. I travel quite a bit and the beach there was one of the nicest I have ever seen and definitely the nicest I've seen in the Caribbean. The weather was great except for 1 day that rained briefly. We were never bored. At night, we usually watched a movie after dinner and then the nightly shows which were not too bad. The entertainment staff was very enthusiastic and energetic. I felt that the drinks were on the weak side so I started asking them for more alcohol and less mixers. I brought a bunch of thermoses to keep the drinks in during the day. These work REALLY well at keeping your drink cold and I would highly recommend bringing one. Plus, they will give you more quantity than the small glasses or cups that the hotel provides. The food was a mixed bag. For breakfast and lunch your only options are the 2 buffets, the main one near the lobby and the one near the beach. The food at each was pretty decent. The main one is bigger and has more options but if you're hanging out by the pool or beach during the day, you may not want to be bothered going there for lunch because you can't walk in with just your swimsuit on like the buffet by the beach. The buffet by the beach was smaller and had less options. Both buffets didn't change their items much from day to day so it's easy to get sick of eating there. At night there are 5 different restaurants and we tried all of them. The best one was the gourmet restaurant which you should make a reservation for as soon as you get there. I am Asian and I would have to say that the Asian restaurant was pretty horrible. The food was bad and the service was also not very good. They even forgot our desserts. We weren't able to get a reservation for the teppanyaki demonstration part so I don't know if that food was any better. The Dominican/Mexican restaurant was mixed. The entrees to order were mostly Mexican dishes and weren't that great. However, they had a small buffet of Dominican dishes which were very good. I would recommend just eating that. The food at the steak place was ok but the service was also not very good. They forgot our appetizers there. And the seafood restaurant was also not great. They burned our lobsters which I did not think was possible. In general, the service at all of the restaurants was pretty slow. They had plenty of staff to bus the tables but not enough people to take orders. I think this was due to the fact that they don't have enough staff who speak English well. Only my father became sick while we were there and he was the only one who did not use bottled water to brush his teeth. Bottled water is plenty available, both at bars and in your free mini-bar in the room so you should definitely use this for teeth brushing and drinking. We also took prophylaxis for malaria as the Punta Cana area is high-risk for malaria and antibiotic prophylaxis is recommended by the CDC. Overall, we had a really nice vacation here and I would recommend it to other people. When I booked it, I found that the cheapest way to go was to book directly through the hotel's website. Other sites, including CheapCaribbean.com, will add on their own fees.

<Content>What a great time we had, can't wait to return. Well, after a week in rehab (Presidente withdrawals, sleep deprived, loss of arm strength from carrying Bubba girl about and overall depression from having to return home from paradise) I ready to write my review. First and foremost I would like to say a special thank you to Richard at the Majestic who worked so hard prior to our arrival and during our stay to make our vacation one of the best we have had in many years. This gentleman is a true asset to the Majestic and if he leaves prior to our rebooking at the Majestic next year I fear I may have to follow him to his next job. Do they have stalking laws in DR??LOL. I love you Richard.Flights to and from PC. We had a 6:50 am flight out of Logan. Got there the usual 2 hours early and breezed through ticket lines and was sitting waiting to board plane within 1/2 hour of arrival to Logan. TSA did check my carryon and wouldn't you know it was my Bubba Keg that caused the commotion. Explained to the TSA personnel the background on Bubba and variety of uses and was on our way. Went American Airlines with stop in Miami on the way there and home. On time or a few minutes early. Only issue I had was the flight attendant on flight down to DR told everyone that there was a $75.00 departure fee from DR. Alot of folks on the flight were shocked to hear this, myself included as all have been saying $20.00 each or nothing as it was included in the specific packages. Long story short in the end we did not pay any fee to leave the country. I'm assuming the cost ($20.00 which others had paid) was included somewhere in our package price. We did however, pay the $10.00 entrance fee into the DR. No biggie. In and out of airport was a breeze at PC. On board the VIP shuttle van within 1/2 hour. Got to PC airport at approx 1:15 pm. sat on the shuttle bus about 20 minutes and was at the hotel at 2:45 p.m. Had to stop 5 times prior to arrival at Majestic. At the Iberostars and Rui hotels. Wild ride between the twist and turns on the main roads and the speed bumps every 50 feet at the hotels I was glad to get to the Majestic. Next time I may opt for the taxi ride from PC airport to Majestic. With no stops you can get there in about a 1/2 hour. Shuttle on the way back to the airport was fine as Majestic was the last pickup prior to driving straight to the airport.Upon arrival to the Majestic was immediately greeted with a cold towel and taken to check in where we received a Majestic cocktail. Sweet but yummie. Before I could ask if Richard was available one of the gentleman went in the back room and then out came Richard who introduced himself and completed our checkin. He escorted us to our room and on the way took us to make reservations for dinners at the Gourmet and Japanese restraurants and explained to us the layout of the hotel. We arrived at our room -1420-Colonial Junior Suite. Room was one of the largest we have ever stayed in at an AI. Had the two sitting areas plus a writing desk and chair . Just as it was pictured in the photos from other folks. It was a corner unit with a balcony and terrace with jacuzzi. The balcony overlooked the hotel next door and did have a not so nice view of the back of what I am assuming a restraurant. But it also had some pretty good views of the ocean. The private terrace which was surrounded with about 3 foot walls overlooked the hotel next door again with ocean on one side and the garden area and building 2 on the opposite. My husband was quite happy with his jacuzzi as most of you may already know from my day by day review when we were there.LOL. The Colonial Junior Suite do allow for free room service. We ordered it on a couple of occasions. Once when we had Oceangirl and her hubby over for a quick bite prior to our Meet and Greet with other TA members and once for breakfast. I was stunned on both occasions with how much food they brought. It was truly more than anyone could eat. Service was quick within 1/2 hour (they tell you it will arrive within 40 minutes). Enjoyed the robes and slippers in the room. Wore the robe alot in the room as we were back in forth in the jacuzzi and the AC worked just dandy. Slippers were great as the floors are all tiled and can be slippery when wet. Balcony had a drying rack attached to the wall this was handy for drying bathing suits (I brought about 10 and I packed 5 for hubby- I used 8 and hubby used 3) Fridge was stocked with sodas, chocalate and of course Presidentes. We were also given a bottle of Johnnie Walker Red Label whiskey and a bottle of Bruggal rum, two bottles of Champagne. Toilet is as described in previous reviews, shower huge and jacuzzi in the room. Never used the jacuzzi in the room always used the terrace jacuzzi. The terrace jacuzzi took about 2 1/2 hours to fill and about 15 minutes to empty. Had hot and cold water out of spicket, so you could warm it us at night which was nice. In the end I would get this category room again or upgrade to the Colonial Suite category as they are in building #2. Already picked the room 2411 or 2412. These two overlook the pool and again corner units.I have to say that one of the main reasons for choosing the Majestic was the pool. It is huge.....and very clean with no overpowering smell of glorine. We did not have any problems finding loungers with umbrella huts for the two of us. Any time we were swimming in the pool we truly felt that the area was ours. It is was not crowded and they were totally booked. There were alot of children there the week we were there but I have to say we did not have any issues with the little ones running about around the pool area (or anywhere for that matter)or being out of control. I must say that the beach was lovely but we did not partake in laying out on the beach. What can I say we are pool people. Though again I will say that there were plenty of loungers and umbrella huts for those who chose to dip their toes in the sand.At night the grounds are lit up beautifully and I personally thought the hotel was more beautiful at night than in the day. Don't get me wrong it very nice during the day, but it's just gives the place more of a romantic feel at night.Service was outstanding. Never waited more than a minute or two for a drink and I never had a problem with anyone filling up my Bubba (20 0z). I actually think that many of the bartenders got a kick out of my Bubba girl dressed in her daily bathing suits. Hubby initially wouldn't bring my dressed Bubba to the bar but after I told him to man up he was fine. LOL. Never had to wait long to be seated for any meals as well. Service was always quick and plates were always cleared in a timely manner. All the folks at the Majestic were friendly and always said hola and smiled. Our maid who cleaned the room was efficient and the room was always well cleaned and decorated with flower pedals and the like.Food-Can I say I liked everything that I ate. No, of course not. But I can say that I had plenty of choices and never, never went away hungry. Hubby said he enjoyed everything that he ate and let me tell you the boy can eat. (All 165lbs of him) Our favorite restaurant was the Japanese (food freshly prepared and a show)and my least favorite was the Gourmet (steak was very tough and very difficult to cut) We enjoyed eating at the steakhouse for lunch. Run in grabbed a quick bite and back out in the sunshine. Loved the chicken no matter how they prepared it and enjoyed the variety cold salads (pasta, rice, green) I brought a pharmacy with me and we never once took a Pepto or Immodium for any stomach issues. We are used to the food as this is our 3rd time to the DR. In my personal opinion the food is the same at all of the AIs in DR its just prepared in a different hotel kitchen. The overall recipes are the same and the food is most likely provided by the same suppliers, We brought our laptop with us and used it everyday. We paid $10.00 a day which I thought was quite fair as again we used it quite frequently (I wrote a daily TA review and hubby checked on things with work) TV and internet are satalite and we only had problems with both when it rained/downpoured. TV had quite a few US stations USA, ESPN, TBS, one major US station, a BBC station, kids cartoon station (which ironically never lost a signal to when it rained-those lucky kids) and there were a few more. Bugs-Hubby and I got one mosquito bite each and we never had to put anything on for the inch. Mine pretty much disappeared in about an hour. We did have one cockeroach in our room and it was found during the rain storm. I think that it came in from under the door from the outside. Unfortunately it was seeking shelter in my room on the bathroom counter when discovered. Hubby took care of it as I fled for the safety of the balcony in the pouring rain. Never saw another bug of any type in our room after that.Animation team- Always friendly and fun. Played a game or two and took a Spanish lesson. Animation team worked hard to involve the guests but were never pushy about it. Shops- Typical souvenirs for the tropics. Bought a few carved wooden animals for the grandson and hubby bought himself yet another carved tiki (Johnnie Big Wood as he likes to refer to them). They have a Harrisons Jewelry store on site. Not a huge selection and of course very pricey. Nice selection of Larimar (Stone specific to DR). They have a cigar shop on site. Cigarettes are $6.00 a pack or $35.00 for a cartoon (Marlboro and Marlboro lights)Can't tell you too much about any mixed drinks. Hubby and I are beer drinkers and pretty much stick to what we know. I did hear that it was hit or miss on the mixed drinks. Some bartenders made an awesome drink and then others didn't even know the proper recipe. Hubby and I meet a bunch of wonderful folks from TA. We had a wonderful time and look forward to returning and bringing friends next year.Some tips....Smile and say Hola to everyone you meet.Start a meet and greet for the hotel you're staying at. A great way to meet those other TA addicts you've been conversing with prior to your trip.Bring plenty of ones to tip the hard working folks that greet you everyday with a smile and great serviceBring plenty of suntan lotion - Sun can be brutal. I also wore my baseball cap everyday. Not only to keep the sun off my face but to hide the bad hair days. Water is very soft and couldn't do a thing with it. Bubba Kegs or your favorite thermal mug are muy importante. Frosty stays frosty and hot stays hot.Pop up laundry hamper. Great to use in room for the dirty clothes. Instead of opening and closing suitcases.Please be careful on the floors when wet. There is tile everywhere and it is slippery when wet. I also found the Gourmet restaurant and Chinese/Japanese floors to be very slippery in my heels. Wood and some other surface not tile in these rooms.A night light would be handy for those late night wanders to the bathroom as it is quite dark in the rooms when the curtins are closed.And finally the most valuable tip. Please do a test on your balcony/terrace doors. Have one member stand in the room and the other outside. Close the door tight and see if the person on the outside can open the slider. Why you may ask?? Well if you are both outside on your terrace in your jacuzzi in your birthday suits and discover that for whatever reason when you closed your slider it locked. You either better had learned to speak the phrase help I've locked myself out of the room and need help or be willing to scale the roof/ledge over to the front door and go knocking on neighbors doors or venture to the lobby in nothing but a smile. For this my friends happened to me. Thankfully, our neighborhood heard my calls for help and called the lobby for assistance. Within 10 minutes security had arrived to let us in and then another 10 minutes someone else came to check in on us. For whatever reason our latch get moving into the locked position everytime we closed the door. Even when we unlocked it prior to closing. From then on after we placed a facecloth in between the slider and the jam. Please PM with any questions and I will be happy to respond. I will be posting some photos shortly, but need my hubbys help for that. Have a great vacation at the Majestic I know we did and will be going back soon.

It is a very romantic setup. Lovely marble everywhere and a king sized bed that I found to be extremely comfortable, no mattress topper needed...slept like a baby the entire time. Maid service was very good. One day I was missing face cloths, not a deal breaker to us like it seems to be for some, but later our maid brought us some. The towels are huge and luxurious....we felt pampered in every way!The food has been the subject of many negative comments but we enjoyed the food very much. The supreme buffet had something for everyone and if you could not find anything, then an all inclusive is not for you. They serve everything from pasta to veggies to fruit to rice...and a carving station each evening for dinner plus pizza each night along with delicious homemade pastries to enjoy. We also ate at the Japanese restaurant, my husband's favorite, my second favorite, and at my favorite, the Mexican/Domincan restaurant. I didn't bother with the mexican food but my husband enjoyed his. I loved the Domincan food, delicious slow roasted pork with bean stew and Domincan rice...sooooo delish! We went twice :)!!!! The beach was gorgeous, as previously reported. My husband brought snorkeling equipment and saw fish, octopus and sea creatures which thrilled him, things I don't want to see, thank you. I swam and swam in the ocean each day and totally enjoyed the water, never looking down to see the creatures I don't care to meet. Just a beautiful beach! I spent time at the pool to be with travelbums because they prefer the pool and it was very nice as pools go. Not a pool person at all but it was very clean. I can't go into detail about it because I really don't know what constitutes a great pool. This was the first time I ever even stepped foot in one in the DR as it seems pointless to me to swim in a pool when nature is so beautiful there...to me, the ocean is the second most precious resource found in the DR, the first being the incredibly humble people.That brings me to my favorite asset the Majestic has...it's employees. As I said, Richard has become a friend. I also must comment on the wait staff...they are incredible. It saddens me that I rarely saw people leave even a dollar as a tip. It is a personal choice but to me, the service being as outstanding as it was definitely deserves a tip. The service at this resort is the best I have ever encountered. Everyone I spoke with agreed. My coffee cup was never less than half full. My plate was always taken away in a timely fashion. My water glass was always full. When I was served a house wine I didn't care for, I was offered another and it was delicious..and I am a wino! If you are looking for personalized service, this is your resort. I also have to mention my new friend, Jenny....the best hostess in Punta Cana, hands down! She gives a whole new meaning to the word welcome. Each morning she greeted my husband and myself with a warm smile and eventually a morning hug....she is a wonderful woman and the Majestic is lucky to have her. Sitting in my seat I watched her as she greeted everyone upon entering the buffet....what an asset she is to the Majestic! I also must mention my friend DENNY, the beach concierge, who was very attentive, always checking to make sure we were hydrated! This guy is something else! He works the beach with real class....this guy is a real professional that makes a great stoli and tonic with just the right amount of fresh squeezed lime...yummmmm! Denny, where are you???????? I miss you! Something that struck me about the employees is the fact that each one that I chatted with commented on how well they are treated by management at the Majestic. That makes me feel good about spending my vacation there. I guess that is probably part of the reason that the service is so excellent there. Happy employees make happy customers......My husband enjoyed the kayaks and had fun playing in the waves each day while I swam and watched him :)As you can tell, we love the Majestic and hope to return when we are able. We would love to even try out the new Majestic Elegance, which is slated to open in the Fall of this year. I am sure it will be every bit as lovely.In closing, I would like to thank everyone who helped me choose this resort as we were undecided which one to chose. Without tripadvisor, we may have never met all of our new friends and stayed at such a magical place...thank you!And thank you Richard, Denny, Jenny and all the wonderful staff at the Majestic for making us feel so special as we celebrated our anniversary! <Content>Best we have ever been to!!! Lets start at the airport....Once you fight off the Porters you have about 25 steps to the buses and taxis so there isnt a need for them. The taxi drivers are a little braver then most but they get you there in a hurry.Once we arrived at the resort (about 30 mins from the airport) we met up with Richard. Richard is one of the front desk managers in charge of guest relations. One of the other trip advisor writers put us in touch with him and it saved us alot of aggrevation. He had our room where we asked for it and everything we needed to know he would answer the questions within a day or so. Everyone at the resort is extremly helpful and curtious. Richard took us for a tour of the resort and explained alot to us which cut down on the getting lost the first day. Our room was amazing.... It was very large and well dressed. The bathroom tub is out in the open but the rest is great. We had our four year old with us, when we got to our room Richard asked if we wanted a brib or a bed for our daughter. We asked for a bed thinking we would get a cot, but to our amazement we got a single bed frame and all. The rest of the room was great. We were on the first floor in room 1148. Which is almost at the beach. It was a long walk to the lobby and main buffet, but for the pool, the beach and beach buffet it was great.The restaurants and buffets..... what can I say... they were GREAT!!! The buffets are huge and have everything from fried food to vegetarian and diet food. The pasta bar was great and in the mornings the egg stations were amazing. The only complaint we had was that one of the restaurants we heard alot about (Le Gourmet) was adults only so we couldnt go there. The Japanese restaurant is a must do... They put on an amazing show for you and it isnt all fish. My wife doesnt eat fish at all and left that place stuffed to the gills.The pool is another part of the resort that I dont really have words for... It is absolutely an amazing site to see a pool that is that big. It took more than 20 minutes to go from one end to the opposite end. The only issue we had with the pool was that there is only one swim up bar and there is only three washrooms the entire length of the pool (behind the towel hut, behind the beach buffet, and in the lower lobby bar area). Other then that we spent alot of time with our lounge chairs in the water along the pools edge enjoying the weather. I suggest you all bring a cooly cup for your drinks so that you dont have to walk to the bar all the time. We brought two 52oz Bubba's and only had to fill them twice a day.We were all extremly happy with this resort. It was one of the biggest resorts we have ever been to, but there is so much to do and see and so much room that it never seems busy. This was the first resort also that we didnt have to search and search for a lounge chair. We always found one almost exactly where we wanted to sit. There is alot of chairs at the pool and the beach so there is always some empty ones. Other then that I dont know what else to say besides we absolutely loved this resort and would definitly go back for another visit, especially when they finish building the Majestic Elegance part of the resort.
