<Author>coldinNH603
<Content>Greatly Exceeded Our Expectations My wife, 2+ year old daughter and I stayed at the Majestic from April 19-26. We were getting a little worried about whether we made the right choice after the string of bad reviews the Majestic was getting. However, all of those worries were quickly erased. The Majestic is a great resort, from its location, to its people, to its services.We had never traveled with our daughter, so most of the worries were rooted in would she like it, would there be enough to do, and would she like the food. While my wife and I had a great time, our daughter had an even better time. For her, the pool was fantastic. It is so large that you can just go on a float tour from end-to-end and she thought that was so much fun. The beach was our afternoon destination and it was great for her too, from the water to building sand castles. Maybe one of my only gripes (and this is also geared to the guests) was the beach could get quite littered with cups, straws, and cigarette butts by the afternoon. There were many other families at the Majestic and our daughter made a lot of friends throughout our stay.As for the food, which was our greatest worry of all, we were simply blown away. We've never been to an all-inclusive, but we've heard the horror story of terrible food. Now, our family really enjoys good food and cooking and the food at the Majestic was very good. We all over ate. We would have breakfast and lunch at the main buffet. Breakfast was amazing and such a great way to start the day. Lunches were very good with new choices all the time. For dinner, we did the buffet twice, the steakhouse twice, the Mexican/Dominican restaurant twice, and seafood place once. None of us can raise one complaint about the meals we had. Our daughter also really enjoyed the food.The Majestic staff were just so friendly. Mercedes, one of the hostesses in the main buffet, was so good to our daughter. Our daughter had to get her daily kiss from Mercedes. Nelson in the seafood restaurant was hoot. He quickly learned our names, gave us fantastic service, and never let our drinks get half empty. Richard invited our family to a private cocktail party to share our Majestic experience with other guests as well as the resorts management. He deserve kudos for making sure everyone has a great time. Thank you Richard for putting us in a great room as we requested in our email. I don't think we could've had a better room (3343), just a few rooms down from the beach with a great view of both the beach and pool.This vacation was for pure relaxation and for our daughter to have a good time. Both of those agendas were accomplished. We did not participate any of the daytime or nighttime entertainment. The nightly entertainment started far too late for us. If you want a great vacation with good price, the Majestic is a fantastic choice. There's a lot to do for everyone and you can make it as fun or relaxing as you'd like. Thanks for the great time we had and we'll always remember it.

<Author>daisy081881
<Content>Our Honeymoon in Paradise Im going to take this step by step to give as accurate a view for those who may be hesitant to come here. First off, let me explain myself. Im picky, hard to please, with a very tempermental stomach. I have hard to reach standards and I also researched and read the reviews on here before going. Allow me to say, it exceeded my expectations in some ways, met them in others, and dissapointed in only a few. Let me also say, for the complainers on here that every trip is what you make of it. If youre cranky at home, then youll be cranky in paradise too.The airport is like a giant tiki hut, open air, you come down stairs straight thru to a little band playing and your baggage being immediate put on the belt. You go through customs and pay your $10 a piece to enter the country. No issues, very easy.The drive to our hotel was eye opening. A true look into a 3rd world country is jarring and made me appreciate everything that much more. It also made me understand their culture, customs and how hard they work for the little they have. Its a bumpy ride, if you get car sick- bring dramamine or put your head down. The hotel- gorgeous, manicured in every direction, the attention to detail is paramount. I never once had a complaint about the cleanliness or beauty of the resort. Native plants all around, palms, just awesome. The pool stretches on forever and is about 4ft all the way through. Chairs can be hard to come by under the palm hut's so reserve a chair in the morning w. your towel or something. We didnt have any issues it wasnt crowded. The beach is pristine, water was warm, lets just say I came back VERY tan. Our room was immediately upgraded to the 4th floor colonial or presidential (one of the 2) but it was awesome! 2 mini bars, big jacuzzi bath tub, the works! Being it was our honeymoon they put a banner on the door, it was so cute! We had champagne when we walked in the room, a bubble bath already made for us with petals everywhere. The chocolate bars in the fridge I loved. There was also complimentary liquor in our room but we arent too big of drinkers. El Presidente is their beer, its kinda like Budweiser. The majestic drink tastes like a creamsickle, the pina coladas were great. Service- Its just hot there so dont complain that things arent frozen solid like we have it here. Lets be real, youre in their country, deal w. it or get a insulated cooler thingy. Everyone we saw there from bellboys to our housekeeper, literally everyone on staff was so nice to us. I speak basic spanish which helped a bit, plus I think it was appreciated by them that I tried to speak some of their language for all the effort they put into learning english. My husband speaks no spanish except for cerveza and hola and he was just fine. Service was awesome, simple as that.Restaurants- We didnt like the seafood restaurant, just our personal opinion. The steakhouse chicken was good, my husband didnt like the chateaubriand. The buffet is always good- if you cant find something there, its your own fault. Omelettes every morning with nutella and crepes and these sugary churros I loved! La Gourmet is fantasic, I had the chicken, my husband had the filet both great! Taino (mexican) was really good, the steak can be overcooked so watch! The teppanyaki (sp?) was also a ton of fun, we had a good group sitting w. us and the food was excellent. All the bars are great... the swim up bar came in handy. Entertainment- for us, it was our honeymoon so the entertainment wasnt first on our list... haha... (again its not broadway its what you make of it!) They had volleyball, dancing, olympic games, etc etc... the animation team was a blast. Water aerobics, although I didnt join in was by far the funniest thing to watch. We didnt go on any excursions so I cant comment, we really stuck to our grounds. The vendors come out for a night and were very nice, you can haggle to about half of what theyre asking for stuff. Be aware for fake silver, amber and their native stone... Harrison's has real jewelry or some vendors have real stuff. Here's my final note, and by all means for those who may have questions we just got back Sunday May 4th so Im able to be reached regarding this, do your best to realize how hard these people work, make the best of everything, realize nothing and no where will ever be perfect but this place can be pretty close. We didnt get sick, we dont know how people could get sick, we had great service, we were nice to everyone and got the same in return. Tip well, its appreciated and its repaid 10x over. Have fun, enjoy it, take tons of sunscreen and lotion!

<Author>PlayNotWork
<Content>Our experience at the Majestic We vacationed in PuntaCana 4/26 鈥?5/3. It was wonderful. I would highly recommend it. We had a nice non-stop flight from BOS to PUJ both ways. Arriving in the PUJ airport was not a big deal. We quickly passed thru customs (paying $10 each) and got our bags. There are porters waiting for you and they are aggressive. I just ignored them considering my bags are on wheels. The bus transfer was easy to find. I booked my travel on-line using Delta Vacations (we flew USAir however, Delta changes their schedules to frequently for my tastes) and it included a round trip transfer. This was thru VIP. In retrospect I would have preferred to take a cab, because you have to share your ride with other people, which means you stop at a few hotels along the way. The ride took about 45 minutes. I would guess we could have done it in 30 but no big deal.For a reference, we booked our travel in Oct 2007 for 2 adults 2 children (17  13). The airfare was about $1800 out of BOS and One double bed room was $2200 for the week (Sat to Sat). This nice thing is you really don鈥檛 need to spend a whole lot more after this.This time of year there were no bugs that bothered us. The temperature is perfect and can actually be cool if the sun is not out but very hot when it is. Arrival at the Majestic went smoothly. I had emailed and called requesting a room in building 2 or 3 but ended up with 1335. I was a little worried but the room was fine. It was fairly close to the beach and we had a nice view of the ocean from our balcony. It was also away from the noise and very quiet at night. The bathroom everyone complains about is not that bad. The tub is totally in the open but the shower and toilet are hidden with frosted glass doors. The shower is large enough to change in if you want to. I am an early riser (7ish) and had no problem what so ever finding a palapa. There are plenty to choose from and seemed to be available until around 9 am. One complaint I had was that the coffee was up near the lobby. There was no coffee available near the beach. I would highly recommend (if you are a coffee drinker) bringing a large insulated coffee mug so you can fill it and return to the beach an still have hot coffee. The little cups they supply were just too small.One little trick people would play was to bring a $3 blow up raft and leave it wedged in between the chairs and the palapa overnight to save there spot. I would then see them roll out around 10 am and grab a front row palapa. The staff does not go around and remove things from the palapas at night. My son and I would walk the beach in the evening and remove all the floats from the palapas (hey you snooze you lose. Get up like the rest of us if you want a front row palapa! I think anybody reading this should do the same).I found the grounds to be beautiful and well kept. I did notice that the resort is new so the grounds are not quite as lush and mature as some of the other resorts, but still very nice. The beach and ocean were great. There is a reef about 100 yards out from the beach and you can see the waves breaking over the reef. This keeps the waves in front of the resort much smaller. This allows for the snorkeling to be great. There is a lot of coral and rocks and fish to be seen. We would bring some bread and feed the fish. The resort next door (to the left facing the beach) does not have the reef, so the waves are bigger and good for body surfing. The beach is enclosed by buoys but snorkeling outside of the buoys could be hazardous since a lot of boats go by especially in the afternoon.The pool is very impressive. I found the temperature of the pool to be very nice. About the same as the ocean. A little chilly for just a second or two and then you are used to it. The pool is huge and long. The depth is about the same thru out. There is a volley ball net that stretches across the pool at the pool bar which kind of forces you to get out of the water and go around.The food was very good. The only breakfast (7 鈥?10) is served in the big buffet up by the lobby. Later (10:30 鈥?12:30) there is a continental breakfast in the restaurant by the beach. I wish that this one was earlier since personally I would prefer just to have a more casual breakfast close by.I found the shows at night to be very entertaining. A little late at night for me (10pm) but a lot of fun. The shows that are just audience participation were not that interesting to me, but the magic show and the Michael Jackson show was great.My favorite bar was the one to the right of the main desk as you enter the resort. This bar had the good booze. Apparently if you are from North America you will get a grey bracelet and it entitles you to the premium liquor. There are also some liquors that are not included like Johnny Walker Black and Green as well as Grey Goose vodka. I would order Bombay Sapphire Gin martini鈥檚 which are included. I loved the way the bartenders would make the drinks. They do a really nice job making a mojito at this bar.We would head to this bar for cocktails before dinner. The area is open air with nice couches and live music on the piano. It was really pleasant to site there and sip you drinks. You could either get one at the bar or wait for the waitress.The pool bar was very convenient. You can swim right up to it and order your drinks. I found it crowed sometimes and hard to get a drink, but all you have to do is get out of the water and go to the other side where there is another bar that was less crowed.The flea market people talk about is about a 40 minute walk to the right down the beach. It鈥檚 a long walk (especially coming back) but I heard some people say you can get a water taxi back (not sure of the price). The shops are fun to see and there are a lot of harmless stray dogs laying around. The stores have your basic souvenir type items like wood statues and shells. They also have cigars and liquor but I have heard you may not get what you think (especially the cigars). They really put the pressure on and you need to haggle since the prices are absurdly high (I heard you should expect to pay 30% - 40% of what is asked). Be careful buying things made of leaves (not sure about wood) because they will be confiscated at the airport when you leave (I watched a lady lose here banana leaf hat).The cigar shop in the lobby wants $35 for a Cuban cigar and $6 for a pack of Marlboros.There are bicycles that you can use (we did not) somewhere on the resort but you can鈥檛 leave the front gate with them. The main lobby does not have change. So bring a lot of ones if you plan on tipping.Beware of your children and alcohol. My daughter is 17 and she had no problem getting served drinks. They do not have different colored bands so its up to the bartender to decide. In closing I would say you definitely cannot go wrong at the Majestic. It is a totally relaxing and beautiful place. If you are thinking of booking or already have, rest easy you will not be disappointed.

<Author>twinms
<Content>family vacation enjoyed by all of us We live south of Boston and stayed at the Majestic Colonial over April school vacation 4/19-26/08. This is our fourth consecutive trip to the D.R, and second to Punta Cana. It was very enjoyable for me, my wife and twin 14 year old boys. This was our sixth all-inclusive vacation and one of our favorites. I must admit, with the rash of bad reviews a few months back, we had some anxiety, but it was completely unsubstanciated.Upon arrival we had no problems with our luggage or ground transportation. Check-in was fast and easy and both rooms were ready. The rooms are very large and clean. We had a king size bed and the boys had two full beds. Beds were firm but very comfortable. Pillows were thin but additional ones readily available. We were 3 rooms apart, on the third floor rooms 2310 and 2313 overlooking the pool. Very nicely located, across from the towel building and a bar, close to both the main buffet as well as the beach. There was a bottle of champagne in our room the first night, sushi and white wine delivered the second night, and a small bottle of rum and scotch left two other days. Very nice touches that were appreciated and enjoyed. The rooms were usually cleaned by early or mid- afternoon and towels often brought separately. We did not find the bathroom layout to be an issue, but if traveling with children and staying in one room, some may elect to change in the shower which is very spacious. Expect occaisional loss of power(very common in the D.R.) If it happens during the night, the a.c needs to be reset before it will come back on, otherwise it is just a matter of resetting the clock radio. Breakfast: main buffet 7-10:00am. excellent selection and quality! fresh eggs, omlets and crepes along with endless bottles of champagne. The beach restaurant also has breakfast available, but pre-made, nothing prepared fresh. There is even a coffee and juice bar set up in the morning for those that prefer their coffee first or do not want to use the in room coffee pot.Lunch : main buffet 12:30-3:00pm again very good selection. always cooking fresh pasta, steak, chicken, pork and fish. Plenty of variety and good quality. Beach buffet good but fewer options. Burgers, fried chicken, french fries and pasta. There was a beach BBQ on Sunday and giant paella on Thursday.Dinner: main buffet 6:30-10:pm. Lots to choose from with something for everyone. We always found the quality and quantity very good.The service was always very good, and language is certainly NOT an issue. If you go the main buffet for lunch and your bathing suit is at all wet, you will not be seated and asked to change. We found this out the hard way.Specialty restarants:Japanese: Very good. Only one plate of sushi per two people. For dinner, everyone gets to try steak, chicken, shrimp and fish.Steak: Outstanding. Soup or salad and steak. Chateaubriand was fantastic. Service exceptional!Chinese: unlimited sushi, which is very good. Main courses average, but certainly NOT authentic.Dominican/Mexican: Appetizes very good, well above average. Main courses good, steak seemed to be the best.Seafood: We all had the seafod bisque and lobster tails which were very good.The service was very good, certainly above average thougouht! Prompt, attentive and friendly. Anything you need or want will be provided by simply asking.The Pool: Absolutely amazing. Huge, clean and very enjoyable.The Beach. Spectacular for walking, lounging or swimming. More coral directly in front of Animation Team activities, better swimming to the right. On the weekend, there were plenty of chairs availble in the shade. However, during the week, we found it necessry to reserve a hut in order to be assured some shade.Bring plenty of sunscreen and reapply frequently. Do not pack in a carry-on bags if larger than 3 oz., or it will get confiscated. We did see a lot of people that were badly burned.The temperature of the water in both the pool and beach were slightly cooler than in the past. Refreshing, but once acclimated, can stay in for a long period if you choose to. It did rain several afternoons for an hour or two. This is typical for late April, early May in DR.Entertainment: Enjoyed the Michael Jackson show and the Circus. The Magic show was boreing and we left. We did not go to any of the audience participation shows.I bought individual Cohiba cigars from a local beach vender for $3/each. My wife and sons went to the local plaza(a 5-7 minute walk) to get a a few things. Don't bother with the vendors that come Thursday evening, more expensive than the gift shop with poorer quality.There were an average of two weddings a day and numerous large groups(10-60). Since we went over April school vacation, there were a big contingency from the northeast and numerous families.When departing, we met a gentleman at the airport who had left his wedding band in the safe in his room, with the door open. He immediately contacted the Majestic, who notified the cleaning people and the ring was found. I thought that was excellent customer service, and reflects the overall care of this resort.In speaking to several different groups from our area, rates did vary slightly depending on which agency you book through so be a educated consumer and compare. Also, if you have ANY special request, I would advise contacting Richard directly through Tripadvisor. You can expect a prompt response, and he will certainly try to accomodate based on availability.For each and every member of our family, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Majestic and would certainly return. For those who have written negative reviews, perhaps they would have been better served eating at a 5 star restaurant, ordering an expensive bottle of wine and then taking in a Broadway performance. Probably would spend the same amount of money, but what would they do the other 6 days and would miss out on the pool and beach. To each his own!I hope this has been helpful and would be certainly willing to answer any specific questions at jamindux@comcast.netRegards, Joe

<Author>hollis4621
<Content>A Beautiful Deal My sister and I stayed at this resort from Apr 26 - May 2, this year, 2008. Oeverall, it was a great experience and we are considering coming back to the Majestic. We still can't believe we stayed at such a beautiful place with such great service for the amount of money we paid. A complete steal. We booked this trip through cheapcaribbean.com.  It takes about 45 minutes to get there from the Punta Cana airport. When we arrived (close to 3pm) our room wasn't ready. I was not happy about this but since we were starving our main priority was to eat. We went to the Supreme, one of the resort's buffet restaurants. We ate there during most of our stay. We tried two other restaurants but the Supreme seemed to have the most options. We did not try the food in the two reservation only restaurants so I can't comment on those. As for the others, the food was okay. We had no food related sicknesses during our trip. I tried a lot of different dishes and found that most were okay and a few were really good. My sister who is a picky eater found the food to be good. I wouldn't come back here if I measured this trip solely based on food but check the other reviews for comments on the two reservation only restaurants (Le Gourmet and Matsuri) because the food their might be really good.  We spent our days going back and forth between the beach (absolutely beautiful clear water and white soft, sand) and the pool. For both the beach and the pool, if you want a chair under a palapa to cover yourself from the sun, I suggest you get their early (between 8 and 8:30) or before you have breakfast, take your towels and leave them on the chairs you want. This way they will be held until you return. We didn't always get there early or leave towels on the chairs and we were still able to find palapa covered seating, it just would take a lil bit of walking back and forth and possibly sitting in an area too far from the water or the bar. I simply cannot express how beautiful the beach is. The photos on their website come close but in person it is something else. The pool which goes up and down the length of the resort is so big that at times you feel like it is your own pool. No matter where you are in the pool there is a bar close-by, not to mention the swim-up bar. All of it is absolutely gorgeous. They have bridges going across the pool at different spots, just beautiful.  The service, whether being given by the front desk attendant, housekeeper, mini-bar refiller, bartenders, waiters/waitresses, managers, porters, security personnel, or towel attendants, is exceptional. You are treated as though you woke up that morning as Queen Elizabeth. My sister and I are a bit shy and like to keep to ourselves. The bartenders/waiters are so friendly that they ask you not only if you are enjoying yourselves but where you are from and so on. They might have spoken to my sister and I more than others because we speak really good Spanish and this would pique their interest as to where we learned to speak the language. So for most people who are not social anxiety-prone this would not be a problem but instead a plus. Even though this turned us off a bit (again for people who don't mind a lil small talk this is no big) we decided that we would still like to come back beacause of the sheer beauty of the resort. Even if you do not have an ocean-view or poolside room, you are still surrounded by such beautiful gardens and fountains. Please remember to tip the staff. They'll give you great service regardless of how you do or don't tip but they are not paid very much, work twelve days in a row with three days off in between, and our tips make all the difference. The great price you will get to stay at this resort should make tipping easier for all.  You will find a lot of Germans, French, and Spaniards visiting this resort. Mainly Europeans with the balance being Canadians and Americans. A lot of families and couples. Not big with the young, single crowd. If you are young and single you are probably going to want to go off the resort for the clubs. Taxis should make this no problem. Otherwise, they have nightly entertainment. A movie at 8pm, a show (usually a performance of some kind) at 10pm and an on the property disco/sportsbar after the performance. The shows are pretty good. Whether it is cheesy/funny or just plain good, you will enjoy it. During the day they also have activities you can participate in led by the animation team.  The only area of major concern for us was that we overheard a guest being asked to sleep at a neighboring resort for one night because they did not have room for him. This was disturbing because the guest had reservations and were there for a wedding but for some reason there was no room. I don't know if this is a common occurrence when vacationing but it happened to them. Even with that knowledge the place is so beautiful and they are so nice, I want to go back as soon as possible.

<Content>Everything but the FOOD!! FIRST IMPRESSION: Great - the cold towel and tropical drink were very welcoming.CHECK-IN: Not impressed. We asked for a room away from construction (which we got), but were told that the room wasn't ready. Interesting, as it was almost 3pm which is check-in time. We were told to have a late lunch at the buffet and come back in about 30 min. Upon returning, the person originally helping us completely ignored us. We ended up being helped by another staff member, but he couldn't find our check-in papers and was running around discombobulated for at least 15min. The original staff member continued to ignore the whole situation. We finally got checked in though, and didn't get bumped to another resort as some others had in previous reviews.ROOM: Majestic Colonial is advertised as a 4-star hotel, but is actually around a 3-star if you are going by US standards. It was nice having a hot tub in the room, but the open bathroom wasn't ideal. It wasn't an issue for my boyfriend and I, but I think that most people prefer privacy when using the toilet.RESORT: Absolutely beautiful and picturesque. They work hard to maintain the grounds and it shows. Pool winds throughout the whole property and the temperature was always perfect. SPA: I got a 1 hr aromatherapy massage for $95 US dollars and it was pretty good. Spa facilities are nice and I think are supposed to be exclusive to guests who pay for spa services, however some kids infiltrated the outdoor spa retreat so we couldn't really relax out there after our treatments. The outdoor space would probably be relaxing otherwise.BEACH: Amazing! As others have commented, plenty of beach chairs for everyone. Each set of beach chairs had a magnificent view of the ocean and it did not feel crowded at all. There was some beach entertainment/activities that could get loud, but if you choose a spot away from that area, it won't be a problem. They also have staff from the bar periodically making rounds on the beach taking drink orders. There was a restaurant with bathrooms about 15 ft from the beach which was very convenient.FOOD: Definitely the downside of our trip. I was apprehensive about the food after reading so many negative reviews. Unfortunately, they are all true. Our dining experience at the Majestic Colonial was less than average AT BEST. The hibachi at the Japanese restaurant was edible but not great. DO NOT EAT A LA CARTE AT THE JAPANESE RESTAURANT!! Unless you are a fan of cheddar cheese sushi and sweet  sour dishes that are just plain SOUR. We took 1 bite and got up and left! Another night, we went to Le Gourmet and did the same thing - the food was horrible! And these are supposed to be the 2 best restaurants, both requiring reservations. On our way to the airport at the end our our trip, a couple in our van said they really enjoyed the Rodeo Steakhouse. My boyfriend and I didn't have the energy to try it after multiple bad experiences at the other restaurants. Looking back, we should have tried it because most reviews had good things to say about it. The only safe bet is the breakfast buffet, so fill up!! It's actually really good. All of that being said, you should take into consideration that my boyfriend and I are from NYC and are very spoiled when it comes to dining. Just lower your expectations and bring a lot of snacks!!ENTERTAINMENT: We enjoyed the live jazz shows every night. The theater shows are just plain corny!! Giant chess was fun, and we had a good time at the casino.CONCLUSION: Beautiful resort. Gorgeous beach. 3-star rooms. Would hesitate to stay here again due to below-average dining.

<Author>Americaine-in-Paris
<Content>Wonderful family resort We had a wonderful time at this all-inclusive resort and would gladly go back. We booked two junior suites, garden view which are the least expensive rooms. We paid $2982 for 7 nights for the two rooms, all meals for the four of us, open bar, and entertainment. The food was ample, delicious and offered sufficient variety that we weren't tired of the selections even after a week. They do say that there is a dress code, especially for the fanciest restaurant at night (which wants men in shirts with a collar and no sandals). As long as you have a shirt and sandals, you are usually fine. Our son got told to change his shirt one evening when he was wearing a skimpy sleeveless shirt. The restaurant farthest from the beach did not serve you in wet bathing suits but the one by the beach would.The rooms were spacious and even had a large jacuzzi tub in the room. The only weird thing is that the bathroom is not physically separated from the bedroom/living area.Hints:- If you want chaise lounge chairs on the beach but under the shade, send a person down to the beach well before 8AM to stake our your claim. You can always move the chair into the sun. It makes a nice time of day to take a brisk walk on the beach before going to the breakfast buffet.- Take advantage of the activities. My two teenaged boys found that they enjoyed both the stretching and aerobics class on the beach in the morning. They both won small bottles of rum (well, I picked up their prize) in games.- Kayaking was easier in the morning before the afternoon wind picked up.- Bring US dollars. You need $10/person for your entry visa and they prefer dollars for any extra purchases (souvenirs, outside trips such as snorkling). Many of the guests were tipping the bartenders but we got good service even though we hadn't brought much cash.- See if you can book your transportation to the resort ahead of time - there was not a queue of taxis waiting to take you to your resort. We found a company that handled Expedia customers and they charged $20/person for the roundtrip transportation (another request for US dollars).- Bring lots of sunblock - it is very expensive to buy there.- There is paying internet access at $5/hour.- There were some bugs that could leave some nasty bites - we only seemed to encounter them at dusk when we sat out on our balcony. Bug spray is good to bring but the bugs still liked my husband.- The evening shows are pretty well done - don't miss the circus program as there are some good aerial acrobats.- If you want a raft, noodle or innertube for floating in the pool or ocean, bring one from home as they are expensive there and there aren't any available at the pool.Definitely a place to enjoy!

The food here is plentiful- lots of choices- You wont go hungry- But nothing was outstanding- The best restaurants were the japanese and the seafood. Everything else is ok- Overall I would say, this is a great resort if you know what to expect. It was a great relaxing vacation, and that was exactly what we were looking for.Hope this helped!

They were well trained though.We are planning to return to Punta Cana again next year and if the price is right again I would return to the Majestic. Although I should mention the beach at the Majestic is not how it looks in the photos...it appears that there is a large point of sand that extends out but in fact it is not there anymore. The beach while we were there had alot of the weeds washed up on it and they were always working to remove it all. I am not sure if the weeds are always there, but apparently the waves had been quite large and powerful to the extent that no one was aloud on the beach for a few days prior to our arrival. We always ended up aways down the beach.Enjoy your time at the Majestic:)

<Author>GAPeachTravelers
<Content>Absolutely Gorgeous! My husband and I recently returned from a 4-night stay at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana. We've been to several all-inclusive resorts previously, but not in the Dominican Republic. Booking online, one can never be too sure, but we were definitely pleased. The hotel is only two years old and is really stunning. It's practically spotless - someone is cleaning, sweeping, washing every minute of the day. Our room was very nice. Tiled floor, roomy with a sitting area, king bed, jakuzzi and balcony. We liked the location of the room because of the view of the pool area and beach, but it could get a little noisy due to the proximity to the activities. We did have issue with the noise of the staff working their way through the hallways with their carts. The halls are concrete - thus no carpet to lessen the noise. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had some self-imposed challenges like lost luggage, forgotten appointments, etc. They were patient and accommodating. Most of the customer facing staff spoke very good English. Others - not so much. In particular, Mr. Angel Perez from Guest Services was very helplful. The landscaping, pools and beaches were incredible. You can walk freely up and down the beach, unlike some other resorts. The beaches were clean with powdery white sand. The pool was incredible - absolutely enormous weaving through the property. Plenty of comfortable lounge chairs - not a need to stake out chairs. Some women do go topless - be prepared if traveling with children. They have plenty of activities to keep you busy from sun up to sun down - you can take advantage of as much or as little of that as you wish. There is a walking track around the property which provides a nice break, too. You do need to wear a wrist-band the entire time. We found the food to be so-so. The buffet near the beach was generally a mystery - serving uncoverd, over cooked food. The buffet in the main building was fine. All in all... beyond the so-so food, the hotel was very, very nice. Very nicely appointed and clean. We would score it an 8 out of 10. Enjoy!

<Author>boxer2
<Content>Felt like a King and a Queen at the Majestic!! This was our third trip to the Domincan and once again it was an absolutely wonderful experience! Last year we stayed at the Bahai next door and thought it was paradise ...however, the Majestic quickly became our favorite Punta Cana resort! We enjoyed every minute from the moment we arrived . We were immediately checked in and personally escorted to our room by Roberto. Roberto pointed out everything as he guided us to our room (2129). We booked a Junior colonial suite which is a swim out room. Our room was so clean, spacious, and we were greeted with champagne, sculpted towels, flowers, rum, Majestic souvenior shirts and caps ....a most romantic and enchanting ambiance! The shower was huge, (the toilet room is small and probably not comfortable for some), there's a jacuzzi tub in the room (and one outside the patio doors) along with beautiful lounge chairs. (We never did see anyone using the outside jacuzzi tubs) Everyday we left a tip for our maid ($5-$10) and gifts. Our room was cleaned every afternoon while we were out and about and we always returned to flowers, sculpted towels, and the second day a fruit and cheese tray.We started every day by going to the fitness center for a couple hours (we both enjoy a good workout...and never felt too guilty over-endulging in the food department!) The gym met our needs with various cardio equipment and free weights as well as several universal pieces. Outside the fitness center were pool tables, a fooseball table, chess, and tennis racket rentals. (There is also a running circuit around the resort approx. 1200m. once around) Since we never completed our workouts until 11:00 we missed out on breakfast which included everything one could possibly desire from fresh omelette stations to fruit, cereal, sausage, bacon, assorted pastries etc,, etc. The pool area of this resort is certainly it's claim to fame in our opinion, although we only spent 2-3 hours a day in this area.(At the Bahai we had to reserve chairs by 6-7 a.m. or go without) At the Majestic we loved that the pool area was never crowded, there were always chairs, and one had their own space...(the pool wraps around the entire resort and is beautiful!) The beach goes for miles and we spent part of each day walking and enjoying the scenery, the sand sculptures, the flea market (a few kilometers past the Bahai and Riu. )There's many activities at the pool to participate in and on the beach. (pool aerobics, kayaks, banana boat rides, para-sailing, snorkling, beach volleyball etc.)We went on two excursions...one which we love is going to the outback for a day. (approx. $90 a person). This year we went on the tour called a Jeep Safari, which was fantastic (although our jeep was misaligned). We visited a sugar plantation, saw the country side and how the people live, a mountain farm (where they produce coffee, cocoa, make coconut oil, etc.) stopped for lunch, some went for a horseback ride (we never do this....the horses just look so forlorn), then to a virgin beach and we were personally escorted to a school, as I'm a teacher and had brought several school supplies. Our second excursion was an afternoon at their Zip Line, and we quite enjoyed ourselves! My husband and a friend also golfed one day at a nearby course. (Resort offered a little tournament...cost $80.00)For lunch we went to the buffet by the beach....and everything we had was good. The main buffet does offer more of a selection and is better with lots of choices.Our evening meals were all fantastic and our service was great...we tipped lots ($2-$5 ind addition to gum, fancy pens, packages of lindor chocolates, tic-tacs) and were served by such gracious and lovely people! The chateaubriand (steak house) as mentioned in almost every review was superb...the lobster (seafood restaurant) was excellent! (These two resaturants are on the beach....during the day it is the beach buffet and in the evening they divide it in half for their evening meals) We also went to the Gourmet (need reservations for this) and it was good...had the chicken...but we preferred the fore mentioned. We didn't make it to the Japanese (need reservations for the show) or Mexican (Dominican) but others indicated it was reallygood too. We went to the buffet a couple times and there are so many choices...I like the pasta station and seafood) The wine is not great, but no big deal...the Majestic drink is great and their rum is so smooth, many love the Presidente (beer).Anyone who complains about the food at this resort needs to stay at home....we've been to many resorts outside of the Dominican and cruises and it completely bewilders us when we read reviews complaining about the food!Evening entertainment begins at 10:00 at their theatre and was most enjoyable....don't miss the Michael Jackson, the circus, or the Legends. We did go to the Bahai one evening and watched their Legends show which was really good too,The Disco...was okay...but we are older so only visited once, and the casino was fun for one evening, with no expecations of winning.Prior to leaving we had hep shots, took malaria pills and dukoral (for traveller's diarrhea and cholera), as preventatives... we also took prescription antibiotics, and antibiotic cream (for bitres eg. sand fleas...I did get two bites just prior to coming home, but never had previously) and we always take immodium, pepto, tums etc...just in case but have never had a problem. We saw only one mosquito...(by my pillow one morning). We will not take malaria next year as it is hard on one's body.If anyone has any questions or would like pictures feel free to contact us...we will definitely return to this resort!! (we also e-mailed Richard prior to arriving and he was most accomodating...an absolutely wonderful man!)

There is also a safe to put all of your valuables in which is especially nice to insure for a stress-free vacay! We had towels turned into swans with hibiscus flowers thru-out the room. We also had a bottle of champagne and two glasses waiting for us on the table. Very nice touches!! The weather was beautiful so we straight away put on our bathing suits and walked literally seconds to the beach. There are PLENTY of places to lounge - a ton of little hut umbrellas to keep you shaded (way more so than the other resorts down the way, actually.) The sand and ocean were absolutely breathtaking. The pool was so well maintained that it was never dirty - the staff sure work hard to keep the resort spotless. It was seriously the nicest pool we have ever seen - 400 metre pool with cute bridges scattered here and there, wide ledges on the side so people can move their loungers onto them. The swim up bar has stools so you can sit and drink if you want to. We found that the more rambunctious crowd hung around there. Though we never saw people completely out of hand and obnoxious which was great. The animation team hang out at the pool and give dance lessons, play drinking games, water balloon games, bingo, aerobics, spanish lessons, etcetc.The bars are FAB - we especially liked the lobby bar and the plaza bar. Actually we went wherever Franklin was bartending at. We definitely have to give it up to Franklin, he was one of the nicest, if not, THEE nicest person we met while staying there. His english could be better but he tried to communicate the best he could which we appreciated a lot. The staff also appreciate it a lot if you speak spanish to them, even just the basics, please if you ask for your drinks or food always say POR FAVOR and GRACIAS. We saw a few people that were just so disrespectful to the bartenders that it made us want to slap some sense into them. These people work so hard to make everyones stay enjoyable and memorable. The least we can do is acknowledge them and treat them with respect. The restaurants were great! Our least favorite was Le Gourmet but we only gave it one chance so it could have just been what we ordered so take that with a grain of salt! Our absolute fave was Taino (the mexican/carribean restaurant.) We ate there 3 nights! The chicken fajitas were SUPERB! So good! We enjoyed a lot of mamajuana and coffee there as well after our meals. The wait staff were so friendly! The japanese restaurant was our second favorite. It's worth reserving for sure. We also booked a snorkeling excursion with Modesto, our sunwing representative, which was AWESOME! They take you out on a catamaran party boat and we guarantee you will love every second of this trip - it was beyond amazingly fun and relaxing! You can swim with sharks and stingrays and feed schools of fish! After the snorkeling they take you to shallow water to chill out in while drinking bevies and dancing to Bob Marley! We had a blast!All in all, our vacation exceded our expectations. It's beyond me how this resort slipped from #1 to #3!! We'd be happy to go back there anytime!

<Author>MomsABeachBum
<Content>GREAT big resort My children ( pre and teens) and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial over Spring Break. The hotel is beautiful and huge.  The grounds are lush,lovely, and well maintained. Several weddings took place during our stay. And I can see why it is such a popular wedding destination.  We booked our hotel and transfer thru Bookit.com and as usual got a terrific deal.  The hotel staff could not be more helpful. When I called to request more towels, we had them within minutes. We tried each restaurant and all were suberb. I have some picky eaters and no one complained at all about the food. The gourmet restaurant was our favourite. If you go the avacado martini is to die for. Every night there was a small appetizer table set up in the walk way. The selection was different every night and there were also different corresponding cocktails offered.  The rooms were quite large and lavish. The pictures you see are accurate. The only problem was that there is really no privacy in the bathroom. It looks lovely with the jacuzzi tub. And it does give the room an open feel. This would be fine for a couple. But we each dressed in the huge shower. Our room was a garden view room. We did have plants and flowering bushes outside our patio. But in reality we looked onto a construction site. We really did not mind because we were not interested in sitting on the patio. The pool is among the largest we had ever seen. This was great for kids and adults alike. The size of the pool and the hotel in general make it difficult to know where your kids are if they want to go from say the beach to the pool alone. The beach was beautiful and well maintained. It is possible to walk from hotel to hotel along the beach. Several bars are located in the pool area and there was someone walking along the beach to get drinks for guests,  The hotel property is huge and very spread out. This could pose a problem if someone has trouble walking. But otherwise it is so lovely no one cares. There is a game area with a pool table, fooze ball and large scale chess set. And a mini castle pool area for smaller children.  There were always fun activities offered and shows each night. We saw a few shows and they were very good. We did not make it to the casino.  We did one tour to swim with sharks and along the coral reef. It was fun excursion and well worth the money.  I will say that the hotel photographers can be a bit pushy in trying to get guests to pose with the different exotic animals. One day a week there is a flea market where local vendors sell their wares. Since there is really no market close by this is a good way to buy local crafts. However, though we thought we had bargained well, we found prices cheaper at the airport.  All and all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Majestic Colonial. And if we are ever in Punta Cana again would not hesitate to stay there again.

We had a true nightmare with the front desk. When we arrived at the hotel it was 4am. We were greated at the steps by the night manager and he told us that the hotel was overbooked and that we would have to stay at another hotel for the night. He assured us that the hotel was very sorry for our inconvenience and that we would be compensated for our troubles. I wasn't really happy about it, but I know that this happens from time to time, and that it would only be for a couple of hours any way. He said the other resort was just around the corner. He had one of the staff drive us to the other resort. When we get there, they say that they know nothing about this but that they'll gladly take us for the night... $185... cash or credit. I told them that I wasn't going to pay, they'll need to arrange payment with the other resort...I already paid for my vacation. The two hotel managers argued on the phone for an hour in spanish and took turns waiting on hold while I got more frustrated. Finally they convinced me that it would just be a deposit, and that when the day shift managers came in, they would sort it all out and that my credit card would be reimbursed. After I put the $185 (per person as it turns out) on my credit card they took us to our room...is was 7am by they time we were in bed. When we woke up, we went to see the front desk to finalize things with the day manager and go back to the Majestic... of course he knew nothing about this. after trying to explain this for half an hour I was so fed up that I just checked out and took a taxi to our resort. They now had a room for us... but here too the manager denied knowing anything about our situation. After speaking with our tour operator, we got $350 back in Cash from the hotel, along with a free late checkout and a 55 massage. Our tour operator also gave us a free excursion work a maximum of $100/person. This is the first time we've been to a resort that was actually full. Usually all the flights are full because of March break, but the resorts still have room. The resort was at full capacity the whole time we where there... although it didn't seem crowded anywhere like other resorts we've been to. The resort itself was beautiful and we really enjoyed our stay.I know it sounds weird to say that we enjoyed ourselves after the ordeal we had to go through... but it was a really nice resort. The rooms were really nice, the pool was huge, the beach is amazing, and the restaurants were above par...I didn't really have any bad meals, and I'm picky.We were checked in, the only thing I have to complain about, is the bar... which isn't a show stopper for me. Getting a drink from the bar was like spinning a roulette wheel... sometimes you got what you ordered, and sometimes you didn't. If you got what you ordered, it probably tasted different then the last time you had it. The beer was consistent. And I know that this is common in Dominican.

<Author>GreyCountygirl
<Content>A great vacation at a lovely resort! February 1, 2008 we returned from a wonderful vacation at Majestic Colonial, Punta Cana Dominican Republic. After having read some of the reviews we were quite worried, but unnecessarily so. Our family of five (three teens) traveled with a large group of 26 (wedding) and all had a great time! Admittedly, some more than others. Vacations are all about attitude. Punta Cana, the Majestic Colonial is a beautiful five star resort. Our family is I believe seasoned travelers, usually staying each year at a different location in Mexico or Costa Rica. This was our first time to the Dominican Republic. No regrets. Being we traveled with a large group we received the group rate which is cheaper than that traveling as a family of five, especially when the teens are paying adult fares. Getting to the resort: The Punta Cana airport was quaint - it is a small airport and it was built to exude Caribbean style with thatch roofs and open ceilings. At the airport, you are aggressively approached by workers who want to help you with your luggage. They live off the tips. A dollar was fine. They do not have their hands out but are visibly sad when you walk away without tipping. I recommend you get one of them to help. The airport is small, but, it is not necessarily well marked. They were helpful finding our tour bus. Be sure to take just one dollar (US) bills with you as they will not give change. I ordered them from the bank as one dollar units. There were some down sides but not of the resort itself. Mainly of its location: nothing is close by. No towns or shopping areas. There is a small Market with very aggressive sales people. (not fun for me but the teens sure enjoyed it) Punta Cana is even a fair drive away. However, that did not stop us from traveling out to swim with the sharks and the sting rays. This was a good days catamaran excursion, but the drinks they serve are VERY WATERED down鈥?snacks were safe. When we were on this catamaran tour and snorkeled by the reef, the waves/ strong water current tuckered us out and we felt we could not get back to the catamaran. The crew was very attentive and swam out to bring us in.The color of the water there is magnificent; the sand is among the nicest you'll find in the Caribbean. We actually had fun feeding the fish right there at the resort: we stuffed bananas in an empty water bottle and while snorkeling slowly squeezed the food out. . . we saw tiger fish, barracudas ecetera. Great time. The water is tough there too, with a strong undercurrent. We are not strong swimmers so calm days were important to us. Even on the stronger days though, we would get gently towed down the beach to the next resort and just walked back. Not really an issue. It did not frighten us or make us feel we were being pulled out to sea. We did take our own snorkel gear too and SANDSHOES as there are rough spots of coral where we were snorkeling by the resort rope water boundaries. The staff are happy and try to please, few understand English, this is the first resort we have been to that the staff were not schooled in the basics of English. 鈥?they do try but progress over the past two years has been poor. . We spoke several times to Raphael before the trip, (from the reservations office) he was very good with his English. He treated us with a great deal of respect and ensured we had an adjoining room with our teens. This was perfect! We met him on arrival and thanked him personally. The rooms are very large and clean. The doors do not have peep holes or safety chains. Our card keys did not work well, we were constantly getting them reprogrammed. Not really an issue as we had five keys so usually one worked to get us in the room. The maids in our rooms were consistently good and did an excellent job in keeping the rooms clean. We did tip a dollar per day. This kept our room fridges full of beer and water. She also left us 鈥渕ucho towels鈥?Being with teens this was great. The bathroom area is not very private and our teens were self conscious with the shower set up. However having read about this in advance, I did take down some string and used an extra blanket to make a temporary wall for privacy. The string tied easily around the pillars by the open room tub. The hotel would do well to set up a permanent privacy curtain that could nicely complement the room and be held back for those that have no issues being open to the entire room and potentially anyone walking by if you forget to close the balcony curtains. We also received champagne, wine and fruits throughout the week. Why one evening we even received sushi! Delicious !!!!! . There was a turn down service for some of our group members. We had the turn down service two nights before leaving. However, part of this included spraying the pillows with a perfume.(We walked into the room when they were doing it.) This caused an allergic reaction for my face. Was not pretty! SO we made sure they did not do it again. The food was similar to most resorts we have been to. We felt there was lots of variety and the main area to eat was clean, bright and many table/seats. Never a problem to locate with a large group. We did not make it to the other restaurants as they booked up quickly after our first day there. We had no regrets eating at the two main restaurants: one by the beach and the other 鈥淭he Supreme鈥?No one in our group got sick. You cannot drink the water from the tap there. Nor use it to brush your teeth. They provide lots of bottled water in the room/fridge. This is not uncommon; we experienced this at other 5 star resorts.The resort is not a high rise (we liked that) but it is big. However we were not displeased with this. There were ample lawn chairs by the pool and beach. We never had a problem locating space for our group. The pool was amazing! Long and winding throughout the middle of the resort. It was not that deep for us non swimmers. We spent many hours having fun in the pool. We did bring our own tube floaters which were a savings as we paid ten dollars Canadian for them and there they sold for more than twenty in the resort 鈥淢ini Mart鈥? Not well populated as in a shady area. Would be a good idea if they put another one at the opposite end of the pool near the main area. There was a bar there but it was not a pool bar. Guests stay in one of four buildings - with construction for an adjacent resort going on by building four. The construction was not noisy but when they did work on it, it was entertaining to watch. We stayed in building three which is joined to four. We had no issues with the construction. Building 1, was a few yards away from another resort, with the view of brightly colored building. The entire area was really quite picture perfect! The only oddity was no birds or insects (other than mosquitoes) Lawns are weedless. <Author>leprechaun25
<Content>Great Time at a Great Place! My family had a great time at Majestic. My mom, stepdad, and 4 brothers all went down for spring break. Myself and brothers age range is 14-26yrs, me being the oldest.The rooms: Very nice, marble floors, jacuzzi tub, large shower, twin sinks, balcony patio with swimsuit drying rack, etc...They could definitely use a de-humidifier to help with the moisture, but it's not horrible. A note on the location of the rooms: We had what I would consider the perfect location, building 2, facing the pool, room # in the mid twenties. But really, the distance isn't more than a 2 minute walk to anything no matter what room you're in, so it's not a big deal, other than to be facing the pool rather than construction or something else. The sliding door to the patio is soundproof, but the door to the hall is not, because there is no threshold or anything to keep the sound out, which is a bit of a problem if you like to sleep in in the morning. Because it's mentioned often, I'll try to describe the bathroom situation more clearly, since I didn't really know what people meant by no privacy. The bathroom is not a separate room. If you walk into the room and turn right, to the right are your sinks, in front of you is a shower and right next to that is your toilet. The shower and toilet both have frosted opaque glass doors with a foot of space above and below the door. To your left is the jacuzzi tub, and just to the left of the tub is the rest of the room. So basically, if you take a loud crap, anyone else in the room is going to hear it. End of story.The Food:We thought it was great. This is probably the one thing in all of the reviews here that varies the most, and it honestly surprises me that it does. Of the 7 restaurants, in my mind it really boils down to 1 place you want to eat every meal: The grand buffet, which supposedly counts as 2 or 3 of the restaurants. There is such a huge variety here that you can't possibly go away hungry because you couldn't find something you like. It serves all 3 meals every day, and includes a wide variety of fresh fruits, cooked vegetables, meats, dessert bar, and has several grilling and pasta stations where they cook something for you. We tried the Gourmet restaurant and were thoroughly unimpressed--10 menu items total and quality was the same as the buffet. The beach buffet has decent food if you don't want to go inside to eat, but the quality is generally much worse compared to the indoor buffet. My best advice is to just go to the indoor buffet every day, try a lot of different things, and eat more of what you like. We were there 7 days and had zero stomach problems, with the exception of my stepdad who had mild issues the last 3 days. Only guess is that it could have been the salad because he eats a lot of that, and that's the only thing my brothers and I didn't eat much of there.The Beach/Pool:Awesome pool. Temperature was perfect in my mind. Maybe that's because I was either playing volleyball or swimming. I'd imagine it might be cool if you sat around and got drunk at the bar in the shade, but if you're in the sun it feels fantastic. The beach was nice, plenty of chairs, and you could go on very very long walks if you wanted. You can even have a bit of fun visiting other all-inclusives and sampling if you catch my drift... The ocean kayaks were fun too, although the current is very strong and I think anyone that isn't in shape would have a bit of trouble.One thing they severely needed: A nice hot tub. The 2 hot tubs are part of the spa and not supposed to be accessed from the pool I don't believe, but they were merely warm tubs with generally no one in them.Entertainment/Gym:The nightly shows were a mixed bag. The michael jackson show is obviously the best, the celeb show is good, as are the perfect couple and circus shows. The magician was a bit weak to me, relying on the same in the box, now gone type of trick one too many times. One thing to keep in mind if you bring young children, the shows start at 10pm and many of them are not intended for children in my opinion, unless you're very comfortable with partial nudity and/or sexual themes.The entertainment team is a lot of fun, and they run the games and classes during the day. If you volunteer for some game you've never heard of, prepare to be embarrassed and required to do some sort of sexy dance as part of it. Their bikini contest was kind of weird though, because the girls were all 16-18 (it was high school spring break, not college) and you got a very distinct pedo vibe from a lot of the old guys gathered around. Not to mention 16 is underage in a lot of countries.The gym was pretty decent. It has free weights for people that know what they're doing, and machines for people who don't. Also plenty of cardio equipment.The DR itself:Seemed very poverty-stricken from what you can see on the way to the resort. A lot of garbage on the side of the roads, roads in incredibly bad shape and seemingly twisting and turning for no reason, etc... Also there is a distinct hustler feeling if you visit any local shops down the beach or the little flea market that gets setup once in a while on the resort. If you actually decide to buy some trinkets or jewelry, be prepared to bargain extremely hard and lowball the hell out of them because a necklace that they initially asked $140 for, ended up with them offering $20 when my brother decided to walk. They will make unreasonable quotes and try to get you to bargain down to something that's still a ripoff.Overall, if you want to relax by the pool and read, walk on the beach, eat good food, workout, and be entertained, you'll have a nice time. If you want 5-star spa service, flawless rooms, and 5-star service, you'll be disappointed. Hope this helps.

<Content>Excellent Vacation ***** My husband and I just got back yesterday from a weeks stay at the Majestic. There were 8 of us that went ranging from the age of 32 to 61. I read a lot of reviews before we went and got nervous. Let me tell you, this place is wonderful. Check in: When we got to the hotel we were greeted with a cool towel and the Majestic drink. Franklin at the front desk was wonderful and got our rooms all on the same floor. We were in the third building on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool. The rooms were excellent and huge. They were very clean. Grounds and Pool: The grounds are beautiful. Very well kept, always sweeping and mopping, picking up other peoples trash. The pool was the best one I have ever seen at any resort. One warning: the chemicals in the pool turned the white in our swimsuits green. But hey when you have a pool as big as this one with as many people in it I guess a clean pool is better than a white suit! We never had problems getting 8 chairs by the pool or beach. The beach was wonderful too.Bars: For those of you who say the drinks are not good or strong enough, you obviously have a drinking problem. I am from Wisconsin originally (and we all know how they drink), and there were many days when several people in our party were a little tipsy! We NEVER had to wait for a drink. Most times we had a new one coming before we were done with the one in our hand. Victor at the pool bar was AWESOME!! Yeah baby!!! We did tip and the employees truly appreciate it. Some people that visit this country are very ignorant and don't realize what these people are getting paid and going home to. Dirt floors, no running water etc. People in this country don't go to school the way students do in the US, so yes their english is not very good. Remember You are in their country, respect them. I suggest taking the Bavaro Runners tour. It was about 80 dollars but well worth it. Gave you a good idea of how people live there. The 4 wheeling tour was also very good. A few in our party did the zip lining and enjoyed it very much. Food: We went to every restaurant (except the Japanese) and found all the food to be good. There are so many restaurants to choose from, if you can't find something you like then you are just too picky. It is critical that you don't drink the water. The water in the restaurants and the ice is okay. Don't use the ice machines. Don't brush your teeth with the tap water. Don't rinse your toothbrush with tap water. Use bottled water. Many people don't use bottled water and they wind up getting sick. We had no problems. It is something you really need to think about. There were several times when I would be brushing my teeth and turn the sink on and think Oh can't do that. The casino is small but very fun. The roulette table was a blast. Yes the dealers made some mistakes that you had to keep an eye out for, but remember, most of these people don't go to school the way we do. The staff at this hotel was great. Very accomodating and always greeted you with a smile. If you want a wonderful, relaxing, and enjoyable vacation, this is the place for you. The worst part of the trip was having to go home. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me! I would be happy to answer. :-)jbirdj2@verizon.net

<Author>Triptronic
<Content>Worth visiting I just spent about a week at this resort (16/3 - 24/3). It is fairly new and the overall condition and appearance of everything - from rooms to restaurants - was very good. The food is decent. Spirits are low quality, although the local rum (Brugal) is very good. I opted for a more expensive room on the top floor to shelter myself from guest noise (door banging, etc.). I think it was a Colonial Junior Suite. It had two outdoor decks, one was very large with an outdoor jacuzzi and plenty of room for relaxing. I went during a holiday/vacation week (both locally in Dominican Republic and for many US schools) so there were a lot of families with younger kids (teenagers) around - to whom the resort caters to just fine. Probably not the best place for singles ages 20-40 as there is little night life, etc. For this you have to grab a taxi and head to one of the local clubs. The staff is typically very friendly, although the reception staff (check-in and check-out) could use some improvement (knowledge about hotel, dealing with guest issues, personalities, etc). I did not have too many issues with them, but witnessed plenty of other people's frustration there. The BEST part of my experience was the entertainment/animation staff. They are great - very friendly and they show geniune enjoyment in their work and interaction with guests. I did not get a chance to meet all of them, but I did have a fair amount of interaction with two in particular - Jesus and Lina. Jesus is typically the MC for daytime events. He speaks English, Spanish and French and is extremely friendly and knowledable so don't hesitate to approach him. Lina leads daily exercise sessions, such as aerobics at both the pool and beach. Her big bright smile and positive attitude make it hard not to join in the activities. You can also find both of them - with some of the other staff - at the resort's disco every night helping those of us less gifted dancers take on salsa dancing, etc. Lina and Jesus get 5 stars from me - thanks for making my stay more enjoyable! Again the other entertainers where great too, I just didn't get a chance to interact with them. Overall I think the resort was a pretty good value. It is big and a little busy for my liking (could have just been the timing of my stay), but I would recommend it to family and friends. I would go back again. I hope someone finds this information helpful. Happy travels!

<Author>newbienovascotian
<Content>Majestic Paradise My husband and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana during the March break, from the 8th to the 15th. The weather was beautiful the entire week. We arrived in the early afternoon and were greeted with the nice, cool towels and the signature Majestic drink. Initially, we had some problems with our room. We requested a quiet room overlooking the pool. What they gave us and most of the Air Canada Vacation travellers was a room in building 4 looking over the construction area. I took my initial request with me, presented it to Richard and Victor. It took about an hour, but we finally got a room in building 2 floor 3 overlooking the quiet end of the pool. You do have to stand your ground with these people. We made our reservations in Sept. of 2007 and we were told the hotel was overbooked! The rest of the week was a piece of heaven. This was our 25th wedding anniversary and our first time visiting the Dominican Republic. Our room was very spacious and always kept spotless. We did not mind the bathroom setup. The huge shower was great! We had wonderful service from our maid. The air conditioning and fan always worked. We had champagne upon our arrival, a fruit plate another night and on our last evening a special anniversary cake. Nice touch folks!The pool was amazing and was always clean. We found the water temperature perfect. It was a wonderful way to cool off from the heat. We spent much of our time at the beach as we enjoy swimming in the warm Caribean waters, walking the wonderful, white sandy beaches and lounging under the papala huts. The food was good. We did begin to tire of the Supreme Buffet by the end of the week. We had excellent meals at the Gourmet restaurant, the Rodeo restaurant (especially the Chateaubriand), the Dominican and Mexican restaurant. I did begin to feel unwell on our last day. It was probably the chicken I had at the Jelly Fish Restaurant after our sunset cruise in Bavaro Beach. All in all, we would return to the Majestic in a flash. The people there are hard workers, they always greet you with Hola and produce a wonderful smile. We did tip and it did make a difference. I guess we had good luck. We're not fussy people and I certainly enjoyed not having to cook, clean or do laundry for a whole week!!

<Author>orangeipodguy
<Content>Loved the Majestic and Animation Team My wife and I along with my two kids aged 11 and 8 just returned from our vacation in Punta Cana in the DR (March 18-25). We stayed at the Majestic Colonial on the third floor overlooking the gardens and ocean. Overall, the stay was magnificent and the people and weather were great! We tend to travel quite a bit and have an appetite and liking for finer accomodations and settings. We thoroughly researched a couple of places and choose the Majestic based on its 5star rating, location, and past reviews. I highly recommend the Majestic and would not hesitate to return back. Here's my snapshot review of the vacation:Room:Comfy, large, and contained two double beds and a cot plus a huge shower. We requested a room with an ocean view and wanted to be on the third floor. The room was clean, the bar was always stocked with water and beer. Neg - beds aren't the most comfortable and the room lacked privacy especially for my wife who has two boys. There's no place to dress after a shower. Tip: Make sure you state you do not want a room facing the construction of the New Majestic Excellence that is getting built next to the resort. We met people who had a room with a construction view - still in the concrete phase - not pretty at all. Request a room facing the interior gardens. All rooms are close walking distance to the beach..unlike some hotels where you have to take the trolley or takes 15 minutes to walk to the beach.Animation Team: Love them, Love them!!! Part of the enjoyment of any travel experience for us are the people who entertain. The Majestic Animation Team was simply so much fun and always ready to entertain and make you laugh! I'll never forget Lina and her non-stop energy, beauty and smile. Rey, Sandy, Jesus, Samuel, Francisco, and Leo were super cool guys and always made us feel special and constantly joked with us lol. We were amazed how much energy they all had beginning early morning until the early hours of the morning at the disco. When you have to say your goodbyes to them and you're holding back a few tears, you know they are special and integral to the success of the resort! Beach:Aside from the rare 15 foot wave that crashed into the beach shore, forced an evacuation of the entire coast line, and caused erosion damage, the beach was simply beautiful! Clear blue water on a slightly slopey and sandy beach that is lined with palm trees made a picture perfect post-card! The beach was closed for the first two days of our vacation so we had to hang out at the pool - kinda got the feeling when a part of North America was blackedout where everyone hung out together at the pool making it a festive atmosphere! On the third day, the beach reopened and was swimmable. Some of the ocean's floor was lined with coral rock making it a bit uncomfortable but many of the tourists were removing them by hand. By the fifth day, there was significanlty less rock on the bottom. Snorklers were pulling out beautiful shells as a result of the wave storm. The Majestic probably had the most loungers and umbrella huts than any other resort on the strip. Tip: if you want a nice location with lounger and umbrella, place your towels upon your late night return from the disco or early morning around 6-7am. Everybody did this and respected people' reservations. Pool - The best pool i ever swam in. It is long, wide, meanders around the resort and spans continously from one end of the hotel to the other. No shortage of loungers, but again, we recommend to reserve your spot early in the morning or else you won't get a spot or umbrellla hut. If you have young kids like us, the entire pool is around 4 feet so we felt comfy letting our boys roam freely. Yes there's a swim up bar with the best bartender that our family likes to call ya baby. Victor was super and always made my boys laugh. It was routine for them to stop at Victors for a non-gasonline (non-alcoholic) pina colada!Food - We ate at the Supreme Buffet - great variety and good quality food. We did kinda get sick of it by day 4-5 because our kids were not into dining at the a la carte restauarants. I'd say its above average with excellent service. Always had hot fresh food stations for breakfast, lunch, and supper. Best chicken i ever tasted, beef is okay, and coffee was super..and i love my Timmys and Starbucks. Again, the staff was super!!! We ate once at the Japanese restauarant and didn't really enjoy it. It appered to have a great selection of sushi if you're into it..we're not. The food we ordered off the menu was kinda blah. I felt like leaving and going to the buffet but it was a nice change of scenary.We often had lunch at the beachside restaurant. Great sandwiches albeit the sandwich guy didnt seem too happy. Never a shortage of burgers, hot dogs, and salads. Nice walk up bar too, especially if you're hanging at the beach and need to cool down. At nigth this restuarant turns into a seafood and steak place. We never had supper there, but we did hear mix reviews, mostly good. There's a super place for late night snacks and munchies located next the nightclub - best burgers and wings (add tobasco and ketchup). A couple of our friends went to the Gourmet Restaurant and were disappointed. If you plan to go, make sure you bring long pants for the guys and kids. Kids under a 12 are not allowed to go hence why we ate mostly at the buffet. The mexican place looked foreign to us so we never ate their either. Despite mixed reviews about the a la cartes..the buffet was great. We really enjoyed the fruit and pastries too!Nightly Entertainment:-Animation team would always open up the shows with audience participation activities. Tons of laugh!!All the shows were way better than we expected. Must see the Michael Jackson and the Music Legend Show - wow!!! After the show, the Animation team would head over to the disco and teach a few dominican line dances...the club tends to empty out quick unless there's a large group of tourists travelling together - in our case there were 65 portuguese students who always made the club looked filled. When they left, the club tended to think out quickly. Many partiers would head over to another nearby club that was10 minutes away. My wife and I enjoyed dancing there, mingling with the Animation team, and others! Good mix of music too. Next to the disco was a casino..small but served the purpose. Exercise and Spa : I used the exercise room regularly. Impressed with it given that most resorts have very small rooms. This one had all the machines and free weights. The guy who worked there provided super service! Neg - the gym had a bit of a musty cabbage like smell...quickly disappated once you were in. Next to the gym was a kids gaming area - had foozball, pool, etc..We never used the spa, but i did inquire because it looked specatacular...if you want a spa vacation, the Majestic has a great one!! We were too burnt to take advantage of it! If you want your hair braided and a temporary tatoo do not, i say do not go to the lady working at the resort by the beach. She originally wanted to charg my wife $30 dollars for 5 braids...my wife talked her down to $20. We later found out, other had their entire hair down for $30-$40. A friend of ours got a temporary tattoo for $10...she wanted $25 for the same one when we inquired. We later walked down the beach and found non-resort workers who did hair and tattoos for a lot less. This lady really rubbed my wife the wrong way.Other: This resort is simply beautiful and looks majestic, especially at night with all the lights and fountains. . It has a grande open air lobby, piano bar, beautiful bars, and outdoor patios. Reminded us of the titanic, espeically the grande staircase in the lobby. Our experience at the Majestic Colonial was super and first class all the way. Everyone worked hard to impress! Service all around was excellent and would 100% return to this beautiful hotel.
