<Author>Ruphus
<Content>Positives outweighed the negatives Our family (my wife and I and our two teenage boys) just returned from a terrific week at the Majestic. We really had a wonderful, relaxing holiday together. We've had previous AI experiences in Mexico (Mayan Riviera) and in Cuba and our time at the Majestic was much, much better than Cuba and at least as good if not better in some ways than in Mexico.The Majestic is a lovely resort with a nice park-like feel. It's well-treed, beautifully-landscaped with an enormous pool that runs nearly the entire length of the resort. We marveled at the beauty of the place.I'll run through some of the pros and the cons of the Majestic from our perspective. First the positives. The staff are great. Almost without exception, we found the people working at the Majestic to be warm, friendly and welcoming. The attitude of the bellman who brought our bags to the room was typical. When I went to help him bring in the suitcases, he said, Let me do the work for you...you're on your vacation! As noted, the physical property is lovely. The pool was great--cool enough to be refreshing but not so cold that you didn't want to spend time in it. Lots of shade around the pool as well. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a great view of the pool and grounds from our third-floor balcony. I would definitely not have wanted to be in any room facing the construction--loud and ugly view. But ours was fine.Overall, we found the food to be quite acceptable. The buffet breakfast was lovely--I had a made-to-order omelet several mornings and fresh squeezed orange juice that was out of this world. The cafe au lait was also great. An unbelievable variety of just about anything you could imagine was available for breakfast. A real highlight. We liked the fact that we could dine in a different restaurant every night--which we did, most without reservations. The first night we ate in the buffet and enjoyed it very much. The second night was Taino--the Mexican/Caribbean-themed restaurant. The third night, we tried the Chinese restaurant, the fourth we ate at Le Gourmet, the fifth at the seafood restaurant (ask for lobster tails that are not overdone!) the sixth at the steakhouse, and the seventh at the Japanese restaurant. All were really good. We had some minor intestinal issues a couple of days--but nothing too serious.Lovely beach--lots of shade if that's what you want but lots of sunny places too. Water sports are fine--we took out a catamaran for an hour. Unfortunately, we couldn't go out very far due to the presence of the reef--but it was fun to go back and forth parallel to the shore.There were a few negatives. Perhaps it's a North American thing, but I didn't like the toilet set-up. It's a real water closet with an opaque glass semi-door that provides little privacy with respect to sights, sounds or smells. The room had a few other quirks--for instance, our shower's drain was not located in the lowest part of the shower floor--and as a result, there was a perpetual pool of water on the shower floor--perhaps contributing to a bit of mustiness in the air.I worked out at the gym the first day--while the place had great equipment, the whole exercise room had a bad smell--like sewage. I didn't want to go back. I was also disappointed that they wouldn't allow my 14 and 16-year-old boys to work out with me--despite a sign saying the age limit was 13! When I pointed that out to the attendant, he said something along the lines that those signs should come down. He seemed to be making up the rules as he went.My son and I signed up for tennis one day--but the guy who was supposed to be manning the place where they give out balls never showed up (after telling me he would). That was a bit annoying. The court we played on was in pretty rough shape.On days that the beach was closed, it was very difficult to get chairs by the pool. We resorted to getting up really early (6:15a.m.) and saving ourselves a good spot by the pool by putting towels out. You hate to have to do that, but if you don't, you end up with no place to sit.There's not a lot to do around the resort. I golfed a couple of times--the tournament on Thursdays at Punta Blanca is a lot of fun as well as a much better deal than golfing there at other times. There's also a little place to go and shop. But other than that, the only other activities are of the paid variety, some of which required a substantial drive. We didn't mind that, however since we mostly enjoyed reading by the pool and walking on the beach. If you need to be active all the time, you may find the Majestic kind of boring.Overall, I'd say the positives outweighed the negatives quite substantially. I think if you go in with a relaxed, flexible attitude, and reasonable expectations you'll have a great time.

<Author>ssl1017
<Content>Outstanding Pool  Returned this week from a glorious vacation at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana. After reading many conflicting opinions about this resort, we were not sure what to expect, but we were delighted and thrilled by our experience. The weather was perfect, and the accommodations very comfortable. We were in a standard junior suite, and my only comment is that the bedding and linens could have been much nicer. The mattress was quite inferior, and the pillows lumpy and most uncomfortable. Sheets were adequate, but not very soft on sunburned skin. There were always plenty of towels, however, and even wash cloths on some days. The shower, however, was fantastic!! Large enough for four people, with great water pressure and water temperature. So maybe one thing makes up for the other. The two restaurants I would recommend are Le Gourmet and Matsuri. Le Gourmet was an island of elegance in the midst of vacation frivolity. Be sure to try the tenderloin and the creme brulee with rum sauce and the meringue dessert with chocolate sauce. Delicious!! The food at Matsuri was delicious and it was a great opportunity to visit with other guests, but neither our chef or his assistant could converse in English, and it was a bit awkward.The most memorable aspect of our trip will surely be the Animation Team- Rey, Leo, Samuel, Lina, Sandy, and Melvin. We saw them from 9am at the pool until after the evening show late at night. They never failed to greet us with hugs and smiles. They encouraged us to engage in pool activities and we looked for them wherever we went! Rey in particular was always genuinely happy to see us, and was always cheerful. Our interaction with these charming gentlemen with always be a very special part of our vacation.

<Author>seniormrs
<Content>Great service overall, but... Just returned from Majestic Colonial resort, Punta Cana. Not having been to the region prior, nor knowing anyone who had, we had no idea what to expect. I believe this contributed to some sense of disappointment with this trip. The grounds are beautiful, the place is immaculately clean. The employees are busy, busy, bees... always cleaning, sweeping, replacing, doing their best to maintain everything and they will do everything to attempt to satisfy your needs. The selling point of the resort seems to be the fact that it is all-inclusive; all one can eat and especially drink.The problem for us was 1) the food was terrible, 'tho there was always great effort to present it attractively, and 2) not being heavy drinkers we found little to do other than lounge by the pool . Because of weather conditions (of course the resort had no control over the storm which kept everyone off the beach for two days) the pool area was quite crowded and short of lounging chairs. Not being near even a small city shopping area we never saw much of the life of the country. We did take the one day trip to the Island for beach and BBQ. This trip was nice, but way too long. It was a 2-hr bus ride to the marina where we boarded a catamaran. Following our time on the beach we had another looong return ride to the hotel. Whew!Families with small children seemed to have a good time with the youngsters being able to plop around the pool; and certainly the hearty drinkers enjoyed the never empty glass of whatever it was they wanted to drink. My advice then, would be to take a good book or two, snag a lounge chair, just relax, read, and drink up. For us, it just wasn't enough.

Looking at a Dominican Republic construction site at a supposedly 5 star hotel is not my idea of a vacation. If you are assigned a room with the number starting with a 4, I recommend that you immediately demand another room. All room numbers starting with 4 face the construction site. They did move us to another room with an excellent view of the pool. Unfortunately, the air conditioner leaked leaving us to walk on wet marble floors every night. Secondly, the power went off 3 times in our room leaving us with no lights or air conditioning and needing to chase hotel staff to get it turned on again.FOOD: The food is average at best. <Author>bctcmaui
<Content>Enjoyed the Majestic We enjoyed our week March 13-20 at the Majestic. We went with 2 other couples, our 2 children 11 and 13, and another 13 year old. The rooms were large and clean. We had 2 doubles, and they put a single bed in the room so our daughters could both have their own beds. ( we did not ask for this, it was done by the resort , and it was a nice surprise) Our beds were made daily by 10:00 am, our towels changed and most days we arrived back to our rooms after the 10:00pm show to find that our towels were again changed for fresh ones. Our mini bar was replenished with water every day, we did not use the pop that was supplied, but expect that would have been replinished. We stayed in Building 3 on the 2nd floor and we were very happy with the location of the room, midway from the lobby area, and the beach area. The food was average. The breakfast buffet had a good choice of food. You could have fresh eggs, omelletes made to your liking, or choose from pancakes,waffles,crepes. There were also a variety of cereals to have, fresh fruit, yogurt. There were cold cuts and cheese, and a variety of sausages, bacon, and other warm items. There were fruit smoothies and juices. Certainly not a problem finding something for every taste!!Lunch in the Buffet was also much of the same. You could have fresh pasta cooked , hambergers cooked. There were potatoes, french fries, vegetables, salad, fish fried chicken, breaded chicken. We tried the Palapa hut for lunch one day and were very disappointed in the variety of food offered. They did have fresh pasta, but not alot of variety in the other choices.Dinners went from average at the Carribean/Mexican Restaurant and the Chinese Restaurant, to very good at the Japenese demostration Dinner and the Gourmet Restaurant. The Rodeo Grill was very good one night, especially the Chateubriand , but the second night we tried the Rodeo the food was not prepared as well. We did not try the Buffet for Dinner. The bars by the pool areas served your basic drinks, and depending on the wait staff were not always made the same. Pool service was on and off, not consistent. We usually swam down to the bar, or walked to one of the 3 bars. When you ask for a Majestic, Daquiri, Pina Colada if you want alcohol make sure you tell them, alot of times they would just give it to you without adding the alcohol, no big deal, just ask.We didn't have to fight for chairs by the pool, there were plenty, even for our party of 9, we never had a problem. The last day we were at the Resort there were very rough waves, the beach area was closed, so the pool area was very crowed and it was hard to get chairs by the pool. But that certainly was not the norm. The Lobby bars were good, both upsatirs and in the area by the Restaurants. There was always music in the square and you could sit and have drinks out there as well.The nightly shows were hit and miss. Some were just fun to watch and others were very cheesy.The pool is very refreshing on a hot day, and never felt crowded because of it's size. Always something going on by the main pool bar area, but there are alot of quite areas that you could just lounge in and not be disturbed. The kids enjoyed boogey boarding and sea kayaking, included in our package. They went banana boating and para Sailing which we paid for at the diving /aqautic center.Overall we had a great time at the Majestic.

<Content>Exceeds Expectations If this resort does not exceed your expectations, what exactly are your expectations? And no, they don't receive top notch service... would you bend over backwards for them, or would you save this for the friendly guests?Anyway, on to my review of the Majestic. I have worked for a number of years in the hospitality industry and have a great appreciation for great service and a great facility, we found both at the Majestic.Upon check-in we were greeted and welcomed to the resort - cold towels were provided to the guys while we checked in... the girls had already made their way to the lobby bar.We were traveling with another couple. Our room was ready when we arrived, our friends room was still being cleaned(we arrived 2 hours before check-in time. This was not a problem, rooms were side by side as requested, we went to lunch and their room was ready afterward.Rooms were very clean, spacious, comfortable, pretty much perfect. I can see the bathroom (glass door at toilet stall) could be an issue for couples that have only been together s short time, it wasn't a problem for us. There is also the opportunity to step out on the balcony for a minute to provide your partner with some privacy. Showers were excellent, big enough for two (wink)Our room was cleaned very well every day and almost always when we were still at the beach. The only exception was one day it was cleaned at about 6pm, but you could see it was a heavy check-in/out day at the resort, so we grabbed a deck of cards and spent some extra time at the pool bar (life is a *itch ain't it).We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. We visited every restaurant except for LeGourmet (our choice, we just couldn't be bothered putting on pants, LOL). There was great selection, the buffet is huge and has multiple pasts stations. This resort knows how to deal with full capacity. It was fully booked the week we were there, yet there were no line ups, no lack of seating, and no lack of service. My wife is a picky eater and had no complaints about the food the entire week. The steak restaurant was definitely my favorite, we went there twice. Last year we stayed at the Punta Cana Princess resort, the food at the Majestic was better and we were not unhappy at the PCP. The Majestic is a much larger resort and has the ability to provide larger variety...Beach / Pool. We are definitely beach people, it is our preference and primary reason for traveling. If you have ever been to Punta Cana, you already know that the beach is fantastic. For the Majestic's section of beach there is one small section where there are a few rocks (this is the ocean remember) it is about 30 metres left of the volleyball net. if it bothers you go to a different section and you will not have a problem. The Majestic'c section of beach is huge, there is a lot of choice in where you decide to throw down your towel.The week we were there it was pretty windy (more then usual for PC) so we ended up pool side a couple of times. The pool really is amazing, how on earth they maintain such a huge pool I have no idea. The water is sparkling clean every day - wow. There was one day we found the water a little nippy, so swam in the ocean instead.The beach chair game.... I can't believe it, we didn't have to play the game. Even though the hotel was full, there were still plenty of chairs/ umbrella's available - even when we didn't get to the beach until 9ish some days. There are literally a ton of chairs and umbrellas, both at the beach and pool. Superb planning.Towels, two locations to refresh your beach towels - one at the beach, one at the pool. I have no clue why anyone would have issue with not being able to get a towel, I guess see comment at the beginning(lol)What more can be said about this hotel? we had a completely problem free stay, not a single complaint, staff were wonderful, shows were pretty good (circus show was our favorite) disco - was pretty good etc etc. Activities staff were excellent, encouraged participation but were not pushy about it, they really seem to enjoy their job.If you stay at this resort and end up frustrated with anything... perhaps it's not the resort at all. Treat people the way you want to be treated, the staff here deals with thousands of guests day in day out, how do you think they will react if your a pain in the [--] to them?We highly recommend the Majestic, Enjoy.Cannot wait to get back to Punta Cana - great vacation.

I brought my laptop and bought internet service for the room ($10. daily) it had its problems but staff were responsive, even having a tech person (Carlos) come to the room to trouble shoot. I went to a yoga class and spanish lessons. Lots of available fun. A great photo opportunity is available with the visiting animals. <Author>funincuba
<Content>Fun family vacation in the sun! We spent a week at the Majestic Colonial with extended family from February 16 to 23rd. We were a group of seven, including two children, aged 3 and 6. Among us, we have travelled in the past few years to Cuba, Mayan Riviera, Barbados, and Jamaica. When we booked the holiday, we were thrilled with the reviews on this site and were getting more concerned in the months before we left.Check-in went well - we were greeted with cool towels and a Majestic drink and two of the three rooms were ready - the third within an hour or so.I e-mailed Richard before we left and we accomodated us with three rooms next to each other and away from the construction. He was on lunch break when we arrived and when I went later to thank him, he was disappointed to not have brought us to the room. He was very helpful with a number of special requests and took care of us right away. Very friendly and professional - thanks Richard.RoomsWe all had champagne in the room on arrival (nice touch). The rooms were large and clean. We had a king size bed and a couch and cot for the kids and there was still plenty of room. None were musty - the tropics are humid. As discussed, the bathrooms were open concept, which was fine for us, but would not suit everyone (and would not be great if you were sick). The rooms were cleaned well (although the times did vary) and we left a tip for the maid with a little gift daily. We never had bugs and maybe one mosquito. The air conditioning worked really well (we had to turn it down daily) - just remember it turns off automatically if your patio door is ajar. The fridge was stocked daily.We did have a pipe come apart under the sink when we first arrived, spilling water over the floor. It took three calls to have it repaired. On the other hand, when our safe would not open and we called, someone was there to fix it in under 10 minutes. This is a big resort.I will try to describe the lay out - There are four rows of rooms running from the lobby to the beach. Each of these building is 3 - 4 stories high and the rooms are numbered with the lower numbers close to the lobby and buffet and the highest numbers (50, 51, etc being oceanfront). Building one looks towards the neighboring resort. The rooms closest to the lobby would likely have been having to listen to the loud theatre from that resort which faces those rooms. Building 2 runs along the pool (and the first floor is the swim-out rooms. We were in 2227 (second floor, half-way down) which was great. This is quite closed to the pool bar and cocktail hour activities, so was a bit noisy in the afternoon. This did not bother us as we were not in the room much during the day and the noise ended promptly at 6pm. Building 3 borders the walkway and is probably the quietest (although the rooms closest to the lobby would be bordering the Majestic theatre). Building 4 faces the construction of the New Majestic next door.There is a fair bit of walking, from beach to room to lobby area. The access from rooms to the lobby and buffet were covered, which was nice when it rained (don't worry if this happens - even when it looked awful, it was sunny and clear within an hour). There were elevators everywhere. It was one of the more accessible resorts that I have been to. GROUNDS AND LOBBYThe lobby and grounds were beautiful. There were always people working on the property. They do appear to use a lot of pesticides and we were a little concerned to not see any wildlife (only one gecko the whole week) and birds in cages. This is our preference though, and I know that if they didn't do this, people would complain about bugs - can't please everyone.POOLWe are more beach people, but this was an unbelievable pool. It was huge and never seemed crowded. There was plenty of spots to have a quiet swim or to hang out by the swim-up bar. The temperature was good for us and the depth was perfect for the kids. The pool was spotless (they must have been cleaning it while I slept). We did notice some of the tiles starting to detach and as others have mentioned, the concrete around the pool was breaking in a few areas - they will be having to do some maintenance.BEACHThe beach was beautiful. The water is clear and blue and warm. Fun waves to play on and the best sand-castle sand I have ever seen. Be careful outside of the roped swimming area - my husband snorkeled around the area and saw lots of spiny sea urchins - just watch your feet. He snorkeled quite a bit from the beach and saw lots of fish (and when he went quite a way out, even a ray!). Boogie boards were fun and if you walk to the left down the beach to the undeveloped area, there is some great body surfing (a bit rough for the kids). Take a walk and enjoy the undeveloped beach - it won't be there long! Although we never had a problem getting each chairs or palapas we did find the beach a bit crowded and as people followed the sun and the tide moved in, people were more in each others space. The constant helicopter tours were a bit annoying, but not the hotel's fault. They could use another bathroom close to the beach - It is a long walk to the restaurant bathroom (especially with two kids who can never coordinate their trips). I would agree with others that they need more soap dispensers and towel holders in the public bathrooms. They were always empty.FOODOverall, the food was fine. You would have to be pretty picky to not find anything to eat. Lunch was the least selection (although we only ever went to the beach restaurant - great view). We were happy to not see fries and hot dogs and burgers at every meal, but others might complain.... Chicken was great, check doneness if they are busy though. Breakfast was awesome. Some dinners at the buffet were better than others - beef was generally overcooked, but there was always good pasta and meats or seafood cooked to order (lamb, salmon, squid and shrimp). We also ate dinner at the Steak (great steak - which was not expected in the Carribean, and pork chops) and we all had good meals at the seafood. Dominican/Mexican was pretty good, but salty. My brother went to the Gourmet, which he said was great and three people went to the Japanese, which they said was just okay. (two of that party got very sick the following day, but cannot say for sure it was the food). It was nice to not hav eto make reservations (especially with the kids), but they were eager to get you moved out at the Steak.... One note - we were traveling with a child with a severe peanut allergy and were very pleased with the response and care at the resort and restaurant. I had e-mailed in advance and Richard prepared small cards for me to show the restaurant staff, explaining the situation simply. He explained the situation to a guest services person who e-mailed the restaurants to advise that there would be a person with a food allergy. The cards were well received (don't ask the wait staff, find the manager or chef in the restaurant). We were very impressed that they consulted the kitchen and carefully brought us around the buffet or walked us through the menu for safe foods. Two managers even introduced themselves to my daughter (age 6) and assured her that they did not want her to get sick - THIS WAS EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE IN OUR EXPERIENCE, EVEN HERE IN CANADA. There were lots of options (we stayed away from desserts as a precaution and brought our own treats).There is lots of water available - they will give you bottles at any bar on request and several in the room. Heed the warnings and don't drink the water and don't brush your teeth with it (can't say this is the cause, but our two sick group members did brush their teeth with tap water). We ate salad and fresh fruit all week and drank drinks with ice and were fine. Do bring some pepto along, in case you get some travelers stomach - I was a bit queasy a couple of days, but nothing unmanageable.ENTERTAINMENTDidn't go to any shows or casino, so can't comment. There was live music on the outdoor patio near the buffet every night which was nice and fun for an after dinner night cap. We went out one night and the lobby bar was busy and social, although I don't think that this would be much of a party resort and wouldn't suit young singles or couples looking for a bar or dancing scene. There are lots of children (including ours), so if this is not something you are comfortable with this might not be the right place for you - there is no adults only section of the resort. That said, despite the number of kids, the Kids Club looked awful and I would not have left my kids there. The castle and water slide looked to be in disrepair (and maybe a bit unsafe). We peeked in when no one was there and the indoor set-up looked better - clean play areas for crafts, games and some videogames (if that is your interest). We saw a few kids at lunch with staff and they seemed to be having fun, but I would not have been comfortable with it. It is at the very front of the resort, away from everything, in the sun and too far from where I would be - but that's me. Lots of stuff to do with the kids anyway on the beach so we had fun. Bring your own beach toys if you can - they will charge you a lot there and its worth it to have the sand toys and a floating chair.SERVICEWe found the staff throughout the resort friendly and helpful and especially great to the children. These people work very hard and are away from their families for close to two weeks at a time at the hotel camp area. Acknowledging their work with a thank you or a hello goes a long way. I notice complaints about language barriers on this site - you are going to a Spanish-speaking country, so people there speak Spanish. (Just a note to one lady I witnessed at a bar - speaking loudly and painfully slowly in English does not equate Spanish or make you more understood!) Invest in a travelers dictionary and/or learn a few key phrases and it will be appreciated and very useful.Sorry to be a bit long-winded, but hope its helpful. Overall a great trip! The resort will have to do some maintenance to keep their rating.  
<Date>Mar 6, 2008

<Content>Majestic Was Great! New HampshireWe stayed at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana from Feb 23to March 1, 2008. As you look out from the lobby to the beach, Building 1 is on your far left, building 2 is also on your left, the pool is in the center, building 3 is on your right, and building 4 is on your far right. Again, ..this is as you look from the Lobby area to the beach. This is important because building 4 is next to the new construction and farthest from the pool, therefore, I would say, the least desirable. Building 2 is the only building with poolside rooms and this is where we stayed. This was the most desirable as you were close to the pool and away from the new construction. The rooms nearest the lobby start with room number 1 as in 2101 (which means building 1, first floor, room one). The room closest to the beach would be room 2150 (building one, first floor, room 50). We stayed in room 2135. This was close to the swim up pool bar and the center for most of the daytime activities. If you want it a little quieter, rooms 2101 to 2125 would suit you. Buildings 3  1 were set up in a similar fashion and would be suitable as well.Also, the pool has a small wall, which divides it. On the side closer to the lobby rooms 2101 thru 2128, that part of the pool was noticeably warmer than the water nearer the pool bar. Food: The food was excellent. At each restaurant we were all very pleased (16 of us), but this obviously is up to personal tastes. The Chateaux Brian at the steak house, the tenderloin at the Gourmet Restaurant (French), and the Fried Lobster at the seafood restaurant were all very good. Some thought the Japanese restaurant was the best (be sure to sign up for this restaurant as soon as you arrive) so again, it is all up to personal tastes. The overall facility is wonderful. Although the resort was full, we all commented that we never felt crowded. There were poolside chairs available throughout the day and the same was true at the beach. A few people got up early to save seats, but this was not as predominant as I have seen at other resorts. The lobby areas were outstanding, including an outdoor patio/bar area with musical entertainment each night.All facilities have minor problems from time to time, a leak, a musty smell鈥tc.. The front desk was very accommodating to make changes, as this was necessary for one couple in our group. The Majestic is a wonderful vacation spot. We would definitely return.You can email me at pmoll2001@yahoo.com if you have any questions.Phil

<Content>Absolutely Majestic I want to start my review with the advice to not believe all the horrible things that you have previously read. We were not, unfortunately, greeted with the Majestic Drink(but i had plenty of those later on to suffice). The bell boy was really nice, as was the concierge and all of the staff that we met along the way. The room was very nice and big, clean, with the nicest shower that was all tiles. The toilet area is a little bit odd and could have had more space, but that was no big deal. We had THE BEST view from our room. We were facing the pool, oh the beautiful pool, and looking right onto the pool bar and all the activites that went on right around the bar. I loved just sitting on my balcony and people watching. I also need to mention that the chambermaids do an excellent job cleaning. They don't just make your bed with your old sheets, they replace your sheets with fresh ones every single day. They also leave some fresh flowers and do cool little designs with your comforters. They were all very sweet and as helpful as they could be.The Pool: No words can effectively describe this pool. They just can't so I won't even try, you can only believe how gorgeous it is if you see in person. Many places to sit and no problem getting a palapa or chair.The Beach: Gorgeous, again no problem getting chairs there either. I am missing my morning dose of Toni Braxton and Lionel Richie during the 10 am hour for stretching! The Food: Really, no complaints. Buffet is fine, plenty of choices for a picky eater. I urge you, eat the mango, I think my roommate and I ate at least 7 on our own. Great manchego cheese as well, if they have any left. Breakfast is the best, I ate enough Bacon for a small army. Crepe's were great, and the staff is so attentive, you feel as if they outnumber the guests 2:1. The restaurants were very good. The Steakhouse is awesome, the Gourmet was good, but we liked Taino, the Domincan/Mexican the best.Entertainement: We didn't really go out at night, but we did catch one show and it was actually really good. The dancers could move, man! During the day there was always something going on, bikini contest, arm wrestling contest, dancing, spanish lessons, scuba! The bars were really nice and there were plenty to choose from. We liked Victor at the pool bar Yeah Babay(exactly how he says it) and we want to extend our special love to our boy Pablo, yummy. One note: Don't try to order any unique drinks because unless Pablo is waiting on you, they won't know how to make it and you can end up with a really different type of drink; I speak from experience.Excursions: I encourage everyone to go on an excursion, and we did go to La Isla Saona, and that was probably the highlight of the trip, it was just so different, and we went to a private island and also were able to see the Dominican country side with the sugar cane fields and the villages.Overall I need to reinforce that some people are just impossible to please, and that's a shame because this resort is nothing less than spectacular. You will love it, we were so sad to leave. But as Francisco once said you have to leave to come back. See you in a minute, Pablo!

<Content>Truly Majestic We just returned from 7 wonderful days at the Majestic Colonial and I am amazed that anyone could give this all-inclusive resort a bad review. Service and staff at this resort is second to none - friendly, courteous, and very acommodating. While we always tip extra for service (on everything) if you didn't I am convinced the service is the same. We just like to share our good fortune and are appreciative of their hard work. The beach is magnificent and lots of palapas available. We spent most of our day there topping the day off by the pool and in our hot tub on the patio (while drinking the Champagne they provided). They also gave us a fruit basket one evening and a bottle of Rum and Scotch another. Nice touch.The food was plentiful (best deserts we have had at any resort in the Caribbean or Mexico). The specilaty restaurants had a limited menu (we liked the Le Gourmet / splurge on the better wines for sale here and Tres Calaberas-Seafood / see Omar for he is the best) but the Supreme Buffet was limitless. Quality was very good and I would rate the food overall as a 4.5. Dreams in Puerto Vallarta had the best food for any all-inclusive we have ever stayed at (been to many). Entertainment was fun (Michael Jackson show, Circus, and and rest of the nightly theme performances) although the sound system could use an adjustment. Casino was adequate (can lose money there as well as any where). Fitness center also was adequate and I enjoyed my daily workouts there. Overall I give the Majestic a 4.8 out of 5. I would highly recommend this place to everyone. I would certaily go back. If you are a happy person whose cup is half full then go to the Majestic Colonial to fill up your glass. They will help make your stay a memorable one. If you are a grouch, stay on your couch, for no one can make you happy. ENJOY...........

Had he gone out at 10am or at 2pm the prevailing winds are less intense... and again... careful with the amount of free drinks before heading out on the water.I could go on but all I can say is: five star. <Author>Ray-50
<Content>Terrific Time at the Majestic Our family stayed at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana Resort President鈥檚 week 2008 (Feb. 16th to the 23rd). When I was looking for place a year ago, this site鈥檚 travelers gave it very high ratings. We travel a great deal and I use this site extensively when selecting places to stay on business and vacation. Just before we left I made the mistake of checking again. It was a big mistake! Some of the reviews were very negative. My reservation was booked and I couldn鈥檛 make a switch at that point. I鈥檓 glad I couldn鈥檛. The resort was wonderful. We鈥檝e been to about a dozen all inclusive resorts throughout the Caribbean and would rate this one in the top ten percent. There are pros and cons to every resort and I鈥檒l try to break them down for you here. There aren鈥檛 too many negatives though.The resort is about a half hour from the airport. We don鈥檛 like getting pre-paid transfers and travelling on a bus or in a van with a large group. We like the convenience of taking a taxi and the individual attention that goes along with it. As with most Caribbean airports, you need to get past the porters that attempt to steer you to a taxi for a gratuity. We passed these guys and found a large group of taxis about fifty yards from where we exited the baggage claim. The taxi fare to the resort was $35 before the tip. When we arrived we were greeted by the friendly bellmen that took care of our bags and got us on line for the check in process. They also gave us a cold moist towel to clean up with. A young lady handed us a frozen pink cocktail called appropriately called a Majestic. The check in took longer than I鈥檇 like, but not inordinately longer than what we鈥檝e previously experienced in the Caribbean. Our rooms were ready and we got the same category and location that we requested. (I called a week before we left to confirm.) We had two adjoining oceanfront suites on the third floor of building two. (Rooms 2351 and 2352) The suites were very large and had huge terraces with outdoor Jacuzzis. If you don鈥檛 get the top floor, you will be paying the same price but getting a smaller balcony with a less appealing view of the ocean. There was another Jacuzzi inside the room as well. The shower was large and tiled in marble. There was always plenty of hot water. The commode is in a tiny 鈥渃loset鈥?next to the double sinks. There鈥檚 also a telephone in the closet which I wouldn鈥檛 want to handle. If you鈥檙e a large person, I could see how this could be a little uncomfortable. Housekeeping did a nice job of keeping the place clean. I usually tip them when I arrive. I don鈥檛 think it made a difference. Our package included room service. Each night we would order some appetizers prior to going out for dinner. We usually got the sushi platter and a salad. It comes on regular china with linen. The only problem is getting them to take away the dishes when you鈥檙e done. There鈥檚 a small cabinet that opens to the hallway that you鈥檙e supposed to put the dishes in, but nobody comes to pick the stuff up unless you make a call. We ended up leaving it on the table, and I guess housekeeping took care of it. The room refrigerator gets restocked every day with water, beer and soda. We had espresso machines in our rooms that we put to good use. The beach is very nice. The water is clear, unlike the north shore of the Dominican Republic at Puerta Plata. There鈥檚 a reef about a hundred yards offshore where there鈥檚 a steady break. If you walk about ten minutes to the left of the resort, there鈥檚 some nice surf that鈥檚 adequate for boogie boarding and body surfing. We went scuba diving one day at a site called 鈥淧atata鈥? It was okay, not great. Not much coral or large fish. The day we went there was a strong surge. We always have a great time anyway. We had a very friendly and accommodating dive master named Angel. He works for the Mariana water sports company. They seem to have a monopoly on the water sports in that area. They have three Hobie Cats, boogie boards and one and two man kayaks. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair on the beach. If you arrive late though you might find it difficult to find a Palapas for shade.The pool is really large and clean. There are plenty of lounge chairs here as well. As was written in other reviews, we did find the water a little cool, but not too much so. The Animation Team was very friendly and fun. They weren鈥檛 too pushy as in other places. They have regularly scheduled events throughout the day.The restaurants were fine. There are six of them. We found that the best of the lot was the steak house on the beach. It鈥檚 attached to the seafood restaurant which is on the other side of the same dining room. We really like Mexican food and were a little disappointed with the food at their restaurant. The people that work at all the restaurants work very hard to please you. If you want to eat at the Japanese restaurant, you need to make a reservation as soon as you arrive. We waited until the second day to find that they were completely booked for the whole week of our stay. As I previously mentioned though, we got room service most nights and got the sushi platter delivered to the room. The main buffet restaurant had the most seating and the greatest variety of food. The only drawback is that if your room is near the beach, it鈥檚 about a five minute walk to the lobby area where this restaurant is, and that鈥檚 where you have to go for breakfast.The liquor was fine. Presidente is the beer on the island and tastes great. If you鈥檙e on the superior plan, as we were, you can get Johnny Walker scotch and Absolute vodka. The local rum was fine and is called Brugal.They give you a casino credit of $25 per room.We took a walk out to the shopping area near the front gate just outside the property boundary. It wasn鈥檛 worth the walk. We didn鈥檛 take the ATV excursion, but had planned on it when we arrived. There are tour operators set up in the lobby. Beware of these people. We were quoted a price in the morning for the ATV excursion. When we came back in the afternoon to take the trip, the price increased by fifty percent. When I reminded them that I was there earlier, they just stated that I must have misunderstood them the first time. The sales people became angry with us for suggesting that they were mistaken. Obviously they work on commission, but could have used some lessons in public relations. They then carried on loudly in Spanish making us feel very uncomfortable. I understand a little Spanish and what they were saying was not flattering. There are plenty of tour operators up and down the beach and I had no trouble finding friendly people elsewhere to book the same tour for the lesser price.The gym is adequately equipped with treadmills, elliptical machines, Stairmasters, free weights and a universal machine.All in all we had a great time and would recommend this resort to others that are planning on visiting the Dominican Republic.

<Author>jobyone1
<Content>A fair stay at the Majestic.. We stayed at the Majestic from February 16 to the 25th 2008. I have a mixed opinion of the hotel. We had great weather and the resort was clean but it was not the best.Check In: I called the day before and spoke to someone in reservations and explained that we would arrive late. I requested connecting rooms or rooms next to each other with 2 double beds. I also explained that since we have young children we wanted a room in a quiet area. I was told we would be assigned rooms 2203 and 2204. We checked in at night. There were no adjacent rooms. I saw our rooms cards and the rooms we were assigned were crossed off. I asked why they were given away and they told me it was because of late check in. We were given two rooms near the theatre and overlooking the construction. They both had King Beds and we were told that they would have another bed in the rooms waiting. The rooms did not have beds waiting. One room had a spill on the floor of something sweet and was hot and full of flies. The other room was fine. It was 2 hours before they brought the beds and cleaned the room. The construction woke us up at 7:30am.Two days later, we were moved to Building 2 in the middle to far end of the resort overlooking the pool. It was much better.Rooms:Building #1 overlooks the Grand Paradise resort next door. If you are in the high number of building #1 you will see and smell the restaurant. Building #2 (the best in my opinion) overlooks the pool and has some ocean view rooms. It is generally quiet and easy access to the pool and beachBuilding #3 overlooks the other side of the pool and in the early numbers some of the resort and wedding gazebo; it is the second best building as long as you are not near the theater which is noisy at night. Building #4 is by far the worst unless you are really close to the beach. It over looks the construction and the early numbers are near the theater as well.The rooms are spacious compared to other resorts. They have open bathrooms which makes them look larger but can be embarrassing if you end up getting a sick stomach at night. There is little to no privacy if you are staying with friends and not close family or if you are staying with teenagers who like to use the bath alone.The beds are aged and in need of replacement. The pillows are foam. The bedspreads have been used a few too many times. In one room we had a new sofa but in the other the sofa was worn through and ragged. In other words, the furnishings can use a replacement. They also have few drawers to put your things but adequate closet space. They give terry robes which are nice and the bath towels are large. In one room the drain on the tub was broken and the magnifying mirror was torn from the wall. These things were never fixed during the stay.There is a nice terrace to sit outside with a rack for hanging clothes. The maids always keep the rooms clean. The mini bar has 4 bottles of water, soda and two beers daily. The grounds:The grounds are kept clean at all times. The staff takes pride and picks up all of the debris daily. The grounds are large and spacious and the resort never appears crowded. The main pool is HUGE. It is bigger than at most resorts. There is more than one quiet area for people who do not prefer the entertainment and activities by the pool. There is always a chair and never a fight for an umbrella or a seat which is nice. The only bad part about the pool was more a complaint from my children. It was BORING. It is just a pool. There is not a water slide, a wave pool, a lazy river, or a water recreation area for children as in most of the resorts we have visited. It is just a huge pool. Of course, that didn鈥檛 bother me but it did make it a little more difficult to keep the children entertained.The beach is gorgeous! The water was fairly calm and clean. The sail boats and kayaks are free as well as boogie boards although there is a wait to sail. There are plenty of umbrellas and showers as you exit the beach. The sand is soft and the beach is cleaned daily.The food:In my opinion, the food was very limited. It was probably the poorest selection of any buffet in an all-inclusive from my experience. We are not picky eaters. There was always something to eat. We ate. It just wasn鈥檛 great. For example, at the buffet, they would often run out of something, like grilled chicken midway through the lunch service and not have more. Also, there was just less selection.The A La Carte Restaurants were a little better 鈥?not great but better. We enjoyed the Churrasco at the Rodeo Steak House. We did not enjoy the lobster at the seafood as it was severely overcooked. We enjoyed fresh fish at the Mexican and the Oriental as well as fairly good egg rolls. The best part about the restaurants was that most did not require a reservation. You can just show up and they will normally seat you within a few minutes. The only required reservations are the Hibachi and the Gourmet. The Hibachi was disappointing. It was not done like the other resorts or like our local Hibachi restaurants. The cook just cooked 鈥?no tricks. However, on other nights I heard people cheering so it is possible that it was just our cook that was new and not all of the cooks. Overall, the food was fair to poor. The drinks were inconsistent. At one bar, the frozen drinks were cold and good; at the pool bar they were always warm. Also, the pool bar has no blender so they can鈥檛 make many of the drinks that they have at the other bars. They will fill any cup you give them so if you like to drink, bring your own container.Other impressions:The kids club was very nice. It has a small private pool with 2 slides and a nice indoor area with video games and bikes. Mainly it is for children ages 10 or below. It is far from the beach and main pool. They do a good job watching the children and my son enjoyed his time there.The entertainment was average; it was about the same as the other resorts with games by the pool and beach. There is water aerobics, stretching, aerobics at the beach, volley ball, tennis and a spa. We did not visit the spa. They also have massage at the beach which we did not try either. There were no special events. For example, at the Riu they had a night time celebration with fire and acrobats on the beach weekly. We have also been to resorts with a weekly outdoor picnic with food and entertainment. Most resorts also put out a special food and drink pool and beach side daily where they cook and serve you by the beach and pool around 2pm each day. They had none of that. They did have nightly bands and singing near the lobby with appetizers and a signature drink which was nice. Overall, I thought the resort was only OK. If you get a great price then go. It is worth it but if it is the same price as the Riu Palace or the Iberostar 鈥?go there instead. They have superior service and selection in my opinion.

<Author>Greenskeeper31
<Content>Good Experience at the Majestic We travelled to the Majestic during school break Feb 18- 25. We were a party of 4,adults and 2 12 year olds. As many have stated, we were concerned with the previous negative reviews. I will just touch on some of what concerned us before going.BEACH: Fabulous. Perfect blue water, clean white sand. As some have stated, there is some coral. It's easy to see and easy to avoid. One part of the beach does have a safety line so people avoid the coral. Next to it an area of soft white sand. No need for water shoes whatsoever in either place. If you go out beyond the safety line, coral is the least of your problems. Boats from various excursions zoom by. The roped off area has great waves for boogie boarding. I think that is due to the coral close to shore. In the area that is not roped off, it is much more calm (less coral close to shore). No need to worry about rip tides etc as the current pushes you into shore. There are waiters on the beach for drinks and it's a very short walk to the beach bar for a cocktail.Rooms: Large and clean. No problem with housekeeping as they took care to leave extra towels etc. We had a fabulous balcony room overlooking the pool and the beach. We had wonderful breezes all night and usually opted for sleeping with the slider open rather than the ac. No problems with bugs. The ac did work very well. As for a musty smell,not a problem. We brought along air fresheners. Same goes for the toilet area. We didn't find it to be as small as some stated. There is a good amount storage space in the closets etc and an easy to use safe. The t.v. gets New York stations so if you feel the need to keep up with US news, you can. We enjoyed our break from the nonstop Britney Spears saga for a week! LOL Contrary to what Ive read, AC does work when you are out of the room. YOu just need to shut the balcony door and it kicks on. The beds was hard as previously reported but we found it very comfortable. We sleep on a really nice mattress at home and were concerned but it was for naught. They brought twin beds in for the kids and they fit fine in the room.Food: It was good. Not fantastic, not bad. Some things were done better than others but we never went hungy. We weren't impressed with the teppanyaki grill. The food was okay but the show part was nonexistent. Not a big deal but if you are going looking for the whole experience, it's just not there. The main buffet was the best.. For dinner, they grill boneless chicken breast, fish etc right in front of you. It was very good. At lunch, we opted not to make the trek to the lobby for the better food because for us, sitting in an open air restaurant with a view of the ocean was worth having fewer choices. Breakfast was always well done. Dominican coffee was the best ! The kids loved the warm milk each morning to make their own hot chocolate. We did book the dinner romantica on the beach one eveing for my husband and I. I highly recommend it! The food was the best we had all vacation and the ambiance and service were top notch. Can't say enough good things about that experience. Any foodborne issues can't be solely attributed to poor food handling by the staff. We saw people use their fingers to pick up food from the buffet, take food, bite it and put it back and worst of all, a child take their finger, run it over one side of tongs, lick their finger to taste and then do it over the other side to taste again and then put the tongs back in the dish. His father then proceeded to do the same.Staff: So much has been made of rudeness. I have never in my life seen such rude people. NOT THE STAFF BUT THE TOURISTS. Hello, please, thank you, excuse me. That's all you need to know to get good, courteous service. If you can say them in spanish, even better. The staff appreciates any effort made to speak their language. There are even spanish lessons every day at 10:30 for anyone who feels they have a major language barrier. One evening while my family and I were enjoying dinner, a group came into the restaurant and started rearranging tables. It was a sit down restaurant where a host seated you and sent a waiter over to wait on you. They chose not to wait. This woman approached our table and waved her hand (no excuse me etc.) and asked You speak English. We said yes, and she asked us How does this work? We told her that appetizers and dessert were buffet but you order dinner etc. She said OH, turned on her heels and walked away. The staff was treated even more rudeley including the party of 12 flagging down the waiters, waving glasses in the air with the other hand thrown up and a very loud UH? white whine? I've never seen anything like it in my life. We also watched a group of tweens who ran around the resort for the entire week unattended. We saw them dump the contents of tea bags on the table, pour drinks over onto tables and one bragging about how he almost had to kick a French guys *^. We were embarrassed by the behavior as the perpetrators were from the US. Bottom line, you reap what you sow. The drinks were good. I know some people said they weren't strong enough. If you wanted more liquor, you could just ask for it. I thought they were good as is. Presidente beer was excellent. Bubba Kegs are a good idea if you want to grab a drink and want it to stay cool for a few hours at the pool or beach. Resort in general: The pool was fantastic. Very clean and well kept. You could find a quiet area under a palapa or a lively area near the swim up bar. Perfect. The plaza bar was a fun place to gather at night. There was live music and candlelit tables that provided a comfortable space for drinks before or after dinner. The lobby was also a nice place to relax. We only made it to 2 shows. Both were put on by outside acts. They were just okay- a little cheesy but a fun evening none the less. As some said, there is some wear and tear but there is also constant maintenance being done. I hate to say it, but based on the behavior we witnessed from some people, I would think that the wear and tear is due more to people disrespecting property than lack of maintenance. We always had plenty of towels etc. No bug issues and nobody spraying chemicals that we saw. Conclusion: We had a terrific time at the Majestic. We did have some stomach issues but we can't attribute them to the resort. The week we left, a local school was closed because of a gastrointestinal illness so it was rampant in our area. I took pepto daily and was fine. I did this as a precaution because we were drinking more alcohol and eating more than usual- it's vacation! As far as being a 5 star resort, I never believed that and still don't. I would give it 3.5 - 4 stars- above average. You need to go with an open mind as life is different in the DR. The staff works hard but they do it a little slower. They are friendly and happy and will always greet you with a hello, how are you. Just do the same and things will be fine. I think some folks who live in major metropolitan areas have a tough time with that slow down as their lives are so harried on a daily basis. Relax, take a deep breath it's your vacation!

<Author>CUatpoolbar
<Content>Mucho Majestic We travelled with four other couples this month to the Majestic Colonial. We have stayed at several other resorts in the Dom Rep over the last few years and we all agree Majestic was the best. We previously stayed at the Iberostar and Gran Bahia resorts--we enjoyed our vacations every time, but this resort earned a few extra points for friendliness of staff, food and the pool.Pool: winds through the resort like a river; wide in some areas and narrow in others. The depth never exceeds 4ft. Water is clean and refreshing. We have played the towel game at every other resort we've stayed at and found it simply wasn't necessary here. There are always plenty of lounge chairs in every area of the pool and along the beach.Beach: clean, soft and HOT! Tried boogie boarding--we looked ridiculous, but had a lot of laughs. Try the water sports if you're up for it...Food: plentiful. Surprisingly good beef at the restaurants. Abundant choices at the buffets. The lobster was undercooked at the seafood restaurant, but ask for it to be grilled some more and problem solved. Keep a watchful eye on the doneness of your meat/fish, don't assume.Drinks: Coco Loco, Dirty Monkey, Pina Colada, The Majestic...all wonderful. Smirnoff and Stoli available for vodka drinks. Try the Majestic--we received one upon arrival and continued ordering them all week. Mamajuana is the local drink--it takes some getting used to (local barks and spices soaked in rum), but the effect is somewhere between caffeine and too many Martinis. Got the giggles during more than one mamajuana session.Restaurants: we loved that you only needed to make reservations at the Gourmet and theJapanese show restaurants...other resorts you need reservations for every meal that's not at a buffet. Food and service was fine. The Japanese show restaurant was not authentic Japanese, it was basically a stir fry. That was fine though, the majority of us aren't into sushi and other delicacies of the Japanese diet, but thought we'd enjoy the show. Try the pasta bars at the restaurants and buffets...yummy. They make your pasta dish to order with several pastas and sauces to choose from. Rooms: well appointed, sunny colors, colonial-tropical feel. Bed was firm which my husband and I loved. Slept soundly each night. Okay, the cocktails and full meals every day may have accounted for some of that restful sleep. No charge for the room safes, plenty of space for clothing. Some folks seemed to have issues with the bathroom setup--I don't see the problem, the shower was large and the bathroom stall was smallish. You're only in their to take care of your business, how much room do you need? As far as privacy in the bathroom--you really should have those issues worked out long before you decide to room together. Dual vanities, hairdryer, outlet in the bath area for curling irons, etc. Iron and board in the closet. Satellite TV with plenty of stations. Our maid was okay, not terribly consistent with the time of day the room got cleaned. We had some chocolates and my husband's Valentine's Day card stolen, but we're fairly certain that was the man who fills the room fridge as that's where the items were and the maid had cleaned prior to him coming in to restock. Luckily I had already inhaled most of the homemade chocolates. Hope he liked the card. Staff: friendly, friendly, friendly. Always willing to help you along with your Spanish or refresh a drink. These folks work day and night and still smile all the time. The Animation Team is awesome. We did water aerobics almost every day and felt great. We're not the most energetic group and we take our relaxing VERY seriously, but this was a lot of fun and what the heck, you're in the water anyway.Health: we take an Immodium each morning and some OTC Zantac and have never suffered from intestinal distress. We eat whatever we want and drink far too many combos of fruity/creamy tropical drinks. I guess you just have to know your innards. I bring bug lotion each year and have never needed it. For the last few hundred of us that still smoke (bad, I know), the cigs can be had at the Cigar Shop for $6 US. That's about what we pay here in good ol' Tax 'Em Till Ya Kill 'Em New York.They have several gift shops at the resort, but wait for Market night to do your shopping. A little haggling and you can fare far better. It's usually mid-week. Casino was fairly big and lots of machines and a few tables. I don't gamble, but the members of our party who do said it was fine. One guy even came back with more money than he went with!Bring about $200 US singles for tips. Couple of bucks can go a long way with these folks. Spread the wealth! You're on vacation for Pete's sake! We tipped $5 per couple when we all went together to eat and that seemed to be very appreciated. We'd tip a couple of bucks with every drink order delivered too (it was always a tray full---did I mention we drink far too much?) and the waitress made sure we had whatever we needed for the entire week--be it more ice or mucho rum.Enjoyed our stay and have already planned on returning to the Majestic next year.I'm sure I've forgotten something, but if anyone has questions, feel free to contact me.If anyone was there between Feb.12-19: we were the bunch of old folks with the Booze Barge near the swim-up bar.

<Author>TVicenzi
<Content>Great Beach, All Around Good Resort Our first trip to DR, my husband and I have just returned from a stay at Majestic Colonial Feb. 14-19. In the past, my husband and I have traveled in the Caribbean and stayed at other all-inclusive resorts, so we had a pretty good idea of what to expect. The beach in Punta Cana is excellent, probably the best I've ever seen. Powdery, clean sand, stretching for miles, and noticeably less crowded right outside of the resort. Palm trees everywhere, picture perfect gorgeous. We were also pleased to see an absence of pesky vendors selling their wares so you could stroll down the beach in relative peace. There was always a stiff breeze the entire time during our visit, so the surf was a bit rough for beach front snorkeling or sea kayaking. We had no issues with check-in, and the front desk staff (Bernice and Janet) were especially gracious, escorting us to the room and describing the amenities as we went. Room was beautiful, spacious, very clean, and housekeeping was reasonable. The only minor complaint was the low powered mini-fridge which was not able to chill down the contents very quickly. The room was equipped with a coffee maker and espresso maker, a nice touch.True to the many reviews on this site, the food was average, but nothing to get excited about. Plentiful and a fair selection at the buffets, but relatively bland and never very warm. We found the best food at Rodeo House (grilled meats) and the Carribean restaurant. The Gourmet was a little nicer presentation and taste, but not so great that I would go out of my way to make a reservation. We also found the drinks at the bars to be relatively light on the alcohol. El Presidente is the only beer offered at the resort, and if you are a fan of spicy bloody marys, you will be in heaven.The pool was beautiful, very clean, a bit chilly, and generally there were enough chairs at mid-day if you hunted around a bit. The grounds are beautiful and there is constant attention to upkeep. The main gathering hall is absolutely grand in scale and very inviting for enjoying a before-dinner cocktail. We were disappointed in the live music selection but this seems to be our experience at most Caribbean resorts.A final comment. Very few of the staff speak English, but that makes if fun trying to communicate and you get to learn some Spanish during your trip. In general, the staff were genuinely pleasant and prompt and made us feel very comfortable.All in all, we strongly recommend this resort as long as you aren't searching for gourmet cuisine. A great place to simply relax and enjoy the beautiful beach of Punta Cana.

<Author>Eleni4255
<Content>Amazing Time!! This is going to be a pretty long in-depth review, but because I thoughroully read every review before going, I want to give specifics! My boyfriend and I are a couple in our mid twenties from Toronto that stayed at the Majestic from Feb9-16th. He has never been to a resort before, I have however been to many many resorts.Travel/check in and check out: We booked through an agent and flew with skyservice (found the leg room incredibly tight) and travelled with Sunquest (great company) the aiport in Dominican is open and beautiful, the flight, and airport/bus ride experiences were quick and easy.Upon arriving at the majestic we received a cool towel, a majestic virgin drink and we were informed that our room was not ready yet (it was 1:00) so we grabbed lunch and returned and it was ready. They gave us a room with 2 double beds by accident then quicky changed it to room 2305 with a king bed. I had asked for a room in building 2 and was incredibly happy with the room :)Room/Grounds: The room was beautiful, extremely lagre and clean. No musty smell the airconditioning worked amazing, we were actually cold alot :) The beds did however kill our backs but thats ok. There was towel art and a bottle of champagne given to us upon arrival. The grounds are incredibly beautiful and well maintained. There are 9 bars so pretty much everywhere u go you can find a drink. When checking in make your dinner reservations right away** There are always people working on the lawns and flowers so they really maintain the grounds very well. There are fountains everywhere, there is a sidestreet with shops the casino, theatre, sports bar and medical centre. And the beach isnt too far a walk from the lobby.Staff: Here is where I have to say I was shocked. I read so many reviews about people complaining about the staff. Please ignore them! I found from the first minute the staff was incredibly kind and accomodating., no matter whether you tipped or not (which we did) I left the maid a couple of dollars every day with a note and our room was cleaned every day, the fridge was restocked and we got beautiful towel art everyday! We came back after breakfast one day at 10am and the room had already been cleaned!! On valentines day she filled the tub with bubbles and rosepetals and it was so pretty. Everywhere I went everyone smiled and said hola! So please smile back to them, the wait staff was kind and quick to get you a drink, the guest services and concierge people were unbeleiveably kind and the best of all had to be the bartenders! Felix at the beach bar and the staff there were wonderful and always had a rum and coke ready for my boyfriend. beach: The beach I have to say was one of the best beaches I have ever been too, typically I dont swim in the ocean too much cause I hate stepping on random things that you cant see, but here the water was warm and clear and there was nothing but sand. If you went off to the left there were some rocks, and far out was the coral reef, but there was plenty of swimming space where it was just sand. We LIVED at the beach. Only once did I play the towel game and reserve a hut, other than that we went to the beach around 10-11:00 every day and got chairs and a hut with no problem. Excursions: We only did 1 excursion which was the dune buggy ride. We had a great time! Unfortuantly the guy advertises a natural cave that we stop and swim in which never happened, but the buggys are awesome, they are two seaters and we went with two other couple that we met on vacation (hi Graham, Nicole, Cindy and Johnny!!) The atv's however seemed to keep breaking down so I would recommend the dune buggys. Its $100 per couple and they take you out into the wilderness for a long time so its great (just be smart and dress properly because you will get very muddy!) The excursion stops at a womans house where she serves you coffee and you can buy from the shop there. Please bring some candy and little gifts for the kids there beacuse we felt bad that we didnt have anything. Food: The food was probably the only drawback for us. Please understand that it is not because the food wasnt good, it is only beacuse we are pretty picky eaters even in north america, I did get sick one night and towards the end of the trip only ate bread and rice, but my boyfriend ate pretty much everything and was fine. We ate at the Steakhouse (the chateaubriand was really good) the dominican (the fajitas and nachos were awesome) and the Japanese (the teppanyaki tables are really fun and they give you alot of food) We also did the romantic dinner in the private gazeebo for Valentines dinner and they went all out decorating it with rose petals, and candles and we had a private table for 2 with our own waiter, it was fabulous. The regular buffets were good too, there are alot of options.Entertainment: We only caught 1 show which was the michael jackson show it was hilarious to see audience members dancing, we went to the casino alot and I won $80 although they didnt seem to like us much there, especially when we were winning. And we had a couples massage at the spa on valentines day which was amazing, the spa is really beautiful, be sure to check it out! *as a side note please tip, it may not seem like much to you, but a little tip can go a long way*To sum it up we had a really great vacation, I was nervous after having read some bad reviews closer to us going, but I realise either these people were expecting something that was unrealistic (please remember this is NOT north america a 5* there is about a 3* here although I do feel this hotel is a solid 5*) or they simply are peole that cannot be pleased. Just go with an open mind, relax and enjoy the amaing hotel and wonderful staff, I look forward to returning to the majestic in the future.If anyone has any questions please feel free to email me at Eleni4255@hotmail.com. Thanks :)

<Author>yakers33
<Content>Nice but would not go back My boyfriend and I recently took a trip to the Majestic in January. The resort is very nice with lush landscaping and is very clean. Although we had a good time there were some problems.Our room was not ready when we first checked in which is not that big of a problem because we spent time at the bar. However, we were told to come back in 30 minutes and the room would be ready. Of course we came back and then they told us another 35 minutes..so we waited for a while for the room. The check-in process itself is very chaotic and the staff are just running around like chickens with their heads cut off. The one thing we were very upset about was the fact that they had us checking out a day earlier. Thank goodness the departure bus service (which you have to register with so you can find out what time your bus is leaving) noticed that they had us leaving the wrong day. Well, trying to correct that was hell!!! They kept telling us we had to prove to them that we were staying til the 31st and not the 30th...well, that was pretty hard to do since THEY had our itinerary which they requested when we checked in. All in all, we were able to fix it.The pool and beach are very nice and we had no problems getting towels or lounge chairs....The food is bland...and they DO NOT label anything at their buffets so you are constantly walking around wondering what the food actually is. Plus, every buffet is the same. The only restaurant that was good was the Le Gourmet. Get reservations and eat there. The chinese and steakhouse restaurants are decent as well.The rooms are ok. The bed was like sleeping on the floor. The mattress was so hard. I have never slept on something so hard in my life. The bathroom is tiny...well the toilet area...You feel cloisterphobic if you shut the door to use the bathroom...The shower is big enough to fit five adults and I cant understand why they made that so big and the toilet so small. Also, room location is key. We paid for an upgrade to have a pool side room, which was nice..but BEWARE. My boyfriend and I are not partiers. We like to relax when we go away. It was very hard to do this at Colonial Majestic. They have weddings here daily..which is fine during the day..but at night, the wedding receptions are held at the pool bar which is right smack in the middle of all the rooms....and of course, right in front of hours. So from 7pm to 12am every single night, we had to listen to loud music and hollering guests. I mean, I'm all for having fun at weddings, but this resort needs to find a reception area that does not interfere with its other guests. I did not pay for a five star resort to hear someones wedding all night long. Plus, you can hear the entertainment from other areas of the resort as well. The only way for peace and quiet is to book a room by the ocean, but this resort is not worth all that money.The weather was beautiful and we enjoyed relaxing by the pool everyday....but we will never go back to Majestic. Take this review as you see fit. I read all reviews before I went and I took the positive ones over the negatives...wish I didnt do that....Think about it before you book.

<Author>only_n_cali
<Content>Nice place...but please read I just got back from a four day stay at the Majestic Colonial. I read some of the reviews before I left and it's apparent that there's a little truth in a lot of the comments. I've stayed in everything from The Holiday Inn to The Four Seasons and all in between so I'm going to tell you how it is:THE GOOD:*The reception lobby area is open, airy and impressive, it looks just like it does in the pictures. (on par with a Hyatt Resort) *The staff are VERY nice and attentive. A few but most employees do not speak a lot of English, so it's good to know the basics. *The grounds are well manicured and kept clean. *The rooms are very decent (on the level of a Sheraton or Marriott). *Had a massage and it was great, slightly less expensive than an hour massage at a typical spa in LA. *Took the ATV tour - through the streets, stops at a nice beach and cave....awesome! (A must do)*Rented racing boats on the beach...pretty fun but be ready for a wild ride the waves are choppy at this beach.*Club Mangu...if you want to party definitely go here!THE BAD:*The food is very average but it's an all inclusive resort with buffets so what do you expect. The best food is in the restaurants that require reservations.*The rooms are designed for couples...bathrooms are open with no privacy.*I did see a couple of roaches in the room but my other friends did not have that experience in theirs (it's a tropical island so I ignored it unlike I would if I saw one in the states).*There was one ATM (issues pesos only) that was broken the entire time and the casino which gives US money opens after 4pm (minimum withdrawal is $100 with a $7 surcharge)BOTTOM LINEFor an all inclusive resort this place is really nice, and in spite of some of the problems, I would still recommend it. It is NOT the St Regis! If you want luxury, you need to stay at the SIVORY or PUNTACANA RESORT  CLUB. While there I visited the BARCELO BAVARO RESORT (a very low budget hotel), stay away from there! Absolutely no comparison to the Majestic. Overall I would recommend The Majestic as a very good choice for the money.

<Author>Missyoubleep
<Content>Had a Fantastic Time at the Majestic Colonial My husband and I along with another couple stayed at this resort from January 25th to February 8th. Yes......two weeks. Before we left, we had read nasty reviews of the resort and were starting to get a bit nervous. We are all angry that we allowed these reviews to cause us stress before we even left for the vacation. The resort is absolutely beautiful. Our room was not a special room. It faced the the back garden........but we loved it. The rooms are very spacious and the cherry wood was beautiful. The showers were huge and the water pressure was wonderful. Yes, there may be a musty smell at times.....but you are in a very humid country. We found the rooms to be very quiet. Our power went out on occasion but I made a phone call and someone knocked on the door while I was still on the phone.......now that's service!! It was fixed within seconds. When I heard the reviews about how unfriendly the staff were.....I was outraged. These people who complain about the staff....I have a question for you. Have you ever tried to talk to them in Spanish? You are in THEIR country after all. Have you ever shown kindness instead of expectations? They don't owe you anything. We found everyone we met to be very friendly and willing to make your day better. The staff will treat you with the respect that you give them in return. We found the food to be excellent. There were so many choices at the buffet. The menu restaurants were also great. Out of five choices of restaurants you only had to make reservations for two of them. We were all healthy except for the occasional night which we blame the fact we had too many bahama mamas....or pina coladas. Guess what........coconut milk is a laxative. Who knew?? The pool is amazing. It is kept very clean and winds around through the entire resort. We loved to stay on the beach but on the occasional day when the wind was strong, we stayed by the pool. The beach was beautiful. The water is clear and blue. The sand is soft and is raked everyday by the staff. At times the waves were rougher than usual which only caused a great deal of fun trying to body surf. The day we left for home was a sad day. The man who dropped off our water and soft drinks everyday stopped by to say good-bye. He thanked us for coming and hugged us goodbye. Our maid called out to us and also hugged us good-bye. We met many people at the resort who loved staying there and had no complaints. So to the people who are planning on going to this resort and are going there with a kind and open heart. Relax. You will love it. Our group would go back there in a heartbeat. Here's to booking our next year's trip!!
