<Author>JPrice1
<Content>Overall, a nice resort My wife and I just returned from our stay at the Majestic. We were there from Feb. 7th - 11th. Since I booked this trip six months ago I had a lot of time to read the reviews on Trip Advisor. Like others before me mentioned, the reviews at either end of the spectrum (i.e., worst resort ever or the best resort in the world) should be taken with a grain of salt. Clearly the Majestic is a nice place and probably one of the best in Punta Cana. But it also has its flaws and is definitely NOT the 5 star resort it's oftentime advertised as. Arrival - Our flight arrived in the late afternoon on a Thursday. Many reviews have stressed the importance of not taking pre-arranged shuttles from the airport. I booked mine way in advance and really didn't feel like making changes so we took the shuttle. We had no problems. No waiting in long lines at the airport or anything like that. The van was very comfortable. There were only 6 of us with 4 going to the Majestic and 2 going to the RIU Palace (two resorts down the beach) so it wasn't as if we were making a ton of stops. I'm pretty sure the transfer would have been worse had we arrived on a Friday or Saturday. I'd keep that in mind when booking. Check-In - Again, this seemed to be a major complaint by many of the negative reviewers. We were fortunate to arrive in the late afternoon so the lobby was nearly deserted of new arrivals. We were greeted by the famous Victor who was as advertised - very accommodating and professional. He not only checked us in but escorted us to the dinner reservations desk and walked us through making reservations for the week. He then accompanied us all the way to our room which was at the other end of the resort nearest the beach - probably a 10 minute walk. He explained the room's amenities and what was included in our package and explained the layout of the resort. It was all very professional and much appreciated. I'm not sure why we received the royal treatment by the manger (or one of the managers) of the resort. All of the arriving guests I saw had to find their rooms on their own. I think the service we received was due to a) the lack of guests checking in at the time we arrived and b) the fact that I called the resort 4 times in the previous month to confirm my reservation and also emailed them the week prior (as others have recommended). Check-in could not have gone better.Room - We had an ocean view suite in building 2 - room 2154. The room was very nice and well situated. No foul odor or exposed wires as reported by other reviewers. I would recommend for those staying in an ocean front suite to request a room on the second or third floor for optimum ocean views. We were on the ground floor and could see the ocean ok, but the second floor would have been nicer. One tip: Confirm on arrival what plan you have. I wasn't aware that I had purchased the 'Supreme Package' which gave us free room service (not included in the standard all-inclusive) and premium alcohol. No complaints about the room. Grounds - The resort's grounds are immaculate. There is no doubt that the grounds crew does a wonderful job maintaining a beautiful landscape. Pool- Even the most negative reviews gushed about the pool and rightly so. The pool is the best I've been in. It meanders through the center of resort, around various bars, the spa, and restuarants. I felt that best thing about the pool was that the areas in which to lounge in were spread out in pockets. It's wasn't as if you looked up the pool and saw chairs lining it all the way to the beach. This design eliminated the feeling of being in a crowded resort pool. And, aside from the wet bar area, the pool areas were fairly quiet. Beach - The beach was nice. It's a half moon shaped beach (jutting into the ocean) and always felt uncrowded. My wife and I took a long walk down the beach and felt that the Majestic's was the nicest out of the any of the resorts around it. We never had any problem finding beach chairs. I much prefer a beach on the Caribbean Sea, however. The Atlantic coastline was fairly rough even though our beach was guarded by a reef 200 yards away from the shoreline. The water was warm and clear.Entertainment - The entertainment was surprisingly good. I'm using the first one to want to leave a resort show, but the shows involving the local dance troupe (The Stars are Here and the Michael Jackson show) were really good. Food/Drink - Ok, here's where I start siding with the negative reviews. My wife and I put a lot of emphasis on the importance of the quality of food in whatever resort or hotel in which we're staying. I can honestly say that this is my first vacation EVER that I didn't enjoy one good meal. Most of the food was really bland and fairly tasteless. Even the reservation-only restaurants - Le Gourmet and Taino (Japanese) - produced really bland food. I never expected the low quality of the food, even after reading all the bad reviews. I was really shocked and disappointed. The Supreme buffet was, unfortunately, the best option for food there. The drinks were ok. It seemed they got worse the farther away from the lobby you went. The bars in and around the lobby produced really good drinks. Oh, and expect the worst wine you've ever had. Seriously - it was like drinking blueberry schnapps. The wet bar and beach bar were just ok. If you're the type of person that just wants to go and enjoy the fun and sun and food is secondary, don't worry about the food. It's not really terrible or anything. It's just not as good as we would have wanted.People - The cool thing about this resort is that it is very diverse. In fact, I would say that Americans were in the minority - there were a ton of Europeans (especially Spanish) and Canadians. It was nice to meet people from all over the world and not feel like the resort was dominated by Americans. But, as luck would have it, I was again embarrassed by a few of my countrymen (I stress a FEW - most were great). Why is it that drunk and obnoxious Americans need to always make a scene? Most everyone there was nice and quiet and kept to themselves except for those two or three groups of Americans who had to direct attention to themselves while drinking their 40-oz insulated mugs full of Presidente (which I found ironic considering how quickly they were consumed). I'm not trying to tell anyone to not have fun - my wife and I are under 30 and drank all week - but seriously, what is the need for the constant attention-seeking commotion? What's wrong with having a good time without reinforcing the stereotype of the Tommy Boy-esque American? Aside from some slight annoyances, we had a good time. I'd highly recommend that you arrive and leave mid-week to avoid much of the frustration of dealing with the crowds on Friday and Saturday. I'd also recommend contacting the resort a couple times prior to your stay to confirm that the arrangements are in order. I'm not sure if I'd return to the Majestic or go to another all-inclusive resort in the DR. With that said, I'm not so sure there's anything much better in the DR. Punta Cana as a destination is so new (relatively) and I don't think they have the infrastructure yet to manage really top-quality resorts. Hopefully I'm wrong and will visit again....  
<Date>Feb 12, 2008

The cups are small at the resort so if you want a big cup of coffee or a big 'Pina Colada' or beer to walk around with-bring a travel mug with you. We booked our trip because the Majestic was rated #1 on TripAdvisor. It's now slipped to #2. We had better service at a 3star resort in La Romana than we did here. Let me say the positives: Richard at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I contacted him before we left as I did not want a room facing the construction. He took care of us and we got a beautiful room. We had a Colonial Junior Suite and it was lovely. There was a huge terrace overlooking the ocean..beautiful. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and kind. We had Rum, Wine, Champagne, Whiskey, Pepsi, Chocolate, Water, Coffee and Espresso in the room. Aside from the chocolate, it was re-stocked every day. The walk in shower is really nice and had lots of hot water and pressure. There was a really comfy Terry robe to use- I loved it.There is an iron  ironing board in the room- ours didn't work very well but we didn't need it much anyhow.The pool is outstanding however it was too cold to swim around in when we were there. There are plenty of chairs but you have to play the towel game if you want to get one. It really isn't fair to put your towel on a chair at 8am so it can be yours at 2pm. It's a little annoying-wish that could change but....Never a problem getting a drink. The main drinks are from 'Slushy' machines. The Main Buffet had lots to choose from. We enjoyed the seafood restaurant. We had the lobster twice- very yummy.The gym was adequate. It smelled pretty musty and could use a good cleaning. It had free weights, treadmills, some machines and benches. You could certainly get a good workout there. It was air conditioned and music was always playing. At the piano bar, a young gentleman played the piano every night. It was very nice to sit and listen to him while having a coffee or drink. The shows were pretty corny but that is personal opinion. You may like them. We avoided the Disco as it was too smoky. It would have been nice if the resort had a beach party one night or had some night time activities/games. We did have bugs in our room. Lots of ants and a few mosquitoes. I'm still scratching at the bug bites on my legs. I'd wake up each night with a few new ones.The service staff at the buffet needs some training. We are not demanding people but a smile would be nice. There is a language barrier. If you don't speak spanish, learn a few key phrases before you go. Basically---if you want good service, you have to tip (at least that is how it was for us). It seemed the more you tipped, the nicer they were to you. At the last resort we stayed in, there was a no tipping policy and everyone got great service, every day, from every one. The seafood restaurant had good service every time.We were told not to go to the Steak House as the meat was tough and food bad. We avoided it.Now...here's the bad stuff:I got very very sick after eating at the so called Gourmet restaurant. The next morning was the worst I have felt in my life. I spent the day in the room as I didn't want to travel to far from the 'washroom'. It took 5 days to get back to myself. It was not pleasant. Others got sick as well (see past reviews). There are cockroaches. We had a laugh at a bunch of them that were swarming (a nest maybe?) in a wicker table across from the piano bar. When you put a warm drink on the glass, they would emerge (under the glass). We pointed it out to the waitress who got startled at the sight of them. I hope they take care of the problem before you get there.They had men wearing masks spraying chemicals on the plants in mid day. The problem is that they had masks and we did not. It's not pleasant to get a whiff of that stuff when you walk by.Be prepared to get grabbed and hassled when they have the 'Market'. If you want to buy a souvenier, you will be hounded. A man wanted us to pay $130 American for a little blue necklace. I laughed out loud actually. We refused but he wouldn't let us walk away. Haggling went on for about 10 mins. Well guess how much we got it for?? $10. As soon as we left that vendor, there are 10 more grabbing at your arms to pull you to their tables... Cheapie Cheapie they kept saying. $80 for a shell necklace...On and ON and On.....It's hard to walk through. Take note of that... a so-called $130 necklace..we got for $10. It was a little much. One night at 2:30 in the morning, we were woken up with a phone call telling us to calm down the party in our room. (we were asleep--it wasn't us...but thanks a lot for waking us up!) You would think they would have an employee down to verify what room is causing a commotion and maybe knock on their door.The walls are very thin. You can hear everything out in the hall. Hard to sleep some nights.Breakfast starts at 7, Lunch at 12:30 and Supper at 6:30. It would be better if supper could start at 5:30 for us early risers. We checked out with no problems. We had an 'Okay' time. Really don't feel that it was worth the money we spent when we compare it to our other vacations. We wouldn't go back nor recommend it to our friends.I really hope that your experience is a good one and that you have have a better time than we did.Happy Travels to you!

We found the best deal through cheap caribean and booked immediately.Walkig into the lobby you are immediately greeted with a cool towel and drink. The relaxing begins. We arrived a little early to check into the room but, they took our luggage, did the paperwork, gave us our bracelets and said to take a quick tour, get a bite to eat and our room would be ready shortly. It was. The pool was just spectacular. Not only was it nice to look at, there was never as much as a piece of sand in it. Considering that the pool begins maybe 100 feet from the beach this was amazing. There were always lounge chairs available and the pool area is so large that even though the hotel was filled to capacity you never felt over crowded. The beach left us speachless. The beauty and cleanliness made it picture perfect. Got pushed around a bit with the strong undertow, but being from NY we could more than handle it. Our room was nice. Very spacious We were on the second floor overlooking the pool in room 3205. Great location. Of course it was a little musty smelling but nothing too bad. We heard ahead of time that this might be and we were ready with a candle. We never even needed to light it, but we did open the jar. This just freshened it up a little. After each flush of the toilet there was a weird sound. We found out that it was due to air in the pipes. Nothing was ever done about this nor am I sure anything could have been done. The drinks were abundent. My husband never has to wait very long before someone put another beer in his hand. The people who worked here could not have been more professional or friendly. Nothing was ever a problem, they may not have been able to help you but they always did it with a smile and you always felt as though they really wanted to help. One of the negatives in my opinion was the buffet. I didn't care for the dinner buffet or the lunch buffet at the main buffet dinning area..There was a lot to choose from but my husband and I didn't think the quality was so good. But on the other hand you would never go hungry. All of the ala carte restaurants were great. My favorite was the japanese but my husband loved the steak restaurant. He loved his dinner and mine so the server brought him over another helping of what I was eating so he wouldn't eat mine. We had trouble with an excursion that we booked through cheap caribean because even though it was supposed to be just 15-20 minutes away from the hotel noone at the Majestic new anything about it and were not very helpful to us in trying to figure out what to do. In the end a bellboy put us in a taxi, told us we may not be able to get a taxi back and that we should pay the driver 80 US dollars to sit and wait for us. We did decide to do this but, after driving around Punta Cana for an hour and a half, we told the taxi driver in our most simple but demanding spanish that we could muster up to take us back to the Majestic. I must say I did not feel safe while driving outside of the resort. So I would suggest if you are thinking of booking an excursion do it through the hotel not a travel agent or a.com because representatives from the hotel are not able to help you if there is a problem. There are always activities going on at the pool and at the beach. You can join in or not, there is no pressure at all. As a matter of fact, the pool is soooo large that you may not even know that anything is going on down by the other end. The shows at night were OK, not good not bad, just OK. Something to do at 10:00 if you couldn't eat or drink another thing. Water sports were right there on the beach. We went tandum para sailing and saw the most spectacular views. I am 48 years old and not adventurous, but I am very happy I did it. My husband played in a golf tournament next door at the Punta Cana Golf resort. He was put in a foursome of other guests of the Majestic and he enjoyed that day as well. We went on this vacation to sit, relax and read a book without interuptions and thats exactly what we got. If you choose this resort you will be happy with the beauty of the buildings, the amazing pool and the most stunning beach. I can't image ever getting nicer landscape anywhere. Not only would I recommend this resort I would go back myself.

The resort was beautiful, the rooms were gorgeous, pool was awesome and the staff was great. The only thing is we ALL came down with Montezuma's revenge. If it was filtered, they really need to upgrade and do a better job at insuring the quality of the water when serving it to people. They do offer bottled water - we should have stuck with that.But who knows what they were serving us in our mix drinks. I have been to Mexico before and the resort we stayed at (Iberostar) made sure the water we were served during dinner, ice in the drinks..etc, were all through their filtered system. And because of that, we never had a problem.The only other thing I did not like was the quality of the alcohol was watered down and they served you the drinks in plastic disposable cups. We understand the plastic part, but both Jamaica and Mexico served you tall plastic glasses. This is such a minor detail and one that would not make or break our next trip. As for the food, I would give it about a 6. The gourmet restaurant was great, Chinese  Japanese was pretty good as well, but overall the buffets we alright. There was plenty to choose from and safe foods we stuck with like pizza, pasta, rice beans鈥tc.  Other than that, I would recommend this resort but I would strongly urge people to avoid the water at the tables, avoid fruits and vegetables that are not steamed (i.e. salad) because they rinse them in the tap water, and limited the number of mixed drinks because who knows if they use the tap water for ice.We booked with our travel agent Betsy at Yogatta Travel and she was very helpful, you can find her information online.

<Author>jc48439
<Content>Great Stay at the Majestic I have never posted a review before, but I felt I needed to after our recent stay and other comments I have read.Let me start by saying that I truly believe that some people are not happy unless they are unhappy. I had been reading the recent negative reviews of the Majestic before my trip and I was more than a bit nervous about how things would be when I got there. After spending a week there (1/26 - 2/2) with my wife and two other couples, we were all thrilled with the way the vacation turned out. This way, by far, the best value we have received for our vacation when comparing with Riviera Maya, cruises, and US vacation destinations. No, everything was not perfect, but overall it is a very nice place to spend a week's vacation!Check-inTransfers from the airport were no problem. It is apparent on the way to the hotel that this is a poor area. The rest of the infrastructure apart from the hotel zones hasn't caught up yet. There were a lot of partially built roads and buildings along the way. Check-in was quick, probably about 15 minutes for our group. I had requested rooms in bldg. 2 and that is what we got. RoomsThe rooms were very large and finished nicely with marble. Upon close inspection, it is obvious that the workmanship in the D.R. isn't up to the same level that you would see in other countries but it didn't detract from the overall feel. Everything in the room (TV, safe, air cond., etc) worked well. One funny thing is that the clocks in ours and our friend's rooms all ran fast. From the first day to the last, the clocks would gain about a half hour. The rooms did smell a bit musty but that, I'm sure is due to the very humid conditions. It was also something I didn't even notice after the first day or two. Maid service was good; she always left fresh flowers and brought a clean set of towels in the evening along with a turndown. Definitely ask for a room in bldgs. 2 or 3 as those rooms will look over the pool area rather than neighboring resorts. FoodThe food was good overall, especially for an all-inclusive resort trying to please people from all over the world. We ate at all of the restaurants and the buffets and always found things that we liked. Especially good were the gourmet restaurant and the breakfast buffet. I felt the presentation of the food was always sanitary; the cold items typically sat on a refrigerated surface and the hot items were kept warm. There were definitely some things there that didn't look too good to me, but I'm sure they were just fine to others. The service ranged from pretty good (they would sometimes forget to refill water or be a little slow) to outstanding (very helpful in accomodating special requests) and they were always friendly. GroundsThe grounds were spectacular. The pool area was clean, water was perfect. People have mentioned that the pool was cold. I would call it refreshing but certainly not cold. Plenty of chairs. People would play the save-a-chair game but you would never have a problem getting a chair either at the pool or at the beach. The beach was beautiful with clean sand beaches as far as you could see. We walked to the vendor market about 2 miles down the beach and I think the Majestic had the best overall beach and location. The water was not too cold and there was always a relaxing surf rolling in. I did notice that it was a bit windy at the beach and I never saw anyone that was able to use the non-motorized watersports equipment. Seemed that they always said it was too windy for it.SpaThe spa looked nice and the services were good, however only one of two hot tubs (more like a warm tub with a gigantic jet on the bottom) were working. The steam rooms also weren't working. The massage services were good and were priced as you would expect at a resort.One final note is that there is definitely a language barrier. However, we were almost always able to get our point or question across and it never created any issues, instead we had fun with it. I heard a few workers helpfully letting guests know how to say things in Spanish (two eggs = dos huevos). But at least a couple times I saw somebody who arrogantly told the cook I didn't come here to learn a new language! or just ignore them altogether. It only takes a few bad apples to ruin it for everyone. We would probably want them to speak our language in our country too wouldn't we?If you are looking to spend a relaxing time at a very nice place at a great price, I would definitely recommed the Majestic.

Then while we were checking in they offered us the Majestic which is their house frozen drink - we loved it and drank them all weekend.At first they were not able to get us into the right building but when I mentioned I had been working with Rafael they confirmed with him and while we had to wait about an hour, they were able to get us in bldg 2. When we got to our room they were still cleaning it and we saw that they moved the beds to clean under them and it looked like they did a really great job. We had no problems with the open air bathrooms honestly, it is not really open and not an issue at all.The pools are beautiful!! There is a nice quite side and if you are in the mood for entertainment and activities you can stay on that side of the pool as well.The bars are nice and everyone on staff was extremely friendly.Regarding food - it was not out of this world but it was not terrible either (not in any way). We ate at the steak house the first night after reading several reviews that it was the best of all options. We were not impressed at all and in fact I would say it was the worst of all options. <Content>Majestic is truly majestic just returned from 16 nights at the beautiful Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana. Here is our review: We arrived late on Sunday January 13th and were quickly taken to a room in Bldg 1 on the main floor. This was not the type of room we had asked for and so asked to be moved. They were able to move us the next morning to a third floor room in Bldg 3 which was more to our liking. The only problem with the room location was it was directly in front of the activity pool which was quite noisy with excercise and dance classes each day from 4 till 6 pm. We stayed in that room but next time would probably have tried to get one closer to the main lobby area which would have been quieter. Other than the odd late night returnees waking us we found the room very nice. We loved the shower and double sink area with the shelf and drawers most of all. We also had a leather couch and large coffee table and the balcony was a great place to relax at the end of the day. The grounds are beautiful and the main lobby building is spectacular. Huge two story marble filled with 20 or 30 couch seating areas. Very nice and spacious. We spent a lot of time at both the pool and the beach. We thought the beach was fabulous with tons of powdery sand and lots of waves to play in. We especially liked the light beige beach chairs as they seemed of a much nicer quality than any of the other resorts. It didn't matter what time of day we went to the beach, we never had a problem finding chairs or a palapas to sit under. If yu wanted lots of personal space, you could easily find that at the top area of the beach. It was a bit closer down near the water but not overly so. Some days we found the beach a bit too windy, and so we spent time at the fabulous pool. Long winding and not too cold for us at all. If you don't like the loudness of the activity area, there is plenty of quiet spots closer to the main lobby with an exceptional bar playing lovely Dominican music. Again, we never had any trouble finding somewhere to sit (even shade) at any time of the day.  We loved the evening bands which played on the open air courtyard from 7 - 10pm each night. There is a dancefloor and lots of tables and chairs to relax after dinner. The bands were great, too. There weren't many waitresses so we usually got up and got our own drinks. We went there almost every night. We didn't see any of the shows so cannot comment on those. A nice feature was an early evening movie each night in the theatre, all animated for kids to watch. We had a one hour session with one of the photographers and bought the cd with all of the pics. She did a fabulous job taking us around the resort and shot some great photos. Thanks Lucy The food was more than adequate at the buffet and we ate there most meals. They just started putting signs on the different foods the day before we were leaving. It was interesting trying to choose a meal before that, but they had a lot of variety, beef and pork and chicken every night. Also, chili, lasagna, pastas, pizza, seafood and much more. We also tried the Steakhouse, the Gourmet and the Asian restaurants. All served nice meals. We had our anniversary dinner at the gourmet and they decorated the table with beautiful flowers especially for us. We also saw couples having special dinners on the beach.The staff were helpful and friendly. Hola to Joe and Marian and Cesar and thanks for making our trip even more fun. Overall, we loved this resort. We have stayed at 4 other all inclusives in the caribbean and thought this one rated very high on our scale. We probably will book to go back there next year.

I really liked this pool and by the way--the cleanest of any we have stayed at.Staff--Like any hotel some are better at their jobs than others. The Majestic is new so they have some new staff where the English is not up to speed, but again how's your Spanish? Its not that they won't sometimes help you its that a lot of time they don't know what you want. I find the Dominican people to be very kind and attentive and like any where some are not. One thing is for certain--if they do a good job for you or you are asking for something better than average then do the right thing and TIP.Its the same as here--want something special then tip.Special people--There are probally more than this but these are the staff that I came to know.Victor Pollantis---(Front Desk Manager)--AwesomeAngel--(Front Desk)---Awesome -- Angel (middle swim bar should be wearing t-shirt that says Whata'sup)--AwesomeEdgar---(Porter)--Awesome----Jason--(Porter)-Awesome and of course Felix--(Chef) should be on T.V.Special mention to Dianna (temporary guest services) for going beyond the call of duty. I had some tricky things I had to do and she got them done.My wife and I have travelled throughout the Caribbean and Mexico, Myan Riveria, Hawaii and some Asia. Six cruises. We are well travelled and stay mostly in these types of hotels. I will give you my honest opinion of this hotel.( I know it should be 5 to 1 star rating but we have stayed at so called 5 star hotels)Pool-6 star, Beach-6 star Rooms 5 star Food 4 star Entertainment 4 star and staff 4 star over all. That is comparing this to all the others that we have stayed at, all over the world. My honest opinion is if you are going for sun and sandy beaches with a super pool then this place is for you. We will return. I did not include pictures.Thankyou Majestic for a super holiday.

<Author>jesster810
<Content>Simply Wonderful. Returned from the Majestic yesterday and I feel compelled to write a review to make up for all the bad reviews that have been showing up recently. This is my sixth time to the Dominican Republic, and I have also been to Mexico, St. John, St. Thomas, Puerto Rico, Aruba, etc., so I think I have a fairly strong basis for comparison. Basically, the bottom line here is that for a resort in Punta Cana, the Majestic is fantastic. Obviously, you are not going to the Ritz, and you should not expect the hotel to resemble the Ritz. However, for a resort in the Dominican Republic, the resort is fantastic. I'll break my review down into categories:Rooms:We stayed in an Oceanfront room and it was amazing. In fact, it was why we chose to stay at the resort. We had a huge semi-private balcony overlooking the ocean with a hot tub from which we could gaze at the stars at night. It was magical. I know a lot of fuss has been made about the bathroom set-up, musty odors, etc., but none of that was a problem for us. No funky smells, room generally cleaned by noon, mini-bar restocked daily--no problems. Also, there was a DVD player and an espresso machine in the room we didn't know to expect, which was awesome, as well as the normal champagne, rum, and whiskey. One really nice thing about these rooms was how quiet they were. No loud neighbors to deal with.Food:Last year we stayed at the Iberostar, and in the past we've stayed at the Paradisus and in general the food is the same as at all other resorts, though perhaps not quite as good. The fruit and vegetables spread is amazing; the desserts are enticing; but the overall hot food rotation is not as diverse as some may like. It didn't really bother em though. We mostly ate at the main buffet since they had better fruits, but I have to say the langosta (lobster) at the seafood restaurant was superb. I thought I was going to be annoyed that the main buffet was inside and not open air like at Iberostar, but it actually meant that there were no flies buzzing about, which I hadn't thought of. Oh yes, and there is much mention of the pasta bar in these posts, but also worth mentioning is the grill stations, which have great meat and seafood offerings.Beach and Pool:We're more beach people, and as expected, we never had any problem finding chairs. However, one thing that did bother me a tiny bit is that there is less privacy at the beach than at the Iberostar. The chairs are just packed in more tightly. it is not a big deal, especially since we had our own private balcony, but just worth noting. At the pool there were also always chairs available, fyi, though we didn't hang out there much.Walking on the beach was great from the Majestic, because in one direction (to the left) you could reach undeveloped parts of the beach, while in the other direction you could walk past tons of resorts and do a lot of people watching.Bugs: We didn't see any and only got a couple of mosquito bites. I didn't need bug spray or anything, even though we brought some.Entertainment:This is not Broadway people! The shows were fun and amusing when we made it to them. What we also really liked was the live music that played every night at the bar near the buffet. It was from like 7 pm to 10 pm or something, and just a nice touch I haven't seen at any other resorts. Gym:We went for the first few days then took our runs to the beach. Of note: the machines are good enough, but the AC does not feel strong enough after ten minutes, and the music is played so loud my ears were ringing when we left the room. I'm sure we could have asked the guy to turn it down, but I guess we were embarrassed or something. It wound up deterring me from going back in there.I think that's all the really important stuff I wanted to mention. All these bas reviews coming in before our trip made me super nervous, but everything went smoothly and without a hitch, and we had a superb vacation. You will too!

<Content>Fantastic! I just returned from a week at the Majestic and am thrilled with the choice to stay there. I have to admit I was a little worried about going after reading a lot of negative reviews just before leaving, but now that I've been myself, I have NO IDEA what those people were complaining about. I find some of the reviews on here a little misleading. I chose another resort last year based on fantastic reviews and was VERY disappointed (Breezes in Jibacoa, Cuba). The Breezes was a horrible experience, yet most people loved it! Huh.RoomsWhen we arrived (very late at night since our flight was delayed) we were put in a room on the first floor, facing the construction. The next day we asked to be moved and got a room on the 4th floor, also facing the construction. I do admit that there were a few too many mosquitoes in the first floor room, but I only saw one or two for the rest of the week in the 4th floor room. Also, the room on the 4th floor had very high ceilings, and was much more pleasant as a result. The construction wasn't exactly great to look at but it didn't really bother me as I only slept and showered in the room, and spent the rest of the time on the beach.FoodThe food was great. I love seafood and there was fresh grilled fish every night (salmon, maro, sea bass...). Also, the seafood restaurant served lobster! The Gourmet restaurant was great too. I eat out a lot in Toronto, and I wasn't disappointed at all.Best of all, you can get premium liquor in the lobby bar. :)BeachThe beach was amazing. Soft white sand stretching in either direction. You can safely walk for a long time in either direction, especially to the east, as it is lined with other resorts. ServiceI thought the service was great. It was MUCH friendlier than in Cuba (both of us visited Cuba last year, at different resorts). Although the resort was at capacity, you never had to wait for anything, as there were so many people around to help you with everything. Comparison to other ResortsBesides the Breezes in Cuba, I've also stayed at the Barcelo Tropical Beach, Mayan Riviera. I really enjoyed my stay there as well, but I think the Colonial beat it out because the rooms were nicer, the beach was nicer, and it was less money.We also did some reconnaissance on the other resorts in the area. The Riu looked horrible (it stank and looked old). The Iberostar looked old and cheap and crowded. The Bahia Principe looked as nice as the Colonial, but it was huge and seemed very crowded and had way too many kids around.

<Author>JasenL
<Content>Second time at the Majestic and STILL plan on going back... This was the second time in just under a year that I traveled to the DR and stayed at the Majestic. My first experience was a gift given to my girlfriend and I as a graduation gift. We stayed at the Majestic for just over a week around the end of May, 2007. This most recent trip was a family get-away for 5 in mid Jan. 2008, with myself and my siblings, all in our late 20's to early thirties, and our free-spirited, energetic mother all staying at the Majestic for 6 days. The two trips could not have been anymore different and yet each was so special and amazing that I have no doubts I will return.  My girlfriend and I spent a ton of time at the beach and doing the hotel and additional activities (such as snorkeling. $30 and totally worth it... be sure to snag some rolls from the breakfast buffet to feed the fish) that we were exhausted by the end of each day. We stayed mostly to ourselves though met people easily and occasionally would have lunch with a friendly group while reserving dinner time and the evening for just the two of us. My family, on the other hand, spent most of our day at the pool, were very social with other guests, and constantly relied on he staff for entertainment and conversation. (Tomas in the French restaurant,Edward in the Japanese, and Mercedes at all the different bars, were all extremely friendly, genuine, and amazing in who and what they remembered each day considering the 12+ hour days they work). Each night we'd head out to the shows and be amused by the wackiness, though in both trips I thought only the Michael Jackson show was consistently great. The circus of dreams was amazing this time (and I don't recall seeing it offered when I was there previously). We almost always stayed out late, closing some of the bars and staying at the disco into the wee hours. The Majestic isn't a great place for singles... but if you're willing to go the extra mile, act like you're on vacation rather than at a club in your hometown, and be as outgoing as possible (perhaps thanks to a bit of liquid courage?) it's very easy to meet people and you'll find that the folks there really are interested in meeting others. Some people have posted here that they were upset about the lack of articulate English spoken by the staff. Personally, having learned some of the island's history and seeing the lifestyle most of the island inhabitants live, I am constantly amazed by how pleasant and wiling to try the staff at the Majestic are. Having been to Europe several times, I always find that the responsibility for communication has always fallen on the local's ability to speak English while my own attempts to speak the native languages are almost always met with scorn. At the Majestic the staff are always pleased when the guests attempt to converse with them in Spanish and it's amazing how well you get to know someone simply by struggling through an attempt to speak each other's language. I found I felt much better about being liked for trying. The weather was great during both trips despite the different times of year, though a quick shower here and there in the afternoon was common both trips. We were well prepared from reading the reviews on what to bring, what not to eat, and I once again avoided being sick by drinking bottled water, not eating salad or washed, cut fruit, and by being conservative in what I chose to eat (are people REALLY going to the DR to eat the sushi?). Overall an amazing place. I could easily see myself going back time and time again.

We were the seventh room in and were kept up through all hours of the night. A lot of partiers head to their rooms around 2:00 / 3:00 a.m. and are happy to scream about their enjoyment. The man in the room next to us arrived at his room drunk and making a lot of noise. He was arrested around 3:00 a.m. and his wife was escorted out the next morning. Do not count on the concierge, Rafael, for help. He booked us a taxi for our roundtrip airport  hotel  airport. When we found our driver he escorted us to his taxi. In a large parking lot full of nice, clean taxis, we were stuck in a small, very dirty, and run-down taxi. The driver spoke no english and didn't seem too concerned about us.So once we settled in we were excited to go to the beach. When we got down there, directly in front of the hotel there is about 15 feet of swimming from the shore. There is a safety line you can't go past because that's where they let their speed boat renters ride around. They told us we could go past the line but might get run over. If you wander down the beach to the far side of the resort it opens up much more. We took our snorkel gear but ... no coral and no fish. The coral is too far out to swim to. They offer free water sports for anything that doesn't have a motor. My daughter wanted to wind surf but was told it was too hard if she had never done it. My husband and I wanted to take a catamaran out. It was free AFTER you paid the $50 instruction fee. The only good thing I can say about the beach is that they had plenty of chairs for everyone.It rained all four days we were there so we explored the resort for fun things to do. The basketball court is not for basketball -- does not even have a hoop. The tennis courts are extremely run down. The outdoor ping pong table is warped and hard to play on. The pool water is very cold. The entertainment at night is almost as good as a high school performance. The towel hut only permits one towel per person. If your towel is taken or blows away, you pay for it. TV stations are poor in the room. To get the decent channels, including the weather channel, you have to pay extra. Personnel in the computer area are rude and unwelcoming. Board games are in spanish so you can't play them. The list could go on but I'm sure you get the gist of it.

We had an excellent dinner at the French restaurant and both times at the steak restaurant. We recommend changing for lunch and going to the buffet instead of eating by the beach. Our mother did get sick at the beginning of the trip (she brushed her teeth with the water many times and ate lots of fresh fruit, but it's so hard to know the actual cause of her illness). The staff was great about helping us take food back to the room for her.We left a tip for the maid and beverage person each day and always had great service. We were prepared for uncomfortable beds and pillows, but we all slept great each night. Overall, our vacation was exactly what we had wanted - fun in the sun at the beach and pool. The exceptional service and friendly staff made the vacation much more memorable - we will be going back!

<Author>Rebeccathumbsdown
<Content>beautiful hotel, amazing pool. I had been reading the reviews beforehand and was getting quite nervous as some of the reviews were quite bad; however, these people writing these bad reviews have obviously never been to a three- or four-star hotel in D.R. so why they are comparing it to that is beyond me.We just returned from this gorgeous hotel yesterday (January 19). ROOMS: The rooms are absolutely gorgeous. Nicer than most rooms in hotels in U.S./Canada. The only thing about the room I did not like is the bathroom was quite open concept so not private at all but the shower was huge and everything was very clean. not damp or humid at all in the room like in some other hotels in the D.R. we've stayed in before. Huge bed. Beautiful.FOOD: Food was okay. The Steakhouse was very good. Mexican was pretty good as well. Only ate at the buffet for one dinner and it had good selection of stuff but nothing is labeled and lots of Domincan-style food. I would say the people that are complaining about getting sick are probably eating things that look sketchy and have been sitting out (eggs benedict, pre-cooked eggs) and you would get sick if you picked that off a buffet in Canada as well. Be choosy of what you eat and you will be fine. also, you really can't go wrong with things made fresh in front of you. If delicious food is important to you for your holiday, don't go to Domincan. It is not the same standards as Canada/U.S. and you will be disappointed if you go thinking that you are going to get the same quality in the buffets.DRINKS: pretty good. I recommend the Dirty Monkey. very yummy. lounge bars also had speciality drinks and quality is better than the beach and pool bars.GROUNDS: absolutely beautiful. constant staff everywhere cleaning and tending to things.SHOWS: I can't really comment on this one. We only went to one show but it was entertaining enough. POOL: Amazing. get a floating mat and float around the pool. There were also tons of activities here, both on the beach and the pool. Staff tries to get everyone involved and it was pretty entertaining. We had a great time at this resort and amazing weather. I would definitely go back if I was going to go back to Domincan.UNRELATED TO RESORT BUT PROBABLY GOOD TO KNOW: One thing I would recommend is pre-book your seats when you book your vacation. The flight we were on had a huge group and many people on our flight who were travelling as couples had to sit apart, including ourselves. Not a big deal if you are travelling with two adults but if you are travelling with children, you should definitely pre-book. Also, unrelated to the resort, don't go on the horseback riding excursion. It was extremely dangerous and not to North American standards at all. The horses were tired and unpredictable and only two guides for a group of about 20 to 30 people.

<Content>Wonderful time at the Majestic I just returned from a four night stay at the Majestic Colonial Hotel in Punta Cana. This was my first trip to the Dominican Republic. We enjoyed the swim up bar where a really great bartender named Anita made us special drinks every afternoon. We met alot of friendly people from our country and others. Lots of lounge chairs for sunning and shade if you want that. We ate at almost all of the resturants at the resort. The steak house was our first night and we were quite pleased with the selection and meal. This was a sit down meal with table service. Next night was the Chinese resturant. I was sold at the sushi bar. There is also a large buffet open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and another smaller, but not small!, resturant out by the beach. Very friendly and good service everywhere. The staff all do their very best to converse in English...which is more than I could do in their language. <Author>Stepchilds
<Content>Maggie and Maria at the Kids Club are excellent Our family of four (kids 3 and 6) stayed for ten days. The most signficant aspect of the trip was that we were for the first time able to enjoy some adult time without worrying about the health, safety and entertainment of our young children. For those of us double-income working families, we know that vacations can be an exercise merely of moving child care operations from one place to another and the parents are usually more exhausted after the vacation than they were before they left. Not so here. With love and care, these two women provide a supportive and fun environment. The club is open from 10 to 6, which allows parents to take a meaningful break.Other thoughts -- make sure you have cash upon arrival in Punta Cana -- there is a ten dollar per person entrance fee into the country; be sure to have some immodium or mylanta on hand -- the food is tough to handle; give yourself plenty of time to get to the airport -- the process is amazingly inefficient; be sure and get a combination swedish/deep tissue massage from Emilia, Pilar or Dulcividia at the spa --- the service, attention to detail and skill of the masseuses is second only to those in Asia.Overall, a good family resort.

We then were given a non alcohlic beverage which was very nice, and as the kids were with us I was very happy that it was without alcohol. We were given 4 towel cards and shown to our room which was ready. They had just set up the two extra beds for our two sons who accompanied us. The jacuzzi was full, with bubbles and floating rose petals. There was also a bottle of champagne waiting for us. A banner was put across the outside of our room door the announced us as  The Honeymooners, we saw other doors that said Happy Anniversary as well. The luggage arrived about 10 minutes after we entered our room. At that time we were told if anything was needed all we had to do was call and we were shown our passport to the hotel that was given to us at check in. The boys, 10 and 12, immediately ran out the patio doors and off into the pool. We had a ground floor room although not a swim up room. We were in Bldg 3 Room 3144 which is at the very end closest to the ocean and right at the beach bar and restaurant. The pool bar was directly in front of us and the Spa was slightly to the left. It was a fair walk to the main hotel and the buffet and a la carte restaurants but it was a pleasant one that was set up quite nicely for wheelchair access as well as wheeled walkers. My new husband was delighted as he had free access to the sushi bar that was set up outside on the way into the main lobby and as you were passing on your way to the main buffet. We have been to the Carribean on many occasions before and basically a buffet is a buffet. This one was done quite well. The boys preferred all there meals there and we went with a different a la carte every evening. Breakfast was always at the Buffet and we looked forward to seeing Felix at the omelette station. He always remembered us and always had a smile and conversation for us. On our last day he even wished my husband good luck on his bet for Dallas on Sunday and for my son to get a goal at his next hockey game. This was a person who was genuinely interested in what his patrons had to say. Cooked an excellent omelette as well.The Gourmet Restaurant was wonderful, we ate there first. The beef was done to perfection.The Mexican Restaurant was everything we expected it to be with a very nice atmosphere.The Rodea Steak House and Grill were my favorite as I am a simple meat and potatoes kind of girl. The Matsuri Restauarant had a very impressive Sushi Bar for appetizers and the Lemon Chicken I would definitely recemmend.LeCaberete was our Romantic dinner for two that was offered to us from the hotel. Normally you don't need reservations for this restaurant but it was a meal that was catered only to us by one waiter. The lamb was very, very good. They made a special menu for us as my husband is allergic to all shell fish and this was the Seafood Restaurant. Beef was served with the lamb and was just as good. Actually, I was surprised at the beef in Punta Cana as it was much better that in Cuba or Mexico, The fresh Ceasar salad made the meal.Twice in our room we came in to find pleasant surprises. I should say 3 times. Once we came back to a wonderful fruit plate, another time was the invitation for the Romantic dinner for two as well as a bridal breakfast brought to our room, which we booked at our convenience. (when the kids had left for the pool)On the day before we left we found a piece of heart shaped cake on a platter that was glazed with peaches and kiwi on it and across the platter was written Happy Honeymoon.I never really met our maid but she did a wonderful job. I left a small gift bag with cosmetics ect. everyday and I am sure the gift bag was just as important as what went into it. We always had 6 large white towels and two yellow beach towels in our room as well as our 4 towel cards. We were given two clean Majestic white robes on a daily basis as well. For the person who filled our mini bar we left a dollar everyday and left notes in simple spanish as to what we wanted. Our requests were met everytime, whether it was for extra water, chocolate for the kids, or a couple extra Presidente. We left a larger tip for them both when we left.The beach was absolutely amazing. I have never been to such a beautiful beach. Although I never noticed whether it was raked or not, I never saw a cigarette or cigar butt anywhere. Every morning when we went the chairs were all back in order and never had a problem finding 4 chairs together under a palapas. The ocean is quite rough but made it all the more fun, the boys loved it. They knew not to go down there without one of us with them because of the danger they could be in from undertow. We were never allowed to get any of the snorkel gear as we were told the water was too rough but we used the boogie boards on many occasions and my guys took advantage of the parasailing offered at the beach( extra $$$) $ 45 for a single of $40 for tandem which is quite reasonable. I realize I am jumping everywhere with this but I have so much to say and I didn't prewrite anything this is it in the rough. The stores in the hotel are very overpriced and we just didnt bother shopping there after a $22 munchie stop the first time. The professional photographers were fantastic . I wanted to get pics done but my husband isn't one to pose. The Punta Blanca shopping mall that you can get to from the hotel can be slightly intimidating at first but get bartering and have fun. The rule of thumb is automatically knock off 75% of there first offer and if they don't come back with the numbers you like, then walk away and you will get your price.We travelled thu West Jet and they were amazing, out tour rep met us at the hotel the next morning and we booked our excursions, were always picked up on time for everytrip and also the trip back to the airport where she made she we got standing in the right line for our luggage ect. Preey painless. I know I am missing a thousand things but please feel free to ask me anything. We originally emailed ahead to the resort and told Richard of our plans and everything was made very special for us

<Author>Yorf
<Content>Disappointing Not as good as presented by trip advisor reviewers. Before every trip, I review the comments and ratings provided on this site for my desired destination. The data compiled on this site has proven very accurate in the past. Sure you can get some overly positive or negative reviews but usually you can pick up trends to help you understand what the resort is really like. For the first time, I have found that the information provided by the majority of the reviewers for the Majestic resort does not match what I experienced first hand. Normally, I would not provide my own review because I would only be repeating what had been said by other reviewers. But in this case, I felt it necessary to balance things out a little and perhaps save some other innocent travelers the great feelings of disappointment that my family and I felt during our trip to the Majestic. But then again, if mosquitos, musty smelling water damaged rooms, worn out recreational equipment, dirty fitness room, poorly constructed buildings, unhelpful front desk personnel, noisy outside closet doors, unprofessional night time entertainment, and last but not least food that will probably make you ill is your thing then this is the place to go. If you are lucky, you might get one of the good rooms. They must exist because reviewers have documented how if you complain loud and hard enough they will move you to another better room. Unfortunately, we didn't have such luck.Basic information: Duration of vacation was one week. Starting December 27, 2007 and ending January 3, 2008. The weather was pretty good. Plenty of hot temperatures for water activity and just a little rain on one day. Stayed in room 1337. So, that's building number 1 on the third floor in room 37. It should be noted that there are 4 buildings and for the most part they are only 3 stories high. But in spots there are 4 floors. Our room was in one of the locations were there was another floor above us.First, I will start with positives that are not directly related to the resort. The beach was and is amazing. Also the water is pretty rough. I like that because I find it fun to frolic in the waves. So did my son. However, this can be viewed as negative for families with young children. It can be very dangerous. Two adults drowned on December 28th. So you have to be careful. This occurred off the beach at the Excellence. For the record, the Excellence is quite a distance north of the Majestic. The water was rough as far as I could walk in both north and south directions.I enjoy walking the beach. I walked both north for an hour on one day and south for an hour another day and in both cases never reached the end of the beach. This leads to the next group of positives, items directly related to the resort. Location. I liked where the resort was located. To the south there is resort after resort and to the north you can walk on the beach where they are a couple of resorts then new a giant resort that's under construction and eventually parts where there are no resorts at all. Just wild beach with all sorts of garbage laying around. I counted two refrigerators a basketball and hundreds of plastic bottles. I liked the beach but not the garbage. I can't blame the Majestic for that however.Lobby is very attractive. The grounds at the Majestic are very nicely landscaped. The pool is large and it is worked into the grounds in a way that is very appealing. Generally, the grounds are kept pretty clean. I was happy with the cleaning staff with regards to daily maid service. We were there for New Year's and the fireworks display was good. Also, the New Year's buffet was well done.I can't speak about all the rooms but the variant that we had was very spacious and most everything worked as it should. No blocked drains, broken toilets, leaky taps, etc. as reported in other reviews. Oops, sorry there was a problem with the balcony door not always closing and locking properly. Note: Air Conditioner is designed to only operate when door is closed and locked. Our room had a partial ocean view and it was no where near the construction site.Now for the negatives. The room was the biggest disappointment. Stinky. Very musty smelling. Obvious water damage to ceiling and arch over the Jacuzzi. Once upon a time, water from the 4th floor unit above must have leaked down and the resulting damage was never fixed. Another interesting initial observation upon entering the room was that there were many squashed mosquitos on the ceiling and various walls. My wife had asked for a (cot) for our son, in the event we could not get 2 double beds. As it turned out the room did have 2 double beds but the resort gave us the cot anyway. We did not need nor use the cot. The cot is actually a single mattress and box spring. The set in our room was dirty and ragged. Considering it's condition, I would have had a difficult time using it. As stated in the positives, the room was big and had a desk and chair as well as a sofa. The chair was was stained and dirty. The sofa was blocked by the cot and we never used it. For the record, it looked in need of replacing and I saw them bringing in new ones but we never got one. At night, there was a constant banging noise. I eventually tracked down the cause and fixed it. There are utility closets in the hallway that the maids use and I guess some closets provide access to pipes and wires. At night, it is very windy causing the closet doors to bang loudly. I saw down the hall that someone else had stuck a folded up napkin into the space between the closet door and the frame. I did the same for the closets near our room and this solved the problem until someone needed to open the closets. I had to do it a couple of times throughout the week. Even though we arrived very late, after seeing and smelling the room, we asked to change rooms. We were given the old line that it was impossible because the place was full. The person at the front desk suggested that we try again in the morning. The next morning our request was again deferred. Try again later in the afternoon was the response. I know we should have kept complaining but I don't go on vacation to have to constantly complain to get acceptable accommodations. We decided to make the best of it. I honestly picked this place because I incorrectly believed things would be at a very high standard thus avoiding the need to complain. However, this is not the case. So beware, management at this resort does not mind putting it's reputation at risk by sticking customers in rotten rooms. If you go to this resort and things are not to your liking, you will have to complain and complain loudly to get something decent. If you do not enjoy complaining, well I suggest picking a different place.The first morning is also when we realized that during the night we were mosquito bait. I didn't know that I was bitten until I noticed a smear of blood on the bed sheet. For the rest of the trip, we spent countless hours before bed trying to kill all the mosquitos in the room. This happened every night. While my son thought this was an exciting adventure because it allowed him to stay up past his bedtime, I however, did not enjoy the experience. Of course we always managed to miss one or two so we would wake up with bites. Just for the record, this island has mosquitos that carry the malaria parasite. I don't believe they currently have active cases in Punta Cana but they did a couple of years ago. According the CDC, they do have active cases in Haiti and in other parts of the Dominican. Getting bit by mosquitos is never a good idea. But in the Dominican it is especially dangerous. Fogging at the resort occurred every day we were there except one. They started like clock work right under our balcony window at 6:00 p.m.. I'm not sure how the mosquitos got into our room but my theory is that they came in when the cleaning lady had the doors open. One day, I was in the room in the afternoon and I notice quite a few mosquito trying to get in through the balcony door. There must have been a dozen or so. This is midday. I've been to Mexico and other Caribbean islands and I never encountered a problem like this. I've seen mosquitos but not in the rooms and not during the day. During midday, I also encountered mosquitos in the men's washroom by the theatre and in the fitness room. Not good.I worked out in the fitness room 3 times during my stay. The fitness room is found in the games club area and it is not kept clean. Besides the mosquitos, there were many flies and the floors in general look as though they are rarely cleaned. I only saw cleaning staff in there once during the week and they were cleaning the windows. I bet the equipment is never properly wiped down. When in the fitness room, I would wash my hands as often as possible. To do this, you have to go into the washroom. All main washroom doors in the resort are always kept open. So all the bugs were in there too. The equipment is average and in not too bad of shape. The one free weight bar that existed in the place was bent and one of the collars was broken. Really, compared to the rest of the equipment in the games club this was as good as it gets.The other equipment in the games club was in pretty bad shape. The pool tables were in need of a good cleaning. The one ping pong table could only be describe as dilapidated. For part of the week, one of the ping pong paddles was being held together with scotch tape. The fuse ball table was also ready for the dumpster.I like to play tennis but after playing once on the one regulation size hard court, I decided it was better if I didn't. The surface was peeling away. There were bits and pieces scattered all over the court. It was dangerous to play on. The tennis area in general was very disappointing. Besides the bad condition of the one regulation sized hard court, the other multi-use court was strewn with concrete block debris. The one clay court or at least what passes for a clay court in the Dominican was in need of some serious attention as well. There were no facilities near the court. No water available. No washrooms. To get to the courts, you have to walk across a bridge that crosses the swamp. The railings on the bridge were falling off. One day a work crew began tearing off all the railings. I imagine that they were going to install new railings but it didn't happen while I was there. Archery was advertised as being available. But when I inquired about it, I was told that the one bow they had was broken.Reviewers constantly stated in past reviews that finding empty chairs on the beach and around the pool was not a problem. I did not find this to be the case. We still had to play the get down to the beach early game or we would not be able to find chairs in the shade. Same with the pool. One cause of the problem on the beach was the fact that about 10 of the shade structures were missing their palm leaves. It wasn't until the last day that I noticed workers installing the palms in some. I also noticed many discarded cigarette butts in the sand from the previous day. It didn't look like they do much in the way of a clean up. For example, I didn't see any rake marks. Other resorts that I've been to rake the entire beach overnight.I noticed some large crack in the exterior walls in both buildings 1 and 2. I don't know if they compromise the building's integrity but it sure didn't look right. Hurricane damage? Don't know but in my opinion it might be due to poor building standards.Our return flight was at 8:00 p.m. so we requested a late checkout. The person at the front desk said it was impossible. My wife tracked down Victor. I guess Victor is the guy. He granted our request. It is unacceptable that the other front desk staff are told to only say not possible. Again it appears not to matter to management if guests are needlessly disappointed. Another example of poor management is their little passport book directs clients to call a special number to make restaurant reservations. When we called the number the person on the other end informed us that we have to go in person to the restaurant to make reservations.The night time entertainment. Don't waste your time. Very unprofessional. Embarrassingly so. Hard to watch. One show the audio system kept kicking out and the lip-synchers just kept lip-synching. Without music. Very funny for the kids. For those that were still up. The show doesn't start until 10:00 p.m.Last but not least, the food. The unfortunate part about this is we did get some decent food. But we also got some terrible food. Quality is very inconsistent. Breakfast is the worst. If you don't mind standing in line for an omelette(breakfast) or pasta(lunch), you should get something edible. Most of the breakfast and lunch buffet food that is suppose to be hot is not. The food is left out too long without replacing it. I'm use to hot dishes being put on steam tables or under heat lamps to keep it warm. But they are not always doing this. The orange juice tastes like grape fruit juice. The pineapple and lemonade beverages were sickly sweet. The breakfast fruit selection is very limited. In general, the popular stations are poorly located and/or understaffed. The pasta bar down at the beach buffet is setup so the line of people for it blocks access to a main part of the steam table. Also at the beach buffet, my family and I noticed ants crawling all over a tray of cookies. I watched the situation for the duration of my lunch to see if any staff would notice. I warned guests that were about to take cookies from the tray. Unfortunately, not one staff member noticed. My last negative about the food involves how food is stored at the Japanese restaurant. Before cooking the food, (chicken, beef, shrimp), it is sitting in containers with no refrigeration. For example, they don't use the whole container of shrimp for a sitting. So the next sitting will use what is left. This means that the meat and seafood is sitting there for extended periods without refrigeration. To make matters worse, I don't know how long it had been out prior to our sitting. The containers had no condensation on them to indicate that they had at least come from a refrigerator.Besides our disappointment with the resort itself, I must mention that the tour company that we booked with added to the disappointment. We booked with Nolitours which promotes the added advantages of being part of the Cameleon Gold Club. Nolitours advertises a list of additional services available to their customers. Several of the services were either missing in action or just the normal services that all guests received. We did not get a welcome drink, a welcome letter, a preferred room location (unless of course the mosquitos make the room a preferred location), or preferred reservations for the restaurants. As a matter of fact, when we tried make a reservation at the Japanese restaurant, we were told the first opening was after we were due to leave. My wife indicated that this was not acceptable and again after complaining we were accommodated. It is not totally clear what some of these additional services are suppose to provide. For example, concierge service. Other services seem to be just the norm for all the guests at the resort. For example, the Mini-bar being stocked daily with water, beer, soft drinks and snacks. A misrepresentation in my opinion. To top off the poor service from the tour company, we had paid for transfer between the resort and the airport. On our last day, the tour representative told us that the bus to the airport would leave the resort at 4:15 p.m. sharp. We were in the lobby a 3:50 p.m.. At 4:30 p.m. my wife had to negotiate with the Sunquest people to get us on their bus. We never did see the Nolitours bus.As I stated at the beginning, I'm writing this because my experience didn't match what other reviewers had been writing. If I would have known about these conditions in advance, I would not have gone to the Majestic. Since my return, I have notice reviews more in line with what I experienced. I totally concur with the review written by drpdd on Jan. 01, 2008. I suspect the overly positive reviews must be written by individuals with vested interests or the standards mysteriously dropped during one of the busiest times of the year. A time when you would expect management to try and make the best impression possible. They certainly made an impression.

<Author>Paul5485
<Content>Fantastic holiday My wife and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial in October 2007. Overall, we had a wonderful stay.Emily (on the front desk) was fantastic. She allocated us a great room in building 2 on the top floor with great views including a partial ocean view.During our stay, all staff members were very polite and helpful at all times. We left our cleaner a small daily tip which she appreciated very much. We also left her a daily note (which the front desk translated into Spanish for us) which thanked her for her hard work.Our minibar was not stocked daily (as advertised) but we easily managed to get drinks elsewhere and bring them back to the room if required.The room was magnificent and well sized. The bathroom was not at all private, but for my wife and I this didn't matter. The lack of privacy would not suit everyone.Some people complained about the mattresses being hard but we found it fine. Yes the pillows are shallow but they have more pillows available in the cupboard.We had mixed feelings about the food, as follows:The best was the gourmet (French). The soup and steak were both fantastic.The steak grill at the beach was also excellent.The breakfast buffet was extremely good - lots of variety.The seafood restaurant was great.The mexican was good.The Japanese (with reservation) was quite good but our cook lacked any charisma, and forgot to provide a started.However, the main buffet wasn't so good. ALL the food was just warm whether it was supposed to be a cold plate or a hot meal. Even the ice cream was often more like cream!!The late night fast-food place served food that went straight into the rubbish bin.One reason we booked this hotel was because our brochure said unlimited use of non-motorized water sports including sailing and kayak. This wasn't true as you are limited to an hour per person per day which means that we could not have visited the shipwreck (about an hour's kayak from the hotel) as we had hoped. So we asked instead about sailing and they said that they only had catamarans and you needed experience to be able to hire one. So we eventually settled with hiring a kayak for an hour - but was told that the water was too rough. Too rough? I have kayaked down white water rivers and the sea was calm! I asked what they meant by this, and was told that the underwater currents would knock me over when I got into and out of the boat. So I checked the sea and was able to stand perfectly without feeling any currents. Each time we tried to hire a kayak, we were told that the sea was too rough. Unfortunately, we never got to use any of the water activities which we were disappointed with.The swimming pool is phenomenal in terms of its size and cleanliness. There is a wall dividing the pool effectively into two, so you have to get out at one point if you want to swim the entire length. It was a little disappointing that everyone was asked to leave the pool at around 6.30pm. After this time, there was very little to do other than eat or watch television.The games area was not too bad. The pool tables were in a horrible condition but then 2 new tables were delivered during our stay which were a delight to use. The table-tennis table was very hard to play on given its poor condition. The tennis courts were flooded (from rain) most days so we were unable to make use of that.The worst point of the entire holiday was our tour rep (obviously nothing to do with the hotel) but she is worth a mention. Emma, the job is not for you!The internet shop was useful but the connection kept breaking. Sometimes it would be down for days. You pay for 30 / 60 minutes in advance and were charged even while the connection was down. We tried politely to get a refund but were refused. However, when the connection was back up and running, it was a useful facility.If you leave the hotel and explore the local shopping areas, you will get very very harassed by the local sellers. A polite no thank you seemed to work in most cases. If you want to buy something, then prices will start off incredibly high. For example, a shop keeper wanted 200 USD for a small bottle of sunblock. We eventually got this down to around 12 USD.The beach and sea were amazing. The sand was white and litter free (in fact there was always a staff member picking up any litter). The sea was warm and although we were warned of strong currents, we never experienced a problem.We loved the hotel and staff. I would suggest that the 5 star rating would be comparable to a good 3 or 4 star in Europe or North America. If you go with a slightly lower expectation, then things can only be brilliant!This is a third world country and it's worth remembering that before you complain to the hotel about every little issue. My wife and I noticed many people ruining their own holidays by complaining bitterly about stupid things! Just relax and enjoy the holiday!
