<Author>GeekVeep
<Content>A wonderful resort I had us booked at another resort, but after reading reviews on TripAdvisor about that resort (i.e. smoking EVERYWHERE) I contacted our travel agent and got us booked at the Majestic. I have been to almost a dozen all-inclusives in the Caribbean now and this one was one of the very best. We arrived by way of Miami. This is fine going, but I highly advise against it for the return flight, as I will discuss later in the review. Our flight was out of Baltimore and it is a very easy trip to DR. Thanks to TripAdvisor reviews, we weren't surprised by the thatch huts that make up the airport, and we also knew to avoid/ignore the throngs of taxi drivers. We simply looked for the sign of our tour company and got our transfer to the resort. The transfer was effortless and in about 1/2 hour, we were at our resort for check-in. There were no rum punch drinks offered to us like I read about in other reviews, but we didn't care. There was a line, but it moved at a decent pace. When we checked in, there were 3 of us and 3 rooms. 2 of us had our rooms ready and it was very quick, but one of us they could not find. Not a problem as they got the manager in a few Dominican minutes and he got a room for the third person. Be warned - of all the places I've been, the ability of the locals to speak English here is the worst. I highly suggest a phrase book or some translation software for your PDA if you want to have any real hope of communicating with the vast majority of the staff. We always got by and we all laughed as we tried to understand eachother, but I can imagine that if you ever had a real issue or problem in this country, the language barrier would be a significant hurdle. The grounds and the resort are exactly as pictured. The rooms are amazing and just like the pictures. We requested upgrades, but as the resort was booked, we didn't get them. No worries. The standard rooms were great. And even though it says on their website that room service is only included with the upgraded rooms, we had room service each morning for our meetings and there was no charge. No problems with electricity (the outlets look wierd, but are fine for our gadgets) plenty of hot water, toilets worked great. The rooms are entirely marble and wood. Very beautiful. We could not get the cable internet in the rooms to work for us, but the wireless in the lobby worked great and was very fast. There is an internet cafe up past the casino and it charges $5 per 1/2 hour and you get a code so what you don't use one day, you can use another. 2 of us were in building 3 looking out into the gardens and a third was in building 1 looking out at the neighboring resort. All of us were happy. I could see where building 4 might not have been great as there is much construction along that side of the resort. The pool is just spectacular and really is the crown jewel of this resort. It spans the entire length of the resort. There is an area for activities and then areas of quiet. Although the activities on the beach in the morning disturb the quiet of the one end of the pool, it is over in about 1 hour and after that, it's pretty quiet. The resort itself is a nice size. Not too big, not too small. I hope that doesn't change after the completion of the construction. I've been to monster resorts where you had to get golf carts to get from one part to another, but this one isn't like that. I saw quite a few handicapped persons at this resort and I wonder if this might be due to the size and the plentiful elevators. It is very well suited to wheelchairs and crutches. The food was the best all-inclusive food I've ever had. Understand that all-inclusive resort food is RARELY 5-star cuisine. The sheer volume of the food that has to be prepared each day just makes it impossible that the food is gourmet. But this resort had a great amount of diversity at all restaurants so even picky children would find something. Try the chocolate cake. I've rarely ever found deserts in the Caribbean to be good, but the chocolate cake was fabulous. The main buffet is a huge dining hall. A bit noisy. The beach resaurant was very good and had a great variety to choose from. Very few bugs anywhere. Did get bit a couple times sitting out on the balcony after sunset, but not sure by what because I never felt them or heard them. We didn't do the nightlife. We were on a corporate retreat so after working all morning and then enjoying the sun all afternoon, we were pretty tired at the end of the day. The specialty restaurants are good. We had no problem with reservations. The people are very friendly, but I noticed that in this country, you generally must make the first move. And I also noticed that they seem to mirror the attitude that you have when you make the first move. I made a conscious effort to be very happy and upbeat to everyone of the staff and that was exactly the attitude that I got in return. Consequently, I also took a lot of time and watched people and saw that those who were grouch in the morning, or who spoke to them with disrespect, got the same in return. Dominicans are a hard working and proud people, so be sure to appreciate that and show that appreciation and you will be rewarded. I was appalled by how some of the customers spoke to the staff and found it hard on several occassions not to say something. And I found it to be across the nationalities and not just the Ugly American. The nice thing about this resort is that there did seem to be little riff-raff. I've been to some resorts where it seemed like every freak in a trailer park who could scrape together $599 was there. This isn't one of those places (yet). At the prices in the Dominican, I'm surprised there isn't more of a Greyhound bus feel, but so far, so good. Another nice thing is that smoking is not allowed in certain areas, so if you are like me and get headaches or upset stomach from second hand smoke, you won't be bothered by it. The beach is beautiful but the surf when we were there was quite rough. Don't know if that is a regular thing, but I prefer the more shallow and placid Caribbean waters. There was even a strong undertow, so be careful if you are traveling with little ones. We went scuba diving one day. Somewhat disappointing. The visability wasn't great, but even if it was, there wasn't much to see. It was brown and dead as far as coral went. The fish were beautiful, but nothing spectacular. The dive boat is basically just a dinghy. Getting back into the boat, especially with big swells and rought seas was very difficult. One of us has bad shoulders so getting back into the boat was almost impossible. We did see a HUGE eel and that was a great experience. But we only went on one dive since we just weren't impressed with the first experience. We didn't do any of the organized excursions off the resort, but I did speak to a gentleman and his 12 year old son. They had done the dune buggy trip. They really enjoyed it and the 12 year-old especially enjoyed the 4 layers of mud he had encrusted on himself when he got back!! One of us got a killer massage in the spa. He just raved about Juana and how good her massage was. He said it was the best of his life. Based on his recommendation, I would suggest asking for Juana by name if you want a great massage. Be sure to take some 1's or 2's for tips. The staff at this resort are very hard working and certainly deserve it. The minibar has a 2 beer per day limit, but I just left a note that said 4 mas cervasas, por favor and a couple dollars and I always got what I wanted. The beds are very firm. If you are used to a soft pillow top mattress, you are probably going to end the week with a stiff back. We drank the water, ate salads, fruit, etc. One of us got an upset stomach one night, but we don't really think that had anything to do with the food since we all ate and drank the same stuff and he was the only one who got an upset stomach. I had an upset stomach one night too, but I think that was because I had a few too many pina coladas in the pool! Victor at the swimup bar is great and he keeps the drinks coming. Be sure to take a floaty if you like them since they are $13 in the gift shop. And be sure to take an insulated mug since the drinks (alcoholic and non) come in little 6/8 oz cups and the mugs in the gift shop are $12. We have Verizon cell phones and had no problems receiving or making calls. You don't have to dial a country code, just dial normally with the 1 and then the area code. And we even were able to send and receive email on our cell phones too. We did have a problem with reception in certain places. In our rooms, the reception was terrible (maybe because of all the marble and concrete) but out in the open or on our balcony there was no problem. Oh, one last thing; try NOT to have a layover in Miami!!!! I don't know if it is this way everywhere, but we had to go through customs and immigration (which was fine) but once you do that, you then have to go through security ALL OVER AGAIN!!!! When you are tired and hungry, this isn't exactly a welcome surprise. I have no idea why we had to do that since we had already been through security in the Dominican and the customs and immigration areas were highly secure. From now on, it's direct flights for me!!! Well, I think that is everything. Our trip was exactly what we expected thanks to the advice we got on TripAdvisor so I hope that this review helps someone else.

<Author>brooklynbean
<Content>Wedding-Beautiful! Resort-Beautiful! Food-SoSo! We stayed at the Majestic from Nov 22-29. The reason we went was for our wedding. We chose the Majestic based on the great ratings, price, and accomodations. Here are a few pros and cons about the resort. Hopefully this helps others when choosing a resort. Also, feel free to contact me if you are planning your wedding at the Majestic and want info.There were 25 people in our group and overall, the resort did a good job of accomodating everyone. The grounds are absolutely amazing. The staff does a great job of keeping the landscaping trimmed neatly and everything is beautiful. The pool area and beach areas are cleaned daily. The weather was great-a bit windy, but warm enough and not too much rain. Room: We were given an upgraded room because we booked our wedding there. We had 2250, 1st floor at the very end of building 2. Our view was poolside, partial ocean. The patio included a tub (which was only used once). The location of this room is not so private. Because the room was on the end of the building, there was a walkway that many people used to go from the beach/pool to building 2. That would be my only complaint with the patio...not a big deal, but not very secluded and private if you are looking for that. Maybe ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor? The room did have a musty smell, but I think it was due to the ocean being nearby and the humidity. The room was clean, however it could use a little polishing. The mirror was dirty and the ceiling/walls appeared as though they could use a good scrubbing. Still not really a big deal. The minifridge is tiny. There is enough room in it for a few bottled beers, bottled water and sodas and that's about it. The in-room safe came in very handy, as we kept all of our valuables and money in there and didn't worry about a thing while we were out during the day. Housekeeping seemed to come clean the room at a later time in the day (usually around 4pm). If it were up to me, I would have preferred to have the room cleaned earlier. As sometimes we would spend a little time in our room in the middle of the day and needed clean towels. The bathroom issue that many people have with the resort was not an issue for us. We didn't mind it at all. I guess if you are sharing a room with someone you don't know very well this might be a problem. The bathroom area is not completely private. The bed was not great. Not terrible, but not great. It's hard and the sheets felt wet due to the humidity. But if you are tired enough everyday from being in the sun, this doesn't matter that much..you just get used to it.Food: Probably the lowest on my list of cons. The food is just so-so. Everything is bland and maybe slightly underdone to my liking. And while there is a lot to choose from, after a few days you realize the variety isn't there so much. The breakfast in the main buffet was the best meal, in my opinion. I always made it to breakfast everyday! We tried every restaurant except for the Japanese-Hibatchi table. The Japanese restaurant is open without reservations, where they have a select menu and a sushi buffet bar. But in order to eat at the Hibatchi table you have to make a reservation. There are only 3 of these tables with 10 seats each. They have 3 seatings a night (6:30, 8:00 and 9:30pm). They fill up quick. I would suggest making a reservation the day you get there, as they are usually booked solid during the first 3-4 days of your stay. The other restaurant that requires a reservation is the French restaurant, Le Gourmet. It turned out to be my favorite. The beef tenderloin there was very good. The main buffet serves a decent breakfast, but the rest of the meals served there leave you with much to desire. The mexican restaurant, El Taino was not very good. The seafood restaurant, Tres Carabelas, was OK...the dinner menus at all the restaurants are very select..so there's not a lot to choose from. Again, the food in general was probably the biggest disappointment for me. But it didn't ruin my whole trip by any means!The wedding: We chose the gazebo location with a private reception dinner/dancing at the parrots bar afterwards. The wedding ceremony was wonderful...everything was decorated beautifully, completely handled by the staff. Other than picking out my flowers and music, I didn't have much to do with the planning. Larissa, the wedding coordaintor on site is somewhat difficult to deal with, but in the end she did a good job of putting everything together nicely. The reception was fantastic. If you plan to marry here and are debating on whether to spend the extra money for a private reception, DO IT! It was totally worth it. We had our own music, our own staff-bar tenders and waiters. We chose the BBQ buffet for our dinner. The selection was nice..soups, grilled fish, chicken, lobster, beef, potatoes, salad, broccoli and mushrooms and a variety of desserts. The wedding cake was also nice and pretty good. Our guests really enjoyed everything, as did we. The photography wasn't that great and in my opinion, if you can afford it, I'd hire your own and pay their way down there or work out soem kind of deal. Our photographer barely spoke english and had us in akward poses we ddin't like. With our package price of $550 we received a cd of 50 pictures. If we wanted the other 57 photos that were taken they offered them to us a $8 a photo! I guess for us it was easy to decline because none of the photos were that great that we wanted to pay for the additionals. Oh well, thankfully all of our guests brought cameras and we have plenty of non-professional photos to frame.Would I go back? Probably not..but mostly because there are plenty of other places I want to see and visit. :) Hope this review was helpful for those who are considering a vacation or wedding at the Majestic Colonial.

Go to Majestic Colonial Punta Cana and you will not be sorry, but do what i did after reading all the reviews and pack some pillows and you too will have no complaints. Happy Traveling Elaine

<Content>Majestic Colonial Beautiful with great people We returned from the Majestic on November 20th and I am finally getting around to my review. As many others have said you just need to know your own stomach and what it can take. The steak house was a great place to eat. I loved the filet mignon and the Caesar salad. The service here was very good. Our glasses both water and wine were always full. The only other place that we ate was the buffet. The best time to go there is right after it opens. We found this true for both lunch and dinner. I don鈥檛 recommend the beach restaurant for either breakfast or lunch the selection was not as big as the main buffet. We did have some occasions where we had to grab someone鈥檚 attention to get water refilled or tea in the morning, but it was not a big deal.Our room was 2246 which I requested from Emily before we arrived and she was nice enough to accommodate us. The view from this room is incredible. We overlooked the pool right by the swimup bar and had a view of the ocean. When the sliding door was open you could hear the music from the bar but when it was closed it was totally silent. We had a problem with a leak in the ceiling above the Jacuzzi, we called it in and someone was up there within minutes and got it fixed. That was the only problem that we encountered. Our room did have a musty smell to it and unfortunately I forgot the air freshener but we eventually got used to it. I highly recommend bringing one just in case. We asked for extra pillows and received them without a problem. I slept fine in the beds and the air conditioning was plenty cool. Our room was cleaned perfectly each day and our wet bar filled. We tipped both the maid and the man that filled the wet bet bar each day as well as leaving them little gifts now and then. Whenever we met up with them they smiled and offered a big thank you for both. The maid came early a couple days but found that I enjoy sleeping so our room was cleaned in the afternoon and was ready for us when returned from our day at the pool. My favorite part of the room was the shower. It was so big and the water pressure was great. The small toilet are did not bother me at all although my husband bumped hi arm a couple times but only complained about it once. This room is on the ocean end so you do have a walk to the lobby and the buffet but it was good exercise.We went to both the Michael Jackson show and the Ultimate couple show. Both were good. The couple show was really funny, they take people from the audience and they compete against each other. The service in the theater was great. We had barely sat down and someone was there taking our drink order. After the Michael Jackson show we went to the disco where we had a great time. There were lots of people and good music. I heard a lot of people during the week saying how much fun they had at the disco. The animation team comes there after the show and really helps getting the crowd into it. Now that I have mentioned the animation team I have to say that they were the best part of our vacation. They were at the pool every day at 10 and then again at 4 and full of enthusiasm. I read so many reviews with people raving about the animation team and really never thought that I would feel the same. We have been to Mexico and the entertainment team there really wasn鈥檛 anything to brag about. This group is just wonderful. They created games each day and got people involved. They really encouraged people to participate which was good because it was a good way to meet people. We had a lot of fun with all of them and really appreciate all of there hard work and their great personalities. I could not get over how hard and how long they work each day. Like I said before they arrived at the pool at 10 and them were at the disco which opens at 11 and I鈥檓 not sure what time they left but it was late. We really got to know Miguel, Pablo and Jesus. We had the pleasure of teaching Pablo how to play cribbage. We want all of them to know how much we appreciated their friendship while we were there. In my opinion the animation team made the resort. As others say you can not say enough about them.We would also like to say that the bar staff was great at all of the bars we went to. During the day our bar was the pool bar with Ernesto, Rosa and Ismael (?sp). There were all very friendly and greeted us each day with a smile and great service. At night we went to the lower lobby bar where we met Pablo and Francis (a.k.a. Spiderman) We really got to know Pablo, he was my man for making a mean dirty martini and always kept the mamajuana coming for my husband. Pablo was able to chat with people from many different countries. He made it a point to learn some part of the language. Meeting him was best part of our trip, it was sad saying goodbye. The upper lobby bar was also a good place to go and there you can meet Freddy another wonderful person. We had great service at all of the bars that we went to. They get very busy and you may have to wait a bit for your drink but remember you are on vacation.Well I think I have said everything that I can. I definitely recommend this resort. If you go there with a positive attitude and take the good with the bad you will have a great time. One thing I forgot to mention we walked to the market on the beach. It is quite far, we guessed 1 陆 - 2 miles each way. It is a nice walk and you get to see a bunch of resorts on the way. The market had some good things and the people were not rude at all. Be prepared to bargain though. Everything started at $65 US for me.Thanks for a great time.Kim and Gary (Mr Andrea Agassi as Miguel dubbed him)

<Author>Mag1006
<Content>My Majestic Vacation... I stayed with my boyfriend at the Majestic from November 18 to 25. I chose this hotel over many other 5 star hotels because of its very positive reviews and so I was willing to pay a little extra.Overall, I was happy with our vacation. The hotel itself is just beautiful and very well kept. At night it looks even nicer with all the lighting. The rooms look exactly like on the pictures on the hotel's website. We were lucky to have a nice view of the pool from our balcony. I didn't find the room smelt funny or anything. When we arrived however, they initially gave us a room with two queen beds although I'm not sure why because they had another room a few doors down available with a King size bed - but they let us switch no problem.Beach was great too. When my boyfriend and I went for walks down the beach some of the hotel's beaches weren't as clean as ours so we were happy with our beach.Staff was very friendly, but it is true that the ladies that work at the casino look depressed! They just refuse to smile but we had a regular poker lady named Luchy who after a few days got to know the regulars and seemed to have a good time with us.The evening shows were very entertaining and fun to watch every night at 10:00 pm in the theatre.My only complaints with this hotel are 1- the food which I found to be MEDIOCRE. The 2 restaurants which you have to make reservations for (Le Gourmet and the Japanese Matsuri one) were pretty good. The rest were ALRIGHT. I know I can't expect too much because it's the Dominican and it's a very poor country but I was hoping it would be a little better than it was. 2 - the drinks weren't very good. They either just didn't taste like they were supposed to or were watered down. It was pretty much all their domestic stuff, nothing I've seen or tasted before. So when we drank we took shots instead. They had some familiar alcohol at the casino that I saw like Smirnoff and Grey Goose but you had to pay extra for those. And finally 3 - we just got devoured by mosquitos or SOMETHING in our room at night. I was covered in literally 28 bumps that I could count on my body and they were itchy as hell!Overall, I think this hotel is a 4 out 5. It's a wonderful hotel and we had lots of fun. No regrets booking this hotel.

<Author>katie139
<Content>Incredibly Majestic We are a couple in our mid 20s who travelled to Punta Cana Nov 18-25. I have been to Punta Cana before and loved it which is why we returned. I read all the reviews on this website and chose the Majestic Colonial based on that and we were not dissapointed.FLIGHTWe booked through selloffvacations and had a Sunwing Holiday. We flew zoom airlines to Punta cana leaving at 10 am. The flight was long and we pre booked our seats so that we could have 6 extra inches of leg room which was well worth it. The service and food was good. AIRPORTWe arrived in Punta Cana at 7 pm at night. We were the only plane to arrive at that time so going through the airport was quick in easy. We quickly got our bags and hopped a cab to the resort. I didn't want to wait for the bus to fill up. This was easier for us. The price was $40. ARRIVALWe received our cold towel and went to the registration desk. Prior to arriving I contacted Majestic Emely to upgrade to a colonial jr suite. They said that they didn't have any availability and gave us a standard room instead. We were handed English passports with two room keys, a 5 dollar voucher to the casino, and a spa brouchere.ROOMSWe were lead to room #2222 - it was breathtaking. Awaiting us was a bottle of champagne, cheese tray, and fruit tray. The room is amazing. The shower can fit ten people! 4 poster king size bed and 2 person jacuzzi. We had an incredible view of the pool and a bit of a sea view. You also have your two yellow beach towels awaiting you in your room. You trade these in for cards at the end of your stay.BEACHINCREDIBLE!! White sand, no rocks, warm water. There are fun waves! one day the waves were HUGE! We boogie boarded and had a lot of fun:) There are maybe 2 rocks in the sea otherwise the water is clear. It is beautiful. It could be a little windy but otherwise, it was great. One day we walked probably 12 km down the beach (to the west). We walked past a market and all the way to the town of Corticeito (spelling?) and went to the supermercado there. I love how you can walk the beach for miles. It was great. POOLBreathtaking. You can walk for miles it seems. Great swim up bar where are the activities are. There is a a hot tub in the spa. The pool is warm and an average of 3'9 deep. BARSThere are bars everywhere. One beach bar that is in the La Hispanola restaurant. There is 2 amoung the pool area and one before the lobby where a band performs every night. There is on in the lobby which is beautiful, one by the registration desk, one in the theatre and of course in the disco and casino. Always able to get drinks to matter what. The champagne was all inclusive as well as the as much beer as you could drink. Some premium brands were available such as smirnoff vodka or canadian club. The service was good. FOOD The food was overall okay. I had some tummy trouble a couple of days before going but I have a sensitive stomach. Definitly go to the Tapanyaki restaurant. The food there is incredible. I loved the warm crousants, banana milkshakes, made to order crepes and the fresh squeezed OJ at the morning buffett. I loved the pizza at the lunch buffet. The Pumpkin soup at le gourmet was great and the chauteubriand at the rodeo steakhouse was wonderful. DRINKSReally good! The frozen lemonade is great with vodka or rum. The dirty monkey tastes like a chocolate banana milkshake made with rum. The champagne is good:) Also, go to the lobby bar and try the Pablo special! The majestic cocktail tastes like an orange creamsickle! Overall the drinks were excellent. I read a review earlier that you couldn't get bottle of champagne to your room. We only had to buy one bottle and it was because it was above premium. Otherwise, we just went to the disco and were given a bottle of the Rothenburg champagne and two glasses whenever we wanted. We had many a beautiful evening on the beach with that. Just be friendly and nice to these great people and they will treat you really well. We never had a problem getting a bottle of champagne and we got many.ENTERTAINMENTAwesome. The animation team work hard to entertain everyone. The shows were very good. Sunday was Micheal Jackson and it was excellent. They actually do the thriller dance dressed as zombies! Awesome. Monday was ideal couple where they get couples from the audience do fun games to be named the Ideal couple. Tuesday was the Circus show with fire throwers, trapeze acts and all kinds of gymnastics. It was amazing. Wednesday was Miss Majestic. They pulled a bunch of women from the audience to compete to get the title. Thursday was the 70/80s rewind. A dance troupe is in and does the show. It was really good. Friday was Men vs Women. Another audience participation show. Saturday was the international show where a dance troupe comes in and does dances from all over the world. It too was quite good. The animation staff head to the disco after to get people to do the Taki- taki dance. Its fun. The disco was pretty good and there were a few people in there right after the show then it would quiet down. It's open till 6 am.  CASINOWe were there every night and they were pretty fair. The dealers are good and understand the games. Bar service is great too. Anna is the cooler so watch out for her:) EXCURSIONSWe made our own one day when we walked to Corticeito and then cabbed to the Hard Rock Cafe. Food there was okay but we got some goodies. There is a high priced shopping centre there as well. Better off going to the mini mart at the resort.We also did the Marinarium tour. Its a half day one where you go snorkelling, swim with sharks and sting rays and then hit up a natural pool. At first it was a bit chaotic and frustrating. Snorkelling with the nurse sharks was surreal! Really awesome experience. The natural pool is the most beautiful thing i have ever seen. It was incredible. They really worked hard on the boat to entertain. SHOPPINGThere is a market about 30 minutes down the west beach. There is a lot of bartering needed for that. There is a mini mart and a bunch of shops in the resort. I found it easier to just shop there. I hate bartering. They have everything but it is true about the little conviences we might forget at home. It is quite expensive. the suntan lotion is $15 USD. WEATHEROverall it was great. We had two hours of rain one morning then it was beautiful. We had half an hour one after noon and one day of cloudy/ rainy weather. Overall it was really good.OverallWe had an amazing vacation. we met a lot of great people from all over and found the dominican people to be incredible. This hotel is truly a 5 star. The service was amazing and the hotel itself incredible. We would return in a heartbeat! LITTLE POINTS*you can book a professional photography session for FREE. They follow you around for 2 hours and take pictures of you all over the resort in different poses. It then costs $8 a photo to get them put on a CD or $10 for 8x10s. They took 175 pics of us and offered us all of them on a cd with 5x7 copies for $800. *The service at the steak/ seafood restaurant isn't the best.*spa is wonderful. The average cost for a massage is $80 USD*there is a bank machine in the front lobby that hands out pesos only. It is on average 30 pesos to $1 *I do not believe that the room upgrades are worth it. The swim up rooms are not private enough to use the jacuzzi.* Building 2 is the best. You get beautiful views of the pool* NOT a great place for singles. A lot of couples here. We met a couple of singles there with weddings but they had a hard time meeting people.*there are about two weddings a day but they looked beautiful*we tried to get late check out as we didn鈥檛 leave till 930 at night but it was not available. They had our stuff put in a room beside the front desk and they have many shower rooms available to use as well. They let us keep our towel cards for the beach and we never turned them back in. They told us not to worry about it. This place is incredible and my third all inclusive. I would return in heartbeat:)

<Author>CharHollywood_Fl
<Content>Not Majestic.........at all We went to the Majestic for my brothers wedding. Apart from the wedding the trip was a bust. 36 people went and more than half of us got sick and stayed sick the entire time (we named it DR butt). In fact, I have been home a week and my intestines are still cramping. Aside from the medicore food and the cheap liquor, we were ripped off by hotel staff members. Here's the scam. If you go to the tour desk before there are tour operators are there (before 9:00 am) a hotel staff member complete with (picture) ID, receipt book and guest list and uniform will approach you about an excursion and take your deposit, even tell you where to wait and give you a receipt. When you go to the tour desk to ask what's taking so long. You show your receipt, they tell you Majestic doesn't book excursions. Juan took our deposit for 6 people (one of them the groom). The hotel did not reimburse us, nor did they put us on another tour. In fact, I felt, put them blame on us. After hours of arguing, we asked that they call the police, they refused. When I asked them how to dial the police myself, they would not tell me either. I found out later it is 911 (just an fyi). Aside from that, if you bring your lap top, be advised that hotel staff can and will hack into it and view the information you are viewing too (as they did my nephew's banking info). Then there is the casino. You really need to know the game you are playing, how much you are betting and how much you would win. Casino dealers will pay you incorrectly, take your money when you win and then say, No comprende. We did get them to rewind the tape and pay us correctly, once. The Majestic really made an impression on us. Their refusal to help us (their guests, who brought 30 other people) leads us to believe these incidents are not isolated. They know it goes on and they do not care. If you go be very cautious. PS. You can jimmy the in room safes open very easily. Do not be lured into a false sense of security.

Main lobby bar on ground floor had slow service and we found that they were looking for tips here. Plaza bar was wonderful to sit and listen to the sax and piano player. We also found live music at the beach one night.ENTERTAINMENTWe aren't into daily activities, but it always seemed like there was something going on near the swim up bar in the afternoons. We watched the Michael Jackson Show, Circus Dream, and the 70/80's rewind show. Jackson and Circus were excellent. 70/80's not so good. We chose to skip the Miss Majestic, Men vs, Women, etc. Casino looked fun...not our thing either. Disco was amazing I'm sure...but we were on our honeymoon, more interested in relaxation. Didn't use the spa, but it looked pretty posh.RESTAURANTSI don't see what the problem is here. Anyone who didn't like the food, must not like food. The food was great, we gained like 5 lbs. each! Buffet was excellent for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The beach restaurant was efficient for lunch. The made to order pasta at each of these restaurants was awesome. Your water glass was never below half full, as well as wine or whatever you were drinking. We ate at Taino (Caribbean and Dominican), Le Gourmet, The Japanese Grill show, and the Steakhouse. All of the food was wonderful. It is important to mention that we did not recieve our soup course at Le Gourmet, and they also forgot my husband's appetizer at the Steakhouse. Nothing will ever be perfect. Food, overall, superb!!STAFFOverall quite good service, at times you could feel like you were being ignored at the bars. Our patio door did not lock on arrival, took two times of asking to get it fixed. Most of the staff were very happy and helpful. It's like anywhere though, you can't expect everyone to be in the best of moods all the time. Language barrier not really a problem.TOUR AND SHOPPINGWe took the Outback Safari, I recommend this tour so much!! You got to see more than I ever expected. You will not see the Dominican unless you go on a tour like the Safari. Plantations, crocodiles, beaches, mountains.....also a great way to buy cigars at the Rum Shack (prices in shop at resort are very high, on the tour they are very reasonable.)Shopping market right ouside the resort and to your right. It's called Punta Blanca. Also down the beach to your right about a half an hour is one of the markets on the beach. Bargain, bargain, bargain! Use US currency.WHEWWWWEnjoy your trip! You will love it, don't sweat any small stuff. Just look around and catch the Vacation Spirit. Majestic Colonial is 5* and I would return again. I like new experiences and new places, but I think it will be impossible to match the Majestic when I return to Punta Cana. Hope you have as awesome weather as we did!!RELAX AND ENJOY

<Author>MCC27
<Content>Mixed feelings We stayed at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana from Nov. 10 to Nov. 17. Overall, it was a great experience, though there is certainly room for improvement. Pros: - the grounds are gorgeous and very well maintained for the most part. We did notice some signs of wear-and-tear that we did not expect in a 5-star, 2-year-old hotel.- the beach is amazing, and there are lots of lounge chairs and palapas. We never had a problem finding a great spot on the beach.- the pool is probably the best I have ever seen - it is huge and beautifully done. - the a la carte restaurants (Le Gourmet, Matsuri, Rodeo Grill, and Tres Calaveras) were all great. We enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Cons: - the service was not the best. Our return flight was not leaving until 10 pm, so we tried to arrange for a late check-out, paying the $40 fee. You would not believe the hassle - every time we went to talk to them they asked us to come back later or the next day, wait for a supervisor that never seemed to be around, etc. We did eventually get our late check-out - on the very last day, hours before we were supposed to leave the hotel. We were not impressed. Room service was also hit-and-miss, occasionaly forgetting wash cloths, soap, coffee, or sugar. We came back to our room once to find the bed only half made. - the food at the buffets left a lot to be desired, in terms of variety and even quality. Unless you came first thing, as soon as the restaurant opened, the food would be cold and lacking. - the service in some of the restaurants was poor. Some of the waiters made you feel like they were doing you a favour serving you, and others just plain forgot what you had ordered and left you waiting for ever, and then acted surprised or annoyed when you tried to remind them. Granted, some of the waiters were wonderfully attentive, but service in a 5-star hotel should not be hit-and-miss. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the sheer beauty of the grounds and scenery, but be prepared for occasional annoyances.

<Content>Don't go unless you want food poisoning! My boyfriend and I (who are in our mid-30's) just returned from a week's stay at the Majestic Colonial鈥擭ovember 10-17. After reading positive reviews on this site before our trip, as well as traveling extensively in the past, this vacation proved to be an utter disappointment, please read on. This review is very detailed, but I feel it is a must read for anyone contemplating choosing this wretched hotel.THE FOODFirst and foremost, on day 3 (Tues.), my boyfriend became ill with food poisoning. At this point, we weren't sure from what. We had eaten at the Mexican restaurant the previous night, but for now, I felt OK. We spent the entire day in the room as he rested his stomach. Luckily, it was pouring this day (more on that later).Wednesday early am (3:15am), I awoke with nausea and stomach cramps. Tuesday evening, we had eaten at Le Gourmet, the international restaurant, which requires reservations, where I had the grouper. Since my boyfriend had muscles on Monday, at this point, we were convinced it was the seafood that was tainted. I spent the next 24 hours held up in the room with VIOLENT vomiting and diarrhea. We received medicine from the pharmacy (at a cost of $50) that finally curbed only the vomiting at around 4pm on Wednesday; however, the diarrhea continued for BOTH of us. I was finally able to leave the room Thursday morning after having to reschedule our excursion, originally planned for Wednesday. Despite telling the staff that we both had food poisoning from their ill-prepared food, they were more concerned that we were missing our Sales appointment and called several times, persisting that my boyfriend still come down.We were terrified to eat anything after being so sick, so we ate mostly rolls. Finally, on Friday night鈥攖he last night of our vacation鈥攚e were feeling a little better, so we got meals. Avoiding the seafood this time, I had chicken, and he had beef. Not 10 minutes after this dinner, I ran back to the room with more nausea and vomiting, forced to end my trip at 8pm. We had to take pills by the fistful just to make the flight.WE WERE NOT ALONE! We spoke to at least 5 other couples that we had become friendly with over the course of our stay, and every one had some symptoms of food poisoning. One couple on an off-site excursion said that they lost two days of their honeymoon to the food poisoning at the Majestic. Just imagine how many couples we didn't speak to had this issue.THE ALCOHOLBe warned that, unlike other all-inclusives you may have experienced, the Majestic does not allow you to have bottles delivered to your room, unless you want to pay. There is a two beer per day limit in your room. After that, you have to pay or walk down to the bar. So if you feel like retiring to your balcony and sipping on a bottle of champagne like we did, it will cost you anywhere from $35 to $80 a bottle to do so.... or as so gracefully suggested by a staff member, go drink it at the bar where it's free. If you want beer in a bottle at the bar, $3, but we were OK with beer in cups.Also, we were told by the representative who booked our excursion not to drink the Pina Coladas, as (and I quote), Dominican pineapples contain a 'substance' that make people sick. Why, then, do they serve it? PS - we did not have any Pina Coladas while there, so that was not the cause of our illness.THE RESERVATIONSWe attempted to make reservations at both Matsuri (Japanese) and Le Gourmet (International) restaurants. We were told the Japanese restaurant was booked solid all week. Every night we looked in, only to see more than half of the tables empty. After eating at the French restaurant and seeing the same thing, we learned that both restaurants were grossly understaffed. They weren't filled to capacity; but rather, they could only accommodate a very limited number of people per night. Le Gourmet also pushes very hard for you to purchase wine by the bottle. They scoffed a bit when we asked for ours by the glass, a.k.a. free.THE ROOMOverall, the rooms were very nice and as pictured on the website. The hot tub was smaller than most we have encountered and the jets were very weak, but it still did the trick. The rooms were sometimes not cleaned until 6pm or later, and no wash cloths are provided. All of our faucets were reversed, hot labeled cold, and vice versa.THE OCEANI am not sure if this was due to weather, but the ocean water was nowhere near the color of the crystal blue water pictured on the website. As a graphic designer, I feel that the ocean color may have been Photoshop enhanced in the photos for appeal. It was still very pretty, but definitely more on the green side. Contact me if you'd like to see photos of what I mean.THE SPAWe booked massages for Thursday morning, both of which were very relaxing and professionally done. $80 for Relaxing and $85 for deep tissue. A few points of criticism on the spa facility itself:1. There is a men's and women's steam room鈥攖he men's was out of order, but they told us that my boyfriend could use the women's.2. We were only given 1 locker key for the two of us, causing me to have to carry all of my clothes out of the locker room and give them to him to lock up. It also meant that we got 1 pair of slippers for the two of us, since they were in the lockers, and I had to walk around in my bare feet. They would not budge on this.3. They have two Jacuzzis outside of the spa. One of which was ice cold and turned off. There is also a separate horseshoe-shaped bath area that was also drained/ non-functioning. 4. No soap in the shower areaFITNESS CENTERAs fitness enthusiasts, we work out every day on vacations and have seen some wonderful gyms. The gym was terrible, with two treadmills that would stop at random while you were running due to faulty sensors. The gym is also very warm, cutting workouts a bit short. There is only one set of each free weight, so if someone else is using them, you are out of luck. The man working the gym enthusiastically handed us our towels the first day, but I suppose since we didn't tip him, he ignored us for the rest of the week. He didn't offer spots or any help with the malfunctioning equipment. He just sat there, miserable, or working out himself. Despite this, we still got a workout of some sort in every day. A bad gym is better than no gym. CLIENTELEEveryone at the resort was very friendly. Nearly everyone at our resort was either Canadian or European, with very few Americans. The Europeans were quite comfortable going topless both at the beach and the pool. What was most surprising to us were the few topless鈥攐r completely naked鈥攜oung European girls on the beach. These were not toddlers, perhaps between 8 and 13 years old. Again, I assume this is completely acceptable in their culture, but just be prepared for this culture shock if American or Canadian.STAFFThe staff was very friendly and eager to please. Nelson was particularly nice and looked for us every day. In general, they didn't offer any extra service for large tips. My boyfriend tipped the bartender at the outside bar $20 on one evening, and he didn't even remember him the next day. I would say $2-$5 for good service is sufficient, although not necessary.ENTERTAINMENTThe Michael Jackson show in the arena was very entertaining. I was very disappointed that the poolside/bar side entertainment was very sporadic. This may have been due to the weather, but I believe there was only entertainment in this area 3 of our 7 nights. If you wanted a drink outside at night, you basically sat in silence. WEATHERTo be honest, I am not sure if this is typical Dominican weather, but it POURED all day, every day but two at our resort. Our excursion, the Caribbean Festival snorkeling trip, went out on the water in the pouring rain. We all had a great time anyway, but the bad weather certainly didn't cancel the trip. We had expected a tropical storm that would quickly pass, but to our dismay, the weather was terrible most of the week with no reprieve. Maybe well choose a more desert island next year, like Aruba. :)As you can see, our experience at this hotel was nothing short of horrifying, with absolutely no apologies made by the staff for the food poisoning or the like. After barely making it home, my boyfriend proceeded to the ER in his hometown, where they took cultures to see if it's perhaps a parasite. We'll find out in a day or so. Please feel free to contact me on this resort. This experience was so disappointing; I would hate to see anyone else's long-awaited vacation be ruined as ours was.

<Author>pegct
<Content>Beautiful Resort but not paradise for us The Majestic Colonial Resort is a beautiful resort which has a lot to offer vacationers. The grounds are breathtaking and constantly being cared for and the enormous pool is truly majestic and never feels crowded. The beach was lovely and you never had to worry about finding a lounger or shade area if that is where you wanted to relax. The ocean temperature was actually warmer than the pool water and the beach was well taken care of and cleaned daily by staff. The staff there were friendly and always courteous and always attempted to provide for your needs to the best of their ability. Our favorite restaurant was the gourmet restaurant and their service and four entrees offered were excellent. The only consistent complaint I would have about the restaurants is that coffee is not readily available. The servers would usually pour a half cup and many times it was prepoured and frequently not hot when it was served. (I wondered if the availability of coffee beans were affected by previous storms as I never noticed this at my stay in Puerto Plata several years ago.) Unfortunately the weather during our stay was not ideal with lots of cloudy days and frequent heavy rains that makes your entire vacation experience less than ideal. The hotel has no control over the weather but the little annoyances that you may not have noticed become more pronounced when you are spending more time wandering around the resort in the rain. Be prepared to wear rubber soled sneakers as the beautiful tiled hallways and walkways are extremely slippery when wet especially during downpours.I don't want to sound like a complainer but would like to comment on some issues I encountered so that other guests may be able to avoid them in the future and enjoy their stay more. Room It was a standard jr. suite in building 4 which was a ground floor room with our balcony facing the construction area that was blocked by a black netting. The construction work did start early and several night went late probably trying to make up for lost hours due to heavy rainfalls. (Noise was an issue if you chose to use the patio but not heard inside room) The room is very large and we had no issues with the layout of this suite. The bed was fine but the pillows could be improved. The sofa is not comfortable(if you were sitting in the sun this would not be an issue) and the fabric covering it and the bench appeared dirty due to old stains. The increased moisture and ground floor location also contributed to increased number of centipede/inchworm type creatures found inside our room throughout our stay. (The rooms were cleaned excellent by staff so cleanliness was not the contributing factor here.) We were unfortunately assigned a room that had a door that would accomodate guests that wanted adjoining rooms. The door is extremely hollow and we could hear conversations of the guests in that room as if they were sitting right next to you. Circumstances had one family with children/baby crying which was tolerable but the last night we were awakened to new drunken guests screaming and cursing at each other several times during the night. When we checked in we were told that the hotel was fully booked so we did not request a room change. I would recommend requesting room on upper floors and not accept adjoing door suite to eliminate the problems I experienced. EntertainmentThe animation team works hard but I only did two dancing lessons as daytime activities. I did use the gym but was disappointed that the treadmill kept shutting off on me after manually trying to increase speed to increase my pace. I chose to walk around the perimeter of resort for exercise but that was interrupted by heavy downpours. The shows at night were not impressive and it seemed like the only other choice of entertainment was the sax and keyboard player who were good but it did become a little repetitive after two nights. No activities available during rain that we were aware of. Medical EmergenciesDO NOT TRAVEL TO PUNTA CANA UNLESS YOU ARE INDEPENDENTLY WEALTHY OR HAVE TRAVEL INSURANCE THAT COVERS UNANTICIPATED ILLNESSES. My husband became violently ill with a bacterial gastrointestinal illness. I don't think it matters how or where he picked up this bacteria but I can assure you he has traveled all over the world including many third world countries and knows standard precautions to take to avoid these type illnesses. The hotel MD was a pleasure to deal with and was very competent. My husband was sent to private hospital for IV antibiotics and fluids by ambulance. The cost of these services were $400 and charged to my credit card. I just by chance remembered that I had purchased travel insurance for the first time due to threat of hurricanes and was pleasantly surprised that it covered medical emergencies too. The hotel doctor did tell me to have the hospital contact the insurance company which I did when I arrived. The billing person kept telling me they did not take any US travel insurances but I insisted they call prior to giving them my credit card for guaranteed payment prior to treatment. She then informed me the insurance would pay but again wanted my credit card which I was reluctant to present. The hospital was very clean and of course we did have some communication difficulties as we do not speak Spanish fluently but nothing insurmountable. The biggest problem was trying to be discharged as they wanted guaranteed payment but were not accepting verbal and written confirmation of payment by insurance company and appeared to be insisting on charging my credit card as opposed to insurance payment guarantee. I actually spoke to insurance case manager several times via telephone and she said they had never encountered this before and she had dealt with same facility on prior occasions. As we finally left the hospital I observed another frustrated family dealing with same issue of insurance guantee that we had. I recognize that this facility does not want vacationers to disappear without receiving payment but when they are dealing with internationally known insurance companies there has to be a better way to a confirm coverage without causing patients and their families the increased stress. I would have been willig to use my credit card if that was procedure to get reimbursement from insurance company but they stated they already guaranteed payment and I didn't want to be double billed for services. I also was not able to receive a written itemized list of supplies and cost of services when we left hospital.I think a variety of circumstances such as the rainy weather, less than ideal room location, one bad meal resulting in bacterial infection and hospital experience will not bring me back to Punta Cana in the near future. If I did choose to return and wanted a quiet relaxing vacation and could be guaranteed an upper level floor without adjoining doors I would try the Majestic again as it really is a magnificent property. Suggestions to the management team at the Majestic would be to make sure you have information and maps of property in English and other languagues for new arrival guests. Also it would be a great if they actually had drink menus at the bars so guests could experiment with new drinks and know what types of beverages were available and ingredients in them.

<Author>Irishfan68
<Content>Great Vacation Location My wife and I had a wonderful week's stay at the Majestic fron November 7-14th, 2007. Here are comments for reviewers to decide if this is a destination to visit.  Cheap Caribbean.com-first time we booked a trip with them, and it won't be the last. They had the best price for us, and were extremely courteous, professional and informative the two times we called prior to our trip. Check out their webpage and give them a try. Punta Cana Airport-has improved it's services since our first visit two years ago. Turinder Ground Transportation-booked through Cheap Caribbean. Very efficient at the airport. The mini-van was clean, air-conditioning worked. The driver spoke very little English, but three other passengers spoke Spanish and translated as the driver pointed out places of intetest. His comment about the Majestic was, Paradise.The trip from the airport to the Majestic was approximately 50 minutes. We had two stops prior to the Majestic , and were behind a slow dump truck for a large part of the trip. You'll understand why if you visit the island. The roads are narrow and not well-maintained once you travel about a mile from the airport. Close your eyes if your squeamish about passing on narrow roads and curves. Recommend you don't rent a car. Either book ground transportation in advance, or local taxis, which are in droves at the airport. We recommend the former, but it's a personal preferance. Bear in mind, this island is fairly impoverished so the ride from the airport should not be construed a harbinger of what the resort is like. Majestic Resort  Spa-very lavish, the upper and lower lobbies in the main building where you register in and check-out is very elegant. The gounds are lush and constantly maintained.As soon as we arrived, we were given a cold towel and a Majestic, the resort's signature drink. Check-in was quick and efficient. Roberto, who checked us, walked us to our room.We had booked a Junior Colonial Suite with a hot tub. This is what were given, however it was in Building 4, which is next to the construction of the resort's expansion project. Our balcony overlooked the construction and offered a limited view of the beach and ocean. The hot tub was on a separate patio, which abutted the building in front of us. This patio, however, was 45 feet long and 8 feet wide with a large hot tub. We advised Roberto we preferred a room in another building, and he accomodated us the next day. We paid a little more and were given an ocean-front room in Building Two. We had the same patio set-up, as the previous room, and fronted the beach. The room was spacious, our maid service was great. We did not experience any problems with the room at all. This being said, we both could see where privacy would be a problem for travelers with more than two people staying in the room. The bathroom area is open to the rest of the room, so if you want privacy, you either gut it out and tell the other guests to turn their backs or go out on the balcony or patio, or you use the large tiled shower to change. The toilet is a very narrow stall next to the shower. Both shower and bathroom have frosted glass doors. Our room had a double sink vanity. Hot water was never an issued. Yes, we used our hot tub everyday, except the last due to rain. Oh, yea, the pillows are not very comfortable, but after a long day at the beach, copious amounts of your favorite beverage, three full meals and the late show, you won't notice the pillow firmness at all. Food: We did not have issues with any of the food, although we both felt the food at Dreams Cancun and Dreams Puerto Vallarta was of better quality and presentation. The buffet offered a wide variety of food at breakfast. Reservations are needed at The Le Gourmet and Japanese Restaurants, so book them as soon as you check in. The Mexican restaurant was our least favorite. The Steakhouse and Seafood Grill both were very good.Service: I know other reviewers have downgraded service at this resort, but we both felt it was impeccable at the front desk and restaurants. The staff hovered around us at every restaurant, and could not have been more friendly, courteous and professional. This was really the atmosphere they conveyed throughout the resort.The bar staffs are overworked especially at the Beach Bar. The only really negative comment is the lack of service on the beach. They only have two attendants taking and delivering orders but they takes way too long to deliver the drinks to you. The beach is spacious and clean with ample palapas and chairs. The water is fairly warm and you can swim. The pool meanders thoughout the center of the resort, and is so large it never appears crowded. Water is chilly but feels good after sitting out in the sun. Your allowed two towels a day-trade in the used and get two clean.There is a large bulletin board outside the rear of the main building outlining daily events and the nightly show. The Michael Jackson Show was was loud, high energy and very entertaining. The entertainment staff puts their hearts and souls into these shows, and while it's not Broadway, the shows are enjoyable. The theater is quite large and comfortable. Shows start at 10am,and last 45 minutes to an hour.Casino: very small-maybe 20 slot machines and ten table games. We won on the slots as did other guests. Check out was a breeze and Turinder's van came early to take us to the airport.Tipping: It's a personal preferance. To us, we feel good service should be rewarded so we tip. Bear in mind the staff probably make a pittance, but still provide great customer service, which my wife and I, who had waitering jobs in college, appreciate. Weddings: Multiple wedding everday. There is a picturesque, large wedding gazebo in the center of the resort, and weddings are held on the beach. This would be a great location for a Destination Wedding.In short, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and will return again.Warnings:Avoid flying in and out of Miami, especially returning. If you have to, allow yourself at least 2.5 to 4 hours in between flights. We had a 4 hour layover for our flight to Dulles Airport. By the time we cleared immigration, customs, and security we only had an hour until our departing flight left. If topless bathing will be an issue with you, then avoid not only this resort, but this island. The DR is a favorite vacation spot for Europeans and South Americans, where topless bathing is the norm. A favorite alcoholic beverage is a liquer called Mamajuana, purportedly an aphrodisiac. It can be purchased already brewed, or with the ingredients to make it yourself. We did the latter and were told by customs, at the Punta Cana Airport, to either pour rum into it, on the spot, or have it confiscated. We did have rum so right in front of the customs staff, we filled the bottles, and were sent on our merry way. Save yourselves the hassle, and by it already brewed.I enjoy writing reviews of the place we visit, and answering questions from anyone who hasen't been too bored after reading my comments

<Author>sapphire15
<Content>all-around excellent value We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Majestic and would love to go back someday. There were 5 of us (4 adults and a 7 year old) and there was truly something for every age and interest. After a long, 2 plane flight with layovers, we were greeted in the huge lobby with a cool towel and drink. As with many places in the Caribbean, the lobby is open air, so any bit of cooling was appreciated. Even in November the temperature hovered in the high 80's with humidity. Our rooms were next door to each other and exactly 1 minute from the beach. As requested, Emely gave us exactly what we had asked for. The rooms are spacious and kept very clean by the friendly housekeeping staff. A bottle of champagne and plate of fruit was waiting for us. Another day we found a bottle of wine and chocolates, along with flowers on the bed and strewn over the huge, open Jacuzzi tub. The bathroom set-up is more open than many Americans might be used to, but it didn't bother us. The door to the loo is frosted, but does not quite go to the ceiling, so it is not as private as most bathrooms. However, the shower is huge and we were really only in the room to sleep and change.The beach is spectacular with tons of lounges and palapas. The water is warmer than we are used to (thank goodness) but still refreshing with some minor waves. The sand is crystal clear white. Strangely, there are absolutely no shells, so walking is carefree.There are about 7 restaurants to choose from and only 2 require reservations. We loved the gigantic buffet breakfast where there was truly something for the pickiest eater. We remarked that the Europeans all selected healthy yogurt and a bran cereal while the Americans were loading up on bacon, sausage and made to order omelets, or waffles or pancakes. You get the idea!The guests reflect the world, with about 60% from North America (lots of Canadians having a great time!!) and the rest from Europe. There was a little topless on the beach, but our 7 year old got over it faster than the 2 adult men in our group.You had a choice of where to eat for every meal and I thought the food was above average for feeding so many. We particularly liked the Steak House chateaubriand and others told us the Gourmet Restaurant was lovely. We could not visit there because they do not allow children, which makes for a romantic adult evening. Drinks of all kinds really flow and they stock your in-room refrigerator with water bottles, soda and beer every day. My recommendation would be to drink some kind of liquid everyday as you do get dehydrated from the heat.The pool is the biggest I have ever seen....and beautiful as it meanders along one whole side of the resort, crossed by wooden bridges at various spots. Bring a floatie if you are a pool person!Finally, one of the nicest things here was the lovely Dominican people. Every person we encountered, from a gardener, to the maids, to bartenders, waiters and front office staff were charming and working so hard to ensure guests had a lovely time. Please...this is a poor country, so tip them often with a smile. They are working hard to improve their lives and the lives of their families and they responded so kindly to my poor Spanish and a smile.This resort gives you amazing value for the money and we would quickly return again.

<Content>3 late 20s/early 30s couples take our annual trip - this time with +s and -s The group: 3 close couples ranging in ages from mid 20s to early 30s who travel together annually.The time: November 3rd-7th (we left earlier than the other 2 couples because of work).Reviews:-Check-in: was a cluster. We arrived and were happy to bump into one of the other couples we were meeting in Punta Cana. It came out that they weren't able to check in as they didn't have a printed voucher which ended up being a copy of their Emailed itinerary. They literally had to go over to Guest Services and log into Email to get the print out and bring it back - hello, technology? Since when can't you check into a hotel with the credit card you used to make the reservation? At most with a picture ID? There were a bunch of other people going through this check-in hell and the cold clothes and no liquor drinks weren't enough to make anyone happy. We were lucky to have this print out but when we checked in they had no rooms available and it was 3:00pm and we had been up since 3:00am. Our check-in attendant was less than helpful, would not listen, and we finally had to demand a room and were promptly placed next to the construction (which we never heard so no big deal).-Rooms: The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and well kept. We were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and a stocked mini fridge which was nice. Extra shower towels would have been fantastic but were delivered upon request. The in-room safe was great, especially considering I was nervous about leaving important things in the room. The shower was spacious and jacuzzi tub in the room was a nice touch. The bed was like lying on a tiled floor and the pillows were marginal but we made do.-Customer service: You found some, you didn't. We met 2-4 really great people at the Majestic. Pablo and Jose were excellent to us and remembered us - many of the bartenders were smiles and fun, always taking the time to talk to us and interact. The staff at the restaurants leave a LOT to be desired. I've never seen such poor attitudes and bad customer service. The front desk staff, as indicated above, were subpar, with the exception of Rafael who coordinated transportation for us via our Blackberry the day of our arrival. Maybe it's the culture, but it seemed more often than not that we as guests were bothering the staff. The spa ladies were superb, however!-Food: Below average. I was SHOCKED at how the food was, especially after reading so many positive reviews. Maybe I come from a location where the food is way beyond average and have traveled to other islands with phenomenal food but this was probably the largest disappointment. After a day or so, we were able to navigate and remember what was good and what was bad and so it seemingly got better. The food at Le Gourmet was good, with French influence but not French cuisine. The food at the Japanese place was good, but this was our most horrific experience of customer service so that was a bit shadowed. Suggestion: get reservations immediately upon check-in for these two restaurants as we weren't able to do the Japanese hibatchi portion of the Japanese restaurant. Taino was a decent Mexican/Dominican buffet and the breakfast was pretty good (aside from the rubbery french toast and pancakes). I suggest lunch at the main buffet as the one on the beach rarely changes and isn't all that good. Also, the buffets are even strict on attire, so it was somewhat frustrating to not be able to walk off the beach/pool and get lunch without changing into clothes. Also, there is no 24 hour access to food - this was disappointing as sometimes between meals you want a quick snack (especially when drinking) and it was not there.Beach/pool: Phenomenal. I have been all over and this beach was one of the best beaches I've been to and it's the best pool I've ever been to. The ocean is like being in a wave pool - a ton of fun for boogie boarding! There are ample amounts of chairs and huts which is excellent. I suggest taking advantage of the massage on the beach as it was so relaxing and beautiful! The pool is SO clean and has lots of neat spots with jacuzzis, ledges to sit on, a swim-up bar, etc... Again, plenty of chairs and huts.Overall: Pretty good. It's a shame that the check-in experience, poor customer service, and so-so food brought my experience expectations lower than before arrival because this resort is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are well kept, extremely tropical and pretty, clean and full of life. The Michael Jackson show was a blast and many of the bartenders were charismatic and a lot of fun to be around. The rooms were pretty, the beach and pool some of the best I've seen. I think the Majestic can easily improve upon some of the things I've listed and it will truly attract return visitors. Will I go back? Not unless someone gets married there (which they pump out multiple weddings a day - crazy!) or the group decides to return. I think there are better places in the Carribean and look forward to experiencing them - however the Colonial was a great time, excellent experience and I encourage others to visit with the understanding of some of the shortcomings I've identified.

We were greeted at the hotel with a cold washcloth and a nice cold drink. Check in was very smooth and we went to our room - 2223 - and the view was wonderful. (Thanks Emily - I did e mail her the week before we went with my request.) We were right in the middle of the resort. and I could not have been happier with the room.Ask for a room in Building 2 (preferably) or #3. Building one looks over a parking lot and building 4 looks out to the construction of the new Majestic now being built and is expected to open December of 2008. It will be an adults only. If I had a room in building 1 or 4, I would not have been happy.The pool is absolutely beautiful and huge. No one played the Saving Chair Game and the chairs were plentiful at the pool and beach. When you walk to the beach bar - there is only one bartender and you have several people in line waiting for drinks. However the shower is huge and you can always get changed in there.This is a wonderful resort and the works are great and I would definitely go back again but this is the reason for a review - you want the good and bad..

<Content>Nice resort, too many room problems, no suites available. My family and cousins stayed here from Oct 28th to Nov 1st. There were 8 of us, 5 adults and 3 kids (5,3,2). The good: Beach was beautiful. Plenty of chairs available, activities all the time. Be careful with kids, waves were great but a little rough. Water was clear and blue.Food was mostly good. First times start at 6:30 but those were gone pretty quick.Kids explorer club was nice with slide. Only a few kids were there. Not really sure how to sign up for it so we just went there one day and played. It's as far away from the beach as possible so beware. There was a show at 8:30 for the kids each nite and they got to dance on stage with Maria, she was excellent. Also, had a very nice Halloween show where they dressed up the kids and they loved it, have to rate this as the best part of the trip. The disco bar also had some Halloween stuff and many of the staff had masks on. Also had nightly movies for the kids.The bands that played at night were also very talented, but loud. Everything there is loud, loud, loud.The bad:First of all, since we requested adjoining rooms we were probably limited as to which rooms they could put us in. That being said, when we got there, they didn't have us in adjoining rooms but they had us facing the gardens across from the pool. When we requested to have adjoining rooms, they scrambled a bit to find us something. The manager took us to see the rooms (after requesting a few people to run in and clean them up). They were fine but faced the construction side. I asked if we could upgrade to a Majestic suite and they said NONE were available. I'm not sure how the rest of these people upgraded rooms (although with kids some upgrades were not available). We asked several times about upgrades but no rooms were available and supposedly the resort was only 60% full. I think they put us in some rooms that were not quite ready or had problems they didn't want us to know about (4205 and 4204). One room had damp beds and lights not working. The other had no a/c and the worker was trying to fix it at 11:00pm at night while the kids were trying to sleep. The phone also didn't work.After the first day, most of the problems were fixed. One other thing, the music was so loud from the stage shows that you could hear the dj from the room at 11:00pm. Guess people without kids wouldn't care.After asking over and over for and upgrade, which there were none available, I asked (was not offered) for SPA certificates and finally received 5 - 25 minute gift certificates for massage which was very nice from Antonia, the manager. The massages were very relaxing. I guess I was talking to the wrong people because everyone else writing reviews seemed to have no problems getting free room upgrades.Oh yes, think someone else mentioned this. The walking areas are VERY, VERY slippery, especially if there's been rain. They have several little signs everywhere saying 'slippery' but still, be careful, kids and adults, flip flops are the worst for this.Overall, after the first night, trip was great. We had no Spanish speakers in our group so we were confused as to where things were and when, especially kids activities. They had a wall listing all of the activiites and times but if you had questions it was sometimes difficult to get answers. Would be nice to have one area or person for us pathetic Engligh speaking people to get info.It's good walk from the beach to main resort where the breakfast buffet is, so you might consider this when requesting a room. Most of the night activities are around the main lodge.I'm really not knocking this resort and it's my first time to the Dominican so I can't compare it to anything else. The first night was hell and after that, we really had minor issues. We were deciding between Sunscape, Gran Bahia (which is next door) and here. Sunscape was too far away (and they had several complaints of people getting sick). Gran Bahia, we were told, was not as nice as here and the food was not as good. I might try there next time since the reviews there are all good plus it's much less expensive since I believe there is only 1 type of room, no real upgrades available.

<Content>Majestic Colonial Punta Cana- FABULOUS! Our stay at the Majestic from 10/20-10/28/07 was wonderful! The resort is beautiful and the staff are extremely friendly. We were greeted by Laura at the front desk who showed us around the resort and to our room. We were also given the famous Majestic Sunset cocktail upon arrival which is really tasty! The room:Our Jr. suite was nice, just like it appears in all of pictures posted by other reviewers. The open bathroom area was not a problem for us, we are married after all! If you think this may be a problem for those you are traveling with, I would suggest getting separate rooms. One thing I never read anyone mention had to do with the alarm clock. When you leave your room, the power is shut off in the room (except for the AC) and it turns back on when you re-enter. So every time we came back to the room we had to reset the clock. It might be beneficial to bring a 9-volt battery to put in the alarm clock so you don鈥檛 have to bother resetting it so many times. The satellite TV was also hit or miss. Sometimes it was working and a lot of times it was not. But since we were on vacation and there were so many other things to do, this was not really that big of a deal.The pool and beach:The pool and the beach are fabulous. No matter how many people were at the pool, it was never crowded and you could always find a spot with lots of swimming room. The beach also had tons of lounge chairs, but you have to get there early to get one under an umbrella. There isn鈥檛 really a hot tub (unless you enter the spa area) which was a little bit of a let down. There is a bubbly area of the pool though that they show on the resort map as a Jacuzzi.The food:The buffet always had tons of food and a lot of variety. The food wasn鈥檛 always piping hot, but it was always good. The Gourmet Restaurant was our favorite. We had the filet of beef and it was delicious! We went to the Japanese restaurant but it was somewhat disappointing. There wasn鈥檛 really a 鈥渟how鈥?as others had mentioned. The chef just cooked the food and then watched while we ate. The food was pretty good, but not stellar. We tried the Chinese restaurant and it too was just OK. Nothing to write home about. The fried ice cream was good though! We didn鈥檛 try the seafood restaurant since my husband doesn鈥檛 eat seafood, but heard it was good.The spa:I went to the spa one day for a hot stone massage and a pedicure. I would recommend everyone who stays here to see it. The 70s/80s Rewind show was also pretty good. The other shows we saw were somewhat boring, but you have to hand it to those guys for trying so hard to entertain so many people from different cultures. There were always activities going on by the pool and beach during the day as well. We didn鈥檛 participate, but it was entertaining to watch. We also went out on our own one day to the Hard Rock Caf茅 and the shopping center adjacent to it. We just got a taxi in front of the resort.
