<Author>generic1
<Content>Good - But Not Great Have just returned from a week's vacation at the Majestic and while it was enjoyable, I honestly cannot say that there was anything special or unusual about the resort. I have stayed in Punta Cana many times and always at 4 1/2 to 5 star resorts. The best resort I've stayed at was the Paradissus, which you would expect considering the price. However I have paid less at other resorts along the strip and found them just as good and better than the Majestic. I am not sure why there is so much hype about this resort. It does not have the best stretch of beach, in fact there are rocks (many) in the water to the left of the resort, so if you want to swim you must move over to the left. I have never seen rocks anywhere before on Bavaro Beach. Most of the restaurants are just ok, the asian one is the best. The buffet definitely leaves a lot to be desired - food wise and atmosphere. The beach restuarant is positively awful - cannot even serve hot french fries - I just got tired of eating pasta every day. The rooms are large - furniture not particularly nice, kind of cheap looking and for the length of time this resort has been operating the covers on the bed and furniture are terribly shabby. There were large stains on the furniture in my room. Also the bathroom setup up would not suit most people - too open - who needs to hear your partner in the bathroom! The shows are pretty awful, the only good one was the Michael Jackson show, the rest of the shows were just awful and I am not hard to please. On the positive side, the pool is lovely and the service is good. You would not starve at this resort, of course you can always find something to eat and you can have fun in the pool and on the beach - but for the extra money they charge it is simply not worth it. This resort is just an average four star, but that's just my opinion.

<Author>BranVT
<Content>A fabulous vacation!! We just got back from a 6 day trip to Punta Cana and couldn't have been happier with our vacation. Casino:We were very disappointed in the attitudes we encountered of the dealers in the Casino. It may be that they are taught to stay quiet and not socialize with the players, but we felt that the overall feel was not fun. The cards were dealt very quickly and there was no casual banter so once we lost, we left and didn't go back. From previous experiences with gambling, it's more fun when the dealer interacts with the players more so than they did at the resort. However, since we did not go there only to gamble this did not put a damper on our trip. Pool/Activities: There is definitely something going on at all times during the day. The only thing we noticed after a couple of days around the pool is that there is no variation in music, which got a little annoying. The same upbeat songs are used multiple times during the day for the various activities. If you tend to pay attention to music, as we did, you will probably find this annoying as well. The staff does a great job getting people involved though!Overall: I felt that this was definitely a 5 star hotel. From the moment we arrived, we were treated very well by the staff and wanted for nothing. The rooms were clean and large; the pool was absolutely wonderful and the beach was as tropical as you can imagine. We had a wonderful and relaxing trip and I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for an afforable, deluxe vacation.

<Author>TimeTraveler17
<Content>Simply Majestic... We just returned from a week long stay in Punta Cana at the Majestic Colonial. For a 4-star hotel, this place provided a 5-star service and everything was available at all hours of the days and nights. The hotel provided plenty of activities during the day and night at no extra cost but also offered off campus excursions for an additional price. We did not engage in any off those. They seemed a bit pricey. My wife participated in the pool aerobics and dance classes every day, while the men enjoyed volleyball and water polo. Plenty of seating with and without shade is available by the pool and beach. The sun can be brutal, pack a lot of sun-screen. Upon arrival, you're greeted with a drink called La Majestic and cool wet towels. You can make this drink alcoholic by telling them to add rum. It鈥檚 offered non-alcoholic for the obvious reasons. This drink is the staple of the hotel and must say, it beats your standard pina-coladas and Hawaiian punches. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful with all our needs. Since the hotel is never fully booked or over booked, majority of the room views will be either full ocean view or partial ocean view rooms. The rooms with partial ocean view, face the pool and that in itself is just as pretty a view. Our room had a Jacuzzi in it. The room bar is complete with candy bars, water, soda and beer and is replenished every day. Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner: The hotel requires you to make reservations for The French and Japanese restaurants...MAKE'EM. They are upscale and the food is delicious. Japanese food was the best, followed by the French and all others are pretty standard. Between those two, the steakhouse, seafood and buffet, it turned out to be enough variety for a week long stay. The steakhouse and seafood place is huge and therefore divided into two sides. They鈥檙e both on the beach. You can always ask them to serve you dinner on the beach with timely advanced notice. You can have dinner under the moonlight on the beach while being serenaded by a musician. Breakfast: Two places were open. Almost like a college cafeteria with different stations offering different types food, but better quality than your normal college cafe. Eggs, fruits, juices, bakery, meat, low-carb/diet stations and cooks if you want something made especiallyfor you.Lunch: There is a choice of few places, but if you're baking in the sun at the pool or the beach and after having a late breakfast and drinking all morning, anything is edible. A sandwich, pizza slices usually sufficed, but there is more.If you're in an All-Inclusive package, the concept of tipping is almost non-existent. But we did leave tips for the staff we got to know over the 6 days, and the ones that went beyond their service delivery, especially the bartenders and maids. Go see Pablo and Frances at the plaza bar. This package includes the shuttle to and from the Punta Cana airport to your hotel. Depending what hotel you鈥檙e staying at, it can take anywhere from 15mins to an hour to get there. Don鈥檛 bother renting a car, the roads are smaller and local drivers are erratic and there is no sense of direction when driving. Nightlife: Casino, Disco  Sports Bar, Local Shows. Nothing extravagant, but still well put together. This is a vacation spot for a little R  R, if you're looking for a wild night life; visit the other side of the island. This place died down around 11:30pm...but started hopping around 6:30pm, just before dinner. Currency Exchange: Don't bother converting, take the dollars.

We have to say overall yes we will return, thanks to Keyla and people like her who can create a great vacation from an already good one.

<Author>AhWell...
<Content>Amazing! We stayed here from the 11th Sept to 25th Sept on our honeymoon. We flew with Thomas Cook airlines from Manchester, flight was excellent and transfer from airport went fine. Arrived at the Majestic about 5.30pm, greeted with cold towels  the Majestic special drink. We were checked in really quickly and brought to our room. We were in 3343, which was in a great spot, near the beach but also opposite the beach restaurant and pool, our view was fantastic, both the beach and the pool area. There was a bottle of champagne and fruit plate for us on arrival which was a nice touch. The rooms are lovely, decorated really nice with a huge four poster bed. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The maid service was great, our maid came every day and kept the room spotless, we used to leave her a couple of dollars everyday and we were never let down. The minibar was kept well stocked everyday with beer, bottled water and soft drinks. The shower was great, it was massive you could fit 5 or 6 people in it, if you were into that sort of thing!! :) We never used the jacuzzi though. A good point about the room also is that we couldn't hear our neighbours next door, outside noises etc which was great., they seem to be well sound-proofed.The service is absolutely fantastic at the Majestic. All the staff (except for the Casino...) are friendly, helpful and cheerful. These people work so hard for a very modest salary, so if you are thinking of coming here, please tip them a few dollars, they really do deserve it. A few names we have to mention are Francesco the waiter down at the beach restaurant who also worked there at night-time in the steakhouse, Poppy and Juan the barmen in the piano ground floor bar, Laura the Guest Services Manager and Hanison who works in the burger bar beside the disco bar. They were always willing to go the extra mile and were so lovely, thanks guys! The entertainment staff were absolutely brilliant, they were up from early morning to well into the wee hours trying to keep all of us amused, well done guys and keep doing that mad Taki Taki dance! Also, go see the shows in the evening if you can, they are on at about ten o'clock in the theatre, the Michael Jackson one in particular is excellent. The pool is really spectacular, the best I've ever seen. It's huge, it basically runs from one end of the resort to the other, with loads of sun-loungers and umbrellas, there was never any hassle trying to get a space at the pool. The beach is stunning, white sand, crystal clear blue water and loads of palm trees, it really was heaven. The resort itself is gorgeous, they never seemed to stop cleaning, maintaining the gardens, sweeping, it really is a credit to the staff on how well kept the hotel is.With regard to the food we found it to be very good. Granted, after 2 weeks it gets a bit repetitive, however the food overall was fine. There was plenty of variety, our favourite restaurant was the Steakhouse, the Chateaubriand was really good. The Seafood restaurant is nice too, we had the lobster and it was delicious. We only went to the buffet twice at night-time, not too bad, Japanese was fantastic, one of the highlights, Le Gourmet was really nice as well. Don't go to Taino, we went and it was terrible, from the variety, service and the food itself it was not good. The breakfast was great, especially the omlettes and the buffet at lunch was fine. We usually drank at the beach bar before dinner, then the piano bar on the ground floor afterwards. The drink was always fine, if you didn't think there was enough alcohol in it, just ask them to add more! Also, a couple of bucks to the barman went a long way and they will look after you with some good measures :) The Casino was fairly unremarkable, it was small but the main problem is the staff who are rude and just stare at you and make no attempt to be friendly at all. The Disco bar next door is a bit hit and miss, mainly because of the music. They really could do with adding a bit more variety, we saw people walk in and walk straight back out because they were playing dodgy meringue or rap music in Spanish. At the end of the day there is all nationalities staying here and it's not really fair playing 90% music in one language. We also went to a nightclub twice called Mangu which is in downtown Bavaro, good craic, 8 dollars in - it just breaks the monotony a bit to get out of the hotel the odd night.Anyway, I have rambled on enough here, but in closing I would definitely stay here again. We met some lovely people who were here on holidays too, namely Gappy  Lorraine, John  Ava, Les  Jean, Tori  Luke, Steve  Melanie and Jimmy  Letha. I'm probably leaving out loads of others, but we truly had a great holiday and I am so depressed being back home. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering booking it, I looked up reviews of the Majestic prior to booking it and I was honestly not let down at all, they really do deserve to be 5 out of 5. Taki Taki!!!

<Author>Fenten
<Content>The pool was the highlight! My hubby and I just returned from a 1 week stay at the Majestic. We travelled with Sunwing Vacations out of Toronto. Overall, we had a great time. This is most definately a RELAXING vacation, which I found to be a bit difficult to do at times. This was our 1st all inclusive vacation as we usually go on cruises (Royal Caribbean). Due to the fact that we are experienced cruisers, an all inclusive vacation had alot to live up to. The Majestic did not disappoint in most areas. The regular junior suites are amazing. I did ask before hand to have a room in building #2 overlooking the pool. After arriving we were put in building #3. I asked to switch rooms and they did give me a bit of a hard time saying I did have a pool view. But building #2 is so much closer to the pool they eventually switched us. One thing you must ask for when checking in is a Majestic Passport. I can't understand why they don't just hand these out to visitors. Otherwise you have no way of knowing what the restaurant hours are, rules about the towels, housekeeping number to call, etc. There is absolutely no information in your room about anything to do with the resort. That was a bid frustrating, but luckily we had the passport. Now for the food. This is mostly where the Majestic loses 1 star. The food doesn't even compare to cruise food. If you haven't cruised before, then you'd probably think the food was pretty good. The Supreme buffet is pretty good for breakfast, but many items are cold. I always got my eggs or omleets prepared by the cook to ensure they were fresh. The crepes were my favourite part of breakfast. Lunch at the Beach buffet was OK. Not alot to choose from. We would have done better to eat at the Supreme buffet but we were always wet from the ocean/pool. For dinner we tried the Japaneese, Le Gourmet, Rodeo Steakhouse and main buffet. The Japaneese wasn't as fun as I was hoping for. Perhaps our table was a bit on the boring side, but the cook didn't even ineract with us. Le Gourmet was good. It was nice to finally eat at a restaurant that wasn't buffet. I probably enjoyed the main buffet the best just for the variety. I found at all places they tend to cook with ALOT of oils and salt. There is no way I could stay beyond 1 week at the Majestic as the food choices were getting quite boring and routine after a few days. We never got sick thank goodness. The resort grounds are beautiful. No complaints there. We visited the Bahia Principe next door and were VERY glad we chose the Majestic as their layout is much more preferred. The pool is incredible and the ocean was fantastic. The resort couldn't have been more than 50% full so there was always a shady spot to sit. The entertainment crew did a great job. They had so much energy! We saw all the shows at 10 pm and they were good. Perhaps a bit long. Due to the comfy chairs I usually fell asleep.We did 1 exchursion. The Marinium tour where you snorkel with sharks/stingrays. That was pretty fun. The sharks were much bigger than I was expecting. If we were to go back to the Dominican I think we would stay there agin. I can't imagine a more beautiful resort or more helpful staff. The food is just part of the deal and it has to be expected to be a bit lower quality compared to cruise ships.

<Author>veggie216
<Content>Great place to get away from it all! My wife and I went to Majestic to celebrate our honeymoon and it was a fantastic trip. When we first arrived to the resort, we were offered warm towels to wash our faces as well as drinks. There was no problem checking in and we were inside our room in less than 15 minutes. My wife and I stayed in one of the bigger rooms facing the pool and with a jacuzzi both outside and inside. Everything was clean and fresh and very bright. We had a simple routine: breakfast, beach, lunch, pool, dinner, show. However, there were many activities you can participate in such as aerobic exercies, spanish lessons, dance lessons, games, etc. at both the beach and the pool. It looks like they do the same activities at the same time each day. Each night there is a show in an open (roofed) theater and it seemed that they got better each day we were there. The club is so-so only because there weren't too many people there. You can also play tennis there and the gym is alright.Part of the package includes free rentals of snorkeling equipment, catamaran, boogie boards. There are other services that you pay for and it seems relatively reasonable. My wife and I did parasailing the last day and it was great ($80 for both of us). We wanted to take a tour of Santo Domingo but that trip was pretty long and we had a limited amount of time.We are both strict vegetarians (no meat, chicken, fish, eggs) and we were worried that we would not be able to eat so much. However, we talked to the different chefs and they were able to create many items for us to eat. In fact, every morning we were able to eat fresh pancakes because the chef made batter just for us without eggs. We did not eat in the french restaurant, and the mexican restaurant looked like it just picked things from the buffet. The japanese place was good because there was a lot of nonfish sushi and they made a special dish for us. The last night, we had the romantic dinner at the beach. Again, because of our diets, the chefs made an amazing dinner just for us. There is a jazz band that plays music on the beach (I guess for the steak house restaurant) but the way it is set up, it felt as if they were there just for us. Our waiter, Omar, was great and really helped make the night special. Afterwards, when we got to our room we were surprised to see that they created a bubble bath for us in the jacuzzi, sprinkled with fresh flowers. We were definitely sad to leave but it was definitely a memorable trip.A few pointers: 1. Carry cash!!! either in DR pesos or US dollars. If you use a credit card, a)it doesn't always work and b)they charge 16% sales tax. There is an ATM in the check-in area and the cashier can exchange some of your money into pesos. 2. I don't know if this affected other people, but my wife and i were attacked by many, many mosquitoes. Carry repellent.3. Try not to forget your toiletries. There is a store on the property but they charge high prices for standard things.4. They are pretty strict about the food timings. When you get there, ask about the timings so that you are not late. 5. Talk to the chefs and waiters. We made friends with alot of the employees there and they would give us advice and ideas of things to do. They loved talking to us.6. Tip the workers. They work so hard and really try to make your trip pleasant. I don't think they expect anything but when you do so, they remember and will help you out more.7. Try to wake up early one morning and go to the beach. It is such a beautiful and peaceful experience. The nights gets very windy closer to the beach.The only drawback I saw was that to do souvenir shopping you have to somehow get out of the resort area. There isn't much other than what you find in the stores on the property and they are pretty expensive. There aren't any snack machines available so if you get the munchies you can buy some from the general store but again it is expensive.It is a great place to go to and unwind. Weather is great and the atmosphere is awesome. I highly recommend it.

<Author>lovetravel01
<Content>Spectacular Majestic Colonial! Two weeks spent at the Majestic was the best holiday I have ever had. The hotel was wonderful, from start to finish. On arrival we were greeted by colonial-dressed bell-boys with hot towels (very refreshing after the 9 hour flight on a small cramped plane - upgrade to 1st class if you can!). Upon checking in we were given a comlimentary cocktail and a brochure/map of the hotel complex. This map came in very useful given the size of the complex. Unfortunately, they didn't provide a brochure in English, they only had French - but we managed. Accomodation: The rooms are luxurious to say the least. The air conditioning is a god-send and is a must 24 hours a day if you want to keep the mosquitos at bay. We had a room along the side of the hotel, but still had a fantastic sea view, including a ship wreck and coconut plantation. The mini bar was re-stocked daily, although unfortunately did not contain any snacks. It consisted of 2 waters, 2 beers and 4 soft drinks - plenty for each day. The bathroom was lovely, and although not hugely private, it was more than adequate. The housekeeping service was second to none - beds were made daily, towels and dressing gowns changed, and on the one occassion when we were missing some bed linen it took 1 minute from requestin it to having the maid at our door! Fantastic. Careful if using the telephone in the room. We bought phonecards, which are much like mobile phone top-up cards. They take off a $1/2 connection fee. However upon checking out on our last day, the hotel presented us with an extra connection fee bill which came to $20 (for approx. 9 phonecalls to the UK).Food: The food provided at the hotel was amazing. There is enough choice and variety for everybody and it doesn't get boring as there is enough that you can change what you eat every night. Breakfast is wonderful - my favourite meal of the day. The steak house was so good we went there 5 times in 2 weeks. The Chateaubriand I can highly recommend! The Japenese restaurant is out of this world. If you do one thing on your first day - make a reservation for the Japenese restaurant (or, make 2!) and take a camera when you go there! Although we missed out on the French restaurant as we forgot to reserve, friends of ours went twice and couldn't rate it highly enough! I can honestly say that we didn't have 1 complaint about any of the food! The only thing I would recommend is that if you enjoy a snack between meals (as I do) ensure that you take some crisps/biscuits/nuts with you as the mini-market in the complex is extortionate! We paid $40 for a large bag of crisps, 2 chocolate bars and some nuts! Pool:The swimming pool is without doubt the most wonderful pool I have ever been in. It is so big I couldn't believe it! Ensure you get down early to get sunbeds though, and pick your spot carefully as the pool entertainment might not be to your taste - we found it dreadful and therefore picked sunbeds at the opposite end of the pool. Beach:Like something out of a movie - white sands, clear water..just fantastic. Trips:We only took one trip - The Dominican Discovery Mega Truck. This was amazing. A long day, but really good. Take swimming clothes, a towel, wear trainers or something (as horse riding in flip-flops is not easy!). Also, part of the trip stops at a Cathedral and I wasn't allowed in as I was wearing short-shorts, so bare this in mind if you want to go in. I would recommend taking water with you. If you plan to do this trip, take some things from home with you to give to the children at the school. We were unprepared and only had our hotel shampoo etc, but many people had pens, notepads, little tennis balls, etc etc - anything cheap and cheerful that young children could play with would be great. I gave them some costume jewellery and unwanted sunglasses etc. I would recommend doing a few trips if you are there for 2 weeks as cabin fever began to set in half way through the holiday and it was great to get out of the complex for a day. Ensure when you go to the Dominican Republic that you have plenty of 1 dollar bills for tipping. It is hard to obtain change and tipping is essential when you are there. We were a little confused at first with regards who to tip, but we found that it really is up to you. We tended to tip $5 after a meal. For drinks we tipped if at the bar all night (maybe $2-5 at the end of the night) and if being served at the table we tended to tip a dollar for each round. It does follow that the more you tip, the better the service! Ensure you take lots of sun cream, lots of insect repellent and lots of stomach remedies! I suffered with a very upset stomach for 24 hours (cause unknown) and was very grateful I had taken remedies with me! Also be aware that european electrical items such as phone chargers and hair straighteners do not work. The room provides a hair dryer. All in all - a wondeful holiday. I would go back time and time again. The pictures are 100% accurate and the staff are very helpful. You will have a great time here!

<Author>PranayamaMama
<Content>Perfect for Families with Small Kids! Grannie, the kids and I ventured to the Majestic Colonial this year and it was fabulous. Things we loved: the beach stretches endlessly and is safe. There are no barriers between hotels so you can walk for miles undeterred and reach great expanses of white sand where few visitors pass within minutes of leaving the property. It was heaven. And the water was glorious. Somehow I managed to get glass in my foot on the beach but I'm sure that can happen anywhere! The pool snakes through the property so there was somewhere new to rest our bones every day. There were always enough chairs and the kids loved swimming up to the bar for frozen, non-alcoholic drinks. Compared with previous resorts, the food was much better than expected (and significantly better than Club Med) and the portions in the sit down restaurants were much too large. The unconfirmed rumor is that the GM is a CIA-trained chef and well versed in restaurant management. Even if it鈥檚 not true, it鈥檚 certainly believable. (Side note to the self-proclaimed food snobs: If you鈥檙e that concerned about culinary delights, why are you even staying in an all-inclusive resort? Common sense would dictate that you belong at the Ritz-Carlton 鈥?not eating cheeseburgers poolside with the hoi poloi.) With that said, the steak and seafood restaurant by the beach was delicious, the Japanese food was excellent (and the experience was fun for the kids), and the Dominican restaurant was a nice surprise (not sure why it was empty each night). On the last day, I visited the spa for a massage and mani/pedi 鈥?and was bummed that I hadn鈥檛 taken advantage of their services earlier in the week. It is a nice facility with a beautiful outdoor courtyard. The only minor issue is that they positioned the building right next to the pool where the water aerobics and activities take place so it鈥檚 not as serene as it could be. Speaking of which, there is a beautiful, small chapel on the site where a Roman Catholic mass was held on Sunday. The chapel itself is really sweet; the priest, on the other hand, was extremely underwhelming (to put it politely). I think I would have gleaned more from his sermon if they didn鈥檛 have someone translating it into English and I could have made up something of my own . . . The Kids鈥?Club was nothing to write home about. Understaffed with no planned activities. Two shabby slides and a tiny pool. But the kids loved the video games, per usual, and my mom and I loved one of the women working there. She was extremely friendly and fun loving. Another outdoor game room was situated across the way which had a giant chess set that the kids enjoyed playing. The foosball and ping pong tables were rundown and in need of repair. There is a large outdoor room with big, cushioned seats that shows movies every night which we took advantage of more than once. Chicken Little en Espanol for the kids and cocktails for us! The shows, on the other hand, started much too late for families with small children. The vendors from the market outside the property come in once/week to sell their goods at similar prices so there is no real need to leave the premises if you do not want to. They barter with you and have typical tourist goods but it鈥檚 fun for an afternoon. The rooms were clean and spacious; the Jacuzzi tub, for whatever reason, is in the middle of the room without walls around it. Good thing I鈥檓 not modest. The tile floors in the room, however, are slippery when wet. We entered the room apparently after the maid had left and my youngest (who is five) slipped on the floor and cracked his chin open. We had to carry him to the on-site doctor and get stitches. Not a pleasant experience at all but we survived. And, aside from playing the same soundtrack for a week (if I never hear 鈥淗otel California鈥?again, I鈥檒l be thrilled), the lobby is efficiently run. We checked in and out easily with very few people in line at any one time. Travel time from the airport was short 鈥?and we were in a tour bus. Very doable trip. The travel home, as is expected with customs and airport security at these small islands, takes much too long with little children. This is probably the biggest deterrent for our return. Overall, this was, by far, the best property we鈥檝e visited in the past four years.

<Author>M1967
<Content>First AI Experience, loved the Majestic! Stayed that the Majestic from 15-23 August 2007 with 2 friends and had a great vacation. Hotel: Beautiful resort and spotlessly clean. The resort is big but not overwhelming. We stayed halfway between the beach and the main building (room 3327) and it was a short walk everywhere. The only time it ever seemed crowded was in the evenings for the shows. Clientele: seemed to be mainly Canadians, Americans, and Spanish...with a few Italian, French, and Eastern Europeans guests. Room: large and comfortable. Beds are firm which is good for my back but one of my friends didn't like it so much. The pillows are really flat. Like everyone comments, the bathrooms are oddly designed; the shower could fit a group of 5 but the adjacent stall with the toilet barley allows you to spread your legs when seated (sorry for the mental picture..lol) The lack of privacy in the bathroom is a bit uncomfortable at first but after a couple of days it doesn't seem to be a big deal anymore. Pool: big, clean, great swim-up bear. Not very deep but great for hanging out with a frozen cocktail. No problem getting lounge chairs but people do play the annoying game of getting up at the crack of dawn to put down towels to reserve chairs for later in the day. If you don't want the stress of that, you may not get the spot of your choice but rest assured, you'll still find a place. Beach: again big, clean and plenty of chairs. If you want one of the chairs closest to the water and with some shade, you'll have to get up early and claim your territory (see pool comments). But if you don't care about being a few rows back from the water, or don't care about having the shade..you can arrive when you want. The water was very clear and with a nice sandy bottom. Gets up bit choppy when the wind picks up in the afternoon. Yes some women go topless: get over it and grow up, it's no big deal; your children will not be scared for life. Food: had no problem with the food at all. I ate and drank what I wanted and never got sick. Brushed my teeth with the tap water but other than that stuck with bottled (the ice and the water they serve in pictures at the restaurants is purified so no problems there). My rankings of the restaurants: Beach side grillBeach side seafood (lobster and shrimp excellent)Teppanakyi (sp?)Buffet (breakfast was great and the other meals good)Taino (good fajitas and chili con carne)Gourmet (by far the worst...all the rest I was able to find something liked but this place was really terrible)Animation Team: didn't really participate but they seemed to be keeping people entertained. They weren't pushy about trying to get you involved but made you feel welcome if you wanted to join. Went to a couple of the shows, the performers did a good job but it's just not really my thing. Casino: small but fun. Played Black Jack a couple of nights. Dealers seemed to have a lot of luck....unfortunately I didn't..lolDisco/Sports bar: went one night, was pretty crowded with mixed ages. Gym: small but had basic equipment. 1 bench press, 3 adjustable benches, free weights and a few different weight machines. Treadmill, Elliptical, etc. Went a few mornings before breakfast and it was never too crowded. There had bikes that you could sign out for free if you wanted to ride around the resort. Excursions: book your excursion through your tour operator's on site rep. Water sports can be booked at the beach shop. We booked a 2 hour snorkeling trip with the water sports shop at the beach (marimana?). The snorkeling is just ok; not a lot of variety of fish but bring some bread in a plastic water bottle and you'll be surrounded by tons of fish. The blonde German woman working at the shop is annoying with a bad attitude but other than that, the actual trip was fine. Also booked a full day excursion to Saona Island. It was nice to get off the resort but in my opinion not really worth it. Travel 2 hours by bus (stop at a tacky souvenir shop on the way) then another 2 hours by catamaran to Saona, lunch there (bad food), stay at the beach for 2 hours, then return to the bus by speedboat, stopping at a sand bar along the way. I wasn't all that impressed by Saona, the beach was full of seaweed and it really stunk. Apparently this was due to hurricane Dean but I've read similar comments in other past posts so I'm not sure that's the case. It wasn't a total washout but it's not something I would do again. Shopping: On Wed. evenings they have a marketplace at the hotel. The prices might be a bit higher than what you can bargain down to off resort but there is less pressure from the vendors. Still bargain as much as you can of course. There is a marketplace just outside of the resort. I bought a couple of paintings there but BEWARE that the vendors there will try to take you for as much as possible. Of course all the time telling you that since you are a friend they will give you a special price. The painting I bought (maybe 3 feet long by one foot high) started at 150 USD...I got it for 20 USD. (I saw similar at the resort shop for 40- 60 USD) I'm sure it cost a fraction of that to produce. So don't just don't offer half as some other posters have recommend. Paying a mark up is fine, they have to make a living, but come on... Tipping: the staff really works very hard and does an excellent job....and most are extremely nice. You don't need to tip just for the sake of doing it but if there is staff member that you feel gave you really good service or were exceptionally nice to you, a tip at the end of your evening or end of your stay is very much appreciated. In summary: it was a great, relaxing vacation and I wouldn't hesitate to go back to the Majestic or recommend it to others.

<Author>DSWMegs
<Content>The Majestic truly lives up to the hype!!!! I just got home a few days ago from the Majestic and I am wishing it was this time last week so I could be on my way there again! I travelled w/three friends and we did a girls weekend at the Majestic and we absolutely loved it! I had been reading review after review about the resort and it lived up to every thing I had read and more w/the exception of the food. So I thought I'd just throw my two cents in and give my perspective of the resort and all it has to offer.When you arrive they give you a cool scented cloth and a non alcoholic majestic. Let me tell you, from the first sip of the drink we were all hooked and couldn't wait to try the version w/rum! The rooms are what you see on the website pics and are very nice. When we walked in we had champagne waiting for us which was a great touch. I had read so much about the bathrooms on here but if you go prepared knowing whats in store it really isn't that bad, My roommate and I brought air freshner and if one person had to use the bathroom the other hung out on the balcony for a little while, it was totally manageable but we knew about it before we went so we were prepared. Be careful when opening your mini refrigerators, the door on ours always flew open and anything on the door would go flying including a glass beer bottle which smashed all over our floor. This did cause some frustration w/housekeeping as a language barrier prevented them from understanding we had glass on our floor that needed to be cleaned up asap and they didn't get to it until the next day but that was the only issue w/our rooms. The beach is absolutely amazing!!!! It was so clean and there were always chairs available at any time of the day. As for the pool, this has to be the best pool I've ever seen or swam in. It is so clean and in the afternoon is a blast if you are up near the swim up pool bar! I highly reccommend getting involved in the activities as they are a lot of fun and learning the taki taki dance was a blast!Now for the food, well that was the only thing I personally found lacking! Coming from someone who has been dieting for months and I let myself off during my trip, I was highly disappointed in the choices and taste of the food. The best meal I had was on my last night at that was at the Gourmet restaurant. Also, the beach restaurant during the day is not that good. We found ourselves going to the buffet for a better meal but if you plan on doing that, make sure you bring clothes to wear over your bathing suits and dry off before putting them on so that they will let you in. As for the nightlife, the discoteque is okay. One thing that threw us girls by surprise was the aggressive dancing from males from the dominican. At first we found it to be personally violating of our space but over time and from talking to others on our plane we found out that this is the way they typically dance and it was a cultural difference not what we thought. Just wanted to make you aware of this if by chance you dance w/a local. The staff and service at the Majestic was absolutely amazing. Everyone always said Hola as they passed and the staff did everything they could to please the guests from the bartenders who kept the drinks flowing (Nati is great) to the maintenance men who were more than willing to let three girls take their pool kayake and row it around the pool (okay we flipped it over too) for fun. The staff was so friendly and so service oriented, they made our stay absolutely wonderful. Last but not least, the resort, it is as gorgeous as the pictures show. You can see how much pride and hard work the staff and owners have put into creating paradise for their guests. With every view you saw beauty and we all just fell in love w/the resort from the get go! This was my first trip to Punta Cana but it definitely won't be my last! When I return I will stay at the Majestic again and will reccommend it to anyone else I know going there!

<Author>gejpeach
<Content>The Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana is a Great Place to Stay!! If you are visiting Punta Cana, DR, stay at the Majestic Colonial!!My friend and I just returned from the Dominican Republic where we stayed at the Majestic Colonial and we did not want to leave!! We had a fabulous vacation there! We booked the hotel online because we were impressed with the photographs and reviews only to find out that it was all so true. When we first arrived, we were greeted by several wonderful employees who warmly welcomed us and took our luggage. Before we even checked in at the front desk, another employee greeted us with wonderfully cold hand towels. What a treat. These were such lovely initial gestures and I am happy to say that the service continued at that level.The resort is situated on a beautiful stretch of white sandy beach and includes very comfortable rooms (with whirlpool baths), a chain of swimming pools, casino, gym, several restaurants, a spa, a chapel, a theater and various shops. You should definately take advantage of all these services. I especially enjoyed the spa. Before we visited, we were warned about food in the DR, however the food at the Majestic Colonial was great. There is a huge breakfast buffet each morning with made-to-order omelettes, various breakfast meats, breads, juices and fresh fruits (inlcuding some awesome papaya and other locally-grown fruits). The French and the Japanese restaurants require reservations and I recommend that you make reservations at both upon your arrival. Both are excellent. The walk-in restaurants are great also. The seafood, steak, and variety of salads were very good. Don't miss out on the Santo Domingo coffee. It was wonderfully smooth and you should purchase some to take home with you.While you are there I recommend that you plan an excusion. There are reps near the front desk that will gladly coordinate your trip. Plan a trip to Manatee Park where you will see some wonderful local plant and animal species including the giant turtles, flamingoes and cocatoos. You will also be able to swim with the dolphins!! Take some extra cash with you to purchase local art work (at reasonable prices!). We purchased many beautiful carvings made of wood and volcanic rock. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the very best part of the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana - its PEOPLE. The employees there are super nice, highly accomodating, very engaging and friendly. Its been a few years since I took Spanish, but everyone there speaks at least some English and was willing to speak Spanish slowly. When you visit say Hola to Angel Viscaino at the front desk and all the other staff there. Everyone there always has a friendly smile for you and will make your trip unbelievably fun! There is so much to do at the Majestic Colonial. You will be glad you booked you vacation there. -GailSilver Spring, MD

<Content>Awesome Week with my Family This is very difficult to write in a short paragraph. I apologize ahead of time for the novel. There is just no way to do the Reader's Digest version. We love the beach and usually go to the Outer Banks of North Carolina but wanted to try something different. It was awesome!!  I had booked through Vacation Travel Mart (looked online and then called the 800 number -- sorry, I am from the old school -- I needed to talk to a human!). They have wonderful prices and Beth was so pleasant to deal with. We booked two standard suites, one with a king and the other with 2 beds. I PM'd Emily beforehand and asked if we could have connecting rooms with a pool view and SURE ENOUGH we did! We were located in 3216 and 3217 and the view was so beautiful. We couldn't see the ocean but that was okay. The little bit of time we were on our balcony the pool and gardens were gorgeous to look at. We were located halfway through the resort so it was always an easy walk to anything that we wanted to do. Our sitting area had a sofa bed that we did not use but in the kid's room that is where my son slept and found it to be very comfortable. We found the beds to be fine and the bathroom situation was not a problem even for my children. The rooms were always cleaned in a timely fashion and the refrigerators were always stocked sufficiently. (We always left tips, too). There were no issues with using our hair dryers and hair irons from home so I returned the adapters that I had purchased just in case when we got home. We had a nonstop flight from Philly which was great. We experienced no problems at the airport and quickly found our tour company, Turinter, and were immediately taken to an airconditioned van. The ride was uneventful (other than making some new friends on the van) and took about half an hour. Check in was a breeze and the welcoming cold towels and Majestic drinks were perfect. Yeci checked us in and showed us our rooms (one was ready and one was not) and then she showed us to the Buffet for lunch. She was very pleasant and spoke beautiful English. Lunch was a welcome sight after being up since 3:00 that morning to catch our plane. The food was delicious -- plenty to choose from to make anyone happy. We ate at the Buffet every morning and became very fond of Juana and we were sad to say goodbye. She was always so pleasant and welcoming and remembered how we all liked our coffee. It was a pleasure to leave her a tip every day!! We received several surprises in our rooms during our stay besides the champagne upon arrival. We had wonderful fruit and cheese and crackers, two bottles of wine, sushi, truffles, and chocolate dipped grapes and strawberries. What a nice surprise when returning to our rooms after a day at the beach!! Thank you Majestic!! I know I am going on and on but I just can't stop raving about the Majestic. It is magnificent and we all really felt special being there. We enjoyed the steak and seafood restaurants and enjoyed eating outside with the ocean breeze. There was even a meteor shower while we were there! We also loved Henry at this site and the many MamaJuanas that we drank there!! Oh boy, are they strong!! The Taino  Matsuri restaurants were very good but I think I could do without returning to Le Gourmet. It was just okay -- maybe I just don't have a very discriminating palate!? The service everywhere was wonderful and the Dominican people are just so pleasant and ready to do anything for you. We don't speak Spanish other that a word here and there but got along fine. I did bring a dictionary just in case.  The beach was beautiful. We always found chairs under a palapa no matter what time we arrived. We were armed with our Bubbas which the bartenders filled happily. The ocean was fabulous. The water was warm, calm and clear but did get a little wavier (not rough) later in the week as Dean approached but never rough enough to keep us out. Yes, there were women, young and older, topless, but you kind of get used to it after a while and you know what --they are not as hung up on body image as we Americans -- more power to them!! My husband had never had a massage so after 33 years of marriage I treated us to a couples massage at the wonderful Spa. It was 80 minutes of pure heaven and so worth the $100 each. We went to the Shows nightly. Some were better than others but still were enjoyable. My children enjoyed the disco and also enjoyed taking a swim in the pool one morning at 3:30 after being at the disco. Harmless fun! They also enjoyed the ATV tour that they took with Turinter. My son had done that tour 2 years ago and recommended that his sisters go with him. They all really liked it and they actually rode down to the point where the Atlantic meets the Caribbean.  It is pretty obvious that I would highly recommend the Majestic to all. There is something for everyone and you can make it as quiet or as busy as you like. We are already looking at our calendar to see when we can return. Thanks again to everyone on the Forum. Your advice and information is priceless. That is why we chose the Majestic and were not disappointed!!

<Author>jms428
<Content>Very relaxing vacation We stayed at the hotel from August 25 - September 1st. The grounds are lovely and the pool is fantastic. The rooms are large but as noted by other travelers there is almost no privacy. The jacuzzi tub that is in every room is out in the open, however, there is a large, separate shower that you can use if you are looking for privacy. That being said, that is probably the only place where you can have a little privacy in the room. The toilet is the size of a pinhead and is enclosed only with a frosted glass door that doesn't really give you any privacy. Every noise and smell is free to wander throughout the room. The food is buffet food and people should not expect it to be anything more than that. The selections are somewhat redundant and oftentimes they would run out of things. The specialty restaurants have limited choices but the food is better than at the buffet. The biggest problem that we found was the lack of airconditioning. The only place that was airconditioned other than some of the specialty restaurants was your room. The lobby is open air as is the theater and there aren't even fans so the air gets hot and stagnant and somewhat uncomfortable. The staff works hard and try to please. Most people do not speak Englsih but why should they, they live in the Dominican Republic. People that expect English speakers wherever they go should stay in the US or go to England and/or Australia. The check in/out people speak some English as does the Entertainment staff who really did work hard and tried very hard to keep the activities going and the pool hopping. Some top shelf was available at every bar we went to including the swim up bar, but you had to specify that that is what you wanted. Unlike other reviewers, we found the bartenders to pour on the heavier side. Certainly didn't cheap out on the liquor when making drinks. The coffee cups was always filled, as were the water glasses, and the mini-bar in the room. Two beers per day max in the room. We had a very relaxing time and made the most of the pool. Bring your own raft as to buy one in the store on the grounds is $10 minimum. If your planning to buy rum as gifts, buy it at the markets outside of the hotel as it is considerably less money than at the hotel The duty free shops at the airport are a rip off and are more expensive than the hotel. Pack the liquor in your suitcase. You cannot carry it through. Overall, we had a very mellow relaxing time. Oh, nearly impossible to win at the casino, spend your money elsewhere.

There are active areas and quieter ones to suite every person's style. One day I tipped the man in the towel hut and he was so genuinely happy. I don't think many people think of tipping people in these lower positions. If you can do it, please do. Food: OK, not great. You will have plenty to eat but will never come away feeling like it was really special. We tried every restaurant and the Steak House by the Beach had the best steak and the service was really good too. Japanese (Benihana style)was one of the best meals we had. They were very personable and seemed to enjoy their job there. The Gourmet was anything but gourmet but you should try it for yourself to see. I only had 1 bout of intestinal distress and that was after eating at the Mexican/Taino Restaurant. It may have been the Goat Stew. The Main Buffet was good for Breakfast  Lunch. One week of the food was enough for us. We tipped at every evening meal and occasionally at the buffet if we had any money with us.Drinks: Good and Plentiful! The best bar by far is the upper lobby. It is kind of a secret I think. Most people don't bother to venture up there but they will make you a great Mojito and the Cosmopolitan's were as good as any I ever got in the States. We never waited for service and never had a communication problem at any of the bars. We tipped usually $1/drink and it may have been too much but they really appreciated it and the need is there so why not.Entertaiment: Fun to watch. The evening shows that bagan at 10 pm were a bit under par for other resorts we have visited. But, that didn't keep us away. It is very hot in that area and they really should utlize fans otherwise you sit and sweat. The seats are comfortable and I fell asleep during the Magic Show. It was pretty lame but the kids seemed to love it. The Animation Team was great and the Master of Ceremonies awe inspiring. He could rattle off in at least 5 languages. Very high energy group and good looking too! We really enjoyed the outdoor live enterainment that started around 7 pm. They had hors douevres and a signature drink each night and it was a relaxing and enjoyable time. Dancing was an option.Casino  Disco: We didn't do the casino and rarely did we see anyone there. The disco was OK but we only spent a few minues there and decided it wasn't for us. The young crowed will no doubt love it though.Caribbean Street: The prices at the shops were really not so bad and the workers were nice. They will give you change in dollars and not pesos and that is a plus. If you don't get off the property to shop anywhere else, buy your souvenirs here because they are 2-3 times as much at the airport.Excursions: Despite what they tell you, you can book your excursions before you arrive and you don't have to do it through your travel company. We found Monster Trucks on the internet and they met us there on our first day and gave us our tickets and all arrangements. It was a great day and we paid $85/pp for a full day in the countryside. I would recommend it. Don't bother going on the free cigar factory tour, it is not really a factory, but a small store where they want you to buy their cigars in large quantites. We did buy coffee and mamajuana there at reasonable prices however. I snorkeled one day and it was resonable at $29. Overall Impression:  We had a great time. It is a beautiful resort and we would return if we weren't the kind of people who never repeat the same thing twice. Jenny from Guest Relations contacted us on the evening before our departure to arrange for our luggage pick up and to help us with anythng we might need. This is beyond any experience we have ever had at other resorts and we have been to many. She personally saw us off too. How could you ask for anything more?

<Author>rentking
<Content>Want the Scoop on The Majestic Colonial? My wife and I recently traveled to Punta Cana with another couple, and stayed 6 nights at the Majestic Colonial. We loved it! Over the last several months I had done a ton of research and read a million reviews about the different resorts in Punta Cana. Several of the reviews that I read were about the Majestic. Almost everyone had nothing but great things to say, but there were a few people who thought otherwise. Let me just say, if you are looking to have a great time and want to feel welcome somewhere, then the Majestic is the place for you.We booked our reservation through the Vacation Store in Miami, and saved a ton of money by avoiding Expedia, Orbitz, and Travelocity. Seriously, it was a lot cheaper. Prior to my vacation, like many others on TA, I wrote several posts about what I should expect when traveling to the Majestic. To my surprise, I was getting answers from Emily who actually works at the resort. I was so pleased that I had someone providing me with great service, and I had not even left my home yet. She gave me insight on everything from restaurants to the water quality in the hotel.When we arrived to the hotel, we were greeted by a man with cold towels to wipe our faces. The check-in was smooth, and we were escorted to our room by Keyla (from the front desk). On the way to the room, she told us about several of the amenities, and all of the restaurants. We had a swim-up room (2138) and were directly across from the swim up bar and animation team (something that I asked Emily for prior to the trip and she delivered). The room was huge and in my opinion, would be considered superior accommodations in the United States. We had a bottle of champagne and some fresh fruit and cheese waiting for us in our room. This was a great way to start the vacation after a long day of traveling.During our stay, I was blown away with how nice the resort was. The beach was breathtaking, and my friend made a comment that it felt like we were in a Corona Beer commercial. There were plenty of chairs available, and it seemed like we got the same spot everyday. We made full use out of the free watersport activities, and enjoyed watching the entertainment staff teach aerobics on the beach. The animation staff convinced me to play Croquet, and I actually won. I was given a bottle of rum by Keiko for my accomplishment. If you see Keiko, tell him Tiger Woods says hello. The pool has to be the biggest that I have ever seen, and it was not crowded.The entire staff at the resort treated us like royalty. We dined at every restaurant,drank at every bar, and had only one issue where the service was sub par. I think that this may have been because they were in the process of closing for the evening. Otherwise, the employees hustled and worked their rear ends off. One piece of advice I will give you is to give gratuities to the employees. You are not required to, but it really goes a long way. We tipped $4-$5 at every meal for 4 of us. We also tipped our bartenders, luggage handlers, housekeepers, and anyone else who gave us great service.We did a few activities while there, including ATV rides, and a snorkeling trip. If you are interested in snorkeling, go to the Turinter desk and ask for Ronny. Ask him about the Caribbean Festival. They take you snorkeling with Lemon Sharks (they have no teeth and eat by suction) and Sting Rays (they remove the barbs, so they have no stingers),and then on the way back there is an open bar with national drinks, seasonal fruits, and cold cuts. This is a must!!Now I want to address some of the concerns that I have see on the Majestic forums.1) Food Quality - The food was above average. It was not outstanding, but it was also not terrible. There are 7 restaurants, so there is a good amount of variety available. I recommend the buffet in the front of the resort, the Japanese steakhouse, Le Gourmet, and the Steakhouse by the beach in the evening. We had dinner at another resort one night, and the food was not very good. From what I have read, the Majestic has some of the best food in the area.2) Bathrooms - The toilet area is a little small, but it was not what everyone is making it out to be. I am a 260 pound man, and I had no problems with the facilities. The shower is quite large, and it would have been nice if they would have given a little of that space to the toilet area. As for the door on the toilet room, they are similar to a bathroom stall. It was a little unusual from what I have seen, but it was not a big deal. If you are afraid of making noise in front of other people in the room, then have them turn the volume up on the tv.3) Bed - The bed was a little hard, but I slept great each night. I was a little stiff in the mornings, but it would only last about 5 minutes.4) Liquor - If you plan on drinking a lot, make sure that the liquor you like is available. I drink Captain Morgan Rum, and was surprised that they did not have it. They do have several other international brands of liquor available. My suggestion is to submit a post in the forum and a hotel attendant will respond back with whether or not you drink of choice is available. Major Tip For You: Go to Target and buy a Bubba Keg!!! They are only $7. Someone posted this recommendation and we did it. We looked like geniuses. It is so hot there, that the drinks melt very quickly. The Bubba Keg kept our drinks cold for hours.In closing, this resort was fantastic, and I plan on going back next year. We live in Florida, and could not have gone to Miami for less than what we spent to go to the Majestic (including airfare). Trust me, book your stay at this resort and you will not be disappointed. I hope this review helps you if you are trying to decide where to stay. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

<Author>skg45208
<Content>Incredible honeymoon at The Majestic! We went to The Majestic for our honeymoon and it couldn't have been better! The people were as nice as anyplace we've ever visited (which says a lot!) The beach was amazing --wide, sandy, white beaches with warm, clear water and plenty of chairs as well as shady areas, for those who wanted them. In addition, I have never seen such a beautiful, not to mention clean, pool. Considering the fact that it winds throughout most of the property and goes to within just a few feet of the beach, I still cannot figure out how we never saw so much as a single grain of sand in the water! As for the food, any reviewer who voices any complaints should take their next vacation to France or Italy, where gourmet food is part of the culture. This is an all-inclusive resort on an island in the middle of the Carribean. There was a wide variety of foods for any taste and you never had to have the same thing twice if you didn't want to. It was always hot, and there was plenty of it. The drinks were well-mixed, tasty and always available. That said, I do have a few pieces of advice to offer:  1. As mentioned, the drinks are plentiful, but are served in small-ish non-insulated glasses. I highly recommend bringing your own insulated mug with a lid (whether you're at The Majestic or any other all-inclusive resort.) The bartenders will be happy to put your drinks in it rather than their own and even if you're not drinking alcohol, it will keep it cold and if you take it to the beach the lid will prevent sand from getting in. 2. Bring a little more cash than you think you need. You won't need it at the resort, but for things like SCUBA diving, they charge a 17% fee on credit cards. Although there were several ATMs in the area, not a single one was working --at our hotel or any of the others along the strip-- the entire week we were there.  3. If you are traveling on your honeymoon, bring a copy of your marriage license and show it to them when you check in. We did and were given a fruit basket, bottle of champagne, complementary breakfast in bed and a special private couples dinner

<Author>Tampa250
<Content>A Very Good Choice! I felt compelled to contribute something to Trip Advisor because it was a valuable resource for me. Therefore, I am giving back to those of you who might be considering the Majestic Colonial as I was before booking our trip. I hope this review helps someone make the decision to stay at the Majestic Colonial.My wife and I, along with another couple, stayed here from 8-11-07 to 8-17-07. This was a relaxation trip for us and also an opportunity to spend some quality time with these very dear friends of ours. My friend and I scoured the internet, including Trip Advisor, to make the best decision we could sight unseen on which all-inclusive resort to stay at in Punta Cana. After finding that the vast majority of the reviews here were rather positive, and using our gut feeling, we booked the trip to the Majestic Colonial via a travel agent for the best deal.First, I'd like to address some of the more unfavorable reviews the Majestic has received, mostly because I know the slight doubt they placed upon my decision-making process. Everyone is looking for something particular in a vacation, and my idea of a good vacation might not necessarily coincide with someone else鈥檚. However, as a fairly well-to-do individual who does more than his fair share of business and leisure travel I must stress that the Majestic is a very good property. Based on my experiences in general when I travel, this resort should most certainly meet or exceed most travelers' expectations. To give you an idea of the quality and service level I consider excellent, I regularly stay at places like the Waldorf-Astoria in Manhattan, various Ritz Carlton properties, Bellagio in Las Vegas, and other properties of that caliber. I am not bragging here, but rather trying to let you know the experience I am used to.With that being said, the surroundings and accommodations you will find at the Majestic Colonial did not disappoint me. In fact, I was rather pleasantly surprised with the aesthetics of the property. In my opinion, it is my feeling that anyone having anything more than minor issues with the physical appearance or quality of the resort are more than likely nearly impossible to please. I hate to be so blunt, but some of the complaints I have read in reviews here are so petty I can鈥檛 help but imagine what a nightmare some of these reviewers must be any time they interact with a service-oriented business. Without even giving the Majestic a 鈥渂reak鈥? if you will, for being in a developing country this resort overall would give a lot of places in the U.S. a lot of competition. If you can鈥檛 be satisfied service-wise and with the surroundings here, you鈥檙e probably more suited for a country club somewhere and might want to consider lowering your standards to something more realistic.Now, I am in no way saying that the Majestic is perfect in every way. However, I feel that the majority of the concerns presented by others here are attributable to cultural differences as well as environmental and national economic influences. I will try to address some of the more commonly referred to 鈥渘egatives鈥?about the Majestic.As for the infamous and regularly occurring comments on the bathroom layout, it is indeed different than what we are used to here at home in the U.S. We stayed in a Junior Suite with direct pool access, and the spacious room is indeed basically one open space. Your bathroom area is in the front of the room when you first walk through the door. There is a double vanity with dual sinks that are on the front wall of your room. When looking at the sinks, your Jacuzzi tub is behind you and behind that is a space that opens to your bedroom/sitting area. To the left of your sinks on that left wall is the toilet and shower. Each of these has their own frosted glass door, and the shower is quite spacious and has marble floors and tile that match the marble floors of your entire room. The toilet is indeed similar to a stall in a public restroom and there is not much room in there, as we see in a public setting. When either my wife or me needed an extended stay in the restroom, the other person did indeed choose to go on the patio for a few minutes. In my opinion this is not the deal breaker that several reviewers here feel it is. Again, I just think that some people will always need and find something to complain about.The food and beverage situation is quite acceptable. Most of the food is quite middle-of-the-road quality, but at every sitting we always found something acceptable at the rather large buffet. Approach the buffet with the mental picture of something you might find in most hotels of upper quality in Las Vegas and you will not be disappointed. Breakfast was rather decent, and had some good selections. This looked the same on most days. Lunch and dinner were also acceptable, but if you found something you liked one day it might not be available the next day. They seem to rotate some of the featured items every day, but we did see some of the staple items were available each day we were there. Food is really a subjective matter, but I consider myself a somewhat picky eater and I did just fine there. As others have mentioned, out of all the specially-themed restaurants to choose from the steakhouse on the beach is probably the best. The Chateaubriand is truly very good, rivaling some of the nicer steakhouses I have been to.Finally, I wish to acknowledge the level of service at the Majestic. Our experience was that the vast majority of the staff here, with only one or two exceptions, were extremely accommodating and seemed to be truly committed to making our experience a great one. However, I must admit that we may have had an advantage- an advantage that I want to mention both for your benefit and for the gracious, hospitable staff members at the Majestic. This advantage is so obvious, it is a shame that it has to be mentioned at all. Tipping, folks. I鈥檝e read a lot about it here, and the offenders we saw might not be reviewers here, but we made a point to observe other people and most people do not tip this staff! Personally, I cannot understand why and neither could the other people with us on this trip. This is an all-inclusive and yes, gratuities are 鈥渋ncluded鈥? However, we don鈥檛 know how, if at all, they are distributed to the actual people serving you. When you鈥檝e basically covered all of your trip expenses ahead of time, I can鈥檛 for the life of me see any other reason for not tipping other than someone being extremely cheap or having no business taking a vacation. We tipped regularly and proportionally, and by Day Two were receiving the Royal Treatment everywhere we went. Sadly, it was at least partially due to the fact that by tipping the staff, we were in the minority. I can鈥檛 help but think that this probably explains why some people are reporting poor service. Something as small as $1 per round of drinks, or $1 per person per meal seems to go a very long way with the staff here. Other than the monetary compensation, I get the impression that the people appreciate the simple recognition of the hard work they do for you. Do like others mention in reviews here and get yourself a stack of one dollar bills from the bank before you head down there- enough to make sure you can tip as outlined above for the number of people in your party. I spent less than $100 on tipping for the entire six days my wife and I were there and feel that we did more than most people around us did. Also, leave a couple of dollars on your pillow each morning for housekeeping- they are the truly unsung heroes. If you can鈥檛 afford or refuse to do this, you either have severe financial problems and should reprioritize the need for a vacation or are simply a cheapskate.I鈥檇 like to wrap this up, so a few short comments on other areas. The beach- gorgeous. Soft sand with a pinkish color throughout when you hold it in your hand. There is a coral rock reef about 150-200 yards offshore that break the waves before they hit the shore, and a few rocks are close in. These are rather large and easy to spot- simply walk around them. This is by no means a rock-infested beach. The 鈥淎nimation Team鈥?is basically a group of fun-loving employees that organize beach and pool games, dancing, exercise routines, etc. Very fun- be open-minded and either participate or watch from the sidelines. The shows at night- Michael Jackson impersonator is entertaining, and we had fun hearing all the old songs and seeing the theatrics. We didn鈥檛 catch any of the other shows. If you are a rum lover, be prepared for strictly Dominican-branded options. I鈥檓 a rum guy, and ended up switching over to other options. The frozen drinks are made with their rum and they were good. We didn鈥檛 do too many of them in a row because the sweet drinks can be tough on you. Presidente beer is good- somewhat Corona-like.In closing, I hope this review comes across as a rational, level-headed approach to this place. It is truly a gorgeous resort, and the food and drink is decent especially considering the value/price equation of the stay. Staff is overall outstanding, and we only encountered one or two less than stellar experiences (mostly at the outdoor bar just behind the front main building and before the pool. Seemed hard to get service there at night for some reason). Bring dollar bills and tip- it goes a long way. Finally, book this trip and enjoy it. I know we will be going back!

<Author>TheBlueWaterBreeze
<Content>Nice property, terrific beach My family and I just returned from six days at the Majestic. Here is a summary of things I feel that you should be aware of as you are considering this property:Things we liked:1. Compared to other properties in Punta Cana, this resort appears to be of medium size. Not too large like some of the neighboring ones. We found everything very convenient to walk to.2. The beach. Awesome. Clear blue water, great clean sand, gentle water, great scenery up and down the beach. No shells. Staff rake the seaweed every morning that washes up on the beach. Water was clean. 3. The cold pool at the Spa. Terrific way to lower your mid-day body temperature in a break from the sun. Under cover, fountains, soft music all available at no charge in a very convenient location.4. Main pool(s). Very scenic as they wind through the property. Some areas have a 7 foot ledge in about six inches of water allowing you to place a lounge chair in the water to tan. We had no problem getting lounge chairs at the beach or the pool.5. The steak chatieubriand dinner at the steak house. Very tasty, had it twice for dinner in 5 evenings. Things we did not like:1. Our daughter's cell phone went missing from our room. She did not place it in our room safe and it disappeared on our second day there. We did hear (and I did read) of others who had some similar experiences with room theft. We did report this to the hotel front desk and they seemed like it was my fault since it wasn't locked up properly. Please keep your valuables locked up in your room safe.2. The bathrooms in the junior suites. There is clearly a lack of privacy. There is a six foot frosted glass door separating the toilet from the rest of the bathroom area. Sounds and natural odors travel freely. Since it is somewhat of an open bathroom format (no floor to ceiling walls), we actually taped a sheet up to provide some privacy between this area and the rest of the room. (Bring your own duct tape from home)3. Breakfast ends at 10 AM. You need to be in the Super Buffet restaurant by this time. For us on vacation and a desire to sleep in somewhat, getting there by 10 AM for breakfast was a bit of a challenge for us.4. We took the ATV trip Macao Crazy Wheels and found it to be a waste. Do not take this excursion. If you want to quad, find another company to do it with.Other things to be aware of:1. About 15-20% of women at resort are topless2. We found that English was the third most popular language there (behind Spanish and French). You may wish to brush up on your Spanish.3. If you go to the Mini-market to purchase something, or, if you wish to purchase some excursion or a water sport activity, you can NOT charge your room. You must use cash or a credit card.4. If you have a baby stroller you should stay in building 3 or 4. Building 3 would be the best choice. The bridges across the pool all have a number of steps. Building 3 has direct access to poool deck bypassing these bridges.5. Dress code for dinner. The only restaurant that really enforced this was the French one. All the other ala-carte restaurants we wore shorts too. 6. The steak and seafood restaurants for dinner are outside near the beach and not airconditioned. The rest of the restaurants for dinner are all air conditioned. Our room A/C worked fine too.7. We thought that our sofa in our junior suite was a pull out sofa bed. It is not. If you need another bed, you need to contact the front desk regarding a roll-away.8. There are no handles on the sliding glass doors on the outside on your patio. Meaning, getting back into your room if you are out on your patio can be a little tricky.9. My kids went tubing and had much fun. However, due to the type of tubes that the speedboats pull, they all got a number of bad brushburns. You may wish to do this towards the very end of your trip. 10. The food and drinks are okay. They are your typical all-inclusive resort medium quality. 11. The resort is about a 30 minute ride from the Punta Cana airport.Hope this helps. Please e-mail me if you have further questions.
