Our room was excellent. It is the largest standard room we have stayed in in the Caribbean. I requested a top floor, pool view near the beach and was lucky enough to get it. We had a four-poster large double bed, and the usual bathroom as described by others. The Jacuzzi was great 鈥?we鈥檝e only had that before in Mexico. The shower was very large and the water pressure good and the water was always hot. We also had a vaulted ceiling which was nice. The balcony is of a very good size with a table and two chairs. We had the pool view and a sideways view of the ocean 鈥?beautiful! The a/c worked fine although you do need to re-set it if there is a power cut. There was also a ceiling fan. The a/c remains on while you are not in the room and only goes off if the balcony door is left open. You do not need a 鈥榢ey鈥?to activate the a/c. Another good thing as far as I was concerned was that there was enough bright light by the vanity units for me to apply my make-up in the evening 鈥?quite often rooms in the Caribbean are too dark, there is also a magnifying vanity mirror which is great for those of us who need reading glasses! There were also enough available electrical sockets for all my husband鈥檚 chargers. Apart from 2 days when I had to ask the maid for them, we always had 2 face cloths with all the other towels. Robes and slippers are also provided. Our room was clean and kept clean very well 鈥?one of the cleanest rooms we have stayed in and in fact the whole resort was kept very clean all the time. We had no bugs in the room while we were there and did not have any need of the can of roach spray we brought with us (we always do when travelling to humid climates). One of the light bulbs in our bedside lamp wasn鈥檛 working when we arrived. We went to guest services to report it after breakfast(I wanted to meet them, rather than call) and it was fixed by the time we got back to our room to change for lunch.Beach 鈥?Bavaro beach is just beautiful. You can walk for miles should you so wish in either direction. It is also the first resort where we did not need to play the 鈥榯owel game鈥?for a palapa on the beach (my husband burns very easily). The resort was fairly empty the first week of our stay but seemed to be at full capacity in the second. The thing that really pleased me about the beach was that if you didn鈥檛 want to hear the animation team and their music, you didn鈥檛 have to 鈥?you just went to the other end of the beach, whereas at other resorts it has not been possible to avoid the noise, or they even have piped music onto the beach/around the resort which personally drives me crazy. At the Majestic, if all I wanted to hear was the sound of the ocean 鈥?I could. However, if you wanted to participate in the activities 鈥?no problem. There is no bar service on the beach but the bar at the restaurant by the beach is very close and I did not consider this a problem. My only negative comment would be that there are only 2 ladies rooms near the beach, and there was usually a queue. The beach has showers to rinse off the salt and sand at the 4 entrances to the beach.Pool. We mainly kept to the beach, as that is what we like but we did spend a few afternoons by the pool and it is beautiful. We always managed to find a palapa when we turned up and also you can find a quiet area if you don鈥檛 want to be in the middle of all the activity/noise. They do not provide floats at the Majestic 鈥?which I personally think is a good thing as when we were at STB they just seemed to be a source of conflict with people taking them out of the pool and not sharing. We took our own floats and spent a happy time floating around the pool. There is waitress bar service at the pool and Bianca is a very friendly and helpful waitress. There are also two bars (one of which has swim up section). Again, there are showers by the pool to rinse off in. We never had any problems getting fresh pool/beach towels, even when the hotel was really busy.Food 鈥?daytime. Breakfast in the main buffet restaurant is from 7 until 10 am. There is an excellent selection of food from juices, fruits, pancakes, waffles, eggs cooked to order, bacon, meats, cheese, cereals, yoghurts, breads, pastries, etc. The thing that really impressed me was the speed of service at the tables for coffee and tea and clearing away dirty plates etc. This is the best service I have ever had anywhere. We made sure to sit in the same section each day and our waitress always brought our drinks without asking 鈥?my tip would be to sit in Mirian鈥檚 section 鈥?she is absolutely the best. If you miss breakfast here, you should know that you can get a continental breakfast from 10.30 until 12 at the restaurant by the beach. We never needed to try it but it looked fine.Lunch 鈥?you have the option of returning to the main buffet restaurant or eating at the buffet in the restaurant at the beach. We did both and our preference was for the main buffet as there was more choice. Please note that if you use this restaurant you cannot go there in wet costumes as the seats are padded and you will be turned away, which is only right as people eating there in the evening don鈥檛 want to sit on wet seats. However at the beach restaurant they have removable seat pads which are taken off during the day and you can eat there in your wet costume no problem. The selection of food is varied and at the main buffet you can always get pizza or pasta as well as fish, meats, salads, paella etc. Again, if you are at the main buffet sit in Mirian鈥檚 section and if you are at the beach restaurant Francisco will take good care of you.Evening. We don鈥檛 like buffets in the evening and chose the Majestic as it has a selection of a la cartes. The food was the best we have had at an AI. We tried all the restaurants and our favourites were the Seafood restaurant (Tres Cabaleros), the steakhouse (Rodeo Grill) and the Tepanyaki. We also liked the Gourmet restaurant and the Chinese a la carte. The Mexican was good 鈥?but neither of us is a big fan of Mexican food. The seafood was very good 鈥?the lobsters and prawns fresh and well cooked and if you wanted more then all you had to do was ask. The Rodeo grill鈥檚 chateaubriand is excellent and they cook it just how you ask for it. Francisco is a great waiter and we tried to always sit in his section, although service was also good from others. The Tepanyaki (reservations required) is good fun and entertaining and the food is also good. We liked the Gourmet and ate there twice but to be honest we liked the seafood and the steak restaurants so much we chose to go there instead.The thing that impressed me was that we didn鈥檛 have to wait for a table except for once or twice when it was literally only a couple of minutes. If I can compare this to STB it is a big difference. They also operate a no-booking policy (there are 2 restaurants at the Majestic that you have to book but everything else is on a turn-up basis). At STB we were often turned away from restaurants because they didn鈥檛 have the capacity or, if they didn鈥檛 say a flat 鈥榥o more tonight鈥?the wait for a table was around half to three quarters of an hour, not a problem, but it is much nicer to be able to get a table where and when you want to. Both resorts appear to have a similar amount of rooms and we stayed at STB at a similar time of year last year and I would say that occupancy was about the same, however the difference is that the restaurants at the Majestic appear to have a much bigger seating capacity. Also the service is faster (but they don鈥檛 chase you out of your seats if you want a leisurely dinner). Again, the standard of the food and the service we received was the best we have had. We didn鈥檛 have the silver-grey wristbands of the North Americans 鈥?so a tip (although we always left one) wasn鈥檛 necessarily expected and we didn鈥檛 have the red wristbands of the Spanish, so we weren鈥檛 obvious Spanish speakers either. We do however always smile and say thank you, which goes a long way wherever you are.Throughout the resort we found everyone friendly and helpful without exception.The shows. Typical AI Caribbean shows, some better than others. The theatre is a nice set up and comfortable too and the waitress service very efficient.The Casino, small but seemed bigger than the one at STB to me. Generous slot machines (although I managed to restrict myself to two visits only 鈥?my husband can鈥檛 bear gambling).Disco, can鈥檛 really comment on this as we were usually too tired or preferred a drink at the lobby bar (which is a great place to be). Others have commented on the jazz player in the early evening 鈥?and it is lovely to hear the music while you are either out on the terrace bar or inside at the lobby bar. There is also a piano bar in the upstairs reception, but we didn鈥檛 really use this.Guest services. What a lovely group they are. They were all fluent in English, friendly and helpful. We met Emily 鈥?who is a very friendly, efficient and well educated person. Whatever you need 鈥?from any fault reporting to reservations to bellboys 鈥?guest services is the number to call. Check-out was speedy and no problems and we were even able to get bellboys at the last minute when, due to a power failure in the area, the lifts were not working and we really didn鈥檛 fancy getting hot and sweaty taking our bags down stairs.OK, I must apologise for this long, long review, but I wanted to be sure to cover as much as possible (and I know that as soon as I post this I will think of something else I meant to say). We just had a truly wonderful time and I cannot wait to go back there (and no, I am not being paid for my review!)Any questions, just ask.

<Author>pghatty
<Content>Nice resort but not a 5* resort Stayed at the Majestic for 10 days. It is a beautiful resort with nice rooms but cannot give it 5*. See klhoek review for a detailed review. Booked through cheapcaribbean and got a good price and it included an upgrade to a majestic suite (pool side room with outdoor jacuzzi). Airport-ArrivalJust get in line, pay your $10 and get your tourist card, stay in line, go through immigration, walk towards baggage claim where they take your tourist card. The walk from baggage claim to the tour buses is a short distance so tell the guys no or they will grab for your luggage.Airport-DepartureWhen you get to the airport, the bus pulls up and they start unloading the luggage onto the curb while the guy on the bus is telling you goodbye and where to go. The guys already have their hands on your luggage waiting for you when you get off the bus. Here you even have a shorter distance to walk to the counters then when you arrived. If traveling to the US, you have to get in a separate line to have a quick inspection for food and other prohibited agricultural items. Then you get in line to check your luggage. Go through immigration again, then security and wait for your flight.ResortIt was beautiful. One of the nicest resorts I have stayed at in the Caribbean. Upon check-in, did not receive my upgrade to a majestic suite but they said check back tomorrow. Put in building 3 on the 3rd floor. Very limited view of the ocean but it was only for one night. That night got stuck in the elevator for 15 minutes. No air conditioning so it was like a sauna. Next day received the majestic suite so no more elevators for the remaining 9 days. Housekeeping was hit or miss for the entire stay so an area for improvement.BeachThe beach area is beautiful with plenty of chairs and some in the shade. The water is clear but there are many spots with coral on the bottom instead of sand. Plenty of sea urchins in the coral. Get snorkling in the water and you will see what I mean. The current is rather strong here also. Went on a snorkling trip to the marinarium and the water has a lot less coral and there was almost no current. If you have small kids who play in the water, you may want to stay at a resort closer to the airport because of the condition of the water.FoodFood was good especially breakfast at the main buffet. Steakhouse was good as was the Japanese. Chinese was bland and service took forever. Gourmet was also good. After reading some of the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect but the chicken was delicious and it had the best service of all the restaurants. Lunch was at the beach buffet. Same food everyday, hamburgers, hot dogs, french fries, pasta station and some hot dishes that did change. It would be nice if they served pizza at this location instead of just at the main buffet. Never got sick on the food or drinks but stuck to the filtered water or the bottled water.DrinksOne word. Bubbakeg. Had a 52oz bubbakeg and was worth it. Otherwise, the little 8oz cups are to small if you are at the beach most of the day and would have to make several trips. The majestic drink is very good also.ScubaI received my scuba certification while at the majestic. Glenn is a great instructor. It takes 4 days so be prepared. First day is watching an instructional video for 4-5 hours. Second is testing, paper and in the pool for several hours. Third and fourth days are two dives a day (4 total). Well worth it. There are some great dive sites just off the beach and south of the wreck Aston. Saw a turtle and a barracuda. Others saw a moray eel plus many different types of fish. The only complaint is the boats they use. It is an oversized rowboat but with an engine and storage for dive tanks. They expect you to jump, swim or pull yourself into the boat after a dive. I had to request a ladder which is an old rusty thing they hang off the side and is not stable. They also beach the boats for you to get on and off. Some of the other resorts use scubacaribe as their water sports company. We went by their boats and I was jealous. Nice catamarans with seating for 12 and 2 fixed ladders for getting back aboard. The majestic needs to insist upon better boats for scuba diving because they cannot compare to the catamarans. Other people who were there to dive also noticed the difference in the types of boats and were not happy.Overall a nice resort but not up to a 5* rating.

<Content>Great Resort! Me and My Wife stayed at Majestic Colonial June 1-6. Airport: Had a great experience both ways. Thought the Punta Cana airport was nice. Room: We stayed in 1407, a Colonial Jr Suite. The room was excellent, we had a large patio with a private jacuzzi. The room was large and the mini bar was an excellent feature to have. The open concept of the bathroom was not a problem at all for us, but I could see how it could be an issue if you were traveling with kids.Food: The food is by far the hardest part to review. We had some excellent meals, and some not so good ones. I am a very picky eater though. I think the thing to remember is that the food is different than the US. If you remember this when setting your expectations, you will not be disappointed. Teppanakki (sp?) was by far the best meal we had there. It requires reservations, so make sure you try to make them when you arrive. Even if you can't make reservations, you can go to the restraunt at the seating time and see if anyone cancelled there reservations. A couple we met did this and was able to get in when we went without reservations. Pool: The pool is the best feature of the hotel. It is the length of the interior of the resort and has two bars. It is large enough that you can tailor your experience based on what you feel like doing. There are plenty of quiet areas where you can enjoy a good book, or active areas where you can participate in the events with the animacion team. We spent most of our time at the pool. Beach: I prefer the pool to the beach, but the beach was wonderful. White sand and turqouise water. The times we did go out there, we were allways able to find a spot. Bars and Nightlife: We never saw a show in our time there, not our thing. Most of our nightlife was spent in the Sportsbar (Air Conditioning). The staff in there were great. Taison, the manager was excellent and knows how to make sure everybody is having a good time. The bartenders at the main bar were great too. Staff: As stated in some of the prior reviews, the staff was hit and miss at times. The hits from the staff outweighed the misses by a lot though. I'd say that most of the misses could be attributed to the language barrier and the staff not completely understanding what we wanted or needed. Oscar was definitely one of the good ones, and went to lengths to ensure our stay was wonderful. Overall: We had a great time and would reccomend this resort highly. For a point of reference, this is only the second all inclusive we have stayed in, with Sandals Grande Antigua being the other. Valuewise, this was a much better trip than our trip to Sandals. And we definitely regretted only staying five nights.

My wife and I were very, very pleased. We had our special day in the gazebo, and it was wonderful! Zero compliants. You can rest easy if you chose the Majestic for your special day. The onsight photographer is a little pricy, but after you see his work you will understand why. Our photo's are amazing! We have recieved more compliments on them then you could ever imagine. Our reception supper was at the Steak house and it was perfect. The staff waited on us hand over foot. We wanted for nothing. Before you could ask for another drink it was at our table. Our day was the best. Infact the only thing more beautiful then the Resort was my Bride! We traveled with 22 friends and family, many first time travellers and no one was disappointed. I am sure they will all return to the Majestic sometime in there lives. Yes they are that good. They deserve the five star rating and then some. The only bad thing about the whole trip was our air carrier. Sky Service left a very bitter taste in our mouths. Our flight was dealyed nearly half a day. This caused a very late arrival at the Resort and the loss of a full day of our vacation. I have sent a letter to the company and still have yet to recieve any response to our concerns. My wife and I will never travel SkyService again.  Remember that this is a very poor country. They are also very accustom to begging the tourists for anything and everthing. They will try to take the shirt off your back! They are very needy but do not give them money, instead consider giving to a local charity in the area. They do a lot of good for the children and the education process there. They are people helping their people. It seems like the best way to lend a helping hand. Thanks and hope you enjoy your stay at the Majestic, you will love it!

<Author>IndianaSchmidt
<Content>Beautiful, but hard to understand! After reading all the reviews listed at this site and getting a special upgrade offer, we decided the Majestic Colonial would be an ideal place to spend our week-long vacation in Punta Cana. I noticed on the reviews that everyone loved the pool, but the food and staff got some negative remarks. I chalked this negativity up to high standards. First, the positives. The resort was beautiful. Nice landscaping, great pool, very nice rooms. We had two jacuzzi tubs (one inside, one outside). We were right by the pool, so we were able to open our patio doors, roll our lounge chairs to the edge of the pool and jump in..that was nice! They also had a variety of restaurants. You could always find a place to get a drink, if that's important to you.  Now for the negatives. The food at the buffet was ok. I'm a picky eater, so it was just a matter of finding what you like. But there were enough options at the resort that it really wasn't a problem. Yes, the mattress and pillows were pretty hard, again, not a big deal. We were awoken every morning by housekeeping. The front doors hardly kept out any noise; although you could barely hear anything from the patio or the other rooms?? They experienced brief power outages throughout the day. We would reset the alarm clock 3-4 times a day. The ocean was pretty rough in this area, but it was pretty enough to make you forget. My biggest gripe; however, was the language barrier. I understand that we are visiting an area that is Spanish-speaking and I am the first to give credit to them, because I figure they know more English than I know Spanish (I only took one year of Spanish, my boyfriend took two). However, the language difference was a huge problem here.  First off, our room keys worked, so we went back to the front desk and tried to explain...they didn't understand, but soon swiped the cards and sent us off again. Needless to say, it took four trips back and forth from our room to the front desk before they understood that the scratch on the back of the card is why the one card wouldn't work...that was nearly the beginning. Through out the trip we had a hard time relaying our message to just about everyone. We had a small leak from the ceiling in our room, which I alerted housekeeping about, because it was dripping onto the outlet. The first gentleman told the girl who cleaned our room...she brought bug spray. She later sent maintenance, who simply said no comprendo, eventhough he could see the leak. I inquired about a shopping center that opened in December with guest services. I wondered if there were many stores open there. All she kept responding was yes, it's Wednesday, they are open. Needless to say, we spent $40 on a taxi, only to find out there were only about 12 stores open. One night we decided to check out the light nite fast food restaurant. . We were the first ones in line, the gentlemen took my boyfriends order, but not mine. Then when I asked for a burger plain, he started spewing words and stormed in back. Later two coworkers came to see him and he turned around, pointed at us and yelled all kinds of words (probably a good thing, I couldn't understand). I so wanted to tell someone, but the problem was....noone would understand me. Time after time, language was huge issue. Even those people that did speak English, didn't seem to understand what it was they were saying. You could repeat the same words to them and they were confused. So after a week, I was very frustrated and didn't want to talk to anyone. Overall, the resort was very nice, but I wouldn't go back because I don't like feeling left in the dark.

<Content>Good Times in the DR This was our second trip to the DR, first time we visited Puerto Plata and have to admit that we were a little disappointed, however, we were willing to give the DR another try and boy are we GLAD that we did!! :o)We went to Punta Cana and stayed at the Majestic Colonial from May 23-28 for some rest and relaxation and to celebrate my birthday. The trip was fantastic!! We booked the trip through CheapCaribbean.com and could not of been happier with their service. Their price was fantastic and we booked during one of their promotions and got the free upgrade upon arrival so we had a jacuzzi in the room as well as one on the terrace and were only steps from the pool and we had the great lounge chairs so we never had to worry about having a chair at the pool. Great room!! We were in room 2144 and we were only about 30 feet from the pool bar....can't beat that!! Walk out your back door jump in the pool turn to the right and walk a few steps and there you were at the pool bar and where all the entertainment during the afternoon was, we couldn't of asked for a better location for our room. Plus, it was very nicely located near the beach too. As for the rooms....yes, the toilet area is a little akward with the door not going completely to the floor, but we are a couple who went and we didn't have a problem with it. I can see how that can get weird for some. The shower area is HUGE!! It was very nice. The sink area is nice too and double sinks so that is also nice when trying to get ready for dinner.The beds are a little hard and by the end of our stay we were looking forward to going back home to sleep in our nice pillow-top bed. Everything else is pretty standard...desk and chair. Small loveseat and a coffee table. We enjoyed both the jacuzzi indoors and outdoors, however being on the bottom floor there is not much privacy for the outdoor jacuzzi.They offer a safe to store your valuables that you set the code for and we used that and did not have any problems during our stay.The hotel staff were all very helpful and very nice. The CheapCaribbean representatives were also very helpful in the lobby and they even helped my boyfriend plan a surprise birthday cake for me on my birthday which I thought was a nice surprise and it just showed me that they were willing to go that extra step to make sure that we were happy with our vacation. By the way....the cake was so yummy!!The restaurants and food. Comparing it to the last time we were in the DR, the food at the Majestic Colonial is amazing!! Yes, there were dishes and things that we didn't like, but the best thing about staying all inclusive is that you can try something else. We really liked Taino (Dominican and Mexican food) and we ate dinner there twice. You do not need dinner reservations there so that is a plus too. We also really like Le Gourmet (french). Here you do need reservations and we made them when we arrived after checking in because you need your room number to make the reservation.The Steak House, located in the Palapa Hut on the beach, is good as well. We did not try the seafood restaurant or Matsuri. But, we did do room service on evening. I would not recommend it because the selection is not good and very small, it's best to get out and enjoy one of the restaurants and get the variety. Breakfast is better at the buffet up near the lobby of the hotel. They have everything that you can think of and could want. The breakfast that is offered at the Palapa Hut on the beach is not much of anything so if you are hungry get up early enough to hit the buffet.We did lunch at the buffet near the lobby (same one breakfast is served at) and at the Palapa Hut on the beach and they were both really good. Their deserts are also very good. I recommend these little coconut cookies....very good!!! Oh, and the chocolate cake....yummy.I think that even the most picky of eaters will be able to find something. I am one of those picky eaters and I ate well all week. Also neither one of us had any problems getting sick or anything else like that.Drinks: I didn't try anything that I didn't like. Everything was very good. You will get better or fancier drinks in the lobby bars than you will at the pool bar or at the bar in the Palapa Hut on the beach. We got absolute vodka at the lobby bars!!Spa: we got a couple massage and it was really good. Not sure it was worth that much $$ though. Last time in the DR only paid $45 for an hour massage...so prices at the spa were much higher at the Majestic.Beach: The beach is nice. There is some seaweed that can be gross at times, but it clears up in spots and just go there and swim. The water is clear and warm. The sand is white and never gots hot to walk on. There was always plenty of chairs and palapas to sit under. Nightly Entertainment and Excursions....can't really comment on these since we didn't do anything like that. We didn't go to one show in the evenings at the hotel we would rather hang alone or with the bartenders down at the Palapa Hut. We did, however, go to the shopping center at the entrance to the Majestic. They seemed to be overpriced and the prices at the hotel were just as good, if not better on things like t-shirts and things like that. Plus, you get hassled by the locals a lot there. I realize that they are just trying to make a living, but I would rather not put myself into that situation.A few cons.....we ordered room service our first night there and put the dishes in the room service closet and the dishes were never removed during our stay. We checked every day and it became a joke by the end of our stay to see if there were still there or not and even the last day they were still there. They should really watch that because uneaten food can atract bugs.The maids never changed our sheets and really didn't do a very good job at cleaning and there were some days when they would only leave us one towel. We did tip each and every day because I understand that they work hard and don't make a lot of money, but they could of done a better job. Also we made coffee and they never would take the dirty spoons that we would mix with....weird.Also we brought our own beach towels and had them on the back terrace drying over the chairs and on the last night there someone came and took one of the towels. I know....bummer. I chalk that up to it could of happened anywhere and at any hotel...I am just writing it down to warn you to maybe not leave your stuff out over night. Just be careful if you are on the bottom floor. Besides that we had no problems.Well....I think that is it and I hope that this review helps someone out there. All in all I thought that the Majestic Colonial was great. We had a fantastic vacation and would definitely go back there.Happy and Safe Travels!! :o)

<Author>TravelFreeUSA
<Content>Majestic in some ways!! First of all, let me say that the staff was pretty good, always saw a smile on them except for the management people though.After getting off the plane you have to pay the $10 tourist fee or whatever they call it there. When you leave the airport, please keep an eye on your bags because there are people trying to fight for them so that they can get a tip.The ride from the airport wasn't as bad as I thought it would be versus Jamaica. But the people there do drive crazy!! When we got to the hotel we were welcome with a refreshing drink and a cold towel. Checking in was easy but our room wasn't ready because we got there in the early afternoon.Room: The room was huge but nothing to WOW about. Bathroom is an open concept which mean there are no doors except from the frosted doors for the shower and toilet. If you want something in the room. Let's say towels or more water, tip the maid and put some in the fridge and it will be taken cared off. You will need the extra water because you cannot drink the tap water in the rooms (was not going to take a chance getting sick with brushing our teeth with the water either, so use the bottle water to brush your teeth)Pool/beach: It was wonderful, only 4 feet high throughout. The water in the pool was actually warmer then the beach!! The beach was kept pretty clean and you can snorkel there as will. There were some topless people there also. Food: Nothing too fancy but it was edilble. The Steak house was the best in my opinion. The buffet was pretty good considering it was an all - inclusive hotel (comparing it with Cancun). Food was always available. For the late nighters, there is a place for food until 6 AM.Excursions: We did to excursions. 1. The 1/2 day ATV was a must do excursion ( one in the morning and one during the afternoon). You are going to get dirty/dusty, so bring sunglasses and wear something cheap. In the middle of the ride you get to do turns and going thru big bumps/hurdles ( like motocross but smaller ).2. The Santo Domingo tour which is a whole day. 3 hours there and 3 hours back ( 6 hours total coach ride, bring a jacket because the bus is cold ). You get to see the largest city in DR plus you get to go see the amble museum, Columbus palace, tourist stuff, plus a little shopping. Lunch is included which is at the Hard Rock cafe.Also if you are planning to bring Mamajuanna back, make sure you fill it with rum or some sort of liquid and put it in your luggage. If not, they will take it away from you at the airport or make you fill them up. When you get to the airport, take you bags quick because people are fighting for them like crazy men!!! LOL They just want the tips but it's only 2 feet away, so you can do it yourself and save 1 or 2 dollars!!!! There are two lines, make sure you're in the right one. The first line is the pre-screen line which you have to go to first!!! You Do Not have to pay the $20 exit fee if you are US/Canadian citizens. Not sure about the others though.All in all, Majestic is pretty decent for the amount that we paid through Cheap Caribbean, no upgrade though, but the room was nice enough even without the upgrade.

<Author>Z-Tripper8
<Content>Great Time at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana We spent 6d/5n at this large, beautiful facility with our 6 year old son. It was very safe and comfortable at this location. It is a very kid-friendIy facility and the Animation Team, most especially MariaMagie at the Kid's Mini-Club, were excellent with him. We are fromthe USA - primarily English speaking, and on one day in particular our son was there with kids from other countries who only spoke Spanish. Maria assisted our son and made every effort to help him communicate and understand the language differences. Pool - I can't recall having seen a longer, larger pool anywhere I've traveled... it was terrific! The only drawback was that our room was close to the beach and there was only one towel hut that was in the center of the facility - and it was a huge facility so it took a while to walk and do towel exchanges every day. It would be nice to have additionaltowel huts at each end of the pool as well (remember I said it was a very, very long pool). The bars were well placed, the only deficiencywas that there wasn't one directly on the beach. Not that we're alcoholics - but as hot as it was, by the time you got back to your chaise lounge to enjoy what was your frozen drink - it was now liquidy and warm. Be sure to ask for a shot of additional rum as they were the typical frozen-machine selections and were very weak. Also, you were limited to 2 beers per day in the room mini-bar - why we'll never know! They were strick on that too (I tried to negotiate an additional few and lost). The beach bars were not well stocked, but the lobby bar had some top-shelf brands/selections. Another stange thing was that I had to enter my room number on a sheet each time I ordered a Grand Marnier (available only at the lobby bar) - there was no charge, so why did they ask for my number? The only bottled beer was the two-per-day in the mini-bar... none at the other bars (I can understand not having bottles at the pool bars, but why not at the others?). And, all bars only had one beer on tap - the brand was Presidente; a local brew I was told. It was an OK pale ale - and was better with a lime slice! Restaurants - We tried all of them except for Le Gourmet (no kids under 12 allowed - which was understandable to us). All of the others we tried were fine. That's to say that there were sufficient menu selections and we were successful in finding food that was between satisfactory to above average at each. The fruit everywhere was outstanding! Room - it was very large, but we found that the lack of a wall separating the bathroom area was a little strange and sometimes uncomfortable. We didn't use the tub as it was in-between the two sinks and the bed - wide open in the middle of the room - also a little odd we thought. Room service was nice except that the towel distribution varied - some days we didn't get wash cloths (which we both use). Entertainment - they had good shows and a nice variety. The only drawback was that some of the shows were scheduled a little late in the evening for our son to fully enjoy - for example the circus started at 10:00 PM (22:00 hours). It was hot and humid during our first week of June stay and that made it a little uncomfortable in the outdoor theater - which is where the shows were held. It is a huge theater with a very tall roof and open-air sides...they should have ceiling fans to move the air - not only to comfort the guests, but also help cool down the entertainers. We would recommend this facility to our family and friends. P.S. If you walk just outside theentrance to the flea market, be prepared to be EXtremely hounded by the merchants - more so than what we experience anywhere else we've traveled. We never did get to all the stores as we made a few quick purchases and quickly headed back to the hotel!

Would not recommend this hotel although if this is your first time at a resort in punta cana, you may like it but there are definitely others out there better than this.

<Author>mmmvirginia
<Content>Some +'s, Some -'s My husband and I went for our 1 year anniversary to the Majestic Colonial from 5/28 to 6/1. There were definitely some pluses and minuses from this vacation.We arrived at the Punta Cana airport and took a taxi ride to the resort. I was told this was better than taking a shuttle, as the shuttle has multiple stops before Majestic and could take up to an hour to arrive at the hotel. There is no line at the airport for the taxi ride, and it takes about 30-35 mins. Cost is $35 US dollars.When arriving at the resort, we were given cool towels but no drinks. I read some people got cold drinks as they arrived but we did not. We got to the reception desk to check-in and we were helped by Jenny who normally works at Guest Services, but was filling in at the check-in counter. She put the gray bracelets on for us and told us room service was included with these bracelet. Due to this, we ordered room service all week and found out at check-out that this was false information. I'll get to the details of this later.We get to our room and got 2 double beds instead of 1 king size bed. We called the front desk and they told us they will call us back in 5 mins. We waited in the room for their callback for 15 mins before calling them back. They put us on hold and told us they are switching our room and the bellhop will come by and take us to our new room. It took them 30 mins to finally come and take us. We wasted so much time on getting the room situation straightened out. I was not pleased.Rooms: The bathrooms have NO privacy. Unless you're 100% comfortable with the people you are staying with, do not share a room. Since it was only my husband, I did not care, but the toilet area is VERY small with no lock on doors and no privacy to toilet or shower. Also, we saw little ant-like insects crawling around our sinks all week. I think I killed about a hundred of them during our stay. Food: We tried making reservations at Matsuri but was told they are all booked during our stay. They suggested us going there early and taking places of people that do not show up for their reservation. Luckily, we were able to do that and the food was GREAT. Steakhouse was really good, Chinese was good, the Buffet was super. Overall, the food was wonderful. We really enjoyed every restaurant there, but we are not pick eaters.Beaches and Pool: BEAUTIFUL! There was never any problems getting chairs at either places. We got unlucky with the weather as it was only sunny for a few hours early in the day, then rained most of the afternoons and nights.Shows: The shows we saw were - Ideal Couple, Circus Show, Mr Majestic and the Magic Show. All shows were entertaining in a cheesy kind of way. I enjoyed it more than my husband did. Oh, and also, we got TONS of bug bites while watching the shows. Make sure you take bug spray if you go.Service: We encountered some really good service and some really poor service. Some bartenders were really nice and some just did not seem to care. We still tipped $1 for every drink. Take plenty of $1 bills for tips. We tipped normally $1 per drink and $2 - $5 per meals. Most people do not tip but we could not help it, they do work hard.Casino: I normally play blackjack but there were only 3 blackjack tables. Don't expect too much from the casino, it's VERY small with limited seats if you go late at night. We always stopped by after the nightly shows and it got pretty crowded. Also, I'm not sure if the dealers do this on purpose or not, but they mess up A LOT. You have to watch them carefully, as I caught them several times messing up on our pay.We did not do any excursions because of the bad weather. It basically rained most of the days we were there, except for the first and last day. BOO :-(Check-out: We got into a heated argument with the hotel management and because of this incident, I will never go back to Majestic again. During our check-in, Jenny (who normally works at Guest Services) told us room-service was included with our all-inclusive package. As she was putting the supreme gray bracelet on us, she told us that that was the highest level bracelet and that all room service was included. Because of this my husband and I decided to take advantage and order room service during the rainy afternoons. When we were checking-out, we were told that the room service was NOT included with the gray bracelet and we owed over $100 US dollars. I spoke to 2 different supervisors there (Francisco and Victor) who both told us that we should've double checked and told us we had to pay up. I told them Jenny told us room service was included, and they're response was there is no Jenny that works here. There is 1 Jenny at Guest Services. We tried telling them that was the correct Jenny that helped us check-in, but they didn't do anything about it. They looked at us like we were liars. They did not seem to care and did not even try to handle the situation correctly by getting Jenny to come over and talk to us. SO, I had to walk all the way to guest services myself and bring Jenny back. They basically told us that Jenny did not know the correct rules and told us false information, but that it was our responsibily to double check. We were furious, and about 30 mins of arguing with them we noticed lines starting to form behind us (usual check-out time). They FINALLY decide to credit us the money but they were not happy with it. I feel like the only reason they decided to credit us the amount was because they did not want us to make a scene in front of other guest. Our stay at the Majestic Colonial was just OK but we left with a lot of anger. I was furious at how they treated us while we were checking-out. It's funny how one incident can totally change your mind about the place.

<Content>Awesome Place!!! I went with my boyfriend for days (from May 23rd-June 1st)...it was a great trip all around from start to finish...we got upgraded to an ocean view which had a jacuzzi inside the room and outside. We had direct access to the pool and to the beach grill...I wouldn't of paid for it but ask nicely (like we did) and they might give it to you!The food was excellent in my opinion. I read the mixed reviews but you aren't going to be able to please everyone all the time...must try the churrasco at the steak house. It's delish. The seafood place was so/so...I wasn't impressed. Make reservations for both the Japanese place and the French place as soon as you get there as they sell out really fast! At Le Gourmet make sure to order the pumpkin soup (omg! so good) and the chocolate dessert (I put on 7 pounds on my stay!!!) The buffet is good...but make sure for breakfast you get there before 10am...because they do close!!! And then you have to wait until 12:30pm for lunch (one of the only drawbacks of this place)...Daily activities were fun...always a party at the pool by the swim up bar...get towels as soon as you can...because they are FAR from the party area. The nightlife was ok...the performers work hard and the Michael Jackson show was great...the club (if you can call it that) was usually dead by 12am. But if you want to hit up a popping club then you need to take a $15 cab ride to club Mangu. The casino...where to begin...my boyfriend and I LOVE to gamble. We play blackjack. The odds are NOT in your favor at this casino...the girls who work there NEVER smile and actually get mad (suck their teeth) if the table does well...my man and I were convinced that they must get a cut ...anyway...they don't check to see if they have blackjack so if you have 21, you may still lose. ALWAYS COUNT YOUR CARDS! they are quick to take them off the table along with your money (even if you pushed)...so stay alert and aware. Also, if you have blackjack you CAN ask for even money (they won't tell you that)... We ended up doing really well there (surprisingly)...but you meet some great people playing (HEY JACKIE FROM ATL!!!! and Fah from Canada (eh?)As for excursions...we went on the party festival boat that takes you snorkeling, then swimming with sharks. It was awesome. For $80 per person, an experience of a lifetime! As for buying things on the premisis...you can haggle a little...but just outside the hotel down the road there is are shops where you can haggle more. All in all, it's a great trip. I don't recommend it for singles, as it was more a couple place...but still, I can't imagine anyone NOT having a great time at the majestic colonial punta cana. Any questions, email me at highblueeyes@yahoo.comI will be glad to help!Leah

<Author>Girl_from_Paris
<Content>Perfect holiday I just got back from a one-week stay at the Majestic and it was just a perfect holiday! I am really glad I chose this hotel because I got to see a few other ones during my stay and it was by far the best one. The grounds are just so beautiful: the room is incredibly comfortable and clean, the pool is amazing (I realized after 2 days there that it stretched even farther than I thought) you can swim through it for hours and the beach is just paradise. Although the weather was not great (it rained for 2 whole days :-( and was mostly cloudy the rest of the stay ), it was still wonderful to just sit there and enjoy the view, especially since it is so spacious that you feel alone in the hotel most of the time. The food was good and I felt I never ate twice the same: I especially recommend the beach restaurant for lunch, to be able to enjoy the wonderful sight as you eat. It turns into a pretty great steakhouse/seafood place at night.Travelling solo to Majestic, I was scared I would get bored very quickly but the animation team was quite amazing, especially during the dancing lessons and at night at the disco. So you can manage to relax and have lots of fun at the same time... The only thing that didn't work for me was the special shows like MJ, international dance and circus which I thought were beyond average. I had much more fun with the shows held by the animation team where they interacted with people from the audience (cheers to you Scoubidoo wherever you are!) .Finally I recommend going to the Santo Domingo excursion, where you get to see some countryside during the 3 hour trip and then visit some of the historical landmarks of the DR. So that you don't feel just like a tourist locked up in a fancy hotel.I will go back to Punta Cana as soon as I can (see you next year as the customs officer said!), and most definitely to the Colonial Majestic...

<Rating>4	3	4	4	4	3	5	3	

<Author>klhoek
<Content>Nie trip to Majestic Colonial We just returned from a 7night stay (5/23-5/30/07) at the Majestic Colonial. Let me preface this review by stating that this was our 4th AI vacation, and give our vacation background: We honeymooned in August 2003 at Sandals Antigua, and have vacationed the past 2 springs in Cancun at the Iberostar Paraiso Maya (2005) and Secrets Exellence Riviera Cancun (2006). All of these properties have been rated as 5 or 5+ stars on all travel websites that I have visited. Given our vacation history, I cannot rank the Majestic as a 5star resort. It was a nice resort, and there was nothing missing, but after visiting superior properties, the differences were glaringly obvious. That said, we still had a wonderful time, and have no major complaints at all about or vacation.Check-in: Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted with the aforementioned cold towel and a Majestic. We arrived at a time when there were very few other people checking in or out, so were processed through very quickly. The front desk staff were very friendly. However, our room requests were not granted. We booked a Colonial Jr Suite, and I requested building 2 or 3, closer to the beach than the lobby. Therefore, I was very disappointed to discover we had been assigned room 1407. This room was in building 1, and was the Col Jr Suite closest to the lobby. I was even more disappointed upon arrival at our room to discover that both our balcony and terrace overlooked the neighboring property's parking lot. I have to admit that after all the research I did, and knowing which buildings I preferred to be in, that this room location was terribly disappointing, and probably to some extent tainted my view of our entire vacation (just being honest here).Room: Our room was very nice. We had a Colonial Jr Suite, which was on the top floor of our building. There were only 2 Col Jr Suites per block of rooms (and not all blocks had them). It was pretty much exactly as all the pics I saw. As our room was top floor, we had a vaulted ceiling (which was nice). The bathroom was as desribed, but the glass on the doors to the shower and toilet were longer than I expected and the frosting was completely non-see-through, so no problems there. The bed was very hard, and very uncomfortable. And the pillows a bit odd--1 wasn't thick enough, but 2 gave a bad crick in the neck. In addition to the regular balcony that all rooms had on the back of the room, we also had a private terrace with a jacuzzi tub on the side of the room. This was wonderful, and I am very glad that I upgraded for it. We used the terrace just about every day. I layed out topless a few times, as no one could see into our terrace. We also used the jacuzzi as a private pool, and filled it with cold water during the day if we were laying out on the terrace. Only used it as a hot tub one time in the evening, but still got good use out of it.Food/Dining: We did not have any stomach prblems at all (in contrast to our last 2 trips to Mexio). In fact, the breakfast and lunch buffets at the Supreme Buffet were some of the best that I have had at any AI! There were some hot food stations that stayed the same everyday (eggs, omlettes, crepes and waffles made to order for breakfast; pasta made to order and grilled meats at lunch), but the pre-prepared hot foods were different every day. My usual breakfast consisted of fruit and yogurt, 2 churros, and 1-2 crepes. The freshly grilled chicken and the rice option at lunch were always very good. On one of our last days there, I discovered that the chef could make pesto pasta, and it was great (especially when adding a scoop of the cream sauce). The deserts were surprisingly good on the buffet (which has not been the case at other AI's we have visited). Even hubby agreed that the chocolate cakes were some of the best we have had.Dinner was hit or miss. . . . Day 1: Matsuri. This was OK. I had lemon chicken (which was decent), hubby ordered seafood chow-mein, but got beef instead. Appetizers, sushi and deserts were fair.Day 2: Rodeo Steakhouse. We both got the Chateaubriand, which we both thought was the best meal we had while there. The steak was really, really good, while the side dishes left a bit to be desired. We had really great service here, especially from the wine/water guy, so gave him a tip as well.Day 3: Taino. We had really bad service here. No waiter for at least 10 minutes, and we got our food before anyone offered us a drink. This was also an odd set-up. They had a Dominican buffet set up as an appetizer bar, and you ordered off a menu that was Mexican, but it was Mexican unlike any other I have experienced. I actually thought the Dominican buffet was quite good, and should have just eaten that for my dinner--what I got wasn't very good at all. I would recommend that you try the buffet first and see if you can get enough to eat before ordering off the menu. The local foods were quite interesting, and surprisingly tasty.Day 4: Supreme Buffet. We were tired this day, and didn't feel like dressing up, so just went to the buffet. It was pretty much the same as lunch, plus a few additional appetizers and deserts. Still good, just nothing spectacular.Day 5: We were supposed to go to the gourmet, but our reservation got mixed up, so we went back to the steakhouse and got the Chateaubriand again. Just as good the second time.Day 6: Teppanyaki Grill. Great service, great show, great food. Sure, I know that I can get the same thing at home, so it wasn't anything special, but we both agreed that this was our second best meal at the Majestic. There was a nice appitizer platter, and you got TONS of food! The shrimp was a bit overcooked, but I was pleasantly surprised by the fish and beef. Day 7: Gourmet. Surprisingly, after our reservation snafu on sunday, we were able to get a reservation for our last night there without a problem. This meal took a while to serve (we were there for close to an hour and a half). The appetizers were a bit strange, but the pumpkin soup was fabulous. The puff pastry crust really makes it! We both had surf and turf (beef wellington with a little bit of lobster in the center of the roll). It was OK. Deserts were pretty good. Hubby had tiramisu, and I had the Majestic Pinapple which was kind of like a thick flavored creme brulee.Pool: HUGE!!! There was a place for everyone at the pool! Lots of chairs, so never had a problem getting a lounger. They have these little ledges all around the pool where you can lay, or move your chair so that your feet can dip into the water. These are very nice! The animation team was centered at the swim-up bar, so it was very noisy there, and something was always going on. Lots of drunk people planing games. LOL. After a day or two, we gravitated towards the quiet end of the pool. There was a bar there, too, although not swim-up. There were no servers delivering drinks to patrons at any of the pool bars, they were all self-service. The spa pool was also connected to (but separated by a partial wall from ) the main pool, and the water there was about 10-15 degrees cooler. They also had hot and cold (FREEZING, actually!!) plunge pools.Beach/Ocean: one word: WOW!!! The beach was gorgeous! The sand was powder soft, and the water crystal clear. There was not much seaweed at all while we were there (except for one day following a storm). You could walk the beach for hours! You can check out snorkle equipment at the beach, and the snorkling is actually pretty good. There is a rocky reef-like area just a few feet from the beach underneath the swimming bouy markers. Just take some bread from the breakfast or lunch buffet with you, and you will have all kinds of fish following you around! I had a school of about 100 fish following me around for at least 1/2 hour on our last day there!Shopping: There are a few stores on the resort where you can get some souvenirs. Some things are reasonably priced, others quite expensive. There is no bargaining. On Thursday nights, there a caribbean market is set up in the plaza. You can bargain with these guys. In fact, you pretty much have to, b/c there are no prices on any object. You just pick out what you want and they give you a price for it all. Their first offer will make you laugh. We were told not to pay any more than half of what you are offered. Same holds true for the shops at the shopping center out front of the resort. They will try to rip you off! Another bit of advice we were given is to offer the vendor a tip in exchange for a deep discount (he will only make a small fraction of the selling price in commission, and an extra few bucks from you will likely make him willing to sell to you cheap). This worked well for me at one of the stores.Clinic: Unfortunately I had to visit the medical clinic twice while there. Got water stuck in my ear due to excessive wax, and had to have it flushed out. The cost of the visits was a bit high, but the doctor was professional and very nice, and I was very glad to be able to hear again after several days of half-deafness.Excursions: We didn't leave the resort. We wanted to do one of the snorkle trips, but then I had trouble with my ear and was advised not to swim.Clientelle: While Cancun seemed to cater largely to North American tourists, Punta Cana seemed to be a very popular destination for European travelers. I would guess that less than 50% of the guests were English-speaking. There was a large contingent of French, German, and Spanish-speaking people. That said, there was also a LOT of topless sunbathers, especially at the beach. And not only sunbathers. . . .they loved to take walks on the beach topless, too. And, as my husband noted, the majority of topless women were older (over 50), and their parts were not attractive (so guys, beware. . . topless does not always = good! LOL).Language: We were also informed by our tour operator that education is not mandated in the Dominican Republic, and that a large number of native children do not even have access to a school. As such, grasp of English by the staff is not always good. This was by no means a problem for us, just be aware that many of them do not speak English at all.Tips/Suggestions: Bring your own washcloth. You may or may not be given one in the room. Bring your own bar of soap. The ones they leave in the room are TINY, and I didn't feel like I got clean when using them. Bring an insulated mug for the frozen drinks at the pool. They melt fast in those small plastic cups. Bring a pool float. I got ours at Walmart for $1.50. We didn' use it much, but it was nice to float on the really hot days. Bring lots of sunscreen and reapply twice as often as you think you should. I got burned on our first day after sweating off the sunscreen on my chest whan laying face down. Also be sure to lather up even on cloudy days. We saw a LOT of really badly burned people who didn't put on any sunscreen on a cloudy day. If you need change in US$, go to reception. If they cannot break your bill, try the porters--as they work for tips, they usually have small bills and can easily break 10s and 20s.Overall, I felt that this vacation was a great deal for the money that we spent. The resort was nice (although the grounds were not kept up as nicely as other resorts I have visited), the staff very friendly (especially Maximo and Lennin at Reception), the beach and pool beautiful, the alcohol always flowing. If I had not been to a 5+ star resort last year, I probably would have given this resort a higher ranking, but after going to a luxury resort it was easy to spot the difference. Nothing was missing or wrong with this resort, it just wasn't as sparkly/shiny and the service wasn't nearly to the same level as what we have experienced previously. That said, the resort we went to last year was quite a bit more expensive. . . . I guess you get what you pay for.Would I go back to the Majestic? Probably not. Hubby and I usually like to travel to different locations. However, we both agreed that we would be willing to go back to the Dominican Republic.

<Author>Snickerbilly
<Content>Majestic is Awesome My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Majestic from May 20 - 27. We flew in from Atlanta on Delta and getting through the airport was no problem. The baggage carriers are fairly agressive but a few firm no gracias and they will leave you alone. We went with 3 other people in a Turinter tours van directly to the resort where we were greetd with cold towels and a majestic. Our baggge carrier drove us in a van to our room which was 2142 and directly across from the pool bar and just 60 seconds from the beach. We were pleasantly suprised with the upgraded room which featured 2 jaccuzzis which we never actually used during our stay. Our room had a musty odor which never really left. I forgot the Fabreze but it was really not a problem. The room was absolutely gorgeous and the location perfect. For a cocktail I only had to walk 15 feet from the porch to the pool, hop in and walk another 20 feet. The grounds of the hotel are simply stunning and the beach is as fine as any in the world. Never had a problem getting a palapa, although I was usually on the beach by 7:30 each morning.Food: We were pleasantly suprised by the restaurants. The breakfast buffet is awesome with tons of items including passion fruit, mangoes, made to order omelettes, crepes, sausage, smoked salmon, mimosas and a variety of juices. Lunch at the main buffet was also very good and the pizza was excellent. The seafood restaurant was alos pretty good (we had the lobster) and the chateaubriand at the steakhouse was very good. I did not particularly like the chow mein at the Chinese restaurant but hte sushi was very good. I was also dissapointed with the Gourmet but I was rather full from lunch when we ate there so that may have influenced my opinion. Taino was very good (Goat stew was awesome) and I had a good red snapper dish off of the menu. My wife had the grouper which she also enjoyed. Last the Japanese restaurant was also very good with lots of shrimp, steak, chicken and salmon.Bars: The bars were all very good and I never had to wait very long for a drink. Brugal was only to be found at the lower lobby bar but I did not mind the Barcelo. They also had Stolichnaya vodka at all of the bars. I probably had well over 100 drinks during my stay and tried coco locos, pina coladas, daquiris, capirahnas, mojitos (excellent), cuba libres, banana mamas, bloody mary's, majestics and of course mamajuana and presidente.Pool: The pool was gorgeous and the water temperature was just right. You could walk the entire length of the pool in about 35 minutes at a leisurely pace, stopping for a cocktail or two at the pool bars. If you wanted to be around loud, silly drunk people just hang out by the main pool bar. If you wanted peace and quiet gravitate towards the beach end or the lobby side of the pool.Beach: Stunning. white sand, blue water and coconut palms everywhere. You will see topless women as well and I was suprised to see my wife topless after returning from the bar with a few drinks. There is coral on the left and right side of the beaches so watch your feet when you venture into the ocean. We went snorkeling one day and took a couple of rolls from the beach buffet and were swarmed by fish. It was not spectacular snorkeling but well worth the effort. The water temperature is perfect and a bit colder than I expected it to be. Shows: The shows for the most part were very good. I loved the Michael Jackson show and I cannot even stand him or his music. The dancers were awesome with Las Vegas quality talent. The circus was also unbelievable with one really talented and very strong guy who did amazing things on the ropes/trapeze. The 70s/80s rewind show was also very very entertaining.Casino: We never made it except a brief trip through it. We talked to numerous people who said they won there though.Disco: Did not make it ther either as we were to tired to go after drinking and being out in the sun all day.Shopping: Cigar shop at resort is a rip off (like $20 - 30 us for one cigar) as well as the convienence store there. We went to the shops off site (front gate) and were hassled to no end by shopkeepers. They will give you a free cigar and shots of mamajuana for free however. My advice is to barter to 50% of asking price. My wife got a Larimar/amber bracelet and larimar/amber earings, a bottle of rum, a pound of coffee and some post cards for like $50.00 US which I thought was apretty good deal. A similar bracelet in the jewelery store in the hotel was like $125.00 us.Excursions: We did the Saona Island excursion which we both enjoyed, although it took like 12 hours roundtrip. The catamaran ride was nice, the island had probably the nicest beach I have ever seen but be prepared to be hassled by pushy salespeople selling jewelry, coconuts and massages. The buffet on the island was also very good. On the way back they stopped at the natural swimming pool which is a knee to waist deep area about 1/2 mile off shore where there are lots of starfish. We found 4.Complaints: We only had three complaints and they were minor and in no way detracted from our experience. The first was that they advertise catamarans as being included. Well they are only if you have experience with them. If not they want to charge you $50 US for a lesson, which we thought was false advertising. Secondly, when using the internet cafe they charge $5 for 30 minutes or $8 an hour. If you go over your 30 minutes they will charge you an additional $5 unless you specify that you want a whole hour from the get go. Last, the henna tattoo lady tried to rip us off. She initially wanted $25.00 us for a small tattoo and my wife laughed and then she went to $15.00. Well we talked her down to $12 and she drew up the design and only included a portion of it (incomplete design). We walked away and she just sat there without any business for the rest of the afternoon when she could have made $12 for like 10 minutes work.All in all the Majestic was excellent. We never saw any bugs or mosquitos other than like 3 ants on our patio. The weather was awesome although humid at night. Without a doubt it is the nicest resort I have stayed at and we will definitely return for an anniversiary.

<Author>Virginia7
<Content>Just OK--totally honest opinion Having traveled to several countries I am well aware of the cultural differences in food, culture. However, I would have to say that that our time in the DR was just ok. I read the reviews on trip advisor and went there with an open mind since I know that you cannot please everyone. The hotel--A++ for the beauty of the grounds, the pool, the beach, the rooms and the overall layout of the resort. I have no complaints whatsoever about any of these. The pool is huge and VERY clean, the beach is stunning and VERY clean. The resort itself is gorgeous. No problem at all getting chairs, shaded huts, etc.The food--I'd give it a C at best. Trust me when I tell you that I was not expecting Amercianized food but even their local fare just was not good. I would say edible at best. Fruit--excellent--you can't go wrong here. Chatueaubriand was very good and the French Restaurant, while not spectacular, was by far the best. The Sushi at the Japanese place was also decent. The drinks are made with bottom of the barrell liquor. They have stoli IF YOU ASK but everything else is the cheapest available. My husband did get sick but I am going to chalk that up to too much alcohol and sun. But lunch at the beach restaurant is not good at all. There were clearly rotted vegetables, things that should have been kept cool just sitting out baking in the heat and not a great selection. Stick to the main lobby buffet. Service: F. The front desk staff was very good and helpful. Beyond that you are on your own. I was truly made to feel as though I was inconveniencing anyone else including the bartenders. They look at you solely as money and that's it. I am a firm believer in tipping as we are told these people are making $50-$60 a WEEK, however, I will not tip just because. At no point did I feel as though anyone was happy to serve. There is zero beach or poolside service. You have to get your drinks yourself.Entertainment B+. The entertainment staff DO work hard. The Michael Jackson show is by far the best I have seen at any resort anywhere. Shopping: F- If there was a grade lower than F they would get it. There is a shopping area just outside the resort. AVOID THIS. They hound you to point where you can't even LOOK. I understand they are trying to make a living but they are beyond agressive. We left after 10minutes because they do not leave you alone for 1sec. Pay a little extra on the resort and save the hassel of being harrassed. The main thing we didn't like is that we felt like we were in a prison. You cannot leave the resort under any circumstances unless you are taking a tour. You are hounded for money from the second you get off the plane to the minute you leave. It was a nice place to rest and relax but we will not return to DR.

<Author>racerx27
<Content>Unbelievable Value Wife and I stayed at the Majestic 5/21-25 and loved it! This resort is a great value. We stayed four nights for around $1100 taxes and all including transport to and from the airport (which I recommend getting ahead of time, but NOT from Hotelbeds). I am not a cruise person and not really all about all inclusives because I'm a foodie. But I was pleasantly surprised with this place.The Food: none of the food is going to top the Zagat survey, but it is all pretty good and the breakfast buffet is excellent. My favorite thing was the Churrasco at the Rodeo Steakhouse, very authentic. The Japanese grill was neat to experience in a Latin country, but it was no better than a Benihana in my book. But that's a good thing, cause you would still drop $40 or more a head at a joint like that in the U.S., which is a steal at an all-inclusive. Le Gourmet, the French restaurant is pretty good. It was a big surprise to find that they did not enforce the dress code at all (people in nothing better than beach wear) and the service was probably the worst of all the restaurants, including the beach buffet. The food was impressive for an all-inclusive. If you are saving your dessert calories for one place in the whole resort, get them in at this place. The Tiramisu is very good but the Chocolate Fondant is out of this world, among the best I've tasted. The lunch buffet in the main hall is OK, the pizza's not bad and everything else is average. The beach buffet I wasn't too big on, eventhough we had it two or three days for lunch. It was more cafeteria style food. We did not try the Chinese part of Matsuri but we heard a lot of people saying it was not good at all. Taino, the Latin place, was pretty good. I recommend the stews, both the Dominican and the Goat were great. The Fajitas were what you would get at any shopping center Mexican joint in the U.S., not bad and not great. The only complaint I have is the time some of these places opened. Nothing was open from 10 until 12:30, so you have to schedule your day around lunch or eat breakfast twice. And most of the dinner joints didn't open till 6:30 or 7, if you wanted to eat early and then go back out for dessert or a lite bite later like many of us like to do at the beach. This was especially inconvenient on check out day since you had to check out by 12 but no food is available till after that and anyone with an afternoon flight needs to head on to the airport.The Drinks: I do agree with some of the negatives here. The drinks didn't do anything for us. The house drink, The Majestic, is very good. But basically what they do with all their frozen beach type drinks is premake them with no alcohol and then just pour a heap of rum in the bottom of the cup before pouring the mix over it. This makes for an OK pina colada, but not so much for other drinks that would make more sense with a dark rum, whiskey, tequila, and so on. The beer in the mini bar is Brahma, I could look at it and make my decision, I am a beer aficianado and I let my wife try it and she confirmed my concerns. Not good. They do have Presidente on tap, which is OK for a Pilsner and good for hot weather. That's about it. The room: we had a top floor garden view with a balcony that looked toward the beach and the neighboring resort to the West. I was very pleased with the overall decor. It wasn't the Ritz but it was very nice and had a good airflow. The thermostat stops at 20C (68F), so no luck in getting it any cooler in there, but I can understand the need to regulate this. The big fan helps. The bed is not great, we didn't have any back pain or anything but it wasn't a tempurpedic by any means. The sheets were probably 200 count at best, not sandpaper but not good. There is a 24 or 27 inch TV in the room with about 25 channels of DirecTV. We are from Atlanta so we found it hilarious that the DTV provider at the resort was Atlanta as well. It was like we were still at home. They carried Starz and I think there was HBO, I can't remember, didn't watch too much TV. Had ESPN though, that's all that matters. The bathroom is certainly not for private people, the open floorplan was great for me and my wife but it would not be good at all if you were sharing the room with kids or other people. I felt the cleaning crew did a good job daily, the floors were mopped and free of sand daily and my feet never felt grimy, so that's saying a lot.The resort: The grounds are beautiful. They have to work hard on the garden ponds, they have a lot of algae, but other than that this place is pretty much flawless. You would see no less than 30 workers out all day picking up and manicuring the grounds. The pool is too cool to even talk about. It is without a doubt the coolest pool I've ever seen beside Atlantis' Royal Towers. The freezing water in front of the Spa is great too in the hot day, it makes for a nice jolt. The lobby is very pretty but nothing awe inspiring. There's a good shop near the reservation counter with some nice handbags and other goods that were pretty reasonable. They had a free market the Thursday night we were there outside. It was alright, nothing you wouldn't find in the towns for a better price but they didn't seem to be robbing people either. The resort is long and narrow, so you might luck out and get really close to the beach like we did or you might get really close to the food, but for one of the two you are going to have to walk a long way most of the time. The walkways are a little weird, no straight path from front to back of the resort.The bathrooms: I section this off because I can't stand bad bathrooms at a resort. The pool water closets were not half bad for pool bathrooms but could have used better up keep. The bathrooms in the main building were so hot because that building has no air conditioning, it is open air. So the bathroom is like a sauna. Be warned, it is not a place to cool down.The service: I wasn't blown away by the service but I was never let down either. We didn't get into the whole Animation team thing, but they seemed to work really hard to entertain the people that wanted to participate. The counter service for check in and assistance was on par with most places, but I've certainly had better in other countries at cheaper prices.The beach: AMAZING. This is one of the most gorgeous stretches of sand (that's developed) I've ever seen. Powder soft and very well taken care of. They clean the seaweed up each morning and have people picking up trash all day. The Palapa huts (grass umbrellas) are very big, you can easily fit two loungers under them in full shade and three in partial. The beach was never overcrowded in my opinion even though the resort was full. Plenty of space. There is a great breeze all day that makes it so much more bearable here than Florida or other Caribbean islands I've been to. The beach is topless optional and many people choose to exercise this option. Wives and Girlfriends shouldn't be too worried, though, most of the women I saw scared me. The pool seemed to have a lot of topless sunbathers too, just be sure to know this before you go if it might bother you.The Ocean: I was disappointed in the snorkeling. The water itself is beautiful, clear to the point of losing depth perception. But it is very rocky on the Eastern part of The Majestic's beach. The rocks are full of sea urchins, although I never heard of anyone getting pricked. There were maybe 12 varieties of fish, some nice tropical colors, nothing over 10 inches in size. Friendly fish though, good for swimming with. I heard that you could take snorkeling and diving tours outside the resort that were great, but we did not do one ourselves.The Country: I've you haven't been to the D.R. yet, it is very similar to other Caribbean nations. They love to nickel and dime you outside the resorts but for the most part the people are kind and harmless. Don't drink the water, even though the resort doesn't tell you that, it took my bowels four days to recover from the trip because I drank a little from the tap during the night. The airport is a joke, be prepared for a LOOONNNGG wait on your return flight home, it took us every bit of 2 1/2 hours to go from the curb to boarding the plane and we were in a line the whole time, we never sat down. Seriously. There is food at the airport once you go through security. Most of these resorts have you check out by noon and you miss lunch. So thank goodness there was some food at the airport.A couple of notes, if you book through Expedia or GoGo, see if you can get a different transport provider than Hotelbeds. I won't go into our experience here, but I was very disappointed in them. Several people on the same flight as us had other transport companies and got to and from the resort way faster than we did and were picked up on time. Also, they tell you that you have to pay a $10 tax to enter the country per person and a $20 tax per person to leave the country. They got everyone with the $10 coming in, but I never saw anyone pay the $20 on the way out. But then I heard some people say they did pay it. So this is kind of a crapshoot. The Majestic only has one ATM in the main lobby and it only gives Dominican Pesos. The fee from the bank was $3.All in all, any flaws we found with the Majestic were negligent compared to the value in staying in an exotic place this nice for $250 a day all-inclusive. For that kind of money on a cruise ship you might get a balcony room if you get upgraded, but a crowded pool and rushed dashes to crowded beaches await you. Here, it's a moderate walk down to a gorgeous beach with plenty of room and shade where you can just relax all day and do nothing if you wish or find plenty to do. I highly recommend this resort on your next trip.
