<Author>ohwinkle
<Content>The best vacation so far! First let me say that we booked this vacation through CheapCaribbean, who did a fantastic job and took care of all the details. They even got us an upgrade to first class on the trip down. I would highly recommend working through them. The price was good and the service even better. We stayed at the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana from May 11-16 and we could not have had a better time - relaxing, beautiful and they treated us like royalty. This resort is more upscale than some of the others and the beach is also much nicer. The staff at the resort was first class, our room was gorgeous with a stunning ocean view and the food was great. We ate at each of the 5 restaurants at the resort. My only complaint, and it's not really even a complaint, is that the nightlife leaves alittle to be desired. I wish they had some live music or local groups to play in the evenings. Most everything started at 10:00 p.m., which is late when you've been out doing things all day. The Michael Jackson show was hilarious!The stores in site are kind of high in price, but you can get great deals at the Plaza outside the front gate. It's about 2 blocks away and you can walk or take a taxi. The shopkeepers are very aggressive and will hound you to buy from their shop. I just kept my head down and focused on what I was looking for. You also have to negotiate on everything. My rule was to automatically take 50% off the quoted price and then negotiate down from there. You can usually purchase items for about 30-40% of the original cost. Once they see the money in your hand, they won't say no.The beach and water are breathtaking - crystal blue with the cleanest sand I've ever seen. I have to stress that everyone needs to use sunscreen everyday. The sun is strong, but you don't realize it until afterwards. My husband got burned pretty bad the first day and had to watch it the rest of the trip. I was fine with using 30  50 each day. The animation team does lots of activities on the beach - stretching, aerobics, dance lessons and games. They were a good group with LOTS of energy. We took the Monster truck excursion which was fun and very educational. You really got a sense of the people and culture. Visiting the Voodoo Priest in the sugar cane fields was the highlight of the day. It is hot when you get away from the beach, so dress appropriately. Hats and sunscreen are a must. I would definitely recommend this excursion.We had a great time, and the cost and trip were easy. We will go back again next year and try one of the other resorts. I highly recommend the Dominican Republic.

<Author>coraltnt
<Content>Excellent All Inclusive Resort! We have been to the Dominican Republic 2 other times but at Puerto Plata area instead of Punta Cana and this is our third time to DR and first time to Punta Cana. We were there the week of May 12, 2007. We stayed at another 4 star hotel the Hilton Coral Marien in Puerto Plata and it was no where in comparison to the Majestic. Majestic is very nice hotel and most who have stayed there have nothing bad to say about it. It is the same for us. However, since different folks have different preferences on what is consider a good resort, my review will consist of a list of the pluses and minuses in my opinion of the resort for each person to decide for him/herself.Pluses- Lobby area is grand and beautifully laid out for entertaining.- Pool is a huge river like format that flows from the lobby area to the beach area.- There are always available clean chairs around the pool and beach area whether you enjoy the shade or the sun.- All areas of the resort are scenic and clean. Most areas are formal and elegant.- The rooms are great and the one we were in had jacuzzis inside and outside our room in a private patio area separate from the balcony.- Staffs are courteous and friendly.- Since it is May, we did not have any trouble with mosquitos which is a really good thing for me personally since I hate having to put on bug lotion every night. I am not sure if it is just this resort that doesn't have them or because it is in May. There are other bugs like small ants occasionally near the sinks but that's given for hot weather tropics.- Walkways are well lite so it feels safe to walk around at night.- There is a safe in the room free of charge for all your valuables so you can feel at ease leaving things in the room.- The mini frig is stocked daily with bottled water, soda and beer for your enjoyment free of charge. There is a bottle of champaign to welcome you on the first day.- The resort gives out free bottled water if you ask at any restaurants you eat at. This is great since you can't drink tap water there.- The nightly shows are decent. They are not lame like the other resorts I have been to. We saw a Michael Jackson impersonation show and a gymnastic circus show and they were both decent. There are actually talented entertainers at these shows to keep your attention.- The resort is only about 30 mins car ride from the Punta Cana airport which is better than some which are 1 hour away.Minuses- Food was just OK at all the restaurants. Maybe it is because it is a different country so the meats like beef specifically tasted a bit game-y. Other than that, if you stay with the basics like chicken and pasta, you will be fine. There are enough variety for a few days to find something to keep you satisfied. If you have reservations to the French restaurant, try the Grouper (fish), it was really good if you like fish. If you are at the Japanese restaurant, you'll be having Hibachi style chicken, shrimps, fish, beef, veggies, etc.- The pool and the beach are pretty much closed after 6 pm so there is no late night swimming. The weather is so nice sometimes you might want to jump in after dinner but can't.- The toilet in the room is very very small. Everything else in the room is great except the toilet which is a separate stall from the shower and very narrowed so if you are afraid of small spaces, you will find it a little weird. I am a very small person, less than 100 lbs and I still felt trapped.Not Applicable to our trip:- We have no kids so we don't know how the resort is for children. We did see a children play area with water slides just for the kids. There is also a children pool.- We did not do any excursions this time but have to say that the staffs are courteous enough not to hassle you if you are not interested in them.- We did not go to the disco at night so we are not sure how great it is.- We briefly checked out the casino and it was a decent size for a beach resort hotel.

<Content>Okay with some issues My husband and I just got back from a 10 day stay at Majestic from May 3-12. I will start by saying that resort grounds are well maintained and that the pool and beach are amazing. The food was average if that. The buffets are pretty standard but offer the same food pretty much daily. My husband and I found the Hibacchi to be the best meal of all and the nicest service. The only other a la carte that we enjoyed was the steak house. The seafood was horrible. Breakfast each morning was nice, you can get just about anything that you want. The standard suite does not include room service and I mention this because on the third night that we were at the resort I was ill and unable to go to dinner. My husband went to the italian buffet and asked if would be able to bring me back a piece of bread as I was unable to make it through a meal and he was told no more than once. They instead told him to order room service...we both found this interesting because each time that we were at that restaurant we noticed people taking plate fulls of food right out without being stopped. I was a little put off after that fact considering the price that we paid and every other place that I have gone that was all inclusive didnt care if you took food out. I was very upset and told my husband that I was going to search out Majestic Mike, whom I had read so much about. Until my husband told me that he believes that Mike was one that told him that he couldnt bring any bread to me. So much for that. Rooms were spacious and I loved the balcony. We were given a lovely room that overlooked the pool and had a small ocean view. Only problem was the amount of bugs (I would have expected this if I had brought food back to the room and let it set out) there were tons of ants and spiders. Some is to be expected given the climate but it was a little over the top. Not a good thing for a husband with a terrible fear of ants, especially when they are in the bed at night. The bed was a nice king size, I enjoy a hard mattress and it was that, I think it may have been two mats put together because from my husbands side to mine there was a definite dip that started right in the middle. There were plenty of pillows so that can help make up for the hard bed if you dont care for one. The only thing the pillows dont make up for is the sheets that dont seem to fit the bed and always came up, this meant by morning I was sleeping on the plastic cover (?) that was over the mattress itself...I felt like a toddler who might urinate the bed. The air never got cold and we had three lights out in the room. The balcony light sometimes went off at night and sometimes didnt making up for the lack of light inside but killing a good nights rest. I didnt mind the open concept. The toilet stall does have a door on it that gives visual privacy but yes you can hear things. If your a couple, your bound to hear those things eventually though right, lol. Entertainment staff, was great, there was always something to do. There were days that we didnt want to do anything and there was plenty of space for that. We always seemed to find a spot in the shade no matter what time of day and the hotel was sold out during our visit. Beach was awesome sand reminds me of Bermuda. We rented snorkeling gear thats included with the stay...they dont give flippers unless you pay for a snorkeling excursion which we happened to do. We had a blast on this trip, it was two hours and probably the best part of our trip. The one day we walked way down the beach and saw a cop with an automatic weapon escorting locals off the beach, this is not unusual of the caribbean in my opinion. Expensive...make sure you pack everything that you will need. I forgot our Tums and we got a small bottle at the minimarket and it was $10 US. Everything is very expensive, the one day we were buying a photo that was taken of us...I overheard a couple asking to purchase a disposable camera, it was $45 US. Needless to say they left without making a purchase. We only bought gifts when the vendors were all set up along caribbean street, your able to talk them down a little but I would have consider the prices we got to be a bargain by any means. We got a painting for $45 US after we bought it the girl said she was wrapping it up for us...well she took it completely off the frame and handed me a rolled up canvas. I noticed that everyone else was given the painting the way that it was for sale, including a frame that the picture was mounted on. Oh well, she was nice enough and Im sure they work hard for their money so I didnt say anything. I guess they list this place as a five star, I would not agree with that rating. I think this would be a great place for families or spring breakers but not someone who is looking for luxury and great food.Staff, some were great some could have cared less. It was busy when we were there and sometimes when you asked for things there were never given to you. We tipped everyone, regardless of their niceness. I have read how little the employees make and that leaves a spot in my heart. We noticed that some of the male employees approaced the females and had dates to go out with them later in the evening, so any single women looking for a How Stella Got Her Groove Back type affair, Im sure you can find it at Majestic.Now some stuff that I didnt use to evaulate my opinion of this hotel but things that I would have liked to know before going to the DR. Its a very poor country, lots of run down places that you pass on the way to the hotel. There doesnt seem to be the happy atmosphere that you get throughout the caribbean. The scenery lacks greatly. Not many flowers or things along that line. Be advised the airport is a nightmare to fly home from. We were flying first class USAir and there was only two sets of people in front of us, we waited over 30 minutes because people would come up behind us flag someone down with a $20 and get taken before us. Now mind you , the entire time we were waiting they were yelling for people in the coach line to come to the front if there were flying to Philadelphia. I finally went right to the front and just told them to get my ticket printed that I wasnt going to watch anyone pay their way to the front of the line. Im not sure why but our transfer picked us up at 12:30 (originally we were told 12:00) and we didnt get to the airport until about 1:45, our flight was leaving at 3. After all was said and done, this was probably the worst vacation that we have ever gone on from start to finish. All of this is just the opinion of someone who has traveled greatly and was expecting something classier. This is a perfectly suitable resort for plenty and if it were not located in DR, I would go back on a budget friendly trip but I guess its like the line...if it seems to good to be true, it is.

<Author>stubborn1
<Content>Great time - I hope to be back My wife and I stayed at the Majestic for four nights at the end of April/beginning of May 2007. This is the 3rd all inclusive we have been to, but first time in the DR. I would go back again in a minute. Rooms I booked through [---] and grabbed the most basic (garden view) room available figuring I wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the room. We ended up in room 1311 鈥?Building 1, 3rd floor. For a cheap room, I was very impressed. Room was complete with a complimentary minibar with bottled water, a few sodas, and a few beers. Coffee pot was also standard. Shower stall was large with good water pressure. Toilet stall was strange as others have noted, but it didn't bother us. Our room didn't have any rooms above us, so they vaulted the ceiling over the bedroom area 鈥?nice touch. The balcony overlooked the resort next door. It didn't bother me because I spent a total of 30 minutes out there.A few suggestions: better pillows 鈥?I needed to use 3 when I normally use 2 at home. Wasn't a problem because we easily got more from the housekeeping staff. Our room only had a small garbage can in the bathroom. Not sure if this is standard, but a garbage can in the room itself would be very helpful.Food Just a general comment on the food 鈥?If you don't enjoy the food here, consider yourself a food snob. Yes, I found a few dishes on the buffet I didn't care for, but 95% of it was just fine. You can't compare an all-inclusive to fine dining from back home.Breakfast Buffet 鈥?The selection and quality of food at breakfast was excellent. I looked forward to breakfast every day. Crepes, pancakes, waffles, churros, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, cook to order omelets and egg stations, bacon, different types of sausage, plus a few other hot dishes.Lunch Buffet 鈥?I enjoyed lunch almost as much as breakfast. Again, plenty of select and good quality of food. The pizza choices were interesting 鈥?I hadn't seen corn on a pizza before, but it tasted fine. Plenty of salads and soups, cook to order pasta station, and a variety of hot dishes.Dinner Buffet 鈥?I didn't get to the main buffet for dinner, so I can't comment.Beach Buffet 鈥?The lunch offerings at the beach buffet were your basic hot dog/hamburger offerings. Nothing too special, but it worked.Japanese 鈥?Try to get a reservation for this place as soon as you check in 鈥?it books up fast. You don't really get a choice on the meal 鈥?it's fried rice, beef, chicken, shrimp, and fish cooked up hibachi style. You can take a stroll to the sushi bar and get choice of desert. I've definitely had better quality at home, but the variety during our stay made this restaurant worth it.Chinese 鈥?Same area as Japanese. No time for a visit on our stay.Steakhouse 鈥?The chateaubriand was excellent. Best meal I had during our stay. My wife had the sirloin and it was very good as well. The steakhouse and seafood restaurants are in the same building by the beach. Great atmosphere for an evening dinner. Get there early and you can pick a table with an ocean view.Seafood 鈥?We also enjoyed the seafood restaurant. I had grilled red snapper and my wife had shrimp. They don't skimp on the size of the shrimp either 鈥?very respectable for an AI.French 鈥?The French restaurant is the other ala carte that requires a reservation. Again, no complaints from the dining here. The chocolate fountain dessert was my wife's favorite of the whole trip.Dominican/Mexican 鈥?This is the only restaurant I would give a so-so rating. My wife had a seafood combination meal that she didn't care for. I had fajitas and they were fine except they only give you two tortillas 鈥?no big deal, just ask for more.BeachBavaro beach is one of the finest I've seen. You can walk miles either way from the resort and still be on the same beach. No rocks in the sand and crystal blue water. I went snorkeling around the perimeter of the swim area and saw 8-10 different types of fish.If you want a place in the shade, be sure to get down there by 8:30-9:00 to stake your claim to a chair. Otherwise, you can find a shade spot later in the afternoon fairly easy. It seemed like most people frequented the beach from morning to early afternoon.PoolThe pool is the crown jewel of the resort. It winds through the common areas between buildings. Water was plenty warm and it was never crowded. The swim up bar was a popular hangout, but it never took more than a few minutes to get a drink.StaffThe staff were helpful and friendly. The language barrier was never an issue. Knowing a few phrases in Spanish is helpful. They work long hard days, so be sure to tip a dollar or two for good service. They appreciate it.

<Author>PaulaandGlenGardiner
<Content>Loved the Majestic! Stayed 1st-8th May 07. This was our 3rd time back to Punta Cana, but our 1st time at the Majestic - what a great place!BEACH: Bavaro beach is gorgeous (hence why we have been back 3 times!). Powder white soft sand, very wide beach with a beautiful turquoise sea. The beach at the Majestic has the best location and the biggest area compared to other hotels along the stretch - loungers/palapas are well spaced and lots of them - never crowded despite hotel being fully booked.POOL: Fab! A very long winding pool running through the middle of the resort which ends just short of the beach. A couple of jacuzzi's in there too and swim up bar. Always able to get a lounger. WEATHER: Absolutely scorching every day!ROOMS: The best room we have stayed at in the Dominican. The shower is huge! Rooms are very open plan - not sure how it would work for a family - but as there's only 2 of us, we loved it! FOOD/DRINK: I am a very picky eater and I did not have a problem at all. There is so much choice, I don't think anyone would go hungry here! Food and drink are available practically 24 hrs. ENTERTAINMENT: The Animation Team work really hard to put on good shows - and they do just that. Not the usual 'dancers in frilly dresses' type shows which seems to be the norm - their shows are really entertaining; the acrobatic show was great, the ideal couple show was hilarious and if you only see one show you MUST see the Michael Jackson show! Shows normally start at 10.00pm and finish at 11.00pm - after which just wander across to the Casino or Sports Bar.ACTIVITIES: Usual non-motorised watersports, plenty of paid watersports on offer too. My husband went diving and a cameraman went with him and filmed him - we bought the dvd for 拢25 and it was well worth it - edited so professionally to music. There's tennis, football and a golf course next door, gym, jogging track - there is plenty to do if you so wish.TIPPING: It's nice to tip here and there (bellboy, bar staff etc) - the staff all work so hard and are very obliging. We also left a dollar in the minibar each morning and got extra beer. We also left a dollar for the maid each day. OVERALL: This is a lovely hotel, great service, staff, facilities - I cannot fault it. It is quite big, but It's not 'enormous' as some say - (only approx. 240 rooms) - it's just a nice size, spacious and very well laid out.

<Author>JBSAlbany
<Content>Great experience My wife and I stayed at the Majestic for 4 days May 4-8 and had just an amazingly great experience. We wanted rest, relaxation and peace and got it. Hotel: beautiful place everything from the main lobby to the grounds to the pool to the buildings are magnificent. Room: We stayed in room 4240 - jr suite ocean view. The room was towards the back right hand side of the resort (opposite the pool side rooms) and looked out on a palm tree grove and the beach/ocean. balcony had a direct line of sight to the ship wreck. Incredible view. One negative was a old beat up chain link fence that ringed that side of the resort. Room was great, big with many nice touches. Bathroom was big (shower was huge) and was nice. Toilet was odd as has often been stated with only a 3/4 door but didn't bother us (I could see how that would be a big negative though for others). This was the second upgrade available to us (majestic jr suite was the first).Food/Drinks: I thought the food was pretty good - it didn't blow me away but I had a good meal each night. I ate at the Japanese one night and that was by far the best. We couldn't initially get a resv. but as we found out there are usually cancellations so we got in at the 6:30 seating (3 seatings - 30 people each seating). There was also a sushi buffet at the Japanese rest that was available to all diners. The Dominican/mex restaurant was also very good. The steakhouse was pretty good, the wife and I each had the chateau briand which was decent. The seafood rest was ok, fish was fresh (lobster and shrimp) and I like grilled seafood. In all the food was pretty good slightly better than expected. Drinks were always very good but it can be difficult to get exactly what you want at times depending on which bar you're at. Not a big deal as I stuck to the basics. Wine wasn't to my liking and I brought a few bottles down and brought one to the steakhouse which wasn't a problem. My rec to the resort would be to upgrade in the house wine dept. The buffets were better than expected - breakfast always had great fresh fruit - awesome passion fruit - and more than enough variety for our short stay. Lunch was as good. Beach buffet was basic and good if you didn't want to head into the main building. Pool/beach: Pool is unbelievable and the best I have ever seen or heard of. I spent almost all day each day at the pool bar which was quieter. If you wanted more action there was a swimup bar (wet bar) where the animation team spent the day. Beach was incredible as well with nice water (not too rough) and beautiful sand. getting chairs wasn't a problem at the pool we usually dropped off some towels on the way to breakfast and never had any issues. Spa: Wife had a facial, manicure and pedicure and was happy with the services. I stopped in the spa when she made her appts and the place looked very nice. Other: Did some shopping at the Punta Blanca plaza right outside the gate which was standard. The vendors can be a bit much and I probably could have paid less for what I got if I wanted to be a pain the arse but was happy with the deals I got on rum and some pics. I also traded a titleist hat for a bottle of rum so feel free to bring down some stuff to trade. I also went on the Don Lucas cigar tour which was ok, prices weren't great and it took a lot longer than I expected but none the less it was ok. The prices at the resort were good and bad. Some stuff was crazy expensive but there were a few things that we got some good deals on. Staff were great and always helpful. Most understood my rudimentary spanish or english. All in all a really beautiful resort that met or exceeded my expectations and I would definitely return.

<Author>Island_Hunni84
<Content>Exceptional.... To begin, I used this website to read the reviews before booking my vacation. And I must say, I took everything that was said in to careful consideration. To say the least...I was NOT disappointed. My vacation was from April 26-May 3. Right off the airplane we were greeted by two lovely women dressed in traditional DR wear and took our picture. Walking through to the luggage terminal was very easy and luggages were out and I picked mine up in 5 min, I walked over to my bus and was taken to Majestic. It was about a 45min CRAZY drive to the hotel, but I loved it from the moment I walked off the bus. We arrived late at night, approx around 10:30pm. We were greeted by a bell-boy who gave us cold refreshing wet towels. I must say, they smelled very nice, and was very very refreshing. As we walked to the front desk to check in, we were greeted by a waitress who gave us a welcome drink in a martini glass, that was their signature drink titled Majestic, heehee not very original. Check in was easy and we were quickly taken to our room. Walking through the foyer and out to the courtyard, I saw beautiful palm trees, felt a lovely breeze and great structures and decor. We quickly freshened up changed and went for some dinner. Our first stop, the only thing open, was the Taino Restaurant. Keep in mind it was approx 11pm by this time, there was not the greatest amount of option for my taste, but there was enough.The next morning we were up at the crack of dawn and we began our day in BEAUTIFUL Punta Canada (heehee many staff were correcting visitors by saying we were from Punta Canada). The day was bright and the weather was perfect. Breakfast is great at the Buffet Restaurant Supreme. Its located just to the left once you exit the lobby. Their lunch is pretty good too. They have a large asortment of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We also spent some time at the beach restaurant for lunch, because it was convenient to access it from the pool and beach. Their lunch is good as well, but their dinner is more fancier and it is a-la-cart. It is separated in two different restaurants. One is Steakhouse, the other is Seafood. The ribs are EXCELLENT, Im not a fish eater, but the couple we stayed with said the seafood was excellent as well. No reservations needed. The other two restaurants we ate at were Le Gourmet (French) and Matsuri (Japanese). Both are a-la-cart and both require Reservations. But the trick to Matsuri, is that the reservations are only held for 10 min. the evening of your reservation and if you are more than 10 min late they get cancelled. So, for those who cannot get any reservations made (because it is a very good and very popular restaurant) the longest you will wait is 10 min. Because they accept walk-ins if reservations get cancelled. There are also appetizers such as sushi. This restaurant can only accompany 36 people at a time for Japanese, due to the fact there are only 3 rooms with 12 people each that serves the Japanese. There is a dining room with tables and chairs at the same location that serves Chinese food (a-la-cart). Food is exceptional, and you are offered hors-d'overs, main dish (rice with veggies, stir fried veggies, and a selection of chicken, tiger shrimp, beef, and filet of fish (or all of them), then there are 3 options for dessert (fried ice cream, fried banana, coconut flan). Le Gourmet also offered appetizers, main dish and dessert. We had pumpkin cream soup with a layer of puff pastry cooked over top the bowl. We then had chicken with potatoes and veggies. Not your regular chicken and potatoes. It was very good! And you also had a choice of desserts. All to many to mention!Offered through my rep from Signature Vacations were various excursions that are all very well examined, insured, and tempting. My boyfriend and I chose to visit Don Lucas, which is a Cigar factory that demonstrated how they were made and offered a cigar for my boyfriend to try. In the building next to it was a store that was filled with jewelery, clothes, paintings, figurines, cigars, rum, coffee, mammajuana and vanilla. If you plan to buy any of these things, take it from me, buy them here. We bought vanilla, coffee and rum and the prices were great. With $60 USD we bought 2 bottles of rum, 2 packages of coffee, 1 bottle of vanilla and 10 cigars. They offered savings if you bought two in stead of one. Taxes are included. Best of all, this excursion was FREE.We also did the Outback Saffari. I was not too impressed with this one. The guide took us to an old couples home and I felt as though I was intruding in their home, and glamourizing the way they live; and they live very poor. On the other hand, we saw coffee bean trees, cocoa bean trees, passion fruit trees (my new fav fruit eventhough not very appealing to look at), mangoes, wild life, sugar canes (and tasted), bananas, beautiful mountains and we ended by being taken to a secluded beach where we did boogie boarding. It was a full day excursion and we were provided a well balanced lunch. Another thing that I didnt like to much, was the fact that the guide expected a tip. He actually expected $15-20 USD from us. To be honest, I didnt feel as though he did anything above or beyond to deserve the tip. I had encountered other staff on my resort who deserved it much more, because they were exceptional. This trip cost $80 USD which perhaps was not worth it.There are other excursions that the resort offers, and one that I wish I would have tried was the Sanoa Isld. I hear that it was just beautiful and they were able to swim in Caribbean waters as opposed to ocean. They were taken a little further out in the waters and were able to see many starfish and were able to swim with them. They were also given a buffet lunch. Not sure of the price.The casino, shows and disco. What to say...the routine we usually took was after dinner we would head out to the casino until the show began. My boyfriend was the gambler. He stayed at the BlackJack tables. We won a fair amount of money over a few days. The minimum bet at the tables are $5 USD. You are also able to gamble with Pesos. This casino also has roulette, poker and slots. Although it's fairly small, we enjoyed it. The shows, make an effort to see them. We enjoyed all of them, even the Michael Jackson show. The person as MJ was a perfect replica of him. That show was full of lights and dancing and action. We enjoyed it very much. The rest of the shows were just as entertaining. There was one called Ideal Couple, I believe, and it was just HILAIRIOUS!!!! The things these people had to do were outrageously funny! We miss the announcer and his actions. This guy can speak Spanish, English, French, Italian and German. And he did so EVERY time he spoke. But it was soo natural for him that it was very quick. I love my job! Is what he frequently said when people on stage were acting very silly. These shows are very entertaining. I highly recommend catching them. You catch one, you will want to see them all!After the show, was the disco. All the staff that are apart of the entertainment shows will be at the disco. They will be making sure you are happy and you are dancing. There are 3 dances with choreography that occur each night. Follow the leader and two others. All three are entertaining and fun to do. Their entertainment is also carried over to the pool and beach. Just infront of the main lobby, there is a board that shows what the theme is for the show in the evening, and the times that various activities take place and where. Every night around 7pm they also show movies for younger children. Water aerobics every morning at 11:30am was my favourite! My boyfriend also enjoyed water/beach volleyball. This resort is great for families, young children, weddings, couples, and a group of friends. It has everything you need. The rooms are spacious, except the toilet area can be a little snug. But, the shower more than made up for it. I cannot say enough about the staff. They are sincerly EXCEPTIONAL, they make you smile and have a good time. Mjority know English very well and Gaby at guest services is also very nice and knows English as if it were her first language. We asked for a new iron and shower robes and said it was no problem and returned our call to make sure we received it. The staff really care about their service and really cater to you to make sure you are content. I would go back tomorrow if I could. Leaving was sad, you grow so attached to the staff that they almost become your family, even if you dont tip. But when you do, they would kiss your feet if you asked them to. They are very gracious and humble. They appriciate your company and like I said they remember you and will go out of their way to please you. The pool and room and beach and restaurants were awesome. There were no glass windows anywhere. Huge arches that were cut out that allowed for the breeze and sunlight. There are no doors to the entrance of the lobby, but entering the property of the resort there are gates and a security guard standing there watching who goes in and who comes out. He is quite the distance from the main resort, and you only see him when you enter or leave through the main gates. There is staff that are constantly cleaning, and maintaining the grounds of the resort. From the crack of dawn they are on the beach collecting the seaweed that washed up on shore. We walked down to view the rest of the resorts, and I must say, we had the cleanest beach, many huts (for shade) on the beach, and many chairs. We did not feel the need to reserve our chairs, but we were able to leave our towel there for lunch, and leave our stuff there if we decided to take a dip or a walk. We came back and found everything there. We also saw two gentlemen walking the beach collecting garbage that guests may have left by their chairs. There is also another gentleman, standing guard on the beach watching for any beggars, or people selling merchandise. Every Thursday, there is a market that takes place on Caribbean St. They sell anything and everything. You can bargain the prices down a lot. You pretty much make the price and they will most likely agree. If I were given the opportunity, I would leave again tomorrow! I reccomend this resort to ANYONE and EVERYONE. It is a perfect spot. You will not be disappointed. Also, if you are a beach bum or a pool babe, there is no need to take an Ocean View. I was hardly in my room and always by the beach. Paying extra for it is not nessecary. I had the perfect Ocean view from the beach. Reconsider the Ocean View...it will be a waste of money, in my opinion. I had the standard jr room, with a great view of the garden, and I was content. I was in the middle of everything. I was 5 min walking distance from everything. Please enjoy your trip, dont worry too much about the little things. You're there for vacation, dont let anything stress you out. Have a couple Blue Lagoons and all will be forgotten. It's a tropical paradise, enjoy it to the best you can!!!

<Author>TheSFamily
<Content>Fantastic Resort - We'd Definitely Go Back! We spent 4 nights / 5 days at the Majestic Colonial and it was a fantastic time! Here are some of our observations / opinions, we hope you find them as helpful as we have found some of the other reviews here:The Lobby - We were greated with lavendar scented cold towels upon arrival, great touch. Our room was ready and the gentleman at the desk was extremely friendly and funny. The lobby is open and airy and beautiful. The Room (Garden View w/ Jacuzzi) - I read some other reviews before going and I can see how some people would find fault in the rooms for it's open layout. The toilet has a frosted glass door that is open on the top and it's rather small. The shower also has a frosted glass door that is open on top, but it's very large and spacious. We had no issues with privacy, though. The rooms are very spacious, open, and clean. The bed was on the firm side. Our patio had access to the pool as well as a jacuzzi and 2 lounge chairs, plus a small table with 2 regular chairs. At night, with the pool lights lit up, it was a fantastic little retreat for us. Our only complaint was that our room was never clean by the time we returned around 5/6PM. We had to call house keeping every day, but they were responsive. The Beach - The beach was beautiful! There is ample seating, but in order to get a tiki shade close to the water, we put our towels down around 8:30AM. If we hadn't, we still would have been able to find seats, just not in our ideal location. The Pool - Huge! We didn't spend too much time there, but there was also ample seating all around the pool. Restaurants:Japanese - Make reservations when you arrive at the hotel for this one if you want to have the private room with the hibachi chef. To our surprise, the food was very good! We definitely recommend it. Everything had a very fresh, ginger taste.French - Make reservations when you arrive, but this one has much more seating so it's not as difficult to get in. We had the steak, and it was excellent. They have a great wine selection as well. We recommend this restaurant.Carribean - A mix of Mexican and Dominican Food. Ok selection. The food was good. We'd recommend the Japanese or French over this one. But our preference usually isn't for Mexican food.Seafood - Great location, right off the beach. There was minimal appetizers, but the fish itself was excellent. Their lobster tails were huge! We recommend this restaurant.Steak - Didn't go, can't comment.Breakfast / Lunch - We went to the main buffet for breakfast. They had everything you can imagine! We were big fans of the fresh fruit and spanish tortilla. Lunch was our least favorite meal. They have a little bit of everything, though. Entertainment - There were activities all day long from dance lessons to yoga to funny games during the day. At night there was a band playing near the lobby. There were shows most nights. One night vendors set up a small flea market. We really didn't take advantage of these (except for the live band), we were more on a sit and do nothing vacation this time around. But with as much action going on, we had no problem finding a quiet place to sit and relax. There is definitely something for everyone! Our favorite things - The Beach, and having drinks at the different bars. The resort has so much seating, you can always find a place to sit and relax. The staff is very friendly. Bring singles to tip, although gratuity is included, they do accept tips. Pictures do not do this resort justice. It is absolutely beautiful! We highly recommend it and would definitely return for a future 5 day getaway.

<Author>MBCaper
<Content>Wonderful Vacation Spot We visited the Majestic April 14th -21st. Overall the resort was a fantastic vacation spot. Food - Very good, with something for everyone. We especially enjoyed the Taino, and Steakhouse restaurants, and the main buffett provided an exceptional breakfast selection to meet any traveller's taste. i.e. fresh fruit, rolls, breads, real orange juice, and a various assortment of hot breakfast dishes made to order etc. Mini bar in our room was stocked daily with beer, soft drinks and bottled water. All drinks including bottled water were also available at all the bar facilities. We did not have any illness. Our travel representative at the hotel did caution us to take it easy with our consumption of the specialty drinks. Most are made with fresh fruit and can cause some unwanted health issues if you drank too much (either with or without the rum). Rooms - very nice, however we would consider them more suited to couples than families due to the room lay out. The beds were firm but certainly quite comfortable and the pillows were also quite good. We were located in room 2341 - 2nd building from the beach, on 3rd floor over looking the pool. Great location if you wished to be near the beach and away from the main lobby entertainment in the evening. Rooms were very quite and you could not hear noise from other rooms. We did not have any musty smell in the room. Rooms cleaned everyday, with fresh linen, and towels. Occasionally we did not receive any face cloths, however this was not a problem. Service - We had one or two occasional requests during our stay and the staff was more than helpful, delivering items right away. Our room had a minor leak caused by the air conditioning unit. We called at 7:30 a.m. and they assured us someone would be available by 8:30 a.m. They arrived as stated (3 workmen) , corrected the problem and left the room within 20 minutes. In general all the staff were very friendly, and helpful including the front desk. At our arrival, they had extra staff on to meet the new guests arriving. We were quickly served and directed to our room. We did leave some items for the maids daily, and tipped the waiters. Take some US $1 the staff certainly appreciated the gesture. We also took a few items to give to the gardners or outside beach cleaners etc. . These fellows work very hard and don't receive items or much in the way of tips. They were very appreciative of the gesture. Entertainment - Live entertainment each evening outside the lobby /buffett area - OK. Piano upstairs in main lobby - easy listening. Shows at 10:00 p.m. nightly in theatre - Michael Jackson show was the best. Several had audience participation and overall some what amateur, but funny. This resort did not have the professional style entertainment we have enjoyed at other resorts in Cuba. Beach /Pool - FANTASTIC - there were lots of huts on the beach however most were taken by 9 -9:30 am daily. We did note they started to be available again early in the afternoon. The pool was fantastic also with huts and lots of loungers. Overall this was a wonderful vacation resort and we would certainly consider returning.

<Author>xps800
<Content>You Will Have a Fantastic Time -- Do not hesitate or have doubts After sorting through dozens of hotels and tripadvisor ratings, I was admittedly somewhat paranoid about, well, any hotel. But the truth is, you'll almost always find someone who had a terrible experience. Don't let one person's misfortune or, sometimes, obnoxiousness, ruin your vacation plans. The Majestic Colonial is a great hotel. It's not a Ritz-Carlton. But the price different between it and a hotel of that class is enormous. The difference in service however, is minimal. The Rooms are large and impressive. Be nice to the receptionist when you get into the hotel from the airport. Very nice. Ask for a room closer to the ocean and she'll honor your request if at all possible. We got a room that had a view of the pool and the ocean. It was perfect. The rooms are very comfortable, very new and very spacious. No complaints here. The food is above average for an all-inclusive resort. While the standard cafeteria offers a typical buffet, the restaurants where you can make reservations are great. The French restaurant is very good, and the Japanese place is also great. Make sure you make the reservations as soon as you get to the hotel, because they fill up quickly, especially the Japanese place. Luckily, when we went there, the other people did not show up and we were the only ones served by the Chef. The steakhouse near the beach is also great. Alcohol. Few complaints here. They will make you almost anything, and if they can't make *exactly* what you're asking for they'll make you something very similar that sometimes will be better. For instance, I asked for a Mohito at one point, but they made me a Caipirinha instead, which was very good and very similar. For some of the higher end alcohol, there may be a charge, but that is clearly indicated on the drink menu. However, sometimes the waitress conveniently forgets, especially if you are friendly. Don't be alarmed if someone asks you for your room number when you order a drink that you thought was free. This is for statistical purposes (they call it control). Beach is fantastic. No more needs to be said. Take an excursion. Take the free trip to the cigar factory if you're into cigars. The factory (it's a room in a nice compound) will give you a tour of the manufacturing process and then take you into the shop where you have the option of buying something. He puts no pressure on you and speaks very good English. DO NOT BUY CIGARS from the shop in the hotel. They are incredibly overpriced. We also took the Saona island excursion. It was fun to get off of the resort and see the countryside, but it wasn't as fantastic as I had imagined. It's still a good idea to try to get off the resort for a day. The staff at the hotel are wonderful. They are genuinely nice and interested in helping you. While some speak little (or no) English, they will try to help you in any way possible, even if that means finding someone who understands you. If you speak Spanish, you'll have a blast. I had the opportunity to talk to a lot of Dominicans on the trip. They are all extremely friendly people who are willing to share more about their culture and life. While tipping isn't at all expected or necessary, having a lot of singles on you may not be a bad idea. $1 is a very nice tip for most of these people. If you're in a group, and in one of the reservation restaurants, or being served by a waitress for the night at the bar, leave a few dollars, and they will both remember you and be extremely grateful. Many of the people who work at the hotel live in the complex because their families/homes are too far away to travel each day. They get paid a few hundred dollars a month and yet they are genuinely happy to have a job and to work with us tourists. All in all, a fantastic time.

<Author>asasj5
<Content>Absolutely Fabulous!! Spent a week at the Majestic from 4/17 through 4/24. Here are the highs and the lows:Airport was probably the worst run I have ever seen - no organization, hundreds of people swarming with no ropes to form lines, no idea of where to go or what to do. Once through immigration found one of our bags was missing - tried to communicate with an airport rep and filled out a form. Miraculously the bag arrived at the hotel at the end of the day - sheer luck! We arranged transportation through Expedia and had no problems there. The only annoying thing was that they couldn't tell me what time they would be picking us up at the hotel for the way back. I was forced to go meet the rep at the hotel 3 times before they could give me that info.Arrived at the hotel around 1:30 - the 2 rooms weren't ready so we went for lunch at the buffet. Finally got the rooms around 3:30 and they were next to each other but not pool views. Also, one of the rooms had a terrible musty odor. I went to the front desk to try and switch rooms but they said the hotel was full. They promised to send someone right away to wash the room and try to eliminate the odor. Well after calling THREE more times no one ever showed up so we just gave up. Eventually as the weather dried up the smell went away. The rooms were big and comfortable with awesome air conditioning. The shower was huge but the toilet area was a little small. There were a few too many mosquitoes for my taste but that is to be expected in the tropics - just a few bites on the kids, or so I thought....Next day my 8 year old woke up with his eye completely swollen shut! We took him to the 24 hour medical clinic on site. The woman doctor there was very kind and helpful and gave him a shot of something that brought the swelling down after 24 hours. A little unnerving but the response was comforting.The food: all the food was better than I expected. I am NOT a fan of buffets but how else could they feed all these people economically? The breakfast was unbelievable - fresh juice, eggs, omeletts, pancakes, waffles, breads, rolls, crepes, yogurt, fruit shakes, etc. But the best thing were the freshly made churros - nothing like the mushy ones you get in the US! I ate at least 4 every morning. And the coffee? Best I've ever had. The lunches were a little limited - 2 buffets - one on the beach and the breakfast one. Dinner was a choice of the breakfast buffet where they had Italian, or the other sit down restaurants - Mexican, steakhouse, seafood, Japanese and gourmet where only 12 and up can go. All were pretty good but the menus were small and not child friendly. Initially my 8 and 10 year olds didn't eat anything because there were no chicken tenders or mac and cheese. But guess what? Since they were hungry they tried new things and now they both like steak! Pasta was only available at the main buffet for dinner. The desserts were also fantastic - a different variety every night. The chocolate cakes were the best and they always had an ice cream bar - you must try the coconut ice cream - it was so delicious! Believe me, we did not go hungry. My daughter did get diarrhea from the 3rd day until we got home but the rest of is were ok. I tried to not drink too many of the tasty frozen drinks just in case.Now the reason I rated this a 5: the beach and the pool. I have been on many vacations and these were by far the very best I have ever seen. The pool was so big that it never seemed crowded and it was clean all the time. The temperature was perfect and the ledges in the water were ingenious for sunbathing. I didn't want to leave. Since there was so much grass and vegetation around the pool you didn't feel like you were in a hotel - it felt like paradise. The beach was also beautiful - the softest sand I have ever felt. The water was clear and blue although not as calm as I would have liked. And I have to say that this was the ONLY beach in the caribbean that I have been to that did not have the annoying locals trying to sell you hair braiding and jewelry - what a wonderful change!The kids club was a little dull but my kids only went to hang out with other kids so it was ok for them for a couple of days. At the beach and pool every day they brought a different animal for people to pose with and then purchase the pictures for $10 a piece. A little pricey but I'm glad I bought all 8 of them - a python, 2 different monkeys, 2 macaws and an iguana - pretty cool for the kids.We went to a couple of the shows but they were a little cheesy. I tried the casino and that was fun - won a little money too. The nightlife is not fantastic but we were happy to relax in the room and read or watch tv. Wanted to get up early anyway to enjoy the outdoors.All in all this was a great vacation if you can get past the little annoying things. I have been on cruises and to other caribbean islands but for a family of 5 this was the best value around. If you want to relax and sit by the pool and the beach this is the place for you!

<Author>Tigertucker
<Content>Less than expected experience My family (sons ages 11 and 9, daughter 13, and my wife) stayed at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana from April 13th to April 19th 2007. From the reviews on this website, we thought that it would be beyond excellent, and were somewhat prepared for that; we didn't really receive that service, but I guess that is what you get for expecting too much.We arrived after a nice flight at the lobby to a great first impression. We were brought Majestics, the resort's signature drink, which set a tropical atmosphere. After this, though, things didn't go so well. We requested pool-side connected rooms preferably on the second row or higher, none of which were available. They gave us a set of keys for two rooms which they claimed were connected. Once we got to the rooms, we discovered just the opposite. Trip 1 from the lobby to a room and back to the lobby was completed.We were given another room set which was connected. They faced the forest; not exactly the view you would like going on a vacation like this. The next day we took trip 3 to change our room, where they changed us to first floor, connected, pool side rooms. We were promised that Sunday we would move to a fourth room, on the second floor and closer to the beach, exactly what we desired. Long story short: on Sunday, when I went to change the rooms, they had mistakenly given them away. Thus, we were stuck in first floor rooms right across from the ice machine and closest to the theater, so we could almost hear every word from the animation team each night, listen to people yelling outside our door at 2 in the morning, and count the number of ice cubes people craved at whatever time of day.The maids did a nice job; my daughter was able to tell them to please make the beds in spanish, as they speak one or two words in english.Our first night we ate at the steak restaurant, which was comparable to Peter Luger's in Brooklyn (no joke!!!!). The chateaubriand was excellent, as well as the brochettes and steak. We liked it so much that this was the one restaurant we opted to eat at twice.The second night my sons and I went to the seafood restaurant, which was unimpressive. My wife and daughter wanted to try le Gourmet, so we split up for the night. They said service was excellent, the atmosphere nice, but the food fair. When they asked if they could bring their desserts back to the room for us, the waiters brought brand new dishes back. Overall, this restaurant had the best service from their opinions.Next, we tried the chinese restaurant. Eating at 6:30, we were practically the only ones in the room; our food was out in an instant. It was pretty good. Soon, though, we were forgotten....It took what seemed like a week for our dessert to come after asking the waiters a few times.Monday we ate at the Mexican/Dominican restaurant. The service was absolutely HORRENDOUS. We arrived at 6:30, didn't receive drinks until 7, and menus until 7:15. Finally our dinner came at quarter of 8. The food was alright.Our final night, Wednesday, we ate at the hibachi. Make reservations the second you arrive, this was the first opening for reservations, which we made a couple hours after getting to the hotel. It was just like any restaurant in the US, only the fried rice was just a little different than the kids were used to.Breakfast was interesting; I never knew churros could be eaten at breakfast, but boy was I wrong!! The crepes were very good, as well as the omelettes. Lunch was the same, but we found that the beach shack had a a better lunch, the breakfast place just wasn't that great.We took the snorkeling trip one day from the hotel, which was a nice thing to do, especially to get the family ready for scuba diving. The advertisement leads one to believe that you get certified for $95 per person, which is not true. They required that I pay all the money 2 days ahead of time, so I walked down to the Bahia Principe and booked it there, paying right before the boat left for the dive. The people at Majestic's scuba hut were hard to work with, I found the Bahia people much nicer, as well as the fact that it was cheaper to take the dive there.As with any beach vacation, for us, 6 nights/7 days was too long...We stayed at Iberostar Puerto Plata 2 years ago for 4 nights/5 days, which was not quite long enough. (By the way, this was 10 times better.) The compromise will be our choice next time, as we were bored out of our mind by the final day.All in all, a nice experience, but we probably won't be going back.

<Author>Elena77
<Content>Nice place to be All the good things written in other reviews are true, the resort is a wonderful place to be if you do not mind small things, like problems with room service - there was never 3 hand towels( we had 3 people in the room), or no bottled water in the minibar, or your toothbrash trown away, or the table not cleaned up. The minibar is not stuffed for deluxe resort - no nuts, chocolates, they only make sure you have 2 beers in there daily. Oh, no one mentioned it - the resort do not provide body lotion, only shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, so make sure you bring your own, which is inconvenient with current flight rules if you do not check in your luggage. If anyone wants to know - there is plenty of taxis to take you to-from the hotel and airport, cost $35 and it's 30-35 minutes ride. Food is OK, but talking to people from other resorts - it's not something outstanding anywhere around. However, if you have a kid that craves for Wendy's type food - it's only available at the airport and is twice expensive compare to the US. At the end - resort grounds are beautiful and well maintained, but the best place is the beach, compare with the surrounding resorts it is less crowded and calm.

<Author>EnragedCoconut
<Content>My favourite so far We stayed for two weeks in a standard room from March 25 - April 8, 2007. As per the other reviews, the Majestic is a great hotel. I've stayed at eight other all inclusives in the Caribbean and this was by far my favourite to date.Pros: Lots of variety in food so that you're never bored and can always find something you like. Also it is offered frequently so thatif you want a snack or don't eat at the usual times, you can always find something. Drinks were good, lots of fresh fruit and smoothie offerings. Pool was fantastic and large. Beach was beautiful. We snorkelled right off of it in the coral although there is a great sandy area to swim as well. Chairs were rarely hard to come by no matter the time of day although sometimes shade was at a bit of a premium. I loved having internet available in my room for a charge of10$ US per day. We didn't do it everyday but it was fun to have from time to time. The room is beautiful and big. We didn't use the jacuzzi as much as we expected due to the fact that the water in it wasn't all that warm. I'm assuming this was due to the fact that in the evening many people are using them as well and it puts a drain onthe hot water available. Even showers before dinner were a little cool. The shower itself is big and beautiful. The open concept bathroom didn't bother us but there is definately a lack of privacy that may be a little disconcerting to some. Grounds are well kept and beautiful. The workers were constantly changing and maintaining the plantlife. Even a new concrete walkway appeared by the towel booth overnight.Cons: Cleaning staff was a bit awkward in that they either came by our room at 9am or 5pm. It made sleeping in a bit difficult. However, this could have been the location of our room. Perhaps they either started with us or ended with us. Stores on site are very expensive but they do bring in a market every Thursday where you can bargain and there is a permanent one available just outside the hotelgates. I can bargain as well as anyone but one aspect of the Dominican that I don't fancy is that vendors can be very aggressive.The available excursions are lacking in Punta Cana but that is no fault of the tour operators, more the area. We went on Caribbean Festival (200$ CDN for two people) and a horse backriding tour with RN23 (90$ CDN for two people) and didn't find either to be worth the money. For first timers to a Caribbean location though i'm sure they would be fine.All and all a fine resort and deserving of the #1 rating it has on Trip Advisor. Definately a 5 star to which I would return.

<Content>A piece of Paradise My wife and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial from April 2nd through 7th, and had a wonderful experience. The architecture and landscaping are breath-taking. We had a standard room with an open-floor layout overlooking their large, serpentine pool, with a king sized bed and a jacuzzi tub. I thought the room was a great value, in and of itself.The staff is a standout. English is problematic for many of them, but they make up for it with their warmth and effort. We were greeted at check-in with Majestics, pink cocktails that took all the edge off the usual angst one experiences on arrival. After we entered our room, a housekeeper brought us a complimentary bottle of champagne.The food was plentiful. We were not overwhelmed by the Gourmet restaurant, but the others were very good, particularly the steakhouse and Taino, a restaurant with traditional Dominican and Mexican cuisine. After dinner, a small band plays at an outdoor patio where couples can dance to traditional Latin music, plus popular favorites played with a Latin accent. It is as romantic and idyllic as it sounds.My quibbles were few. The air conditioning in the workout room was broken, a defect that I am certain has been fixed by now. We couldn't get washcloths on a couple of occasions, but were able to remedy that later in the day. Overall, however, we came looking for a rest, and got exactly what we came for. I would recommend the hotel in a heartbeat. We cannot wait to return.

<Author>RRJP
<Content>Majestic - wow! This is a fairly lengthy review, but we really appreciate all the other reviews people post - it greatly influences our choices of resorts and hotels when we travel. We were a family of 4 (incl 2 teenagers) who stayed at the Majestic March 21 - 28. In summary, we had a fantastic vacation. We were looking for relaxation and escape from hectic schedules, and we found it. The beach is amazing, the water warm and the waves great for boogie boarding. The pool is incredible - just pick your spot based on how much exercise you want (i.e. the distance to get to the swim-up bar). Those multiple trips to the swim-up bar, and long walks on the beach were the only exercise I got.The rooms are beautiful - quite luxurious. We found the bed very comfortable and we slept quite well. The only complaint is that the toilet in the room could be made a bit more private (they should use solid doors and walls from floor to ceiling). We enjoyed the big jacuzzi tub - especially because our kids had a separate room...). We were in first floor rooms in the 4000 block - close to the beach and the pool. Very quiet with a nice open courtyard with fountains outside. At the back, we had a view of the ocean through the trees on the adjacent vacant lot. We had asked for two nearby rooms - one with two double beds (for our kids) and one with a king bed (for us - yeah baby!). We got exactly the configuration we asked for, and the two rooms were adjacent - perfect.The staff was generally very friendly and helpful. Certainly friendlier service than we get in North America. Although they all speak pretty good english, I tried speaking a little spanish with them - either they truly appreciated it or they are just amused by my ham handed efforts. In terms of the attentative service, I'll givean example. The patio door to our kid's room wouldn't lock properly when we arrived our first day at 7 pm. We called the front desk, and they had two maintenance people fixing it within 30 minutes. Based onNorth American or European experiences, I was expecting that they might get to it the next day.The food was overall excellent. The main buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner had great variety and freshness. The beach restaurant/steakhouse had a pretty good lunch buffet as well, but not quite as varied as the main buffet. For dinner, we tried the steakhouse twice - both times the chateaubriand. It was excellent. As tender as any beef we've had in Canada. We also tried the Teppanyaki, which was also excellent as well as entertaining. We went to the Taino (Mexican) restaurant twice. Both times we had the Steak Tempequena (spelling?) which was very tender and tasty. None of us got sick on any of the food except one night I had a raw fish appetizer at the Gourmet restaurant, which didn't agree with me. I don't eat raw fish at home either, so it probably wasn't the smartest thing to do. I wasfine by the next morning, so clearly nothing too serious. The gourmet restaurant was otherwise ok, but probably our least favourite.The drinks were great - we tried many, including some I've never heard of. Marta at the bar by the lobby end of the pool creates some concoctions of her own that are worth trying - just ask her for something unique and tropical. The ladies bringing drinks by the poolwere also great - never left us thirsty. We found that by tipping a couple of bucks here and there made a difference - they'll remember you day to day and come back frequently to make sure you have what you need. We tipped our housekeeping a couple of bucks per day - I don't know if it resulted in any extra service, but to these people those few extra dollars a day makes a huge difference. We did get extra pillows when we asked, so that wasn't a problem.The shows were good - at least we don't expect Las Vegas headliner stuff, but they certainly put in a great effort. We went to 3 of them(including the famous Michael Jackson tribute show). Many evenings we would just sit on a lounger on the beach with a drink, listening to the waves and gazing at the stars. It's a very romantic spot.This review wouldn't be complete without mentioning Majestic Mike at customer service. My wife and I celebrated our 20th anniversary with a small ceremony of renewing our vows on the beach. It was at sunset and Mike officiated the ceremony - I didn't ask to see his religious credentials. Anyway, Mike wrote up the vows for us to exchange, including our two kids in the ceremony. I had met with him earlier to give him a bit of info about us and from that he did it all himself. He seemed to genuinely enjoy doing it - not like it was just his job. The ceremony was a very touching moment and broughttears to our eyes. Mike also came to say goodbye when we were checking out. It is that kind of personal service and attention that makes the Majestic stand out in my mind. Thanks, Mike!!As you can guess from the above, we would definitely go back. If you're looking for relaxation or romance, or both, this is the place. If you want to be more active, then you can do that too - the animation team has an energy level that amazes everyone.

<Author>SallyandJoe
<Content>Beautiful Beach!! This was our first time at an all -inclusive resort so we have nothing to compare it to. But all-in-all we had a great time.Room: When we checked in it went smoothly and we recieved a ocean/beach view room on the second floor. Not knowing which area to ask for we were pleased with it's location-close to the beach! Friends we were with got a great garden floor room facing the beach, which they loved. The rooms are pretty, but be careful of slippery shower floor-I almost went down a couple of times. Pillows are too thin, and only one bath towel per person.(I'm sure you could ask for more). The first full day we were there the maid didn't show up until 5:45pm. So when she came we promised a good tip each day if room was done by noon.Presto-a clean room by noon each day! Also left small tip each day for young man who stocked the fridge.Beach: Beautiful!!!! No seaweed our week-just clear, blue water. We love the ocean so we were in it a lot. Only went to the pool once, just for swim up bar. Beautiful pool too, but we're beach people. I was up at the beach by about 7:30 a.m. to claim a thatched umbrella and chairs. Just put your towels across them and fold down the backs. We snorkled right off the beach and saw lots of fish. Fun to go get a cocktail and sit and sip while relaxing. Our favorite drink: caibineta(sp.?)-similar to a mojito. The creamy drinks too sweet and thick for us. A friend and I joined the beach excercise class a few times-yoga and cardio. Quite a workout. Activities: My husband golfed a couple of times at different courses. One that was quite beautiful right on the water. We did walk up the beach to the flea market-took us about 45 min. each way. Got most of our trinkets there, as the prices were good if you bartered. Also did the Marinarium with 3 other couples and had fun. Snorkled in a pen with ray's and nurse sharks. Was told the poisonous barbs are removed from the rays(makes sense)so don't be afraid. It was a fun 1/2 day outing. The boating staff are very enthusiastic and sweet.Food: Well, not as bad a some of the reviews made it out to be. I didn't eat beef and stuck to seafood and chicken. We didn't gain any weight, that's for sure. The best restaurant for us on site was the Japanese Steakhouse. Made a reservation when we arrived at the hotel and the soonest available was the night before we left. It was great, though. Ate at Le Gourmet-I had chicken, but just like boiled chicken. The others a beef dish they said was o.k. We lunched mostly at the buffet by the beach-not bad. If you go to main buffet there is much more to chose from. Wish we'd done that a little more often. Breakfast is pretty good. Fruit is great. But the last day or two of our stay the fruit was less plentiful. One night we did venture off site to a restaurant by a beach 30 min. away. It was an interesting place with delicious seafood. We went with 8 other people in one taxi. One of the people knew someone who lived in Punta Cana and it was recommended. A couple of hairy moments on the way home,but lots of fun.We enjoyed ourselves and were able to have fun and relax. Not sure we'd go back, because we like to rent a car and explore areas we visit on our own, and you can't do that there. But we did have a wonderful time.

<Author>getawaygirls
<Content>NOT so hot This is not run like a 4 or 5 star resort. The beach is fabulous-- similar to Bermuda pink sand. Facilities average for the most part: room is large with deep jacuzzi tub out in the open; shower is spacious; toilet is claustrophobic; two sinks. Towels are at a premium, especially face cloths. Beach towels need to be returned to hut, but often runs out of clean replacements. Housekeeping standards are fair.Food is cafeteria style with no variations to salad bar (you too can learn to love shredded cabbage) includes decent ceviche. We were very disappointed with fish/seafood offerings. No made to order fresh dishes. Sitting around makes the fried, baked options very mealy, unappetizing. Best get beef at night. Local food at Taino tasty. Skip the sushi and French altogether -- it's a waste of time. Breakfasts have extensive offerings. Mini croissant and fruit are outstanding.Local beer is good. Mixed drinks use bottom shelf liquor. Ask for Barcelo (sp?) rum at no extra charge. Patrons were not typically binge drinkers--lots of Europeans  Canadians who seem to hold their alcohol well. Bachelor/ette flings are raucus affairs. Weddings go on every day at various venues.The entertainment is uninspired though the jazz sax was good.Our major complaint is with administration. Our toilet's fresh water hose sprung leaks on two different occasions, oth in the middle of the night. First time they fixed the hose; the second they turned off the water and we had to wait until the next morning to get it fixed. I'll spare you the frustrating details except to tell you that they never apologized for my slipping and doing a back landing when I went to investigate the sound of rushing water that first night. I slipped on the wet, glassy-surfaced floortiles and hit the back of my head on the tub. They refused to cover a medical check to ensure I didn't have repercussions from the blow to the back of my head. Very disagreeable front desk staff and manager.The weather was consistently beautiful during our ten-day stay in February/March 2007.

<Author>CarribeanSunGirl
<Content>A Teens Perspective.. I stayed at the Majestic from Mar.4th -11th, along with my brother(18), mom (46) and dad(44). I, myself am 16 and felt that it would be helpful to hear a review from a teen's perspective. I know when my parents booked the resort I checked Tripadvisor everday for the latest tips and pictures, it was well worth it. I will try to make the review as short, and brief as possible.FLIGHT / BUS-- We flew with skyservice, booking through Sunquest. The flight was excellent, about 4 hours. A full meal was served on the plane which was nice. The customs at Punta Cana airport were well organized and people were off to there resorts very quickly. The downfall was that on the way to our resort the bus broke down. We were told to wait on the side of the road (it was about 11:30 at night, in the midst of no where). Our Sunquest rep. told us another bus would be here to pick us up in 10-15 min., unfortunetly the new bus didn't arrive till 45 minutes later. I felt quite bored on the bus. From previous experiences we have been entertained, and given options to buy drinks. There was no music playing, and the rep. gave us no insight to the town or resort. That's okay though, I was anxious to get to the resort anyways.Grounds-- Astonishing. You always see gardners around picking every little trash off the ground, and weeds out of the garden. Pool-- Refreshing and spacious. If you prefer to relax you should find a chair near the lobbyside of the pool. I personally love to be entertained so I always found a chair down near the Wetbar. Finding a hut and chairs was not a problem. There are about 3-4 bars along the pool, so you never grow thirsty!Food-- The food was good. There is always something to eat and you never go hungry. Fresh crepes every morning, fresh pasta at lunch and fried kabobs at dinner were something to enjoy! The variety was good, I found that Mexico had a bit better variety but nothing to complain about. My dad did get sick from the food on the second last day. He had all the common synptoms, no need to explain. I think it may of been from the pork ribs, thats the only thing he ate that we didn't. Other than that the food was fine. All the al a cartes were wonderful. We never went to the Mexican/Dominican one, its not my fancy. Be sure to book your reservations as soon as your get there, spots fill fast! Be sure to try the Surf and Turf wellington at the Gourmet, The Grilled Garlic Shrimp in the seafood, and of course the Steak! Its amazing. Much better than the buffet.Rooms-- I found the setup to be very different. For familys with teenagers it was not good. My brother and I had our own room. If one of us wanted to have a bath/jacuzzi the other had to leave the room. It was inconvienent at times, but thats okay. The bathroom and shower were also a weird design. I found they were not private at all. After your shower you had to step out into the open, the bathroom is to tiny to change in it, once again he had to leave the room. The bathroom stall was the different. You could see people in it through the frosted glass and could here every little sound. Other than that the rooms were beautiful. Very spacious, though ideal for a couple. The pillows were fine, you can always double the flat ones up. Beds were good. Our converter didn't work, we asked for a new one but it was never delivered. Oh well. There are a few bugs in the rooms. Make sure you check before you go to bed, I suggest putting a towel behind the door at night. We noticed small centipedes would sneak through the crack if we didn't.Entertainment-- The Animation staff was very energetic, always got people going. I enjoyed participating and watching the games and dances. My only suggestion would be to have more teen activities. Many(almost all) were for adults only and the reward was always a bottle of champagne, this is not really useful for a 16 yr. old. Thats okay, my parents of course took it! The theatre was gorgeous. Lots of comfy chairs to relax on. All shows are similar to wherever you go (all inclusive). I enjoyed the Ideal Couple, and Mr. Majestic Shows- they were so hilarious, and enjoyable when they got the audience going.The one thing that we found handy at the resort were the walkways. Althought it only rained once, if it did rain more, no worries. You can make your way all around the resort- staying dry. The main walkway is sheltered from the sky. A couple other things to mention, I don't recommend going to the market. Although you can get some good deals is it really worth it. The sales people really try to convince you to by there stuff. Men would pull you in, and hassle with you. It was intimidating and nerve racking. One other thing, I think the internet prices should be lowered. All resorts I went to offered free internet use. Thats my only real complaint..I'm 16 what do you expect?I have stayed the The Gran Bahia Tulum in the Mayan Riveria, Mexico, El Senador in Cayo Coco, Cuba and Melia Cayo Santa Maria In Cuba. The Majestic was my favourite off all. I say my review is accurate and I think I know from previous experiences. I'd give the Majestic 4.5 stars only because of my dad's sickness.
