<Author>saraelizabeth
<Content>Absoultely Perfect, A Peice of Paradise. We stayed at the Majestic from Feb 17-24 and it was by far the best trip I have ever been on. (I have traveled all across Canada and through the United States) Here are some things you should know:The BeachThis was the most beautiful beach I have ever seen, bright aqua coloured water and white sand. The only day we really saw any seaweed was the day they arrived because they cleaned the seaweed off the beach each day. There was always a lounge chair to be found. We also found that the ocean water was warmer than the pool so we spent the majority of our time at the beach. While it is a topless beach if you choose so, most people keep their tops on. If you are interested in fish at all make sure you bring an underwater camera, what you can do is take a roll from the buffet and break it up and put it in an empty bottle of water and go about waist deep in the water and if you put some bread in the water you will see a school of small swordfish. This was very fun.The FoodThe food was excellent at the restaurants, although we found that the buffet got pretty repetitive, but since you only need reservations for two of the restaurants you will have no problem finding variety for dinner. If you like seafood be sure to try the grilled lobster at the seafood restaurant. The sushi bar at the oriental restaurant is also excellent. Just make sure you don't eat too much fruit/drink the fruity drinks because it will make you sick. You probably do not eat that much fruit at home, and then you see all these options of fresh fruit and pretty drinks that look so good you want to try them all, but your body isn't ready to handle that much more fruit per day. Also I found the greasy food bothered me which made it difficult to eat at the buffet but I managed to get through the week absolutely fine, there were still plenty of other places where I could eat. Also I personally found the drinks extremely strong, and did not have a large amount of alcohol while I was there but that is a personal preference. Make sure you try the Majestic Drink, but they are full of fruit so don鈥檛 drink too many.The RoomsThe rooms are gorgeous, we had a garden view on the far end of the resort so we were overlooking a garden next to the service road and the resort next door, some people may not like this because its where they do garbage pickup etc. but we thought it was fantastic because we were worried about noise levels and being woken up in the early morning from reviews we had read but it wasn't a problem because we were on the end of the resort, and did not have any noise problems. The room is kind of an open concept, the only enclosed areas are the toilet and the shower which are surrounded by marble walls and frosted glass doors therefore if someone gets up to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, if you are a light sleeper you will probably wake up, but once again not a big deal. We always had fresh towels and a stocked mini fridge, never had a problem with the rooms. Make sure you leave a tip for the maid; it is customary to leave $1 US per person per day. We also left an item per day, make sure though if you are leaving an item to leave a note stating it is for them as well so they can take it home with them.The resort itselfThe resort is huge! It was fully booked while we were there but you would never know there were really that many people there. I have read about some resorts where if you didn't have your towel on a lounge chair by 9am you wouldn't get one for the day, we had no problem with this sometimes not getting to the beach until after lunch. The Entertainment Staff is fantastic, and the shows were always entertaining. Some of them are actually shows where acts that are not from the resort come in and do a show, others are like game shows led by the entertainment staff. These are great things to go see at night. Occasionally due to the humidity the power will cut out, sometimes two or three times an evening however the longest outage we saw was 5 minutes so it wasn鈥檛 a problem just make sure you restart the air conditioner in your room after an outage.ShoppingMake sure you remember to bring all your toiletries with you (such as sunscreen) because it is expensive on the resort (I paid $17 US for a bottle of sunscreen) however most things are very affordable. The shops upstairs in the lobby are more expensive but they are a cigar shop, Harrison鈥檚 Jewellers and a shop that features designer items. Down below there are more shops including a mini mart where you can get things like chips, rum, sunscreen, and souvenirs. There are shops that have carvings, paintings, swimming gear, jewellery etc. If you are planning on going to the market there are two in the area off the resort, one down the beach and one down the road. We went to the one down the beach which our tour operator told us was about 30 minutes away, in reality it took us about 80 minutes to walk there and 80 minutes to walk back so if you plan on doing this the best time is if you have an overcast day so it isn鈥檛 too hot. Make sure you barter well because you can get some really good deals, if the deal is not something you like walk away. Odds are they will chase after you with a better price. There is also a small market set up at the resort on Thursday nights.ExcursionsExcursions are an option for you as well although they are an additional cost, you can do things such as go parasailing; take a tour of the Dominican where you will see a cigar factory, a sugar cane plantation, a Dominican school, a Dominican house etc. Another option is the one we went on at a place called the Marinarium. There you will go swimming on a coral reef, then over to a protected area to swim with Sharks and Stingrays (Nurse sharks, and the Stingrays have their poisonous barb removed) and after that you get back on the boat and they take you to a natural swimming pool in the ocean where the water is about waist deep and warm. This is about a half day long, and cost $78 American. Overall a great experience.The Majestic Colonial was absolutely fantastic, we had no complaints whatsoever, our room was incredibly clean, and we did not see a single bug other than the occasional bee near the plants. Just remember to watch what you eat, put on some sunscreen and you will have a fabulous vacation here!

<Author>David-from-Boston
<Content>Great Time at the Majestic Colonial My wife and I went to the Majestic with our 9 year old son during school vacation week. It was our first time to the DR, and first time that we stayed at an all-inclusive resort. At first, I was a little overwhelmed by the size of the resort (600 rooms and totally full that week). But things settled down pretty quickly, and within a couple of days, we were relaxed and into the pace of the vacation. For me, two things helped immensely. One was getting out and playing golf on the new Nick Price designed golf course that is 5 minutes from the resort (they pick you up in a golf cart). I had brought my own clubs and ended up playing 3 rounds there. Excellent course, quick but true greens, and very well manicured. Wonderful staff at the course also. The second key to getting into the pace of the vacation was the very welcoming crowd and staff at the main bar in the hotel. I met many charming couples--a number of Canadians in fact--while drinking a few nightly Presidente's at the bar. The experience was enhanced by a terrific bartender--Juan Carbrera--who quickly adopted me as a favored customer, nicknaming me David Ortiz since I come from Boston, despite the fact that I am 50 years old, white, and weigh about half the amount of our favorite Red Sox slugger.Juan not only befriended me and my wife, but also many other patrons of the bar. He speaks five languages, including Spanish (of course), English, French, German, and if you can believe it, even a limited amount of Chinese. He is really a star performer back there, and creates a fun and festive atmospere.The other bartenders and staff were also terrific, as was the staff at the various restaurants, stores and front desk.Despite my fears from reading reviews on TripAdvisor prior to going on the trip, the food at the Majestic was quite acceptable. Good variety and a lot of restaurant choices.The room was great and the overall experience at the hotel was also very good. Fantastic pool that spans the entire distance from the main lobby all the way down to the beach. Our son had a great time navigating the pool on an inflatable raft that we purchased at the resort. We also went on the Swimming with Dolphins excursion that turned out to be alot of fun. Having your wife and son kissed by a friendly dolphin is a surprising and unforgettable image.Overall, I would rate the resort and the vacation itself very highly, and we will definitely consider a return trip.

<Content>complainers are crazy! If you want a short review here it is...absolute perfection, a dream vacation, and we not only highly reccommed it but would go back ourselves. And please, if that is what you want, stay away from the Majestic, because those of us who appreciate the fact this is a thrid world country, who like to challenge ourselves with learning the language when we travel, and who are there for a good time really don't want the complainers around!!!The Majestic was gorgeous! We were there from Marhc 2-9 and loved the culture, the climate, the pools, the ocean, you name it! The only annoyance was truly those visitors who expected to be treated like kings and queens, who loudly fussed about everything, and who marched around like they were entitled to some mysterious ideal. The resort itself was a dream!The food was good, better than I have had at other all inclusives. Yes things get warm...but since much of the hotel is open air, you rol with it. You are in the Caribbean for heaven's sake!! What do people expect!As for getting sick, don't worry about it. Here are my simple steps to preventing illness when on vacation. Don't drink the tap water, or even brush you teeth, but that isn't a problem because there is bottled water everywhere. Don't eat and drink to excess every minute...your body isn't used to that much rich food, and free flowing alcohol. Don't drink too many of the frozen slushy drinks...they have coconut milk which is a natural laxative. And for heaven's sake wear a hat and some sunscreen. People were purple they were so badly burned, and sun stroke will make you sicker than anything. I am extremely fair skinned, and I managed to stay totally unbruned the whole time. And if you are really concerned, look into Grapefruit Seed Extract...a natural remedy that there is loads of info on the internet about and widely available at health stores...perfect for travel.The hotel was at capacity and we found chairs in the shade every single day, and were never out of our room before 10. Yes lots of people save them...so what! Somedays we did have to move a chair that was in the sun into the shade - big deal! The bathroom were fine, but maybe my husband and I are more comfortable with each other than some people. I expected a real shocker considering some reviews, and it just wasn't the case!Consider upgrading to a Junior Colonial Suite...that was what we booked and we had a lovely private deck with hot tub we filled and soaked in and watched the moon. And the shows wree not high class but fun and certainly worth it!Seriously, if you can't handle breaking out of your comfort zone a bit, I don't think you should go to any third world country...let alone Dominican! But for the rest of you who want a safe, lovely holiday...don't miss the Majestic!

<Content>Fairly Nice for an All-Inclusive - 3 Star Quality HOTEL REVIEW: 3.5My wife and I stayed at the Majestic in September of 2006 The Majestic is a nice all-inclusive resort that has a more intimate feel to it compared to the other resorts in Punta Cana. The place is pretty new and the vegetation around the grounds shows it. Also the service is hit or miss. Overall pretty good for the price and I can't complain since it was $144 / night for both of us. Not that I expect 5 star quality at that price, I also don't expect them to advertise themselves as a 5 star resort.Food was ok for being an all-inclusive but probably same quality as the rest of the all-inclusives in the area. It was nice to have a wide variety of foods (mexican, domincan, tempenyaki (more chinese flavored than japanese, french, steakhouse, seafood, and italian.)Overall we had a nice time and enjoyed ourselves, if you are set on going to Punta Cana, this is a good choice for the value. DESTINATION REVIEW: 3Punta Cana as a destination is great if all you like to do is sit by the beach and pool all day for 7 days, the pools are very nice and the beaches are great! However, if you like doing other stuff like taking excursions, or going to the downtown for dinner or shopping, there are much better destinations. When going on an excursion for example, it takes at least an hour or two to get to the where the activites are since the shuttle buses need to pick up people from 10 different resorts before driving 30-40 minutes to the activity.Also, there isn't a nice downtown area. The only shopping you'll find are little artesan shops, which are ok but once you see one, you've seen them all.We probably won't go back to Punta Cana for these reasons.CIGARS 1.5:Don't expect to get a good deal down there. In fact its cheaper to buy them from a reputable dealer on the web then to get them down there. Plus, in most shops they sell very low quality cigars, unless you know what you are doing don't stray from the classics and brand names.STAY AWAY FROM DON CARLOS CIGAR FACTORY. <Content>Great - once we got our room! We went to the Majestic Colonial for the February vacation week. All in all, though, it was a wonderfully relaxing time in an excellent resort of this type.

<Author>Lildevil_lady
<Content>5 Star? After reading many positive reviews, my family (my husband ,our 2 sons...ages 12 and 16 and I) decided to stay at the Majestic. The airport in Punta Cana was very quaint and got us in the caribbean mood immediately. The transfer was fairly quick, with only a couple of stops along the way. CHECK-IN We were immediately greeted with a cold refreshing drink, which was very much appreciated. We were told our room wouldn't be ready for a couple of hours but they provided us with a room to change, so we could enjoy the resort in the meantime. When we went back to get our room, the check-in was a bit of a zoo. We originally had a room on the top floor, but was moved to a ground floor room once we explained that I suffer back problems.ROOMS For a couple, the rooms would be great but there wasn't alot of privacy for a family of 4. I still can't understand why they would build the toilot as a stall. They were extreamly small, with very little privacy. The beds were extreamly hard (but that seems the norm at all inclusive resorts) and the pillows were very, very flat. Housekeeping was very quick to accommidate our request for extra pillows, as well as other things like face cloths. Housekeeping kept the room fairly clean but dust was visably seen in some areas.FOOD The first thing 3 of us ate once we arrived, was a hamburger at the buffet near the beach. It wasn't till we were halfway done, did we realize that the hamburger wasn't fully cooked. Needless to say, we didn't eat the rest of it. That night, my 12 year old got sick, followed by me the next day, then my husband. Thankgoodness we brought Immodium!! Unfortunately, I ended up having to see the doctor at the resort and after 36 hours and 2 IV treatments, I was feeling better. From then on, we were very cautious about the food. In regards to the buffet, we are not picky eaters but we were hard pressed to find something to our liking. The kids ended up eating pizza all week and my husband and I stuck with the pasta. The japanese cooking demonstration fun and entertaining, the caribbean was just ok but the steakhouse was great. I would of been nice if the breakfest buffet was open a little later, as we always seemed to miss out on breakfest. There is a contenental breakfest in the restaurant by the beach, but it is extreamly limited. The snack bar is only open from 11pm till the wee hours of the morning and is tucked away behind the shops (by the kid's section). With 2 growing boys, it would of been advantagous to have a snackbar near the beach and open all afternoon.POOL  BEACH The pool is very unique and large enough to accommadate those that want to play and those that want to relax. In the early afternoon, lounges were always available, but as the day wore on, it seemed harder to find a group of four togeather. A waitress was always available to take your drink orders and deliver them to your lounge....a very nice touch. It is a shame that some vacationers toss their empty cups in the bushes, when there are garbage bins close by. The entertainment staff at the pool were always full of energy. They always managed to get participants to join in and rewarded the winners with a bottle of spirits. Unfortunately, when the kids were victorious, they didn't make provisions to reward their efforts. The beach was beautiful and usually there was a welcomed breeze coming off the ocean. Most people spent the early afternoon at the beach so a lounge by the water was difficult to find. The beach was always maintained and tidied up each night. The water was a little on the rough side, but it only added to the fun. Taking a insulated cup to the beach is a great idea as there are no bars directly on the beach. Other guests were telling us that the prices of water activities would change depending on how busy they were. For example, if the parasailing was slow, the price would be cheaper than those times where it was busy.BARS The bars were always busy and at times it took awhile to looked after. We found this especially true in the evening, where the only bars open were in the lobby. Waiting 20 minutes to be served was not out of the norm.ENTERTAINMENT The evening entertainment in the theatre didn't start till 10pm, which seemed a little late. Every other night, the entertainment consisted of audience participation and got to be boring mid week. The magician show was great, as was the Micheal Jackson show. As the resort matures, I'm sure their entertainment will grow. The sax player was awesome...especially when he played down by the beach. He always encouraged people to get up and dance but those that wanted to sit back and listened were always welcomed.MEDICAL There is a doctor on the premise 24 hours/7 days a week. She was very nice and kept a tight eye on you if you needed her services. MONEY There is an ATM machine in the lobby but it was out of money for a few days during our stay. Apparently, this is the only source for cash at the resort. It despenses passos only, so becareful not to withdraw more than you need. Even though we had a few rough days, we still enjoyed our holiday. We wouldn't say this was a 5 star resort, but it is definately a solid 4 star (regardless of the food incident). If we travel to Punta Cana again, we will definately try a different resort.*make sure you have $20/person set aside for departure taxes. The airport requires it in US$ or passos and will only accept cash.

On the other hand, we felt that the french restarant was a complete waste of time. The service was unfriendly and the food was almost inedible. <Author>ajaxbhoy
<Content>First AI, loved it, will definitely be returning We just returned from a week at the Majestic Colonial. This was our first all inclusive (AI) experience, and while we don't have other DR hotels to compare against, I'll simply state my opinions based on our experience.Rooms - We booked the standard room and it was very nice. Next time I would consider the poolside room just so we could get our chairs into the sun without having to reserve them in the morning with everyone else. The room sizes are plenty large, and well maintained.Service - Excellent, everyone was friendly and went out of their way to please you. Those more comfortable with English tended to be more outgoing, also the Animation team (entertainment group) tried to get you involved whenever they were near (but never annoying). However just using some Spanish phrases and smiling a lot usually got warm smiles in return and an eventual understanding. It really made for a more special experience. Additionally, rooms were cleaned well, bar fridge was stocked daily and with extras if requested. One more point, Majestic Mike, who frequents the forum quite often, was very helpful on a number of occasions.Value - The cost for the Majestic was comparable to the other resorts. The grounds were beautiful, the beach was easily accessible, rooms were great, amenities were good.Food - Reservations are needed for Teppenyaki (Japanese) and Le Gourmet restaurants. These are absolutely worth it, and book your meals immediately after checking in as reservations can be tough to get. The main buffet restaurants had a good selection of food, including fresh pastas at lunch and omlettes in the morning. We also loved the banana smoothies and champagne orange juice at breakfast. Another favourite for us was the Rodeo steak restaurant for dinner. Try the brochette and chateaubriand.Bars - Plentiful and with an excellent selection of drinks. The Majestic, which is basically a frozen creamsicle mix, is excellent with dark rum, and wound up being the drink of choice for the week (and was for a lot of people). Remember though to drink lots of water if you're going to be out in the sun.Entertainment - Movies for the kids are available in the evening, and the nightly entertainment was varied. Do not miss the Michael Jackson and Circus Dream shows, they were by far the best of the week. The animation team also had lots of daytime activities down by the wet bar/beach area. There was also a great saxophone and keyboard duo near the lobby playing almost every night, an excellent deviation between dinner and the nightly shows or simply as a stand alone event.Pool - One of the signature points of the Majestic, the pool stretches from almost the main lobby area to just before the beach. Great for a dip when the heat got to be too much.Beach - The views were fantastic, the sand soft and clean. I saw workers cleaning the sand of as much garbage as possible.Casino - We only went on one evening; it's fairly small but we enjoyed ourselves.Sports Bar/Disco - Though we didn't go, we heard good things from people we spoke with.Spa - My wife had a massage and found it quite good and comparable to those she receives from a licensed massage therapist here. The facility was beautiful and most inviting.Golf - Punta Blanca is immediately next door and is still developing. The price was very reasonable; $105 secured a cart, greens fee, lunch, unlimited course drinks, and range balls. Additionally, a cart came to pick you up and drop you off. Club rentals at $40 are quite reasonable for a resort (I played with newer Callaway Big Berthas). The course was good, though the waste bunkers still need some work. Also, there are no ocean view holes despite the general proximity to the sea. A good value nonetheless.Side Trips - Tour operators provide their own enhanced excursions, but with some ingenuity I was able to procure a day trip with Tropical Storm, a catamaran tour which took us to a shipwreck, provided snorkel gear to see tropical fish and coral as well as stingrays and sharks, stopped at a resort for some fun on a three story slide, and finally took us to a private lagoon for drinks and a great lunch. Also I was picked up from the hotel for a short trip to Don Lucas Cigars, where you can not only purchase cigars, rum, coffee, art and clothing, but you also see the cigar making process (you can even roll one yourself). The shops outside the hotel are interesting, but make sure you negotiate well. Handmade items starting at $30 can easily be negotiated down to below $10. Finally the Majestic shops can be pricey, but the quality of the items are fairly much assured. Any forgotten items (suntan lotion, etc.) are easily attained, but at a significantly higher price ($15-$20), but the clothing is reasonable as are the trinkets and artwork.My overall impression of the Majestic is that it's an excellent resort that doesn't try to cater to every possible traveller, is still developing but does a lot very well for such a young resort, has excellent staff, has beautiful views, great rooms and amenities, and good food and drink. I would highly recommend the Majestic to anyone.

Funny story, I told some guy at the Asian restaurant that only good food at the resort was the Dominican Soup and Salad bar鈥e responded with these exact words 鈥淚 know鈥 agree with you鈥鈥檓 one of the people that makes this whole resort possible鈥濃€asically, the guy, who I think was an owner or investor, told me that that food at this resort sucks and agreed that the best food was the Dominican food at the Mexican Restaurant.The BeachThe beach is gorgeous鈥t least if you don鈥檛 mind the occasional seaweed build up. Up and down the entire beach (at all the Punta Cana resorts), seaweed drifts down the entire coast. The amount of seaweed along the Majestic鈥檚 stretch of the beach varied from day to day鈥ometimes it was hard to avoid it as it wrapped around my ankles. However, it wasn鈥檛 a big deal on most days. The seaweed does build up on the beach鈥ind of ugly, but they rake it up every few days. Even so, a nicer resort would remove the seaweed each morning. As for the water itself, it鈥檚 crystal clear (when calm). I鈥檓 not sure what the temperature was, but it was prefect and refreshing. One caution though鈥f you鈥檙e bring your children, keep in mind that the water gets deep pretty fast鈥t was over my head about 20 to 25 feet out (7 to 8 meters). There weren鈥檛 too many rocks鈥 only found one area were I couldn鈥檛 avoid stepping on some rocks鈥hey are hard to see as they are the same color as the sand. As for the beach, the sand is white and soft鈥ots of chairs and umbrellas. However, on some days, small roots are exposed that are annoying to step on鈥ther days, the roots were covered by the sand鈥robably covered the same day the seaweed was raked off the beach. Other than that, the beach is generally clean鈥otel workers are always walking around picking up trash. (FYI, if you want an umbrella, place your towel on the chair under the umbrella before 10am鈥lthough some people dropped their towels at 9am and didn鈥檛 return to their spot till hours later鈥lease don鈥檛 be one of those people). There are plenty of activities on the beach. Every morning around 10:30am, an aerobics class is held on the beach. Keep in mind that the instructor plays the same load music every morning that can be heard from every point on the beach鈥ind of annoying when you are trying to relax or recover from a night of drinking鈥o bring your ipod to drown out the sound. This lasts for about an hour. Around 12 noon, the same aerobics instructors begin recruiting beach goers to participate in the daily beach Olympics (egg tossing, tug of war鈥hat sort of thing)鈥gain, they play the same loud music every day. This lasts for about an hour as well. There鈥檚 another aerobics class around 2pm as well鈥nly this time the class is located closer to the waters edge. All of these activities are free. The resort also has your standard non-free activities, but I think they were overpriced鈥?25 for 10 minutes of water skiing. (FYI, there is no bar on the beach and no waitresses taking drink orders on the beach) The PoolThe Pool is very appealing to look at鈥ot to mention enormous鈥aybe two and half football fields long (about 200 meters). There are four bars at the pool, including a swim up bar. About every hour or so, a waitress does walk around taking drink orders. Most of the action at the pool takes place near the bar that is connected to the swim up bar. Here you can participate in more organized activities, aerobics, and pool volleyball. Again, the aerobics music is loud, annoying and the same every single day. The pool is large enough to find a quiet spot鈥ometimes鈥owever, you can鈥檛 control large groups of loud people that migrate to the quiet section鈥hat鈥檚 what happens at these huge resorts. If you are looking for a quiet vacation, then this place is not for you. The RoomsWhat鈥檚 the deal with these bathrooms? I didn鈥檛 quite get it from the reviews I read. Everyone was complaining about the privacy of bathrooms, mainly the toilet. Let me explain. The privacy of the toilet is that same as the privacy you would experience while in a public bathroom鈥nly, your girlfriend can hear every loud noise you make at 3am鈥nd the walls that help amplify the sound which doesn鈥檛 help the situation鈥 hope you don鈥檛 get sick. The toilet stall is not a separate room. The door to the stall does not reach the ground nor does it reach the ceiling. One of the toilet stall walls is shared with the shower wall, which does not reach the ceiling either. This does not help contain the your normal bathroom smell鈥f you catch my drift. The shower on the other hand is great鈥arge enough for two people. The showerhead is detachable and the water pressure is great鈥ood for getting the sand off your legs. The bed is hard鈥ut its not bad鈥fter a long day on the beach, falling asleep was pretty easy. The pillows are soft, but very thin鈥ust ask for extra pillows and you鈥檒l be fine. The A/C takes a little while to kick in, but it eventually makes the room nice and cool鈥ou can lower the temperature to 20 degrees Celsius (68 F). The TV has about 37 channels鈥ost in English.The Casino The casino is small. It has about 8 card game tables, a roulette table, about 15 slot machines, and a bar. I only played blackjack, which has a minimum bet of $5 and maximum bet of $100. Watch out for the blackjack dealers, they don鈥檛 always know how to count. You can only bet with the American dollar or Dominican Peso.The DiscoThe Disco is right next to the casino. It has a few pool tables, a large bar, many couches and longing areas, a small dance floor, and a wrap around bar. I didn鈥檛 go inside, but it seemed like the only music they played was house music鈥ot my cup of tea. The ServiceFor the most part, the service was fine. The only negative I had was that they gave us the wrong room鈥nd it took some haggling to get them to switch us. Apparently, there was a long list of people who were given the wrong room.

<Content>Great Deal! Would go back! We traveled to the Majestic 2/10-2/17. We had a great time and thought it was an awesome deal. The room was ready on arrival. They did forget to give us our towel cards when arriving though and we had to go back to get them. We booked through Cheap Caribbean. I have booked before with them and I will continue to go to them first. They seem to have better prices than a lot of the other sites and provide excellent customer service. We had room 4316 facing a fence and we has a little bit of a view of the ocean. The room was a little noisy some nights from the entertainment. Also the hotel cleaning staff could be heard early in the morning. There were no clocks in the room. The bathrooms weren鈥檛 very private. You would be able to hear anything anyone is doing in there. The toilet is in a little stall with a frosted glass half of a door. The pool was perfect. There is nothing you could really ask for more in a pool. The resort is showing a lot of wear and tear for such a new place. The bathrooms over by the disco/casino/sports bar were gross. They did an awful job with the tile/grout work and this place will need a major overall in a couple years if it expects to still be a 5 star place. The grounds and landscaping are very nice. They spend a lot of time grooming them. Also I didn鈥檛 notice a lot of bugs. I got one mosquito bite. (usually I am eaten alive) We took anti-malaria meds as recommended by CDC when traveling to Punta Cana, but my boyfriend didn鈥檛 get bit at all. The ocean was a little seaweed-y. I think some people put their towels in the chairs under the huts on the beach when they weren鈥檛 even on the beach all day, which is unfortunate. You could get a hut on the beach though as long as you were there by 10am so it wasn鈥檛 like you had to be up at sunrise or anything. The beach wasn鈥檛 too crowded. You could walk past other resorts and people seemed a little more crammed in at some of the other places. However, there are not enough bathrooms either -- 2 stalls in ladies room for beach/pool area. There was always a line. Staff is constantly trying to clean them though. The food was so-so. It was better than some other all inclusives I have stayed at before. All Inclusives are not exactly known for great food. We did have a little but of stomach troubles despite drinking Pepto-Bismo everyday. We brought the Pepto with us. You wouldn鈥檛 want to pay the gift shop prices. WAY expensive. They just are trying to gourge you in those places. We were able to find quite a few different food chosies that were ok despite the fact I can be picky and my boyfriend is allergic to nuts and eggs. If you eat eggs, the eggs were probably the best thing for breakfast too since they are cooked fresh to order. The fruit was very good too. I was a little disappointed you couldn鈥檛 order a bloody mary or anything like that though. They did have some cheap champagne over by the OJ dispenser though. They don鈥檛 seem to be concerned too much with keeping cold foods cold or hot foods hot. There are also a lot of flies in the beach restaurant that sit on the food. The best places to go we the French and Japanese (of course the only two where you need reservations). At the French place we ordered Surf and Turf which was a breaded steak stuffed with a small piece of lobster and it was pretty good. We had lobster at the seafood place and it was the worst lobster I ever had, but it wasn't awful. They also always ask you if you have had enough so if you wanted two of those little alien lobsters, they would be happy to give you another. The meat wasn鈥檛 super high quality, like a fancy steakhouse or anything but it was certainly better than fast food. The Mexican was also decent. People were raving about guacamole. They have a nacho bar as well 鈥?got to love that. We talked with some other people on the beach from other resorts and it sounded like the Majestic had better food then the competitors. We went on an Outback Safari tour and the food provided was almost exactly like the Majestic鈥檚 food and the people from all the other resorts were claiming that the food provided by the excursion company was much better than their resort food. So I guess the so-so Majestic food is as good as it gets in the Dominican. Staff is very friendly. They ask you how you are and when you respond, they smile and nod. I don鈥檛 think most of them know more then some basic phrases in English. I don鈥檛 think learning some Spanish before you go will help you much like some previous posters suggested though. What simple phrases you would learn are probably the same simple phrases they already know. The bars up front did have premium liquors. A couple times they tried to tell me they were out and I was like I can see it right there and they went ahead and poured it. I don't think they were trying to hide it, I think they just didn't know what I was asking for. It would be nice if they had some more variety over at the beach and pool bars. The premium liquors were reserved to the bars in the lobby. They ask you for your room number if you order a premium drink, but you are not charged for them. They are also constantly asking you if you want another drink. Doesn鈥檛 matter if it is some fancy frozen thing, coffee, or a beer. The photos the staff took (the ones you have to pay for) were awesome. We got a couple with animals and they came out perfect. It also looked like you could do some sort of photo shoot with them, I am not really sure of the details because it isn鈥檛 advertised and they never approached us about it, but there were a lot of people in the photo shop going through some very professional pictures.We were going to use the spa since it looked beautiful but it was a little too expensive so we went on the excursion instead. When we arrived at the airport it was like our plane was the only one there, the place was so empty. When we left our van dropped us off 2 hours 45 mins before departure and we almost missed our flight. It was awful. No a/c, babies screaming, and over 2 and a half hours in line. The security people don鈥檛 even look at the monitors as your bag goes through either making this miserable process pointless and thus even more frustrating! The resort shows were a little cheesy, but they try real hard. They also have waitresses in the theatre which I thought was nice. A lot of the other places I have stayed at didn鈥檛 have service come to you. The band they played at the pool bar at night was great and so was the sax player. The casino was pretty small and not very busy. We never stayed up for the disco, but I doubt it every really got going seeing the lack of crowds out that late. Overall this was a great beach vacation 鈥?beach and pool were awesome, customer service was good, the food was really the worst part but I went here to get out of cold snowy NY and relax which is what I did and I didn鈥檛 starve. I would go here again. I though it was a great deal.It is always easier to write about the bad than the good, but this place is very nice.

<Author>JGMoore
<Content>Really nice My family (4 kids, 8 adults) stayed at the Majestic from 2/9-2/14. It's a beautiful resort, really nicely maintained with a great beach. This was my 5th Caribbean stay in the past 6 years and the Majestic was definitely the nicest of all of them. Unlike Iberostar, there was never a problem getting a chair by the beach or by the pool. There was a nice little area to play pool, foosball and ping pong when you get tired of the beach, lots of shopping (super-overpriced, however), and a kids area with water slides that our kids asked to go to hourly. Noise can be an issue so if you're going with small kids try to get a room not near elevators, and preferably closer to the beach. Food is just okay -- no real options for snacking during the day  pretty limited buffets (aside from breakfast). My family loved the steakhouse (no reservation required). No one liked the seafood restaurant (to the extent that all the guys -- including my 4-year-old -- went back to the steakhouse for a second dinner). The Mexican restaurant was great too. The Majestic has staff photographers who are always around and you can set up a time with them as well...we did a family portrait on the beach  the guy who did it was great (took 88 pictures!). The prices in the little market are insane, so if you've got small kids and don't feel like paying $5 for a can of pringles, $3 for gatorade, etc. bring your own snacks. We were in Punta Cana last year and found everything cheap...they seem to have realized in the intervening time that people will pay a lot of money when they have no choice. The Majestic is overall a much nicer resort than Iberostar, but with little kids I think I'd be inclined to go back to Iberostar because of the graduated pool (at Majestic you've either got to choose a somewhat deep kids pool -- my two-year-old wouldn't go in -- or the adult pool at 4+ feet) and the poolside eating area.

The gym is okay-decent free weights, hand weights and bench press. Some decent weight machines to work with although some very outdated and not useful. Lots of mats and balls to use.Two treadmills and two elipticals which were in great shape and fairly new. Can be very warm inside despite air conditioning. Great tunes usually going and several t.v. screens but no clock. We limited ourself to an hour a day and often had to guess at the time. There seems to be a Trainer in there but don't ask for any spots-he didn't know what it meant! All in all, decent for a week but we would have struggled for two weeks.7) Weddings- In short, I would highly recommend getting married here. Aurelio was very accomodating although we really didn't bug him too much as I know a lot of couples do! The wedding itself was on the beach and very private but unfortunately it was windy that night which was unusual. I would still recommend the beach over the gazebo as that's what the Caribbean is all about! Our wedding time was 6pm however started later due to the one Judge in the D.R. running slightly late. Due to this, our wedding pictures were taken in the dark-not ideal but they turned out okay. A warning to brides-if you plan to have the salon do your hair, make sure you do a trial run. Despite having pictures our hairstylist made a mess of our hair and we literally had to run back to our rooms with towels over our head less than an hour before the wedding to wash it and do it ourselves. Very stressful. The special touches the Majestic provided after the wedding (flower petals in the room and special bath, bath towel swans, breakfast delieverd the next day and a special dinner the next night) were wonderful extras which really made us feel special. Our wedding dinner table and cake was also beautifully done.I would recommend the Majestic in a heartbeat. We will definitely be returning to Punta Cana someday (possibly our five year anniversary) and it would be hard to decide between the Majestic and the Secrets Excellence.

Fine soft white sand with beautiful clear blue/green ocean water with palm trees everywhere. They had plenty of chairs and shade. I won $400 total by playing at Roulette table so I can't complain!! It was awesome.DISCO - We were there during the Super Bowl week and they set up the disco bar with finger foods and showed the game on their big screen TVs which was good. We went there one night to join the other guests to dance which was fun.WATER SPORTS AT THE BEACH - they are usually free and we rented a kayak and snorkling gear.EXCURSIONS - Excursions are not part of the all-inclusive package. They said it's like Dominican Republic aphrodisiac. haha... Overall, we had a great time and were very pleased with their services and property. It's really cold and snowing in the East coast now so I certainly do miss the Majestic very much now. I highly recommend anyone who wants to have fantastic time in Punta Cana. Go to the Majestic Fantastic!!! :-)

<Author>piezon50
<Content>All-inclusive fun in the sun Just returned from 6 days at the Majestic Colonial (Feb 6-12) and had a fabulous time. We were very leery about going to an all-inclusive but were pleasantly surprised, especially after reading some of the negative reviews on this site.First off, the hotel was beautiful and spotless with a pool that was the most unique one we've ever seen. The beach was fantastic with plenty of lounge chairs and shaded areas. The service was quite impressive and the staff went out of their way to greet you with a smile and a hola whenever they walked by. The room was very spacious and the balcony was quite large with great views from the upper floors. We happily didn't encounter a mosquito during our entire stay so the bug spray went unused. Now for the slightly negative, the food (and wine). No problem whatsoever with the buffet breakfasts. Food was plentiful with a great assortmenet including a pancake/waffle station, an omelet station and an eggs to order station. Add to that fresh fruits, yogurt, cereal, french toast, bacon  sausage and you had a perfect start to your day. Lunch, on the other hand, was a disappointment, perhaps because we weren't all that hungry but the selection was quite boring (and always the same). Dinners were varied. We had great meals at the seafood and steak restaurants (no reservations needed) and mediocre meals at the Gourmet (reservation required) restaurant and Asian a la carte restaurant (no reservation needed except for the Hibachi section). Try to get a reservation for the Hibachi dinner because that was our best meal of the week The wine (from Spain) was more like vinegar but the beer on tap was quite good. They didn't use top shelf liquor so some of the drinks were just average. However, the Majestic was very good as were some of their other specialty fruit drinks, i.e. dirty monkey, bahama mama, strawberry dacquiri and pin a colada). There were 8 or 9 bars and we never had to wait long for a drink. All in all, I would give this vacation a big thumbs up and would definitly consider returning..

<Author>wonderbear
<Content>"If You're in the Dominican ....You can't go wrong" Just returned from Majestic and had a delightful time. This was my second time to the Dominican. The Majestic was a nice resort. We had absolutely no problems with the food and we tasted everything. The food was always fresh and hot and there was plenty of variety. The breakfeast was our favorite. They had an omelette station, fresh fruit, quiche, homemade doughnuts all breakfeast meats and really anything you would typically desire for breakfeast. Also delicious Dominican coffee and fresh pineapple, guava, passion fruit juice, etc. Our favorite restaurant was the Rodeo grill steakhouse(anything taste good off the grill):) The room was nice. I would compare it to a Holiday Inn, it was not luxurious, for a new hotel , some steps were missed in construction, I did notice the painting and ceiling were a bit shoddy. I also agree with the other travel advisors that the bathroom set up was strange. The toilet was located behind a frosted glass door and right next door was a large marble shower. If you are modest or traveling with a family this would not be ideal. There was no room to change your clothes in privacy, and when you step out the shower you basically were in the bedroom next to the bed. The bed was very hard but if you like a firm mattress as I do you will enjoy it. The pillows were very thin however there were extra pillows in the closet and once you doubled them up it was comfortable. The resort itself was very lovely, the pool weaving in and out of the resort was beautiful. The lobby, entertainment area, and all restaurants were nice. The beach was wonderful, soft, white sand and beautiful clear water that was warm. All beach lovers must visit the Dominican for this reason alone. Tha average temperature during my stay (Feb 9-12th) was 83 F. The staff spoke English well enough and were very accomodating. The spa was nice, however be warned,again, you modest ones, the attendant does not leave the room when you undress (unless you request). The spa menu was good and offered a variety of standard services, including couples massage. Please do not miss the Michael Jackson show on Sunday nighrs. Also I highly recommend an all day excursion with Jurrasic Safari or Mountain View Safari so you can really get an idea what Dominican life is like. I agree with the others, please tip everyone if you were pleased with the services. The average income for a Dominican family is $250USD a month. In conclusion I liked the Majestic but I liked the Riu Palace a lot more(see my previous review) but hey either one you can't go wrong in the Dominican...ENJOY!!

<Content>Romantico time My Wife and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial from Feb 2-9, 2007.We had a wonderful time and here are some of our thoughts on our stay:AIRPORT - nice and clean and organized we didn't have to wait very long to receive our luggage, but unfortunately there was no sign to direct us to our bus. Other people waiting around for a long time until they found their bus Need clear directions for travelers.RESORT ENTRANCE - Upon entering the resort you notice a stark contrast from poor area to rich area. The very front entrance of Majestic could use some landscaping. We passed Gran Bahia and their front entrance looked amazing, beautiful flowers everywhere.POOL - what an amazing pool. So grand and spacious yet pockets for everyone. If you wanted action you can play volleyball, if you wanted to relax you just swim into the whirlpool areas, if you want seclusion you just swim around one of the many twists and turns that run from one end of the property to the other. Clean when we arrived, but as the week went on it became a little dirty with leaves and debris, but still very beautiful.GROUNDS - Very well maintained. Always grooming and cleaning. The selection of plants and flowers and the varying displays and landscaping was enthralling. Everywhere you walking you see different arrangement of flowers and plants, it makes the resort look even larger and grandiose. BEACH - Make sure you put on some sun block because once you start walking on this beach you will just keep on going until you realize you have walked for hours. The beaches here have wonderful fine white sand, no rocks, shells or seaweed and not just at Majestic, but for as far as you can walk in either direction. Plenty of chairs and shade for everyone. No issues with pushy vendors when we were there.ROOMS - We had an ocean view room with a king size bed and it was great - what a beautiful view and the sound of the ocean waves was memorizing. For me, the hard bed was fine, but the pillows were too soft and thin for the hotel of this caliber. Our room had cathedral ceiling, double sinks, larger shower with bench, but the cramped toilet area takes some getting used to. The safe was included which was nice.SPA - Didn't try it, but loved the fountain they had inside the grounds, maybe next time.FOOD - I read all the reviews about not to expect much quality in the Caribbean and I'm glad we did lower our expectations because that helped us to enjoy the food more. Majestic had great variety and everything was fresh including all the salads, fruits and vegetables. I personally stayed away from cold meats and chesses, but they looked fine. We loved the French and Japanese (too bad I wasn't that hungry that night, but it was delicious). All restaurants were clean, chairs were comfortable utensils clean and the service was prompt and friendly. The ambiance in most restaurants were very romantic especially by the ocean - nothing like having dinner with moonlight and rolling waves behind you. DRINKS - This is were you MUST lower your expectations. I tried a Pina Colada and other fruit drinks, but that was a mistake - terrible. Thank God they had endless amounts of bottled water.STAFF- Cleaning staff were very thorough with our room and restocked our fridge every day. Actually we should give a big thank you to Francisco for helping us with our check-in. We had a problem with our room and he certainly made our stay that much more enjoyable by providing us with a great room.ENTERTAINMENT - We loved the Micheal Jackson show and the acrobats, but the others were just so so. Movies for kids every night as well.SPORTS - Beach volleyball was fun, basketball court needs resurfacing (bad shape). Tried to play some tennis when they had a scheduled tournament, but no staff showed up. Courts looked good (they also had a clay court - sort of). Lots of activities to do.Last but not least, we absolutely loved the piano and sax nightly performances. Especially the sax player, it seemed every time he saw us he would say that its Romantico Time and prompt us to dance and we did!I would definitely recommend this resort. A very relaxing and satisfying stay. We had a blessed stay.

<Content>A Fantastic Vacation! My husband and I vacationed at The Majestic Colonial in mid-November of 2006...although it was a few months ago..I felt as though I still had to share our wonderful vacation experience. The hotel is absolutely breathtaking. We were fortunate enough to get a room facing the pool along with our own private Jacuzzi on our patio. I would be remiss to mention the fact that there was a slight language barrier; knowing a little Spanish would be extremely helpful. However, we never ran into a problem with this, there certainly were enough staff around that spoke fluent English so if need be there was always somebody to communicate effectively with. My husband  I had been on a few cruises before but never vacationed at an all-inclusive resort before so we were a little reluctant to try this. It absolutely proved to be one of the best and most relaxing vacations we ever had! The beach was gorgeous. You can sink your feet right into the salt-like sand (not that coarse sand-papery sand), and the best part was that no matter how warm the temperature got, the sand was never too hot to walk on, the water was just the right temp and getting a comfortable lounge chair on the beach was not a problem (although getting to the beach by 10AM is highly recommended if you want to put your chair under one of the palm trees!). The food was delicious and plentiful. There were many choices of food, however, there were 2 restaurants that we needed to make reservations for: the sushi restaurant and the Gourmet Restaurant. Well worth the wait! They really were great! The room we stayed in was lovely. Spacious and bright  the housecleaning staff did a good job of keeping the room clean. We brought our laptop computer down with us so we can stay connected to our family..there was a minimal charge for this but it was nice having the Internet connection in our room. The nightly entertainment was pretty good. Some nights, were better than others, but they mixed it up enough that there was something for everybody. There were a few nights that we decided not to go to the entertainment but rather walked on the beach or around the hotel or went to the casino. It is just that beautiful! The guests at the hotel were very nice. We met people from all over the world! The best part was that although I believe that the week we were there, the hotel was almost at full-capacity, it never felt crowded, we always had our 鈥渙wn space鈥? All in all, we made a great choice, it was a fantastic vacation...we would (and plan to) to go back again in the future!

<Content>A Piece of Paradise It was our first time to the DR, as well as our first time trying all-inclusive and we were impressed with both. We are not-hard-to-please Canadians, and found everything to our liking. The trip from the Airport was fine, and the road is under construction, but you can tell that mass improvements are under way. Check in left ALOT to be desired. We spent about 1 1/2 hours trying to get 3 rooms together (3 couples) which was impossible even though we had emailed ahead. Some of the staff just couldnt care less. We ended up with 2 couples on the 4th floor on one end and one couple at the other extreme end of the bldg on the ground floor. Tipping was readily accepted, but made absolutely no difference in service. One couple ended up with double beds, and we all had a view that left alot to be desired~a chain link fence that had fallen half over. So the first day was a total writeoff after check in taking so long. But,....we did make up for it in the restaurant, and after a few bottles of wine, it really didnt matter much!~~enjoyed ourselves anyhow!Weather was terrific. Rained a few minutes here and there, and then cleared off and was beautiful. One week was definitely NOT long enough as the crew we were with werent into doing tours or anything~~maybe if we had had more time. If we returned we would definitely do a tour or two. Would have definitely done the tour that takes you to a school, etc. Brought gifts for the students and just ended up passing them with Majestic Mike, who, by the way, told us that emailing ahead of time to request a certain floor, etc, does you no good whatsoever~just basically the luck of the draw upon check-in. The boys did go golfing which they enjoyed~course was nice.Animation team does a great job~~we really enjoyed the games we participated in. Left gifts for them as they deserved it.The food was great. We were unable to book into the Japanese rest. though; they definitely need to add another Japanese dining room there as the 2 they have now are just not sufficient. Most people dont realize that there is a Chinese food rest that is adajcent to the Japanese that requires no reservation. We preferred the Steakhouse and the Mexican restaurant best. I have a cast-iron stomach and had no trouble all week though the hubby ate a few Immodium along the way. We tried many new foods, and thoroughly enjoyed it all! My favourites were the imported pasta and sauces, calamari, shrimp, fries, and the made to order omelettes for Breakfast. Also be sure to try the fresh orange and passion fruit juice for Breakfast~delicious! The desserts were all incredible. The Ocean water was so warm! A fellow told us that the water was more turbulent than usual~that it usually is much calmer right after Christmas. We didnt think it was too bad~great for boogie-boarding! The beach went on for miles, and was incredibly postcard-perfect, and our resort beach was very clean....again, tip the workers who got up early each morning to clean it!The pool was the nicest we have ever seen.....amazingly long and very clean. We had great times around the pool. Make sure you take a ton of American one dollar bills with you for tipping and because many places will not give change. Do not take Travellers Cheques as a couple that was with us exchanged them at the desk, and they converted them to pesos first and then back to US dollars, and charged a huge fee for doing so, along with losing on the exchange. My good sunglasses and camera were either lost or stolen while there, but that was my own fault for not being more careful. Most folks were very good for keeping an eye out, but I think the camera went missing on the Thurs evening while shopping at the merchants who peddle their goods once a week. Majestic Mike assured us they were all searched as they left the resort, but I highly doubt that was true. We wondered how much Mike told us was true or not.....most employees there didnt have a high opinion of him for some reason, but wouldnt state why. We found most employees friendly (make sure to tip the gardeners, etc and those who dont see the tips often and could really use it~~the bartenders get ALOT of tips, and as I stated, it really doesnt get you any better service) Maid service was nothing great, but adequate. Again tipping made no difference. We left cash and gifts which they took and appreciated, but made no difference in the quality of service. Also know that it is 2 different people who do your room~one is the maid, and another person stocks the mini-bar, so leave tips/note requests for this person IN THE FRIDGE itself. The accomodations (hotel itself and rooms) were very impressive, and we had no complaints with either the pillows or the beds. It was nice to have a safe in each room.We tried many of the drinks which were all delicious and were glad we had brought the insulated cups with us as saved a few trips, and kept them cool.We had a fantastic holiday, and thought the Majestic to be a wonderful place to stay. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Most of the staff was very helpful and I did notice that there were a couple of staff members that did not know any English and did tell us that they did not understand what we wanted, but we were able to find someone to help us. For anyone going or looking for a resort to go to, you will not be disappointed. You have to remember that for the price, there is no reason not to have a very enjoyable and memorable vacation. <Author>Meline
<Content>Great experience at Majestic Colonial My husband and I just got back from the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana. We were there from Jan 27-Feb 3/07,in a group of 11 people for my sister's wedding.Here are my comments:RESORT - Very nice resort. The grounds were beautifully maintained and it was easy to get around. The pool was fantastic - ran the entire length of the resort and was a consistent depth to allow you to walk through the water from one end to the other. The beach was beautiful too - we walked the 45 minutes down to the vendors shops and passed several other resorts along the way. We by far liked the set up at the beach of the Majestic as the chairs were not as crammed together and there was lots of sun. There were no high pressure sales people approaching you on the beach at the resort, which was great...but you could walk down the beach to the vendors if you wanted to shop and haggle.ROOMS - We had a pool view room and it was great - good size and good view. As others have mentioned, the beds were a bit hard but the pillows were fine.SPA - The bride and one of the bridesmaids in our group had their hair done at the spa the day of the wedding...both wanted their hair loosely curled and had pictures. The result was a disaster...they threw towels over their heads, ran to their rooms and washed it all out and started over again. If you are having your hair done for a wedding, I would definately say it would be worth your while to do a trial run in advance.FOOD - The food was OK, but lets get real...what do you expect....you don't go to the Caribbean for the food. From other 5 star resorts I have been to in the Caribbean, the Majestic is about on par. As we were part of a larger group, the variety offered seemed to be good enough for everyone (even the vegetarian in the group). There was never a long wait for tables or service or food. My only complaint was the issue that we had with our group reservation - Le Gourment seemed to have a big problem honouring our reservation for 11 people and argued with me for a while (until Majestic Mike helped us out).STAFF- The restaurant staff was very good -very attentive and always smiling. The maid service was mediocre (our room was not made up one day until we called that evening). Angel  Francisco at the front desk were both great and very helpful. We had a few issues come up that they tried to help us out with and always knew who we were and what it was about (unfortunately the items that I left in the room before we changed rooms never did turn up after 5 days of back and forth which was a little frustrating). And now for the best guy at the resort...MAJESTIC MIKE, hands down!!! This guy is great!!!! He works crazy hours and is very busy, but always finds time to chat and to help you with your problem and make you feel important as well. The best thing that the Majestic did was to hire Mike to head up their Guest Services department. It doesn't hurt that he is a fellow Canadian either as he really does understand and is able to give helpful advice. Thanks, Mike...you came to our rescue a few times and really made the difference during our stay!All in all, I would recommend the Majestic Colonial if you are going to Punta Cana. It is a great place...just keep in mind that you are in the Caribbean and things are done a little differently there. If you are OK with that, then you will love your stay there...and take a minute stop and say hello to Mike if you do go!

<Content>I would rather cruise I'm finally getting around to writing a review. My daughter, cousin, and I went to the Majestic to relax and enjoy the beach. I would advise knowing a little bit of Spanish, or, take a dictionary with you. The bed was very hard. We asked for extra pillows and towels upon arrival. The maid was outside of our room. We had a scented candle with us. Also, leaving the ceiling fan on all of the time, helps ALOT! The bathroom is strange, to say the least. Not much privacy. I didn't like that!  The bar downstairs from the main lobby makes the best drinks. Many people got sick during our stay. I think it's because they ate anything they saw. We never ate food that was outdoors. We were careful and stayed healthy. No goat stew for me. If I didn't know what it was, I didn't eat it. Drink bottled water. The mini-fridge in the room is well stocked. We took drinks to the beach. Many tourists are Spanish or Euorpean. The Euorpeans could be seen(some of them) walking topless on the beach. Didn't bother us. I would feel uncomfortable if my son were with me. The beach is very clean. The entire resort is clean and new.  All in all, it was a wonderful trip. However, I prefer a Caribbean cruise instead. Much more to do on a ship. I have gotten spoiled. I'm very happy I went to the Dominican. I always dreamed of going. I don't think I'll return though. There is alot of poverty. I feel sorry for the residents!

<Author>jules1025
<Content>A Perfect Week in Paradise.. I travelled with my boyfriend to the Majestic in mid December and couldn't of had a better time... I relied so much on TripAdvisor when booking it, so here is my review:ARRIVAL - It is a short drive from the airport and reports of terrifying Dominican driving are highly exaggerated! Check-in was smooth, the staff were unbelievably nice. We never had any problems with the language, as most speak english quite well. Try and speak some spanish, though, its a beautiful language and fun to learn! ROOMS - Our room was breathtaking. I've stayed in numerous 5 stars including the Bahia and this was by far the nicest! A spacious room with gorgeous marble floors... The mattresses and pillows were fine, I don't know what people are complaining about!FOOD - The food was FANTASTIC!!! I am the worlds pickiest eater and found something at every meal that I not only ate, but LOVED! Try the french toast in the morning - yum! My boyfriend is a seafood fanatic and would not stop raving about the lobster at the seafood restaurant - (no reservations required) Delicious pasta bar and omellette stations were favourites of everyone we spoke to! I have no idea what more people could ask for! ENTERTAINMENT - Not bad. The Michael Jackson show was really fun, as was the ideal couple night - we we're made to participate in that so I should know! That's another thing, if you don't want to participate in the nightly show or activities, don't sit near the front! They will drag you on stage! The dance and circucs nights were, to be honest, a little amatuerish, but what they lacked they more than made up for in effort. These performers worked sooooo hard! It wasn't any better or worse at any other hotels.BEACH - AMAZING. White sand, clear water, lots of lounge chairs. I must tell you not be shocked at the amount of topless beach-goers. Many guests were European and it is perfectly acceptable to go topless. Didn't bother us at all. Something we really enjoyed and wish we'd done more than once was take a walk down the beach around 5p.m. and watch the sunset... Very serene and romantic! Also a good way to burn off that buffet!POOL - Huge pool, always a place to sit. The animation team sticks to one area, so if you want to read or snooze you can do so. We mainly stayed at the beach though.MEDICAL TREATMENT - Luckily, with the exception of a little tummy trouble, neither of us got sick from the food. I did however need to fill a prescription for something completly unrealted and there is a doctors office on site, open 24hrs a day, with a fluent, english speaking doctor. Wonderful service.TIPS - We tipped every night, although many didn't. We left $2 U.S for the maid and $2 on top of the fridge. Our room was always clean, and the fridge stocked to the brim. He started to notice what we were drinking more of, and put extra of it in. I don't know what the tipping standard is, but they seemed to appreciate it, as did the dinner servers. SHOPPING - There are vendors outside of the hotel and my godness do they try to rip you off!! The prices are reasonable when compared to the hotel gift shop, but they can be talked down if you are firm with them. Also, the vendors come and set up in the hotel on Thursday evenings.OVERALL - The most perfect trip I could have asked for. The staff were a joy, always greating you with a smile. The hotel was beautiful and had everything you could ever want. I would go back in a heartbeat!!!!!!

<Author>kennedyEdmonton
<Content>Majestic was fantastic Lynne and Stu Orr from Edmonton, AlbertaWe just returned from two weeks in Punta Cana, January 17 to January 31/07. The Majestic Colonial was one of the best resorts we have been at. We went with another couple and we had rooms 3120 and 3121 which is on the first floor that had a balconey's the accessed the pool. The room was beautiful, all marble, very large, pillows were fine, and the rooms were cleaned every day. We had no problem with bugs, never used our insect spray. Coffee was a little strong so we made Sanka from one of the bars and sat on our balconey every morning relaxing before breakfast.The pool is something to see. Biggest swimming pool we have ever seen. Very clean but bring a towel early in the moring to reserve a spot. We tried to cheat and left one over night but it dissappeared.The bar tenders are very friendly and the drinks they pour are usually three to four ounces of alcohol so be careful if you aren't used to strong drinks, but they can make them any way use want them. Food was excellent in all the restaurants and we tried them all. We had no trouble making reservations and liked the Japanese and the Mexican the best. Some of the bars didn't have premium type drinks available such as Corona which if they had it you would pay $3 US, but they had none. We had premium wrist bands meaning that we could order everything from the bar menus, however, my favorite scotch, Cutty Sark wasn't available, so had to subsitute with JB's or Red LabelThe beaches are fanastic. Some reviews I have read mentioned rocks. We are unsure were they were as we saw none and we walked virtually every day along the beach. The ocean water is like swimming in your bathtub. No much to see snorkelling wise in front of the hotel but there are excursions that cater to those so inclined. We also played golf at the Majestic golf course called Punta Blanca Golf Club. Best golf deal that we have ever experienced. Green fees are 30% off when you stay at the Majestic (regular price is $150) and comes with a cart, free beer and other beverages, and free food. The golf course itself is very forgiving and beautiful. Tee times are such that there was never anyone behind us nor anyone in front of us. Try and find that anywhere else. Green fees are $105 US. Club rentals (Calliway, Titlest, Taylor made) is $40 US. No shoe rentals, so bring them from home The other golf couses not affiliated with the Majestic are $150 US and up. We would go back in a heart beat. The grounds are absolutely beatuiful, the staff very friendly, and most speak english but are interested to teach you some Spanish if you show some interest in learning. We would recommend this resort to our friends andanyone else who asks. If you want you can contact me at: stewart.orr@shaw.ca We can home to a winter storm last night so I guess its back to reality. Damn!

RESORT (general): It truly is majestic 鈥?the pictures don鈥檛 even do it justice. FOOD: The food was fine 鈥?many people again forget that these resorts cater to people other than Americans, so some of the food might seem odd. They had a crepe station, fried egg and omelet station, and by the way if you like coffee 鈥?it was always available anytime day/night. You could also order cappuccino (yummy) and espresso. We ate lunch at the beach bar/grill because of the amazing beach view 鈥?yes, a lot of the same food, but it is lunch 鈥?what do you expect? Dinner was always great 鈥?we loved the Rodeo steakhouse (amazing Chateaubriand with b茅arnaise sauce) and Tres Carabelas (fish  seafood) because at night the beach grill was split into these two restaurants and the open air atmosphere was so nice. The French and Caribbean were also good (didn鈥檛 go to the Japanese place). Overall, we didn鈥檛 get sick and the food was fine 鈥?worked for us 鈥?we were there to relax, not gain 20 pounds. I think if you focus on the food and set high expectations, you will be disappointed at most all-inclusives. But for the value, we thought they had lots of variety and overall was good. We also brought a few munchies for at night just in case, but never needed them - we always got full at dinner! BAR: Let just say they have no problem pouring the drinks on the heavy liquor side! Freddie at the beach bar was great 鈥?his drinks were always good. Some of the bartenders had better personalities than others, but they would still get your drink. As I said before, a smile and patience goes a long way. We liked hanging out in the lobby house at night on the comfy couches - and they do have cocktail waitresses taking orders and cleaning up after people too - don鈥檛 normally see that at an all-inclusive. POOL: Amazing and so cool looking 鈥?runs the length of the hotel - never really used it as we are beach people, but it was very spacious and had quiet places you could hang out. BEACH: Awesome! We had some people from another resort stop to ask what the name of ours was because we had the best beach they had seen along their walk! Never had a problem getting chairs 鈥?people kind of cycled through. Each day we traded in our beach towels for new ones (there are 2 places to do this) 鈥?they always had plenty. ENTERTAINMENT: We are more of the quiet type, but did see the magic show one night (not bad) 鈥?the area where they had shows was nice 鈥?lots of chairs and tables and 2 bars. Even though we didn鈥檛 get to know the animation team, we could see them from our balcony and the energy they had would put most aerobic instructors in the US to shame! They always smiled and said 鈥淗ola鈥?and never hassled us about games, etc. We also didn鈥檛 sit near where they were 鈥?so there were areas close to the action and farther from it which was nice. EXCURSIONS: Didn鈥檛 do any this time 鈥?but will try next time.MONEY: We never had a problem as they were always willing to except cash 鈥?however bring ones, tens and fives because they can鈥檛 always make change on big bills. . We didn鈥檛 see the need to tip everyone either 鈥?and if you do, do it discreetly as they really don鈥檛 like to be seen taking tips. Usually a big smile and a 鈥淕racias!鈥?made them happy.SMOKE: My husband and I are not smokers and my eyes and throat get irritated when I am around it 鈥?but due to the open airiness of the resort, it never really bothered me. <Author>AmyInNY
<Content>Falls short in important areas My review is based on placing The Majestic along side all of the resorts in the Caribbean that I have visited--this is not a How much fun did we have here review, it's a How Does the Majestic Stack up Against Area Resorts In General review. Our Stay: January 8-14, 2006. Room 3234.POSITIVES: The professional and candid photos of the resort really are a true reflection of the property. The main building, the grounds, and public areas overall are quite lovely. The thoughtful architectural design and physical layout ensures that nearly all rooms at the resort have a view of either the pool, the beach, or both. (There are a few very unfortunate exceptions where rooms face an ugly neighboring hotel building, access road and/or chain link security fence.) The beach is large, the pool is huge, and we had little problem finding chairs at either--it was particularly easy to locate chairs on the beach.The service and the staff who directly interact with guests (Animation team, bartenders, restaurant personnel) are very good. NEGATIVES: Despite the nice overall appearance of the rooms (marble floors, large walk-in shower, double vanities), the items that you actually need and/or use in the rooms are poor or nonexistent. Beds are hard as a rock--literally. Pillows are not actually pillows but thin half inch slices of non supportive foam (you need 4 or more to equal one 'normal' down pillow), You may or may not get towels. Our room, despite assurances that more would be sent (that never were) averaged 2 bath towels and one hand towel. For 2 adults, this is not adequate. Never a wash cloth, only twice in 6 nights did we have a bath mat (and the marble is way too slippery when wet to not have that), and twice our dirty towels were just not changed! (We had to use our pool towels.)Our bedspread was dirty throughout the stay, and on one day sheets were put on our bed that had lipstick all over the top of them! When the bed was turned down, there was no possible way that it could have been missed by maid service--but was left nonetheless.Fittings and room finishings are below par. We had a broken ceramic lamp in our room that the maid kept trying to rebalance on it's severed base--it fell over on my head the first night and we requested replacement--which never did arrive although the lamp was removed on the 4th day (they left the shade?!!). Cheap furniture is also already showing wear, slip covers are ill-fit and untidy, missing trim pieces were evident in the bathroom. FOOD and drinks: This is where the resort is most seriously lacking. If your idea of 'good' is akin to 'a lot', then you won't be disappointed with the food and drinks. HOWEVER, if what you want on vacation is fresh, local, interesting, tasty, well prepared, cuisine--GO ELSEWHERE. The quality of the food at the buffets is on par with hospital food and/or public cafeterias. The quality ranges from disgusting to below average at lunch time, average at breakfast, and below average at dinner. The most passable dinners we had were at the Rodeo Grill (steak) and the Japanese restaurant--where you are LUCKY to even get a reservation (we were told both reservation-only restaurants were totally booked during our entire when we attempted to make reservations UPON ARRIVAL). Neither is worth writing home about, but at least the food is average.Drinks  Wine: The wine is plentiful, but it is utterly horrid if you are truly a wine drinker. (And I don't mean 'wine snob', I mean if you like anything above a $4 bottle or box!) Premium brands of liquor are advertised but do not count on their availability. IN SUM: If you like a Spring Break type atmosphere, your goal is to 'par-tay!' and you don't care about food and drink quality--you'll have a good time. (I think I may have enjoyed a stay here when I was in my early 20s.)If you seek a relaxing, romantic, comfortable or pampering get away with good food  drinks, this is not the place. If Trip Advisor allowed, I'd give the Majestic 2.5.
