Riding the boat is a blast and the snorkle area is outstanding. You feed fish and see all kinds of aquatic life! It is a half day trip. The next trip we took was the Sedona Island Trip. This was aboslutely horrible. Let me first warn you that it is a full day trip and by this I mean we left at 6:00am and returned at 9:00 pm. We left our hotel and drove 1 hour in a van. We arrived at a location with about 30 others and loaded up on a bus where we then drove another 2 1/2 hours to a village where we went to the bathroom. We then drove another 45 minutes to the beach where we got on a speed boat to ride another hour. We spent 1 hour in a cove that was suppose to have star fish but was not better than our beach at the Majestic and then spent another 2 hours at a very average beach. We then rode a catamaran boat back which took 2 hours and then proceeded to take the 4 hour venture back on the bus. It was a TERRIBLE waste of a day. A 13 hour day and 8 of those hours are on a bus! LONG DAY!Service: This depends. Some days it was great and some days it seemed as though the service did not really want to be there. From what I am to understand they work 21+ days and then get 3 days off so I am sure they get rather tired of what they do. I do not think they liked the fact that we did not speak Spanish. They do work HARD!! They are ALWAYS working on the grounds, cleaning, serving etc..Summary: I enjoyed relaxing at the beach and getting away from the world. My wife and I met some terrific people from the USA and really enjoyed their company! However, if you have never been to the Dominican Republic here are a few things you need to consider before traveling: Punta Cana is primarily a TOURIST location. THere is nothing else there but resorts. This is great however consider the fact that this side of the island does not have any town life that you can visit to go shopping or walk around. You are pretty much isolated to your resort. Because of this the excursions you go on you will have to travel a pretty good distance before you arrive at you destination. 1 hour plus. Beware of the shops. Some of the workers get very hands on and pull you into their shacks! Last but not least consider that 95% of the employees do not speak English and even worse 95% of the tourists do not speak English as well. This made it very, very difficult for my wife and I to enjoy meeting new people and taking part in the activities around the resort. Everything was in spanish and we often felt like outsiders due to the fact that we could not communicate with others around us. It does not seem like a tourist location for Americans. Because of these aspects we would probobly not return however, The Majestic was gorgeous and the beaches were outstanding for relaxing.Feel free to email me with any questions!

<Author>kristyp
<Content>A great vacation!!!! We just returned to the states yeterday from our week at the Majestic and here are some quick tips for making your vacation better in the Dominican Republic.... understand and remember that even though you are staying at a luxury resort, you are still in a third world country and these people are giving you everything that they have. They are a very happy people that are full of life and are constantly busting there humps to make your stay enjoyable.MARKET- WARNING ... DO NOT GO!!! We went off the property to the local market which was right out the main gates of the resort. They are all fighting for your business and will grab you and pull you into their shops and close the door behind you and stand there holding the door knob. As soon as you get out of the door the next person is pulling you physically into their store. STAY AWAY! There are some shops on the resort that will offer the same things and they will also bring some other vendors in from the market that will set up tables during your stay. You can barter with the vendors, just not the shops on the resort. Wait for them to come to you!FOOD- The food was good. We highly recommend the Japanese restaurant (make your reservation as soon as you arrive with guest services as this one books like 4 days out). The Seafood side of the playa Beach area was also wonderful and if you cannot decided from what is on the menu, ask for both and they will be more than happy to bring you two full meals. The Steakhouse was not so great. They offered a good cut of mean, just not prepared well. We did not eat at the Taino or Le Gourmet as the men had to wear pants to get into the LeGourmet. You cannot go wrong with the buffets.... many choices!A good tip is to take Pepto Caplets or Immodium with you and take them every morning like you would vitamins...our stomaches were not used to the unprocessed foods and dairy there. Although the food was good, we would have to make a return trip to the room directly after every meal until we started just taking Pepto before eating.ROOMS- Bring your own pillows. They have Pepsi products at the Resort and in the rooms. They did a nice job of keeping the wet bar filled for us and remembered what we liked from day to day and would make sure we had those things. We would leave $2-3 for the cleaning service and always received excellent results. Keep in mind they do not have washcloths in each room, but you can call the front lobby and get some. Bring some scented candles because the rooms smell a little musty like, but that is only because of the humidity in the air. It took my swimsuit 2 full days out on the balcony to dry and when I would get out of the shower, my hair would stay wet until the next morning. ENTERTAINMENT-The entertainment team was great. There was always something going on with them. You must see the Michael Jackson show, it is amazing. The other shows were good as well, but the MJ show brought the house down!All in all, we had a great time and would definately go back!

<Author>jadagem
<Content>Good, but not Five Stars! My husband and I stayed at the Majestic Colonial from July 13th - July 19th. We had a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation. I would be remiss if I didn't write a review as I utilized trip advisor to learn more about Majestic Colonial. The property is beautiful and the hotel tries to live up to being a five star but falls short. There were subtle things that made it apparent, such as, no one cleaning up around the pool. By mid day the circumference of the pool was filled with used drink cups. No one helped with beach chairs. Cards were given to obtain towels for the beach, and when the towel was returned you got your card back. No card upon check out, it was $20 fee. I called to report the pillow cases were wet that were put on the bed, assured that someone would make the change but no one ever came to the room. It was those sorts of things that took away from a true five star hotel. We tipped often throughout the day and found the $1 tip made a world of difference in the service delivered. Felix the bartender at the beach was very appreciative and had drinks ready as we approached the bar . The housekeeping staffed replaced whatever was necessary in the wet bar, when left a note and $1. This is a very poor area and $1 is a lot of money to them. Go with singles because change is not easy to come by.The food was okay, but by no means gourmet. The breakfast buffet was excellent, offering almost anything you can imagine for breakfast with the exception of waffles, but they aren't missed.Other then the buffet between 8:30 - 10AM, there is a continental breakfast offered. Lunch was a buffet at the beach. It had a lot of choices as well as the American fair of hamburgers, hot dogs, and cold cuts. There was another buffet for lunch at Portofino where breakfast is served. That buffet was a bit more extensive but if at the beach it was out of the way to go for lunch. Dinner had several choices, the Gourmet restaurant (reservations needed, and can only go once in a stay or once a week) and the Japanese Masuri is the same as the gourmet. Both are good but not excellent and not over the top. The Japanese cook is Dominican and has only been there for five months, he has no formal training. I found this out at our dinner, which is served at a hibachi table with other people. The gourmet restaurant we went to twice as we went on Friday and were allowed to go again early the next week. The first time is was quite good but the second time was not up to par. Tiano is the Mexican/Dominican restaurant which had a small buffet of Dominican cuisine plus the dish you ordered off the menu. The food is fine, there is something for everyone. There is always the buffet for dinner which seemed to be frequented by families as there is a lot for children on the buffet. The shows were entertaining, somewhat hokey at times but the staff tries very hard to present an hour of entertainment. The Michael Jackson show is excellent and shouldn't be missed. The other show which we enjoyed was the Latin show. All shows are 10PM and last for one hour.Our room was lovely with a garden view. It did have a musty odor.Knowing this ahead of time I came prepared with incense and Airwick Solid Airfresheners, but when unpacking my suitcase, all my clothes needed to be laundered. The musty odor came back to the states with us. There is very little shopping there. The market which is outside the hotel gave my husband and me an uncomfortable feeling. It was unlike a busy market place you might find in Cancun as hardly anyone was there. We came back to the hotel and purchased small items to bring home. As far as sunscreen, toiletries, and drug items, think ahead, they are very costly . Bring Imodium as you never know. I was very careful yet on day four was stricken. My husband who ate everything and had ice in his drinks and was fine. I guess it happens. I brought all the necessary remedies with me and tried hard not to let it ruin the vacation. I brought bug repellent as suggested but didn't need it at all.In summary, the Majestic Colonial is a fine resort and tries hard to meet everyone's needs. I would recommend it without hesitation. Please feel free to e-mail me with any questions.

<Content>Very enjoyable stay at the Majestic My boyfriend and I stayed at the Majestic 07/10 through 07/15 and we had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay. We booked our trip through Cheap Caribbean which was great - everything was taken care of from being picked up at the airport and being taken back without any difficulties. We would definitely use their services again. Be aware that upon arriving at the airport in Punta Cana, you are required to buy a tourist card for $10 which they issue you and then collect shortly thereafter. HOTEL: Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful....and it is MAJESTIC! The grounds are beautiful, were constantly being attended to and it is exceptionally clean. The grounds are quite large but not too large that you can't comfortably walk everywhere you need to go. ROOMS: We have been to many resorts on many islands and this room was by far the nicest room we have ever stayed in. We were in room 4319 and didn't have a view but that was unimportant to us. *The only downfall to the room was the lack of privacy for the toilet facilities. It is basically a stall with a door that is open at the top and the bottom. While I certainly wasn't a fan of that, I would think that would be a very uncomfortable situation perhaps for couples who hadn't been together very long or groups or families sharing the same room. Mini-fridge was kept stocked daily. No washcloths but great towels! Awesome shower and jacuzzi tubBeds are very hard and the pillows are very flat - I took my own pillow! We were never awakened early by the maids/staff knocking on our door but I would imagine this depends upon your room location.....we were situated in the middle of the hotel and they probably start at one end and work their way through until they're done. STAFF: Very, very friendly and hard-working. The entertainment staff was exceptional. I was amazed at how they were at the pool most of the day and full of energy and then back for the evening and still going strong! Another reviewer had written an opinion that they were rude and only spoke to those they were interested in getting with and I couldn't disagree more. As a couple, we were approached and greeted by the staff just being friendly. We felt everyone at the resort was very friendly and accomodating. They were also very appreciative of any tips and we tried to do that often. POOLS: Gorgeous - perfect temperature - clean - plenty of chairs and shade available. If you want activity, hang out near the staff where they have games, music etc. If not, just go to a more private area and you can relax peacefully. BEACH: Beautiful water and calm enough to swim in. Plenty of chairs available as well as umbrellas. Just like the pool, you can relax or get involved with the staff playing games etc. - your choice. FOOD: I'm a very picky eater but I didn't go hungry. What I did eat was very good but I didn't get too adventurous! The Japanese restaurant as noted here by everyone else is a must and is excellent. We also did the Gourmet restaurant and I thought it was very good as well. The rest of the meals we ate at the buffet and one night ate at the steakhouse. Honestly, we almost cancelled our trip before we even left after reading so many reviewers commenting on how sick they got! We were really paranoid about eating anything! Like another reviewer, we went stocked up with Imodium and Pepto-Bismol and thankfully, never needed any of it. If you do get sick, you probably won't be very appreciative of the lack of privacy your in-room bathroom provides! LANGUAGE: It was hard to understand many of the staff and likewise, many of them didn't understand much English but we managed okay. We got the feeling that as Americans, we were very much in the minority there as it seemed to be more of a vacation destination for Spanish-speaking tourists (Spain, Puerto Rico, Cuba, Columbia) but it certainly was not a problem at all. It was a beautiful resort and if we return to the Dominican Republic, we most likely would stay there again, however, we like to travel to different places so probably would explore somewhere else for our next trip.

<Author>beebalm
<Content>Majestic...Majestic!!!!!!!!!!!! Planning our (six couples) trip to Punta Cana began in January. Having researched many resorts, our group made the decision to stay at the Majestic Colonial. Periodically, we checked the reviews about the resort and often wondered if we had indeed made the correct decision. Excitement grew as our departure date drew closer. After arriving at the Punta Cana airport, we were immediately taken to the our hotel. The Majestic was truly ............Majestic!! The lobby, the grounds, the rooms, the beach, the pool............all were extremely clean and inviting......8 days of paradise!!!! We had an ocean front room with a king bed, a jacuzzi inside as well as outside, a well stocked cooler, a handy safe, and were just steps from the huge pool and white sandy beach. What more could one want?? The food was quite good and the buffets offered many different dishes. Something for everyone! The steak and seafood by the beach was very tasty, and we ate there more than once. I would highly reccommend the Japanese restaurant as well. Food was not a problem even though some dishes were foreign to us. The waiters and waitresses were always trying to please and were ever so friendly. My husband and I celebrated our birthdays during our stay and believe me.............the staff made both days special complete with cake and drink !!!!! The beach was just as I had pictured it............breathtaking blue water and sand as white as can be. Post card perfect!!! We never had any trouble securing a lounge or 6 huts near one another. We enjoyed the pool and swim up bar in the afternoons. Blue Hawaiians........yum!After a late dinner, there was always the option of a show, a trip to the casino, or just hanging out in the lobby bar or the open air bar with live music. We never did visit the disco....too tired from all the sun and sand.Buying souveniers was difficult, however. The little shops in the resort were very limited. And if you are over 50 and slightly overweight, I suggest you leave the tubing to the younger slimmer guests. Although It did provide our group and much of the island with a good laugh!!!I really enjoyed the mix of people.........it definitely made our stay more interesting. It does help if you speak a little Spanish, but we were lucky as one of our Club members is fluent in Spanish and could help us out when necessary. We also took along some extra cash so we would be able to tip the much deserving staff.Before we knew it, it was time to leave the DR. This vacation was relaxing and memorable. Great place, great time, great friends. Did we make the right decision by booking the Majestic Colonial? You bet!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>WOW, WOW, WOW!!!!!!!!!!!! We just returned from paradise. We stayed in the Majestic with 2 little kids (8 months and 2 1/2 year) for 15 days. It was incredible. The hotel was amazing, so beautiful. RoomsThe rooms are extremely spacious, even with 2 extra kids in the room. First they gave us room 1310. We overlooked the parking of the Majestic and the entree of the resort next to ours. Not really what we hoped for, but well... But at night the kids couldn't sleep because of the noise of the theater of the resort next to us. Next day we asked for an other room, and they gave us room 3244. This room had sea and poolview. That added an extra 10% of joy to our holiday, we were a lot in the room because of the kids taking a nap. What I should mention is that it was damp in the room, accompagnied with the damp-smell. That wasn't so in the other room. But well, we took it for granted. So if you want a good room, here is what you should know: There are two buildings, the 1xxx and 2xxx rooms are in the first, the 3xxx and 4xxx in the second. The x1xx number indicates the level and the xx44 number is you roomnumber. The 1xxx rooms are on the back and for most part facing the other hotel and the parkinglot. The higher roomnumbers may have seaview, but I'm not sure. The 2xxx are facing the pool. The 21xx are on the groundfloor and have straight acces to the pool. Those rooms have a jucuzzi on the terras. The higher 2xxx rooms also have seaview. The 3xxx rooms are also facing the pool, but without the easy acces on the ground floor. And the 4xxx rooms are facing palmtreas. The higher 3xxx and 4xxx rooms also have seaview. Ok, enough about the rooms. FoodThe food was great and we never got sick. We ate about anything. So did our oldest girl. We ate a lot in the buffetrestaurants because of the kids. But we also visited Taino, the carribean restaurant, the tepanjaki restaurant, chinese restaurant with sushibar and the steakhouse. We loved the sushi. Our youngest got sick though, but we think that was due to swallowing lots of water in the pool. But if you'can't find anything you like, what I think is hard to believe, you'd better stay at home. We travelled a lot and never found such luxerious restaurants in an all-in resort. KidsAbout bringing small kids. Don't, if you don't like lots of attention. Of people touching you kids, speaking to them, taking them for a walk through the restaurant, or behind the bar. But this proud mum loved it, and so did our little one. The oldest is a bit shy. And the people. They are so nice. They are happy to please you. I can mention some names, but I will do wrong to those not mentioned. They all made us feel so welcome.Other guestMost guest come from the US. Just a few from different parts of europe. We met so many nice people. Beach and poolSuper!!!!! Nice green-blue sea. Beautiful white beach. Incredible large pool. We don't like participating in games, but we found enough quiet places. We were happily to find almost no-one putting towels on the chairs on the beach and by the pool. We usually went for a swim at 11 a.m. and always had choice of many shadow places. Never had a problem. Oh, and I didn't mention swimming in the shadow near the Spa. Great for kids and in case you got a sunburn. TheaterWe didn't watch that much shows. But the once we visited were great. Lots of musquitos though, so use repelent. We all loved the live music that was in the theater almost every night. Other barsSuper. We loved to sit on the patio. Just drinking some nice vino rossado or a margarita. And the wetbar is also very nice in the daytime. The gardenBeautiful. And in the evening, the lights just made it a fairy tale. SightseeingWe rented a car for a day and drove into the hills. The roads are very bad, but it's so nice going there. Beautiful nature, people so nice, almost no tourist visiting. Try visiting a local store. They don't speak english and I don't speak spanish, but that's no problem. It's that we never visit a place for a second time. To many places in the world to see. But I'd recommend it to any-one else.

<Content>Two thumbs up ! I would like to begin by thanking Aurelio Sanchez for answering all of my pre stay questions and ensuring that while at the Majestic my stay was nothing less that perfect. With that said, let us begin the review. Room #1 Majestic Swimout Suite (2146)In a word, great. The room location could not have been better. It is located directly across from the Wet Bar and pool activities. Most importantly, it is less than a 3 minute walk to the beach. The furnishings were very nice (taupe color wood) and both indoor and outdoor Jacuzzis filled up fast and the jets worked well. The airconditioning and fridge both functioned properly and there was no mold smell to contend with. Pillows while flat did the job. I would also like to mention that there were no bugs or critters of any kind to be found either inside the room or on the patio. Maid Service was always good and always early, usually around 9am and the mini bar never lacked anything. I was disappointed when I had to move to....Room #2 Majestic Oceanfront Jacuzzi Suite (2152)Now you're probably wandering why I would be disappointed in an upgrade of this calibur? It's pretty simple, I had to walk a few steps to the pool and wade over to the bar ! Seriously though, the room was absolutely beautiful and huge ! In addition to being larger and having a very slightly obstructed view, the furnishings were Mahogony wood as opposed to the taupe color in the swimout. Airconditioning, fridge, Jacuzzis all in working order. FYI, if booking a Oceanfront, try to get one on the 2nd floor for a less obstructed view. As with the 1st room, Maid service was good and always by 9 or so... Daytime/Nightime EntertainmentThere are theme nights each night of the week at the theatre ie: Latin, International, Michael Jackson, Couples contests etc. Folks, keep in mind that this is not Vegas. If you go with an open mind, grab a cocktail and relax it will be an enjoyable evening. I have to say that the talent of some of the dancers is amazing and these guys work their butts off for us on a nightly basis. Yes the shows are kind of corny but hey, it's all inclusive. After the show you are urged to go to the disco, don't bother. Seriously. It is the place where fed up parents send their kids. The Anamacion Team gets the party started during the day and they do a damn good job. Activities range from Spanish classes in the morning to Sexiest Man contests in the afternoon. There is something for every taste. The guys refuse to let you be bored or have less than a good time. My personal favorite was aerobics both on the beach and at the pool. Really fun and a good workout. Special shout out to sandy, Billy and Sexy Papi Felix. Thank you for making me enjoy myself.Resturants/FoodThis is a very subjective topic. The food ranged on any given day from average to excellent. My personal favorites were Taino and the Lobster place. The Gourmet and Matsuri really were nice, food not as good as I expected but still ok. The Buffet was really good if you get there when it first opens. Avoid eggs at all cost. Note: I did not get sick during my 8 day stay and did not notice flies in any of the eating establishments. Another piece of advice is that if you get hungry really late at night Taino stays open until 6am.BeachGreat. Lots of chairs and palapas. No need to wake up at the crack of dawn to reserve a seat. It did not occur at all. If I have left anything out or if you have additional questions, feel free to email me. Do not hesitate to book the Majestic.Cynthia

<Content>Traveled to Punta Cana several times, Majestic is not a 5-star resort We enjoyed our vacation in Punta Cana, as we always do. Initially, my family was excited about staying at the Majestic (new 5-star resort). During our 7-night stay, we realized the overall service  food selection gave it far less ratings. Otherwise, the overall resort was beautiful, including the pool  beach. I have summarized a list of Pro's  Con's for your reference:Positives: Massive pool area, breathtaking beach, above average suite (room), above average nightly shows, friendly entertainment staff, didn't have any problems with bugs, above average grounds  cleaniness.Negatives: Exactly the same food selection for every meal in typical restaurants, extremely poor service in restaurants (no drinks or refills - mostly had to get yourself, if thirsty), room smells moldy  damp, not a good variety of drinks, refridgerator in room barely keeps drinks cool, some staff wanted a hand-out for any type of service, staff never went out of their way to please their customers, and weak casino. (Overall resort rating = 3.5 stars).During our walk on the beach, we toured another newly constructed resort (RIU Palace - 5 stars ++), it was hands-down rated higher than Majestic. Being a new resort, they may have similar service problems, but it seemed extremely nice. Overall, keep in mind, you are visiting another country, the food doesn't taste nearly the same as home. Typically, it is overlooked because you are in paradise. Our previous vacations to Punta Cana include: Paradisus Spa Resort  Casino (better overall quality than Majestic) and Breezes Punta Cana.

<Author>susiet
<Content>Relaxed at The Majestic Husband and I stayed for 8 days 6/4-6/12. Check in was absolutely wonderful. Had emailed the resort ahead of time and asked for 2nd or 3rd floor and got 3rd floor with pool  semi ocean view--great room. Resort and grounds are very pretty. Once the foliage grows it will be magnificent! A few problems with construction--for example some of the concrete walkways are already being repaired. The place was totally immaculate! Everytime you went into a bathroom, there was a maid behind you mopping up. Maid service for our room was tremendous. We called houskeeping when we 1st got there and asked for our room to be made up early during our stay and it was done every day before 11am! We did tip our maid every day ($3) and we did bring some little gifts for her children. Our in room bar service was also wonderful. Never had to call for refills--automatically refilled what had been used, including the free champagne. Service at all the bars and the restaurants was wonderful. Always had a smile on their faces and again, we did tip at all meals ($2-3) and maybe a $1 a drink or so. Not every single drink but often enough that the servers knew our faces! Food was very good. Neither of us are big buffet people but the buffets here were better than any buffets that we have ever had at any of the many AI's we have been to. Very fresh, hot/cold and no flies/insects that other people have complained of. The sit down restaurants were also very good. We ate at every restaurant so I will leave my email at the end of this review if anyone has any questions for me. Drinks were okay. I liike a good glass of wine and the wine included in the AI package was so-so. The sweet drinks were okay. We managed very well at finding something everyday to drink. My husband likes Vodka Tonic and they never seemed to have any Tonic so he says he is going to open up a tonic factory there--he'd probably make a fortune. Beach  water was absolutely beautiful! Constructive Criticism: The resort has 2 bars open every day at the beach end of the pool. There are 2 more bars at the lobby end (quiet end) of the pool but they were never opened the entire time we were there and the resort was pretty much full the last 4 days we were there. We got pretty bored with the animation team screaming for people to join them and went down to the quiet end but couldn't get a drink down there unless you went into the lobby soaking wet which I was not comfortable doing and it was quite a hike from the pool! Also ( and this is not the fault of the resort), there were a lot of kids at the swim up pool bar just hogging all the seats and splashing water into our drinks and jumping from the little tree islands, getting dirt into the pool. Now, their parents did nothing about this. I think that with a pool this size, there should be an adult only section, with a bar. And by the way, the pool is the prettiest we have seen! Shows were so loud that we could not watch them--too bad because these kids work so hard on them but my hearing is not worth losing!  Our last full day at the resort was a little rough because my husband got stuck in the lobby elevator!! He was the only one on it and no one knew how to get him out!! It was about 90-95deg that afternoon and he was soaking wet from sweat. There wasn't any clear message in the elevator as to what to do in an emergency! Thank God it is glass because I think if it weren't he would have really panicked! He finally started pushing every button in the elevator and it must have put a light on above the outside of the elevator becasue a bunch of staff members came over and tried to pry the doors open. After about a half hour, they had the doors open about 18 inches and they literally pulled him out! It was such a small space that they had to take his glasses off for fear of breaking them! He was dripping wet when it was all over! They were apologetic about this but you would have thought that a manager would have followed up with us to see if he was okay! Not a phone call--nothing! That was a little disappointing when speaking of service. Sorry this is so long but if any questions please feel free to email me at susiet@twcny.rr.com

<Author>VADoe
<Content>Magnificent Majestic Just returned yesterday from the Majestic Colonial (May 11-16) and I can only sum it up in one word...Magnificent! I may not be a world traveler but this resort offers everything a person could want or need. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, the pool is fantastic and the beach will take your breath away. The way the resort is designed made it easy to find your way around quickly. The hotel management does a great job in keeping the grounds of the resort in perfect and spotless condition (no trash, cigarette butts, etc.)Upon check in, which only took minutes, we were escorted to our room. My husband and I had an ocean front room (2253) and we do not regret paying for the upgrade. The view and location was worth every cent. The room was huge and the bathroom area beautiful. I can see how the set up of the room with the open bath area may be a problem for families, but for a couple it is great. I had read previous reviews regarding restaurant reservations being difficult to get, but had absolutely no problems. Some staff are friendlier than others but that is no different anywhere you go. I was surprised at how many of the staff spoke fairly good English and communication was never a problem. The food at the resort may not be 5-star by American standards but being that it is an island I felt the food to be fine. The breakfast buffet had many choices - I recommend the made to order omelets and crullers and the coffee was excellent. Some of the items were a little on the cold side but keep in mind the quantity needed to serve many people at one time. We never ate at the buffet for any other meals but breakfast so I cannot really give an opinion for food served at lunch or dinner. Since we spent so much time at the beach, if we ate lunch we ate at the beach restaurant. The selection included hamburgers, hotdogs, chicken, pasta and a salad bar. At dinnertime, we went to the Gourmet, Japanese (wonderful), steakhouse and seafood restaurants near the beach. Our favorite restaurant was the Taino which served a Dominican buffet/Mexican menu. The fajitas were probably some of the best I ever had and my husband loved the Dominican food especially the goat stew! The staff was extremely friendly and lots of fun. We spoke with a few other people and we were all in agreement that the Taino was an under rated treasure! We did not experience any sickness from the food at all. One lady we met had a little problem but for the most part everyone we spoke to had no illness issues.The only negative comment that I can make about the Majestic was the inconsistent cleaning of the room and the stocking of the mini-fridge. Some days our room was cleaned by 11:00 a.m. One day, my husband had to call when our room was not cleaned by 4:30 p.m. and the response from housekeeping was immediate. It was our understanding that when they have a large number of people who check out those rooms are cleaned first for new arrivals. The only issue I had was that I wanted to take an afternoon nap and was afraid that the maid would come in to clean the room. I don't quite understand the inconsistent stocking of the mini-fridge. Some people had no problem and even got extra sodas and beer. We had to call two times in our 5-day stay to have fridge restocked with water and beer. My husband asked for extra beer and did not get it. Other guests would get extra beer with no problem. We used quite a bit of bottled water not just for drinking but for brushing our teeth. I must say that brushing your teeth with bottled water is not as easy as it sounds! As far as nightlife goes, Punta Cana is pretty tame compared to some place like Cancun. There are nightly shows, casino and disco. Punta Cana is the place to go if you want to just relax and take it easy.Our stay at the Majestic was wonderful. We caught a glimpse of some of the other resorts and I must say that Majestic was by far superior. Being a new resort was a plus in my book. If you want to relax, enjoy a wonderful beach and be surrounded by lovely grounds, the Majestic is for you.

<Author>gatorhon
<Content>Wonderful time at the Majestic Colonial Like many others, we were skeptical about staying at the Majestic based on all of the reviews. We booked our Honeymoon back in September/October 2005. As soon as we arrived all of my concerns were gone. The hotel lobby is magnificent. We arrived around 4:30 p.m. and were quickly taken to our room, #1407 - building 1, on the 4th floor facing another resort. We had two balconies, one with a huge Jacuzzi tub that was extremely private. We were a quick walk to the main buffet and to the pool. We enjoyed the quiet part of the resort and were very glad not to have a room by the pool.The main buffet was great for breakfast. The omelet station is definitely good. I would say that whenever you have the opportunity for them to prepare the food for you, your better off. My husband and I also enjoyed the pasta station immensely, but have them cook it for you and add fresh vegetables, etc. We ate at Le Gourmet twice and enjoyed the lobster and the filet mignon. We also ate at the Japanese Steakhouse once and thought it was decent, but we were in no rush to go back. We did enjoy the sushi at the Chinese restaurant. The buffet at the Caribbean restaurant was good and we enjoyed the salsa bar immensely. We did try the Seafood restaurant at the beach one night and were extremely disappointed. Needless to say, we did not go back there. We did enjoy the main buffet for dinner when we didn鈥檛 have reservations at another restaurant.The housekeeper came everyday (she even fixed my bathing suit) and cleaned up our room. We did tip periodically about $1 to $2, although it was not at all necessary; it was more something we wanted to do. We also tipped at dinner in the restaurants that required reservations and to the bartenders we visited frequently.As far as the drinks were concerned, they do have Smirnoff, Johnny Walker, J  B, etc. that do not cost extra, but you have to ask for them. We found the bartenders at the wet bar and the large bar near the restaurants (Lidio and Mike) were the best. They will make you anything you like and if for some reason you don鈥檛 like the drink tell them and order another one. We also brought our own insulated mugs and they had no problem filling them up. The shows were fine and some were more entertaining than others, but we by no means were expecting Broadway or Vegas style shows. Take them for what they are and you'll enjoy them. The Michael Jackson show was very good, even if you're not a fan.We did not experience much of a language barrier at all. As some others have said, you are not in the U.S. or Canada and their native language is not English. We brought a Spanish dictionary that was not at all needed. If you attempt to speak their language they will do their best to speak yours. A lot of them do speak English so I wouldn鈥檛 worry about that at all.We also brought our Sirius satellite radio receiver, antenna and home docking kit with the hope that we could pick up stations. It worked and we really enjoyed having it after hearing Spanish music most of the time. We just took our antenna out on the deck and hooked up the receiver through the front TV inputs. Worked like a charm. Also, bring your own pillows, the pillows they provide are as thick as a sheet. They are awful. You will be very glad you brought your own. The snorkeling off the beach is ok; if you want to just see some pretty fish, then it is good. The left side and the right side of the roped off area in the ocean are the best places to see the fish. Bring your own mask and snorkel. Also bring some bread into the water and the fish will swarm around you. To experience the culture of the Dominican Republic we took the Bavaro Runners Safari day trip. It was $81 U.S. per person, but we very much enjoyed the trip and thought it was money well spent. We visited sugar cane fields and a tobacco museum where they showed us how they make cigars. You will also travel to a typical Dominican home where you鈥檒l learn how they make chocolate and coffee which I thought was extremely interesting and tasty. My favorite part of this excursion was the horseback riding along the beach. It had been at least 20 years since I had been horseback riding and this was the perfect environment to try it again.The resort is most definitely suited for couples. It is the perfect spot for beautiful weather and if you just want to RELAX which is exactly what we did. We would definitely go back.

<Content>Fabulous Week April 21-28, 2006 We just returned from the Majestic Colonial and found it to be outstanding! When we got to the hotel we checked in with no problems and when we got to our rooms we were pleasantly surprised, they were beautiful. After reading reviews about having to purchase top shelf alcohol we were very worried but after a few drinks we found it to be not so bad, there were plenty of options. We found the piano bar in the lobby not to be so busy and the 3-11 bar tender was great, he would even do shots with the guys. Also the bartender in the morning/afternoon at the beach bar was great, when he saw us walk in he would start making what the guys always ordered. The food was great, plenty of options with the buffet. Breakfast consisted of every kind of meat, pancakes, fresh donuts, fruit, crepes, and omelets made to order. The buffet for lunch and dinner was wonderful as well, pizza, pasta, meats, fresh steamed veggies and much much more. The beach restaurant had a buffet during the day with hot dogs, burgers (not so good), and salad. For dinner they had the place divided into 2, 1 side was the steak house and the other side was seafood. We only went to the steak house twice, it was fabulous. We also made reservations for the gourmet (wonderful) and the Japanese (fabulous and entertaining), I would suggest as one of you check in the other go the the desk to make reservations for these two places and some people did not get in. There were 2 other restaurants, the Caribbean and a Chinese which we did not go to but heard from others that is was good. You do have to wear long pants to get into the Gourmet restaurant, Japanese, Chinese and Caribbean restaurants. The beach was fabulous and plenty of chairs to go around. We only found one day that is was limited. There were plenty of activities around the pool bar during the day but would say if you are a younger couple looking for lots of entertainment than you should probably stay down the beach near the Bavaros up by the Majestic it is very quiet. A great place to relax or bring kids so they can enjoy the fabulous pool and not see things that they shouldn't. Don't get me wrong, there are topless women sunbathing. The rooms were very clean floors washed daily and beds changed daily, we would leave the maid 2 dollars a day. The shops at the resort did not have a lot of souvenirs as far as t-shirts and things to bring home for kids. We did walk to a place right outside the resort gate (very safe) called the hole in the wall. You really don't need to that because on Thursday night all the vendors come into the resort and set up tables and you can barter with them. We never made it to the disco so We cannot comment. We went to the Casino every night and a great time. I am not very good at Roulette. The resort itself was very well laid out and everything was very clean. The staff was great to deal with and tried very hard to understand, we never had any issues. We did two tours, the Bavarro Runners tour, which was just ok. We also did the Marinarium tour, which was a blast. The bus picked us up at the hotel and took us to the beach down by the Bavaro hotels about 15 minutes away, we got onto a Catamaran and went not far off shore and got to snorkel and swim with nurse sharks and stingrays. What a great experience. After that they took us down the beach to a natural sand bar and we all got off and they served us drinks in the water. After that we headed back to the beach. On the way back they were served drinks, we had dancing lessons and they showed us how to make a coco loco. The tours were not that expensive about $80.00 each per person. All in all it was a fabulous vacation and would recommend it to everyone. Feel free to email me with any questions. Not only was I viewing this as a guest but as a travel agent.

<Content>2 thumbs up across the board! After seven trips to Punta Cana, I guess we can be considered seasoned travellers, at least where the east coast of the Dominican Republic is concerned. Our vacation goals are simple: we want to relax, enjoy some good food and drink, and get a great tan. Our goals were met and exceeded at this 5 star resort. I emailed the hotel through their website (http://www.majesticcolonial.com) a few weeks prior to our trip to request a second floor or higher room that was close to the beach, and that was exactly what we got (our travel agent included a similar request when we booked). We were in room 4222 on the second floor. We faced a treed lot, but we actually had a pretty good view of the ocean from the balcony. We were about a minute from the beach and a few minutes walk from the front of the resort where the buffet and theatre are located. Our room was exactly as pictured on their website 鈥?soaker tub, 4 poster king-sized bed, etc. We had no problems with the bathroom/toilet set-up, but then, it was just the two of us. The bathrooms don鈥檛 seem to have been designed with families in mind 鈥?those with very small children would probably be okay, but families rooming with teenagers or older kids might find things a little awkward. The king sized bed was very comfortable, though the pillows were quite flat. Fortunately the hotel provides extras in the closet so the pillow situation was easily remedied. The closet afforded plenty of storage space and lots of hangers. The safe (keyless entry/programmable) was also stored in one of the closets. Our mini bar was refilled on a daily basis, and when we left a US dollar with a note for more beer and water (鈥渕as cervesas y agua, por favor鈥?, our request was met (not leaving the note and money resulted in the standard refill of 2 bottles each of Presidente and Pepsi, one bottle each of orange pop and diet Pepsi, and a few bottles of water). The oversized shower with 2 showerheads was awesome 鈥?we never had any problems with water pressure or with shortages of hot water, though the shower was quite slow to drain. I was very impressed with the grounds and landscaping, considering how new the resort is. I expected tiny palm trees and barely-there foliage; what I found were towering, mature trees and bushes in full bloom. In another year or so the grounds will be truly spectacular. Our tour rep told us that the resort was designed to encourage people to spread out, hence the sprawling pool that runs the length of the resort. The idea certainly worked 鈥?we were surprised to learn that the resort was at 100% capacity during our stay. The resort didn鈥檛 seem busy or crowded at all, and best of all, we never had to get up early to reserve chairs. We saw empty palapas at the pool as late as 10:30 a.m. The beach may have been a different story; we spent our mornings at the pool and most afternoons on the beach.I was thrilled with the quality and selection of food in the a la cartes and the main buffet restaurant. Hot foods were hot and cold foods were cold, and serving platters never sat empty for more than a minute before being refilled. Tables were cleared promptly and I don鈥檛 think I ever actually finished a drink in a restaurant because someone was always right there to top you up or get you a refill. We had breakfast each morning in the buffet restaurant. They offered the usual bacon, sausages, fruits, juices and pancakes, along with made to order crepes and omelettes. The omelettes were awesome and were cooked just right each morning. Be sure to grab a slice of the delicious banana bread, too; it disappears pretty quickly. A continental breakfast was offered at the beachfront restaurant after 10 a.m. so if you wanted to sleep in a bit, you weren鈥檛 out of luck for your morning meal. The lunch buffet was open from 12:30-3 p.m and offered an impressive spread of everything from French fries to ham carved off the bone. I鈥檓 not a big fan of pasta, but the made to order pasta station was awesome 鈥?I think I ate more pasta in one week than I have in a year. Reservations are required for the French/gourmet restaurant and the Japanese 鈥?the Caribbean, Chinese, Steakhouse and Seafood were all first come, first serve. We dined at all but the French (we had a reservation but cancelled it in favour of the steakhouse that night) and never had to wait more than 10 minutes to be seated. Make your a la carte reservatiosn as soon as you arrive at the hotel - before you go to your room, even! The reservation desk is directly across from the check-in counter, just outside of the clothing store on the upper level. Take whatever time they offer you for the Japanese restaurant 鈥?the resort holds 1300 people but can only accommodate 260 per week in the Japanese restaurant. The food presentation and atmosphere was incredible, and the portions were almost too big. The Chinese restaurant, located just outside the Japanese, had fantastic sushi 鈥?we popped in twice just for appetizers. The seafood restaurant was great but the portions were rather small (easily remedied by a visit to the buffet afterwards for more food or for dessert). We dined at the steakhouse twice and it was delicious both times 鈥?the chateaubriand was to die for. There is some confusion as to what is and is not included in the AI portion at this hotel. Room service is available but not included. After coming home I also learned that in-room, high-speed Internet is included but you鈥檒l pay a $10 US deposit if you don鈥檛 have the appropriate cables/hookups with you. Some premium/top shelf drinks carry an extra fee, though I was pleasantly surprised at the number of brand name liquors that were included in the AI. My better half enjoyed Johnny Walker Red Label with coke all week, and I saw Smirnoff and Jim Beam being poured frequently as well. If you wanted Johnny Walker Black Label or Canadian Club in your drink, that would cost you an extra $9 US, but really, if you鈥檙e going to mix it, why pay extra? House wines were included at all restaurants (the white was okay, the red tasted like homemade wine that needs a few more months to mature) and imported wines were available for purchase, too. Bavaro beach never disappoints in terms of beauty, and this section of beach was no exception ~ the sand was clean of sea debris and the water was crystal clear. There were some rocky patches in the swimming area, but the left side of the roped off section was much clearer with no rocks or sea grass. Snorkelling was quite good on this section of beach 鈥?we borrowed our friend鈥檚 goggles and were amazed at the variety of fish swimming beneath us. At the water sports hut on the beach, guests can borrow catamarans, kayaks, boogie boards, and windsurfing and snorkelling equipment; I believe each guest is allowed 1 hour per day to use such equipment. The pool is enormous and offered plenty of spots to just relax or get in on the fun offered by the Animation team. The section between the front lobby and the spa was typically quieter, while the area from the spa to the beach was more active and loud (this is where all the Animation activities took place). There is a huge warm pool with fountains and waterfalls just off the main pool behind the spa 鈥?this was a wonderful place to unwind at the end of the day (though we found that children tended to congregate in this pool since it was so warm). Saunas were also available in this area, along with cold and hot water Jacuzzi pools. The Majestic offers plenty of things to keep you entertained, whether you participate or are just a spectator. Aerobics and stretching were offered each morning on the beach, as well as soccer, volleyball as well as the typical silly games like coconut bowling and egg tossing contests. Water polo and aerobics took place in the pool, and things like arm wrestling contests, bingo, and Spanish lessons were offered poolside (made all the more amusing with generous doses of alcohol). Evening entertainment took place in the theatre and was your typical AI fare of audience participation shows and dance performances. The only show we attended was the Michael Jackson revue, which was quite well done. I didn鈥檛 enjoy the music so much but the dancing and special effects were impressive, particularly for Thriller. The resort offered a children鈥檚 movie early each evening in the theatre followed by a brief kids show on the stage. Friends told us that the daytime kids club was very good as well. Internet services were available off the main shopping street (hang a left after the medical centre) at a charge of $5 US per hour. We did not use the internet centre but were advised of the pricing by our tour rep. Of all the places we have stayed in Punta Cana, $5/hr is the cheapest I have ever heard of - much cheaper than phoning home just to say you've arrived and are having fun. The resort offers an air conditioned gym which I鈥檓 told is equipped with new, good quality machines 鈥?some treadmills and elliptical trainers, weight machines, free weights, etc. It opens at 7 a.m. each day and there is usually someone there to provide instruction for the machines if you need it. The activities sheet in our room also indicated that 鈥渋mpact walking鈥? light walks, and aerobics were conducted between 7-9 a.m. on a daily basis in the gym. The gym is located just past the shopping area, next to the casino/disco. We did not visit the casino or disco so I can鈥檛 comment much on that, though from the outside, the casino didn鈥檛 look very big. I hear the disco was quite the happening place to be later in the evening 鈥?unfortunately for us, those long days in the sun had us ready to turn in early most nights. The only 鈥渆xcursion鈥?we took part in was an outing to the local cigar manufacturer, Don Lucas cigars. This trip was completely free of charge 鈥?my kind of excursion! Our tour rep arranged our transportation, though the front desk of the hotel could probably also make the arrangements for you. The 鈥渇actory鈥?(it鈥檚 a very small setup) was probably 15 minutes from the resort, but because it was a busy traffic time when we went (around lunch time), it took us closer to 30 minutes to get there. After a brief demonstration of how the cigars are made, we went into the main shop where they also sell jewellery, artwork, coffee and alcohol. Anyone who was interested could sample a cigar, free of charge. We spent $82 at the shop; 4 packages of coffee cost us $20 US, a 700 mL bottle of Brugal Extra Viejo rum was $12 and Brandon got 4 cigars for $50/$12.50 a piece. They did have some Cohibas and other imports for sale, but they were not willing to barter on the prices so most people just picked up a few of the better Dominican brands. Dominican cigars on the resort were selling for $35 apiece, so I think the boys got a good deal on their smokes. One tip for the ladies (and probably for the men, too) 鈥?use the facilities at the hotel before venturing out on this trip. To put it nicely, the washrooms here were nowhere near as clean as at the hotel - if you have to go, do it before you leave or wait till you get back (I learned this the hard way). Shopping on the resort was typical of most AI hotels in the DR; prices were high and the shopkeepers didn鈥檛 have much wiggle room to bargain. I purchased a printed bandana type scarf to cover my hair for $7 US in one shop 鈥?I like to shop in peace so I didn鈥檛 mind paying that price (and I鈥檇 sunburnt my scalp so I was a little desperate). The store right on the end of the resort鈥檚 shopping street is the mini-market where you could purchase snacks, alcohol, post cards, and toiletries. I appreciated that the prices were marked in US dollars instead of pesos. A can of Pringles was $5, a 700 mL bottle of Brugal rum was $15.50, and coffee was $10. If you like to haggle and want more selection, there is a small strip mall type plaza near the hotel 鈥?I believe it is called Plaza Blanco. The fastest way to get there was to walk about 10 minutes from the front entrance of the hotel, then pass through the hole in the barrier wall (it鈥檚 marked with a sign indicating a shopping centre). Our friends picked up some t-shirts there for $5 a piece and Hawaiian-style shirts for $10 US a piece. We were told to pay between 20-40% of the vendor鈥檚 original asking price, but our friends also told us that some of the vendors really did not want to haggle on prices. Be prepared to walk away if you don鈥檛 feel you鈥檙e getting a good deal. Beach vendors were also located about an hour鈥檚 walk south of the resort toward the Gran Bahia and RIUs. We never ventured that far down the beach so I can鈥檛 comment on the shopping there. I have to say that the service at the Majestic was just fantastic. We had very few problems/complaints but those that we did bring to their attention, such as our balcony door not locking right, were fixed within one hour. All of the staff that we encountered, from groundskeepers to the general manager, Jorge, whom I had the pleasure of meeting one evening, were very friendly and seemed intent on ensuring that we had a good experience at their hotel. I was very impressed to learn from our tour rep that the Majestic is one of the few hotels in the region that offers daily lessons in English and hospitality training for their employees. I would often ask a question in (my very limited) Spanish and receive an answer in English 鈥?the staff seemed to be working hard to make use of their schooling! In almost all cases, service in the restaurants and bars was always fast and provided with a smile. The staff worked hard to keep their respective areas in tip-top condition; I was especially impressed with how clean all of the washrooms were, especially those near the pool and beach. I should also note here that the resort seemed very wheelchair friendly. There were elevators in the front lobby area to take you from the main check-in level to the lower level which accessed the rest of the resort. Each block of rooms also had at least one elevator that serviced all floors. I noticed many wheelchair accessable ramps throughout the resort as well, and walkways were tiled in a flat enough manner that getting around on wheels does not seem like it would have been an inconvenient journey.A word on staying healthy: please remember to pack your common sense when visiting anywhere in the Caribbean. Guests rarely get sick from the food in the Dominican Republic. More often, they become ill because they try to consume everything in sight during their first 2 days of vacation. Add to this 8-10 hours a day in the scorching sun, often without adequate sunblock, and almost always without sufficient hydration and yes, you鈥檙e going to get sick. The buffet and the bar will be there tomorrow 鈥?you don鈥檛 have to try everything on your first day. The sun will also be there tomorrow, so apply that sunscreen with a generous hand and you鈥檒l have a much more enjoyable vacation. Toss in a bottle of water after every couple of drinks and you鈥檙e good to go. I ate everything that appealed to me at the restaurants, including salads twice a day, and probably drank my weight in a variety of alcoholic drinks, and never experienced any form of sickness (neither of us needed even a single dose of Immodium all week 鈥?that鈥檚 a first). We were also careful to apply SPF 30 every 2-3 hours, and were sure to chug a bottle of water after every couple of alcoholic drinks. Your holiday is what you make of it 鈥?if you play it smart, you鈥檒l stay healthy and enjoy yourself a whole lot more!To sum up, we were thrilled with the Majestic Colonial and highly recommend it for anyone wanting a top-notch vacation in Punta Cana. If anyone has questions or would like to see photos of the hotel, you鈥檙e welcome to contact me via email at ginnyfyris@yahoo.ca Happy travels!

<Author>wildcorndogs
<Content>Relaxing week at the Majestic My husband and I stayed at the majestic April 17-24. This is the 5th all-inclusive we have visited, and our second time to Punta Cana. Overall, we were pleased with the resort and would recommend it to anyone going to PC. For the specifics:The Beach-Very nice. Beautiful clear water, pretty decent snorkeling right off the beach. Even on days when the weather was less than perfect and the waves were a little stronger it still seemed safe to swim. On better weather days the water was pretty calm. Just be careful venturing outside of the roped off areas as boats occasionally buzzed by kind of close. Beach area in front of the resort was kept clean, and there were lots of palaps for shade although you had to reserve one early in the day or come back later in the afternoon.The Pool-As most have said, it was very large, beautiful and clean. Probably my second favorite pool of all the resorts we have been to. It had a large swim up bar. Service there could be a little slow, but we gave a two dollar tip one day and our drinks never reached empty the rest of the day without being refilled.The Room-Rooms were a good size, with a sleeper sofa and desk on one side and bed on the other. Minibar had soda, water and 2 beers, and was restocked every day. We tipped and asked for more beer in the fridge since there were only two small bottles, and they brought 2 more. Fridge wasn't extremely cold but that wasn't a problem since they provided an ice bucket and had ice machines close to the rooms. A bottle of champagne and a small bottle of rum were also in the room the first day. (Also included) Others have covered the bathroom situation, so you already know how that goes. The room was kept clean and we did not have any bugs of any kind in our room during our stay. The room we were originally assigned was a first floor Majestic Suite with the jacuzzi outside. The outside jacuzzi was the same size as the inside one, and you were only steps away from the pool so everyone could watch you relax in your outside jacuzzi. I told our vacation rep I was not happy with this since I had told my travel agent I wanted anything BUT the first floor, and the front desk staff worked with us and put us in a great ocean front second floor room instead. We saw almost no bugs at the resort in general, but did see a lot of little worms that looked like small centipedes on the first floor. The a/c in the rooms was set not to go below 19 degrees centigrade, and I found that a little uncomfortable for sleeping, but no big deal. They do offer room service, but it costs extra and was pretty pricey (a hot dog was $8, a hamburger was $10-it got worse from there).The Resort Layout-This was a mid-sized resort compared to others we had been to, and we had no trouble getting around. Our room was at the opposite end of the resort from the lobby and most of the restaraunts, but the walk was not bad at all. They also had several elevators in the hallways and two in the lobby, so getting around did not seem to be bad for people who have problems with stairs. Walkways from the rooms to the main lobby and most of the restaurants were covered, which came in handy when it rained.Food-As others have mentioned, you shouldn't expect fabulous food every day at any AI. The food here was good. I liked it better than my husband, but there was a lot to choose from and we liked that you only had to make reservations for two of the ala cartes. We were able to get reservations at both the Japanese and Gourmet. I liked the Japanese, and the Gourmet was o.k. I ordered the filet there and am not quite sure what I got, but it wasn't a filet. Still it was a decent steak. The seafood and steak house are the same place divided in half at night. We ate at the steakhouse part one night and received the slowest service of any place at the resort, but the food was pretty good. We went to the seafood side a few nights later and received the best service of our stay, so you can never tell how it will go. My husband had the lobster and said it was very good. We are pretty brave and tried just about everything from goat to octopus pizza, and neither of us got sick while we were there, which is rare for me because I have some stomach issues anyway. The breakfast buffet was really good, and the self-serve mimosas were a good way to start the day!Casino-The casino was small, but had several slot machines, a roulette table, blackjack and poker. Everyone seemed to enjoy it, and we saw a woman win over $500 on a nickle slot machine one night. Drinks were included at the casino.Service-Overall the service was better than I expected here. We had been to the DR 5 years ago and found the staff at the last resort slightly unfriendly and the service was very slow. I went expecting this again, so I was pleasantly surprised. Every request we made was granted, from changing rooms to extra pillows to extra beer for the fridge. There were some problems with the language barrier, but we were patient and they were patient and we eventually always ended up getting what we needed. Some problems that people had earlier in the year have been resolved. There is now a daily schedule of events at the front of the resort outside of the lobby bar, so you know what will be going on that day and what the show will be that night. They also gave everyone a booklet with a map that listed the restaurants and their hours when we checked in so we knew where everything was from the start.Shopping-There were a few small shops at the resort and they are making a few more. They brought vendors in to the resort to set up booths on Thursday night so there was more to choose from but you had to do the ever popular haggling. We visited the shopping plaza outside and to the right of the front entrance of the resort, (through the hole in the wall and were able to buy things cheaper there than at the resort. I only gave the Majestic 4 out of five stars because I feel that to be a five star room service should be included, and you should be able to adjust the a/c to a comfortable temperature, not one they have set for you since everybody is different. The other thing the resort is lacking is service at the beach and poolside. While I don't mind to get up and get myself a drink, others did seem to mind. It was a little bit of a hike to get from the beach to the closest bar. Empty drink cups sometimes sat around the pool for too long since there was no service around the pool and not many trash cans (we threw ours away, but some people are really lazy you know),and some of them ended up in the pool a few times. (This did not happen very often, don't get the idea that the pool was dirty). None of these things is the end of the world, just small improvements that could be made to elevate the resort to 5 star status in my opinion. I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants to go and relax and enjoy the great pool, beautiful beach and friendly staff.If anyone has any questions, feel free to e-mail and ask and I will be happy to try to help. If you have already booked a vacation at this resort, relax-you will have a great time!

<Author>dclaker
<Content>4 star hotel, some 1 star guests Went with 2 adults and our 3 children ages 9-13 and we had a great time. The weather was great ( a lttle rain here and there) but overall, great weather so that helped. To reply to earlier comments:Staff -- friendly and helpful. I never would have retrieved my lost luggage from the airport without the help of guest services who put through many many calls on my behalf. People don't speak English???? I tried to speak spanish, but no one would let me. The only spanish I spoke was to spanish speaking guests. One complaint was that staff tried so hard to be nice, that they really didn't enforce any rules with rude guests.Rooms -- Clean. Definitely damp-- particularly if you don't keep the AC on at all times. (Once the maid turned it off and all of our clothes for the evening felt wet) One of our rooms had the musty beach smell, and the other had it intermittently. I wish they could find a good dehumidifier solution to the problem!We had a different maid every day it seemed, but never had towel art, though I saw it in many other rooms. But the rooms were cleaned and we always had enough supplies-- towels, soap, water (which is brought by another person, not the maid, and it is generally brought much later in the day). Never, never saw a misquito during the entire trip, though there was a bee in my room on the last day. They spray nearly every night and cut the foliage beside the hotel to curtail insects. We did get bites, but only on our feet, so we suspect it was sand fleas or something. Because of the way the rooms were set up, we didn't really have a big problem with the open bathroom configuration. Some rooms may be set up differently, so maybe it does make a difference in them. I wasn't happy initially about the open toilet set up, but it turned out to be a much better solution, providing for better ventilation. The WC itself was no smaller than many I've seen in Europe, the advantage to this one being the ventilation.OH! and be careful when you put your belongings in the closets. In some rooms, the last closet contains an electrical panel which the workmen open from outside the room and never seem to close up again. Came home more than once to find my daughter's closet open to the hallway with all of her clothing exposed. Beach -- gorgeous. Found exactly three large shards of glass, all under trees which the perpetrators obviously had to use to break their beer bottles. Otherwise, very very clean, though I did get odd pieces of coral, palm slivers and shells in my feet. Be there by 7 to get a chair, or give up until after two. We sat near the volleybal court and found the exercise and game gurus to be great fun. Lots of topless women, so if that bothers you, stick with the pool.Pool -- beautiful. Yes, there is a problem with the concrete. Not sure how they will deal with this. they'll have to close it down for a while to fix it. Food -- we loved it. The fruit was absolutely amazing. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Always have a great vacation! We always have a great time on vacation - we have that mindset b/c we pay too much money to go to complain and find fault. We were at majestic from March 20 to April 3. After reading every review since the place opened, I have finally decided to write a review - my first. In short, Majestic was beautiful, but way missing some little things and in time may get it all together. The rooms, grounds, common areas, beach, pool, were absolutely gorgeous - but it is evident things were rushed to open in time and the resort will probably have some maintenance problems in a short time! From reading the recent reviews, it seems everyone had the same problem we had with the leaking toilet stall on rainy nights. Someone didn't finish the vents properly, and now they are all leaking. We put our umbrella over the crapper and left it there for the housekeeping staff - next time it rained we did not leak!!Shopping - many people have mentioned the flea market down the beach, but there is also one - about 30 shops- just outside the Majestic gates. Just follow the road you came in on (off reception area)to the gate - 5 to 10 minute walk - lots to choose from and good bargaining.Food- we always enjoyed breakfast at the buffet but only had one lunch and one dinner there. Found the food about the same as any buffet - we are not real buffet fans - brakfast was great when you got it grilled to order - omellets, eggs anyway, crepes and pancakes. We mostly ate at the a la carte restaurants - the Chinese 4 times - it was great food and great service and you didn't need reservations. A lot of people we talked to did not know it was even there. It was in the same door as the Japanese, in the outer area. We also loved the French restaurant - le Gourmet. If you go and see Danny - the head waiter - tell him the lobsterfisherman from Canada says hello! They treated us like royalty with special soup and special dessert that were not on the menu . And I will say that we are not big tippers - a couple dollars left on the table after a nice meal - and our pockets full of candy for any of the staff that waited on us. The Dominicians are wonderful, friendly, hardwarking people. We went to the Mexican 2 nights - also no reservations required - it was OK, but we are not Mexican food fans - I had the fajitas and found them good except too salty. We went to the steak house once and had blood red chateaubrian after ordering medium well, so didn't go back - it was also very busy that night and the service wasn't great although the head waiter was actually timing the orders from when taken to delivered, but he seemed very tense with the wait staff and the atmosphere was not as relaxed as you like on vacation. I found myself feeling sorry for the people working under his thumb. Did not try the seafood as lobster is something we have at home and the Dominician lobster is nothing like our Bay of Fundy lobster. Went to the japanese once and really enjoyed the experience of eating at close proximity to 8 other people and getting to know them while the chef did his thing right in front on you. The food was OK but enjoyed the Chinese much better. Anyway as you can see, we did a lot of eating. Make coffe in your room, it is wicked in the buffet - poured thick like molasses! I always stay away from drinks with coconut milk to avoid Carribean revenge! Other than that we ate everything and were never sick.One thing I will comment on that noone seems to have mentioned is the music in the lobby and buffet restaruant! CLASSIC!! on a Caribbean vacation?? I even heard TAPS several times in the restaurant and this terrible TUBA or something in the lobby. Not the right mood for us - maybe they are trying to be upscale to fit with the 5 star rating!! The only time we heard any upbeat music was during the arobics and games on the beach and around the pool.Our first room was 44ll and the elevator did not, does not, and probably will never work. It was 54 steps to our room and our middle age legs grew very sore and tired. After our second day and second inquiry at guest services we were taken to a beautiful room right on the beach, second floor, corner room. If you played volleyball and looked up to the first room you could see, that was us! So stick to your guns if you have a legitimate problem with your room and you will be moved. The rooms had everything you could want, huge shower and tub, lots of hot water and pressure, double sinks - bring your own soap and shampoo and the water is very hard do you need a good quality soap (and facecloths) - mini bar with water, pop, beer everyday, coffee pot, iron, ironing board, good size TV, coach, King bed, patio with 2 chairs and table, lots of storage room and very quiet. We also had extra pillows in our closet but some people had to ask for more. And, oh yes,champagne - we had 2 bottles as we changed rooms. Also champagne in the buffet - have it with orange juice in the morning.I am not going to add to the comments on the beach - that is what has taken us back to the Domincian each year for 3 years. Just gorgeous for miles in both directions. We did need to play the towel game the second week, as it was quite busy, but the first week there was no trouble getting lounges. The Majestic desperately needs a couple of bar huts on the beach. It is a long trek from the bottom of the beach to the top, across the road, up two flights of stairs to the beach restaurant/bar for a thirsty tourist!In summation - Majestic was very good, probably will not go back as there are so many other places to see. Last year we were at Grand Palladium , about 5 miles down the beach, and we would go back there in a heartbeat, but I think it will be Jamacia next year! Got to start reading more reviews! CHOW!Any questions you may e-mail us at peggym@nb.sympatico.ca

<Author>CharlotteTRAV
<Content>Great Vacation - Excellent Food, Location  My wife and I have traveled extensively, we are used to dining in quality restaurants both at home and when we travel, and while we usually prefer to stay in normal hotels and eat in restaurants outside the hotel, we have stayed at several all-inclusives in the Playa del Carmen area of Mexico ranging from mid-range to high-end. This was our first trip (March 25-April 1)to an all-inclusive in the Dominican Republic.There have been a lot of reviews posted about the Majestic Colonial, and savvy readers of TripAdvisor reviews should be able to glean something approximating the truth from them. Our experience at the Majestic was pretty much what we expected after reading these reviews. We are really picky, and we loved our stay at this hotel.People who dislike this hotel likely fall into one of two categories: 1)those who may have had some type of unusual problem while there and 2) those who simply cannot be happy. The food at this hotel is excellent - by far the best we have had at an all-inclusive. Piles of smoked salmon every morning at breakfast, locally grown vegetables and fruits that taste 10 times better than the trucked-in ones we can get at home (especially in the winter), and uniformly good seafood, duck, chicken, lamb, goat, and pork (I can't speak to the beef, as I didn't try any) were available at the Majestic. Perhaps those who are unhappy with the food did not try the many inventive preparations available -- highlights for us were the grilled shrimp filet that my wife had in the French restaurant and the Peking Duck that I had in the Asian restaurant (for which you do not need reservations unless you want to see the Japanese show). The local Dominican specialties in the Dominican restaurant (and in the buffet) are also a highlight. Try eating some foods that are outside your normal routine and you will be happy at the Majestic. Best of all, unlike any other all-inclusive we've ever been to, we never had to wait for anything (well, there was a short line for the omelette station at breakfast, but there were 8 types of egg dishes including pre-made omelettes available without waiting). I don't know where the people who complain about this place being crowded are coming from. On our one rainy day during the week, when pretty much everyone at the hotel was at breakfast at the same time, there were empty tables in the buffet restaurant. At night, we never ate in a restaurant that was more than half-full. The tables are so far from one another (compared to tables in a normal restaurant) that we were never bothered by even noisy conversation at the next table. Even at the buffet, staff circulate pouring wine at every meal - there's champaigne at breakfast. Service at the hotel is top-notch. Everyone is super-friendly and helpful. My wife and I both felt the staff was a major plus at this resort. True, not everyone speaks perfect English (or German or Italian or French - as there are many European guests here), but the frontline staff do pretty well with it. Try a little Spanish just for fun.The beach is great. The pool is great. The rooms are beautiful. The jacuzzi tub in the room is deep and comforable for two. The lobby with bars and live music is great. Great news about the bars, too. Apparently the management of the hotel reads these posts. Gordon's gin and Smirnoff vodka are now available at all bars as part of the all-inclusive. The local rum is actually very good, especially the dark one. I also had a nice Spanish brandy every night, again all-inclusive. The drawbacks that keep us from giving this five stars have been mentioned several times in other postings. The mattresses are super-hard. I like firm, but these are killers. The hotel should put some foam padding on them, at the least. The bathrooms give no privacy - I spent some waiting time on the porch due to this, which was actually pleasant. Finally, and I think this is an easily fixable problem, the availability of decent food between the hours of 3:30 and 6:30 p.m. needs to be addressed. We arrived at the hotel very hungry and the only food available was at the beach restaurant. There were hotdogs and hamburgers (which my wife and I do not eat) and a few finger sandwiches with flies all over them (the wind was still that day). I strongly suggest that one of the indoor restaurants stay open all afternoon to accomodate newly arrived guests (as the Dominican stays open all night to accomodate guests arriving in the early hours of the morning). This is a nice hotel. I would go back in a second. There are a few drawbacks, but they are all (with the exception of the bathroom privacy) easily fixed by the hotel management - and I am sure they will be. If you are thinking about going to the Majestic, by all means go. You will have a great vacation.
