<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it... Just returned on Sunday March 26th after a one week stay with my husband. Thought the resort grounds and rooms were beautiful...and of course the weather was perfect. An ocean breeze kept the beach very comfortable to lay out in the sun without sweating. The water was refreshing.Here's some information I wish I had left home with in regards to the room selection. I had some info, but not quite enough. The 2000 series rooms face the pool, and if you sit out on your balcony in the morning, you will have the sun directly on you. If you prefer an inside room, but would rather have the afternoon sun, then the 3000 series rooms are for you. They are on the opposite side of the grounds and have a more indirect view of the pool, but are still nice. In my opinion, this would be the ideal room to request..... An upper level room (I say upper level because some areas only go to a 3rd level where others go to a 4th). The upper level rooms have vaulted (cathedral) ceilings which make them that much more beautiful. Also ask for an outside or end room closest to the ocean or at least on the ocean side vs. the lobby side. This will provide you not only with a front view from your balcony but a side view as well. Just that much more of a view.We initially were given a 4th floor garden view room. The room was beautiful, but sitting out on the balcony overlooked a wooded lot next door. Not ugly, just nothing to look at.One day my husband and I ventured outside the hotel entrance to the shops. I know you have to negotiate with these vendors as they start with ridiculously high prices. A souvenir spoon (which I typically have paid $5 - $6 everywhere I've been) started at $23. I managed to get them down to $10, which was still too high so I walked away from two of them. Really wanting the spoon, I finally gave in and bought from the third vendor for the $10. When we returned to the hotel, I found the same exact spoon in the hotel gift shop for the same price...$10. In my opinion, it wasn't worth the hassle of negotiating for the same price, unless you really enjoy that type thing. The vendors that came into the hotel on Thursday evening where also priced very high with room to negotiate, but I still wasn't impressed with their prices, even after walking away. They are all somewhat pushy and anxious to show their stuff. All tables seem to carry somewhat the same merchandise.We tried all the restaurants except the fish which shares the same roof as the Rodeo steak house near the beach. My husband wasn't impressed with the quality cut of sirloin he ordered. After ordering it medium it was delivered rare-raw. He sent it back and it came back still rare, but he ate it anyway. He's very picky with regards to fat or gristle in his meat so wasn't pleased. I would have to say that was his worst experience all week. No other complaints about the food..everything we had was very good to excellent, including the Filet Mignon at Le Gourmet. Although it wasn't typical of what we are use to at home. The cut was more the thickness of a sirloin steak and was served with brown mushroom gravy. Still excellent though.There was some slight communication issues, but we went there fully expecting that. They certainly would not prevent me from returning.

<Author>HankWil74
<Content>5 Star Sometimes, 1 Star others My fiance and I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana, and though we had a good time, it could have been a whole lot better. I'm going to break down different aspects of the resort, and hopefully you will find this helpful.Room - The room itself is beautiful, all marble and very spacious. The double sink is very nice, as is the oversize shower built for the 2 and the jacuzzi is wonderful. It made the room have a very honeymoonish feel. The layout is a little revealing, but for a couple it is perfect. However, if you have kids, I would not recommend this resort, as the layout of the room is not very condusive to having any privacy. Another negative about the room is the bed, which is a ROCK! I like a firm bed, but this was like sleeping on the floor, and the pillows are extremely cheap and thin. Beach - The beach is beautiful, very spacious, and the water is gorgeous. There are a lot of chairs, but lots of people play the towel game, which is annoying, so if you want a spot in the shade, you might want to get out there early and drop a towel or two on some chairs. Personally, I just asked people at the beach if anyone was using the chairs with towels on them, and if they said no, those towels got tossed. I recommend doing the same.Pool - The pool is very nice and seemingly endless, and though some people have complained about the noise, there are very few times where loud activities are going on, and the pool is big enough that you can go to one end and never hear anything. The Pool has a bar and a swim-up bar, but one major negative about the pool is that it closes at 6pm. With temperatures still in the 80's well past 6pm (and no part of the pool is deeper than 4 1/2 feet), I saw no reason why the pool wouldn't be open until 11pm. Also the jacuzzi is just an extension of the pool with jets attached, and not a hot tub.Bars - The bars are plentiful and it is never hard to get a drink, but as a previous reviewer remarked, there just doesn't seem to be any management/supervision of any of the bar staff. The staff is friendly enough, but their drink-making knowledge leaves much to desire. Also, the bars do not have cranberry or pineapple juice, making many tropical concoctions impossible to make, which I found extremely annoying. Lastly, the all-inclusive tag only applies to rail liquor, as anything above cheap dominican rum and vodka costs much american dollars ($10 for Grey Goose on the rocks)Food - On a scale of 1 to 10, I would give the food a 3, and that is generous. My fiance and I stayed for 6 days and by day 4, we literally dreaded going to eat. Every meal we ate after day 4 we left with a slight stomach ache, which makes it hard to enjoy the rest of the resort. Breakfast and lunch are both only available at the buffet, which never changes their spread. You can get by on fruit and donuts, but pretty much everything else is pretty nasty. The omelets taste funny as the cheese used isn't real cheese (I don't think there is any milk in the cheese they use) but some sort of disgusting cheese made of filler. Lunch isn't much better, as the cold cut tray and cheese tray that has been sitting out for 2 hours doesn't do much to whet the appetite. Dinner is the easiest meal to eat, as there are different restaurants to choose from, though the Japanese restaurant always seems to be booked (though if you go when it opens, there are usually spaces open later in the evening. The French restaurant is supposed to be the best, but I found the filet mignon to be comparable to a subpar London Broil and the duck appetizer tasted like old liverwurst. I recommend sticking to the Caribbean restaurant (fajitas) and the steakhouse (the pork chops) as those are at least edible. Entertainment - Subpar is how I would describe it. The nightly shows are slightly entertaining, but there is really nothing going on during the day whereas other resorts I've stayed at had well organized trivia games, water polo games, volleyball games and things of that nature. This resort had none of that. Also, the casino doesn't open until 8pm, and the blackjack rules give the house even more of an edge (they don't check for blackjack with an ace or a face showing, making it impossible to double on an 11 vs. a face card or an ace... a major disadvantage if you're a basic strategy kind of blackjack player)Overall, I would compare this resort to an incredibly beautiful dumb girl. You'll love it the first couple of days, as the beauty of the resort will overwhelm you, but as you dig a little deeper, you'll become bored with the lack of substance underneath the initial beauty.

<Content>Improvement still needed I just returned from a 10 day stay at the Majestic. Whether you are a couple, a family or just friends traveling together, everyone likes a certain amount of privacy in the bathroom. The food was ok though somewhat repetitive on the buffets. New plants were being added and new topsoil applied, so that should improve over time.Entertainment was very amateurish. The people that we spoke to re the excursions said that more time was spent on the bus than at the destination, so we decided not to go on any.Shopping was limited to the flea market which came one day and at the hotel gift shops. The items in the gift shops were very expensive. The single worse thing about this resort was the quality of the construction. This place has only been open since December and we witnessed tiles missing from the bathrooms, chipped marble in the showers, broken concrete on the pool decks. I mention the construction, as I wonder about safety and comfort for future guests. If this is to be a 5 star resort with expensive rates, they will have to deal with this asap.

<Content>Great resort and beautiful beach I returned from the Majestic Colonial March 11. I stayed there for a week with my husband and another couple, all late twenties/early thirties. We loved the resort and would return again. The room was very spacious and we didn't mind the open concept although the toilet could be more private. Unfortunately we had a room with 2 double beds instead of a king but I think my husband was secretly pleased with this so he could stretch out by himself. There were no face clothes available.We ate at all of the restaurants. Our friend called his experience a gastronomical delight and we all enjoyed most of the food. Buffets all good, Japanese/Chinese good, gourmet only OK, steak good, seafood only OK. Our Transat vacation rep advised us that the only thing that would make us sick was eating too much and getting out of our usual food habits and she was right. By the end of the week I was stuffed to the brim, but not sick- just too many freshly fried donuts.The beach was wonderful. The sand is fine and the water warm. There was snorkeling offshore and the waves were fun to play in. There were lots of palapas and palm trees for shade. We walked 30 minutes (briskly) to the market on the beach which had the usual touristy type of goods for sale.The pool was long and not too crowded. The section of pool by the bar closer to the beach was loud in the afternoon from the entertainment team and games but the other sections were fine. The swim up bar was never too crowded.Overall, we really enjoyed the resort. The buildings are all very large, open and airy. We found the staff was attentive and friendly. For a resort with 600 rooms, we found the crowds to be well controlled and dispersed well (wonder if filled to capacity yet). We paid $1300 CDN pp for the week and felt that was a good deal. I could see this trip costing $500-$1000 more in the future when the resort matures.

Overall, the resort, beach and staff are all excellent, and when fully matured, this resort will definately represent what a five star should be.

<Author>Tall-Beach
<Content>Had a Great Time My boyfriend and I stayed here from February 12th to the 19th, and we had a wonderful,relaxing vacation.The pool is absolutely beautiful, and is never too crowded, but I am very much more of a beach person. For the first few days, we got up early and put our towels on the beach, but we decided that was a waste of time, as you could go down there and find chairs whenever you wanted. The beach was incredible, the nicest I've ever seen (this was my first trip to the Dominican, but I have been to Puerto Vallarta, Cancun and Mazatlan in Mexico) and it raked and cleaned throughout the day.The food was for the most part very good. I am a very picky eater, and I didn't have a problem finding things that I liked to eat. There were a few things that I was hesitant to try however. I didn't attempt to make any reservations until day 4 of our 7 day vaction. I was unable to get us into the Japanese restaurant, but we did get into the Gourmet on our last night, and our meal was fantastic. (I had the lobster au gratin, and my boyfriend had the fillet minion). The only meal we didn't enjoy was at the Chinese restaurant.We were very happy with our room, which was poolside. It was room 2122, and was across from the spa. This was a good location because it was about half way inbetween two bars, and was very quiet. We didn't use the jacuzzi tub on our terrace as, the plants aren't grown up enough to give any privacy, but we did make use of the one inside our room. The open bath concept, or lack or wash cloths weren't an issue for us.The service staff was very friendly and eager to help. There was a little bit of a language barrier, but you have to expect that. If you give them the odd tip, they are even more accomidating. We drank all of our mixed drinks with top shelf liquor and we were never charged.Anybody who complained about the mosquitos,obviously hasn't spent any time in North Western Ontario. I think I killed 4 in the week we were there. The fitness centre had very nice equiptment, and good work out music playing. I also went and had a massage at the spa which was very nice, with average pricing.My boyfriend and I snorkeled on most days, and saw tons of fish just out in front of the resort. He also went fishing one day. He didn't catch anything, but had fun trying. We went off of the resort one night for supper at Captain Cook's which was fantastic. It was $110 US for the 2 of us. That included our cab ride there (not back), a huge seafood platter that we couldn't even finish, our drinks, appetizers, and desserts. Oh yeah, they gave us a shot of mama juana too. They call it Dominican Viagra, but it just made me very sleepy.We had a great trip. The resort was beautiful, and in another year, it will be amazing. Don't worry about all the negative reviews that were posted earlier. You'll have a great time.

<Author>Over_50
<Content>How can you complain? My husband and I had a goal to find a beautiful beach somewhere we had never been and have a very relaxing week away from work's pressures. The Majestic Colonial certainly filled the bill. We had anxiously watched its progress from not ready to its present state and can honestly say we weren't at all disappointed. The Majestic Colonial finally made it!We experienced NO problems with the room, hot water, smells, spoiled food and foreign language of the staff - and we stayed in the cheapest room category. We were able to get into the restaurants we wanted (just make reservations ASAP when you arrive!) and had a lot of variety in the buffets, too. The landscaping is not mature, as many have mentioned, but certainly isn't ugly. There were no bugs that bothered us, and the weather was unrelentingly beautiful. Tipping wasn't necessary to receive excellent service, either, although we thanked many favorite staff members on our way out.We didn't need to make one complaint or request from the front desk during our entire stay; I think that says alot! The only thing keeping this from being a 5 star hotel (in my humble estimation)is the inclusion of all brands of liquor in the all-inclusive list. Based on what I've written here, we may very well go back to the Majestic Colonial next year.

Bottled water everywhere. Rooms were clean; resort was clean. This is a new resort and will reach a 5 star in about a year's time after their landscapes and staff have matured. Beautiful beaches.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A beautiful restful vacation My sister and I just returned (Feb 9th - Feb 16th) from staying for the first time in the Dominican Republic and at the newly opened Majestic Colonial. We were nervous before we went down about the newness of the resort so we took great comfort in reading the reviews that people had taken time to write so I am returning the favour.We found the property to be beautiful and well kept. The pool is stunning although we spent most of the time at the beach. There was no fighting for beach chairs and If you had your things out by 8 or 8:30am you could always manage to find a place and an umbrella for shade. The beach is stunning and great to walk. Our one caution is that you not pass Breezes (two hotels up) but head the other way towards the beach shopping and the major hotels. A German couple that we sat beside at dinner had been attacked and robbed of their video camera at 1pm in the afternoon on the relatively secluded beach that seems to go on for miles north of the developped area. Apparently it is not a common occurence but they were still quite shaken up. You won't have any problems if you stay where the rest of the vacationers are so that is our helpful hint. We did walk that way twice and enjoyed the solitude but after that story we chose to stay on the safe side. The hotels all have security on the property and you are never hassled while enjoying your time on the beach.Our room was on the 4th floor with a spectacular view of the ocean and beautiful sunrises as well (4420). People seem to suggest that the better rooms face the pool but we beg to differ. I would suggest to see your room first before you ask for a change.The staff was charming, helpful and extremely friendly. The breakfast buffet was endless and delicious and the coffee is grown locally and is fabulous (hot milk and hot coffee mixed).The guests were a very international mix of Spanish, French, Canadian (French and English speaking), German, and American which gave the week a very global and interesting angle.We tipped $2 u.s. everyday for the room and brought lots of singles with us so we wouldn't have to worry about getting change. I understand that the employeed (waitstaff) don't make much more than $300.00 a month so they always appreciate the extra gesture. My bartender always filled up a large thermos with my favorite beverage to take to the beach. You are wise to bring thermal liquid holders as the drinks melt before you get them back to your beach chair (oh the big problems of vacations!!)The food was very good and we enjoyed the Dominican restaurant and the local fare. I will tell you that we did bring immodium with us and only had to take two tablets on our last night. It certainly didn't ruin our vacation, but it is wise to pack a sleeve or two in case.In closing, a beautiful property with wonderful service in a comfortable setting. My sister and I would recommend the Majestic for your vacation and we certainly wouldn't hesitate to let you know if we felt differently. We appreciate everyone who took the time to help us make our decision and we hope we help out future travellers by writing this review.Hasta la proxima

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would have been perfect had we not gotten the stomach thing.... Overall, the Majestic is working towards becoming a 5 star. We traveled the week of 2/10-2/17. After reading many reviews we were nervous going down, but the accomadations were great. We had a great room overlooking the pool (Rm 2206) When we were getting ready at night we could enjoy a cocktail on our balcony and listen to the jazz music. We tipped, but still did not receive the champagne, flowers, or animal towels and think that it just depends on your maid. She did the standard-changed our sheets daily, left us clean towels and stocked fridge. We had a plumbing leak when we checked in but they were quick to resolve it the first day and had no other problems ,though we heard many guests complaining about their plumbing issues so we were lucky. The pool was great! by far one of the best pools in the Carribean. There were quiet areas or you could sit near the pool bar side and get more into the entertainment. Much of the cement is coming up, which is too bad for a new resort. We went for many walks onthe beach but did not bother trying to lie out during the day (many days were too windy). Worth the 1 1/2 hour walk to the bartering shops on the beach, it was just fun to see and the art work is great.The Food and Drinks--we think the food was excellent. We had great meals in all the restaurants and we made a point to try them all. Our favorite was the the breakfast buffet, Le Gourmet (make a reservation) and the Japanese (reservation). The drinks were fair, depending on the bartender. They did not use quality alcohol. The only beer they had was Presidente which is similar to Natural Light. The shelf alcohol they use makes it tough to have a rum/coke or gin/tonic. We tried many of their concoctions which helped mask the poor quality of booze. The Majestic sunset became our favorite and some tenders made it on the rocks and others made it as a frozen drink so you never knew what you were going to get. Entertainment--we enjoyed some of the nights. we enjoyed the outdoor pool tables and chess. For the late night, the night club was fun. The Majestic staff was on hand teaching us to Latin dance, try that at midnight after many Majestic Sunset drinks!!The worst part of our trip was getting sick. We had to stay close to our room for an entire day. We were not alone, the couples we had met were in worse shape than us. We got off easy. Driving back to the airport, a full bus of 30+ of us we were comparing stories of who had the intestinal bug the worst. Not sure if it was something going around our resort only, but the Majestic was hit hard that week. We were lucky that we did not have to pay for medical attention (min. $90 for eval. and $150+ for treatment and medications). We will not return to the Dominican any time soon, just for fear of being sick again. The stomach pains were too severe for us to want to relive.If you have a tough stomach lining and want a quiet, restful vacation, this is definately the spot to consider.

<Author>Dee809
<Content>Great Vacation My husband and I celebrated our 30th anniversary at the Majestic Colonial. It is a beautiful facility; we had an oceanfront suite, and it was worth it. As others have said, the bathroom situation would be awkward for families or individuals traveling together. Our suite was well taken care of by the staff; we left a $2 tip per day and a small item (scented soap, lotion, etc.), and our maid was so grateful. Bugs: If you are bitten by bugs at home, expect the same thing there. No more - no less. Be sure to take your own bug spray; it costs $20 in the gift shop.Food: We were unable to get reservations at the Japanese restaurant, and we checked on it immediately after arrival. We only stayed 4 nights though. Reservations are also required at Le Gourmet. This restaurant was excellent. The breakfast buffets were very good. At almost any time there is some kind of food available and no one should go hungry. If you want snack type foods, I would recommend taking your own. Drinks: We drank the champagne in the mini fridge and were not charged. As stated by some, there is an extra charge for some drinks at the bars. We stayed with the ones included. We took thermal mugs for our drinks to take to the beach; the drinks stayed cold and the sand couldn't blow into the drink.Tourist Card: Upon entering the Dominican Republic at the airport, each person must purchase a $10 tourist card. We paid for the card, were hurried through a line, and returned the card. A quick exchange of cash and card.Money: US dollars were easy to use. The ATM machine in the lobby only gives pesos. We took about $50 in $1's and $50 in $5's. We didn't use them all; but they came in handy for tips as needed. I think a small tip here and there can be very beneficial and appreciated. We booked our vacation package through Sam's Club Travel and couldn't have been more pleased. Toiletries: Take your own face cloth as none are provided. There are small soaps, shampoo (no conditioner), and hair dryers provided. There is also an ironing board and iron.We took a small Spanish dictionary which did come in handy a couple of times.We did the Bavaro Runners excursion. It was alot of fun and worth the money. We took some toys-- coloring books, hair items, balls, etc. for children that we encountered along the way. Our tour guide suggested which children along the way to pass our items to. Such small items brought great enjoyment to these children!  I would definitely return to the Majestic Colonial. The facility is gorgeous with a beach that is unbeatable!

<Content>Majestic has far to go We just returned (Feb 19th) from a one week stay at the Majestic. We would not go back however, unless the food issues are resolved. We went to the Paradisus Rio de Oro in Cuba in 2005, and for the same price, had *nearly* as nice a suite, and far better food.

<Author>writfiler
<Content>Had a great time at the Majestic Colonial We spent two great weeks at this fine resort from Jan. 26 to Feb. 9/06. I don't know what all the fuss was all about in previous reviews of this place, but things were running very smoothly by the time we got there from Edmonton on the 26th!! The resort is a 5-star, but management will have to continue to repair and upgrade things as time goes on. It was slapped together pretty quickly in order to open on time in mid-December and already there are signs of deterioration in several areas, most notably on the main pool deck, where the surface is crumbling in several places, even where it has previously been patched. The food was terrific in all of the restaurants and if you can't find something good to eat, you are not of sound mind!! There are 6 a la cartes plus the main Buffet and I especially recommend the Japanese teppan where they cook the food in front of you on a large grill. Shrimp, beef, pork, chicken, fish and fried rice and lots of veggies were on the menu and lots of it. There are 3 rooms, each with 10 places and three different sittings per evening. You need a reservation and long pants for men. A reservation and pants are also required for the Gourmet one, and we enjoyed the menu selection there as well. There are 8 bars on the property, however, we found that some drinks, such as coco locos and Majestic Speciales were made differently at each bar, depending on whether or not a blender was available. No watered down drinks, though, and they gladly filled my 52-0z Bubba Keg at all locations!! Waitress service was available near the main pool area, but not at the beach. Depending on where you sat on the beach, it was a fair hike to the bar located in the beach restaurant building. This problem could be solved by buidling a bar right on the beach!! But the use of a thermal mug helps considerably, as the drinks are served in those small plastic cups. The nightly entertainment in the beautiful theatre building was not up to the standards of a 5-star resort. Aside from the usual dance shows (complete with beautiful costumes) and lip-synch singing, there were the usual audience-participation shows, a magic show, karaoke night and the like. The chairs were padded and very comfortable and a table was grouped in with every 3-4 chairs. The sound system was turned up way too loud, especially in our first week and that spoiled things a lot. Note to the tech staff--louder is not always better!! The main pool area is stunning as the pool extends about 1,400 feet from the lobby area down to the beach. Bring a floatie and you can cruise down to the swim-up bar for a refill!! There was never a problem getting a lounger at any time of the day and you didn't have to play the stupid towel game there, unlike at the beach in the second week as the place filled up. Then, you had to be down there before 9 to get a lounger or else go in mid-afternoon when people left the beach area to go elsewhere. As stated in previous reviews, the beach is absolutely gorgeous powdery white sand and you can walk for several kms.in either direction . The water was gentle on most of the days, with very little undertow, and snorkellers even said there lots of fish to see and feed. I noticed very few bugs and mosquitoes and didn't need to use repellant at all. All in all, a very pleasant holiday and I wouldn't hesitate to return or to recommend this resort to anyone. The staff are friendly and efficient and understand basic English. Try a few Spanish words and phrases and you'll be fine. Tipping was not expected but when done was most appreciated. Remember, the staff are not highly paid and anything extra comes in handy. As for excursions, go to the briefing session with your tour rep and see what is available. We did just one trip--that to Higuey for some shopping and cheap rum via taxi with a fellow who friends had used last fall for a trip to Santo Domingo. Very good tour guide and reasonably priced. I can give you his contact info if you wish. If you have any questions, e-mail me at randersn@telusplanet.net

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Resort - Spectacular Staff My boyfriend and I spent Feb. 5 thru 12 at the Majestic and I was thrilled!We booked about a month before we left, and I requested a pool view room, king size bed. Our room (2250) was perfectly located. It was last room before the suites at the beach end of the resort, on the second floor. We had both a pool and an ocean view. Privacy on our balcony, but close to the beach, the pool bar, and the beach resturant. The room itself was lovely. We were welcomed with a fruit plate, champagne, and a stocked mini-fridge, with soda, beer, water and chocolates. Neither of us drinks champagne, so I don't know if they charge you for drinking it, but we drank the beer and were never charged. They restock the fridge every day, including the excellent coffee, which I made in the mini coffee maker every morning.The room was very clean, although maintenance was iffy. (Maybe they're concentrating on finishing up construction.) We didn't request maintenance, so I can't be sure. But, our toilet ran after being flushed (we fixed this ourselves), the toilet seat bolts were loose so the seat kept dropping (we tried to fix this, but the bolts were stripped) and the shower drain seemed to have a mind of its own - just when I thought it was clogged, and the water was about to spill out, it would start draining.The food was OK - my biggest complaint at the buffets was that the food wasn't hot. Breakfast buffet had everything you could possbily want, but the pre-cooked food is kept warm under heat lamps, not steam tables, so it's barely warm when you get it, and room temperature when you get back to your table. But, overall the quality is good, and there is more than enough variety for everyone. Drinks are good - don't miss the dirty monkey at the pool bar. We didn't drink the water, but used it to brush our teeth, and had no problems at all.The staff (with the partial exception of the front desk) are the nicest, most friendly people I've ever met. A couple of examples: while at breakfast I dropped some food on my shorts and stopped at the nearest bathroom to try get out the stain. This bathroom didn't have paper towels (only real towels) so I tried to use toilet paper. The maid in the bathroom saw me, grabbed a towel, soaped it, and got on her knees to scrub the stain out of my shorts (can you belive this?). Ernesto at the pool bar noticed that my boyfriend was up early and going to the other end of the resort for coffee. He started putting on the coffee early at the pool bar, just for my boyfriend. The language barrier exists, but I could always manage to communicate my request and the staff was incredibly gracious in granting it.The entertainers are fantastic - the camp counselors I called them. The're fun, funny, and talented. Don't miss the afternoon high-jinks at the pool and learn to do the house dance - the Taki-Taki.Extra-special thanks to Jose from Coco Tours and his buddy (Modesto, I think) who went out of their way for us. Jose cashed travlers checks for me (in dollars at full value) and when our flight out was cancelled due to the blizzard in New England, Jose was on his day off and Modesto took care of us, even though we weren't with his group.A few hints - we brought lots of singles and tipped with them. It was a small amount to us, but so greatly appreciated by the staff. Don't bring Travelers' checks. If they can cash them at all at the front desk, you'll get Domincan pesos and will loose money when you try to change back to dollars. And, on-site it's 30 pesos to the dollar, off site it's about 35. The in-room safe is fine for cash.The on-site shops are outrageously priced. Walk down to the plaza just outside the resort, or take a cab to Plaza Bavaro for souvineers. Expect to be hounded a bit (just say No, gracias) and definitely bargain. You can get some great deals on the larimar jewelery.Communication to the U.S. is tough. The resort charges $2 for every outside call, plus something like $3 per minute to the U.S. If you need to call home, talk to your cell phone provider well before you leave. My cell phone (Cingular) worked very well.If you play black-jack, be careful. They use 8 decks (to our 6 decks) so that changes the odds a bit.Take a late night swim in the pool. I went for a dip at about 11:00 one night and had the whole pool to myself.Overall, the Majestic is fabulous! I'd go back again tomorrow!

They obviously never travelled before or are just to hard to please.   I will give you a summary of the resort: ROOMS: Very large with a king bed or 2 double beds. We also had 2 children and the hotel put in 2 extra beds in our room which fit no problem. We still had ample space. The shower was huge, the toilet room was a little samll. There was also a bath tub in the centre of the room. There was a living room with a sofa and an office desk. The TV was good. We caught over 30 channels. GROUNDS: The grounds were SPECTACULAR and getting better every day. The lobby was by far the MOST BEAUTIFUL and GRAND that I have ever seen anywhere in the Caribbean. POOL: Just gorgeous. Very large. It spanned the length of the resort. beautful architecture throughout. One of the most beautiful pools anywhere. BEACH: The beach in Punta Cana is one of the most spectacular in the world. White powder sand and gorgeous turquoise water. There was also beautiful little angel fish and sometimes little colourful swordfish like looking fish that would come up to you if you fed them bread and bananas. There was also good snorkelling just about 200 metres in from the beach which had a variety of different fish. FOOD: For the Carribean, the food was excellent. There was always lots of variety. The A LA CARTE restaurants were good, especially the JAPANESE restaurant. We stayed mainly to the buffet restaurant at we found it always good with lots of variety especially at lunch since the beach grill was not that good. One recommendation I have is to bring mosquito repellant as there are a lot of mosquitoes at night. OVERALL: THIS IS DEFINITELY A TRUE FIVE STAR. ONE OF THE BEST ANYWHERE. I WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK IN A HEARTBEAT AND WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE.

<Content>We'll be back next year :-) We just returned back from a week at the Majestic early this morning. We had a great time!General layout - resort is a good size. We had a central room (2114) and could walk anywhere in 5 minutes or less. Landscaping has some growing to do, but will be great by this time next year. Nice common areas, with beautiful decor and very comfortable seating. Loved the ambient music... both canned, and the piano and sax players :-) Room - Just my husband and I, so we were OK with the open bathroom concept, and liked being able to see the TV from the tub, but I can see how it would be difficult for non-couples, or those with children in the same room. Our room was great. Clean and bright. We had one of the 1st floor swim-out rooms with the outdoor jacuzzi. After experiencing the convenience of this, I don't think we would be able to settle for just one of the regular rooms! We definitely made use of the jacuzzi :-)I will agree with the comments on the bad pillows. SO thin.. like airline pillows! And they only put two on the bed by default. We asked for two extras, but still thin even then. I think you'll want 6 to be fair.Never had any problems with AC... you could have it as freezing as you like :-)Maid - service was good... not too early. Usually came while we were at breakfast. No towel art, but we did get flowers :-) Couple of little quirks... we left one of our robes on the side of the tub and it was taken with the towels, and we never did get a replacement! Just one robe between us for the rest of the week. Same with our bedspread... something was spilled on it, so instead of making up the bed with another, they just took it away! Oh well... nothing serious :-)Food  Drink - was excellent! We were expecting beef to be not so good, from some of the comments, but it was great! The sirloin at the beach restaurant was great, and the filet at Le Gourmet was even better :-) The grilled lobster at the beach was so-so... again, Le Gourmet lobster tail was better :-) We tried every single restaurant, and enjoyed them all, but Le Gourmet was the best one. The buffets are also pretty good as buffet's go :-) Large, with lots of choice. Can honestly say we only encountered flies one day... and that was at our table, not in the buffet itself.Will agree that the house wine isn't all that great... but it seems that not every bar uses the same. Some reds are darker/better than others. The lobby bar actually has a few different ones that you can get as house. Daquiri's are also best at the lobby bar... slushy, and not just mix on ice cubes. Pool - is gorgeous :-) No deep areas but that's fine with us. The swim out room made it very easy to go for a quick dip... and we had our own lounge chairs, so no need to scout for a good spot. Not sure if the pool is supposed to close at a certain time, but we occassionally jumped in for a swim as late as midnight, and never got in any trouble for it :-) Beach is also beautiful, and never a problem finding chairs, any time of day. Waiter service on the beach would've been a nice touch though... not great having to walk up to the steakhouse bar.We only had one 'technical difficulty' with our stay... twice our room lost power totally! And both times, when they reset it, the TV and mini-bar power didn't come back, and had to be worked on more extensively. An inconvenience to be sure, but both times they sent someone to fix it within minutes, and we just hung out on the patio to catch some more sun :-) Not sure if this was a problem specifically with our room or not??Overall we greatly enjoyed our stay. We plan to go back next year, with friends, for two weeks this time!!

<Content>AWESOME TIME @ THE MAJESTIC COLONIAL We stayed at the Majectic Colonial Punta Cana from Jan. 13 TO JAN, 20--2006.This was our third vacation to Punta Cana, and it was our best. The lobby was impressive, and check-in and check-out went very smooth, they spoke relatively good english. Our room was very spacious and clean. The only problem that some people may have is the bathroom/toilet situation. The only thing between you and any one else is a frosted glass door that does not go all the way to the ceiling. The same thing goes for the shower. So unfortunately there is not alot of privacy if you are with people other than your spouse. There is a huge mirror in front of two sinks with a smaller make-up mirror for the ladies. With no other room to go into for privacy, this is where we changed and got ready to go out. This did not bother us but I could see it being a pain with kids or other family members. The food there was FANTASTIC!!! We were impressed at the variety of food that was offered to us. We tried every restaurant and were happy with them all. The one thing that has to be fixed is the burgers at the beach restaurant. They were never cooked all the way through-always raw, so don't eat those unless they cook it for alot longer. No one should go hungry at this resort. I think there is something for everyone. There was the odd fly or two in the main buffet, but with the sheer size of the area to dine, it will take time to get them all. The beach area was pretty clean, but there was the rare piece of glass so just watch your step. We never had to look very hard to get a beach lounger. There seemed to be plenty to go around. We saw tonnes of fish swimming right off of shore at low tide, around 5:00 pm. We even had angel fish eating bread right out of our hand.  We found the staff to be very courtious and helpfull. They all did not speak English, but with the odd word or two in Spanish, and some hand gestures we usually could figure each other out. Our room was always cleaned on time and our mini-fridge was always stocked on a daily basis. The pool is massive and was never too cold. Myself and some people I met were in there one afternoon, and two staff came to us in a kayak and offered us some mama juana. I thought that was pretty cool. The grounds have a little way to go yet as the plants are still immature and the sod needs to grow and be evened out a bit. I'm sure that in a year or two the grass and flowers will be healthy and blooming. Overall, I would reccomend this resort to any one. Our experience there was great, and we met some awesome people there who I am sure will be friends for years to come.

Better food would have given this a perfect rating.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A perfectly restful vacation! My husband and I (both 25 and from Massachusetts) stayed at the Majestic Colonial from Jan 20-27. One of his coworkers (who is a travel agent) talked him into setting up our vacation with this resort, and I am glad he did!The goal of our vacation was to get away from the craziness of the working world and truly relax. We did not want to go on any outside excursions or go crazy with keeping to any kind of schedule. All we wanted to do was spend time by the pool reading a book or going for long walks on the beach. This will help you understand my review a bit better.The Majestic Colonial and its staff was more than I could ask for. Every staff member you walked by would greet you with a smile and say Hola!. Staff members in the restaraunts would go out of their way to try and assist with whatever you wanted. Many of them spoke some English, and when they did not understand what you were saying, they would try hand gestures or other ways to communicate. They really appreciated the tourists using some basic Spanish words and phrases, and would teach you new ones if you wished. The food was abundant and delicious! I will never forget the sugared donuts in the breakfast buffet and the chocolate cake at the steakhouse. The French restaraunt was spectacular with its service and meals rich with flavors. My husband was ready to eat steak almost all week long, and he was not disappointed. The grounds were very nice, with workmen planting new plants daily. Early in the morning you could see several men cleaning the huge swimming pool, and during the day there were men picking up any trash on the beach. Once all of the plants take root and flourish and all of the fountains are running, the grounds will be spectacular. We went for several walks on the beach. By taking a right after the Majestic Colonial beach area, you can walk by many other resorts and encounter a shopping area after about a 45 minute walk. But by taking a left, you will quickly encounter beach that has not yet been developed and is very quiet and peaceful. My husband and I spent hours one day sitting on this quiet portion of the beach with only a couple people walking by. But since the area is undeveloped, there is no one to pick up the trash that washes up or blows up onto the beach.We also spent a lot of time by the piano bar where they have numerous sitting areas with cozy couches and chairs. By giving one of the bar workers a tip here and there, you were ensured frequent refills of your cervesas and vino without leaving your seat. The room we had was on the second floor and overlooked the swim-up bar. I agree with other guests responses about the bathroom set-up and its lack of privacy, but we worked around it with turning on the TV or the Jacuzzi tub. It was a real treat to sit in the tub and watch a movie on TV. The maid did a wonderful job keeping our room clean, and seemed to know when we would not be in the room for her to come by. Our fridge was always restocked daily. There is a safe in the room with an electronic keypad that you can enter your own code. This way we were sure our passports and plane tickets home would be safe. The TV does carry many English channels, including ESPN in both English and Spanish. We only made it to one of the shows during our stay, and there were many people there. We left early because the speakers were blasting the music uncomfortably loud. Recommendations I would make to others planning to come to the Majestic Colonial:* Bring everything you need in regards to sunscreen, bar soap, shampoo, film, medications, etc because it is very expensive. If you use face cloths or tissues, bring those as well as they are not supplied. * Come with a positive attitude, and you will enjoy your stay that much more. It is a new resort and the employees are still learning their way. And remember that the food will be different than at home-- this is a Spanish country.* Bring $1 bills for tipping. A tip here and there will have the workers going the extra mile for you. * If you like to snack during the day, make sure to bring some of your own. Sitting by the pool with a drink and nothing to snack on was a small disappointment. * If you enjoy floating on rafts in the pool or the ocean, bring some with you as the resort does not have any. * Also bring more reading material than you think you will go through during your vacation. My husband finished his two books in three days and refused to pick up one of my books.I hope my review helps others realize what a wonderful resort the Majestic Colonial is now, and what it may become in the next few months. For those looking for the type of vacation we sought, it was perfect-- by our third night there I had forgotten what day of the week it was!

<Author>KAKCanada
<Content>Majestic Colonial - A wonderful experience! My husband and I just returned from 2 weeks at the Majestic (Jan 6 鈥?20). After reading some reviews prior to our departure we were quite concerned, but determined not to let anything spoil our vacation. As it turned out, we worried for nothing. Our experience at the Majestic was a wonderful one!-Check in was a breeze. Even at 4am (Sunwing鈥檚 flight times are awful), the hotel had 5 employees at the reception ready and waiting for the 20 or so people that arrived. The lobby has two levels and is very beautifully decorated. The piano bar now has a piano (in case you were wondering).-Our room was clean and spacious. There were no facecloths, but this being our 4th trip to the DR, we know that there rarely are, so we had brought our own. It is true that the toilet stall is not floor to ceiling and therefore has limited privacy. This was not an issue for us, but may be for others. As for the air conditioning, it was activated only by motion in the room, which was slightly annoying when you were sitting still watching tv (it would turn off) or when you shifted in bed in the middle of the night (it would turn on). We actually got used to this, however the last 5 days of our stay, the AC was on constantly so we suspect the hotel received complaints and responded to them by adjusting it. -A tip regarding making calls. We thought we would not be charged if we used a calling card to call Canada but the operator at the hotel asked us for the name of the calling card (it was a World Calling Card) and connected us to them and then charged for the connection cost (50 pesos each time). Just ask the operator for an outside line instead and you should be ok.-Seven shops were open on Caribbean Street. The prices are hotel prices. For example, Pringles will cost you approximately $8 US. Sunscreen is $14 US and up. We discovered the Playa Blanca market just outside the resort. Just walk out of the lobby, down the hotel entrance road and it鈥檚 on the right (only a 5-7 minute walk). Also, once a week, vendors come on site and set up tables near the Theatre. Remember, you have to bargain at the market and with the vendors! They will overcharge you just like the hotel, if you let them.-We recommend venturing outside the resort for at least one excursion. This is the only way you鈥檒l get to see the real Dominican Republic. We enjoyed the Marinarium (http://www.marinarium.com) and ATV excursions. You should be able to book with your on site tour rep.-The gardens WILL be beautiful. At the moment everything is newly planted, but in a few months it will be spectacular.-The beach was beautiful and we never had trouble getting a palpa or chairs, though we suspect this may change when the hotel is at full capacity. We did find the water to be very wavy, but still happily swam in it!-The pool goes from one end of the resort to the other. We enjoyed a swim every day and it never felt crowded. -We were very pleased with the food. I am a picky eater and I certainly did not starve. The only restaurant we had to make a reservation for was the Japanese. I鈥檓 not sure if this will change eventually. Most resorts require reservations at any a la carte restaurants鈥?br/>-We only went to a couple of the nightly shows. The Michael Jackson impersonator is definitely worth checking out. We were thoroughly entertained!-The staff was very helpful and friendly. We found that learning a few key words and phrases in Spanish was helpful to us and appreciated by the staff. We ran into occasional language barriers but found that most of the staff spoke some English. These people are some of the most hardworking people you will ever meet. The wait staff begins working long before we roll out of bed. They work through breakfast, lunch and dinner. They work 16 hour days, for 13 days straight and then have 3 days off. <Content>great vacation We just came yesterday from the Majestic. I was, like a lot of other reviewers, a bit apprehensive about it. But we had a beautiful vacation in the end. Let's start with the good:Food was excellent! We've been to Punta Cana 5 times and this was the best food we ever had.Staff was extremely friendly and made a genuine effort to help. So what if sometimes screwed up and brought you the wrong drinks - they were back with the correct ones in less than 30 seconds! Rooms were bigger than any other hotel we've seen (including the neighbouring Grand Paradiso and Breezes, where I took a peek)Buildings and grounds were, well,..majestic! (give the grass and flowers time to get established!)Spa, gym and casino were opened.Maybe we got lucky, but we had none of the crowds we encountered at other hotels. It was a pleasure not to have to wake up at 5:00 a.m. to reserve a chair on the beach or to rub elbows with the neighbours in the restaurants. And, exept for the japanese one, we didn't have to reserve at any of the a la carte restaurants which, by the way, were all open.Now the bad:It is clear that they opened too soon - work still going on (although not that annoying). But things are improving fast - they opened the remaining rooms while we were there.Stores are not all opened and those who are don't have much and are awfully expensive.Cleaning staff need more training - the rooms were clean, but the little details expected from a 5 star hotel are not there yet (sometimes they forgot to bring all the towels or to empty the garbage can in the toilet).The shower-toilet combination are a result of an over eager architect. Completely impractical! As much as I love my spouse of 25 years, I still appreciate some privacy when using the toilet. Not to speak of the smell that penetrates into the room, the toilet not being closed at the top and bottom. The shower is huge, but I would have settled for a smaller one that drains well.We had to call three times until the air conditioning was finally fixed.Here you have it! If you are willing to overlook minor defficiencies (after all, you're on vacation, so relax!)you'll have a great time. The important thing is that they are obviously trying to improve every day and will eventually succeed. At the rate they're going, I do believe they will reach the 5 star status by the end of the year.And don't forget - a couple of tips here and there will definetely give you a better service!

<Content>How can I say...Majestic !! We just got back from Majestic Colonial on January 10th. We ( 4 adults and one child )where there for one week in their third week of operation and we where amaze of the beauty of this complex. It is true that some construction is going on, but it is only at one part of the hotel and to be honest, when you are at the beach, pool, or restaurants you don't hear a thing. You will be astonish when you get in the looby, it is huge and very very taken cared of. There is two bars, one in the upper level wich is the piano bar even though there is no piano, the other one is at ground level and is very nice too. The cuba libre, santo libre and draft beer are excellent at all the bars (6) and are the drinks are recommend.I can understand why previous travellers said that even the staff where lost when looking for their rooms, the room numbers have 4 digits, here's how it works...-The first digit tells wich aisle your room will be, if it is 1 or 4, you'll be facing the exterior of the resort, if it is 2 or 3, you'll be facing the interior ( the bests are 2 or 3 as you'll face the pool wich is 400 meters long.....);-The second digit tells your floor, 1-2-3 or 4th floor;-The last two is your room and the higher is the tow last digits, the closer you'll be to the ocean and further away from lobby, reception, buffet.By the way, they are not aligned, meaning that if your walking ground level and see room number 2134, dont expect to have 2434 in the same building as not all buildings have 4 floors.The Bavaro beach in Punta Cana is amazing, super soft white sand and blue water, calm breeze in January.....that says alote. I went for the helicopter tour, 1/2 hour, I got to see all Macao beach, Bavaro beach, and both are amazing. Flying at 200 Km/h 10 feet above see level, coast line is an experience a recommend to everybody. I saw images that will stay forever embedded in my mind. An helicopter tour in the Caribean (coast line) is'nt the same than one in Ottawa above the parliement I can tell you that..........The rooms are very nice, a working jacuzzi, fridge, large balcony, the nicest shower I've been in (all in marble), the toilet lacks of privacy, TV ( bring 2 AAA batteries for the remote controller if you wish to watch TV before going to bed but I'm sure that if you asked the reception, they will give you batteries) The fridge gets filled every afternoon with 2 pepsi, 1 7up, 1 orange crush, 2 bottle of agua, 2 chocolat bars. Their is also one bottle of champagne and one bottle of whisky, I don't know if they give new ones if you drink them all as we did'nt took that opportunaty :). Beds are confortable (their new !!) but the pillows could be better.The Gym, Casino, Discotheque, theatre where all nice two. The seating at the theatre was the comfortiest seat I've sat in for a show. The set of two chairs plus a table cost like 800$ canadian and there is like 250 of them !!!. The Micheal Jackson show was amazing, for a moment I really thought it was the real Micheal Jackson as we all know how weird the guy is and that he could have decided to produced himself in Punta Cana.......a few santo libre help my thinking that evening too :)))The food was excellent, we went at Gourmet, Oriental, Caribbean and Grill. It was confusing on the restaurants part as they advertise 5 A la carte, but we manage to find only 4 and the fourth one is like the buffet by the beach. Anyway, it was confusing but we can't say anything about the food as it was incredible.The animation could have been better even thought the animation staff works their butt of every day (keep in mind that we were there in their theird week of operation).I'll finish by saying that this complexe will be ......Majestic in a year or two. I can't understand why people would complaint about the vegetation, the little noise with construction, patch work for the grass. You'r in the Caribean, instead go enjoye the beautiful beach, the amazing 400 meters long pool and relax, cause the next thing you'll find out is that your going back home tomorrow. See you next year Punta Cana !!!!!

<Author>BlueSpiritTraveler
<Content>LOTS OF PROBLEMS - STAY AWAY Where do I start? First, if you are even considering a vacation here, be warned to go elsewhere. This place is not what your travel agent may tell you. It is not nearly finished and should never have opened to the public - bad management. There are many safety hazards due to the fact that it's still undergoing construction - loose wires, rocks and dirt piles, etc. Aside from that, it lacks many basic services and amenities, much less anything approaching the 5-star quality that it is supposed to be.CHECK INWe pre-booked and prepaid for everything. When we arrived, they did not have ANY room for us at all. The hotel staff and management did nothing to assist us and were totally unresponsive to our queries or concerns (or offered tips) that we had a 3-year old child, nothing to eat, and nowhere to sleep. We saw and talked to many other people in the lobby who were stuck there for hours with no rooms, either. The resort was literally building the rooms and moving in the furniture as we waited, but even that couldn't make up for all the guests waiting for rooms. We finally had to go to a different resort for that first night, which we ourselves had to arrange since the entire staff was overworked, had many other people yelling at them, and were completely incapable of doing anything to help. Luckily we were able to find another resort with a room available for one night. The next day we finally got a room back at Majestic Colonial. Too bad.FOODTotally sub-par. NOT 5-star. Mostly buffet. House wine AWFUL. Even the choice of menu wines that you have to pay for were bad - nothing for a serious (or even casual) wine-drinker to enjoy. Bar service was chaotic at best. The entire staff is so obviously untrained - they literally walk back and forth doing nothing with dazed looks on their faces; if what you ask of them is too much (like ordering a drink), sometimes they will outright ignore you and walk away. Finally we found one server who was decent and just tried to seek her out whenever we wanted something. The a la carte restaraunts were okay, but not great. There are times of the day when there is no food available, which is unfortunate if you don't like to rush or have a timetable to adhere to, or if you have a child who naps through meal times and then is hungry when nothing is available. We were told there would be snacks, but these turned out to be only hotdogs and hamburgers at the beach bar - not the healthiest choice.ROOMSThe room we had was actually nice - poolside with private jacuzzi, which we used every day. The all marble showers and floors were beautiful but treacherously slippery. The room had a few issues - looked like it was rushed through, and there were a few holes and missed seals in the walls and corners and ceiling; I suppose that's how mosquitos constantly entered the room. Also, there were very loud crickets somewhere in the room that chirped constantly all night (no exaggeration), which got a bit annoying. No facecloths, no tissues, no garbage can, no mini bar (unless you consider a small fridge of bottled water and sodas), no snacks, no shower soap, only tiny circles of hand soap.GROUNDSThe grounds were very nice, but the landscaping needs filling in (the least of your worries, believe me). The paths are downright dumb - some lead nowhere, and you see guests cutting across grass and low shrubs to conveniently get to where they are going. Also, lighting is lacking in many places, making it a bit dangerous in places (like the bridges that cross the pool) at nighttime.POOLThe pool is the one thing that was gorgeous - a very long, huge, freeform pool. It seemed clean enough and we enjoyed that. We were a bit worried about a few troublesome filter areas that looked potentially dangerous to children, but we just stayed away from those. The bar by the pool is a bit annoying, as there was always some 'activity' staff trying to get tourists to do things - play volleyball, limbo, dance, or do other strange tourist trap type activities, and very loud ones.SPASpa, although open, is not quite ready, either. I had two appointments, which were botched (overbooked). The massage I got was basic, and the girl was so sick she had to leave the room twice to deal with her coughing fits. The showers, steam room and sauna were nice, but again, not quite ready yet.BEACHBeach is pretty - soft sand, clean water; saw some reef area and lots of fish (surprising). But near the resort there are a lot of construction rocks that were just thrown there and are now mixed with the sand, and also lots of broken glass. The beach chairs are comfortable but not enough of them for all the guests. There are catamarans and banana boats and donuts (?) and speed boats and kayaks available. We didn't do any of that, but people who did looked like they were having fun. One thing that was annoying were the many helicopters that constantly flew over the resort and buzzed quite close to the water and swimmers a few times - I think they are tourists on pleasure rides. We walked down the beach to see some of the other resorts. All the same, more or less. Lots of people, crowded bars, crowded pools.SUMMARYThe entire Punta Cana strip is basically row after row of all-inclusive mega resorts that cater to those who enjoy non-stop drinking and loud music. If that is your taste, you will like it here. If you prefer a quiet, relaxing vacation, you would be well-advised to consider somewhere else altogether. If you DO go to Punta Cana, stay away from Majestic Colonial for at least another year - it is simply not ready and not worth the headaches of everything that it is struggling with - no matter what discount your travel agent offers. If you're looking for 5-star, or any quality vacation, this is not it.
